6_6.word_by_word: महात्मानम् great soul, धर्मज्ञम् knower of dharma, धर्मवत्सलम् one who loves dharma, त्वाम्you, अर्थित्वात् being the needy ones, आसाद्य having come to you, वक्ष्यामः we speak, नाथ O lord, नः for us, तत् that, क्षन्तुम् to excuse, अर्हसि should.

6_7.shloka: अधर्मस्सुमहांस्तात भवेत्तस्य महीपतेः।यो हरेद्बलिषड्भागां न च रक्षति पुत्रवत्।।3.6.11।।
6_7.translation: O Lord, a king who collect one sixth of the produce as tax and yet does not protect his subjects like his children commits an act of grave injustice.
6_7.word_by_word: तात (नाथ) O Lord, यः whoever, बलिषङ्भागम् sixth portion of wealth as tax, हरेत् will take, पुत्रवत् like children, न च रक्षति does not protect, तस्य his, महीपतेः king's, सुमहान् very great, अधर्मः act of injustice, भवेत् will become.

6_8.shloka: युञ्जानस्स्वानिव प्राणान्प्राणैरिष्टान्सुतानिव।नित्ययुक्तस्सदा रक्षन्सर्वान्विषयवासिनः।।3.6.12।।प्राप्नोति शाश्वतीं राम कीर्तिं स बहुवार्षिकीम्।ब्रह्मणस्स्थानमासाद्य तत्र चापि महीयते।।3.6.13।।
6_8.translation: O Rama, whoever protects the inhabitants of his kingdom at all times like his own son who he loves more than his own life will attain the world of Brahma and remain there for long years and will achieve prosperity thereafter.
6_8.word_by_word: सर्वान् all, विषयवासिनः residents of his country, प्राणैः more than lives, इष्टान् dear ones, सुतानिव like his sons, स्वान् his own, प्राणान् life, यञ्जानः इव taking care, नित्ययुक्तः always in rightful manner, सदा always, रक्षन् while protecting, सः he, शाश्वतीम् forever, बहुवार्षिकीम् extending over long years, कीर्तिम् fame, प्राप्नोति will acquire, ब्रह्मणः Brahman, स्थानम् place, असाद्य after reaching, तत्र चापि there also, महीयते will be excelling.

6_9.shloka: यत्करोति परं धर्म मुनिर्मूलफलाशनः।तत्र राज्ञश्चतुर्भाग प्रजा धर्मेण रक्षितः।।3.6.14।।
6_9.translation: One fourth of the supreme merit a sage earns by living on fruits and roots, accrues to the king through which the people are protected righteously.
6_9.word_by_word: मुनिः sage, यत् whatever, परम् supreme, धर्मम् merit, करोति earns, तत्र there, चतुर्भागः fourth portion, प्रजाः people, धर्मेण righteously, रक्षितः for him who protects.

6_10.shloka: सोऽयं ब्राह्मणभूयिष्ठो वानप्रस्थगणो महान्।त्वन्नाथोऽनाथवद्राम राक्षसैर्वध्यते भृशम्।।3.6.15।।
6_10.translation: O Rama  we are a group of great sages, mostly brahmins, leading a vanaprastha  life. Yet with a protector like you, we are slaughtered in large numbers like orphans.
6_10.word_by_word: राम O Rama, त्वन्नाथः with you as their lord, ब्राह्मण भूयिष्ठः mostly brahmins, महान् great, सः अयम् that we, वानप्रस्थगणः group of sages leading the vanaprastha stage of life, अनाथवत् like orphans, राक्षसैः by the demons, भृशम् in large numbers, वध्यते being slain.

6_11.shloka: एहि पश्य शरीराणि मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम्।हतानां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्बहूनां बहुधा वने।।3.6.16।।
6_11.translation: Come and see  the bodies of ascetics, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit, killed in large numbers in the forest by the fierce demons.
6_11.word_by_word: एहि come on, वने in the forest, घोरै fierce, राक्षसैः by demons, बहुधा in many, हतानाम् killed, भावितात्मनाम् those who have perceived the Supreme spirit, बहूनाम् of many, मुनीनाम् of   sages, शरीराणि the bodies, पश्य see.

6_12.translation: A great slaughter is taking place amongst those residing on the bank of the Pampa lake, near the river Mandakini, and on mount Chitrakuta.
6_12.word_by_word: पम्पानदीनिवासानाम् of residents on the banks of river Pampa, अनुमन्दाकिनीमपि of those residing near river Mandakini, चित्रकूटालयानां च of those residing in mount Chitrakuta, महत् great, कदनम् war, क्रियते is being waged.

6_13.shloka: एवं वयं न मृष्यामो विप्रकारं तपस्विनाम्।क्रियमाणं वने घोरं रक्षोभिर्भीमकर्मभिः।।3.6.18।।
6_13.translation: We ascetics are not able to tolerate the fearful deeds perpetrated by the dreadful demons in the forest.
6_13.word_by_word: एवं वयम् in this state we are, भीमकर्मभि: by those doing fearful deeds, रक्षोभिः by demons, वने in the forest, क्रियमाणम् being done, तपस्विनाम् for ascetics, घोरम् dreadful, विप्रकारम् offence, न मृष्यामः we are not able to bear.

6_14.shloka: ततस्त्वां शरणार्थं च शरण्यं समुपस्थिताः।परिपालय नो राम वध्यमानान्निशाचरैः।।3.6.19।।
6_14.translation: O Rama, you are worthy of refuge. Hence we have come to you seeking your protection. We are being killed by the nightstalkers. Save us.
6_14.word_by_word: ततः then, राम O Rama, शरण्यम् worthy of refuge, त्वाम् you, शरणार्थम् for protection, समुपस्थिताः we have come here, निशाचरैः by the nightstalkers (the demons), वध्यमानान् being killed, नः us, परिपालय protect.

6_15.shloka: परा त्वत्तो गतिर्वीर पृथिव्यां नोपपद्यते।परिपालय न स्सर्वान्राक्षसेभ्यो नृपात्मज।।3.6.20।।
6_15.translation: O great warrior here on this earth there is no protector as mighty as you. So, O prince  save us all from these demons.
6_15.word_by_word: वीर great warrior, त्वत्तः other than you, परा greatest, गतिः refuge, पृथिव्याम् on this earth,नोपपद्यते cannot be found, नृपात्मज O son of a king, नः us, सर्वान् all, राक्षसेभ्यः from the demons, परिपालय rescue.

6_16.shloka: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु काकुत्स्थस्तापसानां तपस्विनाम्।इदं प्रोवाच धर्मात्मा सर्वानेव तपस्विनः।।3.6.21।।
6_16.translation: Having heard this, righteous Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty said to all the ascetics engaged in penance:
6_16.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous self, काकुत्स्थः of Kakutstha dynasty, तपस्विनाम् engaged in penance, तापसानाम् of the ascetics, एतत् this, श्रुत्वातु on hearing, सर्वानेव addressing them all, तपस्विनः ascetics, इदम् this, प्रोवाच said.

6_17.shloka: नैवमर्हथ मां वक्तुमाज्ञाप्योऽहं तपस्विनाम्।केवलेनात्मकार्येण प्रवेष्टव्यं मया वनं।।3.6.22।।
6_17.translation: You should not speak to me this way. I deserve to be commanded by the ascetics. I have not entered this forest only on a personal mission.
6_17.word_by_word: एवम् thus, माम् we, वक्तुम् to address, न अर्हथ it is not befitting you, अहम् I, तपस्विनाम् for ascetics, आज्ञाप्यः should be ordered, केवलेन only to, आत्मकार्येण with a personal mission, मया by me, वनम् forest, प्रवेष्टव्यम्  entered

6_18.translation: I came into this forest in obedience to my father's orders to repel the aggression of demons against you.
6_18.word_by_word: अहम् I, राक्षसैः by the demons, भवताम् to you, इमम् these, विप्रकारम् offence, अपाक्रष्टुम् to ward off, पितुः father's, निर्देशकरः one who carries out instructions, इदम् here, वनम् forest, प्रविष्टः I entered.

6_19.shloka: भवतामर्थसिद्ध्यर्थमागतोऽहं यदृच्छया।तस्य मेऽयं वने वासो भविष्यति महाफलः।।3.6.24।।
6_19.translation: I came here to acomplish your task incidentally, Therefore, my stay in the forest will yield great results.
6_19.word_by_word: अहम् I, भवताम् your, अर्थसिध्यर्थम् to acomplish your task, यदृच्चया incidentally, आगतः came, तस्य for such a man, मे for me, अयम् this, वने वासः stay in the forest, महाफलः great result, भविष्यति will yield.

6_20.shloka: तपस्विनां रणे शत्रून्हन्तुमिच्छामि राक्षसान्।पश्यन्तु वीर्यमृषयस्सभ्रातुर्मे तपोधनाः।।3.6.25।।
6_20.translation: I wish to kill in the fight the demons who are your enemies. O great ascetics, you may  witness my prowess supported by my brother.
6_20.word_by_word: तपस्विनाम् of ascetics, शत्रून् enemies, राक्षसान् demons, रणे in war, हन्तुम् to kill, इच्छामि intend to, तपोधनाः those who are richly endowed with penance, ऋषयः sages, सभ्रातुः  along with my brother, मे my, वीर्यम् valour, पश्यन्तु you will see.

6_21.shloka: दत्त्वाऽभयं चापि तपोधनानां धर्मे धृतात्मा सह लक्ष्मणेन।तपोधनैश्चापि सभाज्यवृत्तः सुतीक्ष्णमेवाभिजगाम वीरः।।3.6.26।।
6_21.translation: Brave Rama, steadfast in righteousness, worthy of honour, gave assurance to protect the ascetics endowed with the wealth of penance, and proceeded towards sage Sutikshna.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
6_21.word_by_word: धर्मे in righteousness, धृतात्मा steadfast man, वीरः a brave man, तपोधनानाम् for ascetics endowed with the wealth of penance, अभयम् assurance to protect, दत्वा after giving, सह लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, तपोधनैश्चापि and along with the ascetics, सभाज्यवृत्तः one whose behaviour deserves to be respected, सुतीक्ष्णमेव to Sutikshna, अभिजगाम approached.

7_1.shloka: [Rama, Sita and Lakshmana reach the hermitage of Sutikshna.]रामस्तु सहितो भ्रात्रा सीतया च परन्तपः।सुतीक्ष्णस्याश्रमपदं जगाम सह तैर्द्विजैः।।3.7.1।।
7_1.translation: Rama, the scorcher of enemies, along with his brother Lakshmana and Sita and the sages went to Sutikshna's hermitage.
7_1.word_by_word: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, रामस्तु Rama, भ्रात्रा with brother (Lakshmana), सीतया Sita, च and, सहितः accompanied, तैः by them, द्विजैः सह with the brahmin sages, सुतीक्ष्णस्य Sutikshna's, आश्रमपदम्  site of hermitage, जगाम went.

7_2.shloka: स गत्वा दीर्घमध्वानं नदीस्तीर्त्वा बहूदकाः।ददर्श विमलं शैलं महामेघमिवोन्नतम्।।3.7.2।।
7_2.translation: After covering a long distance and crossing the river (Ganga) with plenty of water, Rama saw a huge mountain looking like a lofty cloud.
7_2.word_by_word: सः he (Rama), दीर्घम् long, अध्वानम् distance, गत्वा went, बहूदकाः with plenty of water, नदी river, तीर्त्वा after crossing, महामेघमिव like a huge cloud, उन्नतम् lobty, विमलम् pure, शैलम् mountain, ददर्श saw.

7_3.shloka: तत स्तदिक्ष्वाकुवरौ सन्ततं विविधैर्द्रुमैः।काननं तौ विविशतुस्सीतया सह राघवौ।।3.7.3।।
7_3.translation: Rama and Lakshmana, the best of the Ikshvaku family, accompanied by Sita entered the dense forest  filled with trees all over.
7_3.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, इक्ष्वाकुवरौ the best of the Ikshvakus, तौ राघवौ both brothers of the Ragha family (Rama and Lakshmana), सीतया सह with Sita, विविधैः with many, द्रुमैः by trees, सन्ततम् crowded all over, काननम् forest, विविशतुः both entered.

7_4.translation: Entering that dreadful forest, they saw trees full of flowers and fruits, and a hermitage in a lonely place with lines of bark robes hanging.
7_4.word_by_word: घोरम् dreadful, बहुपुष्पफलद्रुमम् filled with trees bearing different kinds of flowers and fruits, वनम् forest, प्रविष्टः entered, एकान्ते at a lonely place, चीरमालापरिष्कृतम् line of bark robes hanging, आश्रमम् hermitage, ददर्श witnessed.

7_5.translation: There at the hermitage was Sutikshna, an ascetic grown old with (long) penance, wearing soiled, matted locks and seated. Rama (first) addressed him as per custom.
7_5.word_by_word: तत्र  there (at the hermitage), रामः Rama, मलपङ्कजठाधरम् with soiled, matted hair, आसीनम् seated, तपोवृद्धम्  grown old with penance, तापसम् ascetic, सुतीक्ष्णम् Sutikshna, विधिवत् as per tradition, अभाषत spoke.

7_6.shloka: रामोऽहमस्मि भगवन्भवन्तं द्रष्टुमागतः।त्वं माभिवद धर्मज्ञ महर्षे सत्यविक्रम।।3.7.6।।
7_6.translation: O venerable one, I am Rama.You are a great sage, armed with truth as your prowess and a knower of dharma. I have come to see you. Could you speak to me?
7_6.word_by_word: भगवन् O revered one, अहम् am, रामः अस्मि I am Rama, भवन्तम् you, द्रष्टुम् to  see, आगतः I came, त्वं you, धर्मज्ञ knower of dharma, सत्यविक्रम having truth as your prowess, महर्षे great sage, मा me, अभिवद speak.

7_7.shloka: स निरीक्ष्य ततो धीरो रामं धर्मभृतां वरम्।समाश्लिष्य च बाहुभ्यामिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.7.7।।
7_7.translation: Thereafter the composed Sutikshna, looked at Rama, the best among righteous men, and embracing him with both his arms said:
7_7.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, धीरः composed, सः he (Sutikshna), धर्मभृताम् among righteous men, वरम् best, रामम् to Rama, निरीक्ष्य looking at, बाहुभ्याम् with both his arms, समाश्लिष्य च after embracing, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

7_8.shloka: स्वागतं ते रघुश्रेष्ठ राम सत्यभृतां वर।आश्रमोऽयं त्वयाक्रान्तस्सनाथ इव साम्प्रतम्।।3.7.8।।
7_8.translation: O Rama, the best among the Raghavas and among the upholders of truth, you are welcome. With your presence this hermitage will have a protector now.
7_8.word_by_word: रघुश्रेष्ठ scions of the Raghu family, सत्यभृताम् among upholders of truth, वर the best, राम Rama, ते to you, स्वागतम् welcome, साम्प्रतम् presently, त्वया your, आक्रान्तः occupied, अयम् this, आश्रमः hermitage, सनाथः इव one that has a protector.

7_9.shloka: प्रतीक्षमाणस्त्वामेव नारोहेऽहं महायशः।देवलोकमितो वीर देहं त्यक्त्वा महीतले।चित्रकूटमुपादाय राज्यभ्रष्टोऽसि मे श्रुतः।।3.7.9।।
7_9.translation: O renowned hero, I had heard that you have come to Chitrakuta, renouncing yourkingdom. I have been waiting so long to see you here. Unable to give up this body, I did not even leave the earth for heaven, the world of the gods.
7_9.word_by_word: महायशः O illustrious one, वीर heroic one, अहम् I, त्वामेव you only, प्रतीक्ष्माणः waiting for you, महीतले on earth, देहम् body, त्यक्त्वा giving up, इतः from here, देवलोकम् world of the gods, नारोहे I do not ascend, राज्यभ्रष्टः renouncing the kingdom, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakuta, उपादाय after taking, असि you are, मे I, श्रुतः heard.

7_10.shloka: इहोपयातः काकुत्थ्स देवराजश्शतक्रतुः।।3.7.10।।उपागम्य च मे देवो महादेवस्सुरेश्वरः।सर्वान् लोकाञ्जितानाह मम पुण्येन कर्मणा।।3.7.11।।
7_10.translation: O scion of the Kakutstha family, Indra, king of the gods came to me and said that by my meritorious deeds I have won all the worlds.
7_10.word_by_word: काकुत्थ्स scion of the Kakutstha family, शतक्रतुः Indra, देवराजः king of the gods, इह here, उपयातः came to me, महादेवः chief of the gods, सुरेश्वरः Indra, देवः deity, उपागम्य after he came here, मम my, पुण्येन कर्मणा by meritorious act, सर्वान् all, लोकान् worlds, जितान् won, मे by me, आह said.

7_11.shloka: तेषु देवर्षिजुष्टेषु जितेषु तपसा मया।मत्प्रसादात्सभार्यस्त्वं विहरस्व सलक्ष्मणः।।3.7.12।।
7_11.translation: Along with your wife and Lakshmana you may roam by my grace the worlds won by me and served by divine sages like devarsi Narada.
7_11.word_by_word: मया by me, जितेषु which have been won, देवर्षिजुष्टेषु worlds served by divine sages like Narada, तेषु those, सभार्यः with your wife, सलक्ष्मणः and with Lakshmana, त्वम् you, मत्प्रसादात् by my grace, विहरस्व move about.

7_12.translation: Selfpossessed Rama replied to the truthful ascetic who had performed intense penance. Just as Kasyapa would address Lord Brahma:
7_12.word_by_word: आत्मवान् selfpossessed, रामः Rama, उग्रतपसायुक्तं doing severe penance, सत्यवादिनम् to the truthful तं महर्षिम् to that great sage, काश्यपः Kasyapa, ब्रह्माणमिव as he would speak to Brahma, प्रत्युवाच thus replied.

7_13.shloka: अहमेवाहरिष्यामि सर्वान् लोकान्महामुने।आवासं त्वहमिच्छामि प्रदिष्टमिह कानने।।3.7.14।।
7_13.translation: O great sage I will win all the worlds myself. I (only) want to live in this forest. Allow me.
7_13.word_by_word: महामुने O great sage, अहमेव I alone, सर्वान् all, लोकान् worlds, आहरिष्यामि I will win, तु but, अहम् I, इह here, कानने in the forest, प्रदिष्टम् directed, आवासम् residence, इच्छामि intend to.

7_14.translation: You are ever engaged in the welfare of all beings. I have heard this from the great sage Sarabhanga of Gautama's clan.
7_14.word_by_word: भवान् you, सर्वत्र all, कुशलः are keeping well, सर्वभूतहिते in the welfare of all living beings, रतः ever engaged गौतमेन of Gautama, महात्मना by a great sage, शरभङ्गेण by Sarabhanga, आख्यातः told.

7_15.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण महर्षिर्लोकविश्रुतः।अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं हर्षेण महताऽप्लुतः।।3.7.16।।
7_15.translation: Thus addressed by  Rama, Sutikshna, the great sage, wellknown to the world was highly delighted. He (then) said these sweet words:
7_15.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् thus, उक्तः told, लोकविश्रुतः wellknown to the world, महर्षिः great sage, महता with great, हर्षेण joy, प्लुतः overwhelmed, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

7_16.translation: O Rama this is a salubrious hermitage where hosts of sages live and which is full of roots and fruits, you may enjoy yourself here.
7_16.word_by_word: राम O Rama, ऋषिसङ्घानुचरितः where hosts of sages live, मूलफलैः with roots and fruits, युतः endowed, अयम् this, आश्रमः एव hermitage only, गुणवान् is good, रम्यताम् enjoy, इह here.

7_17.translation: O illustrious Rama, herds of animals visit this place fearlessly, enticing the inmates and (then) go back without harming any one.
7_17.word_by_word: महायशः of great fame, मृगसङ्घाः groups of animals, इमम् this, आश्रमम् hermitage, आगम्य  coming here, लोभयित्वा enticing the inmates, अहत्वा without harming, अकुतोभयाः fearless, प्रतिगच्छन्ति return.

7_18.shloka: नान्यद्धोषं भवेदत्र मृगेभ्योऽन्यत्र विद्धि वै।तच्छृत्वा वचनं तस्य महर्षेर्लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।।3.7.19।।उवाच वचनं धीरो विकृष्य  सशरं धनुः।
7_18.translation: When heroic Rama heard that there was no other problem from the wild animals except their frequent incursions, he lifted his bow with an arrow and said these words:
7_18.word_by_word: अत्र here, मृग्येभ्यः  from animals, अन्यत्र other than that, अन्यत् other, दोषं demerit, न भवेत् is not expected, विद्धि वै you may know, धीरः heroic man, लक्ष्मणाग्रजः elder brother of      Lakshmana, (Rama), तस्य महर्षेः sages, तत् these, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सशरम् with arrow, धनुः bow, विकृष्य lifted, वचनम् words, उवाच said.

7_19.translation: O reverend one, I will kill with a sharpedged arrow, glowing like a thunderbolt, all those herds of animals who keep coming here.
7_19.word_by_word: सुमहाभाग O reverend one, समागतान् those coming here, तान् those, मृगसङ्घान् herds of animals, निशितधारेण with sharp edge, अशनिवर्चसा with a thunderlike glow, शरेण by arrow, हन्याम् I will kill.

7_20.shloka: भवांस्तत्राभिषज्येत किंस्यात्कृच्छ्रतरं ततः।।3.7.21।।एतस्मिन्नाश्रमे वासं चिरं तु न समर्थये।
7_20.translation: What can be more agonizing for you (than my killing animals). I (therefore) do not foresee our long stay in this hermitage.
7_20.word_by_word: तत्र then, भवान् you, अभिषज्येत harass, ततः कृच्छ्रतरम् may cause pain, किं स्यात्   what could be there?, एतस्मिन् in this, आश्रमे hermitage, चिरम् for a long time, वासम् residence, न not, समर्थये I foresee.

7_21.shloka: तमेवमुक्त्वोपरमं रामस्सन्ध्यामुपागमत्।।3.7.22।।अन्वास्य पश्चिमां स्नध्यां तत्र वासमकल्पयत्।सुतीक्ष्णस्याऽश्रमे रम्ये सीतया लक्ष्मणेन च।।3.7.23।।
7_21.translation: Rama stopped with this. And then the evening drew to a close. Offering his evening oblation, he arranged for his stay along with Sita and Lakshmana in the delightful hermitage of Sutikshna.
7_21.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तम् him, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, उपरमम् stopped there, सन्ध्याम् to the evening twilight, उपागमत् drew to a close, पश्चिमां सन्ध्याम् at Sunset in the west, अन्वास्य to offer (oblation), सीतया with Sita, लक्ष्मणेन च and Lakshmana, सुतीक्षणस्य at Sutikshna's, तत्र then, रम्ये in a delightful, आश्रमे hermitage, वासम् stay, अकल्पयत् arranged.

7_22.shloka: तमेवमुक्त्वोपरमं रामस्सन्ध्यामुपागमत्।।3.7.22।।अन्वास्य पश्चिमां संंध्यां तत्र वासमकल्पयत्।सुतीक्ष्णस्याश्रमे रम्ये सीतया लक्ष्मणेन च।।3.7.23।।
7_22.translation: Rama stopped with this. And then the evening drew to a close. Offering his evening oblation, he arranged for his stay along with Sita and Lakshmana in the delightful hermitage of Sutikshna.
7_22.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तम् him, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, उपरमम् stopped there, सन्ध्याम् to the evening twilight, उपागमत् drew to a close, पश्चिमां सन्ध्याम् at Sunset in the west, अन्वास्य to offer (oblation), सीतया with Sita, लक्ष्मणेन च and Lakshmana, सुतीक्षणस्य at Sutikshna's, तत्र then, रम्ये in a delightful, आश्रमे hermitage, वासम् stay, अकल्पयत् arranged.

7_23.shloka: ततश्शुभं तापसभोज्यमन्नं स्वयं सुतीक्ष्णः पुरुषर्षभाभ्याम्।ताभ्यां सुसत्कृत्य ददौ महात्मा सन्ध्यानिवृत्तौ  रजनीं मवेक्ष्य।।3.7.24।।
7_23.translation: Seeing that the evening had passed and night had set in, the great sage Sutikshna with due hospitality, served those best of men, food fit for ascetics.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
7_23.word_by_word: ततः then, महात्मा the great sage, सुतीक्ष्णः Sutikshna, सन्ध्यानिवृत्तौ  evening twilight had passed, रजनीम् night, ताभ्याम् to both of them, पुरुषर्षभाभ्याम् to both best of men, तापस भोज्यम् (योग्यम्) that which is fit for ascetics, अन्नम् food, सुसत्कृत्य with all hospitality, स्वयम् himself, ददौ presented.

8_1.shloka: [Rama takes leave of  Sutikshna]रामस्तु सहसौमित्रिस्सुतीक्ष्णेनाभिपूजितः।परिणाम्य निशां तत्र प्रभाते प्रत्यबुध्यत।।3.8.1।।
8_1.translation: Rama, worshipped by Sutikshna and accompanied by Lakshmana, spent the night at the hermitage, and got up early in the morning.
8_1.word_by_word: सहसौमित्रिः accompanied by Lakshmana, रामस्तु Rama too, सुतीक्ष्णेन by Sutikshna, अभिपूजितः worshipped by, तत्र there, निशाम् night, परिणाम्य having spent, प्रभाते early in the morning, प्रत्यबुध्यत again got up.

8_2.translation: In the morning Rama and Sita got up in time and took bath in cool, lilyfragrant water.
8_2.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, सहसीतया along with Sita, यथाकालम् at proper time, उत्थाय च getting up, सुशीतेन with cold water, उत्पलगन्धिना  fragrant like lilies or fragrant with lilies, जलेन with water, उपास्पृशत् took bath

8_3.shloka: अथ तेऽग्निं सुरांश्चैव वैदेही रामलक्ष्मणौ।काल्यं विधिवदभ्यर्च्य तपस्विशरणे वने।।3.8.3।।उदयन्तं दिनकरं दृष्ट्वा विगतकल्मषाः।सुतीक्ष्णभिगम्येदं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रुवन्।।3.8.4।।
8_3.translation: And as per routine, sinless Sita, Rama and Lakshmana offered prayers to the fire and other gods of the forest which was the refuge of the ascetics. Seeing the rising Sun, they worshipped him, and approaching Sutikshna,  said these soothing words:
8_3.word_by_word: अथ then, वैदेही Sita, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, ते they, काल्यम् work fit for thattime, अग्निम् fire, सुरांश्चैव the gods, तपस्विशरणे refuge of ascetics, वने   forest, विधिवत् as per tradition, अभ्यर्च्य worshipped, उदयन्तम् rising, दिनकरम् Sun, दृष्ट्वा seeing, विगतकल्मषाः devoid of all sins, सुतीक्ष्णम् Sutikshna, अभिगम्य went towards, श्लक्ष्णम् good, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.

8_4.shloka: सुखोषितास्स्मभगवंस्त्वया पूज्येन पूजिताः।आपृच्छामः प्रयास्यामो मुनयस्त्वरयन्ति नः।।3.8.5।।
8_4.translation: O revered Sutikshna received by one so worshipworthy like you, we spent the night well. We (now)take leave of you. The sages  are hastening us.
8_4.word_by_word: भगवन् O revered Sutikshna, पूज्येन worshipworthy by you, त्वया by you, पूजिताः received, सुखोषिताः stayed comfortably, स्मः were, आपृच्छामः we bid you farewell, प्रयास्यामः we will go, मुनयः sages, नः us, त्वरयन्ति are hastening.

8_5.shloka: त्वरामहे वयं द्रष्टुं कृत्स्नमाश्रममण्डलम्।ऋषीणां पुण्यशीलानां दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम्।।3.8.6।।
8_5.translation: We wish to see the entire circle of hermitages of the sages, residing in Dandaka forest. So we are in a hurry.
8_5.word_by_word: वयम् we, पुण्यशीलानाम् of holy men, दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम् of those residing in Dandakaranya, ऋषीणाम् of sages, कृत्स्नम् the entire, आश्रममण्डलम् circle of hermitages, द्रष्टुम् to see, त्वरामहे we are making haste.

8_6.translation: We seek your permission to go with the great sages, who are ever engaged in righteousness, selfcontrolled by virtue of their penance, and are like flameless fire.
8_6.word_by_word: धर्मनित्यैः ever engaged in nighteousness तपोदान्तैः  selfcontrolled by penance, विशिखैः without flames, पावकैरिव like fire, एभिः by these, मुनिपुङ्गवैः great sages, अभ्यनुज्ञातुम् to be granted इच्छामः desire.

8_7.shloka: अविषह्यातपो यावत्सूर्यो नातिविराजते।अमार्गेणागतां लक्ष्मीं प्राप्येवान्वयवर्जितः।।3.8.8।।तावदिच्छामहे गन्तुमित्युक्त्वा चरणौ मुनेः।ववन्दे सहसौमित्रिस्सीतया सह राघवः।। 3.8.9।।
8_7.translation: We wish to depart before the Sun grows unbearably hot like the man devoid of good lineage who acquires wealth through unlawful means (becomes arrogant). Thereafter Rama along with Sita and Lakshmana offered worship at the feet of the venerable sage.
8_7.word_by_word: अन्वयवर्जितः without good lineage अमार्गेण by unlawful ways, आगताम् earned, लक्ष्मीम् prosperity, प्राप्येव after getting, सूर्यः Sun, यावत् before, अविषह्यातप:  with unbearable heat (of the Sun), नातिविराजते before he comes out with blazing heat, तावत् before that, गन्तुम् to go,  इच्छामहे we desire, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, सीतया सह along with Sita, सहसौमित्रिः with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, मुनेः sage's, चरणौ feet, ववन्दे worshipped.

8_8.shloka: तौ संस्पृशन्तौ चरणावुत्थाप्य मुनिपुङ्गवः।गाढमालिङ्ग्य सस्नेहमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.8.10।।
8_8.translation: When both Rama and Lakshmana touched the feet of Sutikshna, the best of the sages, he lifted them up, hugged them tightly, and said affectionately:
8_8.word_by_word: मुनिपुङ्गव: best of the sages, चरणौ feet, संस्पृशन्तौ while touching, तौ both of them, उत्थाप्य after lifting them up, गाढम् tightly, आलिङ्य hugged, सस्नेहम् lovingly, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

8_9.shloka: अरिष्टं गच्छ पन्थानं राम सौमित्रिणा सह।सीतया चानया सार्धं छाययेवानुवृत्तया।।3.8.11।।
8_9.translation: You may safely tread, O Rama, this path along with Lakshmana and Sita who is following you like a shadow.
8_9.word_by_word: राम Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह with Lakshmana, छाययेव like a shadow, अनुवृत्तया following, अनया सार्धं च with her, अरिष्टम् safe, पन्थानम् on the path, गच्छ you may go.

8_10.shloka: पश्याश्रमपदं रम्यं दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम्।एषां तपस्विनां वीर तपसा भावितात्मनाम्।।3.8.12।।
8_10.translation: O valient Rama the sages, living in  the Dandaka forest, are self realised souls. See how delightful is the location of their hermitages.
8_10.word_by_word: वीर O warrior, दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम् of these residing in Dandaka forest, तपसा with penance,  भावितात्मनाम् of those selfrealised souls, एषाम् of these, तपस्विनाम् sages, रम्यम् delightful, आश्रमपदम् location of hermitage, पश्य see.

8_11.shloka: सप्राज्यफलमूलानि पुष्पितानि वनानि च।प्रशस्तमृगयूथानि शान्तपक्षिगणानि च।। 3.8.13।।फुल्लपङ्कजषण्डानि प्रसन्नसलिलानि च।कारण्डवविकीर्णानि तटाकानि सरांसि च।।3.8.14।।द्रक्ष्यसे दृष्टिरम्याणि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।रमणीयान्यरण्यानि मयूराभिरुतानि च।।3.8.15।।
8_11.translation: You will see the beautiful forestareas with abundant fruits and roots, flowers in full bloom, herds of animals, flocks of quiet birds tanks and lakes filled  with clean waters and shining with fully blossomed lotuses, resounding with waterducks and peacocks  and waterfalls coming down the hills. Thus you will enjoy a delightful sylvan sight.
8_11.word_by_word: सुप्राज्यफलमूलानि places with abundant fruits and roots, पुष्पितानि with flowers in full bloom, प्रशस्तमृगयूथानि full of herds of animals, शान्तपक्षिगणानि च with flocks of quiet birds, वनानि च forest areas, फुल्लपङ्कजषण्डानि with fully blossomed lotuses, प्रसन्नसलिलानि च having clear waters, कारण्डवविकीर्णानि filled with waterducks, तटाकानि tanks, सरांसि च and lakes, दृष्टिरम्याणि delightful to look at, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च waterfalls coming down the hills, मयूराभिरुतानि filled with sounds of peacocks, रमणीयानि beautiful, अरण्यानि forests , द्रक्ष्यसे you will see.

8_12.shloka: गम्यतां वत्स सौमित्रे भवानपि च गच्छतु।आगन्तव्यं च ते दृष्ट्वा पुनरेवाश्रमं मम।।3.8.16।।
8_12.translation: O dear Rama, O Lakshmana you may leave (now), you may have to come back to this hermitage after seeing those places.
8_12.word_by_word: वत्स O dear child, गम्यताम् you may go, सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, भवानपि च you also, गच्छतु may go, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, पुनरेव again, आश्रमं to hermitage, मम my, ते for you, आगन्तव्यम् you have to come here.

8_13.translation: Thus addressed, Rama, scion of the Kakutsthas along with Lakshmana circumambulated the sage (in reverence) and set forth.
8_13.word_by_word: एवम् that way, उक्तः having been told, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, तथेति let it be, उक्त्वा having said this, मुनिम् to the sage, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा circumambulated( the sage as a mark of reverence), प्रस्थातुम् to set out, उपचक्रमे started.

8_14.shloka: ततश्शुभतरे तूणी धनुषी चायतेक्षणा।ददौ सीता तयोर्भ्रात्रोः खङ्गौ च विमलौ ततः।।3.8.18।।
8_14.translation: Thereafter largeeyed Sita handed the brothers two quivers, two bows as well as two excellent swords.
8_14.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, आयतेक्षणा largeeyed lady, सीता Sita, तयोः to them, भ्रात्रोः two brothers, शुभतरे auspicious, तूणी quivers, धनुषी च bows and, ततः then, विमलौ two excellent, खङ्गौ च swords, ददौ gave.

8_15.shloka: आबध्य च शुभे तूणी चापे चादाय सुस्वनौ।निष्क्रान्तावाश्रमाद्गन्तुमुभौ तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.8.19।।
8_15.translation: Both Rama and Lakshmana  tied their auspicious quivers, took the two twanging bows and departed from the hermitage.
8_15.word_by_word: तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, शुभे auspicious ones, तूणी two quivers, आबध्य च tying up, सुस्वनौ twanging चापे च bows, आदाय after taking, गन्तुम् to go, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, निष्क्रान्तौ departed.

8_16.shloka: श्रीमन्तौ रूपसम्पन्नौ दीप्यमानौ स्वतेजसा।प्रस्थितौ धृतचापौ तौ सीतया सह राघवौ।।3.8.20।।
8_16.translation: Handsome Rama and Lakshmana, glowing in their radiance held the bows and exited  with Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epiccomposed by sage Valmiki.
8_16.word_by_word: रूपसम्पन्नौ both very handsome, श्रीमन्तौ तौ राघवौ powerful Rama and Lakshmana, स्वतेजसा by their radiance, दीप्यमानौ both glowing, धृतचापौ both holding bows, सीतया सह along with Sita, शीघ्रम् quickly, प्रस्थितौ exited.

9_1.shloka: [Sita's admonition to Rama on the evil of attachment to weapons, after he had given up the kingdom.]सुतीक्ष्णेनाभ्यनुज्ञातं प्रस्थितं रघुनन्दनम्।हृद्यया स्निग्धया वाचा भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.9.1।।
9_1.translation: While Rama was leaving with the permission of Sutikshna, Sita spoke these warm, affectionate words to her husband:
9_1.word_by_word: सुतीक्ष्णेन by Sutikshna, अभ्यनुज्ञातम् permitted, प्रस्थितम् to leave, भर्तारम् husband, रघुनन्दनम् delight of the Raghus, हृद्यया heartily, स्निग्धया affectionately, वाचा with words, इदम् these, अब्रवीत् said.

9_2.shloka: अयं धर्मस्सुसूक्ष्मेण विधिना प्राप्यते महान्।निवृत्तेन तु शक्योऽयं व्यसनात्कामजादिह।।3.9.2।।
9_2.translation: This great path of dharma you are following now can be attained only through subtle means by one free from addiction born of passion.
9_2.word_by_word: महान् great, अयं धर्मः this righteous path, सुसूक्ष्मेण in a subtle, विधिना means, प्राप्यते  is obtained, अयम् this, कामजात् born of desire, व्यसनात् by addiction, निवृत्तेन by that which is averted, इह here, शक्यः not possible.

9_3.shloka: त्रीण्येव व्यसनान्यत्र कामजानि भवन्त्युत।मिथ्यावाक्यं परमकं तस्माद्गुरुतरावुभौ।।3.9.3।।परदाराभिगमनं विना वैरं च रौद्रता।
9_3.translation: There are three kinds of vices born out of lust. First, speaking untruth, second, having sexual relation with others' wives and third, resorting to violence with no enmity. The later two vices are of serious nature.
9_3.word_by_word: अत्र here (in this context), कामजानि born out of lust, व्यसनानि vices, त्रीण्येव three only, उतindeed, भवन्ति are there, मिथ्यावाक्यम् speaking untruth, परमकम् greatest of all, परदाराभिगमनम् have sexual relation with others' wives विना वैरम् without enmity, रौद्रता violent acts, उभौ both, तस्मात् therefore, गुरुतरौ are of serious nature.

9_4.shloka: मिथ्यावाक्यं न ते भूतं न भविष्यति राघव।।3.9.4।।कुतोऽभिलाषणं स्त्रीणां परेषां धर्मनाशनम्।
9_4.translation: O Rama you never spoke untruth in the past nor will you speak in future. How can there be any desire in you to destroy the virtue of others' wives ?
9_4.word_by_word: राघव Rama, मिथ्यावाक्यम्  lie, ते to  you, न भूतम् never practised, न भविष्यति nor in future, धर्मनाशनम् destroying the character, परेषाम् other's, स्त्रीणाम् women, अभिलषणम् such desire, कुतः how can it come to you.

9_5.shloka: तव नास्ति मनुष्येन्द्र न चाभूत्ते कदाचन।।3.9.5।।मनस्यपि तथा राम न चैतद्विद्यते क्वचित्।
9_5.translation: O Rama, lord among men, you hadn't it (lust for other women) in the past. You havn't it now. Never does it exist even in your mind.
9_5.word_by_word: मनुष्येन्द्र O Indra among men, तव to you, एतत् now, नास्ति does not exist, ते to you, कदाचन at any time, न अभूत् च did not happen earlier, राम Rama, तथा like that, मनस्यपि even in your mind, क्वचित् indeed at any time, न विद्यते does not exist.

9_6.translation: O prince, you are always faithful to your wife. You are righteous, truthful and obedient to your father's orders.
9_6.word_by_word: नृपात्मज O prince , त्वम् you, नित्यमेव always, स्वदारनिरतः ever attached to your wife, धर्मिष्ठःrighteous, सत्यसन्धश्च adherent to truth, पितुः father, निर्देशकारकः obedient.

9_7.shloka: सत्यसन्ध महाभाग श्रीमल्लक्ष्मणपूर्वज।।3.9.7।।त्वयि धर्मश्च सत्यं च त्वयि सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम्।
9_7.translation: O Rama, you are truthful, honourable, powerful. O elder brother of Lakshmana, in you is established truth and righteousness.
9_7.word_by_word: सत्यसन्ध truthful, महाभाग reverend, श्रीमन् powerful one, लक्ष्मणपूर्वज one born before Lakshmana (Rama), त्वयि in you, धर्मश्च righteousness, सत्यं च truth, त्वयि in you, सर्वम् all, प्रतिष्ठितम् are wellestablished.

9_8.shloka: तच्च सर्वं महाबाहो शक्यं धर्तुं जितेन्द्रियैः।।3.9.8।।तव वश्येन्द्रियत्वं च जानामि शुभदर्शन।
9_8.translation: O longarmed one, to contain all this is only possible for those who have conquered the senses. O handsome one, I know your ability to control the senses.
9_8.word_by_word: महाबाहो longarmed, तत् that, सर्वम् all, जितेन्द्रियैः having conquered the senses, धर्तुम् to hold, शक्यम् possible, शुभदर्शन pleasing to look at, तव वश्येन्द्रियत्वम् your ability to control the senses, जानामि I know.

9_9.shloka: तृतीयं यदिदं रौद्रं परप्राणाभिहिंसनम्।।3.9.9।।निर्वैरं क्रियते मोहात्तच्च ते समुपस्थितम्।
9_9.translation: (But) you are a victim to the third (vice born of lust) i.e. showing violence without cause for enmity
9_9.word_by_word: निर्वैरम् without enmity, यत् as such, इदम् this, रौद्रम् wrath, परप्राणाभिहिंसनम् showing violence on other beings, मोहात् out of delusion, क्रियते is carried out, तत् that, तृतीयम् third, ते you, समुपस्थितम्  befallen.

9_10.shloka: प्रतिज्ञातस्त्वया वीर दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम्।।3.9.10।।ऋषीणां रक्षणार्थाय वधस्संयति रक्षसाम्।
9_10.translation: O valiant one, you have promised to kill the demons in the battle, in order to protect the sages residing in the Dandaka forest.
9_10.word_by_word: वीर O valiant one , दण्डकारण्यवासिनाम् those residing in Dandaka forest, ऋषीणाम् of sages, रक्षणार्थाय to protect them, संयति in battle, रक्षसाम् with demons, वधः killing, त्वया by you, प्रतिज्ञात: is promised.

9_11.shloka: एतन्निमित्तं च वनं दण्डका इति विश्रुतम्।।3.9.11।।प्रस्थितस्त्वं सह भ्रात्रा धृतबाणशरासनः।
9_11.translation: It is only on account of this that you entered the wellknown Dandaka forest with your brother wielding bow and arrows.
9_11.word_by_word: एतन्निमित्तम् for this reason, त्वम् you, धृतबाणशरासनः wielding bow and arrows, भ्रात्रा सह with brother, दण्डकाः Dandaka forest, इति by name, विश्रुतम् wellknown, वनम् forest, प्रस्थितः entered.

9_12.shloka: ततस्त्वां प्रस्थितं दृष्ट्वा मम चिन्ताकुलं मनः।।3.9.12।।त्वद्वृत्तं चिन्तयन्त्या वै भवेन्निश्श्रेयसं हितम्।
9_12.translation: I am, therefore, worried in my mind when I see you here and think of your wellbeing. I wish your ultimate good. [The next two lines appear, more or less, a repetition. So omitted : Editor]
9_12.word_by_word: ततः therefore, प्रस्थितम् present, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, मम to me, मनः mind, चिन्ताकुलम् is worried, त्वद्वृत्तम् your stand, चिन्तयन्त्याः while I reflect, हितम् salutary, निश्रेयसम् final benefit, भवेत् वै it is wished.

9_13.shloka: त्वां चैव प्रस्थितं दृष्ट्वा राम चिन्ताकुलं मनः।।3.9.13।।सर्वतचशिन्तय्नत्या मे तव निश्श्रेयसं नृप।न हि मे रोचते वीर गमनं दण्डकान्प्रति।।3.9.14।।कारणं तत्र वक्ष्यामि वदन्त्याश्श्रूयतां मम।
9_13.translation: O brave Rama, I do not like your going to Dandaka forest. I shall tell you the reason. Do listen.
9_13.word_by_word: वीर O brave Rama, दण्डकान् प्रति to Dandakaranyam, गमनम् going, मे to me, न रोचते not to my liking, तत्र there, कारणम् reason, वक्ष्यामि I shall tell, मम वदन्त्याः my saying so, श्रूयताम् please listen.

9_14.shloka: त्वं हि बाणधनुष्पाणिर्भ्रात्रा सह वनं गतः।।3.9.15।।दृष्ट्वा वनचरान्सर्वान्कच्चित्कुर्याश्शरव्ययम्।
9_14.translation: Of course, you will go to the forest with your brother, holding the bow and arrows. Release the arrows when you see the forestrangers.
9_14.word_by_word: बाणधनुष्पाणिः holding bow and arrows, त्वम् you, भ्रात्रा सह with your brother, वनम् to the forest, गतः you are gone, सर्वान् all, वनचरान् forestrangers दृष्ट्वा seeing, शरव्ययम् release of arrows, कच्चित् कुर्यात् you may resort to.

9_15.shloka: क्षत्रियाणामपि धनुर्हुताशस्येन्धनानि च।।3.9.16।।समीपतस्स्थितं तेजो बलमुच्छ्रयते भृशम्।
9_15.translation: A bow in the hand of a kshatriya is like fuel to fire. It surely swells his strength and his brilliance.
9_15.word_by_word: क्षत्रियाणाम् for Kshatriyas, समीपतः nearby, स्थितम् available, धनुः bow, हुताशस्य for a fire, इन्धनानि च is fuel also, भृशम् surely, तेजः lustre, बलम् strength, उच्छ्रयते increases.

9_16.shloka: पुरा किल महाबाहो तपस्स्वी सत्यवाक्छुचिः।।3.9.17।।कस्मिंश्चिदभवत्पुण्ये वने रतमृगद्विजे।
9_16.translation: O mightyarmed one, there dwelt in the past an ascetic, noble and truthful in a sacred forest where animals and birds lived merrily together.
9_16.word_by_word: महाबाहो mightyarmed, पुरा in the past, पुण्ये in a sacred, रतमृगद्विजे where animals and birds roamed, कस्मिंश्चित्  some, वने in a forest, सत्यवाक् one who speaks the truth, शुचिः pure, तपस्स्वी ascetic, अभवत् किल lived.

9_17.translation: Once Indra, husband of Sachi, came to his hermitage in the guise of an attendant, sword in hand, in order to hinder his penance.
9_17.word_by_word: अथ then, शचीपतिः husband of Sachi, इन्द्रः Indra, तस्यैव his only, तपसः penance, विघ्नम् obstruction, कर्तुम् to do, भटरूपधृत् in the guise of an attendant, खङ्गपाणिः sword in hand, आश्रमम् to the hermitage, आगच्छत् came.

9_18.shloka: तस्मिंस्तदाश्रमपदे निशितः खङ्ग उत्तमः।।3.9.19।।स न्यासविधिना दत्तः पुण्ये तपसि तिष्ठतः।
9_18.translation: Then while the sage was practising penance at the hermitage, he gave him that excellent sword to be kept in trust.
9_18.word_by_word: तदा then, तस्मिन् in that, आश्रमपदे at the hermitage, पुण्ये holy, तपसि in penance, तिष्ठतः practising, निशितः a sharp, उत्तमः best, सः खङ्ग: that sword, न्यासविधिना as a trust, दत्तः was deposited.

9_19.shloka: स तच्छस्त्रमनुप्राप्य न्यासरक्षणतत्परः।।3.9.20।।वने तु विचरत्येव रक्षन्प्रत्ययमात्मनः।
9_19.translation: Having received the weapon as a trust, the sage went wandering in the forest, always attentive in safeguarding the weapon.
9_19.word_by_word: सः तु that sage, तत् that, शस्त्रम् weapon, अनुप्राप्य having received, आत्मनः his own, प्रत्ययम् trust, रक्षन् while keeping, न्यासरक्षणतत्परः always attentive in protecting that deposit, वने in the forest, विचरत्येव  went wandering.

9_20.shloka: यत्र गच्छत्युपादातुं मूलानि च फलानि च।।3.9.21।।न विना याति तं खङ्गं न्यासरक्षणतत्परः।
9_20.translation: Vigilant about protecting the sword deposited with him, the sage never moved without it even when he went gathering roots and fruits.
9_20.word_by_word: न्यासरक्षणतत्परः ever alert in protecting the trust, मूलानि च roots, फलानि च and fruits, यत्र wherever, गच्छति he goes, तं खङ्गं विना without that sword, न याति does not go,

9_21.shloka: नित्यं शस्त्रं परिवहन्क्रमेण स तपोधनः।।3.9.22।।चकार रौद्रीं स्वां बुद्धिं त्यक्त्वा तपसि निश्चयम्।
9_21.translation: While the sage moved about holding the weapon, he gave up the practice of penance gradually and developed a violent mindset.
9_21.word_by_word: नित्यम् always, शस्त्रम् weapon, परिवहन् while carrying, सः तपोधनः that sage, तपसि in penance, निश्चयम् his resolve, त्यक्त्वा after giving up, क्रमेण gradually, स्वाम् his, बुद्धिं intellect, रौद्रीम् fierce, चकार developed.

9_22.shloka: ततस्सरौद्रेऽभिरतः प्रमत्तोऽधर्मकर्शितः।।3.9.23।।तस्य शस्त्रस्य संवासाज्जगाम नरकं मुनिः।
9_22.translation: By association with the sword, he developed a violent attitude. And in that habitual state of excitement he was dragged into unrighteous ways which (ultimately) took him to hell.
9_22.word_by_word: ततः then, तस्य of that, शस्त्रस्य संवासात् in association with the weapon, रौद्रे in a violent mood, अभिरतः always involved, सः that, मुनिः sage, प्रमत्तः in excitement अधर्मकर्शितः dragged in unrighteous ways, नरकम् to hell, जगाम went.

9_23.shloka: एवमेतत्पुरा वृत्तं शस्त्रसंयोगकारणम्।।3.9.24।।अग्निसंयोगवद्धेतुश्शस्त्रसंयोग उच्यते।स्नेहाच्च बहुमानाच्च स्मारये त्वां न शिक्षये।।3.9.25।।
9_23.translation: Contact with the weapon has led to this in the past. Like contact with fire, it leads man to destruction. I say this out of my love and reverence for you as a reminder and not as an instruction.
9_23.word_by_word: पुरा in the past, एतत् that, शस्त्रसंयोगकारणम् owing to contact with the weapon, वृत्तम् this happened, शस्त्र संयोगः association with the weapon, अग्निसम्योगवत् like contact with fire हेतुः becomes a cause, उच्यते it is said, स्नेहाच्च out of love, बहुमानाच्च out of great respect, त्वाम् to you, स्मारये I am reminding, न शिक्षये I am not instructing you.

9_24.shloka: न कथञ्चन सा कार्या गृहीतधनुषा त्वया।बुद्धिर्वैरं  विना हन्तुं राक्षसान्दण्डकाश्रितान्।।3.9.26।।अपराधं विना हन्तुं लोकान्वीर न कामये।
9_24.translation: While holding a bow, you should not have the intention to kill demons residing in Dandaka with no animosity against you. O valiant one  I do not desire that any one should be killed without incurring any offence.
9_24.word_by_word: गृहीतधनुषा by one holding a bow, त्वया by you, वैरं विना without animosity, दण्डकाश्रितान् those taking shelter in Dandaka, राक्षसान् demons, हन्तुम् to kill, सा बुद्धि: that thinking, कथञ्चन on any account, न कार्या should not be done, अपराधं विना without any offence, लोकान् the people, हन्तुम् to kill, न कामये not desirable.

9_25.shloka: क्षत्रियाणां तु वीराणां वनेषु निरतात्मनाम्।।3.9.27।।धनुषा कार्यमेतावदार्तानां त्वभिरक्षणम्।
9_25.translation: It is the duty of a kshatriya, a warrior to protect with his bow those who practise selfcontrol (penance) in the forest in a state of panic.
9_25.word_by_word: वनेषु in the forests, निरतात्मनाम् those practising selfcontrol, वीराणाम् for warriors, क्षत्रियाणाम् for kshatriyas, आर्तानाम् of the panicked, अभिरक्षणम् protection, एतावत् this much, धनुषा with a bow, कार्यम्  duty.

9_26.shloka: क्वच शस्त्रं क्व च वनं क्व च क्षात्रं तपः क्वच।।3.9.28।।व्याविद्धमिदमस्माभिर्द्देशधर्मस्तु पूज्यताम्।
9_26.translation: Where is the question of wielding a weapon and living in the forest, where is the life of a kshatriya and the life of penance? For us, this is an encroachment. Let the law of the land be honoured.
9_26.word_by_word: क्वच शस्त्रं where is a weapon, क्व च वनं and where is a forest, क्व च क्षात्रं where is the duty of a kshatriya, तपः क्वच and where is penance, अस्माभि by us, इदं this, व्याविद्धम् is encroached, देशधर्मस्तु law of the locality पूज्यताम् may be honoured.

9_27.shloka: तदार्य कलुषा बुद्धिर्जायते शस्त्रसेवनात्।।3.9.29।।पुनर्गत्वा त्वयोध्यायां क्षत्रधर्मं चरिष्यसि।
9_27.translation: Lord, when we handle the weapon, the mind gets vitiated. (Only) after returning to Ayodhya can you perform the duty of a kshatriya.
9_27.word_by_word: आर्य Lord  तत् thus, शस्त्रसेवनात् serving the weapons बुद्धि: mind, कलुषा impure, जायते will be, पुनः again, गत्वा after going to, अयोध्यायाम् to Ayodhya, क्षत्रधर्मम् duty of a Kshatriya, चरिष्यसि you can practise.

9_28.shloka: अक्षया तु भवेत्प्रीतिश्श्वश्रूश्वशुरयोर्मम।।3.9.30।।यदि राज्यं परित्यज्य भवेस्त्वं निरतो मुनिः।
9_28.translation: You would have been on unlimited source of joy to my fatherinlaw and motherinlaw had you permanently renounced the kingdom for the life of an ascetic.
9_28.word_by_word: त्वम् you, राज्यम् kingdom, परित्यज्य having given up, निरतः permanent, मुनिः an ascetic, भवेः you, यदि if, मम to me, श्वश्रूश्वशुरयोः to motherinlaw and fatherinlaw, अक्षया unlimited, प्रीतिः joy, भवेत् will be.

9_29.shloka: धर्मादर्थः प्रभवति धर्मात्प्रभवते सुखम्।।3.9.31।।धर्मेण लभते सर्वं धर्मसारमिदं जगत्।
9_29.translation: Righteousness brings wealth. Wealth brings happiness. Righteousness brings everything. In fact, the essence of the world is righteousness.
9_29.word_by_word: धर्मात् from righteous duty, अर्थः wealth, प्रभवति will arise, धर्मात् from righteousness, सुखम् happiness, प्रभवते will result, धर्मेण by righteous ways, सर्वम् everything, लभते is attained, इदं जगत् this world, धर्मसारम् the essence is dharma.

9_30.shloka: आत्मानं नियमैस्तैस्तै कर्शयित्वा प्रयत्नतः।।3.9.32।।प्राप्यते निपुणैर्धर्मो न सुखाल्लभ्यते सुखम्।
9_30.translation: The wise earn dharma through getting their bodies emaciated by carefully adoptingdifferent means of discipline (selftorture). Happiness does not beget happiness.
9_30.word_by_word: निपुणैः by wisemen, आत्मानम् themselves, तैस्तै: by their various means, नियमैः by their discipline, प्रयत्नतः with effort, कर्शयित्वा after crushing, धर्मः righteousness, प्राप्यते is  attained, सुखात् from happiness, सुखम् joy, न लभ्यते will not be attained.

9_31.shloka: नित्यं शुचिमतिस्सौम्य चर धर्मं तपोवने।।3.9.33।।सर्वं हि विदितं तुभ्यं त्रैलोक्यमपि तत्त्वतः।
9_31.translation: O gentle one you may move in this forest of ascetics with a pure mind. The true meaning behind everything in these three worlds is known to you, indeed.
9_31.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle one, नित्यम् always, शुचिमतिः with a pure mind (free from thoughts of punishing the innocent), तपोवने in this forest of ascetics, धर्मम् dharma, चर follow, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, सर्वम् अपि all put together, तुभ्यम् to you, तत्त्वतः in true spirit, विदितं हि is known indeed.

9_32.shloka: स्त्रीचापलादेतदुदाहृतं मे धर्मं च वक्तुं तव कस्समर्थः।विचार्य बुद्ध्या तु सहानुजेन यद्रोचते तत्कुरु मा चिरेण।।3.9.34।।
9_32.translation: I told you all this out of feminine fickleness. Who can guide you in the ways of dharma? After carefully deliberating the matter with your brother you may act according to your wish. Let there be no delay (hesitation).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे नवमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the ninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
9_32.word_by_word: स्त्रीचापलात् due to the fickle nature of a woman, एतत् all that, मे by myself, उदाहृतम् is mentioned to you, तव your, धर्मम् rightful duty, वक्तुम् to direct, कः who indeed, समर्थः a capable one, तु you, बुद्ध्या applying your mind, अनुजेन with brother, सह also, विचार्य after deliberating  carefully, यत् whatever, रोचते pleases you, तत् that, कुरु you may do, माचिरेण let there be no delay.

10_1.shloka: [Rama's tells Sita that protection of sages is his supreme righteous duty.]वाक्यमेतत्तु वैदेह्या व्याहृतं भर्तृभक्तया।श्रुत्वा धर्मे स्थितो रामः प्रत्युवाचाथ मैथिलीम्।।3.10.1।।
10_1.translation: Having heard these words spoken by Sita who was devoted to her husband, replied Rama who was firm in righteousness.
10_1.word_by_word: भर्तृभक्तया out of devotion to her husband, वैदेह्या by Sita, व्याहृतम् spoken, एतत् this, वाक्यम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, धर्मे in righteousness, स्थितः steadfast, रामः Rama, अथ thereafter, मैथिलीम् to Sita, प्रत्युवाच replied.

10_2.shloka: हितमुक्तं त्वया देवि स्निग्धया सदृशं वचः।कुलं व्यपदिशन्त्या च धर्मज्ञे जनकात्मजे।।3.10.2।।
10_2.translation: O daughter of Janaka, you are conversant with dharma. Whatever you have admonished out of affection for me is befitting your race.
10_2.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, धर्मज्ञे O one who knows righteousness जनकात्मजे O daughter of Janaka, कुलम् race, व्यपदिशन्त्या by admonishing, स्निग्धया affectionately, त्वया by you, हितम्  good, सदृशम् suitable, वचः words, उक्तम् is stated.

10_3.shloka: किन्तु वक्ष्याम्यहं देवि त्वयैवोक्तमिदं वचः।क्षत्रियैर्धार्यते चापो नार्तशब्दो भवेदिति।।3.10.3।।
10_3.translation: But permit me, Devi, you have already stated, when a kshatriya holds a bow there will be no cry of distress. (it means you approve of my holding a bow)
10_3.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, अहम् I, किन्तु but, वक्ष्यामि I speak, आर्तशब्दः cry of distress न भवेदिति  not  to arise, क्षत्रियैः by kshatriyas, चापः bow, धार्यते is held, इदम् this way, वचः declaration, त्वयैव by yourself, उक्तम् is spoken.

10_4.shloka: ते चार्ता दण्डकारण्ये मुनयस्संशितव्रताः।मां सीते स्वयमागम्य शरण्याश्शरणं गताः।।3.10.4।।
10_4.translation: O Sita, the sages who perform rigorous penance in Dandaka forest came to me personally, seeking shelter although they can be their own protection.
10_4.word_by_word: सीते Sita, संशितव्रता: practising rigorous austerities, शरण्या worthy of giving refuge, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, ते मुनयः those sages, आर्ताः in distress, स्वयम् personally, आगम्य after coming to me, माम् myself, शरणं गताः sought refuge.

10_5.shloka: वसन्तो धर्मनिरता वने मूलफलाशनाः।न लभन्ते सुखं भीता राक्षसैः क्रूरकर्मभिः।।3.10.5।।
10_5.translation: The sages living in the forest, eating roots and fruits and ever engaged in righteous activities are afraid of the depredations of the demons, with their happiness gone.
10_5.word_by_word: मूलफलाशनाः living on roots and fruits, धर्मनिरताः engaged in righteous activition वने in the forest, वसन्तः residing, क्रूरकर्मभिः by cruel activities, राक्षसैः by demons, भीताः are afraid, सुखम् happiness, न लभन्ते do not get.

10_6.shloka: काले काले च निरता नियमैर्विविधैर्वने।भक्ष्यन्ते राक्षसैर्भीमैर्नरमांसोपजीविभिः।।3.10.6।।
10_6.translation: The sages engrossed in various austerities in the forest have been victims to the dreadful demons living on human flesh.
10_6.word_by_word: काले काले at all times, विविधैः by different, नियमैः traditions, निरताः totally involved, वने in the forest, नरमांसोपजीविभिः living on human flesh (as cannibals), भीमैः by dreadful, राक्षसैः demons, भक्ष्यन्ते are eaten.

10_7.translation: The ascetics, the best of brahmins living in Dandaka forest being eaten up like that besought me to come to their rescue.
10_7.word_by_word: भक्ष्यमाणाः eaten up like that, दण्डकारण्यवासिनः living in the Dandaka forest, द्विजसत्तमाः best of brahmins, ते मुनयः those sages, अस्मान् to us, अभ्यवपद्य you may come to our rescue, इति like this, माम् me, ऊचु: spoke.

10_8.shloka: मया तु वचनं श्रुत्वा तेषामेवं मुखाच्च्युतम्।कृत्वा चरणशुश्रूषां वाक्यमेतदुदाहृतम्।।3.10.8।।
10_8.translation: On hearing the words that came from their mouth, I bowed at their feet and said:
10_8.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, तेषाम् their, मुखात् from their mouth, च्युतम् that came out from, वचनम् statement, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मया by me, चरणशुश्रूषाम् bowing at their feet, कृत्वा having done एतत् this way, वाक्यम् words, उदाहृतम् said so.

10_9.shloka: प्रसीदन्तु भवन्तो मे ह्रीरेषा हि ममातुला।यदीदृशैरहं विप्रैरुपस्थेयैरुपस्थितः।।3.10.9।।
10_9.translation: Be pleased  That brahmins like you have approached me while I should have come to you has put me to shame immeasurable .
10_9.word_by_word: भवन्तः you all, मे myself, प्रसीदस्तु be pleased, अहम् I, यत् that, उपस्थेयैः to be approached ईदृशैः by such men, विप्रैः by sages, उपस्थितः is approached, एषा this, मम my, अतुला immeasureable, ह्रीः हि shame in deed.

10_10.shloka: किं करोमीति च मया व्याहृतं द्विजसन्निधौ।सर्वैरेतैस्समागम्य वागियं समुदाहृता।।3.10.10।।
10_10.translation: I enquired about what I could do for them. And all the brahmins in one voice said:.
10_10.word_by_word: किम् what, करोमि can I do, इति this, मया by me, द्विजसन्निधौ in the presence of brahmins, व्याहृतम् was enquired, सर्वैः by all of them, एतैः by these, समागम्य collected together, इयम् this, वाक् voice, समुदाहृता was spoken.

10_11.shloka: राक्षसैर्दण्डकारण्ये बहुभिः कामरूपिभिः।अर्दितास्स्म दृढं राम भवान्नस्तत्र रक्षतु।।3.10.11।।
10_11.translation: 'O Rama, the demons who can assume any form at their will are mercilessly tormenting us in Dandaka forest. Do protect us from them'.
10_11.word_by_word: राम O Rama, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, बहुभिः by many, कामरूपिभिः assuming forms at will राक्षसैः by demons, दृढम् strongly, (cruelly) अर्दिताः are tormented, स्म we are, भवान् you, तत्र for that reason, नः us, रक्षतु may protect.

10_12.shloka: होमकालेषु सम्प्राप्ताः पर्वकालेषु चानघ।धर्षयन्ति सुदुर्धर्षा राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।।3.10.12।।
10_12.translation: 'O sinless one, these cannibals are invincible. They arrive at the time of our sacrificial rituals, on the days of festivities or at the time of lunar conjunctions like no moon or full moon days and attack us.
10_12.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless one, सुदुर्धर्षाः quite invincible, पिशिताशनाः flesheaters, राक्षसाः demons, होमकालेषु at the time of  sacrifices, पर्वकालेषु at the time of change of lunar conjunction like full moon or no moon days सम्प्राप्ताः are arriving, धर्षयन्ति are attacking.

10_13.shloka: राक्षसैर्धर्षितानां च तापसानां तपस्विनाम्।गतिं मृगयमाणानां भवान्नः परमा गतिः।।3.10.13।।
10_13.translation: 'You are the supreme refuge for us ascetics, tormented by demons, helpless men in search of shelter.
10_13.word_by_word: राक्षसैः by demons, धर्षितानाम् oppressed, तपस्विनाम् helpless people, तापसानाम् of the sages, गतिम् direction, मृगयमाणानाम् for those who search for, नः for us, भवान् your, परमा supreme, गतिः refuge

10_14.shloka: कामं तपःप्रभावेन शक्ता हन्तुं निशाचरान्।चिरार्जितं तु नेच्छामस्तपः खण्डयितुं वयम्।।3.10.14।।
10_14.word_by_word: वयम् we, तपःप्रभावेन by the power of penance, निशाचरान् nightrangers (demons), हन्तुम् to kill, कामं शक्ताः have the power, तु however, चिरार्जितम् earned over a long time, तपः penance, खण्डयितुम् to exhaust them, (वयम्) नेच्छामः we are not willing.

10_15.shloka: बहुविघ्नं तपो नित्यं दुश्चरं चैव राघव।तेन शापं न मुञ्चामो भक्ष्यमाणाश्च राक्षसैः।।3.10.15।।
10_15.translation: 'O Rama it is difficult to perform penance which is ever full of obstacles. Therefore, we do not pronounce curses even if eaten up by demons'.
10_15.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तपः penance, नित्यम् always, बहुविघ्नम् is full of obstacles, दुश्चरं चैव but is difficult to pursue, तेन therefore, राक्षसैः by demons, भक्ष्यमाणाः even if  they eat us, शापम् curse, न not, मुञ्चामः we do not pronounce.

10_16.shloka: तदर्ध्यमानान्रक्षोभिर्दण्डकारण्यवासिभिः।रक्ष नस्त्वं सह भ्रात्रा त्वन्नाथा हि वयं वने।।3.10.16।।
10_16.translation: 'The demons, dwelling in the Dandaka forest are tormenting us. You alone are our lord in the forest. Do protect us with your brother.'
10_16.word_by_word: तत् then, दण्डकारण्यवासिभिः by those who are dwelling in Dandaka forest, रक्षोभिः by demons, अर्ध्यमानान् being tormented by, नः us, सह भ्रात्रा with your brother, त्वम् you,रक्ष protect, वयम् we, वने in the forest, त्वन्नाथाः हि you alone as the Lord.

10_17.shloka: मया चैतद्वचश्श्रुत्वा कार्त्स्न्येन परिपालनम्।ऋषीणां दण्डकारण्ये संश्रुतं जनकात्मजे।।3.10.17।।
10_17.translation: O daughter of Janaka, on hearing the words of the sages I promised to undertake the entire protection of sages of the Dandaka forest.
10_17.word_by_word: जनकात्मजे O daughter of Janaka, Sita, च and, एतत् these, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, दण्डकारण्ये ऋषीणाम् of sages of Dandaka forest, कार्त्स्न्येन in the entire, परिपालनम् protection, संश्रुतम् made a promise.

10_18.shloka: संश्रुत्य च न शक्ष्यामि जीवमानः प्रतिश्रवम्।मुनीनामन्यथा कर्तुं सत्यमिष्टं हि मे सदा।।3.10.18।।
10_18.translation: Having promised the sages, I cannot do otherwise as long as I have life in me. To me truth is always dear.
10_18.word_by_word: संश्रुत्य having promised, जीवमानः as long as there is life in me, मुनीनाम् of sages, प्रतिश्रवम् promise, अन्यथा otherwise, कर्तुम् to do, न shall not do, शक्ष्यामि I will not be able, सदा always, मे to me, सत्यम् truth, इष्टं हि is dear.

10_19.shloka: अप्यहं जीवितं जह्यां त्वां वा सीते सलक्ष्मणाम्।न तु प्रतिज्ञां संश्रुत्य ब्राह्मणेभ्यो विशेषतः।।3.10.19।।
10_19.translation: O Sita I may forfeit my life forsake, even Lakshmana and you but will not break the promise made specially to the brahmins৷৷
10_19.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, अहम् I, जीवितमपि even life, सलक्ष्मणाम् including Lakshmana, त्वां वा or you, जह्याम् I may forsake तु but, प्रतिज्ञाम् the promise, विशेषतः specially, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः to thebrahmins, संश्रुत्य after promising, न do not (fail to fulfil).

10_20.shloka: तदवश्यं मया कार्यमृषीणां परिपालनम्।अनुक्तेनापि वैदेहि प्रतिज्ञाय तु किं पुनः।।3.10.20।।
10_20.translation: Even before the sages requested me I should have protected them. What to speak of the promise I have already made ?
10_20.word_by_word: वैदेहि O Sita, तत् that, मया by me, अनुक्तेनापि even if they did not request, ऋषीणाम् of the sages, परिपालनम् protection, कार्यम् should have been done, प्रतिज्ञाय even after making the promise किं पुनः what more?

10_21.translation: O sinless one all that has been said by you is out of your love and affection for me. I am pleased. What is harmful is never advised.
10_21.word_by_word: अनघे O sinless, मम my, स्नेहाच्च out of love, सौहार्दात् friendly feeling, त्वया by you, इदम् this, उक्तम् is spoken, सीते O Sita, अहम् I, परितुष्टः pleased, अस्मि I am, अनिष्टः undesirable, न अनुशिष्यते हि is not advised.

10_22.shloka: सदृशं चानुरूपं च कुलस्य तव चात्मनः।सधर्मचारिणी मे त्वं प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसी।।3.10.22।।
10_22.translation: Your auspicious words are quite befitting your lineage. You are the follower of my dharma and so dearer to me than my life.
10_22.word_by_word: तव your, कुलस्य of family, आत्मनः च of yourself, सदृशम् befitting अनुकूलं च favourable too, मे to me, सधर्मचारिणी follwer of dharma of husband, त्वम् you, प्राणेभ्योऽपि more than my life, गरीयसी dearer.

10_23.shloka: इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनं महात्मा सीतां प्रियां मैथिलराजपुत्रीम्।रामो धनुष्मान्सह लक्ष्मणेन जगाम रम्याणि तपोवनानि।।3.10.23।।
10_23.translation: Having said this to Sita, the princess of Mithila, Rama along with Lakshmana, bow in hand, moved about the delightful penancegrove.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the tenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.
10_23.word_by_word: महात्मा great soul, रामः Rama, प्रियाम् to his beloved, मैथिलराजपुत्रीम् to the daughter of king of Mithila, सीताम् to Sita, इत्येवम् in this way, वचनम् statement, उक्त्वा on having said, धनुष्मान् wielding the bow, सह लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, रम्याणि most delightful, तपोवनानि penance groves, जगाम moved about.

11_1.shloka: [Meeting with sage Dharmabrata -- episode of sage Mandakarni and Panchapsara lake -- Rama, Sita and Lakshmana go about living in different hermitages -- arrive at Sutikshna's leave for Agastya's -- story of Ilvala and Vatapi.]अग्रतः प्रययौ रामस्सीता मध्ये सुमध्यमा।पृष्ठतस्तु धनुष्पाणिर्लक्ष्मणोऽनुजगाम ह।।3.11.1।।
11_1.translation: Rama walked in front, Sita with a beautiful waist, in the middle and Lakshmana holding the bow, behind them৷৷
11_1.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अग्रतः in front, प्रययौ walked, सुमध्यमा a lady with a beautiful waist, सीता Sita, मध्ये in the middle, धनुष्पाणिः one holding the bow, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, पृष्ठतः following behind them, अनुजगाम ह followed.

11_2.shloka: तौ पश्यमानौ विविधान् शैलप्रस्थान्वनानि च।नदीश्च विविधा रम्या जग्मतुस्सीतया सह।।3.11.2।।
11_2.translation: Both Rama and Lakshmana walked on, accompanied by Sita, watching several beautiful mountain ranges, forests  and rivers.
11_2.word_by_word: तौ both (Rama and Lakshmana), विविधान् different, शैलप्रस्थान् chains of hills वनानि च and forests too, विविधाः different, रम्याः delightful, नदीश्च rivers, पश्यमानौ  seeing, सीतया सह along with Sita, जग्मतुः went.

11_3.shloka: सारसांश्चक्रवाकांश्च नदीपुलिनचारिणः।सरांसि च सपद्मानि युक्तानि जलजैः खगैः।।3.11.3।।
11_3.translation: (Watching) the swans and ruddy geese on river banks and lakes full of lotuses, and birds on water and in the sky.
11_3.word_by_word: नदीपुलिनचारिणः roaming the riverbanks, सारसान् swans, चक्रवाकांश्च ruddy geese, सपद्मानि full of lotuses, जलजैः along with aquatic birds in the sky, खगैः with birds, युक्तानि joinedwith, सरांसि च lakes also.

11_4.shloka: यूथबद्धांश्च पृषतान्मदोन्मत्तान् विषाणिनः।महिषांश्च वराहांश्च नागांश्च द्रुमवैरिणः।।3.11.4।।
11_4.translation: (Watching) herds of deer, intoxicated horned buffaloes, wild boars and elephants who are enemies of trees (elephants uproof trees).
11_4.word_by_word: यूथबद्धान् in herds, पृषतान् deer, मदोन्मत्तान् intoxicated, विषाणिनः horned animals, महिषांश्च buffaloes, वराहांश्च wild boars, द्रुमवैरिणः enemies of trees, नागांश्च elephants also.

11_5.shloka: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं लम्बमाने दिवाकरे।ददृशुस्सहिता रम्यं तटाकं योजनायतम्।।3.11.5।।पद्मपुष्करसम्बाधं गजयूथैरलङ्कृतम्।सारसैर्हंसकादम्बैस्सङ्कुलं जलचारिभिः।।3.11.6।।
11_5.translation: As the Sun was setting, they had covered a long distance, watching a yojanalong tank adorned with lotuses, and crowded with herds of elephants and flocks of cranes, swans and aquatic animals.
11_5.word_by_word: सहिताः together with, ते they, दूरम् distant, अध्वानाम् path, गत्वा having gone, दिवाकरे Sun, लम्बमाने was setting, पद्मपुष्करसम्बाधम् filled with lotuses, गजयूथैः with herds of elephants, अलङ्कृतम् adorned, जलचारिभिः with aquatic animals, सारसैः by cranes, हंस कादम्बैः with flocks of swans, सङ्कुलम् filled with, योजनायतम् spread over a yojana, रम्यम् delightful, तटाकम् tank, ददृशुः saw.

11_6.shloka: प्रसन्नसलिले रम्ये तस्मिन्सरसि शुश्रुवे।गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषो न तु कश्चन दृश्यते।।3.11.7।।
11_6.translation: In that lake of clear waters they heard the sounds of songs and musical instruments, while there were none around.
11_6.word_by_word: प्रसन्नसलिले in the clear water, रम्ये in a delightful place, तस्मिन् in that, सरसि lake, गीतवादित्रनिर्घोषः sounds of songs and musical instruments, शुश्रुवे heard, तु but, कश्चन none, न दृश्यते could be seen.

11_7.shloka: ततः कौतूहलाद्रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।मुनिं धर्मभृतं नाम प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।3.11.8।।
11_7.translation: Out of curiosity, mighty Rama, and Lakshmana started enquiring about the matter from sage Dharmabrata by name:
11_7.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, रामः Rama, महाबलः of great prowess, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, कौतूहलात् out of curiosity, धर्मभृतं नाम Dharmabrata by name, मुनिम् to a sage, प्रष्टुम् to enquire, समुपचक्रमे started.

11_8.shloka: इदमत्यद्भुतं श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां नो महामुने।कौतूहलं महज्जातं किमिदं साधु कथ्यताम्।।3.11.9।।वक्तव्यं यदि चेदविप्र नातिगुह्यमपि प्रभो।
11_8.translation: O great sage, this very wonderful sound, has whetted our great curiosity. If there is no top secret about this, do disclose it.
11_8.word_by_word: महामुने O great sage, अत्यद्भुतम् very wonderful, इदम् this, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सर्वेषाम् for all, नः us, महत् great, कौतूहलम् curiosity, जातम् created, इदम् this, किम् what is this, साधु well, कथ्यताम् please tell us, प्रभो O lord, विप्र O sage, नातिगुह्यमपि यदि चेत् if there is no great secret about this, वक्तव्यम् let it be revealed.

11_9.shloka: तेनैवमुक्तो धर्मात्मा राघवेण मुनिस्तदा।।3.11.10।।प्रभवं सरसः कृत्स्नमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।
11_9.translation: Thus addressed by Rama, the righteous sage narrated the entire origin of the lake.
11_9.word_by_word: तदा then, तेन by that, राघवेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः addressed, धर्मात्मा righteous one, मुनिः sage, सरसः of the lake, कृत्स्नम् entire, प्रभवम् origin, अख्यातुम् to narrate, उपचक्रमे started.

11_10.shloka: इदं पञ्चाप्सरो नाम तटाकं सार्वकालिकम्।।3.11.11।।निर्मितं तपसा राम मुनिना माण्डकर्णिना।
11_10.translation: O Rama this lake called Panchapsara  filled with water at all times has been created through penance by a sage called Mandakarni.
11_10.word_by_word: राम O Rama, इदम् this, माण्डकर्णिना by Mandakarni, मुनिना by sage, तपसा through penance, निर्मितम् is created, सार्वकालिकम् for all times (to be filled with water), पञ्चाप्सरः नाम by name Panchapsara, तटाकम् lake.

11_11.shloka: स हि तेपे तपस्तीव्रं माण्डकर्णिर्महामुनिः।।3.11.12।।दशवर्षसहस्राणि वायुभक्षो जलाश्रयः।
11_11.translation: Great sage Mandakarni standing in water and living on air performed  rigorous penance for ten thousand years.
11_11.word_by_word: महामुनिः the great sage, सः that, माण्डकर्णि: Mandakarni, वायुभक्षः living on air, जलाश्रयः standing in water, दशवर्षसहस्राणि for ten thousand years, तीव्रम् intense, तपः penance, तेपे performed.

11_12.shloka: ततः प्रव्यथितास्सर्वे देवास्साग्निपुरोगमाः।।3.11.13।।अब्रुवन् वचनं सर्वे परस्परसमागताः।
11_12.translation: Thereafter very much perturbed, all the gods led by Agni gathered together at one place and started deliberating among themselves.
11_12.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, साग्निपुरोगमाः with fire god in the forefront, सर्वे all, देवाः deities, प्रव्यथिताःvery much perplexed, सर्वे all, परस्परसमागताः getting together at one place, वचनम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke to one another

11_13.shloka: अस्माकं कस्यचित् स्थानमेष प्रार्थयते मुनिः।।3.11.14।।इति संविग्नमनसस्सर्वे ते त्रिदिवौकसः।
11_13.translation: 'The gods of heaven became agitated in their minds thinking the sage might usurp one of their places.
11_13.word_by_word: एषः this, मुनिः sage, अस्माकम् our, कस्यचित् of some one, स्थानम् place, प्रार्थयते he is praying for, इति like this, सर्वे all, ते of them, त्रिदिवौकसः gods whose abode is heaven, संविग्नमनसः  with agitated  minds.

11_14.translation: All the gods then engaged five of the important nymphs, glittering like lightning, to disturb the penance of the sage.
11_14.word_by_word: सर्वैः by all, देवैः by gods, तत्र there, तपोविघ्नम् to disturb the penance, कर्तुम् to do, विद्युच्चलितवर्चसः glittering like lightning, पञ्च five, प्रधानाप्सरसः important nymphs नियोजिताः  engaged,

11_15.translation: The sage, a knower of the inner self and the world of plurality, was gripped by passion for the apsaras, who had come to achieve the target of the gods.
11_15.word_by_word: ततः then, दृष्टपरावरः knower of the inner self and the world of plurality, मुनिः sage, ताभिः all of them, अप्सरोभिः by the apsaras, सुराणाम् of gods, कार्यसिद्धये for the achievement of their target, मदनवश्यत्वम् into the grip of Cupid, नीतः was taken.

11_16.shloka: ताश्चैवाप्सरसः पञ्च मुनेः पत्नीत्वमागताः।।3.11.17।।तटाके निर्मितं तासामस्मिन्नन्तर्हितं गृहम्।
11_16.translation: The five apsaras, got the status of wives to the sage who built them an invisible home inside the lake.
11_16.word_by_word: ता: those, पञ्च five, अप्सरसः apsaras, मुनेः sage's, पत्नीत्वम् wifehood, आगताः became, तासाम् for them, गृहम् a home, अस्मिन् in that, तटाके lake, अन्तर्हितम् in invisible manner, निर्मितम् built.

11_17.shloka: तथैवाप्सरसः पञ्च निवसन्त्यो यथासुखम्।।3.11.18।।रमयन्ति तपोयोगान्मुनिं यौवनमास्थितम्।
11_17.translation: The apsaras lived happily with the sage who remained youthful by virtue of his penance.
11_17.word_by_word: तथैव like that, अप्सरसः the apsaras, यथासुखम् happily निवसन्त्य: while living there, तपोयोगात् by the power of penance, यौवनम् youth, आस्थितम् attaining, मुनिम् sage, रमयन्ति are entertaining.

11_18.shloka: तासां सङ्क्रीडमानानामेष वादित्रनिस्स्वनः।।3.11.19।।श्रूयते भूषणोन्मिश्रो गीतशब्दो मनोहरः।
11_18.translation: While the apsaras played their musical instruments, their melodious songs mingledwith the sounds of ornaments are heard.
11_18.word_by_word: सङ्क्रीडमानानाम् while playing तासाम् for them, एषः this, वादित्रनिस्स्वनः the sound of musical instruments, भूषणोन्मिश्रः mingled with that of ornaments, मनोहरः pleasing to the ears, गीतशब्दः sound of songs, श्रूयते is heard.

11_19.shloka: आश्चर्यमिति तस्यैतद्वचनं भावितात्मनः।।3.11.20।।राघवः प्रतिजग्राह सह भ्रात्रा महायशाः।
11_19.translation: Glorious Rama and his brother heard the wonderful words of the selfrealised sage and exclaimed, 'How strange '
11_19.word_by_word: महायशाः glorious, राघवः Rama, सह भ्रात्रा with his brother, भावितात्मनः of selfrealised individuals तस्य his, एतत् this, वचनम् word, आश्चर्यमिति as wonderful, प्रतिजग्राह received.

11_20.translation: When the sage Dharmabrata was telling the story, Rama saw a hermitage strewn all over with kusa grass and bark garments, and endowed with pure brahminic grace.
11_20.word_by_word: एवम् thus, कथयमानस्य narrating, कुशचीरसमाक्षिप्तम् one with kusa grass and bark garments, ब्राह्म्या of brahmin, लक्ष्म्यया with grace, समावृतम् spread all over, आश्रममण्डलम् hermitage, ददर्श saw.

11_21.shloka: प्रविश्य सह वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च राघवः।।3.11.22।।उवास मुनिभिस्सर्वैः पूज्यमानो महायशाः।
11_21.translation: Illustrious Rama accompanied by Vaidehi and Lakshmana entered the hermitage and, honoured by all the sages, stayed there.
11_21.word_by_word: महायशाः renowned, राघवः Rama, वैदेह्या सह accompanied by Vaidehi, लक्ष्मणेन च and also with Lakshmana, प्रविश्य entered, सर्वैः by all, मुनिभिः by sages too, पूज्यमानः were honoured, उवास dwelt.

11_22.shloka: तदा तस्मिन्सकाकुत्थ्सः श्रीमत्याश्रममण्डले।।3.11.23।।उषित्वा तु सुखं तत्र पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः।जगाम चाश्रमांस्तेषां पर्यायेण तपस्विनाम्।।3.11.24।।येषामुषितवान् पूर्वं सकाशे स महास्त्रवित्।
11_22.translation: Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race, wielder of great weapons, stayed in that beautiful hermitage, accepting the hospitality of the sages extended with due honour, He visited in turn their penancegroves where he repeated his stay.
11_22.word_by_word: सः काकुत्थ्सः the scion of the Kakutstha race, तदा then, श्रीमति prosperous तस्मिन् in that, आश्रममण्डले in the hermitage complex, सुखम् comfortably, उषित्वा after living, तत्र there, पूज्यमानः being honoured by the sages, महास्त्रवित् wielder of great weapons, सः he, पूर्वम् earlier, येषाम् whose, सकाशे in the presence, उषितवान् he had resided, तेषाम् their, तपस्विनाम् sages', आश्रमान् hermitages, पर्यायेण in turn, जगाम went round.

11_23.shloka: क्वचित्परिदशान्मासानेकं संवत्सरं क्वचित्।।3.11.25।।क्वचिच्छ चतुरो मासान् पञ्च षट्चापरान्क्वचित्।अपरत्राधिकं मासादप्यर्धमधिकं क्वचित्।।3.11.26।।त्रीन्मासानष्टमासांश्च राघवो न्यवसत्सुखम्।
11_23.translation: Rama lived happily here for about ten months, there one year, here four or five or six months and there over one or half a month or three or eight months in another.
11_23.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, क्वचित् at one place, परिदशान् about ten, मासान् months, क्वचित् at another hermitage, एकम् one only, संवत्सरम् year, क्वचित् at one place, चतुरः four, मासान् months, क्वचित् at one hermitage, पञ्च five, षट् च six, अपरान् other months, अपरत्र and in another hermitage, मासादपि more than a month, अधिकम् more, क्वचित् at one place, अर्धम् half a month, अधिकम् more, त्रीन् three, मासान् months, अष्टमासान् for eight months, सुखम् comfortably, न्यवसत् dwelt.

11_24.shloka: तथा संवसतस्तस्य मुनीनामाश्रमेषु वै।।3.11.27।।रमतश्चानुकूल्येन ययुस्संवत्सरा दश।
11_24.translation: Thus enjoying their stay in the hermitages, Rama, Sita and Lakshmana spent ten favourable years.
11_24.word_by_word: तथा in that way, तस्य for him, आश्रमेषु in the hermitages, वसतः while he was living, रमतश्च and enjoying, दश ten, संवत्सराः years, आनुकूल्येन favourably, ययुः passed.

11_25.shloka: परिवृत्य च धर्मज्ञो राघवस्सह सीतया।।3.11.28।।सुतीक्ष्णस्याश्रमं श्रीमान्पुनरेवाजगाम ह।
11_25.translation: Rama went round who was full of grace and full of knowledge on dharma went round with Sita and came back to Suthikshna's hermitage.
11_25.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, श्रीमान् graceful, राघवः Rama, सीतया सह with Sita, परिवृत्य after going round, पुनरेव once again, सुतीक्ष्णस्य Sutikshna's, आश्रमम् hermitage, आजगाम ह returned.

11_26.shloka: स तमाश्रममासाद्य मुनिभिः प्रतिपूजितः।।3.11.29।।तत्रापि न्यवसद्रामः कञ्चित्कालमरिन्दमः।
11_26.translation: On his arrival, Rama, the subduer of enemies, was honoured by the sages at the hermitage where he stayed for a short time.
11_26.word_by_word: अरिन्दमः subduer of enemies, सः रामः that Rama, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitage, आसाद्य on reaching, मुनिभिः by sages, प्रतिपूजितः being honoured, तत्रापि there again, कञ्चित्कालम् for some time, न्यवसत् he resided.

11_27.translation: Once while sitting beside sage Sutikshna at the hermitage Rama humbly addressed him:
11_27.word_by_word: तत् that, आश्रमस्थः staying in the hermitage, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, कदाचित् at one time, महामुनिम् to the great sage, सुतीक्ष्णम् Sutikshna, उपासीनः seated near, विनयात् out of humility, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

11_28.shloka: अस्मिन्नरण्ये भगवानगस्त्यो मुनिसत्तमः।।3.11.31।।वसतीति मया नित्यं कथाः कथयतां श्रुतम्।
11_28.translation: I have heard others saying that lord Agastya, the great sage, lives in this forest.
11_28.word_by_word: भगवान् Lord, मुनिसत्तमः best among the sages, अगस्त्यः Agastha, अस्मिन् in this, अरण्ये  in the forest, वसतीति is living, नित्यम् always, कथाः incidents, कथयताम् about that, श्रुतम् is heard.

11_29.shloka: न तु जानामि तं देशं वनस्यास्य महत्तया।।3.11.32।।कुत्राश्रमपदं रम्यं महर्षेस्तस्य धीमतः।
11_29.translation: I am unable to locate the sacred hermitage of that sagacious sage due to the vastness of this forest.
11_29.word_by_word: तु you, अस्य this, वनस्य forest, महत्तया due to its vastness, तं देशम् that place, न जानामि I do not know, धीमतः of the wise, तस्य महर्षेः of that sage, पुण्यम् sacred, अश्रमपदम् location of hermitage, कुत्र where.

11_30.translation: By your grace, I wish to go there with Sita and my brother Lakshmana to offer our respectful salutations.
11_30.word_by_word: भवतः your, प्रसादात् by grace, सानुजः with my brother, सह सीतया and along with Sita, मुनिम् sage, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, अभिवादयितुम् to offer our respectful salutations, तत्र there,अभिगच्छेयम् I wish to go.

11_31.shloka: मनोरथो महानेष हृदि मे परिवर्तते।।3.11.34।।यद्यहं तं मुनिवरं शुश्रूषेयमपि स्वयम्।
11_31.translation: There is a great desire  in my heart to serve in person the best of sages, Agastya.
11_31.word_by_word: तम् to that, मुनिवरम् best of sages, स्वयम् myself, अहम् I, शुश्रूषेयमपि I may serve, यदि that, एषः this, महान् great, मनोरथः desire, मे my, हृदि in the heart, परिवर्तते is being entertained.

11_32.shloka: इति रामस्य स मुनिश्श्रुत्वा धर्मात्मनो वचः।।3.11.35।।सुतीक्ष्णः प्रत्युवाचेदं प्रीतो दशरथात्मजम्।
11_32.translation: Hearing the words of Rama, the righteous son of Dasaratha, sage Sutikshna was pleased to reply:
11_32.word_by_word: सः that, मुनिः sage, सुतीक्ष्णः Sutikshna, धर्मात्मनः of the righteous one, रामस्य of Rama, इति thus, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रीतः pleased, दशरथात्मजम् to the son of Dasaratha, प्रत्युवाच replied.

11_33.translation: I also wished you, O Raghava, to visit Agastya along with Sita and Lakshmana.
11_33.word_by_word: राघव  O Rama, अहमपि I also, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, त्वाम् you, सीतया सह with Sita, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya, अभिगच्छ you may approach, इति thus, एतदेव that only, वक्तुकामः wished to tell.

11_34.shloka: दिष्ट्या त्विदानीमर्थेऽस्मिन् स्वयमेव ब्रवीषि माम्।।3.11.37।।अहमाख्यामि ते वत्स यत्रागस्त्यो महामुनिः।
11_34.translation: Luckily you have asked me on your own. I will tell you where the great sage Agastya lives.
11_34.word_by_word: दिष्ट्या luckily, इदानीम् presently, अस्मिन् in this, अर्थे connection, स्वयमेव yourself personally, माम् to me, ब्रवीषि you are speaking, वत्स dear son, महामुनिः the great sage, अगस्त्य: Agastya, यत्र where, अहम् I, ते to you, आख्यामि I will tell you.

11_35.shloka: योजनान्याश्रमात्तात याहि चत्वारि वै ततः।।3.11.38।।दक्षिणेन महान् श्रीमानगस्त्यभ्रातुराश्रमः।
11_35.translation: Dear Rama, walk from here a distance of four yojanas. There in the southerly direction  stands the great, beautiful hermitage of Agastya's brother.
11_35.word_by_word: तात dear child, आश्रमात् from this hermitage, चत्वारि योजनानि four yojanas, (8 x 4  32 miles) याहि you may go, ततः thereafter, दक्षिणेन in southern direction, अगस्त्यभ्रातुः Agastya of the brother of, महान् great, श्रीमान् beautiful, आश्रमः hermitage.

11_36.translation: This plain land in the beautiful forest tract is adorned with fig trees,filled with  flowers, fruits, and delightful sounds of different birds.
11_36.word_by_word: पिप्पलीवनशोभिते adorned with a fig forest, बहुपुष्पफले with many flowers and fruits, रम्ये in a beautiful, नानाशकुनिनादिते filled with delightful sounds of different birds, स्थलप्राये in mostly  plain land, वनोद्देशे in the forest region.

11_37.shloka: पद्मिन्यो विविधास्तत्र प्रसन्नसलिलाश्शिवाः।।3.11.40।।हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाश्चक्रवाकोपशोभिताः।तत्रैकां रजनीं व्युष्य प्रभाते राम गम्यताम्।।3.11.41।।
11_37.translation: O Rama, there are lotusponds filled with clear, sacred waters, with different kinds of swans, ducks and ruddy geese. Spend one night there and proceed early in the morning.
11_37.word_by_word: तत्र there, प्रसन्नसलिलाः clear water, शिवाः sacred, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णाः filled with swans and ducks, चक्रवाकोपशोभिताः beautiful with ruddy geese, विविधाः many, पद्मिन्यः lakes full of lotuses, राम O Rama, तत्र there, एकाम् one, रजनीम् night, व्युष्य after spending, प्रभाते early in the morning, गम्यताम् you can go.

11_38.shloka: दक्षिणां दिशमास्थाय वनषण्डस्य पार्श्वतः।तत्रागस्त्याश्रमपदं गत्वा योजनमन्तरा।।3.11.42।।
11_38.translation: If you go in the southern direction for a yojana you will find Agasthya's hermitage by the side of a cluster of trees.
11_38.word_by_word: वनषण्डस्य of the cluster of trees, पार्श्वतः nearby, दक्षिणाम् in southerly, दिशम् direction, आस्थाय after setting out, योजनम् for a yojana, अन्तरा at a distance, गत्वा after going, तत्र there, अगस्त्याश्रमपदम् Agastya's hermitage.

11_39.shloka: रमणीये वनोद्धेशे बहुपादपसंवृते।रंस्यते तत्र वैदेही लक्ष्मणश्च सह त्वया।।3.11.43।।स हि रम्यो वनोद्देशो बहुपादपसङ्कुलः।
11_39.translation: Vaidehi will feel happy in your company in that delightful forest region full of many trees.So too will Lakshmana.
11_39.word_by_word: रमणीये enchanting, बहुपादपसङ्कुले full of many trees, तत्र there, वनोद्देशे in the forest tract, वैदेही Sita, लक्ष्मणश्च and Lakshmana too, त्वया सह along with you, रंस्यते will enjoy, बहुपादपसङ्कुलः filled with many trees, सः that, वनोद्देशः forest region, रम्यः delightful, हि will be.

11_40.shloka: यदि बुद्धिः कृता द्रष्टुमगस्त्यं तं महामुनिम्।।3.11.44।।अद्यैव गमने बुद्धिं रोचयस्व महायशः।
11_40.translation: O glorious one, if you have made up your mind to visit that great sage Agastya, think of starting today itself.
11_40.word_by_word: महायशः O glorious one, महामुनिम् to the great sage, तम् him, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya, द्रष्टुम् to see, बुद्धि: mind, कृता यदि if arises, अद्यैव today itself, गमने in going, बुद्धिम् thought, रोचयस्व  may entertain.

11_41.shloka: इति रामो मुनेश्श्रुत्वा सह भ्रात्राभिवाद्य च।।3.11.45।।प्रतस्थेऽमुद्दिश्य सानुजस्सीतया सह।
11_41.translation: Rama heard the words of the sage, offered him reverential salutations and set out along with his brother and Sita.
11_41.word_by_word: रामः Rama, मुनेः sage's, इति this, श्रुत्वा having heard, भ्रात्रा सह  with brother, अभिवाद्य च reverentially saluted, सानुजः with his brother, सीतया सह with Sita, अगस्त्यम् Agastya, उद्दिश्य intending to move in that direction, प्रतस्थे moved out.

11_42.shloka: पश्यन्वनानि रम्याणि पर्वतांश्चाभ्रसन्निभान्।।3.11.46।।सरांसि सरितश्चैव पथि मार्गवशानुगाः।सुतीक्ष्णेनोपदिष्टेन गत्वा तेन पथा सुखम्।।3.11.47।।इदं परमसंहृष्टो वाक्यं लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।
11_42.translation: Enjoying the sight of delightful forests, cloudlike mountains, lakes and rivers on the  way, and following the directions given by  Sutikshna, Rama was happy. He said  to Lakshmana:
11_42.word_by_word: रम्याणि delightful, वनानि forests, अभ्रसन्निभान् looking like clouds, पर्वतांश्च mountains also, सरांसि lakes, पथि on his way, मार्गवशानुगाः moved in that direction, सरितश्च rivers also,पश्यन् while seeing, सुतीक्ष्णेन by Sutikshna, उपदिष्टेन as indicated, तेन पथा by that path, सुखम् happily, गत्वा after going, परमसंहृष्टः a very happy man, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said.

11_43.shloka: एतदेवाश्रमपदं नूनं तस्य महात्मनः।।3.11.48।।अगस्त्यस्य मुनेर्भ्रातुर्दृश्यते पुण्यकर्मणः।
11_43.translation: Surely this is the hermitage of great Agastya's brother, a man of holy deeds.
11_43.word_by_word: एतदेव this alone is, महात्मनः of the great one, पुण्यकर्मणः of holy deeds, अगस्त्यस्य मुनेः Sage Agastya's, भ्रातुः brother's, तस्य his, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, दृश्यते is seen, नूनम् surely.

11_44.shloka: यथा हि मे वनस्यास्य ज्ञाताः पथि सहस्रशः।।3.11.49।।सन्नताः फलभारेण पुष्पभारेण च द्रुमाः।
11_44.translation: This is the glade we were told about with thousands of trees drooping down with abundant fruits and flowers.
11_44.word_by_word: पथि on the path, फलभारेण with abundance of fruits, पुष्पभारेण च heavy with flowers, संन्नताः drooping down, सहस्रशः in thousands, अस्य वनस्य of this forest, द्रुमाः trees, यथा हि like that, मे I, ज्ञाताः were informed.
