11_45.shloka: पिप्पलीनां च पक्वानां वनादस्मादुपागतः।।3.11.50।।गन्धोऽयं पवनोक्षिप्तस्सहसा कटुकोदयः।
11_45.translation: Feel this sudden astringent smell of ripe figs wafted by the breeze from the forest.
11_45.word_by_word: सहसा suddenly, पवनोक्षिप्तः wafted by the breeze, कटुकोदयः astringent aroma, पक्वानाम् of the  ripe fruits, पिप्पलीनाम् fig trees, अयं गन्धः this smell, अस्मात् from this, वनात् from the forest, उपागतः coming from.

11_46.shloka: तत्र तत्र च दृश्यन्ते सङ्क्षिप्ताः काष्ठसञ्चयाः।।3.11.51।।लूनाश्च पथि दृश्यन्ते दर्भा वैडूर्यवर्चसः।
11_46.translation: Heaps of firewood are seen here and there on the path. There are blades of grass (used for sacrificial ceremonies) shining like vaidurya (gems).
11_46.word_by_word: तत्र तत्र here and there, सङ्क्षिप्ताः collected, काष्ठसञ्चयाः heaps of firewood, दृश्यन्ते are seen, लूनाः cut, वैडूर्यवर्चसः shining like vaidurya (gems), दर्भाश्च blades of grass (used for sacrifices), पथि दृश्यन्ते are seen on the path.

11_47.translation: In the middle of the forest can be seen like the tip of the dark clouds columns of smoke coming out of the top of hermitages.
11_47.word_by_word: आश्रमस्थस्य on the hermitages, पावकस्य of the fire, कृष्णाभ्रशिखरोपमम् looking like the tip of the dark cloud, वनमध्यस्थम् appearing in the middle of the forest, एतत् this way, धूमाग्रम् smoke, सम्प्रदृश्यते are seen.

11_48.shloka: विविक्तेषु च तीर्थेषु कृतस्नाना द्विजातयः।।3.11.53।।पुष्पोपहारं कुर्वन्ति कुसुमैस्स्वयमर्जितै।
11_48.translation: Priests are coming out of the solitary sacred spots after their bath and making offerings of flowers they had themselves plucked.
11_48.word_by_word: विविक्तेषु in solitary places, तीर्थेषु in sacred spots, कृतस्नानाः after taking their bath, द्विजातयः brahmins, स्वयम् by themselves, अर्जितैः collected ones, कुसुमैः flowers, पुष्पोपहारम् offering of flowers, कुर्वन्ति doing.

11_49.shloka: तत्सुतीक्ष्णस्य वचनं यथा सौम्य मया श्रुतम्।।3.11.54।।अगस्त्यस्याश्रमो भ्रातुर्नूनमेष भविष्यति।
11_49.translation: O handsome one, surely this is the hermitage of Agastya's brother about which I heard from Sutikshna.
11_49.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, तत् then, सुतीक्ष्णस्य Sutikshna's, वचनम् word, मया by me, यथा as, श्रुतम् was heard, एषः this, नूनम् surely, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, भ्रातुः brother's, आश्रमः hermitage, भविष्यति it will be.

11_50.shloka: निगृह्य तपसा मृत्युं लोकानां हितकाम्यया।।3.11.55।।यस्य भ्रात्रा कृतेयं दिक्छरण्या पुण्यकर्मणा।
11_50.word_by_word: यस्य whose, भ्रात्रा by the brother, पुण्यकर्मणा of holy deeds, लोकानाम् for the people, हितकाम्यया desirous of their welfare, तपसा with penance, मृत्युम् death, निगृह्य after controlling, इयम् this, दिक् direction, शरण्या worthy of refuge, कृता is rendered.

11_51.shloka: धारयन् ब्राह्मणं रूपमिल्वलस्संस्कृतं वदन्।।3.11.56।।आमन्त्रयति विप्रान्स्मश्राद्धमुद्दिश्य निर्घृणः।
11_51.translation: Assuming the form of a brahmin and using Sanskrit language, Ilvala would invite brahmins for offering shraddha to the dead
11_51.word_by_word: इल्वलः Ilvala, ब्राह्मणम् a brahmin's, रूपम् form, धारायन् taking, संस्कृतम् Sanskrit, वदन् while speaking, निर्घृणः a cruel one, श्राद्धमुद्दिश्य for offering oblations to the dead on the day of anniversary, विप्रान् brahmins, आमन्त्रयति स्म invited.

11_52.shloka: भ्रातरं संस्कृतं कृत्वा ततस्तं मेषरूपिणम्।।3.11.57।।तान् द्विजान्भोजयामास श्राद्धदृष्टेन कर्मणा।
11_52.translation: Ilvala would keep his brother sanctified, so that he is fit for offering, Then he would feed the brahmins with mutton according to the rituals.
11_52.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, मेषरूपिणम् assuming the form of a sheep, तं भ्रातरम् his brother, संस्कृतम्   sanctified कृत्वा making, ततः then, श्राद्धदृष्टेन suitable for offering oblations to the dead, कर्मणा did, तान् द्विजान् those brahmins, भोजयामास offered them food.

11_53.shloka: ततो भुक्तवतां तेषां विप्राणामिल्वलोऽब्रवीत्।।3.11.59।।वातापे निष्क्रमन्वेति स्वरेण महता वदन्।
11_53.translation: Then when the brahmins finished eating, Ilvala would call aloud, 'O Vatapi come out'.
11_53.word_by_word: ततः then, तेषां विप्राणाम् when those brahmins, भुक्तवताम् finished eating, इल्वलः Ilvala, महता with a loud, स्वरेण voice, वदन् while shouting, वातापे O Vatapi, निष्क्रमस्व come out, इति thus, अब्रवीत् he spoke.

11_54.shloka: ततो भ्रातुर्वचश्श्रुत्वा वातापिर्मेषवन्नदन्।।3.11.60।।भित्त्वा भित्त्वा शरीराणि ब्राह्मणानां विनिष्पतत्।
11_54.translation: Then hearing his brother's voice, Vatapi would bleat like a sheep and jump out, tearing open the bodies of those brahmins.
11_54.word_by_word: ततः then, वातापिः Vatapi, भ्रातुः brother's, वचः voice, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मेषवत् like a sheep, नदन् while bleating, ब्राह्मणानाम् of brahmins, शरीराणि from the bodies, भित्त्वा भित्त्वा tearing out one by one, विनिष्पतत् came out.

11_55.shloka: ब्राह्माणानां सहस्राणि तैरेवं कामरूपिभिः।।3.11.61।।विनाशितानि संहत्य नित्यशः पिशिताशनैः।
11_55.translation: In this manner, thousands of brahmins used to be killed daily by those carnivorous demons who assumed any form at their free will.
11_55.word_by_word: परन्तप O subduer of enemies, ताभ्याम् by both, संहत्य after killing, पिशिताशनैः by those carnivorous, ब्राह्मणानाम् brahmins, सहस्राणि in thousands, एवम् in that way, नित्यशः daily, विनाशितानि killed, तैः कामरूपिभिः by them assuming any form at will.

11_56.shloka: अगस्त्येन तदा देवैः प्रार्थितेन महर्षिणा।।3.11.62।।अनुभूय किल श्राद्धे भक्षितस्समहासुरः।
11_56.translation: Urged by the gods, Agastya  came  for the shradda . The mighty demon played the same routine trick and Vatapi, for sure, was eaten by the great sage.
11_56.word_by_word: तदा then, देवैः by the gods, प्रार्थितेन on being requested, महर्षिणा by the ascetic, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, श्राद्धे in the shraddha, अनुभूय  experienced, सः महासुरः that mighty demon, भक्षितः was eaten, किल certainly.

11_57.shloka: ततस्सम्पन्नमित्युक्त्वा दत्त्वा हस्तोदकं ततः।।3.11.63।।भ्रातरं निष्क्रमस्वेति चेल्वलस्सोऽभ्यभाषत।
11_57.translation: Saying, the ritual is complete Ilvala offered water in the palm of Agastya and called his brother to come out.
11_57.word_by_word: ततः then, सः इल्वलः that Ilvala, सम्पन्नम् the ritual is complete, इति like this, उक्त्वा  having said, दत्त्वा giving, निष्क्रमस्व you may come out, इति thus, भ्रातरम् brother, अभ्यभाषत said, ततः after offering, हस्तोदकं water in hand.

11_58.shloka: स तं तथा भाषमाणं भ्रातरं विप्रघातिनम्।।3.11.64।।अब्रवीत्प्रहसन्धीमानगस्त्यो मुनिसत्तमः।
11_58.translation: Wise Agastya,  the best among the ascetics, laughing aloud, said to Ilvala, the destroyer of brahmins:
11_58.word_by_word: धीमान् wise, मुनिसत्तमः best among the ascetics, अगस्त्यः Agastya, भ्रातरम् to brother, तथा स like that, भाषमाणम् while he spoke, विप्रघातिनम् destroyer of brahmins, तम् him, प्रहसन्  laughing aloud, अब्रवीत् said.

11_59.shloka: कुतो निष्क्रमितुं शक्तिर्मया जीर्णस्य रक्षसः।।3.11.65।।भ्रातुस्ते मेषरूपस्य गतस्य यमसादनम्।
11_59.translation: I have digested the demon Vatapi your brother, who assumed the form of a sheep. He has reached the abode of Yama, Lord of death. Where does he have the power to come out?
11_59.word_by_word: मया by me, जीर्णस्य digested, रक्षसः of the demon, मेषरूपस्य of the form of a sheep, यमसादनम् to the abode of Yama (lord of death), गतस्य one who has gone, ते भ्रातुः your brother, निष्क्रमितुम् to come out, शक्तिः power, कुतः where from.

11_60.translation: On hearing the news of the death of his brother, the demon Ilvala, out of anger, started attacking the sage.
11_60.word_by_word: अथ and then, भ्रातुः brothers, निधनसंश्रयम् pertaining to death, तस्य his, वचः words, श्रुत्वाhaving heard, निशाचरः demon, क्रोधात् angrily, प्रधर्षयितुम् to attack, आरेभे started.

11_61.shloka: सोऽभिद्रवन्मुनिश्रेष्ठं मुनिना दीप्ततेजसा।।3.11.67।।चक्षुषानलकल्पेन निर्दग्धो निधनं गतः।
11_61.translation: Ilvala who pounced upon Agastya, the best among the sages whose lustre lay consumed by the fire of his eyes which were in flames.
11_61.word_by_word: सः that (Ilvala), मुनिश्रेष्ठम् best among the sages, अभ्यद्रवत् pounced upon, दीप्ततेजसा by him whose lustre was kindled, मुनिना sage, अनलकल्पेन by firelike, चक्षुषा eyes, निर्दग्धः burnt, निधनं गतः died.

11_62.translation: This hermitage surrounded by beautiful lakes and forests belongs to his brother (Sudarsana). Out of sympathy for Agastya, he has accomplished this difficult task.
11_62.word_by_word: तटाकवनशोभितः adorned with lakes and forests, अयम् this, येन by whom, विप्रानुकम्पया congenial to brahmins, इदम् this, दुष्करम् difficult, कर्म action, कृतम् is done, तस्य his, भ्रातुः brothers, आश्रम: hermitage.

11_63.translation: While Rama was thus narrating to Lakshmana (the story of Agastya), the Sun set and evening closed in.
11_63.word_by_word: तस्य रामस्य of Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, कथयमानस्य     as he was narrating, सूर्यः Sun, अस्तं गतः had set, सन्ध्याकालः evening time, अभ्यवर्तत had set in.

11_64.shloka: उपास्य पश्चिमां सन्ध्यां सह भ्रात्रा यथाविधि।प्रविवेशाऽश्रमपदं तमृषिं सोऽभ्यवादयत्।।3.11.70।।
11_64.translation: Rama with his brother Lakshmana duly offered oblations at twilight, entered the hermitage and greeted the sage (Sudarsana) with folded palms.
11_64.word_by_word: सः that Rama, सह भ्रात्रा with his brother, यथाविधि as per rule, पश्चिमाम् western, सन्ध्याम् at twilight, उपास्य offered  oblations, आश्रमपदम् to the hermitage, विवेश entered, तम् that, ऋषिम् to the sage, अभ्यवादयत् greeted with folded palms.

11_65.shloka: सम्यक् प्रतिगृहीतश्च मुनिना तेन राघवः।न्यवसत्तां निशामेकां प्राश्य मूलफलानि च।।3.11.71।।
11_65.translation: Warmly received by the sage, Rama shared the roots and fruits and slept the night there.
11_65.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, तेन मुनिना by that sage, सम्यक् properly, प्रतिगृहीतः was received, मूलफलानि roots and fruits, प्राश्य after eating, ताम् that, एकाम् one, निशाम् night, न्यवसत् spent.

11_66.shloka: तस्यां रात्य्रां व्यतीतायां विमले सूर्यमण्डले।भ्रातरं तमगस्त्यस्य ह्यामन्त्रयत राघवः।।3.11.72।।
11_66.translation: When the night passed and the Sun became bright, Rama took leave of the brother of Agastya.
11_66.word_by_word: तस्यां रात्य्राम् when that night, व्यतीतायाम् was spent, सूर्यमण्डले when the Sun's orb, विमले was bright, राघवः Rama, अगस्त्यस्य Agasthya's, भ्रातरम् brother, तम् him, आमन्त्रयत bid him farewell.

11_67.shloka: अभिवादये त्वां भगवन् सुखमध्युषितो निशाम्।आमन्त्रये त्वां गच्छामि गुरुं ते द्रष्टुमग्रजम्।।3.11.73।।
11_67.translation: O Lord, the night has been wellspent. Now we humbly seek leave of you to see your respectable elder brother.
11_67.word_by_word: भगवन् O lord , निशाम् night, सुखम् comfortably, अध्युषितः wellspent, त्वाम् you, अभिवादये I bow down, त्वाम् you, आमन्त्रये I seek your permission to leave, ते that, गुरुम्  respectable one, अग्रजम् elder brother, द्रष्टुम् to see, गच्छामि I will go.

11_68.shloka: गम्यतामिति तेनोक्तो जगाम रघुनन्दनः।यथोद्दिष्टेन मार्गेण वनं तच्चावलोकयन्।।3.11.74।।
11_68.translation: With his permission, Rama, the delight of the Raghu race, proceeded along the path indicated, watching (the beauty of) the forest.
11_68.word_by_word: गम्यताम् you may go, इति like this तेन by him, उक्तः said, रघुनन्दनः Rama, the delight  of the Raghu dynasty, तत् that, वनम् forest, अवलोकयन् watching, यथोद्दिष्टेन in the indicated direction, मार्गेण path, जगाम went.

11_69.translation: They passed by wild rice fields, jackfruit trees, palmyra and various other trees like Ashoka, trees with white flowers, old trees that existed for a long time, mahva trees, bilva trees and tindukas.
11_69.word_by_word: नीवारान् unvcultivated ricefields, पनसान् jackfruit trees, तालान् palmyra trees, तिमिशान् timishas, वञ्जुलान् ashoka, धवान् trees with white flowers, चिरिबिल्वान् trees existing for a long time, मधूकांश्च mahva trees, बिल्वानपि च and bilva trees, तिन्दुकान् tindukas.

11_70.translation: Rama saw hundreds of trees crushed by the trunks of elephants and by monkeys. He saw some trees echoing with notes of hundreds of intoxicated birds. He saw tree tops coiled with creepers in full bloom.
11_70.word_by_word: रामः Rama, हस्तिहस्तैः trunks of elephants, विमृदितान् crushed, वानरैः by monkeys, उपशोभितान् splendidlooking, मत्तै intoxicated, शतशः in hundreds, शकुनि सङ्गैश्च by flocks of birds, प्रणादितान् echoed, पुष्पितान् पुष्पिताग्राभिः flowers in bloom on top of trees, लताभिः by creepers, अनुवेष्टितान् surrounded by, शतशः hundreds, कान्तारपादपान् trees of the forest, ददर्श saw.

11_71.shloka: ततोऽब्रवीत्समीपस्थं रामो राजीवलोचनः।पृष्ठतोऽनुगतं वीरं लक्ष्मणं लक्ष्मिवर्धनम्।।3.11.78।।
11_71.translation: Then the lotuseyed Rama said to the chivalrous, graceful Lakshmana who stood behind him:
11_71.word_by_word: ततः then, राजीवलोचनः lotuseyed, रामः Rama, पृष्ठतः behind, अनुगतम् following, वीरम् chivalrous one, लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् one who enhances grace by his company, समीपस्थम् who stood nearby, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

11_72.shloka: स्निग्धपत्रा यथा वृक्षा यथा क्षान्ता मृगद्विजाः।आश्रमो नातिदूरस्थो महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः।।3.11.79।।
11_72.translation: The leaves of the trees here are glossy, the animals and birds are peaceful. It appears the hermitage of the selfrealized great sage Agastya is not very far from here.
11_72.word_by_word: वृक्ष्याः trees, यथा here, स्निग्धपत्राः having glossy leaves, मृगद्विजाः animals and birds, यथा as, क्षान्ताः peaceful, भावितात्मनः of the selfrealised one.  महर्षेः of the great sage, आश्रमः hermitage, नातिदूरस्थः not very far.

11_73.shloka: अगस्त्य इति विख्यातो लोके स्वेनैव कर्मणा।आश्रमो दृश्यते तस्य परिश्रान्तश्रमापहः।।3.11.80।।
11_73.translation: Here is the hermitage of Agastya, wellknown in the world for his deeds a place of rest for those tired with hard work.
11_73.word_by_word: स्वेन by his, कर्मणा by deeds, लोके among people, अगस्त्यः as Agastya, इति  thus, विख्यातः wellknown, तस्य his, परिश्रान्तश्रमापहः place of rest for those who are tired with hard work, आश्रमः hermitage, दृश्यते is seen.

11_74.translation: This forest is enveloped with the smoke rising from the sacrificial altar. There are rows of bark robes hanging. Herds of quiet animals lying and different kind of birds chirping around.
11_74.word_by_word: प्राज्यधूमाकुलवनः forest enveloped with smoke rising from the sacrificial altar, चीरमालापरिष्कृत: lined with rows of bark robes, प्रशान्तमृगयूथश्च with herds of quiet animals, नानाशकुनिनादितः resounding with notes of different kinds of birds.

11_75.shloka: तस्येदमाश्रमपदं प्रभावाद्यस्य राक्षसैः।दिगियं दक्षिणा त्रासाद्दृश्यते नोपभुज्यते।।3.11.82।।
11_75.translation: This is his hermitage. On account of his (Agastya's) impact the demons look south but cannot eat the hermits out of fear (for the sage).
11_75.word_by_word: यस्य by whose, प्रभावात् by his power, राक्षसैः by the demons, इयम् this, दक्षिणा दिक् southern side, त्रासात् out of fear, दृश्यते is seen, नोपभुज्यते cannot be enjoyed, तस्य that Agastya's, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, इदम् this is.

11_76.shloka: यदा प्रभृति चाक्रान्ता दिगियं पुण्यकर्मणा।तदा प्रभृति निर्वैराः प्रशान्ता रजनीचराः।।3.11.83।।
11_76.translation: Since the time Agastya of sacred deeds occupied this direction the demons are quiet, leaving all enmity.
11_76.word_by_word: यदा प्रभृति since, पुण्यकर्मणा by a man of sacred deeds, इयं दिक् this direction, आक्रान्ता occupied, तदाप्रभृति from then on, रजनीचराः those who move about at night, the demons, निर्वैराः leaving enmity, प्रशान्ताः are quiet.

11_77.shloka: नाम्ना चेयं भगवतो दक्षिणा दिक्प्रदक्षिणा।प्रथिता त्रिषु लोकेषु दुर्धर्षा क्रूरकर्मभिः।।3.11.84।।
11_77.translation: The southern side favourable to the people was famous by the name Agastya in the three worlds and stood unassailable to the demons.
11_77.word_by_word: प्रदक्षिणा very considerate place, इयम् दक्षिणा दिक् on the southern side, भगवतः of the Lord (Agastya's), नाम्ना by name, त्रिषु in three, लोकेषु worlds, प्रथिता famous, क्रूरकर्मभिः by men of wicked deeds, दुर्धर्षा unassailable.

11_78.shloka: मार्गं निरोद्धुं निरतो भास्करस्याचलोत्तमः।निदेशं पालयन्यस्य विन्ध्यशैला न वर्धते।।3.11.85।।अयं दीर्घायुषस्तस्य लोके विश्रुतकर्मणः।अगस्त्यस्याश्रम श्रीमान्विनीतजनसेवितः।।3.11.86।।
11_78.translation: This is the hermitage of the longlived Agastya who is renowned for his deeds and is served by humble people. The great mountain Vindhya that was growing incessantly and obstructing the path of the Sun stopped growing any more in obedience to Agastya's words.
11_78.word_by_word: श्रीमान् beautiful, विनीतजनसेवितः served by humble people, अयम् this, भास्करस्य Sun's, मार्गम् path, निरोद्धम् to obstruct, निरतः was ever bent upon, अचलोत्तमः that great mountain, विन्ध्यVindhya, यस्य whose, निदेशम् order, पालयन् obeying, न वर्धते does not grow, तस्य for him, लोके in this world, विश्रुतकर्मणः of a man of renowned deeds, दीर्घायुषः of long life, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, आश्रमः hermitage.

11_79.translation: We are going to join this sage honoured by the people of the world and ever engaged in the welfare of the virtuous. This augurs well for us.
11_79.word_by_word: लोकार्चितः worshipped by the people, साधुः a pious man, एषः he, सताम् हिते in the wellbeing of the virtuous, नित्यरतः ever engaged, एषः such, अभिगतान् those who have come, अस्मान् to us, श्रेयसा with welfare, योजयिष्यति will unite.

11_80.shloka: आराधयिष्याम्यत्राहमगस्त्यं तं महामुनिम्।शेषं च वनवासस्य सौम्य वत्स्याम्यहं प्रभो।।3.11.88।।
11_80.translation: O noble, handsome Lakshmana, I will spend the rest of the exile in this forest in the worship of the great sage Agastya.
11_80.word_by_word: प्रभो O noble one, अहम् I, अत्र here, तम् him, महामुनिम् to the great ascetic, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya, आराधयिष्यामि I will worship, वनवासस्य while living in the forest, शेषम् rest of the period, सौम्य  O handsome, अहम् वत्स्यामि I will spend.

11_81.shloka: अत्र देवास्सगन्धर्वास्सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।अगस्त्यं नियताहारं सततं पर्युपासते।।3.11.89।।
11_81.translation: The gods along with gandharvas, siddhas and great sages always serve Agastya, observing discipine in their food habits.
11_81.word_by_word: सगन्धर्वाः with gandharvas, देवाः the gods, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, अत्र here, नियताहारम् controlled diet, अगस्त्यम् to Agastya's, सततम् always, पर्युपासते keep serving.

11_82.shloka: नात्र जीवेन्मृषावादी क्रूरो वा यदि वा शठः।नृशंसः कामवृत्तो वा मुनिरेष तथाविधः।।3.11.90।।
11_82.translation: This sage is such type that he (his spiritual power) will not allow a liar or a cruel man or a deceitful or lustful  or wicked person to thrive here.
11_82.word_by_word: मृषावादी a liar, क्रूरो वा or a cruel one, यदि वा or perhaps, शठः a deceitful person, नृशंसः a wicked person, कामवृत्तो वा or a lustful person, अत्र here, न जीवेत् will not live, एषः मुनिः this  sage, तथाविधः of such type.

11_83.shloka: अत्र देवाश्च यक्षाश्च नागाश्च पतगैस्सह।वसन्ति नियताहारा धर्ममाराधयिष्णवः।।3.11.91।।
11_83.translation: Here gods, yakshas, nagas and birds live, following the righteous path and observing discipline in food habits.
11_83.word_by_word: देवाश्च gods also, यक्षाश्च yakshas too, पतगैस्सह along with birds, नागाश्च nagas too, नियताहाराः of controlled diet, धर्मम् righteous path, आराधयिष्णवः those who practise, अत्र here, वसन्ति live.

11_84.shloka: अत्र सिद्धा महात्मानो विमानैजस्सूर्यसन्निभैः।त्यक्तदेहा नवैर्देहैः स्वर्याताः परमर्षयः।।3.11.92।।
11_84.translation: Here great souls like sages and siddhas gave up the ghost and with renewed bodies left for heaven on aerochariot resembling the Sun (in brightness).
11_84.word_by_word: अत्र here, महात्मानः great souls, परमर्षयः great sages, अत्र here, सिद्धाः siddhas, त्यक्तदेहाः giving up their bodies, नवैः with new, देहैः bodies, सूर्यसन्निभैः shining like the Sungod, विमानैः aerochariot, स्वर्याताः went to heaven.

11_85.shloka: यक्षत्वममरत्वं च राज्यानि विविधानि च।अत्र देवाः प्रयच्छन्ति भूतैराराधिताश्शुभैः।।3.11.93।।
11_85.translation: Worshipped by benevolent beings, the gods here bestow on them the status of demigods or of the immortals or several kinds of kingdoms.
11_85.word_by_word: शुभैः by benevolent ones, भूतैः by beings, अत्र here, आराधिताः those who are worshipped, देवाः gods, यक्षत्वम् status of demigods, अमरत्वं च status of gods, विविधानि several kinds of, राज्यानि च kingdoms also, प्रयच्छन्ति will endow.

12_1.shloka: [ Agastya extends hospitality to Rama, Lakshmana and Sita -- Rama receives the divine bow, many other weapons and missiles from  Agastya.]सप्रविश्याऽश्रमपदं लक्ष्मणो राघवानुजः।अगस्त्यशिष्यमासाद्य वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह।।3.12.1।।
12_1.translation: Lakshmana, the younger brother of Rama,  entered the hermitage of Agastya and met one of his disciples and said to him these words :
12_1.word_by_word: राघवानुजः brother of Rama, सः लक्ष्मणः  Lakshmana, आश्रमपदम् at the hermitage, प्रविश्य  entered, अगस्त्यशिष्यम् disciple of Agastya, आसाद्य  met, एतत् all this, वाक्यम् words, उवाच ह said.

12_2.shloka: राजा दशरथो नाम ज्येष्ठस्तस्य सुतो बली।रामः प्राप्तो मुनिं द्रष्टुं भार्यया सह सीतया।।3.12.2।।
12_2.translation: The valiant eldest son of  king Dasaratha has come along with his wife Sita to see the sage.
12_2.word_by_word: दशरथो नाम called Dasaratha, राजा king, तस्य his, ज्येष्ठः सुतः eldest son, बली strong, रामः Rama, भार्यया with wife, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, मुनिम् to the sage, द्रष्टुम् to see, पाप्तः has come.

12_3.shloka: लक्ष्मणो नाम तस्याहं भ्राता त्ववरजो हितः।अनुकूलश्च भक्तश्च यदि ते श्रोत्रमागतः।।3.12.3।।
12_3.translation: I am his younger brother Lakshmana, his wellwisher and faithful devotee if you have at all heard about me.
12_3.word_by_word: अहं तु I am, तस्य his, अवरजः younger to him, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, भ्राता brother, हितः wellwisher, अनुकूलश्च faithful, भक्तश्च devotee, ते श्रोत्रम् आगतः has been heard by you, यदि if at all.

12_4.shloka: ते वयं वनमत्युग्रं प्रविष्टाः पितृशासनात्।द्रष्टुमिच्छामहे सर्वे भगवन्तं निवेद्यताम्।।3.12.4।।
12_4.translation: By the command of our father, we have entered this dense forest and desire to see the   divine sire. Please report.
12_4.word_by_word: ते वयम् we, पितृशासनात् by the command of our father, अत्युग्रम् very dense, वनम् forest, प्रविष्टाः have entered, सर्वे all of us, भगवन्तम् divine sire, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामहे desire, निवेद्यताम् it may be reported to him.

12_5.shloka: तस्य तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणस्य तपोधनः।तथेत्युक्त्वाऽग्निशरणं प्रविवेश निवेदितुम्।।3.12.5।।
12_5.translation: The ascetic heard Lakshmana, and saying, 'let it be so', entered the firesanctuary to report.
12_5.word_by_word: तपोधनः the ascetic (endowed with wealth of penance), तस्य लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, तत् वचनम् his words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तथेति let it be so, उक्त्वा said, निवेदितुम् to report, अग्निशरणम् firesanctuary प्रविवेश entered.

12_6.shloka: स प्रविश्य मुनिश्रेष्ठं तपसा दुष्प्रधर्षणम्।कृताञ्जलिरुवाचेदं रामागमनमञ्जसा।।3.12.6।।यथोक्तं लक्ष्मणेनैव शिष्योऽगस्त्यस्य सम्मतः।
12_6.translation: Having promptly entered, Agastya's favourite disciple with folded hands reported as he was told by Lakshmana about Rama's arrival to the great sage who was armed with the inviolable powers of penance :
12_6.word_by_word: अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, सम्मतः favourite, शिष्यः disciple, सः that, अञ्जसा promptly, प्रविश्य  entered, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, यथोक्तमेव as told by him, तपसा with penance, दुष्प्रधर्षणम्  who can not be violated , मुनिश्रेष्ठम् the best among theascetics, रामागमनम् about Rama 's arrival, इदम् thus, उवाच said.

12_7.shloka: पुत्रौ दशरथस्येमौ रामो लक्ष्मण एव च।।3.12.7।।प्रविष्टावाश्रमपदं सीतया सह भार्यया।
12_7.translation: Rama and Lakshmana, the two sons of Dasaratha along with Sita, wife of Rama, have arrived at the hermitage.
12_7.word_by_word: रामः Rama, लक्ष्मण एव च Lakshmana also, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, इमौ both, पुत्रौ sons, भार्यया with wife, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, आश्रमपदम् to the hermitage, प्रविष्टौ entered.

12_8.translation: Both the subduers of enemies  have come here now to see and serve your Holiness. You may order what is to be done next.
12_8.word_by_word: अरिन्दमौ subduers of enemies (Rama and Lakshmana), भवन्तम् to your Holiness, द्रष्टुम् to see, शुश्रूषार्थम् to serve, अयातौ both have come, अत्र here, यत् whatever, अनन्तरम् nexl, तत् that, त्वम् you, आज्ञापयितुम् to order, अर्हसि you may be pleased to.

12_9.shloka: ततश्शिष्यादुपश्रुत्य प्राप्तं रामं सलक्ष्मणम्।।3.12.9।।वैदेहीं च महाभागामिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
12_9.translation: Having heard from the disciple about the arrival of Rama, Lakshmana and great daughter of the king of Videha the sage said :
12_9.word_by_word: ततः then, शिष्यात् from the disciple, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, प्राप्तम् arrived, उपश्रुत्य having heard, महाभागाम् great, वैदेहीं Sita, daughter of the king of Videha, च and, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

12_10.shloka: दिष्ट्या रामश्चिरस्याद्य द्रष्टुं मां समुपागतः।।3.12.10।।मनसा काङ्क्षितं ह्यस्य मयाप्यागमनं प्रति।
12_10.translation: It is good fortune that Rama has come here after a long time to see me. I was longing for his arrival.
12_10.word_by_word: दिष्ट्या fortunately, रामः Rama, चिरस्य after a long time, माम् me, द्रष्टुम् to see, अद्य today, समुपागतः arrived here luckily, अस्य his, आगमनं प्रति coming here, मया by me, मनसा at heart, काङ्क्षितं हि was desired indeed.

12_11.shloka: गम्यतां सत्कृतो रामस्सभार्यस्सहलक्ष्मणः।।3.12.11।।प्रवेश्यतां समीपं मे किं चासौ न प्रवेशितः।
12_11.translation: Go quickly and with due hospitality conduct Rama, his wife Sita and brother Lakshmana into my presence. Why was he not ushered in so long?
12_11.word_by_word: गम्यताम् go (quickly), सभार्यः along with his wife, सहलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, सत्कृतः rendering due hospitality, मे my, समीपम् presence, प्रवेश्यताम् may be ushered in, असौ he, किम् why, न प्रवेशितः  not brought in so far ?

12_12.translation: 'So be it ' said the disciple respectfully with folded palms in response to what thegreat sage, knower of dharma, commanded.
12_12.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञेन by the knower of rightousness, महात्मना  by the great soul, मुनिना by the sage, एवम् thus, उक्तः  asked, शिष्यः disciple, नियताञ्जलिः with folded palms, अभिवाद्य  respectfully, तथेति ,so be it, अब्रवीत् said.

12_13.shloka: ततो निष्क्रम्य सम्भ्रान्तश्शिष्यो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.12.13।।क्वासौ रामो मुनिं द्रष्टुमेतु प्रविशतु स्वयम्।
12_13.translation: Then the disciple in a state of excitement came out of the hermitage and said to Lakshmana, 'Where is Rama? Let him come himself to see the sage'.
12_13.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, शिष्यः the disciple, सम्भ्रान्तः exited, निष्क्रम्य after coming out, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said, असौ he, रामः Rama, क्व where is he?, मुनिम् sage, द्रष्टुम् to see, एतु he may come, स्वयम् himself, प्रविशतु let him come in.

12_14.shloka: ततो गत्वाऽऽश्रमपदं शिष्येण सह लक्ष्मणः।। 3.12.14।।दर्शयामास काकुत्स्थं सीतां च जनकात्मजाम्।
12_14.translation: Then Lakshmana reached the entrance of the hermitage with the disciple  and showed  Rama of the Kakutstha race and Sita, daughter of Janaka .
12_14.word_by_word: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शिष्येण सह along with the disciple, आश्रमद्वारम् entrance of the hermitage, गत्वा after reaching, काकुत्स्थम् Rama of the Kakutstha family, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, सीतां च Sita also, दर्शयामास showed.

12_15.shloka: तं शिष्यः प्रश्रितो वाक्यमगस्त्यवचनं ब्रुवन्।।3.12.15।।प्रावेशयद्यथान्यायं सत्कारार्हं सुसत्कृतम्।
12_15.translation: The disciple humbly reported Agastya's words and ushered him in with befitting hospitality.
12_15.word_by_word: शिष्यः disciple, प्रश्रितः most obediently, अगस्त्यवचनम् Agastya's words, वाक्यम् utterance, ब्रुवन् while informing, सत्कारार्हम् one who deserved hospitality, सुसत्कृम् treating with respect, तम् him, यथान्याम् in an appropriate way, प्रावेशयत् ushered in.

12_16.translation: Then Rama, Sita and Lakshmana entered the hermitage, watching herds of quietly moving deer (undisturbed by their entry).
12_16.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, सीतया with Sita, सहलक्ष्मणः and with Lakshmana, प्रशान्तहरिणाकीर्णम् full of quietly moving deer, आश्रमम् hermitage, अवलोकयन् observing, प्रविवेश entered.

12_17.shloka: स तत्र ब्रह्मणः स्थानमग्नेः स्थानं तथैव च।।3.12.17।।विष्णोः स्थानं महेन्द्रस्य स्थानं चैव विवस्वतः।सोमस्थानं भगस्थानं स्थानं कौबेरमेव च।।3.12.18।।दातुर्विधातुः स्थानेच वायोः स्थानं तथैव च।नागराजस्य च स्थानमनन्तस्य महात्मनः।।3.12.19।।स्थानं तथैव गायत्र्या वसूनां स्थानमेव च।स्थानं च पाशहस्तस्य वरुणस्य महात्मनः।।3.12.20।।कार्तिकेयस्य च स्थानं धर्मस्थानं च पश्यति।
12_17.translation: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking),  Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
12_17.word_by_word: सः he, तत्र there, ब्रह्मणः Brahma, स्थानम् place, तथैव च similarly, अग्नेः Fire's, स्थानम् place, विष्णोः Visnu's, स्थानम् place, तथा so also, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, विवस्वतः Sun's, स्थानं चैव place too, सोमस्थानम् Moon's place, भगस्थानम् place of Bhaga (one of the twelve forms of the Sun), कौबेरम् Kubera's, स्थानमेव च place too, धातुः Supreme Spirit, विधातुः the Creator's, स्थाने च place too, तथैव च ल like that, वायोः windgod's, स्थानम् place, नागराजस्य serpent king's, महात्मनः great soul's, अनन्तस्य Ananta's, स्थानम् place, तथैव like that, गायत्र्याः Gayatri's, स्थानम् place, वसूनाम् of Vasu's, स्थानमेव च place also, पाशहस्तस्य Pasahasta's(one who holds the noose in his hand to pull and punish the mortals), महात्मनः of the great soul, वरुणस्य water god Varuna's, स्थानं च place too, कार्तिकेयस्यKartikeya's, स्थानं च place too, धर्मस्थानं च place of dharma, पश्यति he saw.

12_18.shloka: स तत्र ब्रह्मणः स्थानमग्नेः स्थानं तथैव च।।3.12.17।।विष्णोः स्थानं महेन्द्रस्य स्थानं चैव विवस्वतः।सोमस्थानं भगस्थानं स्थानं कौबेरमेव च।।3.12.18।।धातुर्विधातुः स्थानं च वायोः स्थानं तथैव च।नागराजस्य च स्थानमनन्तस्य महात्मनः।।3.12.19।।स्थानं तथैव गायत्र्या वसूनां स्थानमेव च।स्थानं च पाशहस्तस्य वरुणस्य महात्मनः।।3.12.20।।कार्तिकेयस्य च स्थानं धर्मस्थानं च पश्यति।
12_18.translation: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking), Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
12_18.word_by_word: सः he, तत्र there, ब्रह्मणः Brahma, स्थानम् place, तथैव च similarly, अग्नेः Fire's, स्थानम् place, विष्णोः Visnu's, स्थानम् place, तथा so also, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, विवस्वतः Sun's, स्थानं चैव place too, सोमस्थानम् Moon's place, भगस्थानम् place of Bhaga (one of the twelve forms of the Sun), कौबेरम् Kubera's, स्थानमेव च place too, धातुः Supreme Spirit, विधातुः the Creator's, स्थाने च place too, तथैव च ल like that, वायोः windgod's, स्थानम् place, नागराजस्य serpent king's, महात्मनः great soul's, अनन्तस्य Ananta's, स्थानम् place, तथैव like that, गायत्र्याः Gayatri's, स्थानम् place, वसूनाम् of Vasu's, स्थानमेव च place also, पाशहस्तस्य Pasahasta's(one who holds the noose in his hand to pull and punish the mortals), महात्मनः of the great soul, वरुणस्य water god Varuna's, स्थानं च place too, कार्तिकेयस्यKartikeya's, स्थानं च place too, धर्मस्थानं च place of dharma, पश्यति he saw.

12_19.shloka: स तत्र ब्रह्मणः स्थानमग्नेः स्थानं तथैव च।।3.12.17।।विष्णोः स्थानं महेन्द्रस्य स्थानं चैव विवस्वतः।सोमस्थानं भगस्थानं स्थानं कौबेरमेव च।।3.12.18।।दातुर्विधातुः स्थानेच वायोः स्थानं तथैव च।नागराजस्य च स्थानमनन्तस्य महात्मनः।।3.12.19।।स्थानं तथैव गायत्र्या वसूनां स्थानमेव च।स्थानं च पाशहस्तस्य वरुणस्य महात्मनः।।3.12.20।।कार्तिकेयस्य च स्थानं धर्मस्थानं च पश्यति।
12_19.translation: Rama saw at the hermitage, the places (altars) of Brahma, Visnu, Agni (firegod), Indra, Sun, Moon, Bhaga, Kubera, Dhata (supreme spirit), Vidhata (creator Brahman), Vayu (Windgod), Ananta (great serpentking),  Gayatri, Vasu Pasahasta, Varuna, Kartikeya and Dharma .
12_19.word_by_word: सः he, तत्र there, ब्रह्मणः Brahma, स्थानम् place, तथैव च similarly, अग्नेः Fire's, स्थानम् place, विष्णोः Visnu's, स्थानम् place, तथा so also, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, विवस्वतः Sun's, स्थानं चैव place too, सोमस्थानम् Moon's place, भगस्थानम् place of Bhaga (one of the twelve forms of the Sun), कौबेरम् Kubera's, स्थानमेव च place too, धातुः Supreme Spirit, विधातुः the Creator's, स्थाने च place too, तथैव च ल like that, वायोः windgod's, स्थानम् place, नागराजस्य serpent king's, महात्मनः great soul's, अनन्तस्य Ananta's, स्थानम् place, तथैव like that, गायत्र्याः Gayatri's, स्थानम् place, वसूनाम् of Vasu's, स्थानमेव च place also, पाशहस्तस्य Pasahasta's(one who holds the noose in his hand to pull and punish the mortals), महात्मनः of the great soul, वरुणस्य water god Varuna's, स्थानं च place too, कार्तिकेयस्यKartikeya's, स्थानं च place too, धर्मस्थानं च place of dharma, पश्यति he saw.

12_20.shloka: ततश्शिष्यैः परिवृतो मुनिरप्यभिनिष्पतत्।।3.12.21।।तं ददर्शाग्रतो रामो मुनीनां दीप्ततेजसाम्।
12_20.translation: Thereafter surrounded by the disciples the sage came out. Rama saw him coming in front of the effulgent sages.
12_20.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, शिष्यैः by disciples, परिवृतः surrounded by, मुनिरपि sage also, अभिनिष्पतत् approaching, रामः Rama, दीप्ततेजसाम् shinnig brightly among them, मुनीनाम् of the sages, अग्रतः in the forefront, तम् him, ददर्श saw.

12_21.shloka: अब्रवीद्वचनं वीरो लक्ष्मणं लक्ष्मिवर्धनम्। 3.12.22।।एष लक्ष्मण निष्क्रामत्यगस्त्यो भगवानृषिः।औदार्येणावगच्छामि निधानं तपसामिमम्।। 3.12.23।।
12_21.translation: The valiant Rama said to Lakshmana, the enhancer of prosperity, O Lakshmana, sage Agastya is coming out. By virtue of his noble appearance, I know this sage to be a great treasuretrove of penances.
12_21.word_by_word: वीरः  hero, लक्ष्मिवर्धनम् augmenter of prosperity, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, भगवान् glorious, एषः this person, अगस्त्यः Agastya, ऋषिः sage, निष्क्रामति is coming here, औदार्येण by nobility, इमम् him, तपसाम् of penance, निधानम् a treasuretrove, अवगच्छामि I understand.

12_22.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहुरगस्त्यं सूर्यवर्चसम्।जग्राह परमप्रीतस्तस्य पादौ परन्तपः।।3.12.24।।
12_22.translation: Having said so, the mightyarmed Rama, the scorcher of enemies, grasped the feet of Agastya who was shining like the Sun.
12_22.word_by_word: महाबाहुः one with mighty arms, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, सूर्यवर्चसम् shining like the Sun, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, परमप्रीतः with great pleasure, तस्य his, पादौ feet, जग्राह grasped.

12_23.shloka: अभिवाद्य तु धर्मात्मा तस्थौ रामः कृताञ्जलिः।सीतया सह वैदेह्या तदा रामः सलक्ष्मणः।।3.12.25।।
12_23.translation: Then righteous Rama with Sita, the princess of Videha, and Lakshmana offered respects with folded palmsstanding.
12_23.word_by_word: तदा then, धर्मात्मा righteous self, रामः Rama, वैदेह्या with princess of Videha, सीतया with Sita, सलक्ष्मणः and with Lakshmana, अभिवाद्य having offered respects, कृताज्ञलिः with folded palms, तस्थौ stood.

12_24.translation: Agastya received Rama by offering him seat and water, enquired about his wellbeing  and said: Please be seated,
12_24.word_by_word: आसनोदकैः seat and water, अर्चयित्वा honouring, काकुत्स्थम् to Rama (Kakutstha), प्रतिजग्राह received, कुशलप्रश्नम् made enquiries of his welfare, उक्त्वा said, आस्यताम् be seated, इति च these words, अब्रवीत् said.

12_25.shloka: अग्निं हुत्वा प्रदायार्घ्यमतिथीन् प्रतिपूज्य च।वानप्रस्थ्येन धर्मेण स तेषां भोजनं ददौ।। 3.12.27।।
12_25.translation: After giving oblations to the fire, and  providing respectful offerings, the sage worshipped the guests according to the tradition of hermits and served them food.
12_25.word_by_word: सः he, अग्निम् fire, हुत्वा after offering oblations, अर्घ्यम् water etc, प्रदाय after providing, अतिथीन् guests, प्रतिपूज्य च after worshipping, वानप्रस्थेन according to hermit's, धर्मेण tradition, तेषाम् to them, भोजनम् food, ददौ gave.

12_26.shloka: प्रथमं चोपविश्याथ धर्मज्ञो मुनिपुङ्गवः।उवाच राममासीनं प्राञ्जलिं धर्मकोविदम्।।3.12.28।।
12_26.translation: And then the great sage Agastya, knower of dharma  first took his seat and addressed Rama, an export in the knowledge of dharma, seated with folded palms.
12_26.word_by_word: अथ and then, धर्मज्ञः the knower of dharma, मुनिपुङ्गवः great among the sages, प्रथमम् first, उपविश्य after sitting, आसीनम् seated, प्राञ्जलिम् one with folded palms, धर्मकोविदम् knower of dharma, रामम् to Rama, उवाच said.

12_27.shloka: अग्निं हुत्वा प्रदायार्घ्यमतिथिं प्रतिपूजयेत्।अन्यथा खलु काकुत्स्थ तपस्वी समुदाचरन्।।3.12.29।।दुःसाक्षीव परे लोके स्वानि मांसानि भक्षयेत्।
12_27.translation: O scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, only  after offering oblations to the Firegod, a guest should be worshipped with water etc. Otherwise the host will have to eat his own flesh in the other world like a false witness.
12_27.word_by_word: अग्निम् fire, हुत्वा after making an offering, अर्घ्यम् water, प्रदाय after providing, अतिथिम् guest, प्रतिपूजयेत् should worship, काकुत्स्थ O Rama, अन्यथा otherwise, समुदाचरन् by adopting, तपस्वी the sage, दुःसाक्षीव like a false witness, परे लोके in other world, स्वानि his own, मांसानि flesh, भक्षयेत् will have to eat.

12_28.shloka: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य धर्मचारी महारथः।।3.12.30।।पूजनीयश्च मान्यश्च भवान् प्राप्तः प्रियातिथिः।
12_28.translation: You are king of all the worlds, a follower of dharma, a great warrior worthy of worship and an esteemed self. O Rama you are such a dear guest come to me.
12_28.word_by_word: सर्वस्य लोकस्य in all the worlds, राजा king, धर्मचारी follower of dharma, महारथः great warrior, पूजनीयश्च one worthy of worship, मान्यश्च esteemed self, भवान् you, प्रियातिथिः a dear guest, प्राप्तः have come to me.

12_29.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा फलैर्मूलैः पुष्पैरन्यैश्च राघवम्।। 3.12.31।।पूजयित्वा यथाकामं पुनरेव ततोऽब्रवीत्।
12_29.translation: Having said this to Rama, (the sage) honoured him by offering fruits, roots, flowers and other things as desired. He then said to Rama once again:
12_29.word_by_word: एवम् like this, उक्त्वा having said, राघवम् to Rama, फलैः with fruits, मूलैः with roots, पुष्पैः with flowers, अन्यैश्च with other things, यथाकामम् as he desired, पूजयित्वा after worshipping, ततः thereafter, पुनरेव again, अब्रवीत् said.

12_30.shloka: इदं दिव्यं महच्चापं हेमरत्नविभूषितम्।।3.12.32।।वैष्णवं पुरुषव्याघ्र निर्मितं विश्वकर्मणा।अमोघस्सूर्यसङ्काशो ब्रह्मदत्तश्शरोत्तमः।।3.12.33।।
12_30.translation: O best among men  this divine bow studded with gold and gems  belongs to Visnu and designed by Visvakarma. This excellent, unfailing arrow, bright like the Sun, was given to me by Brahma.
12_30.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र O tiger among men, हेमरत्नविभूषितम् adorned with gold and gems, दिव्यम् divine, महत् great, इदं चापम् this bow, वैष्णवम् belongs to Visnu, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितम् designed, सूर्यसङ्काशः glittering like the Sun, अमोघः unfailing, शरोत्तमः best of arrows, ब्रह्मदत्तः given by Brahma.

12_31.shloka: दत्तौ मम महेन्द्रेण तूणी चाक्षयसायकौ।सम्पूर्णौ निशितैर्बाणैर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पावकैः।।3.12.34।।महारजतकोशोऽयमसिर्हेमविभूषितः।
12_31.translation: These two quivers filled fully with sharp inexhaustible arrows, shining like flames of fire and this sword adorned with gold and this big silver sheath were given to me by Indra.
12_31.word_by_word: अक्षयसायकौ  with inexhaustible arrows, निशितैः  sharp ones, ज्वलद्भि: burning, पावकैरिव like fire, बाणैः with arrows, सम्पूर्णौ  filled, तूणी quiver, मम to me, महेन्द्रेण by Indra, दत्तौ were given, महारजतकोशः a big silver sheath, अयम् this, हेमविभूषितः adorned with gold.

12_32.shloka: अनेन धनुषा राम हत्वा संख्ये महासुरान्।।3.12.35।।आजहार श्रियं दीप्तां पुरा विष्णुर्दिवौकसाम्।
12_32.translation: In ancient times Visnu killed the demons in a battle with this bow and brought back the glittering prosperity for the gods.
12_32.word_by_word: राम O Rama, पुरा in the past, विष्णुः Visnu, सङ्ख्ये in the battle, अनेन धनुषा with this bow, महासुरान् great demons, हत्वा killing, दिवौकसाम् for the gods, दीप्ताम् shining, श्रियम् prosperity, आजहार earned.

12_33.shloka: तद्धनुस्तौ च तूणीरौ शरं खङ्गं च मानद।। 3.12.36।।जयाय प्रतिगृह्णीष्व वज्रं वज्रधरो यथा।
12_33.translation: O bestower of honour, receive this bow, the two quivers, the sword and the arrow for your victory just like Indra accepts the thunderbolt.
12_33.word_by_word: मानद O Rama, bestower of honour, तत् that, धनुः bow, तौ both, तूणीरौ quivers, शरम् arrow, खङ्गं च sword, वज्रधरः Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt, वज्रं यथा as his thunderbolt, जयाय to win, प्रतिगृह्णीष्व you may please accept.

12_34.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजाः समस्तं तद्वरायुधम्।दत्वा रामाय भगवानगस्त्यः पुनरब्रवीत्।।3.12.37।।
12_34.translation: The luminous lord Agastya, having said this, gave all the excellent weapons to Rama. And continued :इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
12_34.word_by_word: महातेजा: luminous , भगवान् lord, अगस्त्यः Agastya, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, समस्तम् everything, तत् that, वरायुधम् excellent weapons, रामाय to Rama, दत्वा having given, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said.

13_1.shloka: [ Agastya's advice to Sri Rama--directs Sri Rama to go to Panchavati to reside.]राम प्रीतोऽस्मि भद्रं ते परितुष्टोऽस्मि लक्ष्मण।अभिवादयितुं यन्मां प्राप्तौ स्थ स्सह सीतया।।3.13.1।।
13_1.translation: O Rama ,I am pleased. I wish you well. I am glad that both of you have come here with Sita to pay respect to me.
13_1.word_by_word: राम  O Rama, प्रीतः pleased, अस्मि I am, ते भद्रम् wish you well, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, परितुष्टः satisfied, अस्मि I am, यत् to me, सीतया सह with Sita, माम् to me, अभिवादयितुम् to pay  reverence, प्राप्तौ have come , स्थः you both are.

13_2.shloka: अध्वश्रमेण वां खेदो बाधते प्रचुरश्रमः।व्यक्तमुत्कण्ठते वापि मैथिली जनकात्मजा।।3.13.2।।
13_2.translation: Both of you are tired due to the journey. It is evident that Sita, daughter of Janaka, is anxious (to rest).
13_2.word_by_word: अध्वश्रमेण due to fatigue caused by the journey, प्रचुरश्रमः much labour, खेदः affliction, वाम् you both, बाधते in troubling, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली चापि Maithili too, व्यक्तम् it is evident, उत्कण्ठते is anxious.

13_3.shloka: एषा हि सुकुमारी च दुःखैश्च न विमानिता।प्राज्यदोषं वनं प्राप्ता भर्तृस्नेहप्रचोदिता।।3.13.3।।
13_3.translation: Even though delicate, Sita never feels discouraged by difficulties. She has come to the forest full of obstacles, since she is motivated by her love for her husband.
13_3.word_by_word: सुकुमारी च she is delicate, दुःखैश्च with difficulties, न विमानिता is not let down, एषा this lady, भर्तृस्नेहप्रचोदिता motivated by love for the husband, प्राज्यदोषम् full of difficulties, वनम् forest, प्राप्ता she came.

13_4.shloka: यथैषा रमते राम इह सीता तथा कुरु।दुष्करं कृतवत्येषा वने त्वामनुगच्छती।।3.13.4।।
13_4.translation: O Rama, help Sita enjoy herself in whatever manner she likes. By following you into the forest, she has accomplished the most difficult task৷৷
13_4.word_by_word: राम O Rama, इह here, यथा in whatever manner, रमते she feels like enjoying, तथा like that, कुरु do, एषा this lady, वने in this forest, त्वाम् you, अनुगच्छती came following, दुष्करम् difficult, कृतवती she has done.

13_5.shloka: एषा हि प्रकृतिः स्त्रीणामासृष्टे रघुनन्दन।समस्थमनुरज्यान्ति विषमस्थं त्यजन्ति च।।3.13.5।।
13_5.translation: O Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty from the beginning of the creation women, by nature,  keep the husband company when all goes well and give them up when hard times come.
13_5.word_by_word: रघुनन्धन  O delight of the Raghu race, आसृष्टे from the beginning of creation, एषा this is, स्त्रीणाम् of women, प्रकृतिः is the nature, समस्थम् when everything is normal, अनुरज्यन्ति they enjoy, विषमस्थम् in hard situations, त्यजन्ति च they  give up.

13_6.shloka: शतह्रदानां लोलत्वं शस्त्राणां तीक्ष्णतां तथा।गरूडानिलयोश्शैघ्र्यमनुगच्छन्ति योषितः।।3.13.6।।
13_6.translation: Women are fickle like lightning, sharp like weapons and fast like Garuda or thewindgod.
13_6.word_by_word: योषितः women, शतह्रदानाम् of the lightnings, लोलत्वम् fickleness, शस्त्राणाम् of weapons, तीक्ष्णताम् sharpness, तथा like that, गरुडानिलयोः of Garuda (king of birds) and wind, शैघ्र्यम् speed, अनुगच्छन्ति follow.

13_7.shloka: इयं तु भवतो भार्या दोषैरेतैर्विवर्जिता।श्लाघ्या च व्यपदेश्या च यथा देवी ह्यरुन्धती।।3.13.7।।
13_7.translation: Your wife is free from such blemishes. She is praiseworthy and worthy of mention as an example just like the revered Arundhati.
13_7.word_by_word: भवतः your, भार्या wife, इयं तु this lady, एतैः by these, दोषैः demerits, विवर्जिता is free, देवी revered lady, अरुन्धती यथा like Arundhati, श्लाघ्या च she is praiseworthy, व्यपदेश्या च exemplary too.

13_8.shloka: अलङ्कृतोऽयं देशश्च यत्र सौमित्रिणा सह।वैदेह्या चानया राम वत्स्यसि त्वमरिन्दम।।3.13.8।।
13_8.translation: O Rama, subduer of enemies the place where you reside along with Lakshmana and Vaidehi will look adorned, indeed.
13_8.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, राम Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, अनया by her, वैदेह्याच with Vaidehi, यत्र whereever, वत्स्यसि you reside, अयम् this, देशश्च region, अलङ्कृतः is adorned.

13_9.translation: Thus addressed, Rama held his palms together and said politely to the sage shining like fire:
13_9.word_by_word: मुनिना by the ascetic, एवम् in that way, उक्तः being told, सः that, राघवः Rama, संयताञ्जलिः with palms held together, दीप्तम् burning, अनलमिव like fire, ऋषिम् to sage, प्रश्रितम् politely, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

13_10.shloka: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि यस्य मे मुनिपुङ्गवः।गुणैस्सभ्रातृभार्यस्य वरदः परितुष्यति।।3.13.10।।
13_10.translation: I consider myself blessed and favoured by a great sage like you, bestower of boons as you have been pleased with me, my brother and my life.
13_10.word_by_word: सभ्रातृभार्यस्य of me, along with my brother and my wife, यस्य मे of whom, गुणैः qualities, वरदः bestower of boons, मुनिपुङ्गवः great among the sages, परितुष्यति is pleased, धन्यः blessed, अस्मि I am, अनुगृहीतः favoured, अस्मि me.

13_11.shloka: किन्तु व्यादिश मे देशं सोदकं बहुकाननम्।यत्राश्रमपदं कृत्वा वसेयं निरतस्सुखम्।।3.13.11।।
13_11.translation: Direct me to a place with water and dense forest where we can build an ashram and live happily.
13_11.word_by_word: किन्तु but, यत्र there, आश्रमपदम् the hermitage, कृत्वा after building, निरतः always, सुखम् happily, वसेयम् I may live, सोदकम् with water, बहुकाननम् with many forests, देशम् place, मे for me, व्यादिश direct.

13_12.shloka: ततोऽब्रवीन्मुनिश्रेष्ठश्श्रुत्वा रामस्य तद्वचः।ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं धर्मात्मा धीरो धीरतरं वचः।।3.13.12।।
13_12.translation: On hearing the words of Rama, Agastya, the best among the sages, coolheaded and righteous, thought a while and uttered these words coolly :
13_12.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, धर्मात्मा a righteous soul, धीरः cool, मुनिश्रेष्ठः best among sages, रामस्य Rama's, तत् that, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मुहूर्तम् for a while, ध्यात्वा after thinking, धीरतरम् more solemn, वचः word, अब्रवीत् uttered.

13_13.translation: O dear two yojanas away is a place wellknown as Panchavati, a beautiful resort with many roots, fruits, plenty of water and many animals.
13_13.word_by_word: तात dear son, बहुमूलफलोदकः a place with many roots, fruits and water, बहुमृगः a place with many animals, श्रीमान् beautiful, पञ्चवट्यभिविश्रुतः popularly known as Panchavati, शः that place, इतः from here, द्वियोजने at a distance of two yojanas.

13_14.shloka: तत्र गत्वाऽऽश्रमपदं कृत्वा सौमित्रिणा सह।रमस्व त्वं पितुर्वाक्यं तथोक्तमनुपालयन्।।3.13.14।।
13_14.translation: Reaching there, you wikk build a hermitage with Lakshmana and enjoy your life given to the fulfilment of the pledge to the father.
13_14.word_by_word: त्वम् you, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana, तत्र there, गत्वा after going, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, कृत्वा building, यथोक्तम् as told, पितुः father's, वाक्यम् words, अनुपालयन् while obeying, रंस्यसे you will enjoy.

13_15.shloka: कालोऽयं गतभूयिष्ठो यः काल स्तव राघव।समयो यो नरेन्द्रेण कृतो दशरथेन ते।।3.13.15।।तीर्णप्रतिज्ञः काकुत्स्थ सुखं राज्ये निवत्स्यसि।
13_15.translation: O Rama, scion of the Kakutsthas  much of the period of exile king Dasaratha had assigned has passed. You will fulfil your promise and live happily in the kingdom.
13_15.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, ते for you, नरेन्द्रेण by the king, यः whatever, समयः time, कृतः is fixed, यः that period, तव your, कालः time, अयं कालः this period, गतभूयिष्ठः has been mostly spent, काकुत्स्थ Kakutstha, तीर्णप्रतिज्ञः one who has fulfilled his promise, राज्ये in the kingdom, सुखम् happily, निवत्स्यसि you will live.

13_16.shloka: धन्यस्ते जनको राम स राजा रघुनन्दन।।3.13.16।।यस्त्वया ज्येष्ठपुत्रेण ययातिरिव तारितः।
13_16.translation: O Rama, joy of the Raghu family with the eldest son like you, your father is blessed and liberated like king Yayati.
13_16.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन delight of the Raghu family, राम Rama, ते जनकः your father, सः he, राजा the king, धन्यः blessed, यः who, ज्येष्ठपुत्रेण with the eldest son, त्वया by you, ययातिरिव like Yayati, तारितः is liberated.

13_17.shloka: विदितो ह्येष वृत्तान्तो मम सर्वस्तवानघ।।3.13.17।।तपसश्च प्रभावेण स्नेहाद्दशरथस्य च।
13_17.translation: O sinless one, I have kown all these facts about you by the power of penance and love for Dasaratha.
13_17.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless one, तपसः of the penance, प्रभावेण by the power, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नेहात् due to love, तव your, एषः this, सर्वः all, वृत्तान्तः facts, मम to me, विदितः is known.

13_18.shloka: हृदयस्थश्च ते छन्दो विज्ञातस्तपसा मया।।3.13.18।।इहावासं प्रतिज्ञाय मया सह तपोवने।अतश्च त्वामहं ब्रूमि गच्छ पञ्चवटीमिति।।3.13.19।।
13_18.translation: I know your heart by virtue of my penance. I, therefore, ask you to proceed to Panchavati, after ensuring your stay here with me in this penancegrove for the time being.
13_18.word_by_word: ते your, हृदयस्थः  of your heart, छन्द: desire, मया by me, तपसा by the power of penance, विज्ञातः is known, अतः therefore, मया सह with me, इह here, तपोवने in this penancegrove, आवासं residence, प्रतिज्ञाय after ensuring, पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, गच्छ you may go, इति thus, त्वाम् you, अहम् I, ब्रूमि telling you.

13_19.shloka: स हि रम्यो वनोद्देशो मैथिली तत्र रंस्यते।स देशश्श्लाघनीयश्च नातिदूरे च राघव।।3.13.20।।
13_19.translation: O Raghava, that forest tract is delightful and beautiful. It is not far away(from here). Maithili (Sita) will enjoy her stay there.
13_19.word_by_word: राघव Raghava, सः that, वनोद्देशः forest region, रम्यः हि is delightful, सः देशः that place, श्लाघनीयश्च praiseworthy, नातिदूरे च and not far away, मैथिली Maithili, तत्र there, रंस्यते will enjoy.

13_20.shloka: गोदावर्यास्समीपे च मैथिली तत्र रंस्यते।प्राज्यमूलफलश्चैव नानाद्विजगणायुतः।।3.13.21।।विविक्तश्च महाबाहो पुण्योरम्यस्तथैव च।
13_20.translation: O longarmed Rama,that place has plenty of roots and fruits. It is a solitary, holy and beautiful place teeming with various kinds of birds. Sita will enjoy her stay in the vicinity of river Godavari.
13_20.word_by_word: मैथिली Maithili, तत्र there, गोदावर्याः of Godavari, समीपे nearby , रंस्यते will enjoy, प्राज्यमूलफलश्चैव roots and fruits are plenty there, नानाद्विजगणायुतः teeming with a kariety of birds, महाबाहो long armed, विविक्तश्च it is a solitary place, पुण्यः holy place,   तथैवच in the same way, रम्यः is beautiful.

13_21.shloka: भवानपि सदारश्च शक्तश्च परिरक्षणे।अपि चात्र वसन्राम तापसान्पालयिष्यसि।।3.13.22।।
13_21.translation: O Rama, while staying with your wife, you will look after the ascetics living there sinceyou are capable of giving protection.
13_21.word_by_word: राम O Rama, भवानपि you also, सदारश्च accompanied by your wife, परिरक्षणे in giving protection, शक्तश्च able, अपि च and so, अत्र there, वसन् while living, तापसान् ascetics, पालयिष्यसि you will protect.

13_22.shloka: एतदालक्ष्यते वीर मधूकानां महद्वनम्।उत्तरेणास्य गन्तव्यं न्यग्रोधमभिगच्छता।।3.13.23।।
13_22.translation: O valiant Rama look at the great forest of madhuka trees. Walk north to the forest till you see a great banyan tree.
13_22.word_by_word: वीर O hero, एतत् this is, मधूकानाम् of madhuka trees, महत् big, वनम् forest, आलक्ष्यते is seen, अस्य its, उत्तरेण northern side, न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, अभिगच्छता while going towards, गन्तव्यम् you should go.

13_23.translation: Then climb the elevated ground not very far from the mountain. There is the wellknown Panchavati with forests, ever in full bloom.
13_23.word_by_word: ततः there, स्थलम् ground, उपारुह्य getting to the elevated, पर्वतस्य of the mountain, अविदूरतः not very far from there, पञ्चवटीत्येव is Panchavati, ख्यातः wellknown, नित्यपुष्पितकाननः  where the forest is always in full bloom.

13_24.translation: Thus addressed by Agastya,  Rama with Lakshmana paid respects to the sage wedded to truth and took leave of him.
13_24.word_by_word: अगस्त्येन by Agastya, एवम् thus, उक्तः was said, सौमित्रिणा सह with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, सत्यवादिनम्  to the truthful, तम् that, ऋषिम् sage, सत्कृत्य after worshipping with respect, आमन्त्रयामास took leave .

13_25.shloka: तौ तु तेनाभ्यनुज्ञातौ कृतपादाभिवन्दनौ।तदाश्रमात्पञ्चवटीं जग्मतुस्सीतया सह।।3.13.26।।
13_25.translation: Both of them worshipped the feet of sage Agastya, and proceeded to Panchavati with his permission.
13_25.word_by_word: तेन by him, अभ्यनुज्ञातौ permitted, तौ both, कृतपादाभिवन्दनौ worshipping his feet, सीतया सह along with Sita, तदाश्रमात् from that hermitage, पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, जग्मतुः proceeded.

13_26.shloka: गृहीतचापौ तु नराधिपात्मजौ विषक्ततूणौ समरेष्वकातरौ।यथोपदिष्टेन पथा महर्षिणा प्रजग्मतुः पञ्चवटीं समाहितौ।।3.13.27।।
13_26.translation: Both the princes, unafraid of battles, held their bows, tied the quivers and carefully proceeded towards Panchavati along the path suggested by the sage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
13_26.word_by_word: समरेषु in wars, अकातरौ never frightened, नराधिपात्मजौ two princes, गृहीतचापौ holding bows, विषक्ततूणौ tying the quivers, समाहितौ made attentive, महर्षिणा by the great sage, यथोपदिष्टेन as per the directions, पथा by the path, पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, प्रजग्मतुः proceeded.

14_1.shloka: [Meeting of Rama and Jatayu  Jatayu tells the story of the birth of all beings, including his race.]अथ पञ्चवटीं गच्छन्नन्तरा रघुनन्दनः।आससाद महाकायं गृध्रं भीमपराक्रमम्।।3.14.1।।
14_1.translation: On the way to Panchavati, Rama, the delight of the Raghu race, met a vulture with a huge body and fearful strength.
14_1.word_by_word: अथ and then, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghus (Rama), पञ्चवटीम् to Panchavati, गच्छन्  while going, अन्तरा in the middle, महाकायम् of huge body, भीमपराक्रमम् of fearful strength गृध्रम् vulture, आससाद met.

14_2.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा तौ महाभागौ वटस्थं रामलक्ष्मणौ।मेनाते राक्षसं पक्षिं ब्रुवाणौ को भवानिति।।3.14.2।।
14_2.translation: Seeing the bird on the banyan tree, venerable Rama and Lakshmana mistook him for a demon and enquired who he was.
14_2.word_by_word: महाभागौ both the venerable, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ  Rama and Lakshmana, वटस्थम् on the banyan tree, तं पक्षिम् that bird, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, भवान् you, कः who are, इति this way, ब्रुवाणौ (while) saying so, राक्षसम् demon, मेनाते thought.

14_3.shloka: स तौ मधुरया वाचा सौम्यया प्रीणयन्निव।उवाच वत्स मां विद्धि वयस्यं पितुरात्मनः।।3.14.3।।
14_3.translation: With a sweet, pleasing, and gentle voice he said to both of them, O dear know me to be a friend of your father.
14_3.word_by_word: सः he, तौ to them, मधुरया sweetly, सौम्यया in a gentle way, वाचा in a tone, प्रीणयन्निव   pleasing them, उवाच said, वत्स dear child, माम् me, आत्मनः पितुः your father's, वयस्यम् friend, विद्धि know.

14_4.shloka: स तं पितृसखं बुद्ध्वा पूजयामास राघवः।स तस्य कुलमव्यग्रमथ पप्रच्छ नाम च।।3.14.4।।
14_4.translation: Rama knew he was a friend of his father. So he enquired in a cool, composed voice his name and his lineage.
14_4.word_by_word: सः राघवः Rama, तम् him, पितृसखम् father's friend, बुद्ध्वा after knowing, पूजयामास paid obeisance, अथ then, सः he, अव्यग्रम् in a cool and composed manner, तस्य his, कुलम् lineage, नाम च name also, पप्रच्छ enquired of.

14_5.shloka: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा सर्वभूतसमुद्भवम्।आचचक्षे द्विजस्तस्मै कुलमात्मानमेव च।।3.14.5।।
14_5.translation: On hearing Rama's words, the bird started narrating the origin of all beings including his own family:
14_5.word_by_word: द्विजः  bird, रामस्य Rama's, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा  hearing, सर्वभूतसमुद्भवम् the origin of all beings, कुलम् family, आत्मानमेव च about his own family, तस्मै to him, आचचक्षे started narrating.

14_6.shloka: पूर्वकाले महाबाहो ये प्रजापतयोऽभवन्।तान्मे निगदतस्सर्वानादितश्शृणु राघव।।3.14.6।।
14_6.translation: O mightyarmed Rama hear from me while I am telling you about the lords ofcreation from the very beginning.
14_6.word_by_word: महाबाहो O mightyarmed, राघव Rama, पूर्वकाले in ancient times, ये those, प्रजापतय: lords of creation, अभवन् were there, तान् सर्वान् all of them, मे while I, निगदतः mention, आदितः from the beginning, शृणु listen.

14_7.shloka: कर्दमः प्रथमस्तेषां विक्रीतस्तदनन्तरः।शेषश्च संश्रयश्चैव बहुपुत्रश्च वीर्यवान्।।3.14.7।।स्थाणुर्मरीचिरत्रिश्च क्रतुश्चैव महाबलः।पुलस्त्यश्चाङ्गिराश्चैव प्रचेताः पूलहस्तथा।।3.14.8।।दक्षो विवस्वानपरोऽरिष्टनेमिश्च राघव।काश्यपश्च महातेजास्तेषामासीच्च पश्चिमः।।3.14.9।।
14_7.translation: O Rama among the lords of all beings the first was Kardama, the next was Vikritha, followed by Sesha, Samsrya Bahuputra, Sthanu, Mareechi, Atri and mighty Kratu, Pulastya, Angirasa, Pracheta, similarly Pulaha and Daksha.Following them were Vivasvan, Arishtanemi and the very glorious Kasyapa who was the last ruler.
14_7.word_by_word: राघव O Raghava, तेषाम् of them, प्रथमः the first, कर्दमः Kardama, विक्रीतः Vikrita, तदनन्तरः thereafter, शेषश्च Sesha, बहुपुत्र: Bahuputra, वीर्यवान्, mighty one (courageous one) संश्रयश्चैव Samsraya, स्थाणुः Sthanu, मरीचिः Mareechi, अत्रिश्च and Atri, महाबलः mighty one, क्रतुश्च Kratu, पुलस्त्यः Pulasthya, अङ्गिराश्चैव Angirasa, प्रचेताः Pracheta, तथा similarly, पुलहः Pulaha, दक्षः Daksha, अपरः after that, विवस्वान् Vivasvan, अरिष्टनेमिश्च Arishtanemi, महातेजाः very glorious, काश्यपश्च Kasyapa, तेषाम् of them, पश्चिम: later, आसीच्च became the ruler.

14_8.shloka: प्रजापतेस्तु दक्षस्य बभूवुरिति विश्रुतम्।षष्टिर्दुहितरो राम यशस्विन्यो महायशः।।3.14.10।।
14_8.translation: O glorious Rama it is wellknown that Daksha, the creator had sixty daughters of great fame.
14_8.word_by_word: महायशः very  glorious, राम Rama, प्रजापतेः of the lords, दक्षस्य of Daksha, षष्टिः sixty, यशस्विन्यः glorious, दुहितरः daughters, बभूवुः इति were born thus, विश्रुतम् very well known .

14_9.shloka: काश्यपः प्रतिजग्राह तासामष्टौ सुमध्यमाः।अदितिं च दितिं चैव दनुमप्यथ कालिकाम्।।3.14.11।।ताम्रां क्रोधवशां चैव मनुं चाप्यनलामपि।
14_9.translation: Out of them(daughters of Daksha) Kasyapa married eight women of beautiful waist called Aditi, Diti, Danu also Kalika,Tamra, Krodhavasa, Anala and Manu.
14_9.word_by_word: काश्यपः Kasyapa, तासाम् among them, अदितिं च Aditi and, दितिं चैव Diti too, दनुमपि and Danu, अथ also, कालिकाम् Kalika, ताम्राम् Tamra, क्रोधवशां चैव Krodhavasa too, मनुं च and Manu, अनलामपि Anala, अष्टौ eight, सुमध्यमाः of beautiful waist, प्रतिजग्राह married,

14_10.shloka: तास्तु कन्यास्ततः प्रीतः काश्यपः पुनरब्रवीत्।।3.14.12।।पुत्रां स्स्रैलोक्यभर्तृ़न्वै जनयिष्यथ मत्समान्।
14_10.translation: Kasyapa, pleased with them said to his young wives, Beget sons of my stature who can rule over the three worlds.
14_10.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रीतः a pleased man, काश्यपः Kasyapa, ताः कन्याः to those young wives, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् said, मत्समान् equal to me, त्रैलोक्यभर्तृ़न् rulers of the three worlds,पुत्रां sons, जनयिष्यथ may give birth to.

14_11.shloka: अदितिस्तन्मना राम दितिश्च मनुजर्षभ।।3.14.13।।कालिका च महाबाहो शेषास्त्वमनसोऽभवन्।
14_11.translation: O best of men, O longarmed Rama while Aditi, Diti and Kalika seriously considered his advice, the rest of the wives did not.
14_11.word_by_word: महाबाहो strongarmed, मनुजर्षभ bull among men, राम Rama, अदितिः Aditi, तन्मनाः engrossed in the thought, दितिश्च Diti, कालिका च and Kalika, शेषास्तु rest of them, अमनसः did not give serious thought, अभवन् became.

14_12.shloka: अदित्यां जज्ञिरे देवात्रयस्त्रिंशदरिंदम।।3.14.14।।आदित्या वसवो रुद्रा ह्यश्विनौ च परन्तप।
14_12.translation: O Rama, subduer and scorcher of enemies to Aditi were born twelve Adityas, eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, and two Asvins, thirtythree deities in all.
14_12.word_by_word: अरिन्दम subduer of enemies, परन्तप scorcher of enemies, अदित्याम् to Aditi, आदित्याः Adityas(twelve), वसवः Vasus(eight), रुद्राः Rudras (eleven), अश्विनौ Asvins(two), त्रयस्त्रिंशत् thirtythree, देवाः deities, जज्ञिरे were born.

14_13.translation: O dear Rama, Diti bore glorious sons called Daityas and this earth with all the forests and seas belonged to them.
14_13.word_by_word: तात dear child, दितिस्तु Diti bore, यशस्विनः glorious, दैत्यान् Daityas, पुत्रान् sons, अजनयत् gave birth to, सवनार्णवा including the forests and seas, इयम् this, वसुमती earth, तेषाम् to them, आसीत् belonged.

14_14.translation: O subduer of enemies, to Danu was born Hayagriva and to Kalika, Naraka and Kalaka.
14_14.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, दनुः Danu, अश्वग्रीवम् Hayagriva, पुत्रम् son, अजनयत् gave birth to, कालिकापि Kalika too, नरकम् Naraka, कालकं चैव Kalaka, व्यजायत gave birth to.

14_15.shloka: क्रौञ्चीं भासीं तथा श्येनीं धृतराष्ट्रीं तथा शुकीम्।।3.14.17।।ताम्रापि सुषुवे कन्याः पञ्चैता लोकविश्रुताः।
14_15.translation: To Tamra were born, Krounchi, Bhasi, Syeni, Dhrutharashtri and Suki. Altogether they were five beautiful young maids famous in the world.
14_15.word_by_word: ताम्रापि Tamra also, क्रौञ्चीम् Krounchi, भासीम् Bhasi, तथा similarly, श्येनीम् Syeni, धृतराष्ट्रीम् Dhrutharashtri, तथा like that, शुकीम् Suki, एताः all of them, लोकविश्रुताः famous in the world, पञ्च five, कन्याः young girls, सुषुवे she gave birth to.

14_16.shloka: उलूकाञ्जनयत्क्रौञ्ची भासी भासान्व्यजायत।।3.14.18।।श्येनी श्येनांश्च गृध्रांश्च व्यजायत सुतेजसः।धृतराष्ट्रीतु हंसांश्च कलहंसांश्च सर्वशः।।3.14.19।।
14_16.translation: Krounchi gave birth to owls, Bhasi to Bhasa birds, Synei to bright hawks and vultures, Dhrutharashtri to swans and chakravakas with sweet notes.
14_16.word_by_word: क्रौञ्ची Krounchi, उलूकान् owls, जनयत् gave birth to, भासी Bhasi, भासान् Bhasa birds, व्यजायत delivered, श्येनी Syeni, सुतेजसः very bright, श्येनांश्च Syena birds(hawks), गृध्रांश्च Vultures, व्यजायत gave birh to, धृतराष्ट्री तु Dhrutharashtri too, हंसांश्च Swans, सर्वशः all types of swans, कलहंसांश्च waterbirds of sweet note.

14_17.shloka: चक्रवाकांश्च भद्रं ते विजज्ञे सापि भामिनी।शुकी नतां विजज्ञे तु नताया विनता सुता।।3.14.20।।
14_17.translation: Dhrutharashtri, a female bird of great lustre gave birth to chakravakas too. Suki gave birth to Nata and from Nata, Vinata was born. Be blessed, O Rama
14_17.word_by_word: सा she, भामिनी woman, चक्रवाकांश्चापि chakravakas too, विजज्ञे created, ते for you, भद्रम् welfare, शुकी Suki, नताम् of Nata, विजज्ञे gave birth to, विनता Vinata, नतायः from Nata, सुता daughter.

14_18.shloka: दश क्रोधवशा राम विजज्ञे ह्यात्मसम्भवाः।मृगीं च मृगमन्दां च हरीं भद्रमदामपि।।3.14.21।।मातङ्गीमपि शार्दूलीं श्वेतां च सुरभिं तथा।सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नां सुरसां कद्रुकामपि।।3.14.22।।
14_18.translation: O Ramato Krodhavasa were born Mrugi, Mrugamanda, Hari, Bhadramada, Mathangi, Sardooli, Sweta, Surabhi and Surasa, Kadruva and endowed with all virtues.
14_18.word_by_word: राम Rama, क्रोधवशा Krodhavasa, मृगींच Mrugi, मृगमन्दां च Mrugamanda, हरीम् Hari, भद्रमदामपि Bhadramada, मातङ्गीमपि Matangi, शार्धूलीम् Sarduli, श्वेताम् Sweta, तथा सुरभिम् Surabhi, सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नाम् endowed with all virtues, सुरसाम् Surasa, कद्रुकामपि Kadruka, दश ten, आत्मसम्भवा offsprings, विजज्ञे were born.

14_19.shloka: अपत्यं तु मृगास्सर्वे मृग्या नरवरोत्तम।ऋक्षाश्च मृगमन्दायास्सृमराश्चमरा स्तथा।।3.14.23।।
14_19.translation: O best of men, all kinds of animals were born of Mrugi.To Mrugamanda were born bears and chamara (a different kind of deer).
14_19.word_by_word: नरवरोत्तम O best of men, सर्वे all kinds of, मृगाः animals, अपत्यम् offsprings, ऋक्षाश्च bears, सृमराः deer, तथा similarly, चमराश्च chamara deer, मृगमन्दायाः to Mrugamanda.

14_20.shloka: हर्याश्च हरयोऽपत्यं वानराश्च तरस्स्विनः।ततस्त्विरावतीं नाम जज्ञे भद्रमदा सुताम्।।3.14.24।।
14_20.translation: To Hari were born lions, and swiftmoving monkeys and to Bhadramada, a daughter by name Iravati.
14_20.word_by_word: हरयः lions, वानराश्च monkeys also, तरस्स्विनः awift, हर्याः to Hari, अपत्यम् offspring, ततः as, भद्रमदा Bhadramada, इरावतीं नाम by name Iravati, सुताम् a daughter, जज्ञे gave birth to.

14_21.shloka: तस्यास्त्वैरावतः पुत्रो लोकनाथो महागजः।मातङ्ग्या स्त्वथ मातङ्गा अपत्यं मनुजर्षभ।।3.14.25।।
14_21.translation: O bull among men Matangi gave birth to elephants.The mighty elephant Airavata who became the lord of the world was born to Iravati.
14_21.word_by_word: लोकनाथः O lord of the world, ऐरावतः Airavata, महागजः mighty elephant, तस्याः her, पुत्रः son, मनुजर्षभ O bull among men, अथ and, मातङ्गाः elephants, मातङ्ग्याः of Matangi, अपत्यम् offspring.

14_22.translation: O Rama, Sarduli gave birth to tigers and playful, roundbodied monkeys called Golangula and Sweta delivered elephants as sons for guarding the eight quarters.
14_22.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, शार्दूली Sarduli, गोलाङ्गूलांश्च playful roundbodied monkeys, व्याघ्रांश्च tigers, सुतान् sons, अजनयत् gave girth to, श्वेतापि and Sweta, दिशागजांश्च elephants of the  eight quarters of the globe, सुतान् as sons, अजनयत् gave birth to.

14_23.shloka: ततो दुहितरौ राम सुरभिर्द्वेव्यजायत।रोहिणीं नाम भद्रं ते गन्धर्वीं च यशस्स्विनीम्।।3.14.27।।
14_23.translation: Surabhi gave birth to Rohini and Gandharvi,the two famous daughters. May you be happy, Rama
14_23.word_by_word: राम O Rama, ततः then, सुरभिः देवी the divine Surabhi, रोहिणीं नाम by name Rohini, यशस्स्विनीम् famed, गन्धर्वीं च Gandharvi too, दुहितरौ two daughters, अजायत gave birth to, ते भद्रम् be blessed.

14_24.shloka: रोहिण्यजनयद् गावो गन्धर्वी वाजिनः सुतान्।सुरसाऽजनयन्नागान्राम कद्रूस्तु पन्नगान्।।3.14.28।।
14_24.translation: O Rama Rohini procreated cows, and Gandharvi, horses as offsprings. Surasa delivered cobras and Kadru, ordinary serpents.
14_24.word_by_word: राम Rama, रोहिणी Rohini, गाव: cows, अजनयत् procreated, गन्धर्वी Gandharvi, वाजिनः horses, सुतान् as chidren, सुरसा Surasa, नागान् cobras, कद्रूस्तु Kadru, पन्नगान् other serpents, अजनयत् procreated.

14_25.shloka: मनुर्मनुष्यान् जनयद्राम पुत्रान् यशस्विनः।ब्राह्मणान् क्षत्रियान् वैश्यान् शूद्रांश्च मनुजर्षभ।।3.14.29।।
14_25.translation: O Rama, bull among men Manu procreated brahmins, kshatriyas, vaisyas and sudras all famed human beings.
14_25.word_by_word: मनुजर्षभ O bull among men, राम Rama, मनु Manu, ब्राह्मणान् brahmins, क्षत्रियान् kshtriyas, वैश्यान् vaisyas, शूद्रांश्च and sudras , यशस्विनः illustrious, मनुष्यान् human beings, पुत्रान् sons, अजनयत् procreated.

14_26.shloka: सर्वान् पुण्यफलान्वृक्षाननलापि व्यजायत।विनता च शुकीपौत्री कद्रूश्च सुरसास्वसा।।3.14.30।।
14_26.translation: Anala (wife of Kasyapa) procreated trees with sacred fruits. Vinata was the granddaughter of Suki, and Kahdruva and Surasa were her sisters.
14_26.word_by_word: अनलापि Anala too, पुण्यफलान् sacred fruits, सर्वान् of several kinds, वृक्षान् trees, व्यजायत procreated, विनता च and Vinata, शुकीपौत्री granddaughter of Suki, कद्रूश्च from Kadhruva सुरसास्वसा sibling of Surasa.

14_27.shloka: कद्रूर्नागं सहस्रास्यं विजज्ञे धरणीधरम्।द्वौ पुत्रौ विनतायास्तु गरुडोऽरुण एव च।।3.14.31।।
14_27.translation: Kadhru produced a thousandhooded serpent(Adisesha) who held the whole earth on his head and Vinata, two sons, Garuda and Aruna.
14_27.word_by_word: कद्रूः Kadhruva, सहस्रास्यम् thousandheaded, धरणीधरम् he which held the whole earth, नागम् serpent, विजज्ञे produced, विनतायास्तु of Vinata too, गरुडः Garuda, अरुण Aruna, एव च द्वौ two, पुत्रौ sons.

14_28.translation: I am born to Aruna and my elder brother is Sampati. O subduer of enemies, know me as Jatayu, son of Syeni.
14_28.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O Subduer of enemies, अहम् I, तस्मात् from him, अरुणात् from Aruna, जातः was born, सम्पातिः Sampati, मम my, अग्रज: elder brother, श्येनीपुत्रम् son of Syeni, माम् me, जटायुरिति as Jatayu, विद्धि know.

14_29.shloka: सोऽहं वाससहायस्ते भविष्यामि यदीच्छसि।इदं दुर्गं हि कान्तारं मृगराक्षस सेवितम्।।3.14.33।।सीतां च तात रक्षिष्ये त्वयि याते सलक्ष्मणे।
14_29.translation: If you so desire I will be helpful to you in guarding your hut. O dear, it is a difficult forest full of wild animals and demons. When you and Lakshmana are away I will protect Sita.
14_29.word_by_word: सः अहम् that I am, इच्छसि यदि if you so desire, ते to you, वाससहायः guard, भविष्यामि I shall be, दुर्गम् difficult, इदं कान्तारम् this forest, मृगराक्षससेवितम् full of wild animals and demons, तात dear, सलक्ष्मणे with Lakshmana, त्वयि you, याते having gone, सीताम् Sita, रक्षिष्ये will protect.

14_30.shloka: जटायुषं तं प्रतिपूज्य राघवो मुदा परिष्वज्य च सन्नतोऽभवत्।पितुर्हि शुश्राव सखित्वमात्मवान् जटायुषा सङ्कथितं पुनः पुनः।।3.14.34।।
14_30.translation: Rama worshipped  Jatayu and bending down, embraced him. He heard from him again and again several events relating to Jatayu's  friendship with his father.
14_30.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, तं जटायुषम् to that Jatayu, प्रतिपूज्य having worshipped, मुदा with joy, परिष्वज्य च having embraced, सन्नतः bent down, अभवत् he became, आत्मवान् selfpossessed Rama, जटायुषा with Jatayu, पुनः पुनः again and again, सङ्कथितम् narrated, पितुः father's, सखित्वम् friendship, शुश्राव heard.

14_31.shloka: स तत्र सीतां परिदाय मैथिलीं सहैव तेनातिबलेन पक्षिणा।जगाम तां पञ्चवटीं सलक्ष्मणो रिपून्दिधक्षञ्छलभानि वानलः।।3.14.35।।
14_31.translation: Entresting the protection of Sita, the princess of Mithila, to that strong vulture,  Jatayu, and accompanied by Lakshmana Rama went to Panchavati wishing to destroy the enemies like fire burning the moths.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामयणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
14_31.word_by_word: सः Rama, मैथिलीम् princess of Mithila, सीताम् Sita, परिदाय leaving the responsibility, सलक्ष्मणः with Lakshmana, अतिबलेन by very strong bird, तेन by that, पक्षिणासहैव with Jatayu, अनलः fire, शलभानिव like moths, रिपून् enemies, दिधक्षन् desirous of burning, तां पञ्चवटीम् that Panchavati, जगाम went.

15_1.shloka: [Rama, Lakshmana and Sita enter Panchavati --Lakshmana makes a thatched cottage at Panchavati -- performance of traditional sacrifices before entering the cottage --description of the beautiful nature around Panchavati and river Godavari.]ततः पञ्चवटीं गत्वा नानाव्यालमृगायुताम्।उवाच भ्रातरं रामस्सौमित्रिं दीप्ततेजसम्।।3.15.1।।
15_1.translation: On reaching Panchavati, which was full of various vicious animals, Rama said to Lakshmana, his brother who was glowing like  fire:
15_1.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, नानाव्यालमृगायुताम् filled with different kinds of vicious animals, पञ्चवटीम् Panchavati, गत्वा on going, दीप्ततेजसम् glowing like fire, भ्रातरम् brother, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, उवाच said.

15_2.shloka: आगताः स्म यथोद्दिष्टममुं देशं महर्षिणा।अयं पञ्चवटीदेशस्सौम्य पुष्पितपादपः।।3.15.2।।
15_2.translation: O handsome one, following the directions of the great sage, we have arrived at Panchavati, a place full of blossoming trees.
15_2.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, महर्षिणा by the great sage, यथोद्दिष्टम् as directed by, अमुम् to this,देशं place, आगताः स्म: we have come, पुष्पितपादपः (trees full of flowers) full of flowering trees, अयम् this, देशः place, पञ्चवटी Panchavati.

15_3.shloka: सर्वतश्चार्यतां दृष्टिः कानने निपुणोह्यसि।आश्रमः कतरस्मिन्नो देशे भवति सम्मतः।।3.15.3।।
15_3.translation: O Lakshmana cast your eyes all around the forest for a suitable place (for building a hermitage).  Indeed, you are good at judging things.
15_3.word_by_word: कतरस्मिन् in which, देशे place, नः for us, आश्रमः hermitage, सम्मतः suitable, भवति will be, कानने in this forest, सर्वतः all over, दृष्टिः vision, चार्यताम् cast (your sight) , निपुणः good atdeciding, असि you are, हि indeed.

15_4.shloka: रमते यत्र वैदेही त्वमहं चैव लक्ष्मण।तादृशो दृश्यतां देशस्सन्निकृष्टजलाशयः।।3.15.4।।वनरामण्यकं यत्र स्थलरामण्यकं तथा।सन्निकृष्टं च यत्र स्यात्समित्पुष्पकुशोदकम्।।3.15.5।।
15_4.translation: Look, O Lakshmana  for a place to the liking of Sita, a place where there is water source nearby  where both of us can enjoy. Find a beautiful location where the surrounding forest is beautiful and where faggots, flowers, water and kusa grass are available at hand.
15_4.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, यत्र where , वैदेही Vaidehi, रमते is delighted, त्वम् you, अहं च and me, यत्र where , वनरामण्यकम् forest is beautiful, तथा similarly, स्थलरामण्ययकम् beauty of the location, यत्र where , समित्पुष्पकुशोदकम् sticks used for fire sacrifice, flowers, fruits, kusa grass and water, सन्निकृष्टम् is at hand, तादृशः such a location, सन्निकृष्टजलाशयः tank nearby, देशः place, दृश्यताम् survey

15_5.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मण संयताञ्जलिः।सीतासमक्षं काकुत्स्थमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.15.6।।
15_5.translation: Having been thus instructed by Rama, Lakshmana said with folded palms in the presence of Sita:
15_5.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been instructed, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, संयताज्ञलिः with folded palms, सीतासमक्षम् in the presence of Sita, काकुत्स्थम् to Rama, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

15_6.shloka: परवानस्मि काकुत्स्थ त्वयि वर्षशतं स्थिते।स्वयं तु रुचिरे देशे क्रियतामिति मां वद।।3.15.7।।
15_6.translation: O Rama, I shall be dependent on you, even if I live for a hundred years. You only need to indicate a beautiful place of your choice.
15_6.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ Rama, त्वयि you, वर्षशतम् for hundred years, स्थिते while living, परवान् dependant man, अस्मि I am, रुचिरे in a beautiful, देशे place, क्रियताम् it may be built, इति thus, माम् to me, वद order.

15_7.shloka: सुप्रीतस्तेन वाक्येन लक्ष्मणस्य महात्मनः।विमृशन्रोचयामास देशं सर्वगुणान्वितम्।।3.15.8।।
15_7.translation: Rama was pleased with the words of great Lakshmana. Deliberating over it, he agreed upon a site suitable in all respects.
15_7.word_by_word: महात्मनः of a great soul, लक्ष्मणस्य of Lakshmana, तेन वाक्येन by these words, सुप्रीतः very pleased, विमृशन् while checking, सर्वगुणान्वितम् virtuous in all respects, देशम् site, रोचयामास selected.

15_8.shloka: स तं रुचिरमाक्रम्य देशमाश्रमकर्मणि।हस्तौ गृहीत्वा हस्तेन रामस्सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।।3.15.9।।
15_8.translation: Having come to a beautiful spot suitable for the asram, Rama took both the hands of  Lakshmana in his own and said:
15_8.word_by_word: रामः Rama, तम् that, रुचिरम् beautiful, देशम् location, आश्रमकर्मणि for building an asram, आक्रम्य after occupying, हस्तेन with hands, सौमित्रिम् Lakshmana, हस्तौ hands, गृहीत्वा after taking hold, अब्रवीत् said.

15_9.translation: This place is level, surrounded by beautiful trees in full bloom. O handsome one, you may build the hermitage here.
15_9.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle one, पुष्पितैः with flowers in full bloom, तरुभिः by trees, वृतः surrounded, अयं देशः this place, समः even without ups and downs, श्रीमान् beautiful, इह here, यथावत् accordingly, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, कर्तुम् to build, अर्हसि ought to.

15_10.shloka: इयमादित्यसङ्काशैः पद्मैस्सुरभिगन्धिभिः।अदूरे दृश्यते रम्या पद्मिनी पद्मशोभिता।।3.15.11।।
15_10.translation: There, not very far, is a beautiful lotustank shining like the Sun, fragrant with lotuses.
15_10.word_by_word: पद्मशोभिता delightful with lotuses, रम्या beautiful, इयं पद्मिनी tank full of lotuses, आदित्यसङ्काशैः shining like the Sun, सुरभिगन्धिभिः with pleasant smell, पद्मैः with lotuses, अदूरे not very far, दृश्यते is seen.

15_11.shloka: यथातख्यातमगस्त्येन मुनिना भावितात्मना।इयं गोदावरी रम्या पुष्पितैस्तरुभिर्वृता।।3.15.12।।हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा चक्रवाकोपशोभिता।
15_11.translation: As said by the selfrealised soul, sage Agastya, this Godavari is beautiful, surrounded by trees with flowers in bloom, filled with flocks of swans, ducks and ruddy geese.
15_11.word_by_word: भावितात्मना self realised soul,  अगस्त्येन मुनिना by sage Agastya, यथा as, आख्यातम् told by, रम्या delightful, पुष्पितैः  with flowers in bloom, तरुभिः with trees, वृता surrounded by, हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा filled with swans and ducks, चक्रवाकोपशोभिता beautiful with flocks of  ruddy geese (waterbirds), इयं गोदावरी this is Godavari.

15_12.shloka: नातिदूरे न चासन्ने मृगयूथपिपीडिताः।।3.15.13।।मयूरनादिता रम्याः प्रांशवो बहुकन्दराः।दृश्यन्ते गिरयः सौम्य फुल्लैस्तरुभिरावृताः।।3.15.14।।
15_12.translation: O handsome one, neither far nor near are seen tall mountains and flowering trees and herds of deer. Their numerous caves echo with sounds of peacocks.
15_12.word_by_word: सौम्य O pleasing, मृगयूथपिपीडिताः herds of deer all, मयूरनादिताः sounds of peacocks, रम्याः beautiful, प्रांशवः tall, बहुकन्दराः with numerous caves, फुल्लैः flowering तरुभिः trees, आवृताः covered, गिरयः mountains, नातिदूरे not far from here, आसन्ने near, दृश्यन्ते you may see.

15_13.shloka: सौवर्णैराजतैस्ताम्रैर्देशे देशे च धातुभिः।गवाक्षिता इवाभान्ति गजाः परमभक्तिभिः।।3.15.15।।
15_13.translation: These mountains, with streaks of minerals like gold, silver and copper forming decorative designs, look beautiful like colourful windows, and appear like huge elephants.
15_13.word_by_word: सौवर्णैः with gold, राजतैः silver, ताम्रैः with copper, धातुभिः minerals also, देशे देशे in different locations, गवाक्षिताः looking like windows, परमभक्तिभिः with prominent (beautiful) streaks, गजाः इव like huge elephants, भान्ति look splendid.

15_14.translation: The place is covered with  sal and palmyrah trees including mango, jackfruit, dates, kadamba, punnaga, ashoka, champak, tilaka, ketaka, sandalwood, spandan, dhava, asvakarna parnasha, khadira, sami, kimsuka and patala trees. It is full of wild paddy, flowering bushes and creepers that run on the ground.
15_14.word_by_word: सालैः with sal trees, तालैः with palmyrah trees, तमालैश्च with tamala trees (terminata  alata), खर्जूरपनसाम्रकैः with date, jackfruit and mango trees, नीवारैः wild paddy crops, तिमिशैश्चैव  timisha trees that will not let light pass through, पुन्नागैः with punnaga, उपशोभिताः adorning the whole place, चूतैः with mango trees, अशोकैः with asoka trees, तिलकैः with tree, चम्पकैः with champak trees, केतकैः with ketaka (pandams fascicularis), पुष्पगुल्मलतोपेतैः with flowering creepers and bushes, तैस्तैः others, तरुभिः with trees, चन्दनैः sandalwood, स्पन्दनैः spandan trees, नीपैः kadamba trees, पर्णासैः  parnasha trees, विकुचैरपि  creepers on the ground, धवाश्वकर्णखदिरैः  with dhava, ashvakarna and khadira plants, शमीकिंशुकपाटलैः with sami,  kimsukas and patala trees.

15_15.shloka: इदं पुण्यमिदं मेध्यमिदं बहुमृगद्विजम्।इह वत्स्याम सौमित्रे सार्धमेतेन पक्षिणा।।3.15.19।।
15_15.translation: This is a holy place fit for sacrifice. There are many animals and birds here.Hence we will reside here with Jatayu.
15_15.word_by_word: इदम् this, पुण्यम् holy place, इदम् this, मेध्यम् fit for scrifice, इदम् this, बहुमृगद्विजम् full of  many animals and birds, एतेन with this, पक्षिणा सार्धम् along with Jatayu, इह here, वत्स्याम will reside.

15_16.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।अचिरेणाऽश्रमं भ्रातुश्चकार सुमहाबलः।।3.15.20।।
15_16.translation: Thus directed by Rama, the mighty Lakshmana, destroyer  of enemy warriors, soon built a hermitage for his brother.
15_16.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः said, परवीरहा destroyer of the enemy heroes, सुमहाबलः of great strength , भ्रातुः brother, अचिरेण soon, आश्रमम् hermitage, चकार built.

15_17.shloka: पर्णशालां सुविपुलां तत्र सङ्खातमृत्तिकाम्।सुस्तम्भां मस्करैर्दीर्घैः कृतवंशां सुशोभनाम्।।3.15. 21।।शमीशाखाभिरास्तीर्य दृढपाशावपाशिताम्।कुशकाशशरैः पर्णैस्सुपरिच्छादितां तथा।।3.15.22।।समीकृततलां रम्यां चकार लघुविक्रमः।निवासं राघवस्यार्थे प्रेक्षणीयमनुत्तमम्।।3.15.23।।
15_17.translation: Lakshmana who was quick to act dug the clay with nippers, planted long bamboo poles, put branches of sami trees across and tied them with strong ropes. He spread kusa and kasa grass and leaves on the levelled ground. He built a beautiful, spacious and nice residence for Rama.
