15_17.word_by_word: लघुविक्रम: quick to act, तत्र there, सङ्खातमृत्तिकाम् nippers digging the clay, सुस्तम्भाम् having strong poles, दीर्घैः  long, मस्करैः  bamboos, कृतवंशाम् succesfully did, सुशोभनाम् very splendid, शमीशाखाभिः with branches of sami trees (Prospis cineraria), आस्तीर्य after spreading, दृढपाशावपाशिताम् tied with strong ropes, तथा then, कुशकाशशरैः kasa and kusa grass, पर्णैः leaves, समीकृततलाम् the ground was made plain, रम्याम् beautiful, सुविपुलाम् spacious, पर्णशालाम् leafy cottage, राघवस्यार्थे for Rama, अनुत्तमम् best, प्रेक्षणीयम् worthy of looking, निवासम् residence, चकार built.

15_18.shloka: सहसा लक्ष्मणः श्रीमान् नदीं गोदावरीं तदा।स्नात्वा पद्मानि चादाय सफलः पुनरागतः।।3.15.24।।
15_18.translation: Lakshmana then went to river Godavari, had his bath, and returned with some lotuses.
15_18.word_by_word: तदा then, श्रीमान् handsome, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सहसा immediately, गोदावरीं नदीम् (गत्वा) went to river Godavari, स्नात्वा after taking bath, पद्मानि lotuses, च and, आदाय collecting, सफलः completing the task, पुनः again, आगतः came.

15_19.shloka: ततः पुष्पबलिं कृत्वा शान्तिं च स यथाविधि।दर्शयामास रामाय तदाश्रमपदं कृतम्।।3.15.25।।
15_19.translation: Lakshmana offered oblation of flowers, invoked peace as per tradition (before occupying a newly made home) and showed Rama the cottage he had built.
15_19.word_by_word: ततः then, सः that, पुष्पबलिम् offering of flowers, कृत्वा after doing so, यथाविधि as per tradition (before occupying a new residence), शान्तिं च invoking peace, कृतम् did, तत् then, आश्रमपदम् cottage, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामास showed.

15_20.shloka: स तं दृष्ट्वा कृतं सौम्यमाश्रमं सीतया सह।राघवः पर्णशालायां हर्षमाहारयत्परम्।।3.15.26।।
15_20.translation: Rama and Sita saw the beautiful hermitage built by Lakshmana, and expressed much happiness over the leafthatched cottage.
15_20.word_by_word: सः he, राघवः Rama, तम् him, कृतम् made, सौम्यम् beautiful, आश्रमम् hermitage, सीतया सह with Sita, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, पर्णशालायाम् in the leafy cottage, परं much, हर्षम् happiness, आहारयत् expressed.

15_21.shloka: सुसंहृष्टः परिष्वज्य बाहुभ्यां लक्ष्मणं तदा।अतिस्निग्धं च गाढं च वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।3.15.27।।
15_21.translation: Deeply pleased with Lakshmana, he hugged him tightly and said those loving words :
15_21.word_by_word: तदा then, सुसंहृष्टः  highly delighted man, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, बाहुभ्याम् with both his arms, गाढम् very tighty, परिष्वज्य embraced, अतिस्निग्धम् very affectionately, वचनम्  words, अब्रवीत् said.

15_22.shloka: प्रीतोऽस्मि ते महत्कर्म त्वया कृतमिदं प्रभो।प्रदेयो यन्निमित्तं ते परिष्वङ्गो मया कृतः।।3.15.28।।
15_22.translation: O my master, you have done a great task for which I have given you what I could give at the moment a hug.
15_22.word_by_word: प्रभो O master, त्वया by  you, महत् great, कर्म task, कृतम् is accomplished, ते with you, प्रीतः pleased, अस्मि I am, यन्निमित्तम् for what you have done, ते to you, प्रदेयः that which has to be given, परिष्वङ्गः embrace, मया myself, कृतः gave.

15_23.shloka: भावज्ञेन कृतज्ञेन धर्मज्ञेन च लक्ष्मण।त्वया पुत्रेण धर्मात्मा न संवृत्तः पिता मम।।3.15.29।।
15_23.translation: O Lakshmana with a son like you who can understand others' feelings, who has a sense of gratitude and a sense of duty my father is not dead yet.
15_23.word_by_word: भावज्ञेन knower of the feelings, कृतज्ञेन  grateful , धर्मज्ञेन knower of duty,  पुत्रेण by a son, त्वया by you, मम my, धर्मात्मा righteous soul, पिता father, न संवृत्तः not dead.

15_24.shloka: एवं लक्ष्मणमुक्त्वा तु राघवो लक्ष्मिवर्धनः।तस्मिन् देशे बहुफले न्यवसत्सुसुखं वशी।।3.15.30।।
15_24.translation: Rama who was an enhancer of fortunes and who had his senses under control said thus to Lakshmana and lived happily there in that place filled with fruits.
15_24.word_by_word: लक्ष्मिवर्धनः enhancer of fortune, वशी selfcontrolled man, राघवः Rama, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, बहुफले with abundance of fruits, तस्मिन् देशे that place, सुसुखम् happily, न्यवसत् resided.

15_25.shloka: कञ्चित्कालं स धर्मात्मा सीतया लक्ष्मणेन च।अन्वास्यमानो न्यवसत्स्वर्गलोके यथामरः।।3.15.31।।
15_25.translation: Righteous Rama, served by Lakshmana, and Sita lived there for some time like a god in heaven.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fifteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
15_25.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous self, सः Rama, सीतया  with Sita, लक्ष्मणेन च and with Lakshmana, अन्वास्यमानः  served by, स्वर्गलोके in heaven, अमरः god, यथा as, कञ्चित् कालम् for some time,न्यवसत् lived.

16_1.shloka: [Lakshmana's description of nature at Panchavati to Rama -- Rama's reflections on  Bharata's virtues.]वसतस्तस्य तु सुखं राघवस्य महात्मनः।शरद्व्यपाये हेमन्तऋतुरिष्टः प्रवर्तत।।3.16.1।।
16_1.translation: While the great self Rama  lived happily there, autumn passed and dear winter set in.
16_1.word_by_word: महात्मनः great self, तस्य राघवस्य that Rama's, सुखम् comfort, वसतः while living, शरद्व्यपाये  autumn over, इष्टः favourite season, हेमन्तऋतुः winter season, प्रवर्तत set in.

16_2.shloka: स कदाचित्प्रभातायां शर्वर्यां रघुनन्दनः।प्रययावभिषेकार्थं रम्यां गोदावरीं नदीम्।।3.16.2।।
16_2.translation: Once Rama, delight of the Raghu race, went to the beautiful river Godavari for ablution in the early hours of the morning.
16_2.word_by_word: कदाचित् once, सः रघुनन्दनः  he, the delight (beloved son) of Raghu race, शर्वर्याम्  when the night, प्रभातायाम् turned into morning, रम्याम् beautiful, गोदावरीं नदीम् Godavari river, अभिषेकार्थम् for ablution, प्रययौ went.

16_3.shloka: प्रह्वः कलशहस्तस्तं सीतया सह वीर्यवान्।पृष्ठतोऽनुव्रजन्भ्राता सौमित्रिरिदमब्रवीत्।।3.16.3।।
16_3.translation: While valiant Lakshmana, walking behind Sita who was carrying a pitcher in her hand bent down a little and told Rama thus:
16_3.word_by_word: भ्राता brother, वीर्यवान् heroic, सौमित्रि: Saumitri, प्रह्वः bending a little, कलशहस्तः pitcher in hand, पृष्ठतः behind, सीतया सह with Sita, अनुव्रजन् walking behind, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

16_4.shloka: अयं स कालः सम्प्राप्तः प्रियो यस्ते प्रियंवद।अलङ्कृत इवाभाति येन संवत्सरः शुभः।।3.16.4।।
16_4.translation: O sweetspeaking brother, the season which is dear to you has arrived. It appears the auspicious year is going to be embellished with this season.
16_4.word_by_word: प्रियंवद sweetspeaking, यः this( season), ते to you, प्रियः dear, सः अयं कालः this time, सम्प्राप्तः has set in, येन by which, शुभः auspicious, संवत्सरः year, अलङ्कृतः इव as if decorated, आभाति appears.

16_5.shloka: नीहारपरुषो लोकः पृथिवी सस्यशालिनी।जलान्यनुपभोग्यानि सुभगो हव्यवाहनः।।3.16.5।।
16_5.translation: People feel frozen with fog, and water is no more enjoyable. The earth is full of crops and fire is so agreeable.
16_5.word_by_word: लोकः people , नीहारपरुषः frozen with fog, पृथिवी the earth, सस्यशालिनी full of crops, जलानि waters, अनुपभोग्यानि no more enjoyable, हव्यवाहनः the fire, सुभगः very enjoyable.

16_6.translation: Pious men offer their libations of the first crop at Agnistoma sacrifice and thereby please their manes and get rid of their sins.
16_6.word_by_word: सन्तः pious men, नवाग्रयणपूजाभिः with offering of libations of the first crop at Agnistoma sacrifices, पितृदेवताः manes अभ्यर्च्य after worshipping, काले at the proper time, कृताग्रयणकाः  the sages who have conducted sacrifice with oblation, विगतकल्मषाः rid of their sins.

16_7.translation: People in the countryside with their desires satisfied obtain abundant cow's milk at this time. Rulers of the earth are out on their expedition with a desire for victory.
16_7.word_by_word: सम्पन्नतरगोरसाः obtaining abundant cow's milk, जनपदाः people of the countryside, प्राज्यकामाः with fulfilled desire, महीपालाः rulers of the earth, विजिगीषव: desirous of victory, यात्रास्थाः going on expedition, विचरन्ति are moving about.

16_8.shloka: सेवमाने दृढं सूर्ये दिशमन्तक सेविताम्।विहीनतिलकेव स्त्री नोत्तरा दिक्प्रकाशते।।3.16.8।।
16_8.translation: As the Sun has resorted to the direction (south) that serves the god of death, the north devoid of (the Sun) shines like a woman without the vermilion mark on the forehead.
16_8.word_by_word: सूर्ये Sun, अन्तकसेविताम् serving the god of death, दिशम् direction, दृढम् stand still, सेवमाने attending, उत्तरा दिक् northern side, विहीनतिलका without the vermilion mark, स्त्रीव like a woman, प्रकाशते is shining.

16_9.shloka: प्रकृत्या हिमकोशाढ्यो दूरसूर्यश्च साम्प्रतम्।यथार्थनामा सुव्यक्तं हिमवान्हिमवान्गिरिः।।3.16.9।।
16_9.translation: Presently with the Sun far away, the Himalayas abounding in snow has naturally justified its name.
16_9.word_by_word: प्रकृत्या by nature, हिमकोशाढ्यः with snow settled heavily, साम्प्रतम् presently दूरसूर्यश्च distant Sun, हिमवान् Himalaya, गिरिः mountain, हिमवान् snowy mountain, सुव्यक्तम् clearly, यथार्थनामा has a befitting name.

16_10.translation: The days are enjoyable at noon as it is pleasant to move about during this time since the sun is not scorching. But the shade and water seem to be unfortunate (as they are not liked by any one.
16_10.word_by_word: मध्याह्ने at noon, स्पर्शतः the touch, सुखाः comfortable, अत्यन्तसुखसञ्चाराः  comfortable to go about, दिवसाः daytime, सुभगादित्याः will be enjoyable, छायासलिलदुर्भगाः in shade the water will be enjoyable৷৷

16_11.translation: The days will be frostsmitten. The Sun will also be mild. Due to heavy dewfall the weather will be cold with the blowing of the wind. Forests will be empty (as no animals would be seen moving around.)
16_11.word_by_word: साम्प्रतम् at this time, हिमध्वस्ताः destroyed by frost, दिवसाः days, मृदुसूर्याः mild Sun, सनीहाराः heavy dews, पटुशीताः severe cold, समारुताः with breeze blowing, शून्यारण्याः with none moving in the forest, भान्ति shine.

16_12.shloka: निवृत्ताकाशशयनाः पुष्यनीता हिमारुणाः।शीता वृद्धतरायामास्त्रियामा यान्ति साम्प्रतम्।।3.16.12।।
16_12.translation: At this time people do not sleep under the open sky. With the month of Pushya approaching, nights feel cool and look red due to frost. They prolong into three yamas.
16_12.word_by_word: साम्प्रतम् at this time, निवृत्ताकाशशयनाः  sleep under the open sky, हिमारुणाः reddened due to frost, शीताः cool, वृद्धतरायामाः  nights are long, पुष्यनीताः (the month of) Pushya   approaching, त्रियामाः night consisting of three yamas (yama  3 hours approximately), यान्ति  run into

16_13.translation: With the radiance of the Sun dimmed, with its orb reddened by frost, the moon does not shine clear like a mirror blurred with breath.
16_13.word_by_word: रविसङ्क्रान्तसौभाग्यः with the radiance of the Sun dimmed, तुषारारुणमण्डलः with the orb reddened owing to frost, चन्द्रमाः Moon, निःश्वासान्धः with its surface looking blurred with breath, आदर्श इव like a mirror, न प्रकाशते does not shine.

16_14.shloka: ज्योत्स्न तुषारमलिना पौर्णमास्यां न राजते।सीतेव चातपश्यामा लक्ष्यते न तु शोभते।।3.16.14।।
16_14.translation: On a fullmoon night the beams of the moon faded by forest look pale, dull like Sita scorched by the heat of the Sun.
16_14.word_by_word: पौर्णमास्याम् on a fullmoon night, तुषारमलिना faded by frost, ज्योत्स्ना moonlight, न राजते not shining, आतपश्यामा scorched by heat, सीतेव like Sita, लक्ष्यते appearing, न तु शोभते not bright.

16_15.shloka: प्रकृत्या शीतलस्पर्शो हिमविद्धश्च साम्प्रतम्।प्रवाति पश्चिमो वायुः काले द्विगुणशीतलः।।3.16.15।।
16_15.translation: The west wind which by nature feels cold at this time blows doubly cold, hit by snow.
16_15.word_by_word: प्रकृत्या by nature, शीतलस्पर्शः cold touch, साम्प्रतम् at this time, हिमविद्धश्च hit by snow, पश्चिमः वायुः the west wind, काले at this time, द्विगुणशीतलः doubly cold, वाति blowing.

16_16.shloka: बाष्पच्छन्नान्यरण्यानि यवगोधूमवन्ति च।शोभन्तेऽभ्युदिते सूर्ये नद्भि क्रौञ्चसारसैः।।3.16.16।।
16_16.translation: The snowcold forest terrains are fertile with barley and wheat crops. As the Sun rises the swans and kraunchas produce pleasing notes.
16_16.word_by_word: बाष्पच्छन्नानि covered by dew drops, यवगोधूमवन्ति च have abundant barley and wheat crops,अरण्यानि forests, सूर्ये Sun, अभ्युदिते rises, नद्भि:  produce notes, क्रौञ्चसारसैः by kraunchas and swans, शोभन्ते are delightful.

16_17.translation: The tops of rice crops shining like gold resemble the flowers of datepalm.The fields full of ripe paddy bending a little (under the weight of grains) look delightful.
16_17.word_by_word: कनकप्रभाः shining like gold, शालयः rice fields, खर्जूरपुष्पाकृतिभिः resembling the shape of date flowers, पूर्णतण्डुलैः full of ripened rice grain, शिरोभिः with heads of paddy stocks,किञ्चित् slightly, आनम्रा bent down, शोभन्ते look delightful,

16_18.translation: The Sun risen at the distant horizon looks like the Moon, his lengthening rays covered with snow and dew.
16_18.word_by_word: हिमनीहारसंवृतैः covered with snow and dew, उपसर्पद्भि: lengthening,  मयूखैः by rays, सूर्यः Sun, दूरम् yonder, अभ्युदितः risen up, शशाङ्कः Moon, इव like, लक्ष्यते appears.

16_19.shloka: अग्राह्यवीर्यः पूर्वाह्णे मध्याह्ने स्पर्शतस्सुखः।संरक्तः किञ्चिदापाण्डुरातपश्शोभते क्षितौ।।3.16.19।।
16_19.translation: The heat of the Sun which we do not feel in the forenoon is comfortable during midday when the Sun shines slightly reddish white on earth.
16_19.word_by_word: पूर्वाह्णे in the forenoon, अग्राह्यवीर्यः when his(Sun's) heat cannot be felt, मध्याह्ने at midday, स्पर्शतः by touch, सुखः comfortable, संरक्तः red, किंचित् a little, आपाण्डुः whitish, आतपः heat, क्षितौ on earth, शोभते is delightful.

16_20.translation: As the miadows are wet with dewdrops, the land looks delightful with mild Sunlight  shining on the surface.
16_20.word_by_word: अवश्यायनिपातेन with dewdrops fallen, किञ्चित् a little, प्रक्लिन्नशाद्वला the grassland wet with frost, निविष्टतरुणातपा with mild heat  on the surface, वनानाम् the forests, भूमिः land, शोभते looks delightful.

16_21.shloka: स्पृशंस्तु विमलं शीतमुदकं द्विरदस्सुखम्।अत्यन्ततृषितो वन्यः प्रतिसंहरते करम्।।3.16.21।।
16_21.translation: The wild tusker, extremely thirsty, touches the clean, cold water joyfully, but immediately withdraws its trunk unable to bear the cold.
16_21.word_by_word: अत्यन्ततृषितः extremely thirsty, वन्यः wild , द्विरदः tusker, विमलम् pure water, शीतम् cool, उदकम् water, सुखम् joyfully, स्पृशन् for touch, करम् trunk of elephant, प्रतिसंहरते takes back.

16_22.shloka: एते हि समुपासीना विहगा जलचारिणः।नावगाहन्ति सलिलमप्रगल्भा इवाहवम्।।3.16.22।।
16_22.translation: Just as inefficient warriors do not enter the warfield, aquatic birds sitting near water do not venture to take a plunge into it.
16_22.word_by_word: समुपासीनाः seated nearby, एते these, जलचारिणः aquatic, विहगाः birds, अप्रगल्भाः inefficient ones, आहवम् इव as to the battlefield, सलिलम् water, नावगाहन्ति not plunging into.

16_23.shloka: अवश्यायतमोनद्धा नीहारतमसाऽवृताः।प्रसुप्ता इव लक्ष्यन्ते विपुष्पा वनराजयः।।3.16.23।।
16_23.translation: The flowerless forest ranges appear as if they are asleep, enveloped in the darkness of frost and  snow .
16_23.word_by_word: अवश्यायतमोनद्धाः enveloped by the darkness of frost ( at dawn), नीहारतमसा with the darkness of snow, आवृताः covered, विपुष्पाः without flowers, वनराजयः the forest ranges, प्रसुप्ताः इव as if sleeping, लक्ष्यन्ते appear.

16_24.translation: Now the rivers are not visible as the waters are covered with vapour. They are only inferred through the cackling of swans and the sands of the bank moistened with dewdrops.
16_24.word_by_word: साम्प्रतम्  now, बाष्पसञ्छन्नसलिलाः waters covered with vapour, रुतविज्ञेयसारसाः inferred from the cackling of swans, सरितः river, हिमार्द्रवालुकैः with sands drenched with snow, तीरैः river banks,भान्ति appear.

16_25.translation: Due to snowfall, mildness of the Sun, and coldness (of weather) even the water flowing from the mountain top is not generally tasty.
16_25.word_by_word: तुषारपतनाच्चैव  due to snowfall, भास्करस्य Sun's, मृदुत्वात् owing to mildness, शैत्यात् caused by coldness, रसवत् tasty, जलम् water, अगाग्रस्थमपि  although flowing from top of the mountain, प्रायेण generally.

16_26.translation: The lotuses in the tank  no more shine (bright) as they are decayed by age, their filaments and pericarps withered with only stalks remaining.
16_26.word_by_word: कमलाकराः lotustanks, जराजर्जरितैः grey with age, शीर्णकेसरकर्णिकैः with filament and pericarp withered, नालशेषैः only stalks remaining, हिमध्वस्तैः destroyed by snow, पद्मैः by lotuses, न भान्ति are not shining.

16_27.shloka: अस्मिंस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रः काले दुःखसमन्वितः।तपश्चरति धर्मात्मा त्वद्भक्त्या भरतः पुरे।।3.16.27।।
16_27.translation: At this time, righteous Bharata, the best among men, with his devotion to you must be sadly performing penance at his residence.
16_27.word_by_word: अस्मिन् काले at such a time, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, धर्मात्मा righteous self, भरतः Bharata, दुःखसमन्वितः sadly, त्वद्भक्त्या for his devotion to you, पुरे at his residence, तपः penance, चरति is performing.

16_28.shloka: त्यक्त्वा राज्यं च मानं च भोगांश्च विविधान्बहून्।तपस्स्वी नियताहारश्शेते शीते महीतले।।3.16.28।।
16_28.translation: Giving up his kingdom, honour and pleasures of many kinds, Bharata will be living like an ascetic, sleeping on the ground in cold weather, his food under restriction.
16_28.word_by_word: राज्यं च the kingdom, मानम् honour, विविधान् various, बहून् many, भोगांश्च pleasures, त्यक्त्वा after giving up, तपस्स्वी as an asectic, नियताहारः  controlling food, शीते in cold, महीतले on the ground, शेते  will be sleeping.

16_29.shloka: सोऽपि वेलामिमां नूनमभिषेकार्थमुद्यतः।वृतः प्रकृतिभिर्नित्यं प्रयाति सरयूं नदीम्।।3.16.29।।
16_29.translation: At this time, Bharata,  accompanied by his subjects, must be daily going to river Sarayu for ablution.
16_29.word_by_word: सोऽपि Bharata also, इमां वेलाम् at this time, अभिषेकार्थम् for ablution, उद्यतः intending to, प्रकृतिभिः by his subjects, वृतः surrounded by, नित्यम् daily, सरयूं नदीम् in river Sarayu, प्रयाति goes forth, नूनम् surely.

16_30.translation: How can Bharata who was brought up in luxury, who is delicate, and deserves all comfort, take a dip in river Sarayu (in cold morning) ?
16_30.word_by_word: अत्यन्तसुखसंवृद्धः brought up in comfort, सुकुमारः delicate, सुखोचितः  deserving comfort, अपररात्रेषु in the later part of the night, कथं नु how can, सरयूम् to Sarayu, अवगाहते for a dip.

16_31.shloka: पद्मपत्रेक्षणो वीरश्श्यामो निरुदरो महान्।धर्मज्ञ स्सत्यवादी च ह्रीनिषेधो जितेन्द्रियः।।3.16.31।।प्रियाभिभाषी मधुरो दीर्घबाहुररिन्दमः।सन्त्यज्य विविधान्भोगानार्यं सर्वात्मना श्रितः।।3.16.32।।
16_31.translation: He has a blue complexion, a pair of eyes like lotus petals, a thin waist and long arms.He is selfrestrained, softspoken, sweettempered and truthful. He knows his duty and maintains a low profile. A subduer  of enemies, he is heroic and great. Such Bharata has given up the diverse pleasures of life and has surrendered himself to you with all his soul.
16_31.word_by_word: पद्मपत्रेक्षणः  with eyes like lotus petals, वीरः valiant, श्यामः  of blue complexion, निरुदरः of thin waist, महान् great, धर्मज्ञः knower of his duty, सत्यवादी च  truthful, ह्रीनिषेधः one who maintains a low profile,  जितेन्द्रियः self controlled, प्रियाभिभाषी  softspoken, मधुरः sweet in temperament, दीर्घबाहुः  longarmed, अरिन्दमः a subduer of enemies, विविधान् diverse, भोगान् pleasures, सन्त्यज्य  giving up, सर्वात्मना with all his efforts, आर्यम् your, श्रितः devoted to.

16_32.shloka: जितस्स्वर्गस्तव भ्रात्रा भरतेन महात्मना।वनस्थमपि तापस्ये यस्त्वामनुविधीयते।।3.16.33।।
16_32.translation: Although you dwell in the forest, your great brother Bharata has won the kingdom of heaven by faithfully adopting your asceticism.
16_32.word_by_word: यः who, वनस्थमपि dwelling in the forest, त्वाम् yourself, तापस्ये in adopting asceticism, अनुविधीयते faithfully follows, तव भ्रात्रा your brother, महात्मना great self, भरतेन by Bharata, स्वर्गः heaven, जितः won.

16_33.shloka: न पित्र्यमनुवर्तन्ते मातृकं द्विपदा इति।ख्यातो लोकप्रवादोऽयं भरतेनान्यथा कृतः।।3.16.34।।
16_33.translation: The saying that men follow mother's path but not the path of the father, has been disproved by Bharata.
16_33.word_by_word: द्विपदाः humans, पित्र्यम् father's, न अनुवर्तन्ते do not follow, मातृकम् mother's, इति this way, ख्यातः wellknown, अयम् this, लोकप्रवादः saying in the world, भरतेन by Bharata, अन्यथा otherwise, कृतः is rendered.

16_34.shloka: भर्ता दशरथो यस्यास्साधुश्च भरतस्सुतः।कथं नु साऽम्बा कैकेयी तादृशी क्रूरशीलिनी।।3.16.35।।
16_34.translation: How could mother Kaikeyi, who has a husband like Dasaratha and a noble son like Bharata, be so wicked by nature ?
16_34.word_by_word: यस्याः whose, दशरथः Dasaratha, भर्ता husband, साधुः noble, भरतः Bharata, सुतः son, सा she, अम्बा mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, तादृशी such a lady, क्रूरशीलिनी a woman of wicked nature, कथं नु how did it happen?

16_35.shloka: इत्येवं लक्ष्मणे वाक्यं स्नेहाद्ब्रुवति धार्मिके।परिवादं जनन्यास्तमसहन्राघवोऽब्रवीत्।।3.16.36।।
16_35.translation: When pious Lakshmana said thus to Rama out of his love for him, Rama replied, unable to tolerate the words of censure against mother (Kaikeyi) :
16_35.word_by_word: धार्मिके generous, लक्ष्मणे Lakshmana, स्नेहात् out of love, इत्येवम् in this way, वाक्यम् words, ब्रुवते as he was uttering, राघवः Rama, जनन्याः mother's, तम् him, परिवादम् censure, असहन् unable to tolerate, अब्रवीत् said.

16_36.shloka: स तेऽम्बा मध्यमा तात गर्हितव्या कथञ्चन।तामेवेक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य भरतस्य कथां कुरु।।3.16.37।।
16_36.translation: O dear, Kaikeyi, our second mother, is never to be criticised like that. You may, however, speak more of Bharata, the lord of the Iksvakus.
16_36.word_by_word: तात dear, मध्यमा middle, अम्बा mother, कथञ्चन never, ते by you, न गर्हितव्या not to be criticised, इक्ष्वाकुनाथस्य of the lord of the Ikshvakus, भरतस्य Bharata's, तां कथामेव about him, कुरु you may.

16_37.shloka: निश्चिताऽपि हि मे बुद्धिर्वनवासे दृढव्रता।भरतस्नेहसन्तप्ता बालिशीक्रियते पुनः।।3.16.38।।
16_37.translation: Even though I have made up my mind to dwell in the forest and keep my vow, my love for Bharata makes me waver like a child (Rama does not want Bharata to suffer on hisaccount).
16_37.word_by_word: मे my, बुद्धि: mind, निश्चितापि even though determined, वनवासे to dwell in the forest, दृढव्रता firmly to keep my vow, भरतस्नेहसन्तप्ता concern for his love of Bharata, पुनः again, बालिशीक्रियते waver like a child.

16_38.shloka: संस्मराम्यस्य वाक्यानि प्रियाणि मधुराणि च।हृद्यान्यमृतकल्पानि मनःप्रह्लादनानि च।।3.16.39।।
16_38.translation: I remember his dear, sweet, ambrosial  words, soothing to the heart and pleasing to the mind.
16_38.word_by_word: प्रियाणि dear, मधुराणि sweet, हृद्यानि soothing to the heart, अमृतकल्पानि ambrosial, मनःप्रह्लादनानि च that which pleases the mind, अस्य वाक्यानि his words, संस्मरामि I remember.

16_39.shloka: कदान्वहं समेष्यामि भरतेन महात्मना।शत्रुघ्नेन च वीरेण त्वया च रघुनन्दन।।3.16.40।।
16_39.translation: O enhancer of joy of the Raghus  when shall I meet great Bharata, brave Satrughna and you all together?
16_39.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन enhancer of joy of the Raghus, अहम् I am, महात्मना by the great self, भरतेन by Bharata, वीरेण by the brave, शत्रुघ्नेन च and Satrughna, त्वया च and by you, कदा नु indeed, समेष्यामि come together.

16_40.shloka: इत्येवं विलपंस्तत्र प्राप्य गोदावरीं नदीम्।चक्रेऽभिषेकं काकुत्स्थस्सानुजस्सह सीतया।।3.16.41।।
16_40.translation: Expressing his grief in such manner, Rama reached Godavari where he took his bath with his brother and Sita.
16_40.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ: Kakutstha, (Rama) तत्र there, स इत्येवम् he in that manner, विलपन् crying aloud, गोदावरीं नदीम् to river Godavari, प्राप्य having reached, सानुजः with his brother, सीतया सह and with Sita, अभिषेकम् bath, चक्रे took.

16_41.shloka: तर्पयित्वाऽथ सलिलैस्ते पितृ़न्दैवतानि च।स्तुवन्ति स्मोदितं सूर्यं देवताश्च समाहिताः।।3.16.42।।
16_41.translation: And then poised, they offered libations of water to their forefathers and gods and prayer to the rising Sun.
16_41.word_by_word: अथ and then, ते they, सलिलैः with water, पितृ़न् forefathers, दैवतानि च and gods, तर्पयित्वा offered oblations, उदितम् risen, सूर्यम् Sun, देवताश्च deities also, समाहिताः poised together, स्तुवन्ति स्म sang in praise.

16_42.shloka: कृताभिषेकस्सरराज रामः सीताद्वितीयस्सह लक्ष्मणेन।कृताभिषेको गिरिराजपुत्र्या रुद्रस्सनन्दी भगवानिवेशः।।3.16.43।।
16_42.translation: Accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana,Rama finished his bath in the river.He looked splendid like Lord Rudra followed by Nandi and the daughter of the king of  the mountains (Parvati).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षोडशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
16_42.word_by_word: सीताद्वितीयः accompanied by Sita, सः रामः that Rama, कृताभिषेकः completing his bath, सहलक्ष्मणेन along with Lakshmana, गिरिराजपुत्र्या with the daughter of the king of the mountains, कृताभिषेकः ablution over, सनन्दी along with Nandi, ईशः Isvara, रुद्रः इव like  Rudra, रराज shone.

17_1.shloka: [Surpanakha meets Rama --reveals  her identity -- expresses her desire to be his wife]कृताभिषेको रामस्तु सीता सौमित्रिरेव च।तस्माद्गोदावरीतीरात्ततो जग्मुस्वमाश्रमम्।।3.17.1।।
17_1.translation: Ablution over, Rama, accompanied by Sita and Lakshmana, went back from the bank of the river Godabari to their hermitage.
17_1.word_by_word: कृताभिषेकः bath over, रामस्तु Rama too, सीता Sita, सौमित्रिरेव च and also Lakshmana, ततः then, तस्मात् therefrom, गोदावरीतीरात् from the bank of Godavari, स्वम् their, आश्रमम् hermitage, जग्मुः went.

17_2.shloka: आश्रमं तमुपागम्य राघवस्सह लक्ष्मणः।कृत्वा पौर्वाह्णिकं कर्म पर्णशालामुपागमत्।।3.17.2।।
17_2.translation: On reaching the hermitage, Rama and Lakshmana performed the forenoon rituals and entered the leafthatched cottage.
17_2.word_by_word: सहलक्ष्मणः accompanied by Lakshmana, राघवः Rama, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitage, उपागम्य on reaching, पौर्वाह्णिकम् rituals to be performed in the forenoon, कर्म rituals, कृत्वा after doing, पर्णशालाम् cottage thatched with leaves, उपागमत् went in.

17_3.shloka: उवास सुखितस्तत्र पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चकार विविधाः कथाः।।3.17.3।।
17_3.translation: Honoured by the ascetics , Rama  stayed there peacefully with brother Lakshmana,discussing diverse matters (from time to time).
17_3.word_by_word: महर्षिभिः by ascetics, पूज्यमानः worshipped by, तत्र there, सुखितः peacefully, उवास stayed, भ्रात्रा brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, विविधाः diverse, कथाः talks, चकार making.

17_4.shloka: स रामः पर्णशालायामासीनस्सह सीतया।विरराज महाबाहुश्चित्रया चन्द्रमाः इव।।3.17.4।।
17_4.translation: Longarmed Rama seated with Sita in the cottage, appeared like the Moon in conjunction with constellation Chitra.
17_4.word_by_word: सीतया सह along with Sita, पर्णशालायाम् in the cottage, आसीनः seated, महाबाहुः longarmed, सः रामः that Rama, चित्रया with the constellation Chitra, चन्द्रमाः इव like the Moon, विरराज appeared.

17_5.shloka: तदाऽऽसीनस्य रामस्य कथासंसक्तचेतसः।तं देशं राक्षसी काचिदाजगाम यदृच्छया।।3.17.5।।
17_5.translation: While Rama was thus seated, engrossed in conversation, there incidentally appeared a demoness.
17_5.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, कथासंसक्तचेतसः  engrossed in conversation, तथा like that, आसीनस्य while he was sitting, काचित् one, राक्षसी demoness, यदृच्छया by chance, तं देशम् to that place, आजगाम came.

17_6.shloka: सा तु शूर्पणखा नाम दशग्रीवस्य राक्षसः।भगिनी राममासाद्य ददर्श त्रिदशोपमम्।।3.17.6।।
17_6.translation: Surpanakha, sister of the tenheaded demon (Ravana) approached Rama shining like a god.
17_6.word_by_word: राक्षसः demon, दशग्रीवस्य of the tenheaded (Ravana), भगिनी sister, शूर्पणखा नाम by name Surpanakha, सा तु she, त्रिदशोपमम्  resembling god, रामम् Rama, आसाद्य near, ददर्श saw.

17_7.shloka: सिंहोरस्कं महाबाहुं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम्।आजानुबाहुं दीप्तास्यमतीव प्रियदर्शनम्।।3.17.7।।गजविक्रान्तगमनं जटामण्डलधारिणम्।सुकुमारं महासत्त्वं पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितम्।।3.17.8।।राममिन्दीवरश्यामं कन्दर्पसदृशप्रभम्।बभूवेन्द्रोपमं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसी काममोहिता।।3.17.9।।
17_7.translation: The demoness was infatuated with Rama,  whose chest was like that of a lion, who was strongarmed, who had a glowing face, pleasing to the eyes, who walked with the gait of an elephant, whose hair was matted,  who was gentle and strong who was, endowed with royal traits, who had a blue lotuslike complexion, who was handsome as the god of love, and who resembled Indra.
17_7.word_by_word: सिंहोरस्कम् whose chest was like that of a lion, महाबाहुम् longarmed, पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् whose eyes resembled lotus petals, आजानुबाहुम् kneelong arms, दीप्तास्यम् with a glowing face, अतीव vey much, प्रियदर्शनम् pleasing to look at, गजविक्रान्तगमनम्  who walked with the gait of an elephant, जटामण्डलधारिणम् having matted hair, सुकुमारम् delicate,  महासत्वम् very strong , पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितम्  endowed with royal traits, इन्दीवरश्यामम् bluelotuslike complexion, कन्दर्पसदृशप्रभम् glowing like the god of love, इन्द्रोपमम्  as Indra, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, राक्षसी demoness, काममोहिता infatuated, बभूव became.

17_8.shloka: सुमुखं दुर्मुखी रामं वृत्तमध्यं महोदरी।विशालाक्षं विरूपाक्षी सुकेशं ताम्रमूर्धजा।।3.17.10।।प्रीतिरूपं विरूपा सा सुस्वरं भैरवस्वरा।तरुणं दारुणा वृद्धा दक्षिणं वामभाषिणी।।3.17.11।।न्यायवृत्तं सुदुर्वृत्ता प्रियमप्रियदर्शना।शरीरजसमाविष्टा राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.17.12।।
17_8.translation: Rama's face was lovely, Surpanakha's was hideous. Rama had a slender waist, she had a huge belly. His eyes were large,  hers were deformed. His hair was black and beautiful, hers was coppercoloured. He was lovely in appearance, she was ugly. His voice was sweet, hers was shrill. He was young, she was dreadfully old. He was positive, she was perverted. Rama was wellbehaved, she was wicked. Rama was just and loving while she was overcome by lust.  (This) demoness said to Rama :
17_8.word_by_word: दुर्मुखी looking, महोदरी hugebellied, विरूपाक्षी woman with deformed eyes, ताम्रमूर्धजा copperred hair, विरूपा  ugly, भैरवस्वरा of shrill voice, दारुणा वृद्धा dreadfully old, वामभाषिणी with a perverted tongue, सुदुर्वृता very wicked, अप्रियदर्शना ugly to look at, राक्षसी the demoness, सुमुखम् of beautiful face, वृत्तमध्यम् slender waist, विशालाक्षम् largeeyed, सुकेशम् with beautiful hair, प्रीतिरूपम्  with lovely appearance, सुस्वरम् sweet voice, तरुणम्  young , दक्षिणम् favourable, न्यायवृत्तम् who was just, प्रियम् lovely, रामम् to Rama, शरीरजसमाविष्टा overcome by lust, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

17_9.shloka: जटी तापसरूपेण सभार्यश्शरचापधृत्।आगतस्त्वमिमं देशं कथं राक्षससेवितम्।।3.17.13।।किमागमनकृत्यं ते तत्त्वमाख्यातुमर्हसि।
17_9.translation: O Rama you are wearing matted hair like an ascetic, but living with your wife and holding bow and arrows. What brings you to this place haunted by demons ? You should tell me the truth ?
17_9.word_by_word: त्वम् you, जटी  having matted hair, सभार्यः  with your wife, शरचापधृत्  holding bow and arrows, तापसरूपेण in the form of an ascetic, राक्षससेवितम् haunted by demons, इमं this, देशम् place, कथम् how, आगतः have you come, ते your, आगमनकृत्यम् reason for coming, किम् what, तत्वम् truth, अख्यातुम् to tell, अर्हसि  should.

17_10.translation: Thus asked by the demoness Surpanakha,  Rama, scorcher of foes began telling her everything due to his simplemindedness.
17_10.word_by_word: राक्षस्या by the demoness, शूर्पणख्या by Surpanakha, एवम् in that way, उक्तः  asked, परन्तपः a scorcher of foes, ऋजुबुद्धितया  due to simplemindedness, सर्वम् everything, आख्यातुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे started.

17_11.shloka: अनृतं न हि रामस्य कदाचिदपि सम्मतम्।।3.17.15।।विशेषेणाऽश्रमस्थस्य समीपे स्त्रीजनस्य च।
17_11.translation: To Rama untruth is never acceptable at the hermitage and especially in the presence of a woman.
17_11.word_by_word: रामस्य to Rama, अनृतम् untruth, कदाचिदपि ever, न सम्मतं हि not acceptable, आश्रमस्थस्य while at the hermitage, स्त्रीजनस्य of women, समीपे च in the presence of, विशेषेण especially.

17_12.shloka: आसीद्धशरथो नाम राजा त्रिदशविक्रमः।।3.17.16।।तस्याहमग्रजः पुत्रो रामो नाम जनैश्श्रुतः।
17_12.translation: (Rama replied) There was a king named Dasaratha who was mighty like the gods. I am his eldest son known among the people as Rama.
17_12.word_by_word: त्रिदशविक्रमः  mighty like the gods, दशरथो नाम Dasaratha by name, राजा king, आसीत् was, अहम् I am, तस्य his, अग्रजः eldest, पुत्रः son, रामो Rama, नाम by name, जनैः by people, श्रुतः heard.

17_13.shloka: भ्राताऽयं लक्ष्मणो नाम यवीयान्मामनुव्रतः।।3.17.17।।इयं भार्या च वैदेही मम सीतेति विश्रुता।
17_13.translation: Here is Lakshmana , my younger brother, who always follows me . And this  is the daughter of the king of Videha and my wife, wellknown as Sita.
17_13.word_by_word: अयम् he is, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, यवीयान् younger one, भ्राता brother, माम् tome, अनुव्रतः always following me, वैदेही  daughter of king of Videha, इयम् this, मम my, भार्या wife, सीतेति as Sita, विश्रुता wellknown.

17_14.shloka: नियोगात् तु नरेन्द्रस्य पितुर्मातुश्च यन्त्रितः।।3.17.18।।धर्मार्थं धर्मकाङ्क्षी च वनं वस्तुमिहागतः।
17_14.translation: I have come here, commanded by the king, my father and mother.Intending to obey the orders of my father, and impelled by duty to  establish righteousness I have come  to reside here.
17_14.word_by_word: नरेन्द्रस्य king's, पितुः father's, मातुश्च and mother's, नियोगात् by the order, यन्त्रितः impelled, धर्मकाङ्क्षी च one desirous of establishing righteousness, धर्मार्थम् for the sake of duty, इह here, वस्तुम् to reside, वनम् to the forest, आगतः I have come.

17_15.shloka: त्वां तु वेदितुमिच्छामि कस्य त्वं कासि कस्य वा।।3.17.19।।त्वं हि तावन्मनोज्ञाङ्गी राक्षसी प्रतिभासि मे।
17_15.translation: I wish to know who you are. Tell me who your kins are. With lovely limbs you do not appear to be a demoness.
17_15.word_by_word: त्वाम् you, वेदितुम् to know, इच्छामि I wish, कथ्यताम् you may speak, क्व who, असि you are, कस्य वा whose, मनोज्ञाङ्गी a woman of beautiful limbs, राक्षसी demoness, मे to me, न प्रतिभासि seem not.

17_16.shloka: इह वा किंनिमित्तं त्वमागता ब्रूहि तत्त्वत:।।3.17.20।।साब्रवीद् वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षसी मदनार्दिता।
17_16.translation: Tell me truly what you have come here for. Having heard the words of Rama and overtaken by passion, the demoness said:
17_16.word_by_word: इह here, किंनिमित्तम् for what purpose, त्वम् you, आगता वा you have come, तत्त्वत: truly, ब्रूहि  tell, वचनम् these words, श्रुत्वा hearing, मदनार्दिता overtaken by passion, सा राक्षसी thatdemoness, अब्रवीत् said,

17_17.shloka: श्रूयतां राम वक्ष्यामि तत्त्वार्थं वचनं मम। 3.17.21।।अहं शूर्पणखा नाम राक्षसी कामरूपिणी।अरण्यं विचरामीदमेका सर्वभयङ्करा।।3.17.22।।
17_17.translation: My name is Surpanakha. I am a demoness who can assume any form at will, I move in this forest alone, unleashing a reign of terror.
17_17.word_by_word: अहम् myself, शूर्पणखा नाम is Surpanakha by name, कामरूपिणी assume the form I desire, राक्षसी a demoness, एका alone, सर्वभयङ्करा can terrorise all creatures, इदम् this, अरण्यम् forest, विचरामि I move about.

17_18.shloka: रावणो नाम मे भ्राता बलीयान्राक्षसेश्वरः।वीरो विश्रवसः पुत्रो यदि ते श्रोत्रमागतः।।3.17.23।।
17_18.translation: My brother is Ravana, son of Visrava, and lord of all demons. You have heard his name I suppose.
17_18.word_by_word: बलीयान् strongman, वीरः a hero, विश्रवस: Visrava's, पुत्रः son, रावणो नाम by name Ravana, राक्षसेश्वरः lord for all demons, मे my, भ्राता brother, ते to you, श्रोत्रम् is heard,यदि I suppose.

17_19.shloka: प्रवृद्धनिद्रश्च सदा कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः।विभीषणस्तु धर्मात्मा न तु राक्षसचेष्टितः।।3.17.24।।प्रख्यातवीर्यौ च रणे भ्रातरौ खरदूषणौ।
17_19.translation: Kumbhakarna is another brother of mine. He is very strong. He is always in deep sleep. Vibhisna another brother. He is righteous free from  any demoniac trait. My other two brothers are Khara and Dusana who are wellknown heroes of war.
17_19.word_by_word: सदा always, प्रवृद्धनिद्रः in deep sleep, महाबलः very strong, कुम्भकर्णः च Kumbhakarna, धर्मात्माa righteous one, विभीषणस्तु Vibhisana also, तु but, राक्षसचेष्टितः nature of the demon, न not, रणे in war, प्रख्यातवीर्यौ both very wellknown heroes, खरदूषणौ च Khara and Dusana, भ्रातरौ two  brothers.

17_20.shloka: तानहं समतिक्रान्ता राम त्वा पूर्वदर्शनात्।।3.17.25।।समुपेतास्मि भावेन भर्तारं पुरुषोत्तमम्।
17_20.translation: Setting them aside, I came here, as soon as I saw you. You are the finest among men and I am here wishing you to be my husband.
17_20.word_by_word: राम O Rama, अहम् I, तान् them, समतिक्रान्ता transgressing all of them, पूर्वदर्शनात् as soon as I saw, पुरुषोत्तमम् finest of men, त्वा you, भर्तारम् as husband, भावेन with that feeling, समुपेता  approached, अस्मि I am.

17_21.shloka: अहं प्रभावसम्पन्ना स्वच्छन्दबलगामिनी।।3.17.26।।चिराय भव मे भर्ता सीतया किं करिष्यसि।
17_21.translation: I have influence over others, I have capacity to move wherever I want. Be my husband forever. What will you do with Sita?
17_21.word_by_word: अहम् I, प्रभावसम्पन्ना influential, स्वच्छन्दबलगामिनी I have the capacity for moving wherever I want चिराय for long, मे my, भर्ता husband, भव you, सीतया with Sita, किंन्करिष्यसि what will you do?

17_22.shloka: विकृता च विरूपा च न चेयं सदृशी तव।।3.17.27।।अहमेवानुरूपा ते भार्या रूपेण पश्य माम्।
17_22.translation: She is ugly, deformed, unsuitable for you. I  am alone  fit for you. Look upon me as your wife.
17_22.word_by_word: विकृता च an ugly form, विरूपा च deformed too, इयम् this woman, तव your, न सदृशी is notsuitable to you, ते you, अहमेव I alone, अनुरूपा suitable, माम् me, भार्यारूपेण as wife, पश्य look upon.

17_23.shloka: इमां विरूपामसतीं करालां निर्णतोदरीम्।।3.17.28।।अनेन ते सह भ्रात्रा भक्षयिष्यामि मानुषीम्।
17_23.translation: I will devour your brother along with this disfigured, unchaste and fearful lady with a flat belly.
17_23.word_by_word: विरूपाम् deformed, असतीम् unchaste, करालाम् frightful, निर्णतोदरीम् flat bellied woman, इमां मानुषीम् to this lady, ते भ्रात्रासह along with your brother, भक्षयिष्यामि I will eat up.

17_24.shloka: ततः पर्वतशृङ्गाणि वनानि विविधानि च।।3.17.29।।पश्यन्सह मया कान्त दण्डकान्विचरिष्यसि।
17_24.translation: O darling, thereafter you can keep wandering with me in this Dandaka forest, enjoying the beauty of the mountain tops and forests.
17_24.word_by_word: कान्त O darling, ततः thereafter, पर्वतशृङ्गाणि tops of mountains, विविधानि many kinds, वनानि च forests also, पश्यन् while seeing, मया सह with me, दण्डकान् Dandaka forest, विचरिष्यसि will wander.

17_25.shloka: इत्येवमुक्तः काकुत्स्थः प्रहस्य मदिरेक्षणाम्।।3.17.30।।इदं वचनमारेभे वक्तुं वाक्यविशारदः।
17_25.translation: Thus addressed, Rama, skilled in speech, laughed and started speaking to that woman of bewitching eyes.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
17_25.word_by_word: इत्येवम् in this way, उक्तः said, वाक्यविशारदः expert in speech, काकुत्स्थ: Rama, प्रहस्य laughing, मदिरेक्षणाम् to her with bewitching eyes, इदं वचनम् these words, वक्तुम् to speak, आरेभे started.

18_1.shloka: [Rama directs Surpanakha to Lakshmana-- Surpanakha approaches Lakshmana to marry her -- Lakshmana cuts her nose and ears-- Surpanakha narrates the event to Khara.]ततश्शूर्पणखां रामः कामपाशावपाशिताम्।स्वच्छया श्लक्ष्णया वाचा स्मितपूर्वमथाब्रवीत्।।3.18.1।।
18_1.translation: To  Surpanakha bound by the noose of passion Rama with a smile replied in a clear, lucid manner:
18_1.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, कामपाशावपाशिताम् to one who was overcome by lust, शूर्पणखाम् to Surpanakha, स्वच्छया with clear, श्लक्ष्णया with lucid, वाचा with words, स्मितपूर्वम् with a smile, अथ then, अब्रवीत् said.

18_2.shloka: कृतदारोऽस्मि भवति भार्येयं दयिता मम।त्वद्विधानां तु नारीणां सुदुःखा ससपत्नता।।3.18.2।।
18_2.translation: O lady I am married and here is my wife who is dear to me. To be a cowife to some one is indeed painful for people like you.
18_2.word_by_word: भवति O Lady, कृतदारः married, अस्मि I am, इयम् this woman, मम myself, दयिता dear, भार्या wife, त्वद्विधानाम् of people like you, नारीणाम् for women, ससपत्नता being a cowife, सुदुःखा very painful.

18_3.shloka: अनुजस्त्वेष मे भ्राता शीलवान्प्रियदर्शनः।श्रीमानकृतदारश्च लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान्।।3.18.3।।
18_3.translation: Here is my younger brother Lakshmana. He is a man of good conduct, good look, valiant and virtuous. (Besides) he is not with his wife.
18_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणो नाम by name Lakshmana, एषः this man, मे my, अनुजः younger, भ्राता brother, शीलवान् a man of good conduct, प्रियदर्शनः goodlooking, श्रीमान् virtuous,  अकृतदारश्चsingle, वीर्यवान् heroic.

18_4.shloka: अपूर्वी भार्यया चार्थी तरुणः प्रियदर्शनः।अनुरूपश्च ते भर्ता रूपस्यास्य भविष्यति।।3.18.4।।
18_4.translation: He is not with his wife, and is in need of one. He is young, handsome and worthy. He will be an appropriate husband to you.
18_4.word_by_word: अपूर्वी not accompanied by his, भार्यया wife, अर्थी a man in need, तरुणः young, प्रियदर्शनः handsome, ते to your, रूपस्य beauty, अनुरूपः worthy of, भर्ता husband, भविष्यति will be.

18_5.shloka: एनं भज विशालाक्षि भर्तारं भ्रातरं मम।असपत्ना वरारोहे मेरुमर्कप्रभा यथा।।3.18.5।।
18_5.translation: O  woman of large eyes and fine hips, my brother is fit for you. You will (with him) shine like the radiant Sun on mount Meru. You will enjoy yourself without a cowife. You may approach him.
18_5.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed one, वरारोहे  with fine hips, एनम् him, भ्रातरम् my brother, अर्कप्रभा radiance of the Sun, मेरुं यथा like mount Meru, असपत्ना without a cowife, भज serve him.

18_6.shloka: इति रामेण सा प्रोक्ता राक्षसी काममोहिता।विसृज्य रामं सहसा ततो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.18.6।।
18_6.translation: Thus  told by Rama, the demoness, deluded with lust, left him suddenly, and said toLakshmana:
18_6.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, इति this way, प्रोक्ता having been told, राक्षसी the demoness, काममोहिता deluded with lust, सहसा suddenly, रामम् Rama, विसृज्य leaving, ततः thereafter, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

18_7.shloka: अस्य रूपस्य ते युक्ता भार्याहं वरवर्णिनी।मया सह सुखं सर्वान्दण्डकान्विचरिष्यसि।।3.18.7।।
18_7.translation: With my fine complexion, I will be a suitable wife for you. You can happily wander about in Dandaka forest with me.
18_7.word_by_word: ते to you, अस्य रूपस्य for your form, वरवर्णिनी a woman of fine complexion, अहम् I am, युक्ता most suitable, भार्या wife, मया सह with me, सुखम् happily, दण्डकान् to Dandaka forest, विचरिष्यसि you can wander about.

18_8.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सौमित्री राक्षस्या वाक्यकोविदः।ततश्शूर्पणखीं स्मित्वा लक्ष्मणो युक्तमब्रवीत्।।3.18.8।।
18_8.translation: Thus addressed by the demoness Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, wellversed in the use of words gave her a befitting reply :
18_8.word_by_word: राक्षस्या by that demoness, एवम् thus, उक्तः spoken, वाक्यकोविदः wellversed in the use of words, सौमित्रिः son of Sumitra, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, ततः then, स्मित्वा with a gentle smile, शूर्पणखीम् to Surpanakha, युक्तम् appropriately, अब्रवीत् said.

18_9.shloka: कथं दासस्य मे दासी भार्या भवितुमिच्छसि।सोऽहमार्येण परवान्भ्रात्रा कमलवर्णिनि।।3.18.9।।
18_9.translation: O lotuscomplexioned woman , how can you act as a maid to a slave ? Why do you intend to be so? I am already dependent on my revered brother.
18_9.word_by_word: कमलवणिनि O woman of lotus complexion, दासस्य of a servant, मे myself, भार्या wife, दासी female servant, भवितुम् will become, कथम् how, इच्छसि do you intend to be, सः such Rama, अहम् I am, आर्येण्य to that revered, परवान् dependent upon, भ्रात्रा brother.

18_10.shloka: समृद्धार्थस्य सिद्धार्था मुदितामलवर्णिनी।आर्यस्य त्वं विशालाक्षि भार्या भव यवीयसी।।3.18.10।।
18_10.translation: O largeeyed one, you have a clear complexion. You may become the younger wife of my master who is lord of great wealth. And live a happy, fulfilled life.
18_10.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि  largeeyed, अमलवर्णिनी  of clear complexion, त्वम् you, समृद्धार्थस्य lord of great wealth, आर्यस्य to Rama, यवीयसी younger, भार्या wife, सिद्धार्था fulfilled, मुदिता happy, भव you may be.

18_11.shloka: एनां विरूपामसतीं करालां निर्णतोदरीम्।भार्यां वृद्धां परित्यज्य त्वामेवैष भजिष्यति।।3.18.11।।
18_11.translation: He will abandon this uglylooking, unchaste, frightening old woman of drooping belly and accept you alone as his wife.
18_11.word_by_word: एषः this man, विरूपाम् deformed, असतीम् unchaste, करालाम् frightful, निर्णतोदरीम् a woman of drooping belly, वृद्धाम् old, एनाम् her, भार्याम् wife, परित्यज्य after discarding, त्वामेव you alone, भजिष्यति he will accept you.

18_12.shloka: को हि रूपमिदं श्रेष्ठं संत्यज्य वरवर्णिनि।मानुषीषु वरारोहे कुर्याद्भावं विचक्षणः।।3.18.12।।
18_12.translation: O lady of fair complexion and beautiful hips, which wise man will fall in love with any other female giving up a fine figure like you ?
18_12.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनि O lady of fair complexion, वरारोहे (lady with beautiful hips)charming, विचक्षणः which wise man, को हि indeed, श्रेष्ठम् best, इदं रूपम् this figure, संत्यज्य giving up, मानुषीषु among females, भावम् love, कुर्यात् how will he have?.

18_13.shloka: इति सा लक्ष्मणेनोक्ता कराला निर्णतोदरी।मन्यते तद्वचस्तथ्यं परिहासाविचक्षणा।।3.18.13।।
18_13.translation: While Lakshmana was thus making fun of the dreadful, droopingbellied Surpanakha, she presumed his words to be true.
18_13.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, इति thus, उक्ता having spoken, कराला fierce, निर्णतोदरी drooping bellied woman, परिहासाविचक्षणा  capable of making fun, सा that Surpanakha, तद्वचः those words, तथ्यम् to be true, मन्यते presumes

18_14.shloka: सा रामं पर्णशालायामुपविष्टं परन्तपम्।सीतया सह दुर्दर्षमब्रवीत्काममोहिता।।3.18.14।।
18_14.translation: Deluded with passion, Surpanakha said to formidable Rama, the scorcher of foes,  seated in the leafthatched hut along with Sita:
18_14.word_by_word: काममोहिता deluded with passion, सा she, सीतया सह with Sita, पर्णशालायाम् in the leafthatched hut, उपविष्टं seated, परन्तपम् tormentor of foes, Rama, दुर्धर्षम् formidable, रामम् Rama, अब्रवीत् said.

18_15.shloka: एनां विरूपामसतीं करालां निर्णतोदरीम्।वृद्धां भार्यामवष्टभ्य मां न त्वं बहुमन्यसे।।3.18.15।।
18_15.translation: You are holding on to this lady who is ugly, unchaste, fiercelooking, flatbellied and  aged and not caring for me.
18_15.word_by_word: विरूपाम् ugly, असतीम् unchaste, करालाम् fiercelooking woman, निर्णतोदरीम् a flatbellied woman, वृद्धाम् aged, एनाम् her, भार्याम् wife, अवष्टभ्य  taking hold , त्वम् you, माम् me, न बहुमन्यसे not honouring me.

18_16.shloka: अद्येमां भक्षयिष्यामि पश्यतस्तव मानुषीम्।त्वया सह चरिष्यामि निस्सपत्ना यथासुखम्।।3.18.16।।
18_16.translation: I shall eat up this woman now before your very eyes and I can move about happily with you without a cowife.
18_16.word_by_word: तव while you, पश्यतः are seeing, अद्य now, इमाम् this, मानुषीम् to this woman, भक्षयिष्यामि I will eat up, निस्सपत्ना without a cowife, त्वया सह with you, यथासुखम् happily, चरिष्यामि I shall move about.

18_17.translation: While speaking this, Surpanakha, with eyes like flaming amber ran to the fawneyed Sita in great anger like a giant meteor hurtling towards the constellation of Rohini :
18_17.word_by_word: अलातसदृशेक्षणा a woman of flaming ambercoloured eye, इति this way, उक्त्वा after telling, सुसङ्कृद्धा very angrily, महोल्काम् a giant meteor, रोहिणीमिव as if hurtling towards the constellation Rohini, मृगशाबाक्षीम् the fawneyed lady, अभ्यधावत् rushed towards.

18_18.shloka: तां मृत्युपाशप्रतिमामापतन्तीं महाबलः।निगृह्य रामः कुपित स्ततो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.18.18।।
18_18.translation: Mighty Rama in a rage restrained her who was falling upon Sita like the noose of death, and said to Lakshmana:
18_18.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, रामः Rama, कुपितः  enraged, मृत्युपाशप्रतिमामापतन्तीं falling like the noose of death, ताम् her, निगृह्य  restraining, ततः after that, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

18_19.shloka: क्रूरैरनार्यै स्सौमित्रे परिहासः कथञ्चन।न कार्यः पश्यवैदेहीं कथञ्चित्सौम्य जीवतीम्।।3.18.19।।
18_19.translation: O handsome Lakshmana it is not proper to cut jokes with wicked, uncivilized persons. Now see Sita who has somehow survived.
18_19.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, सौमित्रे Lakshmana, क्रूरैः by the wicked, अनार्यैः by the uncivilised one, कथञ्चन indeed, परिहासः fun, न not, कार्यः proper, कथञ्चित् somehow, जीवतीम् a livinglady, वैदेहीम् Sita, पश्य see.

18_20.translation: O tiger among men, this uncouth, bigbellied, unchaste and highly passionate demoness deserves to be formed.
18_20.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र tiger among men, विरूपाम् uncouth, असतीम् unchaste , अतिमत्ताम् passionate, महोदरीम्  big bellied इमां राक्षसीम् this demoness,  विरूपयितुम् to deform, अर्हसि you should.

18_21.shloka: इत्युक्तो लक्ष्मणस्तस्याः क्रुद्धो रामस्य पार्श्वतः।उद्धृत्य खङ्गं चिच्छेद कर्णनासं महाबलः।।3.18.21।।
18_21.translation: Thus instructed (by Rama), powerful Lakshmana took position by the side of Rama, angrily lifted the sword and cut off her nose and ears.
18_21.word_by_word: इति this, उक्तः instructed, महाबलः powerful, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, क्रुद्धः being angry, रामस्य Rama's, पार्श्वतः by the side, खङ्गम् sword, उद्धृत्य having lifted, तस्याः her, कर्णनासम् ears and nose, चिच्छेद cut off.

18_22.shloka: निकृत्तकर्णनासा तु विस्वरं सा विनद्य च।यथागतं प्रदुद्राव घोरा शूर्पणखा वनम्।।3.18.22।।
18_22.translation: Dreadful Surpanakha with her ears and nose cut off, roared in a hoarse voice and ranaway into the forest in the same direction as she came.
18_22.word_by_word: घोरा dreadful one, सा शूर्पणखा that Surpanakha, निकृत्तकर्णनासा with her ears and nose cut off, विस्वरम् in a hoarse voice, विनद्य च making a loud noise, यथागतम् in the same way as she came from, वनम् forest, प्रदुद्राव ran away.

18_23.shloka: सा विरूपा महाघोरा राक्षसी शोणितोक्षिता।ननाद विविधान्नादान्यथा प्रावृषि तोयदः।।3.18.23।।
18_23.translation: The dreadful demoness who thus was disfigured. Drenched in blood, she  thundered like a cloud in rainy season.
18_23.word_by_word: विरूपा disfigured, महाघोरा very dreadful, शोणितोक्षिता drenched in blood, सा राक्षसी that demoness, प्रावृषि in rainy season, तोयदः यथा like a cloud, विविधान्  different, नादान् sounds, ननाद released.

18_24.shloka: सा विक्षरन्ती रुधिरं बहुधा घोरदर्शना।प्रगृह्य बाहू गर्जन्ती प्रविवेश महावनम्।।3.18.24।।
18_24.translation: Dripping blood profusely, the frightful demoness lifted her arms and entered the great forestroaring.
18_24.word_by_word: घोरदर्शना of frightful look, सा she, बहुधा in many ways, रुधिरम् blood, विक्षरन्ती dripping, बाहू प्रगृह्य holding her arms, गर्जन्ती while roaring, महावनम् great forest, प्रविवेश entered.

18_25.shloka: ततस्तु सा राक्षससङ्घसंवृतं खरं जनस्थानगतं विरूपिता।उपेत्य तं भ्रातरमुग्रदर्शनं पपात भूमौ गगनाद्यथाऽशनिः।।3.18.25।।
18_25.translation: A disfigured demoness, she fell down like the thunderbolt from the sky on the ground while her fiercelooking brother Khara sat surrounded by demons at Janasthana.
18_25.word_by_word: ततः after that, विरूपिता a disfigured woman, सा she, राक्षससङ्घसंवृतम् surrounded by demons, जनस्थानगतम्  living in Janasthana, उग्रदर्शनम्  fiercelooking, भ्रातरम् brother, तं खरम् to Khara, उपेत्य approaching, गगनात् from the sky, अशनिः thunderbolt, यथा like that, भूमौ on the ground, पपात fell down.

18_26.shloka: ततस्सभार्यं भयमोहमूर्छिता सलक्ष्मणं राघवमागतं वनम्।विरूपणं चात्मनि शोणितोक्षिता शशंस सर्वं भगिनी खरस्य सा।।3.18.26।।
18_26.translation: Thereafter the sister of Khara, wild with fear and delusion and drenched in blood, narrated all about the arrival of Rama, Sita and Lakshmana in the forest and her disfigurement.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्ग।।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
18_26.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, खरस्य to Khara, भगिनी a sister, सा she, भयमोहमूर्छिता  a woman who was wild with fear and delusion, शोणितोक्षिता drenched in blood, वनम् forest, आगतम् reached, सभार्यम् with wife, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, आत्मनि at her, विरूपणं च disfigurement, सर्वम् all, शशंस narrated.

19_1.shloka: [Khara gets angry seeing mutilated Surpanakha --Surpanakha's description of Rama and Lakshmana to Khara-- Khara sends fourteen demons to attack Rama.]तां तथा पतितां दृष्ट्वा विरूपां शोणितोक्षिताम्।भगिनीं क्रोधसन्तप्तः खरः पप्रच्छ राक्षसः।।3.19.1।।
19_1.translation: Burning with anger to see his sister fallen down disfigured and drenched in blood, Khara enquired:
19_1.word_by_word: तथा in that way, पतिताम्  fallen down, विरूपाम् disfigured, शोणितोक्षिताम् drenched in blood, तां भगिनीम् that sister, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, राक्षसः demons, खरः Khara, क्रोधसन्तप्तः burning with anger, पप्रच्छ enquired.

19_2.shloka: उत्तिष्ठ तावदाख्याहि प्रमोहं जहि सम्भ्रमम्।व्यक्तमाख्याहि केन त्वमेवं रूपा विरूपिता।।3.19.2।।
19_2.translation: Get up, give up your confusion and stupefaction. Tell me clearly by whom you have been disfigured like this ?
19_2.word_by_word: उत्तिष्ठ get up, आख्याहि तावत् you may speak, प्रमोहम् delusion, सम्भ्रमम् confusion, जहि give up, त्वम् you, केन by whom, एवंरूपा by whom, विरूपिता disfigured, व्यक्तम् tell, आख्याहि clearly.

19_3.translation: Who will hurt  an innocent, venomous black serpent and stay away quietly close by for fun with his finger tip?
19_3.word_by_word: अभिसमापन्नम् staying away , आशीविषम् a snake, अनागसम् innocent, आसीनम् settled, कृष्णसर्पम् black snake, कः who, लीलया playfully, अङ्गुल्यग्रेण with a finger tip, तुदति hurts.

19_4.shloka: कः कालपाशं समासज्य कण्ठे मोहान्न बुध्यते।यस्त्वामद्य समासाद्य पीतवान्विषमुत्तमम्।।3.19.4।।
19_4.translation: Who is he who has tied has tied his throat with the noose of death out of ignorance and yet does not know the implications ? Who is he who has caused this injury to you, but does not understand that he has drunk deadly poison.
19_4.word_by_word: यः whoever, अद्य now, त्वाम् you, समासाद्य having approached, उत्तमम् best, विषम् poison, पीतवान् has drunk, कः who, कालपाशम् noose of death, मोहात् out of ignorance, कण्ठे  throat, समासज्य  bound, न बुध्यते has not understood.

19_5.shloka: बलविक्रमसम्पन्ना कामगा कामरूपिणी।इमामवस्थां नीता त्वं केनान्तकसमागता।।3.19.5।।
19_5.translation: You have sufficient strength and courage. You are capable of  moving as you like and taking any form at your will. By whom have you been brought to this state and drawn close to death?
19_5.word_by_word: बलविक्रमसम्पन्ना full of strength and courage, कामगा  able to move at will, कामरूपिणी who can take any form at free will, अन्तकसमागता brought close to death, त्वम् you, केन by whom, इमाम् this kind of, अवस्थाम् situation, नीता is reduced.

19_6.shloka: देवगन्धर्वभूतानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम्।कोऽयमेवं विरूपां त्वां महावीर्यश्चकार ह।।3.19.6।।
19_6.translation: Which valiant person among gods, gandharvas, sages and other great people, has disfigured you like this ?
19_6.word_by_word: देवगन्धर्वभूतानाम् among gods, gandharvas and other beings, महात्मनाम् among great people, ऋषीणां च and among sages, महावीर्यः a valiant man, कः who, त्वाम् you, एवम् in this way, विरूपाम् disfigured, चकार ह has reduced verily.

19_7.shloka: न हि पश्याम्यहं लोके यः कुर्यान्मम विप्रियम्।अमरेषु सहस्राक्षं महेन्द्रं पाकशासनम्।।3.19.7।।
19_7.translation: I can see none in this world who can offend me, nor even the thousandeyed Indra among the gods.
19_7.word_by_word: लोके in the world, यः who , विप्रियम् offensive action, कुर्यात् can do, अमरेषु among gods, सहस्राक्षम् thousandeyed, पाकशासनम्  Indra, महेन्द्रम् Indra, अहम् I, न हि पश्यामि I do not see.

19_8.shloka: अद्याहं मार्गणैः प्राणानादास्ये जीवितान्तकैः।सलिले क्षीरमासक्तं निष्पिबन्निव सारसः।।3.19.8।।
19_8.translation: Just as the swan drinks only milk from water (mixed with milk), my arrows will (unerringly) drain the life from the enemy's body right now.
19_8.word_by_word: अद्य right now, अहम् I, सलिले in waters, आसक्तम् mixed, क्षीरम् milk, निष्पिबन् drinking,  सारसः इव like the swan, जीवितान्तकैः  that can put an end to life, मार्गणैः by arrows, प्राणान् life, आदास्ये I will put out.

19_9.shloka: निहतस्य मया सङ्ख्ये शरसंकृत्तमर्मणः।सफेनं रुधिरं रक्तं मेदिनी कस्य पास्यति।।3.19.9।।
19_9.translation: Whose foamy, red blood will the earth drink while I strike his vital organs with my arrows in the fight ?
19_9.word_by_word: मया by me, सङ्ख्ये in fight, निहतस्य  struck down, शरसंकृत्तमर्मणः vital organs struck by arrows, कस्य whose, सफेनम् foamy, रक्तम् red, रुधिरम् blood, मेदिनी earth, पास्यति will drink.

19_10.shloka: कस्य पत्ररथाः कायान्मांसमुत्कृत्य सङ्गताः।प्रहृष्टा भक्षयिष्यन्ति निहतस्य मया रणे।।3.19.10।।
19_10.translation: Whose flesh will be eaten by cheerful flocks of (vultures), biting and tearing his body when he is killed by me in the battle ?
19_10.word_by_word: मया by me, रणे in war, निहतस्य having been killed, कस्य whose, कायात् from the body, पत्ररथाः birds (vultures), सङ्गताः in groups, प्रहृष्टाः with extreme joy, मांसम् flesh, उत्कृत्य biting and tearing, भक्षयिष्यन्ति will eat.

19_11.shloka: तं न देवा न गन्धर्वा न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः।मयापकृष्टं कृपणं शक्तास्त्रातुं महाहवे।।3.19.11।।
19_11.translation: Neither gods nor devils nor gandharvas nor even demons will have the power to rescue that hapless creature dragged by me ruthlessly in the battle.
19_11.word_by_word: इह here, आहवे in the battle, मया by  me, अपकृष्टम् dragged, तं कृपणम् to that helpless man, त्रातुम् to rescue, देवाः gods, न शक्ताः will not be able, पिशाचाः devils, न not, गन्धर्वाः gandharvas, न राक्षसाः not demons, न not.

19_12.shloka: उपलभ्य शनैस्संज्ञां तं मे शंसितुमर्हसि।येन त्वं दुर्विनीतेन वने विक्रम्य निर्जिता।।3.19.12।।
19_12.translation: You should tell me as you slowly regain your consciousness which bragart has overpowered you in the forest with his strength.
19_12.word_by_word: दुर्विनीतेन which arrogant, येन by whom, त्वम् you, विक्रम्य  showing prowess, वने in the forest, निर्जिता defeated, तम् him, शनैः slowly, संज्ञाम् consciousness, उपलभ्य  recovered, मे to me, शंसितुम्  till, अर्हसि you should.

19_13.shloka: इति भ्रातुर्वचश्श्रुत्वा क्रुद्धस्य च विशेषतः।ततश्शूर्पणखा वाक्यं सबाष्पमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.19.13।।
19_13.translation: On hearing her angry brother, Surpanakha replied with words choked with tears:
19_13.word_by_word: भ्रातु: brothers, विशेषतः specially, क्रुद्धस्य of an angry man, इति thus, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, ततः thereafter, शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, सबाष्पम् with tears, इदं वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

19_14.shloka: तरुणौ रूपसम्पन्नौ सुकुमारौ महाबलौ।पुण्डरीकविशालाक्षौ चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरौ।।3.19.14।।फलमूलाशनौ दान्तौ तापसौ धर्मचारिणौ।पुत्रौ दशरथस्यास्तां भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.19.15।।
19_14.translation: Here are two young sons of Dasaratha, Rama and Lakshmana, who are gentle, handsome,  strong, with eyes like white lotus, wearing deerskin and bark robes, living on fruits and roots, selfrestrained like ascetics and following the righteous path.
19_14.word_by_word: तरुणौ two young men, रूपसम्पन्नौ both very handsome, सुकुमारौ delicate, महाबलौ very strong, पुण्डरीकविशालाक्षौ with eyes like white lotus, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरौ attired in bark robes and black deer skin, फलमूलाशनौ living on fruits and roots, दान्तौ selfrestrained, तापसौ ascetics, धर्मचारिणौ both following righteous path, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रौ sons, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama  and Lakshmana, भ्रातरौ both brothers, आस्ताम् are here.

19_15.shloka: गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमौ पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितौ।देवौ वा मानुषौ वा तौ न तर्कयितुमुत्सहे।।3.19.16।।
19_15.translation: They are kings of the gandharvas with all royal insignia. I was not able to discern whether they are gods or humans.
19_15.word_by_word: गन्धर्वराजप्रतिमौ looking like kings of the gandharvas, पार्थिवव्यञ्जनान्वितौ having all royal insignia, तौ they both, देवौ वा whether gods, मानुषौ वा or humans, तर्कयितुम्  to guess, न उत्सहे I am not inclined.

19_16.shloka: तरुणी रूपसम्पन्ना सर्वाभरणभूषिता।दृष्टा तत्र मया नारी तयोर्मध्ये सुमध्यमा।।3.19.17।।
19_16.translation: I saw between them a young, beautiful woman of slender waist, adorned with all kinds of jewels.
19_16.word_by_word: तत्र there, तयोः of both, मध्ये between, तरुणी young woman, रूपसम्पन्ना very beautiful lady, सर्वाभरणभूषिता adorned with all kinds of jewels, सुमध्यमा a woman of slender waist, नारी lady, दृष्टा was seen.

19_17.shloka: ताभ्यामुभाभ्यां सम्भूय प्रमदामधिकृत्य ताम्।इमामवस्थां नीताहं यथानाथासती तथा।।3.19.18।।
19_17.translation: I have been subjected to this state of an orphan unfaithful woman by both of them for the sake of that lady.
19_17.word_by_word: ताम् her, प्रमदाम् lady, अधिकृत्य pertaining to her, ताभ्याम् by them, उभाभ्याम् both, अहम् I, अनाथा असती यथा like an orphan, unchaste woman, तथा likewise, इमाम् this, अवस्थाम् state, नीता reduced I am.

19_18.translation: I wish to drink the foamy blood of that crooked woman and of both the brothers slain on the battle front.
19_18.word_by_word: अहम् I, रणमूर्धनि on the battle front, अनृजुवृत्तायाः of that crooked woman, तस्याः च her, हतयोः slain, तयोश्च their, सफेनम् foamy, रुधिरम् blood, पातुम् to drink, इच्छामि I desire.

19_19.shloka: एष मे प्रथमः कामः कृतस्तात त्वया भवेत्।तस्यास्तयोश्च रुधिरं पिबेयमहमाहवे।।3.19.20।।
19_19.translation: O dear  this is my first wish and you must fulfil it. I will drink her blood and  of the two brothers, in the battle.
19_19.word_by_word: तात O dear one, मे my, एषः this, प्रथमः first, कामः wish, त्वया by  you, कृतः fulfilled, भवेत् can be, अहम् I, आहवे in a battle, तस्याः her, तयोश्च their, रुधिरम् blood, पिबेयम् be able to drink.

19_20.shloka: इति तस्यां ब्रुवाणायां चतुर्दश महाबलान्।व्यादिदेश खरः क्रुद्धो राक्षसानन्तकोपमान्।।3.19.21।।
19_20.translation: As she was speaking, the inflamed Khara ordered fourteen very strong demons, comparable to Yama, the god of death, to proceed.
19_20.word_by_word: तस्याम् as she, इति in that way, ब्रुवाणायाम् while speaking, खरः Khara, क्रुद्धः  angry, महाबलान् very strong ones, अन्तकोपमान्  comparable to Yama (god of death), चतुर्दश राक्षसान् fourteen demons, व्यादिदेश ordered.

19_21.shloka: मानुषौ शस्त्रसम्पन्नौ चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरौ।प्रविष्टौ दण्डकारण्यं घोरं प्रमदया सह।।3.19.22।।
19_21.translation: Two human beings equipped with weapons, clad in bark robes and deerskin have entered the dreadful Dandaka forest along with a woman of bewitching beauty.
19_21.word_by_word: शस्त्रसम्पन्नौ fully equipped with weapons, मानुषौ two human beings, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरौ robed in bark and deer skin, प्रमदया सह, along with a young woman, घोरम् dreadful, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टौ have entered.

19_22.shloka: तौ हत्वा तां च दुर्वृत्तामपावर्तितुमर्हथ।इयं च रुधिरं तेषां भगिनी मम पास्यति।।3.19.23।।
19_22.translation: I want you to get  both of them along with that notorious woman killed. This sister of mine will drink their blood.
19_22.word_by_word: तौ both of them, दुर्वृत्ताम् woman of bad behaviour, तां च her also, हत्वा after slaying, अपावर्तितुम् get from there, अर्हथ you should, मम my, इयं भगिनी this sister, तेषाम् their, रुधिरम् blood, पास्यति will drink.

19_23.shloka: मनोरथोऽयमिष्टोऽस्या भगिन्या मम राक्षसाः।शीघ्रं सम्पाद्यतां तौ च प्रमथ्य स्वेन तेजसा।।3.19.24।।
19_23.translation: O demons quickly go and crush them with your power and fulfil my sister's sincere wish.
19_23.word_by_word: राक्षसाः O demons, स्वेन by your, तेजसा power, तौ both of them, शीघ्रम् quickly, प्रमथ्य after impounding, अस्याः her, मम भगिन्याः my sister's, इष्टः very dear, मनोरथः desire, शीघ्रम् swiftly, सम्पाद्यताम् be fulfiled.

19_24.shloka: इति प्रतिसमादिष्टा राक्षसास्ते चतुर्दश।तत्र जग्मुस्तया सार्धं घना वातेरिता यथा।।3.19.25।।
19_24.translation: Thus commanded, the fourteen demons along with Surpanakha rushed there like windblown clouds.
19_24.word_by_word: इति this way, प्रतिसमादिष्टाः having been ordered, ते they, चतुर्दश fourteen, राक्षसाः demons, तया सार्धम् together with Surpanakha, वातेरिताः as if blown by wind, घनाः यथा like clouds, तत्र there, जग्मुः went.

19_25.shloka: ततस्तु ते तं समुदग्रतेजसं तथापिऽतीक्ष्णप्रदरा निशाचराः।न शेकुरेनं सहसा प्रमर्दितुं वनद्विपा दीप्तमिवाग्निमुत्थितम्।।3.19.26।।
19_25.translation: The nightrangers were unable to crush him(Rama) despite their sharp, glowing weapons  just as wild elephants cannot face all at once the rising flame of the forest fire.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
19_25.word_by_word: ततः then, तथा like that, तीक्ष्णप्रदराः strike with sharp weapons, ते निशाचराः those nightrangers, वनद्विपाः wild elephants, उत्थितम् risen up, दीप्तम् kindled, अग्निम् इव like fire,समुदग्रतेजसम् glowing in front, तम् him, एनम् this person, सहसा all at once, प्रमर्धितुम् to crush, न शेकुः here not able to.

20_1.shloka: [Rama kills all the fourteen demons -- Surpanakha describes the killing to Khara.]ततश्शूर्पणखा घोरा राघवाश्रममागता।राक्षसानाचचक्षे तौ भ्रातरौ सह सीतया।।3.20.1।।
20_1.translation: The frightful Surpanakha came to the hermitage of Rama and showed both the brothers and Sita to the demons.
20_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, घोरा frightful, शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, राघवाश्रमम् Rama's hermitage, आगता came, राक्षसान् to the demons, सह सीतया with Sita, भ्रातरौ brothers, तौ both, आचचक्षे spoke about.

20_2.shloka: ते रामं पर्णशालायामुपविष्टं महाबलम्।ददृशुस्सीतया सार्धं वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणेन च।3.20.2।।
20_2.translation: They saw mighty Rama together with Vaidehi and Lakshmana sitting in the leafthatched cottage.
20_2.word_by_word: ते they, वैदेह्याः with Vaidehi, सार्धम् together with, लक्ष्मणेन च and with Lakshmana, पर्णशालायाम् in the leafthatched cottage, उपविष्टम् seated, महाबलम् a man of great strength, रामम् Rama, ददृशुः saw.

20_3.shloka: तान्दृष्ट्वा राघवश्श्रीमानागतांस्तां च राक्षसीम्।अब्रवीद्भ्रातरं रामो लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसम्।।3.20.3।।
20_3.translation: Seeing the demons along with Surpanakha arrive, said the handsome Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty to his brother Lakshmana, who was blazing like fire :
20_3.word_by_word: श्रीमान् handsome, राघवः scion of the Raghu dynasty, रामः Rama, आगतान् those who arrived, तान् them, तां राक्षसीम्  to the demoness, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, दीप्ततेजसम्  blazing like fire, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

20_4.shloka: मुहूर्तं भव सौमित्रे सीतायाः प्रत्यनन्तरः।इमानस्या वधिष्यामि पदवीमागतानिह।।3.20.4।।
20_4.translation: O Lakshmana  stand by Sita for a while. I shall kill these demons who have come here.
20_4.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, मुहूर्तम् for a while, सीतायाः to Sita, प्रत्यनन्तरः stand by, भव you may be, अस्याः her, पदवीम् in the way, इह here, आगतान् those who came in, इमान् these to, वधिष्यामि will kill.

20_5.shloka: वाक्यमेतत्ततश्श्रुत्वा रामस्य विदितात्मनः।तथेति लक्ष्मणो वाक्यं रामस्य प्रत्यपूजयत्।।3.20.5।।
20_5.translation: Lakshmana heard him and in turn honoured the word of Rama, knower of the self.
20_5.word_by_word: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, विदितात्मनः knower of the self, रामस्य Rama's, एतत् this, वाक्यम् statement, श्रुत्वा after hearing, तथेति agreeing to, रामस्य  Rama's, वाक्यम् statement, प्रत्यपूजयत् in turn honoured.

20_6.shloka: राघवोऽपि महच्चापं चामीकरविभूषितम्।चकार सज्यं धर्मात्मा तानि रक्षांसि चाब्रवीत्।।3.20.6।।
20_6.translation: Righteous Rama too, lifted up his great bow decked with gold and fastened the string and then said to the demons:
20_6.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous man, राघवोऽपि Rama too, चामीकरविभूषितम् decked with gold, महत् great, चापम् bow, सज्यम् stringed, चकार made, तानि those, रक्षांसि to the demons, अब्रवीत् च said.

20_7.shloka: पुत्रौ दशरथस्यावां भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।प्रविष्टौ सीतया सार्धं दुश्चरं दण्डकावनम्।।3.20.7।।
20_7.translation: We, Rama and Lakshmana, sons of Dasaratha, are brothers, who have entered the inaccessible Dandaka forest along with Sita.
20_7.word_by_word: आवाम् we both are, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रौ two sons, भ्रातरौ two brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, सीतया सार्धम् along with Sita, दुश्चरम् inaccessible, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्ठौ both have entered.

20_8.shloka: फलमूलाशनौ दान्तौ तापसौ धर्मचारिणौ।वसन्तौ दण्डकारण्ये किमर्थमुपहिंसथ।।3.20.8।।
20_8.translation: Feeding on fruits and roots and following the righteous path, we are living in Dandaka forest like ascetics. Why are you torturing us?
20_8.word_by_word: फलमूलाशिनौ both survive on fruits and roots etc, दान्तौ both are selfrestrained, धर्मचारिणौ both follow the righteous path, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, वसन्तौ living, तापसौ ascetics, किमर्थम् why, उपहिंसथ torment.

20_9.shloka: युष्मान्पापात्मकान्हन्तुं विप्रकारान्महाहवे।ऋषीणां तु नियोगेन प्राप्तोऽहं सशरायुधः।।3.20.9।।
20_9.translation: I came here equipped with bows, arrows and weapons, asked by ascetics to kill in the battle sinners like you who are offending them.
20_9.word_by_word: अहम् I, पापात्मकान् sinners, विप्रकारान् offenders, युष्मान् you, आहवे in war, हन्तुम् to kill, सशरायुधः equipped with bows, arrows and weapons, ऋषीणाम् of ascetics, नियोगेन by their order, प्राप्तः came.

20_10.shloka: तिष्ठतैवात्र सन्तुष्टा नोपावर्तितुमर्हथ।यदि प्राणैरिहार्थो वा निवर्तध्वं निशाचराः।।3.20.10।।
20_10.translation: If you care for your life, you may return, or else, if you please you may remain (die) here, O demons.
20_10.word_by_word: सन्तुष्टाः satisfied, निशाचराः demons, अत्रैव here only, तिष्ठतः you may stay, उपावर्तितुम् to return, न अर्हथ you should not, यदि वा or else, प्राणैः with life, अर्थः purpose, निवर्तध्वम् you may return.

20_11.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षसास्ते चतुर्दश।ऊचुर्वाचं  सुसंक्रुद्धा ब्रह्मघ्नाश्शूलपाणयः।।3.20.11।।
20_11.translation: At these words, the destroyers of brahmins, the fourteen demons were inflamed. They lifted their spears and spoke:
20_11.word_by_word: तस्य his, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, ब्रह्मघ्नाः destroyers of brahmins, शूलपाणयः spears in hand, ते those, चतुर्दश राक्षसाः fourteen demons, सुसङ्क्रुद्धाः very angry, वाचम् words, ऊचुः spoke.

20_12.shloka: क्रोधमुत्पाद्य नो भर्तुः खरस्य सुमहात्मनः।त्वमेव हास्यसे प्राणानद्यास्माभिर्हतो युधि।।3.20.12।।
20_12.translation: You have incited the wrath of Khara, our great master for which you will now pay with your life in the fight.
20_12.word_by_word: नः our, भर्तुः lord's, सुमहात्मनः of great, खरस्य Khara's, क्रोधम् wrath, उत्पाद्य causing, अद्य now, अस्माभिः by us, युधि in the fight, हतः killed, त्वमेव you alone, प्राणान् life, हास्यसे will give up.

20_13.shloka: का हि ते शक्तिरेकस्य बहूनां रणमूर्धनी।अस्माकमग्रतः स्थातुं किं पुनर्योद्दुमाहवे।।3.20.13।।
20_13.translation: How can you face us alone? We outnumber you? Leave alone fighting, you cannot even stand in front of us.
20_13.word_by_word: बहूनाम् by many, अस्माकम् of us, अग्रतः in front of, रणमूर्धनि at the head of the battle, स्थातुम् to stand, एकस्य of  one, ते to you, का शक्तिः where is the power, आहवे in war, योद्धुम् to fight, किं पुनः why again.

20_14.shloka: एहि बाहुप्रयुक्तैर्नः परिघैश्शूलपट्टिसैः।प्राणांस्त्यक्षसि वीर्यं च धनुश्च करपीडितम्।।3.20.14।।
20_14.translation: Come on with daggers and sharpedged spears hurled, you will give up your life,your prowess as well as the bow held in your hand.
20_14.word_by_word: एहि come on, नः us, बाहुप्रयुक्तैः by those dicharged by our arms, परिघैः by daggers, शूलपट्टिशै spears with sharp, प्राणान् your life, वीर्यं च prowess, करपीडितम् held by hand, धनुश्च the bow aslo, त्यक्षसि will shun.

20_15.shloka: इत्येवमुक्त्वा सङ्कृद्धा राक्षसास्ते चतुर्दश।चिक्षिपुस्तानि शूलानि राघवं प्रति दुर्जयम्।।3.20.15।।
20_15.translation: Saying these words, the fourteen infuriated demons hurled their spears at invincible Rama.
20_15.word_by_word: सङ्कृद्धाः mighty angry, ते those , राक्षसाः demons, इत्येवम् thus, उक्त्वा after saying, तानि शूलानि those spears, दुर्जयम् invincible, राघवं प्रति on Rama, चिक्षिपुः hurled.

20_16.shloka: तानि शूलानि काकुत्स्थस्समस्तानि चतुर्दश।तावद्भिरेव चिच्छेद शरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः।।3.20.16।।
20_16.translation: All the fourteen spears hurled turned into splinters by the same number of golden arrows released by Rama.
20_16.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ Rama, चतुर्दश fourteen, तानि शूलानि their spears, समस्तानि all of them, तावद्भि: by equal number, एव only, काञ्चनभूषणैः decorated with gold, शरैः with arrows, चिच्छेद cut to pieces.

20_17.translation: Then the effulgent Rama, mighty angry, took fourteen arrows sharpened by stones and glowing like the  Sun.
20_17.word_by_word: ततः then, महातेजाः effulgent, परमक्रुद्धः  enraged, शिलाशितान् sharpened by stone, सूर्यसन्निभान् glowing like the Sun, चतुर्दश fourteen, नाराचान् arrows, जग्राह took.

20_18.shloka: गृहीत्वा धनुरायम्य लक्ष्यानुद्दिश्य राक्षसान्।मुमोच राघवो बाणान्वज्रानिव शतक्रतुः।।3.20.18।।
20_18.translation: Rama took the bow, stretched it and aimed at his target, the demons  and sent the arrows as Indra would release the thunderbolt.
20_18.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, धनुः bow, गृहीत्वा on taking, आयम्य after stretching, लक्ष्यान् the target, राक्षसान् the demons,  उद्दिश्य aiming at, शतक्रतुः like Indra, वज्रानिव like thunderbolt, बाणान् arrows, मुमोच released.

20_19.shloka: रुक्मपुङ्खाश्च विशिखा दीप्ता हेमविभूषिताः।ते भित्त्वा रक्षसां वेगाद्वक्षांसि रुधिराप्लुताः।3.20.19।।विनिष्पेतुस्तदा भूमौ न्यमज्जन्ताशनिस्वनाः।
20_19.translation: Goldfeathered blazing arrows decorated with gold, released by Rama flew fast and pierced the chests of the demons. Drenched in blood they (the arrows) thundered (out of their chests) and  plunged into the earth.
20_19.word_by_word: रुक्मपुङ्खाः feathered with gold, दीप्ताः blazing, हेमविभूषिताः decorated with gold, ते those, विशिखाः arrows, वेगात् speedily, रक्षसाम् the demons, वक्षांसि their chests, भित्त्वा piercing, रुधिराप्लुताः  drenched in blood, तदा then, विनिष्पेतुः fell down, अशनिस्वनाः creating sounds like thunder, भूमौ on earth, न्यमज्जन्त pierced into.

20_20.shloka: ते भिन्नहृदया भूमौ छिन्नमूला इव द्रुमाः।।3.20.20।।निपेतुश्शोणितार्द्राङ्गा विकृता विगतासवः।
20_20.translation: With their hearts split, their bodies drenched in blood, disfigured and lifeless, the demons fell down on earth like trees cut  at the roots.
20_20.word_by_word: ते they, भिन्नहृदयाः  with pierced hearts, शोणितार्द्राङ्गाः bodies drenched in blood, विकृताः disfigured, विगतासवः with their life gone, छिन्नमूलाः  cut at the roots, द्रुमाः इव like trees, भूमौ on earth, निपेतुः fell down.

20_21.shloka: तान् दृष्ट्वा पतितान्भूमौ राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता।।3.20.21।।परित्रस्ता पुनस्तत्र व्यसृजद्भैरवस्वनान्।
20_21.translation: Seeing the demons fallen on the ground, the demoness wild with anger and fear roared.
20_21.word_by_word: भूमौ on the ground, पतितान् fell down, तान् those, दृष्ट्वा seeing, राक्षसी the demoness,  (Surpanakha), क्रोधमूर्छिता  wild with anger, परित्रस्ता frightened, तत्र there, पुनः again, भैरवस्वनान् frihghtening sound, व्यसृजत् released.

20_22.shloka: उपगम्य खरं सा तु किञ्चित्संशुष्कशोणिता।।3.20.22।।पपात पुनरेवार्ता सनिर्यासेव सल्लकी।
20_22.translation: Her blood slightly dried up, she came back afflicted to Khara and fell down like a sallaki tree, its sap oozing.
20_22.word_by_word: किञ्चित् slightly, संशुष्कशोणिता blood dried up, सनिर्यासा juice exuded, सल्लकी इव like a sallaki tree, सा she, तु but, आर्ता afflicted, खरम् to Khara, उपगम्य coming, पुनरेव again, पपात fell down.

20_24.shloka: भ्रातुस्समीपे शोकार्ता ससर्ज निनदं मुहुः।।3.20.24।।सस्वरं मुमुचे बाष्पं विषण्णवदना तदा।
20_24.translation: Then desperately screaming and shedding tears with a sad face beside her brother, she roared again and again.
20_24.word_by_word: तदा then, शोकार्ता afflicted with tears, भ्रातुः of the brother, समीपे presence, मुहुः again and again, निनदम् sound, ससर्ज released, विषण्णवदना with a sad face, सस्वरम् making loud noise, बाष्पम् tears, मुमुचे shed.

20_25.shloka: निपातितान् दृश्य रणे तु राक्षसान् प्रधाविता शूर्पणखा पुनस्ततः।वधं च तेषां निखिलेन रक्षसां शशंस सर्वं भगिनी खरस्य सा।।3.20.25।।
20_25.translation: When Surpanakha saw the demons fall dead on the battleground, she ran to Khara,her brother and told in detail about the death of the demons.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
20_25.word_by_word: शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, रणे in the fight, निपातितान् fallen, राक्षसान् demons, दृश्य seeing, पुनः ततः then, प्रधाविता she ran, भगिनी sister, रक्षसाम् of demons, वधम् about the death, सर्वम् all, निखिलेन in detail, खरस्य to Khara, शशंस told.

21_1.shloka: [Khara pacifies Surpanakha -- Surpanakha provokes Khara against Rama.]स पुनः पतितां दृष्ट्वा क्रोधाच्छूर्पणखां खरः।उवाच व्यक्तया वाचा तामनर्थार्थमागताम्।।3.21.1।।
21_1.translation: Seeing Surpanakha collapse, Khara said in clear terms about the unfortunate situation she had created:
21_1.word_by_word: सः खरः Khara, पुनः again, पतिताम्  fallen down, शूर्पणखाम् Surpanakha, दृष्ट्वा saw, अनर्थार्थम् unfortunate situation, आगताम्  who came, ताम् her, व्यक्तया in a clear, वाचा words, क्रोधात् angrily, उवाच spoke.

21_2.shloka: मया त्विदानीं शूरास्ते राक्षसा रुधिराशनाः।त्वत्प्रियार्थं विनिर्दिष्टाः किमर्थं रुद्यते पुनः।।3.21.2।।
21_2.translation: The valiant demons who feed on blood have been commissioned for your pleasure. Why are you crying again?
21_2.word_by_word: मया myself, त्वत्प्रियार्थम् for your pleasure, इदानीम् just now, रुधिराशनाः  who feed on blood, शूराः heroes, ते राक्षसाः those demons, विनिर्दिष्टाः commissioned, पुनः again, किमर्थम् for what reason, रुद्यते  crying.

21_3.shloka: भक्ताश्चैवानुरक्ताश्च हिताश्च मम नित्यशः।हन्यमाना न हन्यन्ते न न कुर्युर्वचो मम।।3.21.3।।
21_3.translation: They are loyal and faithful to me. They are always my wellwishers. Even when attacked, they cannot be killed. They never fail to carry out my orders.
21_3.word_by_word: भक्ताश्चैव  devoted, अनुरक्ताश्च  fond of me, नित्यशः always, मम to me, हिताश्च wellwishers, हन्यमानाः while they are being attacked, न हन्यन्ते are not killed , मम my, वचः words, न न कुर्युः never fail to carry out my orders.

21_4.shloka: किमेतच्छ्रोतुमिच्छामि कारणं यत्कृते पुनः।हा नाथेति विनर्दन्ती सर्पवल्लुठसि क्षितौ।।3.21.4।।
21_4.translation: I wish to know what makes you lament and roll on the ground like a serpent and hissing?
21_4.word_by_word: यत्कृते for what reason, हा नाथ Ha Lord, इति saying like that, विनर्दन्ती lamenting, पुनः again, सर्पवत् like a serpent, क्षितौ on the ground, लुठसि you are rolling, एतत् this, कारणम् reason, किम् why, श्रोतुम् to hear, इच्छामि I wish.

21_5.shloka: अनाथवद्विलपसि नाथे तु मयि संस्थिते।उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ माभैषीर्वैक्लव्यं त्यज्यतामिह।।3.21.5।।
21_5.translation: When I am here like a lord to protect you, why do you weep like an orphan? Get up. Give up your anxiety. Be not afraid.
21_5.word_by_word: नाथे as lord, मयि me, संस्थिते is present, अनाथवत् like an orphan, विलपसि you are weeping, उत्तिष्ठ you get up, मा भैषीः do not fear, इह now, वैक्लब्यम् worry, त्यज्यताम् may be given up.

21_6.shloka: इत्येवमुक्ता दुर्धर्षा खरेण परिसान्त्विता।विमृज्य नयने सास्रे खरं भ्रातरमब्रवीत्।।3.21.6।।
21_6.translation: Thus consoled by Khara, invincible Surpanakha wiped her tearful eyes and said to her brother:
21_6.word_by_word: इत्येवम् thus, उक्ता addressed, खरेण by Khara, परिसान्त्विता pacified, दुर्दर्षा in invincible woman, सास्रे tearful, नयने eyes, विमृज्य wiping, भ्रातरम् to brother, खरम् to Khara, अब्रवीत् said.

21_7.shloka: अस्मीदानीमहं प्राप्ता हृतश्रवणनासिका।शोणितौघपरिक्लिन्ना त्वया च परिसान्त्विता।।3.21.7।।
21_7.translation: My ears and nose sliced off, drenched with blood, I came to you and you pacified me.
21_7.word_by_word: हृतश्रवणनासिका with ears and nose sliced off, अहम् I, शोणितौघपरिक्लिन्ना drenched with flow of blood, इदानीम् now, प्राप्ता अस्मि myself having come, त्वया by you, परिसान्त्विता pacified, च also.

21_8.shloka: प्रेषिताश्च त्वया वीर राक्षसास्ते चतुर्दश।निहन्तुं राघवं क्रोधान्मत्प्रियार्थं सलक्षणम्।।3.21.8।।
21_8.translation: O warrior  you had sent, out of anger, fourteen demons to put an end to Rama along with Lakshmana in order to please me.
21_8.word_by_word: वीर O hero, त्वया by you, क्रोधात् out of anger, मत्प्रियार्थम् to please me, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, निहन्तुम् to kill, ते those, चतुर्दश fourteen, राक्षसाः demons, प्रेषिताः were sent.

21_9.shloka: ते तु रामेण सामर्षाः शूलपट्टसपाणयः।समरे निहतास्सर्वे सायकैर्मर्मभेदिभिः।।3.21.9।।
