21_9.translation: The demons who went with spears in their hands were killed, their hearts pierced by  Rama's arrows.
21_9.word_by_word: सामर्षाः those spirited ones, शूलपट्टसपाणयः with spears in hands, ते those, सर्वे all, रामेण by Rama, मर्मभेदिभिः hearts pierced, सायकैः by arrows, निहताः killed.

21_10.shloka: तान्दृष्ट्वा पतितान्भूमौ क्षणेनैव महाबलान्।रामस्य च महत्कर्म महांस्त्रासोऽभवन्मम।।3.21.10।।
21_10.translation: Seeing the powerful demons collapse on the ground in a moment's time through Rama's action, I was frightened.
21_10.word_by_word: क्षणेनैव in moments, भूमौ on earth, पतितान् fallen down, महाबलान् mighty ones, तान् them, रामस्य Rama's, महत् great, कर्म च action, दृष्ट्वा seeing, मम to me, महान् powerful, त्रासः fear, अभवत् befell.

21_11.shloka: अहमस्मि समुद्विग्ना विषण्णा च निशाचर।शरणं त्वां पुनः प्राप्ता सर्वतोभयदर्शिनी।।3.21.11।।
21_11.translation: O demon  I am scared and sad. To me everything looks frightening. I, therefore, seek refuge in you.
21_11.word_by_word: निशाचर O demon , अहम् I, समुद्विग्ना scared, विषण्णा sad, च and, अस्मि am, सर्वतः all over, भयदर्शिनी  fear in sight, पुनः again, त्वाम् your, शरणं प्राप्ता sought refuge in you.

21_12.shloka: विषादनक्राध्युषिते परित्रासोर्मिमालिनि।किं मां न त्रायसे मग्नां विपुले शोकसागरे।।3.21.12।।
21_12.translation: I am drowned in a vast sea of sorrow where crocodiles in the form of distress reside. It is full of rows of waves of fright. Why do you not save me?
21_12.word_by_word: विषादनक्राध्युषिते  by crocodiles of distress, परित्रासोर्मिमालिनि filled with rows of waves of fright, विपुले  vast , शोकसागरे  in sea of sorrow, मग्नाम् drowned, माम् me, किम् why, न त्रायसे you do not save?

21_13.shloka: एते च निहता भूमौ रामेण निशितैः शरैः।येऽपि मे पदवीं प्राप्ता राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।।3.21.13।।
21_13.translation: The demons who live on flesh, who came following me fell down on earth and lay dead,  shot by the sharp arrows of Rama.
21_13.word_by_word: पिशिताशनाः  carnivorous, ये those, राक्षसाः demons, मे my, पदवीम् path, प्राप्ता came, एते च these, रामेण by Rama, भूमौ on the earth, निशितैः by sharp, शरैः arrows, निहताः were killed.

21_14.shloka: मयि ते यद्यनुक्रोशो यदि रक्षस्सु तेषु च।रामेण यदि ते शक्तिस्तेजो वास्ति निशाचर।3.21.14।।दण्डकारण्यनिलयं जहि राक्षसकण्टकम्।
21_14.translation: O demon  if you have compassion for me or for the demons, if you have the power and energy to face Rama, kill the enemy of the demons living in Dandaka forest.
21_14.word_by_word: निशाचर O nightranger, ते yours, मयि in me, तेषु among them, रक्षस्सु च on demons, अनुक्रोशः have compassion, अस्ति यदि if you have, ते to you, रामेण equal to Rama, शक्तिः power, तेजो वा or brilliance, अस्ति यदि if you have, दण्डकारण्यनिलयम् living inDandaka forest, राक्षसकण्टकम् enemy of demons, जहि kill.

21_15.shloka: यदि रामं ममामित्रं न त्वमद्यवधिष्यसि।।3.21.15।।तवैव चाग्रतः प्राणांस्त्यक्षामि निरपत्रप।
21_15.translation: If now you do not kill that Rama, my enemy, O shameless one, I will give up my life in your very presence.
21_15.word_by_word: मम my, अमित्रम् enemy, रामम् that Rama, त्वम् you, अद्य now, न वधिष्यसि यदि if you do not kill, निरपत्रप O shameless one, तव your, अग्रतः presence, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यामि will give up.

21_16.shloka: बुद्ध्याहमनुपश्यामि न त्वं रामस्य संयुगे।।3.21.16।।स्थातुं प्रतिमुखे शक्तस्सबलश्च महात्मनः।
21_16.translation: Instinctively I can foresee that you and your army do not have the capability to encounter that great Rama in a fight.
21_16.word_by_word: त्वम् you, सबलश्च with your army too, संयुगे in an encounter, महात्मनः of the great man, रामस्य Rama's, प्रतिमुखे face to face, स्थातुम् to stand, न शक्तः you are not capable, अहम् I, बुद्ध्या through my intellect, अनुपश्यामि I can foresee.

21_17.shloka: शूरमानी न शूरस्त्वं मिथ्यारोपितविक्रमः।।3.21.17।।मानुषौ यो न शक्नोषि हन्तुं तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।
21_17.translation: You call yourself a hero, yet are not able to kill two humans like Rama and Lakshmana. Your claim to heroism is false. You are not a hero at all.
21_17.word_by_word: यः who, मानुषौ two humans, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ those Rama and Lakshmana, हन्तुम् to kill, न शक्नोषि you are not able to, त्वम् you, शूरमानी calling yourself a hero, नशूरः त्वम् you are not a hero, मिथ्यारोपितविक्रमः your claim to be a hero is false.

21_18.shloka: रामेण यदि ते शक्तिस्तेजो वास्ति निशाचर।।3.21.18।।दण्डकारण्यनिलयं जहि तं कुलपांसन।
21_18.translation: O demon  you are a disgrace to the family. If you have power or energy, kill that Rama dwelling in Dandaka forest.
21_18.word_by_word: कुलपांसन a disgrace to the family, निशाचर O demon , रामेण by Rama, ते your, शक्तिः power, तेजो वा or brilliance, अस्ति यदि if it is, दण्डकारण्यनिलयम् dwelling in Dandaka forest, तम् him, जहि kill.

21_19.translation: You have little strength and less heroism. You with your relations should immediately leave Janasthana. What kind of position do you have here?
21_19.word_by_word: निस्सत्वस्य of a man who has no strength, अल्पवीर्यस्य of less valiant one, ते your, इह here, वास: stay, कीदृशः what kind of, सहबान्धव: with your relations, त्वरितः quickly, जनस्थानात् from this Janasthana, अपयाहि go away.

21_20.shloka: रामतेजोभिभूतो हि त्वं क्षिप्रं विनशिष्यसि।3.21.20।।स हि तेजस्समायुक्तो रामो दशरथात्मजः।भ्राता चास्य महावीर्यो येन चास्मि विरूपिता।।3.21.21।।
21_20.translation: Let down by the brilliance of Rama, son of Dasaratha, you will be soon destroyed. He is mighty and his brother who has disfigured me is very valiant.
21_20.word_by_word: त्वं you, रामतेजोभिभूतः let down by the brilliance of Rama, क्षिप्रं swiftly, हि indeed, विनशिष्यसि you will be surely destroyed, सः he, हि दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, तेजस्समायुक्तः endowed with brilliance, येन by whom, विरूपिता अस्मि I am disfigured, अस्य भ्राता च and his brother, महावीर्यः a very valiant man.

21_21.shloka: एवं विलप्य बहुशो राक्षसी विततोदरी।कराभ्यामुदरं हत्वा रुरोद भृशदुःखिता।।3.21.22।।
21_21.translation: Overcome by sorrow, the bigbellied demoness cried  in several ways and being very sad started beating her chest with both hands.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
21_21.word_by_word: विततोदरी  big bellied woman, राक्षसी demoness i, बहुशः in several ways, एवम् in that manner, विलप्य  weeping, भृशदुःखिता very sad, कराभ्याम् with both her hands, उदरम् belly (here, chest), हत्वा beating, रुरोद cried.

22_1.shloka: [Khara gets his brother Dusana and the army ready to fight Rama -- proceeds with  fourteen thousand demons.]एवमाधर्षितश्शूरश्शूर्पणख्या खरस्ततः।उवाच रक्षसां मध्ये खरः खरतरं वचः।।3.22.1।।
22_1.translation: Ashamed and accused thus in the presence of the demons, the valiant Khara spoke to Surpanakha in harsh words:
22_1.word_by_word: ततः then, शूर्पणख्या by Surpanakha, एवम् in that way, रक्षसाम् of demons, मध्ये in the midst, आधर्षितः put to shame, शूरः hero, खरः Khara, खरतरम् harsher, वचः words, उवाच spoke.

22_2.shloka: तवावमानप्रभवः क्रोधोऽयमतुलो मम।न शक्यते धारयितुं लवणाम्भ इवोल्बणम्।।3.22.2।।
22_2.translation: Like the overslowing salt sea water, I am unable to contain this my excessive anger arising out of your insult.
22_2.word_by_word: तव your, अवमानप्रभवः arising out of insult, मम mine, अतुलः incomparable, अयं क्रोधः this anger, उल्बणम् excessive, लवणाम्भः salt water, इव like, धारयितुम् to bear, न शक्यते is not possible for me.

22_3.shloka: न रामं गणये वीर्यान्मानुषं क्षीणजीवितम्।आत्मदुश्चरितैः प्राणान्हतोयोऽद्य विमोक्ष्यते।।3.22.3।।
22_3.translation: Rama is a shortlived human. I do not care for his valour. His life span will be shortened (he will be killed) now for his own misdeeds.
22_3.word_by_word: मानुषम् human being, क्षीणजीवितम् shortlived, रामम् Rama, वीर्यात् due to valour, न गणये I do not count, यः he who has, आत्मदुश्चरितैः by his own bad conduct, हतः be killed, अद्य now, प्राणान् life, विमोक्ष्यते will leave.

22_4.shloka: बाष्पस्संह्रियतामेष सम्भ्रमश्च विमुच्यताम्।अहं रामं सह भ्रात्रा नयामि यमसादनम्।।3.22.4।।
22_4.translation: Restrain your tears and your anxieties I will send Rama along with his brother to the abode of Yama.
22_4.word_by_word: एषः this, बाष्पः tears, संह्रियाताम् may be controlled, सम्भ्रमश्च anxiety also, विमुच्यताम् give up, अहम् I, रामम् Rama, भ्रात्रा सह along with his brother, यमसादनम् to the abode of Yama, नयामि l will send.

22_5.shloka: परश्वथहतस्याद्य मन्दप्राणस्य संयुगे।रामस्य रुधिरं रक्तमुष्णं पास्यसि राक्षसि।।3.22.5।।
22_5.translation: With his life ebbing out, killed by my axe in the fight, you will drink today, O demoness, Rama's red, hot blood.
22_5.word_by_word: राक्षसि O demoness, अद्य now, संयुगे in the fight, परश्वथहतस्य of one killed by an axe, मन्दप्राणस्य whose life has gone slow, रामस्य Rama's, रक्तम् red, उष्णम् hot, रुधिरम् blood, पास्यसि you can drink.

22_6.shloka: सा प्रहृष्टा वचश्श्रुत्वा खरस्य वदनाच्च्युतम्।प्रशशंस पुनर्मौर्ख्याद्भ्रातरं रक्षसां वरम्।।3.22.6।।
22_6.translation: On hearing the words that came out of Khara's mouth, she was pleased. And in stupidity began praising her brother once again as the best of demons.
22_6.word_by_word: सा she, खरस्य Khara's, वदनात् from the mouth, च्युतम् that came out, वचः the words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, प्रहृष्टा she was pleased, मौर्ख्यात् due to stupidity, भ्रातरम् to the brother, रक्षसाम् among demons, वरम् great, पुनः again, प्रशशंस she praised.

22_7.shloka: तया परुषितः पूर्वं पुनरेव प्रशंसितः।अब्रवीद्दूषणं नाम खरस्सेनापतिं तदा।।3.22.7।।
22_7.translation: Khara, accused by her earlier and admired again, said to Dusana, chief of army:
22_7.word_by_word: तया by her, पूर्वम् earlier, परुषितः been acused, पुनरेव again, प्रशंसितः was praised, खरः Khara, तदा then, दूषणं नाम Dooshana by name, सेनापतिम् army chief, अब्रवीत् said.

22_8.shloka: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि मम चित्तानुवर्तिनाम्।रक्षसां भीमवेगानां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम्।।3.22.8।।
22_8.translation: There are fourteen thousand demons at my command ready to act according to my will. They are warriors of terrific speed and will not retreat from the fight.
22_8.word_by_word: मम my, चित्तानुवर्तिनाम् acting according to will, भीमवेगानाम् of terrific speed, समरेषु in war, अनिवर्तिनाम् never turn back, रक्षसाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand.

22_9.translation: They are of the colour of the dark blue cloud, dreadful and merciless, strong and powerful fighters who roam about forturing people.
22_9.word_by_word: नीलजीमूतवर्णानाम् of the colour of the dark blue cloud, घोराणां of dreadful, कृ़रकर्मणाम् those who commit cruel acts लोकहिंसाविहाराणां those who roam about torturing people, बलिनाम् of the strong, उग्रतेजसाम् very powerful people.

22_10.shloka: तेषां शार्दूलदर्पाणां महास्यानां महौजसाम्।सर्वोद्योग मुदीर्णानां रक्षसां सौम्य कारय।।3.22.10।।
22_10.translation: O handsome one, get them all, powerful like tigers, demons with large countenances, mighty and arragant, ready (for the fight).
22_10.word_by_word: सौम्यः handsome, शार्दूलदर्पाणां powerful like tigers, महास्यानां having large countenances, महौजसाम् mighty, उदीर्णानाम् of the arrogant, तेषां of all such, रक्षसां demons, सर्वोद्योगं कारय get ready.

22_11.shloka: उपस्थापय मे क्षिप्रं रथं सौम्य धनूंषि च।शरांश्चित्रांश्च खङ्गांश्च शक्तीश्च विविधाश्शिताः।।3.22.11।।
22_11.translation: O goodnatured one, get my chariot, bows and arrows, wonderful swords of different kinds and sharp missiles ready quickly.
22_11.word_by_word: सौम्य O good natured one, मे my, रथम् chariot, धनूंषि च bows too, शरान् arrows, चित्रान् wonderful, खङ्गांश्च swords, विविधाः of different kinds, शिताः sharp, शक्तीश्च missiles, क्षिप्रम् quickly, उपस्थापय get them ready.

22_12.shloka: अग्रे निर्यातुमिच्छामि पौलस्त्यानां महात्मनाम्।वधार्थं दुर्विनीतस्य रामस्य रणकोविदः।।3.22.12।।
22_12.translation: O expert in warfare, I wish to lead those great warriors of Paulasthya family, to kill that immodest Rama.
22_12.word_by_word: रणकोविदः expert in warfare, दुर्विनीतस्य of the immodest, रामस्य Rama's, वधार्थम् to kill, महात्मनाम् great self, पौलस्त्यानाम् those of Paulasthya family, अग्रे in front, निर्यातुम् to go, इच्छामि I desire.

22_13.shloka: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य सूर्यवर्णं महारथम्।सदश्वैश्शबलैर्युक्तमाचचक्षेऽथ दूषणः।।3.22.13।।
22_13.translation: While Khara was speaking thus, Dusana reported that a huge chariot of the colour of the Sun yoked with good horses of variegated hues stood ready.
22_13.word_by_word: तस्य his (Khara's), इति this, ब्रुवाणस्य while (Khara was) telling, अथ at that time, दूषणःDusana, सूर्यवर्णम् colour of the Sun, महारथम् huge chariot, शबलैः variegated colours, सदश्वैः good horses, युक्तम् fit, आचचक्षे indicated.

22_14.shloka: तं मेरुशिखराकारं तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणम्।हेमचक्रमसम्बाधं वैदूर्यमयकूबरम्।।3.22.14।।मत्स्यैः पुष्पैर्द्रुमैश्शैलैश्चन्द्रसूर्यैश्च काञ्चनैः।मङ्गलैः पक्षिसङ्घैश्च ताराभिरभिसंवृतम्।।3.22.15।।ध्वजनिस्त्रिंशसम्पन्नं किङ्किणीकविराजितम्।सदश्वयुक्तं सोऽमर्षादारुरोह खरो रथम्।।3.22.16।।
22_14.translation: Then the impatient Khara mounted the chariot that looked like the peak of mount Meru. It was decorated with pure gold, had golden wheels, poles studded with vaidurya. The carriage of the chariot was engraved with golden figures of fishes, flowers, trees, the Sun, stars, flocks of auspicious birds, flags and swords. Shining with small bells, it was yoked to fine horses.
22_14.word_by_word: सः खरः that Khara, मेरुशिखराकारम् looking like the peak of the mount Meru, तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणम् decorated with best of gold, हेमचक्रम् having golden wheels, असम्बाधम् wellbuilt, वैदूर्यमयकूबरम् carriage pole studded with vaiduryas, काञ्चनैः gold, मत्स्यैः with fishes, पुष्पैः with flowers, द्रुमैः trees, शैलैः mountains, सूर्यैश्च Sun, मङ्गलैः with auspicious ones, पक्षिसङ्घैश्च flocks of birds, ताराभिः with stars, अभिसंवृतम् all surrounded by, ध्वजनिस्त्रिंशसम्पन्नम् equipped with flags and swords, किङ्किणीकविराजितम् with small bells, सदश्वयुक्तम् yoked to fine horses, रथम् chariot, अमर्षात् with impatience, अरुरोह  mounted.

22_15.shloka: निशाम्य तु रथस्थं तं राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः।तस्थुस्संपरिवार्यैनं दूषणं च महाबलम्।।3.22.17।।
22_15.translation: The demons of terrific prowess surounded Khara and Dusana and stood by, when they saw both of them mounting the chariot.
22_15.word_by_word: भीमविक्रमाः warriors of terrific prowess, राक्षसाः demons, रथस्थम् seated on the chariot, तम् him, निशाम्य seeing, एनम् him, महाबलम् very strong one, दूषणं च Dusana too, सम्परिवार्य after surrounding, तस्थुः stood by.

22_16.translation: Khara mounted the chariot, saw the demons holding great weapons, wearing dreadful shields and holding flags, and ordered them to march.
22_16.word_by_word: रथस्थः from the chariot, खरस्तु Khara on his part, महेष्वासान् those holding great weapons, घोरवर्मायुधध्वजान् those wearing dreadful shields, bearing weapons and holding flags, तान् सर्वराक्षसान् all the demons, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, निर्यात march on, इति thus, अब्रवीत् ordered.

22_17.shloka: ततस्तद् राक्षसं सैन्यं घोरचर्मायुधध्वजम्।निर्जगाम जनस्थानान्महानादं महाजवम्।।3.22.19।।
22_17.translation: Then the army of the demons wearing dreadful shields, holding weapons and flags, and making a loud noise started in great speed from Janasthanam.
22_17.word_by_word: ततः then, घोरवर्मायुधध्वजम् wearing dreadful shields, holding weapons and banners, तत् that, राक्षसं सैन्यम् army of demons, महानादम् a loud noise, महाजवम् in great speed, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, निर्जगाम started.

22_18.shloka: मुद्गरैः पट्टिसैश्शूलैस्सुतीक्ष्णैश्च परश्वधैः।खङ्गैश्चक्रैश्च हस्तस्थैर्भ्राजमानैश्च तोमरैः।।3.22.20।।शक्तिभिः परिघैर्घोरैरतिमात्रैश्च कार्मुकैः।गदासिमुसलैर्वज्रैर्गृहीतैर्भीमदर्शनैः।।3.22.21।।राक्षसानां सुघोराणां सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।निर्यातानि जनस्थानात्खरचित्तानुवर्तिनाम्।।3.22.22।।
22_18.translation: The fourteen thousand demons loyal to the wishes of Khara, took in their hands, maces, piercing weapons, spears, sharp axes used in battle, swords, wheels, splinters, iron clubs, powerful missiles, dreadful iron bars of giant size, bows made of bamboo, clubs and frightening weapons like thunderbolt (of Indra) and  departed from Janasthana.
22_18.word_by_word: गृहीतैः took, हस्तस्थैः by those held in the hand, मुद्गरैः maces, पट्टिसैः piercing  weapons, शूलैः spears, सुतीक्ष्णैः sharp, परश्वधैः axes used in battle, खङ्गै swords, चक्रैश्च wheels, भ्राजमानैः shining splinters, तोमरैः iron clubs, शक्तिभिः powerful missiles, घोरैः dreadful, परिघैः iron bars, अतिमात्रैः of giant size, कार्मुकैः bows made of bamboo, गदासिमुसलैः pounding pestles, भीमदर्शनैः frightening to look at, वज्रैः weapons like thunderbolt, खरचित्तानुवर्तिनाम् of those acting according to the wishes of Khara, सुघोराणाम् very fierce, राक्षसानाम् of demons, चतुर्दय सहस्राणि fourteen thousand, जनन्थानात् from Janasthana, निर्यातानि departed.

22_19.shloka: तांस्त्वभिद्रवतो दृष्ट्वा राक्षसान् भीमविक्रमान्।खरस्यापि रथः किञ्चिज्जगाम तदनन्तरम्।।3.22.23।।
22_19.translation: Khara's chariot moved a bit behind the army of demons of frightening prowess who rushed forward to attack (Rama).
22_19.word_by_word: अभिद्रवतः going speedily to attack, भीमविक्रमान् of frightening prowess, तान् राक्षसान् those demons, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, किञ्चित् a little, तदनन्तरम् behind, खरस्य Khara's, रथः chariot, अपि too, जगाम went.

22_20.translation: Knowing the mind of Khara, the charioteer hastened the horses of the colourful  chariot decorated with pure gold.
22_20.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सारथिः charioteer, तप्तकाञ्चनभूषितान् decorated with pure gold, शबलान्  colourful, तान् them, अश्वान् horses, खरस्य of Khara's, मतिम् mind, आज्ञाय knowing, समचोदयत् hastened.

22_21.shloka: स चोदितो रथश्शीघ्रं खरस्य रिपुघातिनः।शब्देनापूरयामास दिशश्च प्रदिशस्तदा।।3.22.25।।
22_21.translation: Spurred by the charioteer, the chariot of Khara, the slayer of enemies, produced a rattle that filled all four quarters and the intermediate directions.
22_21.word_by_word: तदा then, रिपुघातिनः killers of enemy, खरस्य Khara's, शीघ्रम् speedily, चोदितः spurred, सः रथः that chariot, दिशश्च the four directions, प्रदिशश्च intermediate directions, शब्देन by the sound, आपूरयामास filled.

22_22.shloka: प्रवृद्धमन्युस्तु खरः खरस्वनो रिपोर्वधार्थं त्वरितो यथान्तकः।अचूचुदत्सारथिमुन्नदन्घनं महाबलो मेघ इवाश्मवर्षवान्।।3.22.26।।
22_22.translation: Khara in extreme anger hastened, like Yama, to slay his enemy. He roared loudly like a cloud raining hail stones and impelled his charioteer to speed up.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वालल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
22_22.word_by_word: प्रवृद्धमन्युः whose anger increased, खरस्वनः with harsh tone, खरः Khara, रिपोः enemy's, वधार्थम् to kill, त्वरितः at quick pace, अन्तकः यथा like Yama, the god of death, अश्मवर्षवान् like hail stones, महाबलः powerful, मेघः इव like the cloud, घनम् heavy, उन्नदन् सारथिम् roaring charioteer, अचूचुदत् impelled him to drive.

23_1.shloka: [Khara  sees dreadful omens.]तस्मिन्याते बले घोरमशिवं शोणितोदकम्।अभ्यवर्षन्महामेघस्तुमुलो गर्दभारुणः।।3.23.1।।
23_1.translation: As the army marched from there (Janasthana) a huge dark cloud of the colour of an ass rained dreadful inauspicious water, red as blood.
23_1.word_by_word: गर्दभारुणः dark like the colour of an ass, तुमुलः fierce, महामेघः huge cloud, तस्मिन् that army, याते marched, तत् there, घोरम् dreadful, बलम् army, अशिवम् inauspicious, शोणितोदकम् water red as blood, अभ्यवर्षत् rained.

23_2.shloka: निपेतुस्तुरगास्तस्य रथयुक्ता महाजवाः।समे पुष्पचिते देशे राजमार्गे यदृच्छया।।3.23.2।।
23_2.translation: The swift horses yoked to the chariot stumbled casually while galloping on the plane highway sprinkled with flowers.
23_2.word_by_word: रथयुक्ताः yoked to the chariot, महाजवाः of high speed, तस्य his, तुरगाः horses, राजमार्गे on the highway, पुष्पचिते समे sprinkled with flowers evenly, देशे place, यदृच्छया casually, निपेतुः stumbled.

23_3.shloka: श्यामं रुधिरपर्यन्तं बभूव परिवेषणम्।अलातचक्रप्रतिमं परिगृह्य दिवाकरम्।।3.23.3।।
23_3.translation: A dark ring, bloodred in colour appeared on the border of the Sun's orb, dark in themiddle. This phenomenon of the Sun appeared like a ring of moving charcoal covering the Sun.
23_3.word_by_word: दिवाकरम् Sun, परिगृह्य took position, श्यामम् dark, रुधिरपर्यन्तम् red in the periphery, अलातचक्रप्रतिमम् moving firebrand creating a ring, परिवेषणम् surrounding, बभूव appeared,

23_4.shloka: ततो ध्वजमुपागम्य हेमदण्डं समुच्छ्रितम्।समाक्रम्य महाकायस्तस्थौ गृध्रस्सुदारुणः।।3.23.4।।
23_4.translation: A huge vulture, frightening to look at flew up and sat on top of the flag on the staff of gold.
23_4.word_by_word: ततः then, महाकायः huge, सुदारुणः frightening, गृध्रः vulture, समुच्छ्रितम् erected, ध्वजम् flag, उपागम्य flying up, हेमदण्डम् golden staff, समाक्रम्य after occupying, तस्थौ sat.

23_5.translation: Flesheating beasts and birds flocked at Janasthana producing a cacophony.
23_5.word_by_word: खरस्वनाः of harsh voice, मांसादाः flesheating, मृगपक्षिणः beasts and birds, जनस्थानसमीपे near Janasthana, समागम्य flocking, विविधान् different kinds of, विस्वरान् hoarse voice, चक्रुः created.

23_6.shloka: व्याजह्रुश्च प्रदीप्तायां दिशि वै भैरवस्वनम्।अशिवं यातुधानानां शिवा घोरा महास्वनाः।।3.23.6।।
23_6.translation: The dreadful jackals making ghastly howls turning towards the illuminated direction and produced frightening sounds indicating inauspicious time for the demons.
23_6.word_by_word: घोराः frightful, महास्वनाः ghastly howls, शिवाः jackals, प्रदीप्तायाम् in the illuminated, दिशि direction, भैरवस्वनम् terrible sound, यातुधानानाम् of demons, अशिवम् inauspicious, व्याजह्रुः indicated.

23_7.translation: The clouds looked like shattered mountains pouring down bloodlike rain which filled the sky and made it appear frighteningly different.
23_7.word_by_word: प्रभिन्नगिरिसङ्काशाः those looking like shattered mountains, तोयशोणितधारिणः clouds bearing bloodlike water, भीमाः most frightening, वलाहकाः clouds, तत् that, आकाशम् sky, अनाकाशम् other than the sky, चक्रुः rendered.

23_8.shloka: बभूव तिमिरं घोरमुद्धतं रोमहर्षणम्।दिशो वा विदिशो वापि न च व्यक्तं चकाशिरे।।3.23.8।।
23_8.translation: A terrific darkness, spread all over, produced frightening horripilation. Even the four quarters and the intermediary zones were not discernible.
23_8.word_by_word: घोरम् terrible, उद्धतम् arose, रोमहर्षणम् horripilation, तिमिरम् darkness, बभूव became, दिशो वा  whether quarters, विदिशो वापि or the intermediary, व्यक्तम् clearly, न चकाशिरे did not shine.

23_9.shloka: क्षतजार्द्रसवर्णाभा सन्ध्याकालं विना बभौ।खरस्याभिमुखा नेदुस्तदा घोरमृगाः खगाः।।3.23.9।।कङ्कगोमायुगृध्राश्च चुक्रुशुर्भयशंसिनः।
23_9.translation: Even before Sunset the twilight looked like a fresh wound. Then wild animals, birds, kankas, jackals and vultures facing towards Khara screeched, indicating danger.
23_9.word_by_word: कालं विना before Sunset, क्षतजार्द्रसवर्णाभा glow like a fresh wound, सन्ध्या twilight, बभौ appeared, तदा then, घोरमृगाः dreadful animals, खगाः birds, खरस्य of Khara, अभिमुखाः directed towards, नेदुः produced sounds, कङ्कगोमायुगृध्राश्च kanka birds, jackals, and vultures, भयशंसिनः indicating danger, चक्रुशुः screeched.

23_10.translation: Bad omens that always bring inauspiciousness were a dreadful evidence of what is going to happen. Jackals howled, facing Khara's army with their mouths emitting fire.
23_10.word_by_word: युद्धे in war, नित्याशुभकराः always ominous, घोरनिदर्शनाः dreadful premonitions, शिवाः jackals, ज्वालोद्गारिभिः as if emitting fire, आननैः with their faces, बलस्य of the army, अभिमुखम् facing towards, नेदुः produced sounds.

23_11.shloka: कबन्धः परिघाभासो दृश्यते भास्करान्तिके।।3.23.11।।जग्राह सूर्यं स्वर्भानुरपर्वणि महाग्रहः।प्रवाति मारुतश्शीघ्रं निष्प्रभोऽभूद्दिवाकरः।।3.23.12।।
23_11.translation: The planet Ketu appeared  like an iron beam near the Sun. Although it was not the fullmoon or newmoon day, Rahu eclipsed the Sun. Wind blew hard and the Sun was lustreless.
23_11.word_by_word: भास्करान्तिके close to the Sun, परिघाभासः appearing like an iron beam, कबन्ध: Ketu, दृश्यते  seen, महाग्रहः a great planet, स्वर्भानुः Rahu, अपर्वणि  other than the new Moon, सूर्यम् Sun, जग्राह  eclipsed, मारुतः wind, शीघ्रम् swiftly, प्रवाति blew, दिवाकरः Sun, निष्प्रभः without lustre, अभूत् appeared.

23_12.shloka: उत्पेतुश्च विना रात्रिं ताराः खद्योतसप्रभाः।संलीनमीनविहगा नलिन्यश्शुष्कपङ्कजाः।।3.23.13।।तस्मिन् क्षणे बभूवुश्च विना पुष्पफलैर्द्रुमाः।
23_12.translation: The stars rose in the sky and glittered like fireflies even before night arrived. The fishes and the aquatic birds in the lotusponds hid themselves under water.  Lotuses dried up in tanks and the trees stood bereft of flowers and fruits.
23_12.word_by_word: खद्योतसम्प्रभाः glittering like fireflies, ताराः stars, विना without, रात्रिम् night, उत्पेतुः rose, संलीनमीनविहगाः fishes and birds disappear, नलिन्यः lotusponds, शुष्कपङ्कजाः have dried up lotuses, तस्मिन् in that, क्षणे moment, द्रुमाः trees, पुष्पफलैः flowers and fruits, विना without, बभूवुश्च became.

23_13.shloka: उद्धूतश्च विना वातं रेणुर्जलधरारुणः।।3.23.14।।वीचीकूचीति वाश्यन्त्यो बभूवुस्तत्र शारिकाः।
23_13.translation: Although there was no wind, dust rose like a brown cloud and the sarika birds sang (vichi kuchi) thoughtlessly.
23_13.word_by_word: विना वातम् without wind, जलधरारुणः like a brownish cloud, रेणुः dust, उद्धूतः rose up, तत्र there, शारिकाः sarika bird, वीचीकूचीति thoughtlessly, वाश्यन्त्यः singing, बभूवुः been.

23_14.shloka: उल्काश्चापि सनिर्घाता निपेतुर्घोरदर्शनाः।।3.23.15।।प्रचचाल मही सर्वा सशैलवनकानना।
23_14.translation: Dreadful to watch were the thunderstorms and the meteors that dropped down from the sky. The earth trembled all over with mountains, groves and forests.
23_14.word_by_word: घोरदर्शनाः dreadful in appearance, सनिर्घाताः thunderstorms, उल्काश्चापि meteors, निपेतुः dropped down, सशैलवनकानना mountains, groves and forests, सर्वाः all, मही earth, प्रचचाल trembled.

23_15.shloka: खरस्य च रथस्थस्य नर्दमानस्य धीमतः।।3.23.16।।प्राकम्पत भुजस्सव्यस्स्वरश्चास्यावसज्जत।
23_15.translation: While the intelligent and courageous Khara was seated on the chariot and shouting,his left shoulder shook violently and throat throttled.
23_15.word_by_word: रथस्थस्य stationed on the chariot, नर्दमानस्य  shouting, धीमतः intelligent , खरस्य of Khara, सव्यः left, भुजः shoulder, प्राकम्पत shook violently, अस्य his, स्वरश्च throat also, अवसज्जत throttled.

23_16.shloka: सास्रा सम्पद्यते दृष्टिः पश्यमानस्य सर्वतः।।3.23.17।।ललाटे च रुजा जाता न च मोहान्यवर्तत।
23_16.translation: While watching all this, his eyes brimmed with tears. His forehead ached. Yet he was too deluded to beat a retreat.
23_16.word_by_word: सर्वतः around, पश्यमानस्य while watching, दृष्टिः sight, सास्रा filled with tears, सम्पद्यते became, ललाटे on the forehead, रुजा च  uneasiness, जाता had developed, मोहात् due to delusion, न not, च न्यवर्तत did not retreat.

23_17.translation: Looking at these dreadful, horripilating occurrences Khara laughed and said to the demons:
23_17.word_by_word: सः खरः that Khara, तदा then, उत्थितान् occurring, रोमहर्षणान् horripilation, तान् those, महोत्पातान् most dreadful phenomena, समीक्ष्य after watching, प्रहसन् while laughing, सर्वान् all, राक्षसान् demous, अब्रवीत् said.

23_18.translation: Valiant and strong, I do not take seriously these terrifying omens boding calamity  just as a strong man does not care for the weak.
23_18.word_by_word: उत्थितान् produced, घोरदर्शनान् those terrific to see, इमान् these, महोत्पातान् the events boding calamity, सर्वान् all, अहम् I, वीर्यात् due to valour, बलवान् strong, दुर्बलानिव as he deals with the weak, न चिन्तयामि I do not take them seriously.

23_19.shloka: तारा अपि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैः पातयामि नभस्स्थलात्।।3.23.20।।मृत्युं मरणधर्मेण सङ्क्रुद्धो योजयाम्यहम्।
23_19.translation: With my sharp arrows I can even bring down the stars from the sky. If angered, I can cause mortality to the god of death.
23_19.word_by_word: अहम् I, ताराः stars, अपि even, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः by arrows, नभस्स्थलात् from the sky, पातयामि I will dislodge, सङ्क्रुद्धः if angered, मृत्युम् god of death, मरणधर्मेण mortal nature, योजयामि  will cause.

23_20.shloka: राघवं तं बलोत्सिक्तं भ्रातरं चास्य लक्ष्मणम्।।3.23.21।।अहत्वा सायकैस्तीक्ष्णैर्नोपावर्तितुमुत्सहे।
23_20.translation: I do not wish to return, without killing with my sharp arrows that Rama who is proud of his strength and his brother Lakshmana.
23_20.word_by_word: बलोत्सिक्तम् man proud of his strength, तं राघवम् to that Rama, अस्य and his, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, तीक्ष्णैः by sharp, सायकैः with arrows, अहत्वा without killing, उपावर्तितुम् to return, नोत्सहे I am not intending.

23_21.shloka: सकामा भगिनी मेऽस्तु पीत्वा तु रुधिरं तयोः।।3.23.22।।यन्निमित्तस्तु रामस्य लक्ष्मणस्य विपर्ययः।
23_21.translation: Let my sister be satisfied by drinking the blood of both Rama and Lakshmana on whose account this adversity has come.
23_21.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, विपर्ययः adversity, यन्निमित्तः for whose cause, मे भगिनी my sister, तयोः their, रुधिरम् blood, पीत्वा after drinking, सकामा her desire, अस्तु be fulfilled,

23_22.shloka: न क्वचित्प्राप्तपूर्वो मे संयुगेषु पराजयः।।3.23.23।।युष्माकमेतत्प्रत्यक्षं नानृतं कथयाम्यहम्।
23_22.translation: I have never faced defeat in wars, and all of you have seen it with your eyes. I am not telling you a lie.
23_22.word_by_word: मे for me, संयुगेषु in wars, क्वचित् ever, पराजयः defeat, न प्राप्तपूर्वः never faced, एतत् this, युष्माकम् all of you, प्रत्यक्षम् directly witnessed, अहम् I, अनृतम् untruth, न कथयामि I am not telling.

23_23.shloka: देवराजमपि क्रुद्धो मत्तैरावतयायिनम्।।3.23.24।।वज्रहस्तं रणे हन्यां किं पुनस्तौ कुमानुषौ।
23_23.translation: When angry, I can kill even (Indra) the wielder of the thunderbolt, rider of the intoxicated Airavata and lord of the gods. What to speak of these two petty humans?
23_23.word_by_word: क्रुद्धः angered, मत्तैरावतयायिनम् riding an intoxicated Airavata, वज्रहस्तम् one who wields thunderbolt, देवराजमपि even the king of the gods, रणे in war, हन्याम् I will kill, तौ both of them, कुमानुषौ human beings, किं पुनः should I say again.

23_24.shloka: सा तस्य गर्जितं श्रुत्वा राक्षसस्य महाचमूः।।3.23.25।।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे मृत्युपाशावपाशिता।
23_24.translation: Fallen into the deathtrap, the great army of the demon, felt very happy on hearing Khara roaring.
23_24.word_by_word: मृत्युपाशावपाशिता fallen into the trap of death, सा that, महाचमूः great army, तस्य राक्षसस्य of the demon, गर्जितम् roaring, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अतुलम् immeasureable, प्रहर्षम् joy, लेभे experienced.

23_25.translation: Great souls like sages, gods, gandharvas, and siddhas including celestial bards assembled to see the battle.
23_25.word_by_word: महात्मानः great souls, ऋषयः sages, देवगन्धर्वाः gods and gandharvas, सिद्धाश्च: siddhas (accomplished spiritually), चारणैः सह including celestial bards, युद्धदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः desirous of seeing the war, समीयुः assembled.

23_26.shloka: समेत्य चोचुस्सहितास्तेऽन्योन्यं पुण्यकर्मणः।स्वस्ति गोब्राह्मणेभ्योऽस्तु लोकानां येऽभिसङ्गताः।।3.23.27।।
23_26.translation: Holy men assembled and uttered benedictions, saying, 'let there be wellbeing for the cows and brahmins associated with men of pious deeds in all the (three) worlds.
23_26.word_by_word: पुण्यकर्मणः holy men, ते they, समेत्य collecting together, अन्योन्यम् to one another, सहिताः together, गोब्राह्मणेभ्यः for cows and brahmins, लोकानां of the people, सर्वशः all over, स्वस्ति अस्तु let it be auspicious, ऊचुः they spoke, ये who, अमिसङ्गताः associated

23_27.shloka: जयतां राघवस्संख्ये पौलस्त्यान् रजनीचरान्।।3.23.28।।चक्रहस्तो यथा युद्धे सर्वानसुरपुङ्गवान्।
23_27.translation: 'Let Rama conquer the descendants of Paulasthya in the war like Visnu, the wielder of the wheel had defeated great demons'.
23_27.word_by_word: चक्रहस्तः wielder of the wheel (Visnu), युद्धे in war, सर्वान् all, असुरपङ्गवान् chiefs of demons, यथा like, राघवः Rama, पौलस्त्यान् all descendants of Paulastya, सङ्ख्ये in war, रजनीचरान्  nightrangers (demons), जयताम् let him win.

23_28.shloka: एतच्चान्यच्च बहुशो ब्रुवाणाः परमर्षयः।।3.23.29।।जातकौतूहलास्तत्र विमानस्थाश्च देवताः।ददृशुर्वाहिनीं तेषां राक्षसानां गतायुषाम्।।3.23.30।।
23_28.translation: The great ascetics were talking thus and more. The gods waiting eagerly on heavenly chariots saw the army of the demons whose life span was shortened (who were doomed to death).
23_28.word_by_word: एतच्चान्यच्च these matters, बहुशः more and more, ब्रुवाणाः while talking, परमर्षयः great ascetics, तत्र there, विमानस्थाः occupants of heavenly chariots, देवताश्च gods too, जातकौतूहलाः with much eagerness, गतायुषाम् those of reduced life span, तेषाम् of those, राक्षसानाम् of demons, वाहिनीम् army, ददृशुः saw.

23_29.shloka: रथेन तु खरो वेगादुग्रसैन्यो विनिस्सृतः।तं दृष्ट्वा राक्षसं भूयो राक्षसाश्च विनिस्सृताः।।3.23.31।।
23_29.translation: Seeing Khara, their chief on the chariot driving fast, the army of demons too marched forward.
23_29.word_by_word: उग्रसैन्यः terrific army, खरः Khara, रथेन on the chariot, वेगात् speedily, विनिस्सृतः drove fast, तं राक्षसम् that demon also, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भूयः again, राक्षसाः demons, विनिस्सृताः marched.

23_30.shloka: श्येनगामी पृथुग्रीवो यज्ञशत्रुर्विहङ्गमः।दुर्जयः करवीराक्षः परुषः कालकार्मुकः।।3.23.32।।मेघमाली महामाली सर्वास्यो रुधिराशनः।द्वादशैते महावीर्याः प्रतस्थुरभितः खरम्।।3.23.33।।
23_30.translation: Surrounded by twelve valiant warriors like Syenagami, Pruthugreeva, Yagnasatru, Vihangama, Durjaya, Karaviraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghmali, Mahamali, Sarpasya and Rudhirasana, Khara proceeded.
23_30.word_by_word: श्येनगामी moving like a hawk, पृथुग्रीवः Pruthugreeva (one with a big neck), यज्ञशत्रुः Yagnasatru (enemy of sacrifices), विहङ्गमः Vihangama (who knows how to move in the sky), दुर्जयः Durjaya (an invincible one), करवीराक्षः Karaviraksha (one whose eyes are like the oleander flower), परुषः Parusha (harsh), कालकार्मुकः Kalakarmuka (bow of death), मेघमाली Meghamali (clouds in a row), महामाली Mahamali (a long row), सर्पास्यः Sarpasya (serpentmouthed), रुधिराशनः Rudhirasana (one who feeds on blood), महावीर्याः Mahaveerya (mighty), एते all of them, द्वादश twelve, खरम् अभितः ahead of Khara, प्रतस्थुः marched.

23_31.shloka: महाकपालिस्स्थूलाक्षः प्रमाथी त्रिशिरास्तथा।चत्वार एते सेनान्यो दूषणं पृष्ठतो ययुः।।3.23.34।।
23_31.translation: Similarly Dusana proceeded with four  Mahakapali, Sthulaksha, Pramathi and Trisira  around him.
23_31.word_by_word: महाकपालिः Mahakapali (one with a big skull), स्थूलाक्षः Sthulaksha (bigeyed), प्रमाथी Pramathi (crusher of enemy), तथा similarly, त्रिशिराः Trisira (threeheaded one), एते all of them, चत्वारः four, सेनान्यः army men, दूषणं परितः around Dusana, ययुः walked.

23_32.shloka: सा भीमवेगा समराभिकामा महाबला राक्षसवीरसेना।तौ राजपुत्रौ सहसाभ्युपेता माला ग्रहाणामिव चन्द्रसूर्यौ।।3.23.35।।
23_32.translation: The mighty, swiftfooted army of valiant demons surrounded the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) all on a sudden like the planets around the Sun and the Moon.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
23_32.word_by_word: भीमवेगाः very fast, समराभिकामाः eager for war, महाबलाः mighty, सा that, राक्षसवीरसेना the heroic army of demons, सहसा at once, ग्रहाणाम् of planets, माला garland, चन्द्रसूर्यौ इव like Sun and Moon, तौ those, राजपुत्रौ king's sons, अभ्युपेता: attacked.

24_1.shloka: [Rama sees signs of war -- asks Sita and Lakshmana to stay in the cave and proceeds to meet Khara.]आश्रमं प्रति याते तु खरे खरपराक्रमे।तानेवौत्पातिकान्रामस्सह भ्रात्रा ददर्श ह।।3.24.1।।
24_1.translation: When Khara endowed with malicious might was marching towards the hermitage, Rama and his brother saw the same omens of impending calamity the demon had seen.
24_1.word_by_word: खरपराक्रमे endowed with malicious might, खरे when Khara, आश्रमं प्रति towards the hermitage, याते marched, रामः Rama, भ्रात्रा सह with his brother, औत्पातिकान् phenomena boding calamity, तानेव ददर्श ह he also saw.

24_2.translation: When Rama saw the most dreadful, horripilating phenomena foreboding calamity, he said to Lakshmana:
24_2.word_by_word: महाघोरान् most dreadful, रोमहर्षणान horripilation, प्रजानाम् to people, अहितान् harmful, तान् those, उत्पातान् calamitous, दृष्ट्वा seeing, रामः Rama, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

24_3.translation: O longarmed Lakshmana see these calamitous phenomena that forebode mass destruction of men and demons.
24_3.word_by_word: महाबाहो longarmed, सर्वभूतापहारिणः alldestructive, सर्वराक्षसान् all demons, संहर्तुम् to kill, समुत्थितान् present, इमान् these, महोत्पातान् great calamitous events, पश्य see.

24_4.shloka: अमी रुधिरधारास्तु विसृजन्तः खरस्वनाः।व्योम्नि मेघा विवर्तन्ते परुषा गर्दभारुणाः।।3.24.4।।
24_4.translation: These rumbling clouds, brownishred like the colour of a donkey,  are moving about in the sky showering streams of blood.
24_4.word_by_word: रुधिरधाराः flow of blood, विसृजन्तः showering, खरस्वनाः harsh sounds, परुषाः rough, गर्दभारुणाः brownishred like the colour of donkeys, अमी these, मेघाः clouds, व्योम्नि in the sky, विवर्तन्ते are moving about.

24_5.shloka: सधूमाश्च शरास्सर्वे मम युद्धाभिनन्दिनः।रुक्मपृष्ठानि चापानि विचेष्टन्ते च लक्ष्मण।।3.24.5।।
24_5.translation: O Lakshmana all my arrows are smoking and this goldplated bow welcomes me to war.
24_5.word_by_word: युद्धाभिनन्दिनः welcome me to war, सर्वे all, मम शराः my arrows, सधूमाश्च smoking, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, रुक्मपृष्ठानि coated with gold, चापानि च and bows, विचेष्टन्ते are trying.

24_6.shloka: यादृशा इह कूजन्ति पक्षिणः वनचारिणः।अग्रतो नो भयं प्राप्तं संशयो जीवितस्य च।।3.24.6।।
24_6.translation: The way the forestbirds are screeching makes me foresee danger and makes survival doubtful.
24_6.word_by_word: इह here, वनचारिणः moving in the forest, पक्षिणः birds, यादृशाः in such way, कूजन्ति screeching, नः for us, अग्रतः in future, भयम् fear, प्राप्तम् is foreseen, जीवितस्य of life, संशयः च also doubtful.

24_7.shloka: सम्प्रहारस्तु सुमहान्भविष्यति न संशयः।अयमाख्याति मे बाहुस्स्फुरमाणो मुहुर्मुहुः।।3.24.7।।सन्निकर्षे तु न श्शूर जयं शत्रोः पराजयम्।सप्रभं च प्रसन्नं च तव वक्त्रं हि लक्ष्यते।।3.24.8।।
24_7.translation: A mass destruction of life is going to take place. There is no doubt about it. O brave Lakshmana my right shoulder trembles again and again, indicating the defeat of the enemy. Your beaming visage presages victory.
24_7.word_by_word: सुमहान् very great, सम्प्रहारस्तु destruction of life, भविष्यति will take place, संशयः doubt, न no, शूर O brave one, मुहुः मुहुः again and again, स्फुरमाणः shivering, अयम् this, मे बाहुः my (right) shoulder, सन्निकर्षे in near future, नः our, जयम् success, शत्रोः enemy's, पराजयम् defeat, आख्याति indicating, तव your, वक्त्रम् face, सप्रभं च is bright, प्रसन्नं च cheerful too, लक्ष्यते हि appears indeed.

24_8.shloka: उद्यतानां हि युद्धार्थं येषां भवति लक्ष्मण।निष्प्रभं वदनं तेषां भवत्यायुः परिक्षयः।।3.24.9।।
24_8.translation: O Lakshmana, while preparing for war, those whose faces look pale are, for sure, going to die.
24_8.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, युद्धार्थम् for war, उद्यतानाम् of those making effort, येषाम् of those, वदनम् face, निष्प्रभम् pale, भवति becomes, तेषाम् their, आयुः life, परिक्षयः shortened, भवति become.

24_9.shloka: रक्षसां नर्दतां घोरश्श्रूयते च महाध्वनिः।आहतानां च भेरीणां राक्षसैः क्रूरकर्मभिः।।3.24.10।।
24_9.translation: A dreadful roar of demons and the loud sound of wardrums beaten by the wicked demons are heard.
24_9.word_by_word: नर्दताम् of the roaring ones, रक्षसाम् of the demons, क्रूरकर्मभिः doing cruel deeds, राक्षसैः by the demons, आहतानाम् of the beaten (drums), भेरीणां च of kettle drums, घोरः dreadful, महाध्वनिः very loud sound, श्रूयते च is heard.

24_10.shloka: अनागतविधानं तु कर्तव्यं शुभमिच्छता।आपदं शङ्कमानेन पुरुषेण विपश्चिता।।3.24.11।।
24_10.translation: A wise man who apprehends danger or one who desires his own good should plan his defence even before the onset of danger.
24_10.word_by_word: आपदम् danger, शङ्कमानेन by a person apprehending, शुभम् good, इच्छता by one desirous of, विपश्चिता by a learned one, पुरुषेण by a man, अनागतविधानम् defence before the onset of danger, कर्तव्यं हि should be planned.

24_11.shloka: तस्माद्गृहीत्वा वैदेहीं शरपाणिर्धनुर्धरः।गुहामाश्रय शैलस्य दुर्गां पादपसङ्कुलाम्।।3.24.12।।
24_11.translation: Therefore, take shelter along with Sita in the inaccessible mountain cave, overgrown with trees, ready with your bow and arrows.
24_11.word_by_word: तस्मात् therefore, वैदेहीम् to Sita, गृहीत्वा taking, शरपाणिः with arrows in hand, धनुर्धरः wielding bow, शैलस्य mountains, दुर्गाम् inaccessible, पादपसङ्कुलाम् crowded with trees, गुहाम् cave, आश्रय take shelter.

24_12.shloka: प्रतिकूलितुमिच्छामि न हि वाक्यमिदं त्वया।शापितो मम पादाभ्यां गम्यतां वत्स मा चिरम्।।3.24.13।।
24_12.translation: O dear, I do not like you to oppose this word of honour. You must touch my feet andgo without delay.
24_12.word_by_word: इदं वाक्यम् these words, त्वया you, प्रतिकूलितुम् to oppose, न इच्छामि I do not desire, वत्स dear one, मम पादाभ्याम् my word of honour on my feet, शापितः असि you are bound, गम्यताम् go, चिरम् मा without delay.

24_13.shloka: त्वं हि शूरश्च बलवान्हन्याह्येतान्न संशयः।स्वयं तु हन्तुमिच्छामि सर्वानेव निशाचरान्।।3.24.14।।
24_13.translation: You are valiant and strong. There is no doubt that you can kill all these demons. But I desire to kill them.
24_13.word_by_word: त्वम् you, शूरश्च valiant too, बलवान् strong man, एतान् these demons, हन्याः हि you can kill them, तु सर्वानेव all of them, निशाचरान् demons, स्वयम् myself, हन्तुम् to kill,  इच्छामि wish.

24_14.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणस्सह सीताया।शरानादाय चापं च गुहां दुर्गां समाश्रयत्।।3.24.15।।
24_14.translation: Thus ordered by Rama, Lakshmana took the arrows and the bow and accompanied by Sita took shelter in the inaccessible cave.
24_14.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः was bid, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शरान् arrows, चापं च bow too, आदाय taking, सीतया सह with Sita, दुर्गाम् inaccessible, गुहाम् cave, समाश्रयत् took shelter.

24_15.shloka: तस्मिन्प्रविष्टे तु गुहां लक्ष्मणे सह सीतया।हन्त निर्युक्तमित्युक्त्वा रामः कवचमाविशत्।।3.24.16।।
24_15.translation: With Lakshmana and Sita inside the cave, Rama heaved his shield, saying, Oh the work is accomplished.
24_15.word_by_word: तस्मिन् when he, लक्ष्मणे Lakshmana, सीतया सह with Sita, गुहाम् into the cave, प्रविष्टे entered, रामः Rama, हन्त oh, निर्युक्तम् work is accomplished, इति this, उक्त्वा having spoken, कवचम् shield, आविशत् put on.

24_16.shloka: स तेनाग्नि निकाशेन कवचेन विभूषितः।बभूव राम स्तिमिरे विधूमोऽग्निरिवोत्थितः।।3.24.17।।
24_16.translation: Adorned with the shield, Rama shone like smokeless fire rising in darkness.
24_16.word_by_word: अग्निनिकाशेन blazing like fire, तेन by that, कवचेन by the shield, विभूषितः welldecorated, सः रामः that Rama, तिमिरे in darkness, उत्थितः arising, विधूमः smokeless, अग्निरिव like fire, बभूव looked.

24_17.shloka: स चापमुद्यम्य महच्छरानादाय वीर्यवान्।बभूवावस्थितस्तत्र ज्यास्वनैः पूरयन्दिशः।।3.24.18।।
24_17.translation: Valiant Rama lifted the huge bow and arrows and stood there, filling the directions with the twangs of his bow.
24_17.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, सः he, महत् huge, चापम् bow, उद्यम्य lifting, ज्यास्वनैः by the twangs of the  bowstring, दिशः all directions, पूरयन् filling, तत्र there, अवस्थितः बभूव stayed.

24_18.shloka: ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वास्सिद्धाश्च सह चारणैः।समेयुश्च महात्मानो युद्धदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।।3.24.19।।
24_18.translation: Then the gods along with gandharvas, siddhas, and celestial bards assembled there, wishing to witness the war.
24_18.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सगन्धर्वाः along with the celestial muscians, देवाः gods, महात्मनः great souls, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, चारणैः with bards, सह along with, युद्धदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः desiring to see the war, समेयुः assembled.

24_19.shloka: ऋषयश्च महात्मानो लोके ब्रह्मर्षिसत्तमाः।समेत्य चोचुस्सहिता अन्योन्यं पुण्यकर्मणः।।3.24.20।।
24_19.translation: Great ascetics of the world, distinguished brahmarsis, accomplishers of pious deeds assembled and said to one another:
24_19.word_by_word: महात्मानः highsouled, ऋषयश्च ascetics, लोके in the world, ब्रह्मर्षिसत्तमाः brahmarsis, पुण्यकर्मणः pious, समेत्य assembling, अन्योन्यम् to one another, सहिताः collectively, ऊचुः said.

24_20.shloka: स्वस्ति गोब्राह्मणेभ्योऽस्तु लोकानां येऽभिसङ्गताः।जयतां राघवो युद्धे पौलस्त्यान् रजनीचरान्।।3.24.21।।चक्रहस्तो यथा युद्धे सर्वानसुर पुङ्गवान्।
24_20.translation: 'Let there be wellbeing for the cows, brahmins, and all the worlds. Let Rama, the scion of the Raghu race, conquer the Paulastyas (demons) in war like lord Visnu, wielder of the disc, who defeated the most powerful demons'.
24_20.word_by_word: गोब्राह्मणेभ्यः to cows and brahmins, लोकानां of all the world, (सर्वशः by all means), स्वस्ति auspicious, अस्तु let it be, (ऊचुः spoke), चक्रहस्तः Visnu, युद्धे in war, सर्वान् all, असुरपङ्गवान् powerful demons, यथा likewise, राघवः Rama, सङ्ख्ये पौलस्त्यान् all members of the Paulastya race in  the battle, रजनीचरान् nightrangers (demons), जयताम् let him win.

24_21.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा पुनः प्रोचुरालोक्य च परस्परम्।।3.24.22।।चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।एकश्च रामो धर्मात्मा कथं युद्धं भविष्यति।।3.24.23।।
24_21.translation: Thus looking at one another they discussed among themselves how there can be war between the righteous Rama fighting singlehanded on the one hand and the fourteen thousand demons, performers of terrific deeds, on the other.
24_21.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, आलोक्य च and after looking at, परस्परम् to one another, पुनः again, प्रोचुः spoke, भीमकर्मणाम् of those of terrific deeds, रक्षसाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousands, धर्मात्मा righteous self, रामश्च Rama, एकः all alone, युद्धम् war, कथम् how, भविष्यति will it be?

24_22.translation: Rajarsis, siddhas, great brahmins with their clan and gods on the celestial chariots waited to see the war whetted with curiosity.
24_22.word_by_word: राजर्षयः rajarsis, सगणाः along with their groups, सिद्धाः siddhas, द्विजर्षभाः great brahmins, विमानस्थाः on the celestial chariots, देवताश्च gods also, इति this way, जातकौकूहलाः with curiosity born, तस्थुः waited.

24_23.shloka: आविष्टं तेजसा रामं सङ्ग्रामशिरसि स्थितम्।दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि भयाद्विव्यथिरे तदा।।3.24.25।।
24_23.translation: Seeing Rama standing on the war front, engrossed and radiating heroic lustre, all beings were alarmed.
24_23.word_by_word: तदा then, सङ्ग्रामशिरसि on the war front, स्थितम् standing, तेजसा with heroic lustre, आविष्ठम् engrossed, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि beings, भयात् out of fear, विव्यथिरे were alarmed.

24_24.shloka: रूपमप्रतिमं तस्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।बभूव रूपं क्रुद्धस्य रुद्रस्येव पिनाकिनः।।3.24.26।।
24_24.translation: Rama, who is unwearied in action and who is of an incomparable (lovely) form, looked ferocious like the wielder of Pinaka (Lord Siva).
24_24.word_by_word: अक्लिष्टकर्मणः of one who is unwearied in action, तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, अप्रतिमम् incomparable, रूपम् form, क्रुद्धस्य of an angry one, पिनाकिनः wielder of Pinaka, रुद्रस्य Rudra's, रूपमिव like the form, बभूव appeared.

24_25.translation: Then appeared on all sides the wellequipped army of demons raising deep sounds with dreadful shields, weapons and banners.
24_25.word_by_word: ततः then, गम्भीरनिर्ह्रादम् deep sound, घोरवर्मायुधध्वजम् having dreadful shields, weapons and banners, यातुधानानाम् of the demons, अनीकम् army, समन्तात् on all sides, प्रत्यदृश्यत appeared before.

24_26.shloka: सिंहनादं विसृजतामन्योन्यमभिगर्जताम्।चापानि विस्फ़ारयतां जृम्भतामप्यभीक्ष्णशः।।3.24.28।।विप्रघुष्टस्वनानां च दुन्धुभींश्चापि निघ्नताम्।तेषां सुतुमुलश्शब्दः पूरयामास तद्वनम्।।3.24.29।।
24_26.translation: The forest was filled with tumultuous sounds of the warriors roaring like lions,  shouting at one another, stretching the bowstrings constantly, yawning, proclaiming loudly and beating the drums.
24_26.word_by_word: सिंहनादम् roar of lion, विसृजताम् released, अन्योन्यम् at one another, अभिगर्जताम् shouting loudly, चापानि bows, विस्फ़ारयताम् stretching the bows, अभीक्ष्णशः constantly, जृम्भतामपि  yawning, विप्रघुष्टस्वनानां च  proclaiming loudly, दुन्धुभींश्च अपि even drums, निघ्नताम् beating, तेषाम् of them, सुतुमुलः tumultuous, शब्दः sound, तद्वनम् that forest, पूरयामास filled.

24_27.shloka: तेन शब्देन वित्रस्ताश्वापदा वनचारिणः।दुद्रुवुर्यत्र निश्शब्दं पृष्ठतो न व्यलोकयन्।।3.24.30।।
24_27.translation: The ferocious animals of the forest got frightened and ran away to silent spots without looking back.
24_27.word_by_word: तेन शब्देन by that sound, वित्रस्ताः alarmed, वनचारिणः roaming the forest, श्वापदाः animals, यत्र whereever, निश्शब्दम् silence, दुद्रुवुः ran, पृष्ठतः at the back, न व्यलोकयन् did not look back.

24_28.shloka: तत्त्वनीकं महाघोरं रामं समुपसर्पत।धृतनानाप्रहरणं गम्भीरं सागरोपमम्।।3.24.31।।
24_28.translation: The fierce army, deep like the sea, equipped with various missiles approached Rama.
24_28.word_by_word: महाघोरम् extremely frightening, धृतनानाप्रहरणम् equipped with different kinds of missiles, गम्भीरम् deep, सागरोपमम् like the sea, तत् अनीकम् that army, रामम् to Rama, समुपसर्पत came near.

24_29.translation: Rama, wellversed in warfare, cast his eyes on all sides to see the army of Khara that had come prepared for war.
24_29.word_by_word: रणपण्डितः wellversed in warfare, रामोऽपि even Rama, चक्षुः his eyes, सर्वतः on all sides, चारयन् while casting, युद्धाभिमुखम् facing war, उत्थितम् was standing, तत् that, खरसैन्यम् army of Khara, ददर्श he saw.

24_30.shloka: वितत्य च धनुर्भीमं तूण्याश्चोद्धृत्य सायकान्।क्रोधमाहारयत्तीव्रं वधार्थं सर्वरक्षसाम्।।3.24.33।।
24_30.translation: Rama stretched the formidable bow and lifted the arrows from his quiver to kill the demons and assumed intense anger.
24_30.word_by_word: भीमम् formidable, धनुः bow, वितत्य  stretched, तूण्याः from the quiver, सायकान् arrows, उद्धृत्य took out, सर्व रक्षसाम् to all the demons, वधार्थम् to kill, तीव्रम् intense, क्रोधम् anger, आहारयत् gathered.

24_31.shloka: दुष्प्रेक्ष्यस्सोऽभवत्कृद्धो युगान्ताग्निरिव ज्वलन्।तं दृष्ट्वा तेजसाविष्टं प्राद्रवन्वनदेवताः।।3.24.34।।
24_31.translation: Rama stood burning in anger like the fire of the doom's day. It was difficult even to look at him. Seeing him full of glow even the sylvan deities ran away.
24_31.word_by_word: क्रुद्धः angry, सः Rama, ज्वलन् while burning, युगान्ताग्निरिव like fire rising at the end of the creation, दुष्प्रेक्ष्य: difficult even to look at अभवत्  became, तेजसा glow, आविष्टम् filled with, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, वनदेवताः sylvan deities, प्राद्रवन् ran away.

24_32.shloka: तस्य क्रुद्धस्य रूपं तु रामस्य ददृशे तदा।दक्षस्येव क्रतुं हन्तुमुद्यतस्य पिनाकिनः।।3.24.35।।
24_32.translation: Rama in anger looked like Lord Siva ready to destroy the sacrifice of Daksha.
24_32.word_by_word: तदा then, क्रुद्धस्य of an angry one, तस्य his, रूपम् face, दक्षस्य Daksha's, क्रतुम् sacrifice, हन्तुम् to destroy, उद्यतस्य ready to, पिनाकिनः इव like that of Siva, ददृशे looked.

24_33.shloka: आविष्टं तेजसा रामं सङ्ग्रामशिरसि स्थितम्।दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि भयार्तानि प्रदुद्रुवुः।।3.24.36।।
24_33.translation: Seeing Rama flashing (in anger) and standing on the warfront all creatures ran away frightened.
24_33.word_by_word: तेजसा with splendour, आविष्टम् occupied, सङ्ग्रामशिरसि at the head of the battle, स्थितम् stood, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि beings, भयार्तानि frightened, प्रदुद्रुवुः ran away.

24_34.shloka: तत्कार्मुकैराभरणैर्ध्वजैश्च तैर्वर्मभिश्चाग्निसमानवर्णैः।बभूव सैन्यं पिशिताशनानां सूर्योदये नीलमिवाभ्रबृन्दम्।।3.24.37।।
24_34.translation: The army of demons equipped with blazing armour, bows and banners appeared like a mass of blue clouds at Sunrise.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
24_34.word_by_word: पिशिताशनानाम् of the demons, तत् that, सैन्यम् army, कार्मुकैः with bows, आभरणैः with armour, ध्वजैश्च with flags, अग्निसमानवर्णैः the colour of fire, तैः by them, वर्मभिः by armours, सूर्योदये at Sunrise, नीलम् blue, अभ्रवृन्दमिव like a mass of cloud, बभूव looked.

25_1.shloka: [Khara  and his army attack Rama -- Rama retaliates -- kills all the demons]अवष्टब्धधनुं रामं क्रुद्धं च रिपुघातिनम्।ददर्शाऽश्रममागम्य खरस्सह पुरस्सरैः।।3.25.1।।
25_1.translation: Khara accompanied by his pilot party arrived at the hermitage of Rama, the destroyer of enemies and saw him in fury, standing ready with his bow.
25_1.word_by_word: खरः Khara, पुरस्सरैः सह accompanied by the pilot party, आश्रमम् to the hermitage, आगम्य arrived, अवष्टब्धधनुम् holding the bow, क्रुद्धम् angry, रिपुघातिनम् destroyer of the enemy, रामम् Rama, ददर्श saw.

25_2.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा सशरं चापमुद्यम्य खरनिस्स्वनम्।रामस्याभिमुखं सूतं चोद्यतामित्यचोदयत्।।3.25.2।।
25_2.translation: On seeing Rama, Khara held his terribly twanging bow and arrow, stood facing him, and ordered the charioteer to drive towards him.
25_2.word_by_word: तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, खरनिस्स्वनम् producing terrible sound, सशरम् with the arrow, चापम् bow, उद्यम्य lifted, रामस्य Rama's, अभिमुखम् facing him, चोद्यताम् drive (the chariot), इति thus, सूतम् to charioteer, अचोदयत् ordered to go.

25_3.shloka: स खरस्याज्ञया सूतस्तुरगान् समचोदयत्।यत्र रामो महाबाहुरेको चुन्वन्स्थितो धनुः।।3.25.3।।
25_3.translation: Commanded by Khara, the charioteer also urged the horses towards themightyarmed Rama standing alone and wielding the bow.
25_3.word_by_word: सः that, सूतः charioteer, खरस्य Khara's, आज्ञया by the order, महाबाहुः mightyarmed, एकः alone, रामः Rama, धनुः bow, चुन्वन् selecting, स्थितः stood, तुरगान् horses, समचोदयत् drove.

25_4.shloka: तं तु निष्पतितं दृष्ट्वा सर्वे ते रजनीचराः।नर्दमाना महानादं सचिवाः पर्यवारयन्।।3.25.4।।
25_4.translation: Seeing Khara attacking (Rama) all the demon ministers surrounded him  roaring.
25_4.word_by_word: निष्पतितम् fell upon, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सचिवाः ministers, ते they, सर्वे all, रजनीचराः demons, महानादम् very loud sound, नर्दमानाः while roaring, पर्यवारयन् surrounded.

25_5.shloka: स तेषां यातुधानानां मध्ये रथगतः खरः।बभूव मध्ये ताराणां लोहिताङ्ग इवोदितः।।3.25.5।।
25_5.translation: Seated on a chariot in the midst of the demons, Khara looked like the rising Mars in the middle of the stars.
25_5.word_by_word: तेषां यातुधानाम् of the demons, मध्ये in the midst, रथगतः seated on a chariot, खरः Khara, ताराणाम् of stars, मध्ये in the middle, उदितः risen, लोहिताङ्गः the planet Mars, इव like, बभूव looked.

25_6.shloka: ततश्शरसहस्रेण राममप्रतिमौजसम्।अर्दयित्वा महानादं ननाद समरे खरः।।3.25.6।।
25_6.translation: Khara struck Rama of immeasurable prowess with a thousand arrows and roared loudly.
25_6.word_by_word: ततः then, खरः Khara, समरे in war, शरसहस्रेण with a thousand arrows, अप्रतिमौजसम् of immeasureable prowess, रामम् to Rama, अर्दयित्वा striking, महानादम् a loud voice, ननाद made.

25_7.shloka: ततस्तं भीमधन्वानं क्रुद्धाः सर्वे निशाचराः।रामं नानाविधैः शस्स्रैरभ्यवर्षन्त दुर्जयम्।।3.25.7।।
25_7.translation: Thereafter all the infuriated demons showered on invincible Rama, wielder of a fierce bow, many kinds of weapons.
25_7.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सर्वे all, क्रुद्धाः angry, निशाचराः demons, भीमधन्वानम् wielder of the fierce bow, दुर्जयम् invincible, तं रामम् to that Rama, नानाविधैः with many kinds of, शस्स्रैः weapons, अभ्यवर्षन्त rained.

25_8.shloka: मुद्गरैः पट्टसैश्शूलैः प्रासैः खङ्गै परश्वथैः।राक्षसास्समरे रामं निजघ्नू रोषतत्पराः।।3.25.8।।
25_8.translation: Overtaken by anger, the demons continuously hurled at Rama hammers, spears, spikes, barbed missiles, swords and battleaxes.
25_8.word_by_word: राक्षसाः demons, रोषतत्पराः overtaken by anger, मुद्गरैः with hammers, पट्टसैः with spears, शूलैः with spikes, प्रासैः with barbed missiles, खङ्गै: with swords, परश्वधः battleaxes, समरे in war, रामम् to Rama, निजघ्नुः continously hurled.

25_9.shloka: ते वलाहसङ्काशा महानादा महौजसः।अभ्यधावन्त काकुत्स्थं रथैर्वाजिभिरेव च।।3.25.9।।गजैः पर्वतकूटाभै रामं युद्धे जिघांसवः।
25_9.translation: Very powerful demons like huge clouds roared, eager to kill Rama in war. They ran forward on chariots, horses and tall elephants, looking like  mountain tops.
25_9.word_by_word: वलाहकसङ्काशाः resembling clouds, महानादाः with huge uproar, महौजसः very powerful, ते demons, रथैः on chariots, वाजिभिरेव च on horses and, पर्वतकूटाभैः looking like tops of mountains, गजैः by elephants, युद्धे in war, जिघांसवः eager to kill, रामम् to Rama, अभ्यधावन्त ran towards.

25_10.shloka: ते रामे शरवर्षाणि व्यसृजन् रक्षसां गणाः।।3.25.10।।शैलेन्द्रमिव धाराभिर्वर्षमाणा वलाहकाः।
25_10.translation: The battalions of demons sent down streams of arrows on Rama just like clouds  downpour on mountains.
25_10.word_by_word: ते they, रक्षसाम् of demons, गणाः battalions, रामे on Rama, वर्षमाणाः raining, वलाहकाः clouds, धाराभिः by downpour, शैलेन्द्रमिव like moutains, शरवर्षाणि rain of arrows, व्यसृजन् sent forth.

25_11.shloka: स तैः परिवृतो घोरैः राघवो रक्षसां गणैः।।3.25.11।।तिथिष्वि महादेवो वृत परिषदाङ्गणै
25_11.translation: Surrounded by the terrible demons Rama appeared like Lord Siva at dusk with hosts of his retinues arounds.
25_11.word_by_word: स: that, राघवः Rama, घोरैः terrible, रक्षसां गणैः by hordes of demons, परिवृत: surrounded, महादेवः Lord Siva, वृतः surrounded, परिषदाङ्गणैः with hosts of retinues, तिथिष्वि at dusk.

25_12.shloka: तानि मुक्तानि शस्त्राणि यातुधानैस्सराघवः।प्रतिजग्राह विशिखैर्नद्योघानिव सागरः।।3.25.12।।
25_12.translation: Rama resisted the weapons released by the demons like the sea, the inflow of river waters.
25_12.word_by_word: सः that, राघवः Rama, यातुधानैः by the demons, मुक्तानि released, तानि those, शस्त्राणि weapons, सागरः sea, नद्योघानिव like the flow of rivers, विशिखैः with arrows, प्रतिजग्राह resisted.

25_13.shloka: स तैः प्रहरणैर्घोरैर्भिन्नगात्रो न विव्यथे।रामः प्रदीप्तैर्बहुभिर्वज्रैरिव महाचलः।।3.25.13।।
25_13.translation: Rama remained unhurt like a great mountain struck by many glowing thunderbolts. He felt no pain even though his limbs were hit by the dreadful weapons.
25_13.word_by_word: घोरैः by the dreadful, प्रहरणै by weapons, तैः by those, भिन्नगात्रः his limbs being hit, सः रामः that Rama, प्रदीपैः by the glowing, बहुभिः by many, वज्रैः by thunderbolts, महाचल इव like the great mountain, न विव्यथे was not hurt.

25_14.shloka: स विद्धः क्षतजादिग्धः सर्वगात्रेषु राघवः।बभूव रामः सन्ध्याभ्रैर्दिवाकर इवावृतः।।3.25.14।।
25_14.translation: Wounded all over the body, bleeding through the wounds caused by weapons, Rama looked like the evening Sun covered with clouds.
25_14.word_by_word: विद्ध: wounded, सर्वगात्रेषु all over the body, क्षतजादिग्धः bleeding through the wounds, राघवः Rama, सः रामः that Rama, सन्ध्याभ्रैः by evening clouds, आवृतः surrounded, दिवाकरः इव like the Sun, बभूव became (appeared).

25_15.translation: Seeing Rama left alone surrounded by many thousands of demons, the gods, ghandarvas and siddhas became very sad.
25_15.word_by_word: तदा then, बहुभिः by many, सहस्रैः by thousands, समावृतम् surrounded by, एकम् single, दृष्ट्वा seeing, देवगन्धर्वाः gods and gandharvas, सिद्धाश्च siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, विषेदुः became sad.

25_16.translation: Thereafter Rama, mighty angry, bent his bow and released hundreds and thousands of unfeathered arrows.
25_16.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, रामः Rama, सुसङ्कृद्धः mighty angry, मण्डलीकृतकार्मुकः bending the bow,शतशः in hundreds, अथ and, सहस्रशः thousands, विशिखान् unfeathered ones, बाणान् arrows, ससर्ज released.

25_17.translation: As if sporting, Rama discharged the arrows attached with herons' feathers. The arrows were inescapable, unbearable like that of Yama's staff, that went straight without missing the target.
25_17.word_by_word: रामः Rama, रणे in war, दुरावारान् those difficult to stop, दुर्विषहान् unbearable ones, कालदण्डोपमान् those looking like Yama's staff, अजिह्मगान् going straight without missing the goal, कङ्कपत्रान् arrows furnished with herons' feathers, लीलया very easily, मुमोच discharged.

25_18.shloka: ते शराश्शत्रुसैन्येषु मुक्ता रामेण लीलया।अददू रक्षसां प्राणान्पाशाः कालकृता इव।।3.25.18।।
25_18.translation: The arrows like the noose of the god of death released by Rama on the enemy army easily destroyed the lives of the demons.
25_18.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, लीलया sportively, शत्रुसैन्येषु at the army of the enemy, मुक्ताः released, ते शराः those arrows, कालकृताः made by the god of death, पाशाः nooses, इव like, रक्षसाम् of the demons, प्राणान् life, आददुः pulled out.

25_19.shloka: भित्त्वा राक्षसदेहां स्तांस्ते शरा रुधिराप्लुताः।अन्तरिक्षगता रेजुर्दीप्ताग्निसमतेजसः।।3.25.19।।
25_19.translation: Rama's arrows pierced the bodies of the demons and drenched in blood, they, looking like burning fire, shone in the sky.
25_19.word_by_word: ते शराः those arrows, तान् those, राक्षसदेहान् bodies of the demons, भित्त्वा after piercing,रुधिराप्लुताः drenched in blood, अन्तरिक्षगताः gone high up into the sky, दीप्ताग्निसमतेजसः glowing red like burning fire, रेजुः sparkled.

25_20.translation: From Rama's bow bent into a cirle, countless fierce arrows able to take the lives of demons were released.
25_20.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, चापमण्डलात् from the bow bent into a circle, अतीव highly, उग्राः fierce, रक्षःप्राणापहारिणः which can take the lives of demons, असङ्ख्येयाः countless ones, सायकाः arrows, विनिष्पेतुः thrown out destroying.

25_21.shloka: तैर्धनूंषि ध्वजाग्राणि वर्माणि च शिरांसि च।बाहून्सहस्ताभरणानूरून्करिकरोपमान्।।3.25.21।।चिच्छेद रामस्समरे शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।
25_21.translation: In war Rama cut asunder the bows, flag tops, armour and heads of demons, their shoulders and thighs that were like the trunks of elephants, in their hundreds and thousands.
25_21.word_by_word: रामः Rama, समरे in war, तैः by them (arrows), शतशः in hundreds, अथ and, सहस्रशः in thousands, धनूंषि bows, ध्वजाग्राणि tops of flags, वर्माणि च and armour, शिरांसि च and heads, सहस्ताभरणान् along with armlets, बाहून् shoulders, करिकरोपमान् like elephants' trunks, ऊरून् thighs, चिच्छेद cut.

25_22.translation: He killed horses with golden armours yoked to the chariots along with charioteers, elephants along with riders, the cavalry along with their horses and infantry and sent them all to the abode of death.
25_22.word_by_word: काञ्चनसन्नाहान् golden ornaments, रथयुक्तान् yoked to the chariots, ससारथीन् along with charioteers, हयान् horses, सगजारोहान् with elephant riders, गजांश्च and elephants, तथा likewise, सहयान् along with horses, सादिनः horse riders, पदातीन् infantry, समरे in war, हत्वा  killed, यमसादनम् to the abode of lord of death, अनयत् sent.

25_23.translation: The bodies of the demons torn into pieces by the very sharp iron arrows and by the arrows called vikarni, they cried and shouted aloud in pitiable voices.
25_23.word_by_word: ततः then, नालीकनाराचैः with iron arrows, तीक्ष्णाग्रैः with sharp tops, विकर्णिभिः by shafts called vikarni, भिद्यमानाः torn into parts, निशाचराः demons, भीमम् terrible, आर्तस्वरम् pitiable cries, चक्रुः made.

25_24.shloka: तत्सैन्यं निशितैर्बाणैरर्दितं मर्मभेदिभिः।रामेण न सुखं लेभे शुष्कं वनमिवाग्निना।।3.25.25।।
25_24.translation: Just like the dried up forest burnt by the fire, the army was totally destroyed by Rama's arrows that pierced into the vital parts of the soldiers.
25_24.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, मर्मभेदिभिः by those piercing into vital parts, निशितैः by sharp ones, बाणैः by arrows, अर्दितम् tormented, तत् सैन्यम् that army, शुष्कम् dried up, वनम् forest, अग्निना इव as if by fire, सुखम् relief न लेभे did not have.

25_25.translation: A few warriors of fierce strength approached Rama and hurled at him very powerful weapons, spears, swords and axes.
25_25.word_by_word: भीमबलाः men of fierce strength, केचित् a few, शूराः warriors, रामस्य Rama's, अभिमुखम् going towards, गत्वा went, परमायुधान् very powerful weapons, शूलान् spikes, खङ्गान् swords, परश्वधान् axes, चिक्षिपुः threw.

25_26.shloka: तानि बाणैर्महाबाहुश्शस्त्राण्यावार्य राघवः।जहार समरे प्राणांश्चिच्छेद च शिरोधरान्।।3.25.27।।
25_26.translation: Strongarmed Rama attacked them with his arrows and cut off their heads and took their lives.
25_26.word_by_word: महाबाहुः strongarmed, राघवः Rama, समरे in war, बाणैः with arrows, तेषाम् their, शस्त्राणि weapons, आवार्य attacked, प्राणान् life, जहार took, शिरोधरान् heads, चिच्छेद cut off.

25_27.translation: The heads, armour and bows fell down broken on the ground like trees in the wind gererated by Garuda's wings.
25_27.word_by_word: ते they, छिन्नशिरसः broken heads, छिन्नवर्मशरासनाः broken armour and bows, सुपर्णवातविक्षिप्ताः broken tree tops fallen down by the wind of eagle's wing (blow of the the great eagle Garuda), पादपाः trees, यथा just as, जगत्याम् on the land, पेतुः fell.

25_28.shloka: अवशिष्टाश्च ये तत्र विषण्णाश्च निशाचराः।खरमेवाभ्यधावन्त शरणार्थं शरार्दिताः।।3.25.29।।
25_28.translation: The rest of the demons hit by the arrows ran desperate towards Khara for refuge.
25_28.word_by_word: तत्र there, अवशिष्टाः remaining ones, ये those, निशाचराः demons, शरार्दिताः hit by arrows, विषण्णाश्च desperate, खरमेव to Khara only, शरणार्थम् for refuge, अभ्यधावन्त ran towards.

25_29.shloka: तान्सर्वान्पुनरादाय समाश्वास्य च दूषणः।अभ्यधावत काकुत्स्थं क्रुद्धो रुद्रमिवान्तकः।।3.25.30।।
25_29.translation: Pacifying them all, Dusana regathered them again and ran towards Rama like an angry Yama rushing towards Rudra.
25_29.word_by_word: दूषणः Dusana, तान् स them, सर्वान् all, समाश्वास्य pacifying, पुनः again, आदाय bringing them together, क्रुद्धः wrathful, अन्तकः yama, रुद्रमिव like Rudra, काकुत्स्थं on Rama, अभ्यधावत ran towards.

25_30.translation: Under Dusana's protection, all of them felt relieved from fear and, carrying sal and palm trees and stones as weapons, advanced towards Rama again.
25_30.word_by_word: सर्वे all, दूषणाश्रयनिर्भयाः were free from fear due to Dusana's protection, पुनः again, निवृत्ताः returned, सालतालशिलायुधाः carrying sal, palm and stones as weapons, राममेव to Rama, अभ्यधावन्त advanced towards.

25_31.shloka: शूलमुद्गरहस्ताश्च चापहस्ता महाबलाः।सृजन्तश्शरवर्षाणि शस्त्रवर्षाणि संयुगे।।3.25.32।।द्रुमवर्षाणि मुञ्चन्तश्शिलावर्षाणि राक्षसाः।।
25_31.translation: Holding spears, hammers and bows in their hands, the mighty demons rained on Rama weapons like arrows, trees and stones.
25_31.word_by_word: शूलमुद्गरहस्ताश्च spears and hammers in their hands, चापहस्ताः bows in hands, महाबलाः extremely strong, राक्षसाः demons, संयुगे in war, शरवर्षाणि rain of  arrows, शस्त्रवर्षाणि rain ofweapons, सृजन्तः poured, द्रुमवर्षाणि rain of trees, शिलावर्षाणि rain of stones, मुञ्चन्तः  continuously released.

25_32.shloka: तद्बभूवाद्भुतं युद्धं तुमुलं रोमहर्षणम्।रामस्य च महाघोरं पुनस्तेषां च रक्षसाम्।।3.25.33।।
25_32.translation: The thrilling, fierce, horrifying and horripilating battle again ensued betwen Rama and the demons.
25_32.word_by_word: पुनः again, रामस्य Rama's, तेषां रक्षसां च of those demons, तुमुलम् fierce, अद्भुतम् wonderful, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, महाघोरम् very dreadful, तत् युद्धम् that war, बभूव became.

25_33.shloka: ते समन्तादतिक्रुद्धा राघवं पुनरभ्ययुः।।3.25.34।।तैश्च सर्वा दिशो दृष्ट्वा प्रदिशश्च समावृताः।राक्षसैरुद्यतप्रासैश्शरवर्षाभिवर्षिभिः।।3.25.35।।स कृत्वा भैरवं नादमस्त्रं परमभास्वरम्।संयोजयत गान्धर्वं राक्षसेषु महाबलः।।3.25.36।।
25_33.translation: As the infuriated demons again hurtled towards Rama, filling the quarters and the intermediate directions and raining missiles, Rama aimed at them dazzling gandharvastras, producing a frightening warcry.
25_33.word_by_word: ते they, अतिक्रुद्धाः mighty angry, पुनः again, राघवम् at Rama, समन्तात् from all directions, अभ्ययुः advanced towards, महाबलः mighty, सः he, उद्यतप्रासैः by raised missiles, शरवर्षिभिः raining arrows, तैः by them, सर्वाः all, दिशः quarters, प्रदिशश्च also intermediate directions, समावृताः were covered, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भैरवम् frightening, नादम् sound, कृत्वा produced, राक्षसेषु at the demons, परमभास्वरम् very dazzling, गान्धर्वम् belonging to gandharva, अस्त्रम् weapon, संयोजयत aimed at.

25_34.shloka: ततश्शरसहस्राणि निर्ययुश्चापमण्डलात्।सर्वा दश दिशो बाणैरावार्यन्त समागतैः।।3.25.37।।
25_34.translation: Rama then let out from his bow, stretched round, thousands of arrows that covered all the ten quarters.
25_34.word_by_word: ततः then, चापमण्डलात् from the the bow bent round, शरसहस्राणि thousands of arrows, निर्ययुः let out, समागतैः by approaching, बाणैः by arrows, सर्वाः all, दश ten, दिशः quarters, अवार्यन्त were filled.

25_35.shloka: नाददानं शरान्घोरान्नमुञ्चन्तं शिलीमुखान्।विकर्षमाणं पश्यन्ति राक्षसास्ते शरार्दिताः।।3.25.38।।
25_35.translation: The demons, though wounded, could not see whereform the terrible arrows came. They only saw Rama shooting the arrows.
25_35.word_by_word: शरार्दिताः hurt by the arrows, ते राक्षसाः the demons, घोरान् terrible, शरान् arrows, आददानम् taking out, न पश्यन्ति could not see, शिलीमुखान् arrows, मुञ्चन्तम् sending forth, न not, विकर्षमाणम्  shooting arrow.

25_36.translation: Through the darkness created by the arrows that covered the sky and the Sun, Rama looked as though he was vomitting them.
25_36.word_by_word: शरान्धकारम् darkness created by the arrows, सदिवाकरम् along with the Sun, आकाशम् sky, आवृणोत् covered, रामः Rama, तान् those, शरान् arrows, प्रवमन्निव as if vomitting, अवस्थितः stationed, भभूव appeared.

25_37.shloka: युगपत्पतमानैश्च युगपच्च हतैर्भृशम्।युगपत्पतितैश्चैव विकीर्णा वसुधा भवत्।।3.25.40।।
25_37.translation: It seemed as if it all happened at the same time, the entire earth filling with demons seriously injured, slain and fallen down on the ground.
25_37.word_by_word: वसुधा earth, युगपत् simultaneously, पतमानैश्च fallen down, हतैश्च by those slain, पतितैश्चैव by those who fell on the ground, भृशम् exceedingly, विकीर्णा scattered all over, अभवत् appeared.

25_38.shloka: निहताः पतिताः क्षीणाश्छिन्ना भिन्ना विदारिताः।तत्र तत्र स्म दृश्यन्ते राक्षसास्ते सहस्रशः।।3.25.41।।
25_38.translation: There were bodies of demons pierced and torn, thinned and fallen down, destroyed, broken and cut into pieces scattered in their thousands.
25_38.word_by_word: ते राक्षसाः they, demons, निहताः killed, तत्र तत्र all over there, सहस्रशः in their thousands, पतिताः fallen, क्षीणाः thinned down, छिन्नाः cut into pieces, भिन्नाः those broken pieces, विदारिताः those pierced, दृश्यन्ते स्म were found.

25_39.shloka: सोष्णीषैरुत्तमाङ्गैश्च साङ्गदैर्बाहुभिस्तथा।ऊरुभिर्जानुभिश्छिन्नैर्नानारूपैविभूषणैः।।3.25.42।।हयैश्च द्विपमुख्यैश्च रथैर्भिन्नैरनेकशः।चामरैर्व्यजनैश्छत्रैर्ध्वजैर्नानाविधैरपि।।3.25.43।।रामस्य बाणाभिहतैर्विचित्रैश्शूलपट्टिसैः।खङ्गै खण्डीकृतैः प्रासैर्विकीर्णैश्च परश्वधैः।।3.25.44।।चूर्णिताभिश्शिलाभिश्च शरैश्चित्रैरनेकशः।विच्छिन्नैस्समरे भूमिर्विकीर्णाऽभूद्भयङ्करा।।3.25.45।।
25_39.translation: Slain thus by Rama's arrows, the ground was littered with (bodies of) demons with limbs dismembered, headdresses and shoulders cut off, arms, thighs and knees decked with various ornaments amputated, chariots, horses, best of elephants, fans made of the tail of chamari deer (used as an insignia of royalty), umbrellas, several  flags, and weapons like spears, swords, darts, battleaxes and stones crushed into pieces and arrows splintered and scattered all over. The ground looked frightening.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
25_39.word_by_word: समरे in war, सोष्णीषैः with headgears, उत्तमाङ्गैश्च heads (best part of body), तथा like that, साङ्गदैः armlets, बाहुभिः with shoulders, छिन्नैः cut to pieces, ऊरुभिः with thighs, जानुभिः with knees, नानारूपैर्विभूषणैः with different kinds of arms, अनेकशः in many ways, हयैश्च with horses, द्विपमुख्यैश्च with best of elephants, भिन्नैः by those broken, रथैः with chariots, चामरैः by fans made of yaktail, व्यजनैः by fans, छत्रैः by umbrellas, नानाविधैः of several kinds, ध्वजैः by flags, रामस्य Rama's, बाणाभिहतैः destroyed by arrows, विचित्रैः by different kinds, शूलपट्टिशैः by spears, खण्डीकृतैः by the broken ones, खङ्गैः with swords, प्रासैः by darts, विकीर्णैः by the  scattered, परश्वधैः by battleaxes, चूर्णिताभिः by those crushed into small pieces, शिलाभिश्च stones, अनेकशः many, विच्छिन्नैः broken, शरैः arrows, विकीर्णा scattered, भूमिः on the ground, भयंकरा frightening, अभूत्  to see.

26_1.shloka: [Dusana and his army chiefs get killed in severe combat with Ramathe  demon army also gets destroyed]दूषणस्तु स्वकं सैन्यं हन्यमानं निरीक्ष्य सः।सन्दिदेश महाबाहुर्भीमवेगान्दुरासदान्।।3.26.1।।राक्षसान्पञ्चसहस्रान्समरेष्वनिवर्तिनः।
26_1.translation: Mightyarmed Dusana saw  the army  getting killed in war. He led the forces of five thousand demons, dreadfuly quick at fighting, dangeous to face and who will not beat a retreat.
26_1.word_by_word: सः that, महाबाहुः  mightyarmed, दूषणः Dusana, हन्यमानम्  getting killed, स्वकम् his own, सैन्यम् army, निरीक्ष्य  seeing, भीमवेगान्  dreadfuly quick, दुरासदान्  dangerous to face, समरेषु in war, अनिवर्तिनः who will not beat a retreat, पञ्च सहस्रान् five thousand, राक्षसान् demons, सन्दिदेश led.

26_2.shloka: ते शूलैः पट्टिशैः खङ्गै शिलावर्षैर्द्रुमैरपि।।3.26.2।।शरवर्षैरविच्छिन्नं ववर्षुस्तं समन्ततः।
26_2.translation: The demons continuously hurled at him (Rama)  spears and swords and rained stones, trees and arrows from all sides
26_2.word_by_word: ते they, शूलैः  spears, पट्टिशैः  sharpedged spears, खङ्गै: swords, शिलावर्षैः by raining stones, द्रुमैरपि and with trees, शरवर्षैः by showers of arrows, अविच्छिन्नम् continuously, समन्ततः from all sides, तम् him(Rama), ववर्षुः rained.

26_3.shloka: स दृमाणां शिलानां च वर्षं प्राणहरं महत्।।3.26.3।।प्रतिजग्राह धर्मात्मा राघवस्तीक्ष्णसायकैः।
26_3.translation: Righteous Rama, retaliated with his sharp arrows such as the rain of trees and stones, the mighty destroyers of life.
26_3.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous self, सः राघवः  Rama, प्राणहरम् destroyers of life, महत् mighty, द्रुमाणाम् trees, शिलानां च of stones and, वर्षम् rain, तीक्ष्णसायकैः with sharp arrows, प्रतिजग्राह retaliated.

26_4.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य च तद्वर्षं निमीलित इवर्षभः।।3.26.4।।रामः क्रोधं परं भेजे वधार्थं सर्वरक्षसाम्।
26_4.translation: Rama retaliated in great anger to kill without caring for the shower of weapons like a bull with its eyes closed.
26_4.word_by_word: रामः Rama, निमीलितः closed his eyes, ऋषभः इव like a bull, तत् that, वर्षम् rain, प्रतिगृह्य  retaliated, सर्वरक्षसाम् all the demons, वधार्थम् to kill, परं excessively, क्रोधम् angry, भेजे felt.

26_5.shloka: ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टः प्रदीप्त इव तेजसा।।3.26.5।।शरैरवाकिरत्सैन्यं सर्वतस्सहदूषणम्।
26_5.translation: Overpowered by anger, Rama, with a blazing glow, covered Dusana and his army with his arrows.
26_5.word_by_word: ततः then, क्रोधसमाविष्टः overpowered by anger, तेजसा glow, प्रदीप्त इव as though blazing, सहदूषणम् along with Dusana, सैन्यम् army, सर्वतः all over, शरैः with arrows, अवाकिरत् filled.

26_6.translation: Thereafter Dusana, chief of the army, angrily released at Rama equally powerful arrows comparable to thunderbolt.
26_6.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सेनापतिः chief of the army, दूषणः Dusana, क्रुद्धः angry, अशनिकल्पैः  comparable to thunderbolt, शरैः with arrows, तं राघवम् to that Rama, समवाकिरत् charged from everywhere.

26_7.shloka: ततो रामस्सुसङ्कृद्धः क्षुरेणास्य महद्धनुः।।3.26.7।।चिच्छेद समरे वीरश्चतुर्भिश्चतुरो हयान्।
26_7.translation: Heroic Rama, mighty angry, then, broke the big bow of  Dusana, with his swordlike arrow. And with a series of four arrows cut his four horses to pieces.
26_7.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, सुसङ्कृद्धः became furious, समरे in war, वीरः hero, रामः Rama, क्षुरेण with a swordlike, अस्य his, महत् great, धनुः bow, चतुर्भिः  four more, चतुरः four, हयान् horses, चिच्छेद cut to pieces.

26_8.shloka: हत्वा चाश्वान्शरैस्तीक्ष्णैरर्धचन्द्रेण सारथेः।।3.26.8।।शिरो जहार तद्रक्षस्त्रिभिर्विव्याध वक्षसि।
26_8.translation: After killing the horses with sharp arrows Rama severed the charioteer's head with an arrow of the shape of the crescent moon and pierced Dusana's chest with a set of three arrows.
26_8.word_by_word: तीक्ष्णैः sharp ones, शरैः  arrows, अश्वान् horses, हत्वा killed, अर्धचन्द्रेण with an arrow of the shape of the cresunt moon, सारथेः charioteer's, शिरः head, जहार cut, त्रिभिः with three arrows, तत् that, रक्षः demon( Dushana), वक्षसि chest, विव्याध pierced.

26_9.shloka: स च्छिन्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः।।3.26.9।।जग्राह गिरिशृङ्गाभं परिघं रोमहर्षणम्।वेष्टितं काञ्चनैः पट्टैर्देवसैन्यप्रमर्दनम्।।3.26.10।।आयसैश्शङ्कुभिस्तीक्ष्णैः कीर्णं परवसोक्षितम्।वज्राशनिसमस्पर्शं परगोपुरदारणम्।।3.26.11।।
26_9.translation: With his bow and chariot broken, charioteer and horses killed,  Dusana took up a spear in his hand that appeared like a huge mountain top. Bound by golden bands, covered the iron nails, wetted with the enemy's marrow it created a horripilation. It appeared as though it  could crush the army of gods and render the enemy powerless. It carried the killing touch of the thunderbolt and could break open the enemy's fort.
26_9.word_by_word: छिन्नधन्वा  with broken bow, विरथः no chariot, हताश्वः  horses killled, हतसारथिः  charioteer killed, सः he, गिरिशृङ्गाभम्  looking like a huge mountain top, रोमहर्षणम् causing horripilation, काञ्चनैः with golden, पट्टैः with bands, वेष्टितम् bound, देवसैन्यप्रमर्दनम् that which can crush even gods' army, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, आयसैः made of iron, शङ्कुभिः with nails, कीर्णम् covered, परवसोक्षितम्  sprinkled with enemy's marrow, वज्राशनिसमस्पर्शम् like the touch of thunderbolt, परगोपुरदारणम् that which can break open enemies fort, परिघम्  spear, जग्राह took up .

26_10.shloka: तं महोरगसङ्काशं प्रगृह्य परिघं रणे।दूषणोऽभ्यद्रवद्रामं क्रूरकर्मा निशाचरः।।3.26.12।।
26_10.translation: With the spear that looked like a mighty serpent, Dusana, the cruel demon, advanced towards Rama.
26_10.word_by_word: क्रूरकर्मा cruel, निशाचरः demon, दूषणः Dusana, रणे in war, महोरगसङ्काशम् mighty serpent like, तं परिघम्  spear, प्रगृह्य holding, रामम् at Rama, अभ्यद्रवत् went forward.

26_11.shloka: तस्याभिपतमानस्य दूषणस्य स राघवः।द्वाभ्यां शराभ्यां चिच्छेद सहस्ताभरणौ भुजौ।।3.26.13।।
26_11.translation: Seeing Dusana going to pounce upon him, Rama cut off with two arrows both his arms adorned with armlets.
26_11.word_by_word: सः राघवः that Rama, अभिपतमानस्य  pouncing on him, तस्य दूषणस्य that Dusana, सहस्ताभरणौ adorned with armlets, भुजौ द्वाभ्याम् with two, शराभ्याम् with arrows, चिच्छेद cut.

26_12.shloka: भ्रष्टस्तस्य महाकायः पपात रणमूर्धनि।परिघश्छिन्नहस्तस्य शक्रध्वज इवाग्रतः।।3.26.14।।
26_12.translation: With the hands amputated, his huge spear, like the banner of Indra, slipped off his hands and fell down on the ground on the battle front.
26_12.word_by_word: रणमूर्धनि on the battle front, छिन्नहस्तस्य of one whose hands were cut off, तस्य his, महाकायः huge body, परिघः spear, भ्रष्टः fallen down, शक्रध्वजः इव like the banner of Indra, अग्रतः in front, पपात fell down.

26_13.shloka: स कराभ्यां विकीर्णाभ्यां पपात भुवि दूषणः।विषाणाभ्यां विशीर्णाभ्यां मनस्वीव महागजः।।3.26.15।।
26_13.translation: Dusana fell down on the ground with broken hands like a proud elephant with both his tusks shattered.
26_13.word_by_word: सः दूषणः  Dusana, विकीर्णाभ्याम्  scattered, कराभ्याम् with both hands, विशीर्णाभ्याम् shattered to pieces, विषाणाभ्याम् with two tusks, मनस्वी proud one, महागजः इव like a mighty elephant, भुवि ground, पपात fell down.

26_14.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ दूषणं निहतं रणे।साधुसाध्विति काकुत्स्थं सर्वभूतान्यपूजयन्।।3.26.16।।
26_14.translation: Seeing Dusaana collapse dead on the ground, all beings hailed Rama, saying, 'Well done, well done'.
26_14.word_by_word: रणे in battle, निहतम् killed, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen down, तं दूषणम् that Dusana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सर्वभूतानि all beings, काकुत्स्थम् Rama, साधु साधु इति saying, 'well done well done', अपूजयन् hailed.

26_15.shloka: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रुद्धास्त्रयः सेनाग्रयायिनः।संहृत्याभ्यद्रवन् रामं मृत्युपाशावपाशिताः।।3.26.17।।महाकपालः स्थूलाक्षः प्रमाथी च महाबलः।
