26_15.translation: Meanwhile all the three army chiefs, Mahakapala, Sthulaksha, and the mighty Pramathi ran towards Rama in anger, bound (as though) by the noose of death.
26_15.word_by_word: एतस्मिन् अन्तरे meanwhile, क्रुद्धाः angry  , महाकपालः Mahakapala, स्थूलाक्षः Stulaksha, महाबलः mighty, प्रमाथी च Pramathi, त्रयः all three, सेनाग्रयायिनः army chiefs, मृत्युपाशावपाशिताः  bound by the noose of death, संहृत्य all together, रामम् Rama, अभ्यद्रवन् ran towards.

26_16.shloka: महाकपालो विपुलं शूलमुद्यम्य राक्षसः।।3.26.18।।स्थूलाक्षः पट्टिसं गृह्य प्रमाथी च परश्वधम्।
26_16.translation: Mahakapala had a huge spear, Sthulaksha, a sharpedged spear and Pramathi, a battleaxe.
26_16.word_by_word: महाकपालः Mahakapala, विपुलम् huge, शूलम् spear, उद्यम्य  lifted up, स्थूलाक्षः Sthulaksha, राक्षसः demon, पट्टिसम् sharpedged spear, गृह्य holding, प्रमाथी च and Pramathi too, परश्वधं च with a battleaxe.

26_17.translation: On seeing them rushing to attack him with sharp weapons, Rama received them quickly with pointed arrows as though they were guests.
26_17.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, तूर्णम् quickly, आपततः  attacking, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, शितैः with sharp weapons, तीक्ष्णाग्रैः  pointed , सायकैः with arrows, सम्प्राप्तान् those who arrived, अतिथीनिव like guests, प्रतिजग्राह received.

26_18.shloka: महाकपालस्य शिरश्चिच्छेद परमेषुभिः।।3.26.20।।असङ्ख्येयैस्तु बाणौघैः प्रममाथ प्रमाथिनम्।स पपात हतो भूमौ विटपीव महाद्रुमः।।3.26.21।।
26_18.translation: Mahakapala's head was cut to pieces with sharp arrows and Pramathi was killed with a countless series  of arrows. Pramathi's body, like a huge tree with many branches collapsed on the ground.
26_18.word_by_word: परमेषुभिः sharp arrows, महाकपालस्य Mahakapala's, शिरः head, चिच्छेद cut to pieces, असङ्ख्येयैः with innumerable, बाणौघैः  arrows, प्रमाथिनम् Pramathi also, प्रममाथ killed, सः he, हतः dead, विटपी with branches, महाद्रुमः इव like a huge tree, भूमौ on the ground, पपात fell down.

26_19.shloka: स्थूलाक्षस्याक्षिणी तीक्ष्णैः पूरयामास सायकैः।दूषणस्यानुगान्पञ्चसहस्रान्कुपितः क्षणात्।।3.26.22।।बाणौघैः पञ्चसाहस्रैरनयद्यमसादनम्।
26_19.translation: Rama filled the eyes of Sthulaksha with sharp arrows, and in anger shot five thousand arrows at the five thousand followers of Dusana in a moment and sent them to the abode of Yama.
26_19.word_by_word: स्थूलाक्षस्य Sthulaksha's, अक्षिणी eyes, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, सायकैः with arrows, पूरयामास filled, कुपितः an angry, पञ्चसाहस्रैः with five thousand, बाणौघैः with arrows, दूषणस्य Dusana's, पञ्चसाहस्रान् five thousand, अनुगान् followers, क्षणात् in a moment, यमसादनम् to the abode of Yama, अनयत् sent.

26_20.shloka: दूषणं निहतं दृष्ट्वा तस्य चैव पदानुगान्।।3.26.23।।व्यादिदेश खरः क्रुद्धः सेनाध्यक्षान्महाबलान्।
26_20.translation: Seeing Dusana and his followers killed, enraged Khara commanded his extremely strong army chiefs this way:
26_20.word_by_word: दूषणं Dusana, निहतम् killed, तस्य his, पदानुगान् followers, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, खरः Khara, क्रुद्धः angry , महाबलान् extremely strong, सेनाध्यक्षान् chiefs of the army, व्यादिदेश commanded.

26_21.shloka: अयं विनिहतस्संख्ये दूषणस्सपदानुगः।।3.26.24।।महत्या सेनया सार्धं युद्ध्वा रामं कुमानुषम्।शस्त्रैर्नानाविधाकारैर्हनध्वं सर्वराक्षसाः।।3.26.25।।
26_21.translation: Dusana and his followers are killed in the battle. You, all the demons, along with your great army and different kinds of weapons should kill that wicked human being, Rama.
26_21.word_by_word: अयं this one, सपदानुगः along with his followers, दूषणः Dooshana, सङ्ख्ये in battle, (वि)निहतः killed, सर्व राक्षसाः all the demons, महत्या with great, सेनयासार्धम् along with army, युद्ध्वा after fighting, नानाविधाकारैः different kinds, शस्त्रैः weapons, कुमानुषम् wicked human being, रामम् Rama, हनध्वम्  should kill.

26_22.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा खरः क्रुद्धो राममेवाभिदुद्रुवे।श्येनगामी पृथुग्रीवो यज्ञशत्रुर्विहङ्गमः।।3.26.26।।दुर्जयः करवीराक्षः परुषः कालकार्मुकः।मेघमाली महामाली सर्पास्यो रुधिराशनः।।3.26.27।।द्वादशैते महावीर्या बलाध्यक्षास्ससैनिकाः।राममेवाभ्यधावन्त विसृजन्तश्शरोत्तमान्।।3.26.28।।
26_22.translation: Having spoken thus, angry Khara ran towards Rama. Syenagami, Pruthugriva, Yajnasatru, Vihanga, Durjaya, Karaveeraksha, Parusha, Kalakarmuka, Meghamali, Mahamali, Sarpasya, Rudhirasanaall these twelve valiant army chiefs along with their forces rushed towards Rama, releasing the sharpest arrows at him.
26_22.word_by_word: खरः Khara, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, क्रुद्धः angry  one, राममेव towards Rama, अभिदुद्रुवे ran, श्येनगामी Syenagami, पृथुग्रीवः Pruthugriva, यज्ञशत्रुः Yajnasatru, विहङ्गमः Vihangama, दुर्जयः Durjaya, करवीराक्षः Karaveeraksha, परुषः Parusha, कालकार्मुकः Kalakarmuka, मेघमाली Meghamali, महामाली Mahamali, सर्पास्य: Sarpasya, रुधिराशनःRudhirasana, एते these, महावीर्याः mighty heroes, द्वादश twelve, बलाध्यक्षाः army chiefs, ससैनिकाः with army, शरोत्तमान् sharpest of arrows, विसृजन्तः releasing, राममेव towards Rama  alone, अभ्यधावन्त ran forward.

26_23.shloka: ततः पावकसङ्काशैर्हेमवज्रविभूषितैः।जघान शेषं तेजस्वी तस्य सैन्यस्य सायकैः।।3.26.29।।
26_23.translation: Powerful Rama thereafter slayed the remaining army with his weapons studded with gold and diamonds and glowing like fire.
26_23.word_by_word: तेजस्वी powerful Rama, ततः then, पावकसङ्काशैः  glowing like fire, हेमवज्रविभूषितैः studded with gold and diamonds, सायकैः arrows, तस्य his, सैन्यस्य army's, शेषम् remaining, जघान slayed.

26_24.shloka: ते रुक्मपुङ्खा विशिखास्सधूमा इव पावकाः।निजघ्नुस्तानि रक्षांसि वज्रा इव महाद्रुमान्।।3.26.30।।
26_24.translation: The goldtipped arrows which resembled fire covered with smoke shattered the army of demons like huge trees knocked down by thunder.
26_24.word_by_word: रुक्मपुङ्खाः goldtipped arrows, सधूमाः covered with smoke, पावकाः इव like fire, ते विशिखाः tips of arrows, वज्राः thunderbolts, महाद्रुमानिव like huge trees, तानि those, रक्षांसि demons, निजघ्नुः shattered.

26_25.shloka: रक्षसां तु शतं रामश्शतेनैकेन कर्णिना।सहस्रं च सहस्रेण जघान रणमूर्धनि।।3.26.31।।
26_25.translation: Rama killed a hundred demons  with one hundred arrows by a single stroke. The same way he killed a thousand of them with a thousand arrows on the battle front.
26_25.word_by_word: रामः Rama, रक्षसाम् of demons, शतम् one hundred, एकेन कर्णिना by a single stroke, शतेन one hundred, सहस्रम् thousand, सहस्रेण thousand, रणमूर्धनि on the battle front, जघान killed.

26_26.translation: The demons fell down on the ground with their shields  and ornaments broken, their  bows stained with blood splintered.
26_26.word_by_word: तैः by them, भिन्नवर्माभरणाः  with broken shields and ornaments, छिन्नभिन्नशरासनाः the bows broken to pieces, रजनीचराः demons, शोणिता दिग्धाः smeared with blood, धरण्याम् on the ground, निपेतुः fell.

26_27.shloka: तैर्मुक्तकेशैस्समरे पतितैश्शोणितोक्षितैः।आस्तीर्णा वसुधा कृत्स्ना महावेदिः कुशैरिव।।3.26.33।।
26_27.translation: The entire ground was littered with bodies of demons fallen in the battle with loose hair and with drops of blood on them looking like a great sacrificial altar strewn all over with kusa grass.
26_27.word_by_word: समरे in the battle, पतितैः by those fallen down, मुक्तकेशैः loose hair, शोणितोक्षितैः by those wet with blood, तैः those, कृत्स्ना entire, वसुधा ground, महावेदिः a great sacrificial altar, कुशैरिव like the Kusa grass, आस्तीर्णा was spread all over.

26_28.shloka: क्षणेन तु महाघोरं वनं निहतराक्षसम्।बभूव निरयप्रख्यं मांसशोणितकर्दमम्।।3.26.34।।
26_28.translation: With the slaughtered bodies of demons lying on the ground, the forest in a moment looked very dreadful like hell with the mud of soil soaked with flesh and blood.
26_28.word_by_word: निहतराक्षसम् with demons killed, वनम् the forest, क्षणेन तु in a moment, महाघोरम् verydreadful, मांसशोणितकर्दमम् soil soaked with the mud of flesh and blood, निरयप्रख्य like a hell, बभूव appeared.

26_29.shloka: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।हतान्येकेन रामेण मानुषेण पदातिना।।3.26.35।।
26_29.translation: Fourteen thousand formidable demons were killed by Rama, a pedestrian human,  singlehanded.
26_29.word_by_word: मानुषेण by a human being, पदातिना going on foot, रामेण Rama, एकेन alone, भीमकर्मणाम्  of formidable  acts, रक्षसाम् demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousands, हतानि were killed.

26_30.shloka: तस्य सैन्यस्य सर्वस्य खरश्शेषो महारथः।राक्षसस्त्रिशिराश्चैव रामश्च रिपुसूदनः।।3.26.36।।
26_30.translation: Of that entire army great warrior Khara,Trisira and Rama, destroyer of foes alone remained.
26_30.word_by_word: महारथः great warrior, खरः Khara, राक्षसः demon, त्रिशिराः Trisira, तस्य सैन्सस्य सर्वस्य of that entire army, शेषः were remanant, रिपुसूदनः destroyer of foes, रामश्च Rama also.

26_31.shloka: शेषा हता महासत्वा राक्षसा रणमूर्धनि।घोरा दुर्विषहाः सर्वे लक्ष्मणस्याग्रजेन ते।।3.26.37।।
26_31.translation: The rest of the mighty, dreadful, intolerable demons were killed on the war front byRama, elder brother to Lakshmana.
26_31.word_by_word: महासत्त्वाः mighty, घोराः dreadful, दुर्विषहाः intolerable, सर्वे all, शेषाः the remaining, ते they, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, अग्रजेन by the elder brother, रणमूर्धनि on the battle front, हताः were killed.

26_32.shloka: ततस्तु तद्भीमबलं महाहवे समीक्ष्य रामेण हतं बलीयसा।रथेन रामं महता खरस्तदा समाससादेन्द्र इवोद्यताशनिः।।3.26.38।।
26_32.translation: Thereafter seeing the formidable army killed by mighty Rama, Khara lifted a thunderbolt like Indra, and advanced towards Rama in a great chariot.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वालमिकिय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षङ्विंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga in Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
26_32.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, खरः Khara, महाहवे in the great fight, बलीयसा by the mighty, रामेण by Rama, हतम् killed, तत् that, भीमबलम् formidable army, समीक्ष्य  seeing, तदा then, उद्यताशनिः  raised thunderbolt, इन्द्र इव like Indra, महता with a great, रथेन chariot, रामम् Rama, समाससाद went forward.

27_1.shloka: [Rama's fight with Trisira -- death of Trisira.]खरं तु रामाभिमुखं प्रयान्तं वाहिनीपतिः।राक्षसस्त्रिशिरा नाम सन्निपत्येदमब्रवीत्।।3.27.1।।
27_1.translation: As Khara advanced towards Rama, Trisira the chief of the army approached him and said these words:
27_1.word_by_word: रामाभिमुखम् approaching Rama, प्रयान्तम् marching towards, खरम् Khara, वाहिनीपतिः chief of army, त्रिशिराः Trisira, नाम by name, राक्षसः demon, सन्निपत्य going near, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

27_2.shloka: मां नियोजय विक्रान्त सन्निवर्तस्व साहसात्।पश्य रामं महाबाहुं संयुगे विनिपातितम्।।3.27.2।।
27_2.translation: O valiant one assign this work to me. Refrain from this audacity. See how I am going to put down the mightyarmed Rama in the battle.
27_2.word_by_word: विक्रान्तः valiant Khara, माम् me, नियोजय assign, साहसात् audacity, निवर्तस्व put down, संयुगे in the combat, विनिपातितम् thrown down, महाबाहुम् mightyarmed , रामम् Rama, पश्य you can see.

27_3.shloka: प्रतिजानामि ते सत्यमायुधं चाहमालभे।यथा रामं वधिष्यामि वधार्हं सर्वरक्षसाम्।।3.27.3।।
27_3.translation: I promise you on my weapon that I will kill Rama.He who killed all demons deserves to be slain.
27_3.word_by_word: अहम् I, ते to you, सत्यम् truth, प्रतिजानामि I promise, आयुधं च on my weapon, आलभे I am touching, यथा as, सर्वरक्षसाम् of all demons, वधार्हम् should be slain, रामम् Rama, वधिष्यामि I will kill.

27_4.shloka: अहं वास्य रणे मृत्युरेष वा समरे मम।विनिवृत्य रणोत्साहान्मुहूर्तं प्राश्निको भव।।3.27.4।।
27_4.translation: Restrain yourself for a moment from the enthusiasm to fight the war. Please act as an arbitrator and see who is killing whom.
27_4.word_by_word: रणोत्साहात् from the enthusiasm to fight, विनिवृत्य  restraining, रणे in fight, अहम् I, अस्य his, मृत्युः death, वा or, समरे in war, एषः this person, मम mine, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, प्राश्निकः a judge भव become.

27_5.shloka: प्रहृष्टो वा हते रामे जनस्थानं प्रयास्यसि।मयि वा निहते रामं संयुगायोपयास्यसि।।3.27.5।।
27_5.translation: If Rama is killed be happy and go to Janasthana or else if I am killed you can fight.
27_5.word_by_word: रामे when Rama, हते is killed, प्रहृष्टः with joy, जनस्थानम् to Janasthanam, प्रयास्यसि वा you will go or else, मयि वा when myself, निहते am killed, संयुगाय to the fight, रामम् Rama, उपयास्यसि वा you can fight.

27_6.shloka: खरस्त्रिशिरसा तेन मृत्युलोभात्प्रसादितः।गच्छ युध्येत्यनुज्ञातो राघवाभिमुखो ययौ।।3.27.6।।
27_6.translation: When Khara was prevailed upon by Trisara in that manner with a wish to face death, Khara  permitted him  by saying 'You may go and fight'.Accordingly he advanced towards Rama.
27_6.word_by_word: खरः Khara, तेन by him, त्रिशिरसा by Trisira, मृत्युलोभात् due to eagerness to face death, प्रसादितः persuaded, गच्छ you may go, युध्य you may fight, इति thus, अनुज्ञातः permitted, राघवाभिमुखः forward to Rama, ययौ he went.

27_7.shloka: त्रिशिराश्च रथेनैव वाजियुक्तेन भास्वता।अभ्यद्रवद्रणे रामं त्रिशृङ्ग इव पर्वतः।।3.27.7।।
27_7.translation: Trisira who looked a mountain with three peaks also got horses harnessed to a shining chariot and to attack Rama proceeded.
27_7.word_by_word: त्रिशिराश्च Trisira also, वाजियुक्तेन  horses harnessed, भास्वता shining, रथेनैव in a chariot, त्रिशृङ्गः three peaked Trishringa, पर्वतः इव mountain like, रणे in war, रामम् Rama, अभ्यद्रवत् attacked.

27_8.shloka: शरधारासमूहान्स महामेघ इवोत्सृजन्।व्यसृजत्सदृशं नादं जलार्द्रस्य तु दुन्दुभेः।।3.27.8।।
27_8.translation: Trisira unleashed a stream of arrows like a huge cloud (releasing rain). They produced sound, a drum drenched with water, creates.
27_8.word_by_word: सः that Trisira, महामेघ इव like a huge cloud, शरधारासमूहान् streams of arrows, उत्सृजन्  unleashing, जलार्द्रस्य drenched with water, दुन्दुभेः of the drum, सदृशम् similar, नादम् sound, व्यसृजत् released.

27_9.shloka: आगच्छन्तं त्रिशिरसं राक्षसं प्रेक्ष्य राघवः।धनुषा प्रतिजग्राह विधुन्वन्सायकान् शितान्।।3.27.9।।
27_9.translation: On seeing demon Trisira advancing towards him, Rama shook sharp arrows off his bow.
27_9.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, आगच्छन्तम् advancing towards him, राक्षसम् the demon, त्रिशिरसम् Trisira, प्रेक्षय observing, शितान् sharp, सायकान् arrow, धनुषा setting the bow, विधुन्वन् shaking, प्रतिजग्राह retaliated.

27_10.translation: The tumultuous combat between Rama and Trisira looked like the strong fight between a lion and an elephant.
27_10.word_by_word: रामत्रिशिरसोः between Rama and Trisira, तुमुलः tumultuous, महान् great, सः सम्प्रहारः that fight, अतीव very, बलिनोः strong ones, सिंहकुञ्जरयोः इव as between a lion and an elephant, बभूव took place.

27_11.translation: Then Rama hit  with three arrows on the forehead by Trisira flew into a fury and said in a state of great excitement:
27_11.word_by_word: ततः then, अमर्षी intolerant, रामः Rama, त्रिशिरसा by Trisira, त्रिभिः with three, बाणैः arrows, ललाटे on the forehead, ताडितः was hit, कुपितः a furious one, संरब्धम् very agitated, इदम् this way, अब्रवीत् he said.

27_12.shloka: अहो विक्रमशूरस्य राक्षसस्येदृशं बलम्।पुष्पैरिव शरैर्यस्य ललाटेऽस्मिन्परिक्षतः।।3.27.12।।
27_12.translation: Oh see the strength of this undaunted demon whose arrows fell like flowers on my forehead and only left a scratch.
27_12.word_by_word: अहो Oh, विक्रमशूरस्य of an undaunted hero, राक्षसस्य of the demon, बलम् strength, ईदृशम् this amount, यस्य his, शरैः with arrows, पुष्पैरिव with flowers, अस्मिन् ललाटे this forehead, परिक्षतः scratched.

27_13.shloka: ममापि प्रतिगृह्णीष्व शरांश्चापगुणाच्च्युतान्।एवमुक्त्वा तु संरब्धश्शरानाशीविषोपमान्।3.27.13।।त्रिशिरोवक्षसि क्रुद्धो निजघान चतुर्दश।
27_13.translation: Receive the arrows released from my bowstring. Saying so, the angry and agitated Rama discharged fourteen arrows, venomous like a snake, on the chest of Trisira .
27_13.word_by_word: मम my, चापगुणातच्च्युतान् released from the string of the bow, शरानपि arrows too, प्रतिगृह्णीष्व you may receive, एवम् in that manner, उक्त्वा having said, संरब्धः agitated, क्रुद्धः angry, अशीविषोपमान् like the poison of a venomous snake, चतुर्दश fourteen, शरान् arrows, त्रिशिरोवक्षसि on the chest of Trisira, निजघान hit.

27_14.shloka: चतुर्भिस्तुरगानस्य शरैः सन्नतपर्वभिः।।3.27.14।।न्यपातयत तेजस्वी चतुरस्तस्य वाजिनः।
27_14.translation: With four arrows having strong joints, the mighty hero (Rama) threw down his enemy's four swiftfooted horses.
27_14.word_by_word: तेजस्वी mighty man, सन्नतपर्वभिः with those having strong joints, चतुर्भिः with four, शरैः with arrows, तस्य his, अस्य his (Rama's), तुरगान् swift, चतुरः four, वाजिनः horses, न्यपातयत threw down.

27_15.translation: Rama brought down the charioteer with eight arrows and with one tore down the lofty banner of the chariot to shreds.
27_15.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अष्टभिः with eight, सायकैः arrows, सूतम् charioteer, रथोपस्थात् from the top of the chariot, न्यपातयत् brought down, बाणेन by one dart, अस्य his, समुच्छ्रितम् very lofty, ध्वजम् banner, चिच्छेद shattered to pieces.

27_16.shloka: ततो हतरथात्तस्मादुत्पतन्तं निशाचरम्।।3.27.16।।बिभेद रामस्तं बाणैर्हृदये सोऽभवज्जडः।
27_16.translation: Rama then hit the demon with arrows on his chest while he was running away from the broken chariot. The demon became numb.
27_16.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, तस्मात् from that, हतरथात् from a broken chariot, उत्पतन्तम् one who was running away, तं निशाचरम् that demon, बाणैः with arrows, हृदये in the chest, बिभेद hit, सः he, जडः a numb man, अभवत् became.

27_17.translation: The mighty Rama in fury dismembered the heads of that demon with three sharp and swift arrows.
27_17.word_by_word: अप्रमेयात्मा a man of boundless strength, रामः Rama, सामर्षः an enraged one, वेगवद्भि: swift, शितैः with sharp ones, त्रिभिः three, सायकैः with arrows, तस्य रक्षसः that demon's, शिरांसि head, अपातयत् cut down.

27_18.shloka: स भूमौ रुधिरोद्गारी रामबाणाभिपीडितः।।3.27.18।।न्यपतत्पतितैः पूर्वं स्वशिरोभिर्निशाचरः।
27_18.translation: The demon with his heads decapitated, hit by Rama's arrows a little while ago, fell down, vomitting blood.
27_18.word_by_word: रामबाणाभिपीडितः hit by the arrows of Rama, सः निशाचरः that demon, रुधिरोद्गारी vomitting blood, पूर्वम् a little while ago, पतितैः fallen down, स्वशिरोभिः with his heads, न्यपतत् fell down.

27_19.shloka: हतशेषास्ततो भग्ना राक्षसाः खरसंश्रया।।3.27.19।।द्रवन्ति स्म न तिष्ठन्ति व्याघ्रत्रस्ता मृगा इव।
27_19.translation: Those surviving demons who were under the protection of Khara got scared and retreated fast and fled like deer frightened by a tiger.
27_19.word_by_word: ततः then, खरसंश्रया under the protection of Khara, हतशेषाः surviving, राक्षसाः demons, भग्नाः with broken hearts, व्याघ्रतस्ताः those scared of  tiger, मृगाः यथा like deer, द्रवन्ति स्म fast retreated, न तिष्ठन्ति did not stop.

27_20.shloka: तान्खरो द्रवतो दृष्ट्वा निवर्त्य रुषितस्स्वयम्।।3.27.20।।राममेवाभिदुद्राव राहुश्चन्द्रमसं यथा।
27_20.translation: Personally persuading the fleeing army to come back, the angry Khara leaped forward towards Rama just as Rahu approaches the moon.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
27_20.word_by_word: रुषितः angry, खरः Khara, द्रवतः retreating, तान् them, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, स्वयम् personally, निवर्त्य turning them back, राहुः Rahu, चन्द्रमसं यथा as towards Moon राममेव towards Rama alone, अभिदुद्राव ran after.

28_1.shloka: [Combat between Rama and Khara---- wounded Khara gets down the chariot to fight-- deities assemble-- worship great Rama.]निहतं दूषणं दृष्ट्वा रणे त्रिशिरसा सह।खरस्याप्यभवत्त्रासो दृष्ट्वा रामस्य विक्रमम्।।3.28.1।।
28_1.translation: Khara was overtaken by fear at the prowess of Rama, when he saw Dusana and Trisira killed.
28_1.word_by_word: रणे in combat, त्रिशिरसा सह with Trisira, निहतम्  killed, दूषणम् Dusana, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, रामस्य Rama's, विक्रमम् prowess, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, खरस्यापि to Khara also, त्रासः fear, अभवत् overcame.

28_2.shloka: स दृष्ट्वा राक्षसं सैन्यमविसह्यं महाबलः।हतमेकेन रामेण त्रिशिरोदूषणावपि।।3.28.2।।तद्बलं हतभूयिष्ठं विमनाः प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसः।आससाद खरो रामं नमुचिर्वासवं यथा।।3.28.3।।
28_2.translation: Khara, the mighty demon, saw his large, irrepressible army killed. He saw Trisira and Dusana slain singlehanded by Rama. Nervous, he advanced towards Rama wage war just as Namuchi approached Indra.
28_2.word_by_word: महाबलः extremely strong, राक्षसः demon, खरः Khara, अविसह्यम् irrepressible, राक्षसम् demon, सैन्यम् army, एकेन  alone, रामेण by Rama, हतम् killed, त्रिशिरोदूषणावपि Trisira and Dusana also, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, हतभूयिष्टम् very many killed, तत् बलम् the strength, विमनाः nervous प्रेक्ष्य witnessing, नमुचिः Namuchi, वासवं यथा similar to Indra, रामम् Rama, आससाद went towards.

28_3.translation: Khara drew his strong bowstring in anger and released the bloodhungry arrows, which appeared like venomous snakes.
28_3.word_by_word: खरः Khara, बलवत् strong, चापम् bowstring, विकृष्य drawing, क्रुद्धान् angry, आशीविषानिव like venom of a poisonous serpent, रक्तभोजनान् whose food is blood, नाराचान् arrows, रामाय at Rama, चिक्षेप sent forth.

28_4.shloka: ज्यां विधून्वंसुबहुशश्शिक्षयास्त्राणि दर्शयन्।चचार समरे मार्गाञ्छरै रथगतः खरः।।3.28.5।।
28_4.translation: Khara, sat on the chariot, and with a twang of his bowstring released arrows in all directions, exhibiting his skill in the use of weapons.
28_4.word_by_word: रथगतः sittting on the chariot, खरः Khara, सुबहुशः in many ways, ज्याम् bowstring, विधून्वन् while making a twang, शिक्षया with training, अस्त्राणि weapons, दर्शयन् while exhibiting, समरे in war, शरैः arrows, मार्गाणि in all directions, चचार released.

28_5.shloka: स सर्वाश्च दिशो बाणैः प्रदिशश्च महारथः।पूरयामास तं दृष्ट्वा रामोऽपि सुमहद्धनुः।।3.28.6।।
28_5.translation: When Rama, the great warrior, saw Khara approaching him, he fixed powerful arrows  on his bow and covered all directions and intermediate quarters with his arrows.
28_5.word_by_word: महारथः great warrior, सः he, सर्वाः all, दिशः sides, प्रदिशश्च intermediate directions, बाणैः arrows, पूरयामास filled, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा saw, रामोऽपि even Rama, सुमहत् powerful, धनुः bow, पूरयामास started filling.

28_6.translation: He rained sparkling arrows which were irresistible. He filled the sky with arrows just as the raingod fills it with rain without leaving any space.
28_6.word_by_word: सः he, दुर्विसहैः by irresistible, सस्फुलिङ्गैः with sparkling, अग्निभिः इव like fire, सायकैः with arrows, पर्जन्यः cloud, वृष्टिभिः इव with showers like, नभः the sky, अविवरम् not leaving any space, चकार filled.

28_7.translation: The arrows released by Khara and Rama on one another filled the entire sky. Everywhere only arrows and no sky could be seen.
28_7.word_by_word: खररामविसर्जितैः  released by Khara and Rama, शितैः by sharp, बाणैः with arrows, तत् that, पर्याकाशम्  surrounding sky, सर्वतः all over, शरसङ्कुलम् filled with arrows, अनाकाशम् as though there is no sky, बभूव appeared.

28_8.translation: While they were engaged in the battle, eager to kill each other the sky was covered with arrow and the Sun could not be seen.
28_8.word_by_word: अन्योन्यवधसंरम्भात् eager to kill each other, उभयोः both, सम्प्रयुध्यतोः of those waging (fighting), तदा then, शरजालावृतः covered with arrows, सूर्यः Sun, न प्रकाशते स्म not seen.

28_9.shloka: ततो नालीकनाराचैस्तीक्ष्णाग्रैश्च विकर्णिभिः।आजघान खरो रामं तोत्रैरिव महाद्विपम्।।3.28.10।।
28_9.translation: Then Khara shot Rama with Nalika darts and darts called Vikarni like goads hit a mighty elephant.
28_9.word_by_word: ततः then, खरः Khara, नालीकनाराचैः by Nalika darts, तीक्ष्णाग्रैः pointed, विकर्णिभिः with dartscalled Vikarni, रामम् Rama, तोत्रैः with goads, महाद्विपमिव like a mighty elephant, आजघान shot.

28_10.shloka: तं रथस्थं धनुष्पाणिं राक्षसं पर्यवस्थितम्।ददृशुस्सर्वभूतानि पाशहस्तमिवान्तकम्।।3.28.11।।
28_10.translation: Demon Khara positioned on the chariot, bow in hand, appeared to all beings like Yama, god of death holding the noose.
28_10.word_by_word: रथस्थम् on the chariot, धनुष्पाणिम् holding the bow in hand, पर्यवस्थितम् seated, तं राक्षसम् that demon, पाशहस्तम् holding the noose, अन्तकम् इव like the god of death (Yama), सर्वभूतानि all beings, ददृशुः observed.

28_11.shloka: हन्तारं सर्वसैन्यस्य पौरुषे पर्यवस्थितम्।परिश्रान्तं महासत्वं मेने रामं खरस्तदा।।3.28.12।।
28_11.translation: Khara thought valiant Rama who had destroyed his whole army might be exhausted by now.
28_11.word_by_word: खरः Khara, सर्वसैन्यस्य of the whole army, हन्तारम् destroyer, पौरुषे in valour, पर्यवस्थितम् staying, महासत्त्वम् a very strong one, रामम् Rama, तदा then, परिश्रान्तम् exhausted, मेने thought.

28_12.shloka: तं सिंहमिव विक्रान्तं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्।दृष्ट्वा नोद्विजते रामः सिंहः क्षुद्रमृगं यथा।।3.28.13।।
28_12.translation: When Rama saw Khara aggressively advancing like a lion to attack him, he was not perturbed, for he knew he was a fawn before a lion (which Rama was).
28_12.word_by_word: सिंहमिव like a lion, विक्रान्तम् aggressive, सिंह विक्रान्तगामिनम् advancing to attack, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, रामः Rama, सिंहः lion, क्षुद्रमृगं यथा just like a fawn, नोद्विजते not perturbed.

28_13.shloka: ततः सूर्यनिकाशेन रथेन महता खरः।आससाद रणे रामं पतङ्ग इव पावकम्।।3.28.14।।
28_13.translation: Then Khara mounting a great chariot which was glowing like the Sun, advanced towards Rama just as an insect hurtles towards fire.
28_13.word_by_word: ततः then, खरः Khara, सूर्यनिकाशेन glowing like the Sun, महता great, रथेन on a chariot, रामम् to Rama, पतङ्ग insect, पावकम् इव like going towards fire, रणे war, आससाद went forward.

28_14.shloka: ततोऽस्य सशरं चापं मुष्टिदेशे महात्मनः।खरश्चिच्छेद रामस्य दर्शयन्पाणिलाघवम्।।3.28.15।।
28_14.translation: Exhibiting his agility of the hand, Khara shattered the bow and the arrow in the grip of Rama ,the  great soul.
28_14.word_by_word: ततः then, खरः Khara, पाणिलाघवम् agility of the hand, दर्शयन् exhibiting, महात्मनः of the great self, अस्य रामस्य Rama's, सशरम् along with the arrow, चापम् bow, मुष्टिदेशे at the grip, चिच्छेद shattered.

28_15.shloka: स पुनस्त्वपरान्सप्त शरानादाय वर्मणि।निजघान खरः क्रुद्धश्शक्राशनिसमप्रभान्।।3.28.16।।
28_15.translation: The influriated Khara this time took up seven arrows blazing like Indra's thunderbolt  and hit his armour.
28_15.word_by_word: सः that, खरः Khara, क्रुद्धः angry, पुनः again, शक्राशनिसमप्रभान् blazing like Indra's thunderbolt, अपरान् others, सप्त seven, शरान् arrows, आदाय taking up, वर्मणि at the  armour, निजघान hit.

28_16.shloka: ततस्तत्प्रहतं बाणैः खरमुक्तैस्सुपर्वभिः।पपात कवचं भूमौ रामस्यादित्यवर्चसः।।3.28.17।।
28_16.translation: The armour of Rama who looked radiant like the Sun fell on the ground, struck by the welljointed darts released by Khara.
28_16.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, खरमुक्तैः shot by Khara, सुपर्वभिः by the welljointed, बाणैः with darts, प्रहतम् struck, आदित्यवर्चसः a man radiant like the Sun, रामस्य Rama's, तत् that, कवचम् armour, भूमौ on the ground, पपात fell down.

28_17.shloka: ततश्शरसहस्रेण राममप्रतिमौजसम्।अर्दयित्वा महानादं ननाद समरे खरः।।3.28.18।।
28_17.translation: Khara then attacked Rama of unequal strength in fight, with a thousand darts  and roared loudly.
28_17.word_by_word: ततः then, खरः Khara, अप्रतिमौजसम् of unequal strength, रामम् to Rama, शरसहस्रेण  with a thousand darts, अर्दयित्वा attacking, समरे in war, महानादम् great sound, ननाद produced.

28_18.shloka: स शरैरर्दितः क्रुद्धस्सर्वगात्रेषु राघवः।रराज समरे रामो विधूमोऽग्निरिव ज्वलन्।।3.28.19।।
28_18.translation: Rama, scion of the Raghu race, afflicted by the darts in all parts of the body, glowed in his anger like smokeless fire burning.
28_18.word_by_word: शरैः with darts, सर्वगात्रेषु in all limbs, अर्दितः afflicted, राघवः a scion of Raghu race, सः रामः that Rama, क्रुद्धः angry, विधूमः without smoke, ज्वलन् while burning, अग्निरिव like fire, समरे in fight, रराज glowed.

28_19.translation: Then Rama, destroyer of foes, strung another great bow of fearful sound in order to put an end to the enemy.
28_19.word_by_word: ततः then, शत्रुनिबर्हणः destroyer of foes, रामः Rama, रिपोः enemy, अन्ताय to put an end to, गम्भीरनिर्ह्रादम् deep sound, अन्यत् another one, महत् great, धनुः bow, सज्यम् string, चकार  did.

28_20.shloka: सुमहद्वैष्णवं यत्तदतिसृष्टं महर्षिणा।वरं तद्धनुरुद्यम्य खरं समभिधावत।।3.28.21।।
28_20.translation: Thereafter Rama advanced, aiming at Khara the superior Vaishnava bow given by sage Agastya.
28_20.word_by_word: तत् thereafter, यत् that, सुमहत् very powerful, वैष्णवम् Vaishnava, धनुः bow, महर्षिणा by the sage, अतिसृष्टम् given, वरम् best, तत् that, उद्यम्य aiming, खरम् Khara, समभिधावत advanced.

28_21.shloka: ततः कनकपुङ्खैस्तु शरैस्सन्नतपर्वभिः।बिभेद रामस्सङ्क्रुद्धः खरस्य समरे ध्वजम्।।3.28.22।।
28_21.translation: Rama took up in a rage the welljointed, smooth darts with golden feathers and broke the flag post of the chariot of Khara to pieces.
28_21.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama, सङ्क्रुद्धः enraged, कनकपुङ्खैः with golden feathers, सन्नतपर्वभिः welljointed and smooth, शरैः darts, समरे in war, खरस्य of Khara, ध्वजम् flag on the chariot, बिभेद broken to pieces.

28_22.shloka: स दर्शनीयो बहुधा विकीर्णः काञ्चनध्वजः।जगाम धरणीं सूर्यो देवतानामिवाज्ञया।।3.28.23।।
28_22.translation: The beautiful, golden flag post, broken into several pieces, fell down on earth.It appeared as if the Sun had come down to earth at the behest of the gods.
28_22.word_by_word: बहुधा many ways, विकीर्णः broken, दर्शनीयः a beautiful one, सः that, काञ्चनध्वजः golden flagpost, देवतानाम् of deities, आज्ञया by order, सूर्यः इव like Sun, धरणीम् on the ground, जगाम fell down.

28_23.shloka: तं चतुर्भिः खरः क्रुद्धो रामं गात्रेषु मार्गणैः।विव्याध युधि मर्मज्ञो मातङ्गमिव तोमरैः।।3.28.24।।
28_23.translation: Quite enraged, Khara who knew how to hit the tender parts (of the body) in an encounter sent out four arrows on Rama. It was like poking an elephant's limbs with a javelin.
28_23.word_by_word: क्रुद्धः enraged, मर्मज्ञः one who knows the tender parts of the body, खरः Khara, युधि in war, तं रामम् that Rama, चतुर्भिः four, मार्गणैः with arrows, मातङ्गम् elephant, तोमरैरिव like with a javelin, गात्रेषु on his limbs, विव्याध hit.

28_24.shloka: स रामो बहुभिर्बाणैः खरकार्मुकनिस्सृतैः।विद्धो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गो बभूव रुषितो भृशम्।।3.28.25।।
28_24.translation: Rama, hit by the arrows released from the bow of Khara, all his limbs drenched in blood, became very furious.
28_24.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, खरकार्मुकनिस्सृतैः by those arrows released from the bow of Khara, बहुभिः several, बाणैः arrows, विद्धः hit, रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः one whose limbs were drenched in blood, भृशम् very, रुषितः furious, बभूव became.

28_25.shloka: स धनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठः प्रगृह्य परमाहवे।मुमोच परमेष्वासष्षट्छरानभिलक्षितान्।।3.28.26।।
28_25.translation: The best among archers and a supreme shooter, he lifted the bow, fixed his target and released six arrows in the great fight.
28_25.word_by_word: परमाहवे in that great war, धन्विनाम् among archers, श्रेष्ठः best one, परमेष्वासः supreme shooter of arrows, सः he, धनुः bow, प्रगृह्य lifting, अभिलक्षितान् setting his goal, षट् six, शरान्arrows, मुमोच released.

28_26.translation: Rama hit one arrow on the head, two on the shoulders and three of the shape of the crescent moon on the chest (of the enemy).
28_26.word_by_word: एकेन with one, बाणेन with an arrow, शिरसि on head, अथ and, द्वाभ्याम् with two, बाह्वोः on shoulders, अर्दयत् hit, त्रिभिः three, चन्द्रार्धवक्त्रैः Moon shaped, वक्षसि on the chest, अभिजघान ह struck.

28_27.translation: Enraged and effulgent Rama took up thirteen darts, radiant like the Sun, with a wish to kill the demon.
28_27.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, पश्चात् later, महातेजाः effulgent, कृद्धः enraged, राक्षसम् to the demon, जिघांसुः  wishing  to kill, भास्करोपमान् radiant like the Sun, त्रयोदश thirteen, नाराचान् arrows, समाददे took up.

28_28.shloka: ततोऽस्य युगमेकेन चतुर्भिश्चतुरो हयान्।षष्ठेन तु शिरस्सङ्ख्ये खरस्य रथसारथेः।।3.28.29।।त्रिभिस्त्रिवेणुं बलवान्द्वाभ्यामक्षं महाबलः।द्वादशेन तु बाणेन खरस्य सशरं धनुः।।3.28.30।।छित्वा वज्रनिकाशेन राघवः प्रहसन्निव।त्रयोदशेनेन्द्रसमो बिभेद समरे खरम्।।3.28.31।।
28_28.translation: Rama, like Indra, strong and mighty, broke the yoke of Khara's chariot with one arrow, the four horses with four arrows, and with the sixth the charioteer's head, with three others the main pole of the chariot, with two the axle of the chariot, and with the twelfth Khara's bow and arrows were splintered. As if laughing at him, he pierced Khara's body with the thirteenth arrow.
28_28.word_by_word: इन्द्रसमः like Indra, बलवान् strong, महाबलः powerful, राघवः Rama, सङ्ख्ये in war, एकेन with one, अस्य his, रथस्य chariot's, युगम् yoke, चतुर्भिः with four, चतुरः four, हयान् horses, षष्ठेन with the sixth one, खरस्य Khara's, रथसारथेः charioteer, शिरः head, त्रिभिः with three, त्रिवेणुम्  main pole, द्वाभ्याम् with two, अक्षम् axle, द्वादशेन twelfth, बाणेन arrow, खरस्य Khara's, सशरम् along with arrow, धनुः bow, छित्वा made into pieces, प्रहसन्निव as if laughing at, समरे in the fight, वज्रनिकाशेन diamond like arrow, त्रयोदशेन with the thirteenth, खरम् to Khara, बिभेद pierced.

28_29.shloka: प्रभग्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः।गदापाणिरवप्लुत्य तस्थौ भूमौ खरस्तदा।।3.28.32।।
28_29.translation: Then, with bow broken, chariot destroyed, horses and charioteer dead, Khara jumped  down the chariot and stood on the ground holding a mace.
28_29.word_by_word: तदा then, प्रभग्नधन्वा with bow broken, विरथः without chariot, हताश्वः horses killed, हतसारधिः with charioteer dead, खरः Khara, गदापाणिः holding a mace in hand, अवप्लुत्य jumping down the chariot, भूमौ on the ground, तस्थौ stood.

28_30.shloka: तत्कर्म रामस्य महारथस्य समेत्य देवाश्च महर्षयश्च।अपूजयन्प्राञ्जलयः प्रहृष्टाः तदा विमानाग्रगतास्समेताः।।3.28.33।।
28_30.translation: Then the gods, along with great sages came down in aerial chariots and assembled there. Delighted, they adored Rama, the great warrior, with folded hands for the work done.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकिय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeigth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
28_30.word_by_word: तदा then, देवाश्च gods, महर्षयश्च great sages, समेताः collected together, विमानाग्रगताः standing on the aerial chariots, समेत्य  assembled, प्रहृष्टाः delighted, प्राञ्जलयः with folded palms, महारथस्य of the great warrior, रामस्य Rama's, तत् that, कर्म task, अपूजयन् adored.

29_1.shloka: [Encounter between  Rama and Khara.]खरं तु विरथं रामो गदापाणिमवस्थितम्।मृदुपूर्वं महातेजाः परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.29.1।।
29_1.translation: Effulgent Rama looked at Khara who stood with a mace in hand minus his chariot  and said to him first in a gentle voice and then harshly :
29_1.word_by_word: महातेजा: briliant, रामः Rama, विरथम्: deprived of chariot, गदापाणिम् wielding a mace, अवस्थितम्  stood, खरम् Khara, मृदुपूर्वम् gentle first, परुषम् harsh वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

29_2.shloka: गजाश्वरथसम्बाधे बले महति तिष्ठता।कृतं सुदारुणं कर्म सर्वलोकजुगुप्सितम्।।3.29.2।।
29_2.translation: Although you command a huge army with many elephants, horses, chariots, etc.  you have done such cruel deeds that the entire world despises you.
29_2.word_by_word: गजाश्वरथसम्बाधे elephants, horses, chariots etc. महति in a great, बले army, तिष्ठता standing, सर्वलोकजुगुप्सितम् despised by the entire world, सुदारुणम् very cruel, कर्म deed, कृतम्  done.

29_3.shloka: उद्वेजनीयो भूतानां नृशंसः पापकर्मकृत्।त्रयाणामपि लोकानामीश्वरोऽपि न तिष्ठति।।3.29.3।।
29_3.translation: One who  is wicked, does sinful deeds and causes distress to all beings, will notsurvive even if he is the lord of the three worlds.
29_3.word_by_word: भूतानाम् of all beings, उद्वेजनीयः causing distress, पापकर्मकृत् doer of sinful deeds, नृशंसः wicked, त्रयाणाम् of the three, लोकानाम् worlds, ईश्वरोऽपि even if he is the lord, न तिष्ठति  not survive.

29_4.shloka: कर्म लोकविरुद्धं तु कुर्वाणं क्षणदाचर।तीक्ष्णं सर्वजनो हन्ति सर्पं दुष्टमिवागतम्।।3.29.4।।
29_4.translation: O nightranger, one who does a horrific deed which is against the world will be killed like an evil serpent come near.
29_4.word_by_word: क्षणदाचर O nightranger  लोकविरुद्धम् that which is against the world, कर्म deeds, कुर्वाणम् who does, तीक्ष्णम् a terrific, सर्वजनः all people, आगतम् befallen, दुष्टम् cruel, सर्पमिव like a serpent, हन्ति will kill.

29_5.shloka: लोभात्पापानि कुर्वाणः कामाद्वा यो न बुध्यते।भ्रष्टः पश्यति तस्यान्तं ब्राह्मणी करकादिव।।3.29.5।।
29_5.translation: Whoever commits sinful deeds out of greed or passion and without realisation will be ruined at the end like a lizard that eats hailstone (and dies).
29_5.word_by_word: लोभात् out of greed, कामाद्वा  out of passion, यः whoever, पापानि sinful deeds, कुर्वाणः commits, न बुध्यते not realise, भ्रष्ठः ruined, करकात् by a hailstone, ब्राह्मणीव like a lizard, तस्य his, अन्तम् end, पश्यति will see.

29_6.shloka: वसतो दण्डकारण्ये तापसान्धर्मचारिणः।किन्नु हत्वा महाभागान्फलं प्राप्स्यसि राक्षस।।3.29.6।।
29_6.translation: O demon  what benefit will you  get by killing the venerable ascetics, followers of righteous path residing in Dandaka forest?
29_6.word_by_word: राक्षस O demon , दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, वसतः while residing, धर्मचारिणः those followers of righteous path, महाभागान् venerable ones , तापसान् ascetics, हत्वा after killing, किं नु what kind, फलम् fruit, प्राप्स्यसि will you get.

29_7.shloka: न चिरं पापकर्माणः क्रूरा लोकजुगुप्सिताः।ऐश्वर्यं प्राप्य तिष्ठन्ति शीर्णमूला इव द्रुमाः।।3.29.7।।
29_7.translation: Cruel people, who are despised by the world for their sinful deeds, will not  be prosperous for long just like trees with decayed roots.
29_7.word_by_word: पापकर्माणः who do sinful deeds, लोकजुगुप्सिताः  despised by the world, क्रूराः cruel, ऐश्वर्यम् prosperity, प्राप्य after obtaining, शीर्णमूलाः decayed at the roots, द्रुमाः इव like trees, चिरम् long time, न तिष्टन्ति will not stand.

29_8.shloka: अवश्यं लभते जन्तुः फलं पापस्य कर्मणः।घोरं पर्यागते काले द्रुमाः पुष्पमिवार्तवम्।।3.29.8।।
29_8.translation: Just as the trees bear flowers at the proper season, so also people will certainly reap the fruits of their terrible, sinful deeds at appropriate time.
29_8.word_by_word: काले (at the right) time, पर्यागते comes in, जन्तुः people, पापस्य कर्मणः of sinful deeds, घोरम् terrific, फलम् fruit, द्रुमाः trees, आर्तवम् in proper season, पुष्पमिव like the flowers, अवश्यम् certainly, लभते will get.

29_9.shloka: नचिरात्प्राप्यते लोके पापानां कर्मणां फलम्।सविषाणामिवान्नानां भुक्तानां क्षणदाचर।।3.29.9।।
29_9.translation: O nightranger  people will reap the result of their sinful actions in this world soon like one eating poisonous food.
29_9.word_by_word: क्षणदाचर O night ranger  लोके in the world, पापानाम् of sinful, कर्मणाम् of actions, फलम् result, भुक्तानाम् eaten, सविषाणाम् poisonous, अन्नानामिव like the food, नचिरात् soon, प्राप्यते will obtain.

29_10.shloka: पापमाचरतां घोरं लोकस्याप्रियमिच्छताम्।अहमासादितो राजा प्राणान्हन्तुं निशाचर।।3.29.10।।
29_10.translation: O nightranger  I have come with the orders of the king to put an end to the lives of the perpetrators of dreadful, sinful and offensive deeds in this world.
29_10.word_by_word: निशाचर nightranger, घोरम् terrific, पापम् sin, आचरताम् doers, लोकस्य in this world, अप्रियम् offensive actions, इच्छताम्  who like to do, प्राणान् life, हन्तुम् to put an end, राजा king, अहम् I, आसादितः I have come.

29_11.shloka: अद्य हि त्वां मया मुक्ताश्शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः।विदार्यातिपतिष्यन्ति वल्मीकमिव पन्नगाः।।3.29.11।।
29_11.translation: Now when I unleash the golden  arrows, they will pierce through your body and come out like serpents emerging from the anthill.
29_11.word_by_word: अद्य now, मया by me, मुक्ताः unleashed, काञ्चनभूषणाः adorned with gold ornaments, शराः arrows, पन्नगाः like serpent, वल्मीकमिव like the anthill, त्वा you, विदार्य after piercing the body, अतिपतिष्यतनि will come out.

29_12.shloka: ये त्वया दण्डकारण्ये भक्षिता धर्मचारिणः।तानद्य निहतस्सङ्ख्ये ससैन्योऽनुगमिष्यसि।।3.29.12।।
29_12.translation: Slain by me in the battle today, you and your army will follow the righteous men eaten by you in Dandaka forest.
29_12.word_by_word: त्वया by you, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, ये those, धर्मचारिणः righteous people, भक्षिताः are eaten, तान् those, अद्य now, सङ्ख्ये in the war, निहतः killed, ससैन्यः along with your army, अनुगमिष्यसि will be following.

29_13.shloka: अद्य त्वां निहतं बाणैः पश्यन्तु परमर्षयः।निरयस्थं विमानस्था ये त्वया हिंसिताः पुरा।।3.29.13।।
29_13.translation: The great seers whom you have earlier tortured and killed will, from their aerial vehicles, see you fallen into hell.
29_13.word_by_word: पुरा earlier, त्वया by you, ये whom, हिंसिताः tortured, परमर्षयः great seers, विमानस्थाः seated in the aerial vehicles, अद्य now, बाणैः with arrows, निहतम् killed, निरयस्थम् fallen into hell, त्वाम् you, पश्यन्तु  see you.

29_14.shloka: प्रहर त्वं यथाकामं कुरु यत्नं कुलाधम।अद्य ते पातयिष्यामि शिरस्तालफलं यथा।।3.29.14।।
29_14.translation: O vile fellow, now you may strike at me as you please. I will make your head fall  down like a palm fruit.
29_14.word_by_word: कुलाधम O Nile of the race, त्वम् you, यथाकामम् as you wish, प्रहर freely strike at me, यत्नम् effort, कुरु you may do, अद्य now, ते your, शिरः head, तालफलं यथा like a palm fruit, पातयिष्यामि will strike you down.

29_15.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण कृद्धस्संरक्तलोचनः।प्रत्युवाच खरो रामं प्रहसन्क्रोधमूर्छितः।।3.29.15।।
29_15.translation: Challenged by Rama  in that manner, Khara, his senses switched off, eyes turned red due to anger, replied laughing :
29_15.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having said, खरः Khara, संरक्तलोचनः eyes turned red, (ततः then), प्रहसन् laughed, क्रोधमूर्छितः lost his senses in anger, रामम् to Rama, प्रत्युवाच replied.

29_16.translation: O son of Dasaratha, it is not praiseworthy to kill ordinary demons in war. Why do you praise yourself for it?
29_16.word_by_word: दशरथात्मज O Rama, son of Dasaratha, युद्धे in war, प्राकृतान्  ordinary ( people), राक्षसान्demons, हत्वा killing, अप्रशस्यम् not praiseworthy, आत्मानम् yourself, आत्मना by yourself, कथम् why, प्रशंससि praising.

29_17.shloka: विक्रान्ता बलवन्तो वा ये भवन्ति नरर्षभाः।कथयन्ति न ते किञ्चित्तेजसा स्वेन गर्विताः।।3.29.17।।
29_17.translation: The valiant, strong and the best of men do not at all speak proudly of themselves  and their valour.
29_17.word_by_word: ये those, नरर्षभाः best of men, विक्रान्ताः valiant, बलवन्तो वा strong, भवन्ति they are, ते they, स्वेन by their own, तेजसा by valour, गर्विताः  proud of, किञ्चित् even a little, न कथयन्ति do not speak of.

29_18.shloka: प्राकृतास्त्वकृतात्मानो लोके क्षत्रियपांसनाः।निरर्थकं विकत्थन्ते यथा राम विकत्थसे।।3.29.18।।
29_18.translation: O Rama common people, having no control over themselves and the lowest of kshatriyas boast of themselves in the world in a meaningless way as you are doing (now).
29_18.word_by_word: राम Rama, लोके in the world, अकृतात्मानः having no control over self, प्राकृतास्तु common people, क्षत्रियपांसनाः lowest of kshatriyas, यथा as, विकत्थन्ते they boast, निरर्थकम् in a meaningless, विकत्थसे you boast yourself.

29_19.shloka: कुलं व्यपदिशन्वीरस्समरे कोऽभिधास्यति।मृत्युकाले हि सम्प्राप्ते स्वयमप्रस्तवे स्तवम्।।3.29.19।।
29_19.translation: When death comes in a battle no hero will name his race and boast of himself unnessarily.
29_19.word_by_word: मृत्युकाले when death, सम्प्राप्ते comes, वीरः hero, कः who, समरे in war, कुलम् his race, व्यपदिशन् naming, अप्रस्तवे unnecessarily, स्वयम् himself, स्तवम् praise, अभिधास्यति will talkof.

29_20.shloka: सर्वथैव लघुत्वं ते कत्थनेन विदर्शितम्।सुवर्णप्रतिरूपेण तप्तेनेव कुशाग्निना।।3.29.20।।
29_20.translation: All your meanness is exhibited by your boasting just as the kusa grass caught by fire appears like gold.
29_20.word_by_word: कत्थनेन by boasting, तप्तेन heated, सुवर्णप्रतिरूपेण  looking like gold, कुशाग्निना इव by the fire of kusa grass, सर्वथैव by all means, ते your, लघुत्वम् meanness, विदर्शितम् is exhibited.

29_21.shloka: न तु मामिह तिष्ठन्तं पश्यसि त्वं गदाधरम्।धराधरमिवाकम्प्यं पर्वतं धातुभिश्चितम्।।3.29.21।।
29_21.translation: Indeed, (it is strange that) you do not see me holding a mace and standing here like an unshakeable mountain which contains minerals and supports the earth.
29_21.word_by_word: त्वम् you, गदाधरम् holding a mace, इह here, तिष्ठन्तम् while standing, धातुभिः with minerals, चितम् inlaid, पर्वतम् mountain, धराधरमिव like supporter of earth, अकम्प्यम् unshakeable, माम् me, पश्यसि you are seeing, ननु indeed.

29_22.shloka: पर्याप्तोऽहं गदापाणिर्हन्तुं प्राणान्रणे तव।त्रयाणामपि लोकानां पाशहस्त इवान्तकः।।3.29.22।।
29_22.translation: Just like lord Yama, holding a noose of death is alone enough to destroy the threeworlds, I am alone sufficient to take away your life in war, a mace in hand.
29_22.word_by_word: पाशहस्तः holding the noose of death, अन्तकः Yama, त्रयाणाम् for the three, लोकानामपि इव  worlds also, रणे in war, तव your, प्राणान् life, हन्तुम् to kill, गदापाणिः weilding mace, अहम् I, पर्याप्तः enough.

29_23.shloka: कामं बह्वपि वक्तव्यं त्वयि वक्ष्यामि न त्वहम्।अस्तं गच्छेद्धि सविता युद्धविघ्नस्ततो भवेत्।।3.29.23।।
29_23.translation: Indeed, I shall not speak any more even though a lot can be said on you. But the Sun is about to set and it will be improper to wage war thereafter.
29_23.word_by_word: त्वयि on you, बहु much, वक्तव्यमपि has to be said, कामम् indeed, तु but, अहम् I, न वक्ष्यामि not speak any more, सविता Sun, अस्तं गच्छेत् will set, ततः thereafter, युद्धविघ्नः obstacle to wage war, भवेत् will be.

29_24.shloka: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि राक्षसानां हतानि ते।त्वद्विनाशात्करोम्येषां तेषामश्रुप्रमार्जनम्।।3.29.24।।
29_24.translation: You have killed these fourteen thousand demons. Therefore, I will wipe their tears by destroying you.
29_24.word_by_word: ते for you, एषां these, राक्षसानाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, हतानि killed, त्वद्विनाशात् by their destruction, तेषाम् their, अश्रुप्रमार्जनम् wiping their tears, करोमि I shall carry out.

29_25.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा परमक्रुद्धस्तां गदां परमाङ्गदः।खरश्चिक्षेप रामाय प्रदीप्तामशनिं यथा।।3.29.25।।
29_25.translation: Having said this, highly enraged Khara adorned with large shoulder bands, hurled  at Rama, his mace glowing like a thunderbolt.
29_25.word_by_word: परमाङ्गदः adorned with large shoulder bands, खरः Khara, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, परमक्रुद्धः highly enraged, प्रदीप्ताम् blazing, अशनिं यथा like a thunderbolt, तां गदाम् that mace, रामाय at Rama, चिक्षेव hurled.

29_26.shloka: खरबाहुप्रयुक्ता सा प्रदीप्ता महती गदा।भस्मवृक्षांश्च गुल्मांश्च कृत्वागात्तत्समीपतः।।3.29.26।।
29_26.translation: The huge, blazing mace hurled by Khara's arms reduced the trees and shrubs into ashes and came close to Rama.
29_26.word_by_word: खरबाहुप्रयुक्ता unleashed by Khara's arms, प्रदीप्ता blazing, महती huge, गदा mace, वृक्षांश्च trees, गुल्मांश्च shrubs, भस्म ashes, कृत्वा reduced into, तत्समीपतः close to him, अगात् reached.

29_27.shloka: तामापतन्तीं ज्वलतां मृत्युपाशोपमां गदाम्।अन्तरिक्षगतां रामचशिच्छेद बहुधा शरैः।।3.29.27।।
29_27.translation: The mace, which moved in the sky burning like the noose of death was shattered to pieces by Rama.
29_27.word_by_word: आपतन्ती falling down, ज्वलताम् burning, मृत्युपाशोपमाम् like the noose of death, तां गदाम्  that mace, अन्तरिक्षगताम् in the sky, रामः Rama, शरैः arrows, बहुधा several pieces, चिच्छेद shattered.

29_28.shloka: सा विकीर्णा शरैर्भग्ना पपात धरणीतले।गदा मन्त्रौषधबलैर्व्यालीव विनिपातिता।।3.29.28।।
29_28.translation: The mace shattered by the arrows of Rama , fell down scattered to pieces on the ground like a female serpent subdued by the force of mantras and medicine.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
29_28.word_by_word: शरैः arrows, भग्ना broken, सा गदा the mace, मन्त्रौषधबलैः  on the strength of mantras and medicines, विनिपातिता fell down, व्यालीव like a female serpent, विकीर्णा scattered, धरणीतले on the ground, पपात fell down.

30_1.shloka: [Khara's death in the hands of Rama-- gods and charanas praise him offer prayers-- Lakshmana and Sita come out of the cave.]भित्त्वा तु तां गदां बाणै राघवो धर्मवत्सलः।स्मयमानः खरं वाक्यं संरब्धमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.30.1।।
30_1.translation: Rama, fond of dharma, broke into pieces Khara's mace with his arrows, and smiling at bewildered Khara, said:
30_1.word_by_word: धर्मवत्सलः fond of dharma, राघवः Rama, तां गदाम् that mace, बाणैः by arrows, भित्त्वा after breaking into pieces, स्मयमानः smiling, संरब्धम् confused, खरम् Khara, इदं वाक्यम् these  words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

30_2.shloka: एतत्ते बलसर्वस्वं दर्शितं राक्षसाधम।शक्तिहीनतरो मत्तो वृथा त्वमवगर्जसि।।3.30.2।।
30_2.translation: O lowly demon, you have already exhibited all your strength. Inferior to me in energy, you are needlessly roaring.
30_2.word_by_word: राक्षसाधम O lowly demon, ते your, एतत् this, बलसर्वस्वम् all your strength, दर्शितम् is shown, मत्तः from me, शक्तिहीनतरः inferior in strength, त्वम् you, वृथा unnecssarily, अवगर्जसि roared against.

30_3.shloka: एषा बाणविनिर्भिन्ना गदा भूमितलं गता।अभिधानप्रगल्भस्य तव प्रत्ययघातिनी।।3.30.3।।
30_3.translation: The mace about which you boasted so much has betrayed your confidence. Shattered by my arrows it now lies on the ground.
30_3.word_by_word: एषा this, गदा mace, बाणविनिर्भिन्ना broken by arrows, अभिधानप्रगल्भस्य spoke arrogantly, तव you, प्रत्ययघातिनी that which destroyed all your confidence, भूमितलम् on the ground, गता lying.

30_4.shloka: यत्त्वयोक्तं विनष्टानामहमश्रुप्रमार्जनम्।राक्षसानां करोमीति मिथ्या तदपि ते वचः।।3.30.4।।
30_4.translation: You said you will wipe the tears of the dead demons. (Now) those words have proved false.
30_4.word_by_word: अहम् I, विनष्टानाम् of the dead, राक्षसानाम् of the demons, अश्रुप्रमार्जनम् wiping tears, करोमीति I will do, त्वया by  you, यत् whatever, उक्तम् uttered, ते by you, तत् that, वचः अपि word too, मिथ्या false.

30_5.shloka: नीचस्य क्षुद्रशीलस्य मिथ्यावृत्तस्य रक्षसः।प्राणानहं हरिष्यामि गरुत्मानमृतं यथा।।3.30.5।।
30_5.translation: You are mean. You have false pride. You are of low behaviour. I shall take away your life, O demon,, Just as Garuda carried off the nectar.
30_5.word_by_word: नीचस्य mean, क्षुद्रशीलस्य of low behaviour, मिथ्यावृत्तस्य  of false pride, रक्षसः of the demon, प्राणान् life, अहम् I, गरुत्मान् Garuda, अमृतं यथा  like nectar, हरिष्यामि will take away.

30_6.shloka: अद्य ते छिन्नकण्ठस्य फेनबुद्बुदभूषितम्।विदारितस्य मद्बाणैर्मही पास्यति शोणितम्।।3.30.6।।
30_6.translation: Now with your throat split open by my arrows , the earth will drink your foamy blood full of bubbles.
30_6.word_by_word: अद्य now, मद्बाणैः with my darts, विदारितस्य  split open, छिन्नकण्ठस्य (of a person) whose neck is cut, ते your, फेनबुद्बुदभूषितम् adorned with bubbles and foam, शोणितम् blood, मही ground, पास्यति will drink.

30_7.shloka: पांसुरूषितसर्वाङ्गस्स्रस्तन्यस्त भुजद्वयः।स्वप्स्यसे गां समालिङ्ग्य दुर्लभां प्रमदामिव।।3.30.7।।
30_7.translation: With all your limbs covered with dust, both the arms dropped down and stretched  out  on the ground, you will sleep as though hugging the earth, like embracing a rare woman.
30_7.word_by_word: पांसुरूषितसर्वाङ्गः all your limbs covered with dust, स्रस्तन्यस्तभुजद्वयः with both the arms  dropped and outstretched on the ground, दुर्लभाम् difficult, प्रमदामिव like a woman, गाम् the earth, समालिङ्ग्य after embracing, स्वप्स्यसे you will sleep.

30_8.shloka: प्रबद्धनिद्रे शयिते त्वयि राक्षसपांसने।भविष्यन्तिशरण्यानां शरण्या दण्डका इमे।।3.30.8।।
30_8.translation: When you, O vile demon, will go into eternal sleep the Dandaka grounds will provide shelter to those who deserve it here.
30_8.word_by_word: राक्षसपांसने lowly demon, त्वयि you, प्रबद्धनिद्रे when you attain eternal sleep, शयिते when sleeping so, इमे these, दण्डकाः Dandaka grounds, शरण्यानाम् for the sheltered, शरण्याः refuge, भविष्यन्ति will be.

30_9.shloka: जनस्थाने हतस्थाने तव राक्षस मच्छरैः।निर्भया विचरिष्यन्ति सर्वतो मुनयो वने।।3.30.9।।
30_9.translation: O demon, when my arrows destroy your hold over Janasthana the sages will move freely without fear all over this forest.
30_9.word_by_word: राक्षस O demon , तव your, जनस्थाने when Janasthana, मच्छरैः by my darts, हतस्थाने when the hold is destroyed, मुनयः seers, निर्भयाः without fear, सर्वत्र all over, वने in the forest, विचरिष्यन्ति will wander.

30_10.shloka: अद्य विप्रसरिष्यन्ति राक्षस्यो हतबान्धवाः।बाष्पार्द्रवदना दीना भयादन्यभयावहाः।।3.30.10।।
30_10.translation: Having lost all their relations, the demonesses, who were causing fear to others,will move away with faces full of tears.
30_10.word_by_word: अन्यभयावहाः causing fear to others, राक्षस्यः the demonesses, हतबान्धवाः with slain relations, बाष्पार्द्रवदनाः faces drenched in tears, भयात् due to fear, दीनाः desperately, अद्य now, विप्रसरिष्यन्ति will move away.

30_11.shloka: अद्य शोकरसज्ञास्ता भविष्यन्ति निरर्थकाः।अनुरूपकुलाः पत्न्यो यासां त्वं पतिरीदृशः।।3.30.11।।
30_11.translation: Your wives, who have got a husband like you, must have been born to a befitting race. They will taste the pangs of sorrow today, for no reasons whatsoever.
30_11.word_by_word: यासाम् those women, ईदृशः ruined , त्वम् you, पतिः husband, अनुरूपकुलाः born of a befitting race, ताः them, पत्न्यः wives, अद्य now, निरर्थकाः meaninglessly, शोकरसज्ञाः taste the pangs of sorrow, भविष्यन्ति will remain

30_12.shloka: नृशंस नीच क्षुद्रात्मन्नित्यं ब्राह्मणकण्टक।यत्कृते शङ्कितैरग्नौ मुनिभिः पात्यते हविः।।3.30.12।।
30_12.translation: O cruel, mean, vile fellow, you had been always opposing the brahmins who pour oblations in fire under fear.
30_12.word_by_word: नृशंश cruel , नीच mean, क्षुद्रात्मन् a vile self, नित्यम् always, ब्राह्मणकण्टक opposing the brahmins, यत्कृते due to whom, शङ्कितैः by hesitant, मुनिभिः by seers, हविः an oblation, अग्नौ in fire, पात्यते is offered.

30_13.shloka: तमेवमभिसंरब्धं ब्रुवाणं राघवं रणे।खरो निर्भर्त्सयामास रोषात्खरतरस्वरः।।3.30.13।।
30_13.translation: When Rama was thus speaking in a state of excitement in the middle of war, the choleric Khara  started abusing him in a harsher tone.
30_13.word_by_word: एवम् thus, रणे in war, अभिसंरब्धम् in a state of excitement, ब्रुवाणाम्  was speaking, तं राघवम् that Rama, रोषात् due to anger, खरतरस्वरः  in a harsher tone, खरः Khara, निर्भर्त्सयामास abused.

30_14.shloka: दृढं खल्ववलिप्तोऽसि भयेष्वपि च निर्भयः।वाच्यावाच्यं ततो हि त्वं मृत्युवश्यो न बुध्यसे।।3.30.14।।
30_14.translation: You are very haughty. When there is every cause of fear you pretend fearlessness. Being in the grip of death you do not know what to speak and what not to speak.
30_14.word_by_word: भयेष्वपि even in the midst of fear, निर्भयः fearless, त्वम् you, दृढम् certainly, अवलिप्तः असि you are haughty, ततः then, मृत्युवश्यः under the grip of death, वाच्यावाच्यम् what  to speak and what not to speak, न बुध्यसे not knowing.

30_15.shloka: कालपाशपरिक्षिप्ता भवन्ति पुरुषा हि ये।कार्याकार्यं न जानन्ति ते निरस्तषडिन्द्रियाः।।3.30.15।।
30_15.translation: Those bound by the noose of death, do not know what to and what not to do, as their six senses cease to function.
30_15.word_by_word: ये पुरुषाः those men, कालपाशपरिक्षिप्ताः bound by the noose of death, भवन्ति remain, ते you, निरस्तषडिन्द्रियाः  whose six senses (five sense organs and mind)  cease to function, कार्याकार्यम् (sense of discrimination) of what to and not to do, न जानन्ति do not know.

30_16.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा ततो रामं संरुध्य भ्रुकुटीं ततः।स ददर्श महासालमविदूरे निशाचरः।।3.30.16।।रणे प्रहरणस्यार्थे सर्वतो ह्यवलोकयन्।
30_16.translation: Having said thus to Rama with a frown on his face, Khara, looking around for something to strike him with, saw a huge sal tree not very far.
30_16.word_by_word: सः निशाचरः  nightwalker, रामम् to Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, ततः then, भ्रुकुटीम् eyebrows, संरुध्य drawing together in frown, रणे in war, प्रहरणस्य अर्थे for striking, सर्वतः all over, अवलोकयन् observing, अविदूरे close by, महासालम् huge sal tree, ददर्श saw.

30_17.shloka: स तमुत्पाटयामास संदश्य दशनच्छदम्।।3.30.17।।तं समुत्क्षिप्य बाहुभ्यां विनद्य च महाबलः।राममुद्दिश्य चिक्षेप हतस्त्वमिति चाब्रवीत्।।3.30.18।।
30_17.translation: Khara, biting his lower lip, uprooted the tree , lifted it with his mighty arms, and shouting at Rama loudly hurled it at him, saying, 'You are dead'.
30_17.word_by_word: सः Khara, दशनच्छदम्   lower lip, संदस्य  biting, तम् that( tree), उत्पाटयामास uprooted, महाबलः mighty, तम् him, बाहुभ्याम् with arms, समुत्क्षिप्य  lifted, विनद्य shouted, रामम् उद्दिश्य targetting Rama, चिक्षेप hurled, त्वम् you, हतः  dead, इति thus, अब्रवीत् च said.

30_18.shloka: तमापतन्तं बाणौघैच्छित्वा रामः प्रतापवान्।रोषमाहारयत्तीव्रं निहन्तुं समरे खरम्।।3.30.19।।
30_18.translation: Brave Rama shattered with a flood of arrows the tree falling over him and summoned sharp anger to end Khara in war.
30_18.word_by_word: प्रतापवान् courageous, रामः Rama, आपतन्तम् falling, तम् that, बाणौघैः with a flood of arrows, छित्त्वा having shattered, समरे in war, खरम् Khara, निहन्तुम् to put an end, तीव्रम् intensely, रोषम् anger, आहारयत् gathered.

30_19.shloka: जातस्वेदस्ततो रामो रोषाद्रक्तान्तलोचनः।निर्भिभेद सहस्रेण बाणानां समरे खरम्।।3.30.20।।
30_19.translation: Full of sweat and with the corners of his eyes turned red, Rama hit Khara with a thousand arrows in the encounter.
30_19.word_by_word: ततः then, जातस्वेदः sweating all over, रोषात् with anger, रक्तान्तलोचनः one whose  eyes turned red in the corners, रामः Rama, बाणानाम् of the arrows, सहस्रेण a thousand, समरे in war, खरम् Khara, निर्भिभेद hit.

30_20.shloka: तस्य बाणान्तराद्रक्तं बहु सुस्राव फेनिलम्।गिरेः प्रस्रवणस्येव तोयधारापरिस्रवः।।3.30.21।।
30_20.translation: With his body pierced with arrows his blood started flowing like the waterfalls flow from mount Prasravana.
30_20.word_by_word: तस्य his, फेनिलम् foamy, बहु a lot, रक्तम् blood, बाणान्तरात् by the arrows piercing, गिरेः  of the mount, प्रस्रवणस्य Prasravana's, तोयधारपरिस्रवः इव like the waterfalls from the mountain, सुस्राव came out.

30_21.shloka: विह्वलस्सकृतो बाणैः खरो रामेण संयुगे।मत्तो रुधिरगन्धेन तमेवाभ्यद्रवद्द्रुतम्।।3.30.22।।
30_21.translation: Completely struck by Rama's arrows, Khara, intoxicated with the smell of  blood, ran speedily charging towards Rama.
30_21.word_by_word: संयुगे in the war, रामेण by Rama, बाणैः with arrows, विह्वलः completely struck, कृतः done, मत्तः an intoxicated one, सः खरः Khara's, रुधिरगन्धेन with the smell of blood, द्रुतम् quickly, तं राममेव on Rama also, अभ्यद्रवत् ran charging.

30_22.translation: Rama who was an adept in the science of arms picked up his valour quickly and moved a step back (not  to give him an opportunity to strike), looking at the highly agitated Khara falling upon him, with his body fully drenched in blood.
30_22.word_by_word: कृतास्त्रः trained in the science of arms, (रामः Rama), आपतन्तम् falling upon, रुधिराप्लुतम् drenched in blood, संरब्धम् highly agitated, तम् him, त्वरितविक्रमः picked up his valour quickly, प्रतिपदम्  step, किञ्चित् a little, अपासर्पत् moved aside.

30_23.shloka: ततः पावकसङ्काशं वधाय समरे शरम्।खरस्य रामो जग्राह ब्रह्मदण्डमिवापरम्।।3.30.24।।
30_23.translation: Rama took a dart glowing like fire which resembled another Brahmadanda to kill Khara in the war.
30_23.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, रामः Rama, खरस्य Khara's, वधाय to kill, पावकसङ्काशम् glowing like fire, अपरम् इव like another, ब्रह्मदण्डमिव like Brahmadanda, शरम् dart, समरे in war, जग्राह took.

30_24.shloka: स तं दत्तं मघवता सुरराजेन धीमता।संदधे चापि धर्मात्मा मुमोच च खरं प्रति।।3.30.25।।
30_24.translation: Righteous Rama placed on his bow the dart given him by wise Indra, king of the gods, and shot it at Khara.
30_24.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः Rama, धीमता by the wise, मघवता by Indra, सुरराजेन by the king of the gods, दत्तम् was given, तम् that weapon, संदधे placed, खरं प्रति on Khara, मुमोच च and shot.

30_25.shloka: स विमुक्तो महाबाणो निर्घातसमनिस्वनः।रामेण धनुरायम्य खरस्योरसिचापतत्।।3.30.26।।
30_25.translation: Bending the bow fully, Rama released the arrow roaring like a violent gust of wind, which fell on Khara's chest.
30_25.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, धनुः bow, आयम्य on bending, खरस्य Khara's, उरसि on the chest, विमुक्तः released, निर्घातसमनिस्वनः sounding like a violent gust of wind, सः बाणः that arrow, अपतत् fell.

30_26.shloka: स पपात खरो भूमौ दह्यमानश्शरानग्निना।रुद्रेणेव विनिर्दग्धश्वेतारण्ये यथान्तकः।।3.30.27।।
30_26.translation: Just as Yama was burnt by Rudra's fire(from his eyes) in Swetaranya, Khara collapsed on the ground consumed by the fire of Rama's arrow.
30_26.word_by_word: शराग्निना by the fire of the arrow, दह्यमानः  burned सः that, खरः Khara, श्वेतारण्ये in Swetaranya, रुद्रेण by Rudra, विनिर्दग्धः burnt totally, अन्तकः यथा like Yama, भूमौ on the ground, पपात collapsed.

30_27.shloka: स वृत्र इव वज्रेण फेनेन नमुचिर्यथा।बलो वेन्द्राशनिहतो निपपात हतः खरः।।3.30.28।।
30_27.translation: Khara fell down just like Vrutra or Bala killed by Indra's thunderbolt or like Numuchi by the froth of the sea.
30_27.word_by_word: सः खरः that Khara, हतः killed, स वज्रेण by the thunderbolt, वृत्र इव like Vrutra, फेनेन by froth from, नमुचिः Namuchi, यथा like that, इन्द्राशनिहतः struck by Indra's thunderbolt, बलो वा like Bala, निपपात fell down.

30_28.shloka: ततो राजर्षयस्सर्वे सङ्गताः परमर्षयः।सभाज्य मुदिता राममिदं वचनमब्रुवन्।।3.30.29।।
30_28.translation: Then the rajarsis, great seers gathered together, offered their worship to Rama  and said these words joyfully :
30_28.word_by_word: ततः then, सर्वे all, राजर्षयः rajarsis, परमर्षयः great seers, सङ्गताः together, मुदिताः joyfully, रामम् Rama, सभाज्य worshipped, इदम् this, वचनम् words, अब्रुवन् said.

30_29.shloka: एतदर्थं महातेजा महेन्द्रः पाकशासनः।शरभङ्गाश्रमं पुण्यमाजगाम पुरन्दरः।।3.30.30।।
30_29.translation: For this purpose, killer of Paka, the gIorious Indra (who can break a fortress), came to the hermitage of Sarabhanga.
30_29.word_by_word: पाकशासनः killer of Paka (Indra), महातेजाः glorious, पुरन्दरः one who can break a fortress, (Indra), महेन्द्रः Mahendra, एतदर्थम् for that purpose only, पुण्यम् holy, शरभङ्गाश्रमम् hermitage of Sarabhanga, आजगाम came.

30_30.shloka: आनीतस्त्वमिमं देशमुपायेन महर्षिभिः।एषां वधार्थं क्रूराणां रक्षसां पापकर्मणाम्।।3.30.31।।
30_30.translation: You are brought to this place by the great sages who had cleverly devised a plan to kill the cruel sinners, these demons৷৷
30_30.word_by_word: क्रूराणाम् cruel, पापकर्मणाम् sinners, एषाम् of these, रक्षसाम् of demons, वधार्थम् to kill, त्वम् you, महर्षिभिः by great sages, उपायेन cleverly planned, इमम् this, देशम् place, आनीतः you are brought.

30_31.shloka: तदिदं नः कृतं कार्यं त्वया दशरथात्मज।सुखं धर्मं चरिष्यन्ति दण्डकेषु महर्षयः।।3.30.32।।
30_31.translation: O son of Dasaratha, you have accomplished such a task that hereafter the sages inDandaka will discharge their rightful duties happily.
30_31.word_by_word: दशरथात्मज O son of Dasaratha, नः our, तत् such, इदम् this, कार्यम् a task, कृतम् accomplished, महर्षयः sages, दण्डकेषु in Dandaka, सुखम् happily, धर्मम् rightful duty, चरिष्यन्ति discharge.

30_32.shloka: एतस्मिन्तरे देवाश्चारणैस्सह सङ्गताः।दुन्दुभींश्चाभिनिघ्नन्तः पुष्पवर्षं समन्ततः।।3.30.33।।रामस्योपरि संह्रुष्टा ववृषुर्विस्मितास्तदा।
30_32.translation: Meanwhile the wonderstruck gods along with the charanas (celestial bards) got together and began beating the drums and raining showers of flowers on Rama from all sides.
30_32.word_by_word: एतस्मिन् in the, अन्तरे meanwhile, देवाः gods, चारणैः सह and charanas (celestial bards), सङ्गताः got together, संह्रुष्टा joyfully, दुन्दुभीन् drums, अभिनिघ्नन्तः beating, तदा then, विस्मिताः wonderstruck, रामस्य at Rama, उपरि on, समन्ततः from all sides, पुष्पवर्षम् shower of flowers, ववृषुः rained.

30_33.shloka: अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन रामेण निशितैश्शरैः।।3.30.34।।चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।खरदूषणमुख्यानां निहतानि महाहवे।।3.30.35।।
30_33.translation: 'In a little more than half a moment of this great war Rama had accomplished the terrific task of killing with sharp darts fourteen thousand demons, led by Khara and Dusana.
30_33.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन little more than half a moment (a moment i.e. मुहूर्त  is 48 seconds) निशितैः sharp, शरैः darts, महाहवे in the great war, भीमकर्मणाम् of terrific tasks, खरदूषणमुख्यानाम् led by Khara and Dusana, रक्षसाम् demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, निहतानि were killed.

30_34.shloka: अहो बत महत्कर्म रामस्य विदितात्मनः।अहो वीर्यमहो दाक्ष्यं विष्णोरिव हि दृश्यते।।3.30.36।।इत्येवमुक्त्वा ते सर्वे ययुर्देवा यथागतम्।
30_34.translation: 'Rama who knows the self has performed a great work. Oh what prowess what efficiency  only lord Visnu could do this'. So saying all the gods went back to their respective destinations.
30_34.word_by_word: विदितात्मनः who knows the self, रामस्य Rama's, महत् great, कर्म performance, अहो बत what a great thing, वीर्यम् prowess, अहो Oh, दाक्ष्यम् efficiency, अहो Oh, विष्णोरिव like Visnu, दृश्यते appears, इत्येवम् like that, उक्त्वा saying, सर्वे all, ते देवाः the gods, यथागतम् to their destinations, ययुः went back.

30_35.shloka: तस्मिन्नन्तरे वीरो लक्ष्मणस्सह सीतया।गिरिदुर्गाद्विनिष्क्रम्य संविवेशाश्रमं सुखी।।3.30.37।।
30_35.translation: In the mean time, heroic Lakshmana accompanied by Sita came out of the mountain cave happily and entered the hermitage.
30_35.word_by_word: तस्मिन् अन्तरे in the mean time, वीरः heroic, (सः) लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सीतया सह accompanied by Sita, गिरिदुर्गात् from the mountain cave, विनिष्क्रम्य came out, सुखी happily, आश्रमम् hermitage, (सं)विवेश entered.

30_36.shloka: ततो रामस्तु विजयी पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः।प्रविवेशाश्रमं वीरो लक्ष्मणेनाभिपूजितः।।3.30.38।।
30_36.translation: Then victorious Rama having been worshipped by the seers and also by Lakshmana entered the hermitage.
30_36.word_by_word: ततः then, विजयी victorious man, वीरः hero, रामस्तु Rama too, महर्षिभिः by the seers, पूज्यमानः worshipped by, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, अभिपूजितः worshipped, आश्रमम् hermitage, प्रविवेश entered.

30_37.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुहन्तारं महर्षीणां सुखावहम्।बभूव हृष्टा वैदेही भर्तारं परिषस्वजे।।3.30.39।।
30_37.translation: On seeing Rama killing the enemies of the great sages for their happiness Sita felt glad and embraced her husband.
30_37.word_by_word: वैदेही Vaidehi, शत्रुहन्तारम् one who has killed the enemies, महर्षीणाम् of the great sages, सुखावहम् for their happiness, तम् him, भर्तारम् husband, दृष्ट्वा seeing, हृष्टा glad, बभूव became, परिषस्वजे embraced.

30_38.shloka: मुदा परमया युक्ता दृष्ट्वा रक्षोगणान्हतान्।रामं चैवाव्यथं दृष्ट्वा तुतोष जनकात्मजा।।3.30.40।।
30_38.translation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, was happy to see the demons killed by Rama who himself was unhurt.
30_38.word_by_word: जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, हतान् dead, रक्षोगणान् the demons, दृष्ट्वा seeing, परमया very much, मुदा happy, युक्ता became, रामं चैव by Rama, अव्यथम् unhurt, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तुतोष became glad.

30_39.shloka: ततस्तु तं राक्षससङ्घमर्दनं सभाज्यमानं मुदितैर्महर्षिभिः।पुनः परिष्वज्य शशिप्रभानना बभूव हृष्टा जनकात्मजा तदा।।3.30.41।।
30_39.translation: Then the daughter of Janaka, cheerful Sita, who had a face bright like the moon, embraced Rama, destroyer of demons who was worshipped by the delighted sages.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
30_39.word_by_word: ततः then, शशिप्रभानना face bright like the Moon, जनकात्मजा Sita, daughter of Janaka, राक्षससङ्घमर्दनम् one who destroyed the demons, मुदितैः joyful, महर्षिभिः by the great sages too, सभाज्यमानम् worshipped, तम् him, पुनः again, परिष्वज्य embraced, तदा then, हृष्टा happy, बभूव was.

31_1.shloka: [ Akampana reaches Lanka -- reveals to Ravana about the happenings at Janasthana-- describes Rama's valour-- suggests to Ravana the strategy to win Rama through the abduction of Sita-- Ravana's visit to Maricha-- Maricha's advice to Ravana.]त्वरमाणस्ततो गत्वा जनस्थानादकम्पनः।प्रविश्य लङ्कां वेगेन रावणं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.31.1।।
31_1.translation: Quickly did Akampana leave Janasthana, and quickly he entered Lanka. He said to Ravana:
31_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, अकम्पनः Akampana, त्वरमाणः hastened, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, गत्वा went, वेगेन hurriedly, लङ्काम् Lanka, प्रविश्य entered, रावणम् Ravana, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

31_2.shloka: जनस्थानस्थिता राजन्राक्षसा बहवो हताः।खरश्च निहतस्सङ्ख्ये कथञ्चिदहमागतः।।3.31.2।।
31_2.translation: O king many demons dwelling at Janasthana including Khara have been killed. I manged to escape with much difficulty.
31_2.word_by_word: राजन् O king, जनस्थानस्थिताः dwelling in Janasthana, बहवः many, राक्षसाः demons, हताः are killed, सङ्ख्ये in war, खरश्च Khara too, निहतः  killed, अहम् I, कथञ्चित् with much difficulty, आगतः came.

31_3.shloka: एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवः क्रुद्ध स्संरक्तलोचनः।अकम्पनमुवाचेदं निर्दहन्निव चक्षुषा।।3.31.3।।
31_3.translation: When Akampana thus reported to the tenheaded Ravana, his eyes reddened with anger. He spoke to Akampana as if he was burning him with his eyes :
31_3.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः  been told, दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, क्रुद्धः angry, संरक्तलोचनः with reddened eyes, चक्षुषा by the eyes, निर्दहन्निव as if burning, अकम्पनम् to Akampana,इदम् this, उवाच spoke.

31_4.shloka: केन रम्यं जनस्थानं हतं मम परासुना।को हि सर्वेषु लोकेषु गतिं चाधिगमिष्यति।।3.31.4।।
31_4.translation: He who has destroyed my beautiful Janasthana is sure to die. His life is under the control of others (his enemies). Where can he be(alive) in all the worlds?
31_4.word_by_word: परासुना  whose life is in the enemy's hand , केन by whom, मम my, रम्यम् beautiful, जनस्थानम् Janasthnam, हतम्  destroyed, सर्वेषु all, लोकेषु in the worlds, कः who, गतिम् death, अधिगमिष्यति will surely get.

31_5.shloka: न हि मे विप्रियं कृत्वा शक्यं मघवता सुखम्।प्राप्तुं वैश्रवणेनापि न यमेन न विष्णुना।।3.31.5।।
31_5.translation: One who has caused displeasure to me cannot be happy, be it Indra or Kubera, or Yama or even Visnu.
31_5.word_by_word: मे to me, विप्रियम् displeasure, कृत्वा having caused, मघवता by Indra, सुखम् happily, प्राप्तुम्  to have, न शक्यं हि not possible, वैश्रवणेनापि or by Kubera (the god of wealth), न nor, यमेन by Yama, न or, विष्णुना by Visnu, न or.

31_6.shloka: कालस्य चाप्यहं कालो दहेयमपि पावकम्।मृत्युं मरणधर्मेण संयोजयितुमुत्सहे।।3.31.6।।
31_6.translation: I am the destroyer of the destroyer (Yama). I can burn even that which burns (fire). Ican infuse Death with the characteristics of death itself.
31_6.word_by_word: अहम् I, कालस्य चापि to Yama also, कालः destroyer, पावकमपि fire also, दहेयम् I will burn, मृत्युम् to Yama, मरणधर्मेण  property of  death, संयोजयितुम् unite with, उत्सहे I can do.

31_7.translation: If angry, I can burn the Sun and even fire with my radiance. I can arrest  the speed of the wind instantly with my effort.
31_7.word_by_word: सङ्क्रुद्धः if I am angry, तेजसा by my radiance, आदित्य Sun, पावकौ अपि even fire, दहेयम् I can burn, तरसा instantly, वातस्य wind's, वेगम् speed, निहन्तुम् to arrest, अहम् I, उत्सहे effort.

31_8.shloka: तथा क्रुद्धं दशग्रीवं कृताञ्जलिरकम्पनः।भयात्सन्दिग्धया वाचा रावणं याचतेऽभयम्।।3.31.8।।
31_8.translation: Akampana, out of fear, implored the inflamed Ravana with folded hands and faltering voice to spare him.
31_8.word_by_word: अकम्पनः Akampana, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, तथा likewise, क्रुद्धम् angry, दशग्रीवम् Ravana, भयात् out of fear, सन्दिग्धया hesitatengly, वाचा speech, अभयम् safety, याचते sought.

31_9.translation: The tenheaded Ravana, lord of the demons, assured safety to Akampana, who  gratefully said these words without hesitation:
31_9.word_by_word: रक्षसाम् of demons, वरः best one, दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, तस्मै to him, अभयम् protection, प्रददौ offered, सः अकम्पनः that Akampana, विस्रब्धः grateful, असन्दिग्धम् without hesitation, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

31_10.shloka: पुत्रो दशरथस्यास्ति सिंहसंहननो युवा।रामो नाम वृषस्कन्धो वृत्तायतमहाभुजः।।3.31.10।।
31_10.translation: Dasaratha has  a young son,  by name, Rama. He has a body like a lion's. He has strong, round arms and his shoulders resemble those of a bull.
31_10.word_by_word: सिंहसंहननः with the body like a lion's, युवा youth, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रः son, वृषस्कन्धः  shoulders like a bull's, वृत्तायतमहाभुजः round and strong arms, रामो नाम by name Rama, अस्ति he is.

31_11.shloka: वीरः पृथुयशाश्श्रीमानतुल्यबलविक्रमः।हतं तेन जनस्थानं खरश्च सह दूषणः।।3.31.11।।
31_11.translation: He is a hero of great fame and unequal prowess. He has destroyed your Janasthana and also Khara along with Dusana.
31_11.word_by_word: वीरः hero, पृथुयशाः of great fame, अतुल्यबलविक्रमः a man of unequal prowess, ते your, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, हतम् destroyed, सहदूषणः along with Dusana, खरश्च Khara too.

31_12.shloka: अकम्पनवच श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।नागेन्द्र इव निश्वस्य वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।3.31.12।।
31_12.translation: Having heard Akampana's words, Ravana, the lord of demons, sighed heavily like the king of serpents and said these words:
31_12.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, रावणः Ravana, अकम्पनवचः Akampana's words, श्रुत्वाः having heard, नागेन्द्रः इव like the king of serpents, निश्वस्य after sighing heavily, इदम् these, वचनं च words too, अब्रवीत् said.

31_13.shloka: स सुरेन्द्रेण संयुक्तो रामस्सर्वामरैस्सह।उपयातो जनस्थानं ब्रूहि कच्चिदकम्पन।।3.31.13।।
31_13.translation: Did Rama come to Janasthana with Indra and the gods ? O Akampana   speak.
31_13.word_by_word: अकम्पन Akampana, सः रामः that Rama, सुरेन्द्रेण by Indra, सर्वामरैस्सह along with all deities, संयुक्तः is united, जनस्थानम् to Janasthana, उपयातः कच्चित् came perhaps, ब्रूहि tell?

31_14.shloka: रावणस्य पुनर्वाक्यं निशम्य तदकम्पनः।आचचक्षे बलं तस्य विक्रमं च महात्मनः।।3.31.14।।
31_14.translation: Hearing Ravana's words, Akampana continued telling about great Rama's strength and his exploits in war.
31_14.word_by_word: रावणस्य Ravana's, तत् that, वाक्यम् words, निशम्य  heard, महात्मनः of the great Rama, तस्य his, बलम् strength, विक्रमं च exploits, पुनः again, अचचक्षे started telling.

31_15.translation: Rama is his name. He looks very radiant. He is the best among the archers. Owner of divine weapons, he is comparable to Indra in war.
31_15.word_by_word: रामो नाम Rama by name, महातेजाः very radiant, सर्वधनुष्मताम् among all the archers, श्रेष्ठः best , दिव्यास्त्र गुणसम्पन्नः owner of divine weapons, युधि in war, पुरन्दरसमः like Indra.

31_16.shloka: तस्यानुरूपो बलवान्रक्ताक्षो दन्दुभिस्वनः।कनीयान्लक्ष्मणो नाम भ्राता शशिनिभाननः।।3.31.16।।
31_16.translation: He is strong with bright red eyes. He has a deep voice with the resonance of a drum.His face is like the moon. Lakshmana, his younger brother, is similar to him in appearance.
31_16.word_by_word: बलवान् strong, रक्ताक्षः of bright red eyes, दुन्दुभिस्वनः deep resonance of a drum, शशिनिभाननः face like the Moon, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, तस्य his, अनुरूपः similar in appearance, कनीयान् younger, भ्राता brother.

31_17.shloka: स तेन सह संयुक्तः पावकेनानिलो यथा।श्रीमान्राजवरस्तेन जनस्थानं निपातितम्।।3.31.17।।
31_17.translation: Rama is prosperous. He is the best among kings. Lakshmana with him is like wind with fire. Rama has pulled down Janasthana.
31_17.word_by_word: श्रीमान् prosperous , राजवरः best among kings, सः he, अनिलः wind, पावकेन यथा like with fire, तेन सह along with him, संयुक्तः united with, तेन by him, जनस्थानम् Janasthana, निपातितम् is pulled down.

31_18.shloka: नैव देवा महात्मानो नात्र कार्या विचारणा।शरा रामेण तूत्सृष्टा रुक्मपुङ्खाः पतत्रिणः।।3.31.18।।सर्पाः पञ्चानना भूत्वा भक्षयन्ति स्म राक्षसान्।
31_18.translation: Indeed, they are great men. No god came there (to lend him a hand). There is no need to investigate further about it.  The goldenfeathered arrows released by Rama turned into fivehooded serpents and consumed the demons.
31_18.word_by_word: महात्मानः great people, देवाः gods, नैव not, अत्र here, विचारणा investigate , न कार्यम् not to be done, रामेण by Rama, उत्सृष्टा  released, रुक्मपुङ्खाः goldenfeathered, पतत्रिणः  arrows, शराः darts, पञ्चाननाः fivehooded, सर्पाः serpents, भूत्वा  turned into, राक्षसान् demons, भक्षयन्ति स्म consumed.

31_19.shloka: येन येन च गच्छन्ति राक्षसा भयकर्शिताः।3.31.19।।तेन तेन स्म पश्यन्ति राममेवाग्रतः स्थितम्।इत्थं विनाशितं तेन जनस्थानं तवानघ।।3.31.20।।
31_19.translation: Wherever the demons went they, gripped by fear, only saw Rama in front. O sinless sire In this manner your Janasthana was destroyed by him.
31_19.word_by_word: भयकर्शिताः gripped by fear, राक्षसाः demons, येन येन by whichever (path), गच्छन्ति went, तेन तेन by the same way, अग्रतः in front of them, स्थितम् stationed, राममेव only Rama, पश्यन्ति स्म they saw, अनघ O Sinless Sire, तेन by him, तव your, जनस्थानम् Janasthana, इत्थम् in this manner, विनाशितम् destroyed.

31_20.shloka: अकम्पनवचश्रुत्वा रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।जनस्थानं गमिष्यामि हन्तुं रामं सलक्ष्मणम्।।3.31.21।।
31_20.translation: Hearing Akampana's words, Ravana said, I will go to Janasthana and kill Rama along with Lakshmana.
31_20.word_by_word: अकम्पनवचः Akampana's words, श्रुत्वा  hearing, रावणः Ravana, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, हन्तुम् to kill, जनस्थानम् to Janasthana, गमिष्यामि will go.

31_21.shloka: अथैवमुक्ते वचने प्रोवाचेदमकम्पनः।शृणु राजन्यथावृत्तं रामस्य बलपौरुषम्।।3.31.22।।
31_21.translation: Thus said by Ravana, Akampana responded, I will tell you what happened there. O king   listen to the strength and valour of Rama.
31_21.word_by_word: एवम् in that manner, वचने in those words, उक्ते saying, अकम्पनः Akampana, इदम् thus, प्रोवाच spoke, राजन् king, यथावृत्तम् what happened, रामस्य Rama's, बलपौरुषम् strength and valour, शृणु listen.

31_22.shloka: असाध्यः कुपितो रामो विक्रमेण महायशाः।आपगायास्सुपूर्णाया वेगं परिहरेच्छरैः।।3.31.23।।
31_22.translation: Rama is of great fame. When outraged, he is irrepressible. He can arrest with his arrows even the speed of a river (in spate).
31_22.word_by_word: महायशाः man of great fame, रामः Rama, विक्रमेण in valour, असाध्यः irrepressible, कुपितःwhen outraged, सुपूर्णायाः in full spate, आपगायाः of a river, वेगम् speed, शरैः with arrows, परिहरेत् he may arrest.

31_23.translation: Powerful Rama can pull down the sky along with the planets and stars. He can lift the drowning earth from the depth of the sea.
31_23.word_by_word: श्रीमान् powerful, असौ रामस्तु this Rama, सतारग्रहनक्षत्रं with planets and stars, नभः चापि even the sky, अवसादयेत् can destroy, सीदन्तीम् drowning in the sea, महीम् earth, अभ्युद्धरेत् can lift up.

31_24.shloka: भित्त्वा वेलां समुद्रस्य लोकानाप्लावयेद्विभुः।वेगं वापि समुद्रस्य वायुं वा विधमेच्छरैः।।3.31.25।।
31_24.translation: He is so very powerful that he can drown the earth by breaking the boundary of the sea. He can arrest the speed of the sea or of the wind with his arrows.
31_24.word_by_word: विभुः overlord, समुद्रस्य of the sea, वेलाम् boundary of the sea, भित्त्वा after breaking, लोकान् worlds, आप्लावयेत् can drown, वेगं वापि also speed, वायुं वा or wind, शरैः by his arrows, विधमेत् arrest.

31_25.shloka: संहृत्य वा पुनर्लोकान्विक्रमेण महायशाः।शक्तस्सपुरुषव्याघ्रः स्रष्टुं पुनरपि प्रजाः।।3.31.26।।
31_25.translation: He is a tiger among men. He is so powerful that he can destroy the world and recreate the creatures once again by his valour.
31_25.word_by_word: महायशाः of great fame, सः he, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, पुनः again, लोकान् worlds, विक्रमेण by his valour, संहृत्य after destroying, प्रजाः creatures, पुनःअपि again, स्रष्टुम् to create, शक्तः has the power.

31_26.shloka: न हि रामो दशग्रीव शक्यो जेतुं त्वया युधि।रक्षसां वापि लोकेन स्वर्गः पापजनैरिव।।3.31.27।।
31_26.translation: O tenheaded one, just as it is not possible for sinners to attain heaven it is not possible for you or for the entire world of demons to win him in war
31_26.word_by_word: दशग्रीव O tenheaded one, रामः Rama, युधि in war, त्वया by you, रक्षसाम् of demons, लोकेन by the world, वापि or ever, जेतुम् to win, स्वर्गः heaven, पापजनैरिव by sinners, न शक्यः not possible.

31_27.shloka: न तं वध्यमहं मन्ये सर्वैर्देवासुरैरपि।अयं तस्य वधोपायस्तन्ममैकमनाश्शृणु।।3.31.28।।
31_27.translation: I do not think it is possible for gods and demons together to kill him, yet there is a way for his destruction. You may listen to me with single mindedattention:
