31_27.word_by_word: सर्वैः by all, देवासुरैरपि by gods and demons together, तम् him, वध्यम् victim, अहम् I, न मन्ये I do not think, तस्य his, वधोपाय: means to kill, अयम् this, तत् that, मम from me, एकमनाः singleminded attention, शृणु listen.

31_28.shloka: भार्या तस्योत्तमा लोके सीता नाम सुमध्यमा।श्यामा समविभक्ताङ्गी स्त्रीरत्नं रत्नभूषिता।।3.31.29।।
31_28.translation: Rama has a wife in this world, by name, Sita, who is beautiful, has a slender waistand a wellformed body. Adorned with gems, she is a jewel among women,
31_28.word_by_word: लोके in the world, उत्तमा foremost, श्यामा beautiful woman, समविभक्ताङ्गी woman of wellformed limbs, स्त्रीरत्नं jewel among women, रत्नभूषिता adorned with gems, सीता नाम Sita by name, सुमध्यमा of slender waist, तस्य his, भार्या wife.

31_29.shloka: नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी नाप्सरा नापि दानवी।तुल्या सीमन्तिनी तस्या मानुषीषु कुतो भवेत्।।3.31.30।।
31_29.translation: She has no equal among goddesses nor among gandharvis nor apasaras nor among demonesses. How can there be a peer of her among human beings ?
31_29.word_by_word: तस्याः for her, तुल्या equal, सीमन्तिनी woman, देवी a goddess, नैव not there, गन्धर्वी gandharvi, न not, अप्सराः apsara, न not, दानवी अपि among demonesses, न not there, मानुषीषु among humans, कुतः how can, भवेत् she be.

31_30.shloka: तस्यापहर भार्यांत्वं प्रमथ्य तु महावने।सीतया रहितः कामी रामो हास्यति जीवितम्।।3.31.31।।
31_30.translation: Abduct Rama's wife by force in that great forest and bereft of Sita, he will give up his life.
31_30.word_by_word: त्वम् you, महावने in the great forest, प्रमथ्य forcefully, तस्य his, भार्याम् wife, अपहर you may abduct, कामी passionate, रामः Rama, सीतया by Sita, रहितः separated from, जीवितम्  life, हास्यति will give up.

31_31.shloka: अरोचयत तद्वाक्यं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।चिन्तयित्वा महाबाहुरकम्पनमुवाच ह।।3.31.32।।
31_31.translation: Ravana, the strongarmed king of demons, relished the words of Akampana and pondering over the matter, said to him :
31_31.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, रावणः Ravana, तत् वाक्यम् those words, अरोचयत relished, महाबाहुः of strong arms, चिन्तयित्वा  pondering over, अकम्पनम् to Akampana, उवाच ह said.

31_32.shloka: बाढं काल्यं गमिष्यामि ह्येकस्सारथिना सह।आनयिष्यामि वैदेहीमिमां हृष्टो महापुरीम्।।3.31.33।।
31_32.translation: Yes, early in the morning I will go alone gladly with the charioteer and bring Vaidehi here to this great city.
31_32.word_by_word: बाढम् surely, काल्यम् early in the morning, एकः alone, सारथिना सह along with charioteer, गमिष्यामि will go, हृष्टः gladly, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, इमां (महा)पुरीम् to this city, आनयिष्यामि will bring.

31_33.shloka: अथैवमुक्त्वा प्रययौ खरयुक्तेन रावणः।रथेनादित्यवर्णेन दिशस्सर्वाः प्रकाशयन्।।3.31.34।।
31_33.translation: Having said so, Ravana got on a chariot yoked with donkeys. It had the colour of the Sun. It illuminated all directions. Ravana left.
31_33.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, एवम् so, उक्त्वा having said, अथ then, खरयुक्तेन yoked with donkeys, आदित्यवर्णेन resembling the colour of the Sun, रथेन by chariot, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, प्रकाशयन् illuminating, प्रययौ left.

31_34.shloka: स रथो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य नक्षत्रपथगो महान्।सञ्चार्यमाणश्शुशुभे जलदे चन्द्रमा इव।।3.31.35।।
31_34.translation: The great chariot of the demon king (Ravana) flying in the sky shone like the Moon in the cloud.
31_34.word_by_word: राक्षसेन्द्रस्य of the king of demons, सञ्चार्यमाणः as he was going, नक्षत्रपथगः in the sky, महान् great,  सः he, रथः chariot, जलदे in the clouds, चन्द्रमाः इव like the Moon, शुशुभे shone.

31_35.shloka: स मारीचाश्रमं प्राप्य ताटकेयमुपागमत्।मारीचेनार्चितो राजा भक्ष्यभोज्यैरमानुषैः।।3.31.36।।
31_35.translation: Ravana reached the hermitage of Maricha and met him who was the son of Tataka. The demon king was treated with food that can be chewed and food that can be eaten.
31_35.word_by_word: सः he, मारीचाश्रमम् hermitage of Maricha, प्राप्य entering, ताटकेयम् the son of Tataka, उपागमत् reached, राजा king, अमानुषैः unfit for human consumption, भक्ष्यभोज्यैः food to be chewed and to be eaten, मारीचेन by Maricha, अर्चित: offered.

31_36.shloka: तं स्वयं पूजयित्वा तु आसनेनोदकेन च।अर्थोपहितया वाचा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.31.37।।
31_36.translation: Maricha personally offered Ravana a seat. He offered him water and paid him obeisance. Making meaningful enquiries he said in appropriate words :
31_36.word_by_word: मारीचः Maricha, तम् to him, आसनेन by offering a seat, उदकेन च and water, स्वयम् himself, पूजयित्वा after offering obeisance, अर्थोपहितया in a meaningful manner, वाचा with words, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

31_37.shloka: कच्चित्सुकुशलं राजन्लोकानां राक्षसेश्वर।आशङ्के नाथ जाने त्वं यतस्तूर्णमिहागतः।।3.31.38।।
31_37.translation: O lord of demons  O king hope every one is fine in the world of demons. O lord, (though) your sudden arrival puts me in doubt (about everything going right).
31_37.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वर O lord of demons  राजन् king, लोकानाम् of the world, सुकुशलं कच्चित् hope every one is fine, नाथ O lord, यतः since, त्वम् you, तूर्णम् so quickly, इह here, आगतः have come, आशङ्के doubt, जाने know.

31_38.shloka: एवमुक्तो महातेजा मारीचेन स रावणः।ततः पश्चादिदं वाक्यमब्रवीद्वाक्यकोविदः।।3.31.39।।
31_38.translation: Having thus been asked by Maricha, glorious Ravana, who was eloquent in speech, spoke to him :
31_38.word_by_word: मारीचेन by Maricha, एवम् in this way, उक्तः having spoken, महातेजाः glorious, वाक्यकोविदः one who is eloquent in speech, सः he, रावणः Ravana, ततः then, पश्चात् later, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

31_39.shloka: आरक्षो मे हतस्तात रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।जनस्थानमवध्य तत्सर्वं युधि निपातितम्।।3.31.40।।तस्य मे कुरु साचिव्यं तस्य भार्यापहारणे।
31_39.translation: O dear, Rama who is capable of doing difficult deeds has killed my sentinels. The indestructible Janasthana has been routed in war. Could you help me in abudcting his wife ? (That is the only way to bring him to his knees).
31_39.word_by_word: तात O dear, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा by one who is capable of doing difficult deeds, रामेण by Rama, मे my, आरक्षः sentinel, हतः is killed, तत् it, सर्वम् all, अवध्यम् indestructible, जनस्थानम् Janasthana, युधि in war, निपातितम् have been pulled down, तस्य मे by him, तस्य his, भार्यापहारणे to abduct his wife, साचिव्यम् ministerial help, कुरु do.

31_40.shloka: राक्षसेन्द्रवचश्श्रुत्वा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.31.41।।आख्याता केन सीता सा मित्ररूपेण शत्रुणा।त्वया राक्षसशार्दूल को न नन्दति नन्दितः।।3.31.42।।
31_40.translation: Having heard Ravana ,the king of demons, Maricha said these words:  O king, who is that enemy of yours who, in the guise of a friend,  has told you about Sita? Though obliged by you, who is he that is not happy with you, O tiger among demons?
31_40.word_by_word: राक्षसेन्द्रवचः words of the demon king, श्रुत्वा having heard, मारीचः Maricha, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, मित्ररूपेण prtending to be friend, शत्रुणा by your enemy, केन by whom, सा सीता about that Sita, आख्याता is reported, राक्षसशार्दूल tiger among demons, नन्दितः  delighted by you, कः who, त्वया by you, न नन्दति not enjoy.

31_41.shloka: सीतामिहानयस्वेति को ब्रवीति ब्रवीहि मे।रक्षोलोकस्य सर्वस्य कश्शृङ्गं छेत्तुमिच्छति।।3.31.43।।
31_41.translation: Tell me who asked you to bring Sita ? Who wishes to demolish the peak of the entire clan of demons ?
31_41.word_by_word: सीताम् Sita, इह here, आनयस्व bring, इति this, कः who, ब्रवीति said, मे to me, ब्रवीहि you tell, कः who, सर्वस्य every one's, रक्षोलोकस्य world of demons, शृङ्गम् peak, छेत्तुम् to cut, इच्छति desirous.

31_42.shloka: प्रोत्साहयति कश्च त्वां स च शत्रुरसंशयः।अशीविषमुखाद्दंष्ट्रामुद्धर्तुं चेच्छति त्वया।।3.31.44।।
31_42.translation: He who has encouraged you in this is your enemy, indeed. He wants you to pluck out the fangs from the serpent's mouth.
31_42.word_by_word: कश्च who is he, त्वाम् to you, प्रोत्साहयति he encourages, स च he, शत्रुः enemy, असंशयः no doubt, त्वया by you, अशीविषमुखात् from the serpent's mouth, दंष्ट्राम् fangs, उद्धर्तुम् to pluck out, इच्छति desires.

31_43.shloka: कर्मणा केन केनासि कापथं प्रतिपादितः।सुखसुप्तस्य ते राजन् प्रहृतं केन मूर्धनि।।3.31.45।।
31_43.translation: By  whose action have you been led into this wrong direction? Who has hit you on your forehead while you were sleeping comfortably?
31_43.word_by_word: केन by whom, केन by what, कर्मणा by action, कापथम् an evil direction, प्रतिपादितः advised you, असि you are, राजन् O king, सुखसुप्तस्य of a man sleeping comfortably, ते to you, मूर्धनि केन on your forehead by whom, प्रहृतम् is hit.

31_44.shloka: विशुद्धवंशाभिजनाग्रहस्त स्तेजोमदस्संस्थितदोर्विषाणः।उदीक्षितुं रावण नेह युक्तः स संयुगे राघवगन्धहस्ती।।3.31.46।।
31_44.translation: Rama is like a mighty tusker. His pure and high birth is his trunk. His wellbuilt and strong arms are his tusks. His brilliance in his ichor. Nobody can face this intoxicated elephant in battle.
31_44.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, विशुद्धवंशाभिजनाग्रहस्तः his pure pedigree is his trunk, तेजोमदः his brilliance to his ichor, संस्थितदोर्विषाणः his wellbuilt, strong arms are his tasks, सः that, राघवगन्धहस्ती intoxicated elephant named Rama, संयुगे in war, इह here, न युक्तः not possible, उदीक्षितुम् to look at Rama.

31_45.shloka: असौ रणान्तः स्थितिसंधिवालो विदग्धरक्षोमृगहा नृसिंहः।सुप्तस्त्वया बोधयितुं न युक्तः शराङ्गपूर्णो निशितासिदंष्ट्रः।।3.31.47।।
31_45.translation: Rama is a lion in the form of man, a lion on warfront with its tail touching the waist when angry. This lion is deft in killing deer in the form of clever demons. His body is full of arrows. The sharp swords are his pointed teeth. It does not behove you to rouse such a lion who is asleep.
31_45.word_by_word: रणान्तःस्थितिसंधिवालः lion on warfront with its tail touching the waist when angry, विदग्धरक्षोमृगहा destroyer of the deer in the form of learned demons, शराङ्गपूर्णः having arrows as sharp nails all over the body, निशितासिदंष्ट्रः sharp fangs, सुप्तः asleep, असौ that Rama, नृसिंहः lion in the form of man, त्वया by you, बोधयितुम् to awaken, न युक्तः not proper.

31_46.shloka: चापापहारे भुजवेगपङ्के शरोर्मिमाले सुमहाहवौघे।न रामपातालमुखेऽतिघोरे प्रस्कन्दितुं राक्षसराज युक्तम्।।3.31.48।।
31_46.translation: O king of demons  it is not proper (for you) to jump into the extremely fierce mouth of the nether world known as Rama. Who can steal the bow from his mighty arms which are whirlpools of mud. His arrows are rows of waves in the flow of the great war.
31_46.word_by_word: राक्षसराज O king of demons , चापापहारे steals his bow, भुजवेगपङ्के his mighty arms are whirlpools of mud, शरोर्मिमाले his arrows are rows of waves, सुमहाहवौघे in the flow of the great war, अतिघोरे fierce, रामपातालमुखे Rama is in the mouth of the netherworld, प्रस्कन्दितुम् to leap into, न युक्तम् not proper.

31_47.shloka: प्रसीद लङ्केश्वर राक्षसेन्द्र लङ्कां प्रसन्नो भव साधु गच्छ।त्वं स्वेषु दारेषु रमस्व नित्यं रामस्सभार्यो रमतां वनेषु।।3.31.49।।
31_47.translation: O lord of Lanka, chief of the demons, be pleased to return to Lanka and enjoy yourself in  the company of your wives. Let Rama enjoy with his wife in the forest.
31_47.word_by_word: लङ्केश्वर O lord of Lanka, राक्षसेन्द्र chief of demons, प्रसीद be pleased, साधु it is proper, लङ्काम् to Lanka, गच्छ may go, प्रसन्नः be pleased, भव be, त्वम् you, नित्यम् always, स्वेषु your own, दारेषु by wives, रमस्व enjoy, रामः Rama, सभार्यः with his wife, वनेषु in the forest, रमताम् may enjoy.

31_48.shloka: एवमुक्तो दशग्रीवो मारीचेन स रावणः।न्यवर्तत पुरीं लङ्कां विवेश च गृहोत्तमम्।।3.31.50।।
31_48.translation: Thus advised by Maricha ,the ten headed Ravana returned and entered his best of homes in the city of Lanka .इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
31_48.word_by_word: मारीचेन by Maricha, एवम् thus, उक्तः advised, दशग्रीवः the ten headed demon, सः रावणः that Ravana, लङ्कां पुरीम् to the city of Lanka, न्यवर्तत returned, गृहोत्तमम् best of homes, विवेश च entered.

32_1.shloka: [Surpanakha meets Ravana at Lanka -- describes Rama, Sita and Lakshmana to Ravana.]ततश्शूर्पणखा दृष्ट्वा सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।हतान्येकेन रामेण रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।।3.32.1।।दूषणं च खरं चैव हतं त्रिशिरसा सह।दृष्ट्वा पुनर्महानादं ननाद जलदो यथा।।3.32.2।।
32_1.translation: Seeing Dusana, Khara and also Trisira along with the fourteen thousand demon warriors of terrific performance killed by Rama, singlehanded, Surpanakha roared     like a cloud.
32_1.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, एकेन alone, रामेण by Rama, भीमकर्मणाम् of terrible deeds, रक्षसाम् of demons चतुर्दशसहस्राणि fourteen thousand, हतानि killed, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, दूषणं च and Dusana, खरं चैव also Khara, त्रिशिरसा सह including Trisira, हतम् killed, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, पुनः again, जलदः यथा like a cloud, महानादम्  great noise, ननाद produced.

32_2.shloka: सा दृष्ट्वा कर्म रामस्य कृतमन्यैस्सुदुष्करम्।जगाम परमोद्विग्ना लङ्कां रावणपालिताम्।।3.32.3।।
32_2.translation: Seeing the performance of Rama which is very difficult for others, Surpanakha got scared and went to Lanka, ruled by Ravana.
32_2.word_by_word: सा she, अन्यैः by others, सुदुष्करम् very difficult to do, रामस्य Rama's, कृतम् done, कर्म deed, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, परमोद्विग्ना getting very scared, रावणपालिताम् a placed ruled by Ravana, लङ्काम् Lanka, जगाम went.

32_3.shloka: सा ददर्श विमानाग्रे रावणं दीप्ततेजसम्।उपोपविष्टं सचिवैर्मरुद्भिरिव वासवम्।।3.32.4।।
32_3.translation: Surpanakha saw Ravana shining brilliantly, seated like Indra along with ministers and Maruts on top of the aerial chariot.
32_3.word_by_word: सा Surpanakha, मरुद्भि: with Maruts, वासवम् इव like Indra, सचिवैः with ministers, उपोपविष्टम् seated, दीप्ततेजसम् shining brilliantly, रावणम् to Ravana, विमानाग्रे on top of the aerial chariot, ददर्श saw.

32_4.shloka: आसीनं सूर्यसङ्काशे काञ्चने परमासने।रुक्मवेदिगतं प्राज्यं ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम्।।3.32.5।।
32_4.translation: Ravana, sitting on the magnificent golden seat on a golden altar looked radiant like the Sun or the blazing fire.
32_4.word_by_word: सूर्यसङ्काशे radiating like the Sun, काञ्चने golden, परमासने on a magnificent seat, आसीनम् seated, रुक्मवेदिगतम् at the golden altar, प्राज्यम् ज्वलन्तम् blazing, पावकम् इव like fire.

32_5.shloka: देवगन्धर्वभूतानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम्।अजेयं समरे शूरं व्यात्ताननमिवान्तकम्।।3.32.6।।
32_5.translation: Invincible to gods, gandharvas, all living beings, great sages and seers, he was like Yama, lord of death with wide open jaws.
32_5.word_by_word: देवगन्धर्वभूतानाम् of gods, gandharvas, all living beings, महात्मनाम् of great sages, ऋषीणां च and seers, समरे in war, अजेयम् invincible, शूरम् warrior, व्यात्ताननम् wide open jaws, अन्तकम् इव like Yama, lord of death.

32_6.translation: He had scars of wounds caused by the thunderbolt received in war between gods and demons, and marks of scars on his chest made by tips of the the tusks of elephant Airavata.
32_6.word_by_word: देवासुरविमर्देषु in encounter between gods and demons, वज्राशनिकृतव्रणम् wounded by missiles and thunderbolts,  ऐरावतविषाणाग्रैः by the tips of the tusks of elephant Airavata, उद्धृष्टकिणवक्षसम् marks of scars on the chest.

32_7.shloka: विंशद्भुजं दशग्रीवं दर्शनीयपरिच्छदम्।विशालवक्षसं वीरं राजलक्षण शोभितम्।।3.32.8।।
32_7.translation: Valiant Ravana had an attractive appearance with beautiful dresses twenty arms,ten heads, a broad chest  and brilliant royal marks.
32_7.word_by_word: विंशद्भुजम् with twenty arms, दशग्रीवम् ten heads, दर्शनीयपरिच्छदम्  attractive attire, विशालवक्षसम् broadchested  वीरम् valiant , राजलक्षण शोभितम् with royal marks.

32_8.translation: Wearing burnished golden earrings, he looked bright like the glittering vaidurya. And with his wellformed arms, white teeth and  wide mouth, he looked like a mountain.
32_8.word_by_word: स्निग्धवैडूर्यसंकाशम् comparable to glittering vaiduryas, तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलम् wearing bright burnished golden earrings, सुभुजम्  strong arms, शुक्लदशनम् with white teeth, महास्यम्  wide mouth, पर्वतोपम् like a mountain.

32_9.translation: He was hit by the wheel of Visnu for hundreds of times during great wars and beaten by other weapons.
32_9.word_by_word: देवसंयुगे while in war with gods, शतश: in hundreds  विष्णुचक्रनिपातैश्च hit with the wheel of Visnu, महायुद्धेषु in great wars, अन्यैः by others, शस्त्रप्रहारैश्च hit by several weapons, ताडितम्beaten.

32_10.shloka: अहताङ्गं समस्तैश्च देवप्रहरणैस्तथा।अक्षोभ्याणां समुद्राणां क्षोभणं क्षिप्रकारिणम्।।3.32.11।।
32_10.translation: Ravana whose body was not hurt by the weapons in war with gods, who could perturb even the imperturbable seas, was quick  in action.
32_10.word_by_word: तथा so also, समस्तै: by all, देवप्रहरणैः with the striking weapons of gods, अहताङ्गम् one whose limbs are not hurt, अक्षोभ्याणाम् of the imperturbable, समुद्राणाम् of the seas, क्षोभणम् one who causes agitation, क्षिप्रकारिणम् quick in action.

32_11.shloka: क्षेप्तारं पर्वतेन्द्राणां सुराणां च प्रमर्दनम्।उच्छेत्तारं च धर्माणां परदाराभिमर्शनम्।।3.32.12।।
32_11.translation: (He was) one who could lift and throw great mountains, torment even gods, violate  dharma at the root, and cast an evil eye on the wives of others.
32_11.word_by_word: पर्वतेन्द्राणाम् of great mountains, क्षेप्तारम् who threw, सूराणां च of even gods, प्रमर्दनम् tormentor, धर्माणाम् of dharmas, उच्छेत्तारम् destroyer at the root, परदाराभिमर्शनम् one who casts evil eye on the wives of others.

32_12.shloka: सर्वदिव्यास्त्रयोक्तारं यज्ञविघ्नकरं सदा।पुरीं भोगवतीं प्राप्य पराजित्य च वासुकिम्।।3.32.13।।तक्षकस्य प्रियां भार्यां पराजित्य जहार यः।
32_12.translation: He who could employ all divine weapons, disrupt sacrifices, had gone to the city of Bhogavati, defeated Vasuki and abducted the dear wife of Takshaka.
32_12.word_by_word: सर्वदिव्यास्त्रयोक्तारम् employ all divine weapons, सदा always, यज्ञविघ्नकरम् one who creates obstacles for sacrifices, यः such, भोगवतीम् to the city of  Bhogavati, पुरीम् city, प्राप्यhaving reached, वासुकिम् Vasuki the sepentking, पराजित्य च  having defeated, तक्षकस्य Takshaka's, प्रियाम् dear, भार्याम् wife, पराजित्य having defeated, जहार abducted.

32_13.shloka: कैलासपर्वतं गत्वा विजित्य नरवाहनम्।विमानं पुष्पकं तस्य कामगं वै जहार यः।।3.32.14।।
32_13.translation: Ravana went to mount Kailasa, conquered Kubera and took away forcibly his aerial chariot Pushpaka which can fly as per the rider's desire
32_13.word_by_word: यः such (Ravana), कैलासपर्वतम् mount Kailasa, गत्वा on going, नरवाहनम् Kubera, विजित्य having conquered, तस्य his, कामगम्  which can fly at the rider's desire, पुष्पकम् aerial chariot called Pushpaka, जहार took away forcibly.

32_14.shloka: वनं चैत्ररथं दिव्यं नलिनीं नन्दनं वनम्।विनाशयति यः क्रोधाद्देवोद्यानानि वीर्यवान्।।3.32.15।।
32_14.translation: Out of anger he destroyed all the gardens of gods like Chitraratha of Kubera full of lotusponds and Nandana, the pleasuregarden of Indra.
32_14.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, यः he was, चैत्ररथम् Chaitraratha, the garden of Kubera, वनम् garden, नलिनीम् lotuspond, नन्दनं वनम् pleasure garden of Indra, देवोद्यानानि gardens of gods, क्रोधात् with anguish, विनाशयति destroyed.

32_15.translation: He was like the peak of a mountain. He could stop with his arms the great Moon and Sun from rising. He was a scorcher of enemies.
32_15.word_by_word: परन्तपौ scorcher of enemies, शैलशिखरोपमः like the peak of a mountain, महाभागौ of great prowess, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, बाहुभ्याम् with his arms, निवारयति  prevents, उत्तिष्ठन्तौ while they rise.

32_16.shloka: दशवर्षसहस्राणि तपस्तप्वा महावने।पुरा स्वयंभुवे धीरश्शिरांस्युपजहार यः।।3.32.17।।
32_16.translation: This steadfast Ravana who had in the past performed penance for ten thousand years in a dense forest offered his heads to the selfborn Brahma.
32_16.word_by_word: धीरः steadfast, यः who, पुरा in the past, महावने in a dense forest, दशवर्षसहस्राणि ten thousand years, तपः penance, तप्त्वा after performing, स्वयंभुवे to the Creator,                                                                                                                                                                                               शिरांसि heads, उपजहार offered.

32_17.translation: He was unafraid of death in the hands of gods or demons or gandharvas or pisachas or birds or snakes in war except humans.
32_17.word_by_word: यस्य for whom, सङ्ग्रामे in war, मानुषात् ऋते except by humans, देवदानवगन्धर्वपिशाचपतगोरगैः by gods, demons, gandharvas, pisachas birds and snakes, मृत्युतः death, अभयम् fearless.

32_18.translation: The mighty Ravana  defiled the sacred Soma juice, worthy of oblations, extracted byBrahmins by chanting mantras in scrifices.
32_18.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, यः he, अध्वरेषु during sacrifices, हविर्धानेषु at places fit for offering oblations, द्विजातिभिः by brahmins, अभिष्टुतम् extracted, मन्त्रै: by chanting Vedic hymns, पुण्यम् sacred, सोमम् Soma juice, उपहन्ति made impure.

32_19.shloka: आप्तयज्ञहरं क्रूरं ब्रह्मघ्नं दुष्टचारिणम्।कर्कशं निरनुक्रोशं प्रजानामहिते रतम्।।3.32.20।।
32_19.translation: He disrupted sacrifices at the final stage. He killed brahmins. He was ruthless, harsh, and  merciless. He was involved in activities against human welfare.
32_19.word_by_word: आप्तयज्ञहरम् a disrupter of sacrifices at the climax, क्रूरम् a cruel one, ब्रह्मघ्नम् destroyer of  brahmins, दुष्टचारिणम् one of ruthless conduct, कर्कशम् a harsh one, निरनुक्रोशम् a merciless one, प्रजानाम् towards people, अहिते against their welfare, रतम् involved.

32_20.shloka: रावणं सर्वभूतानां सर्वलोकभयावहम्।राक्षसी भ्रातरं शूरं सा ददर्श महाबलम्।।3.32.21।।
32_20.translation: That demoness , Surpanakha saw  her very strong,valiant brother Ravana who made all beings cry and created fear in all worlds
32_20.word_by_word: सा that, राक्षसी demoness i, सर्वभूतानाम् of all beings, रावणम्  one who makes others cry, सर्वलोकभयावहम्  creates fear among all beings, शूरम् a valiant, महाबलम् very strong, भ्रातरम् brother, ददर्श saw.

32_21.shloka: तं दिव्यवस्त्राभरणं दिव्यमाल्योपशोभितम्।आसने सूपविष्टं च कालकालमिवोद्यतम्।।3.32.22।।
32_21.translation: Resplendently attired, adorned with jewels, wearing beautiful gardlands, seated on a raised throne, he(Ravana) was like death to even the lord of death
32_21.word_by_word: दिव्यवस्त्राभरणम् resplendently attired and adorned with jewels, दिव्यमाल्योपशोभितम्  wearing beautiful garlands, आसने on the seat, सूपविष्टम् well seated, उद्यतम् on an elevated throne, कालकालमिव like death even to the lord of death, तम् him.

32_22.shloka: राक्षसेन्द्रं महाभागं पौलस्त्यकुलनन्दनम्। 3.32.23।।रावणं शत्रुहन्तारं मन्त्रिभिः परिवारितम्।अभिगम्याब्रवीद्वाक्यं राक्षसी भयविह्वला।।3.32.24।।
32_22.translation: On reaching Ravana, the lord of demons, the delight of the Paulastya dynasty, and the destroyer of enemies surrounded by ministers, the terrified, Surpanakha said these words:
32_22.word_by_word: राक्षसी demoness, भयविह्वला terrified, राक्षसेन्द्रम् lord of demons, महाभागम् of great prowess, पौलस्त्यकुलनन्दनम् delight of the Paulastya race, शत्रुहन्तारम् destroyer of enemies, मन्त्रिभिः by ministers, परिवारितम् surrounded, रावणम् Ravana, अभिगम्य   after reaching, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

32_23.shloka: तमब्रवीद्दीप्तविशाललोचनं प्रदर्शयित्वा भयमोहमूर्छिता।सुदारुणं वाक्यमभीतचारिणी महात्मना शूर्पणखा विरूपिता।।3.32.25।।
32_23.translation: Showing her body disfigured by great Lakshmana, Surpanakha, the fearless wanderer, overwhelmed with fear said these cruel words  to Ravana sitting with large, glittering eyes:इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
32_23.word_by_word: अभीतचारिणी fearless wanderer, महात्मना great Lakshmana, विरूपिता disfigured, शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, भयमोहमूर्छिता overcome by fear, प्रदर्शयित्वा showing, दीप्तविशाललोचनम् of large, glittering eyes, तम् him, सुदारुणम् cruel, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

33_1.shloka: [Surpanakha points out the flaws in Ravana's rule-- praises Rama's abilities-- describes the qualities of a good king.]ततः शूर्पणखा दीना रावणं लोकरावणम्।अमात्यमध्ये सङ्क्रुद्धा परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.33.1।।
33_1.translation: When the distressed, anguished Surpanakha met Ravana who makes the world weep, he was seated in the midst of his ministers. She addressed him these harsh words:
33_1.word_by_word: ततः then, दीना distressed , शूर्पणखा Surpanakha, सङ्क्रुद्धा  anguished , अमात्यमध्ये in the midst of ministers, लोकरावणम्  who makes the world cry, रावणम् Ravana, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

33_2.shloka: प्रमत्तः कामभोगेषु स्वैरवृत्तो निरङ्कुशः।समुत्पन्नं भयं घोरं बोद्धव्यं नावबुध्यसे।।3.33.2।।
33_2.translation: Intoxicated with the pleasures of passion, acting on your own, ungoaded and unguided, you do not understand the problems arising out of great fear, problems you ought to know.
33_2.word_by_word: प्रमत्तः intoxicated, कामभोगेषु  with the pleasures of passion, स्वैरवृत्तः  acting impulsively, निरङ्कुशः ungoaded, बोद्धव्यम्  which ought to be understood, समुत्पन्नम्  arising, घोरम् dreadful, भयम् fear, नावबुध्यसे do not understand.

33_3.shloka: सक्तं ग्राम्येषु भोगेषु कामवृत्तं महीपतिम्।लुब्धं न बहुमन्यन्ते श्मशानाग्निमिव प्रजाः।।3.33.3।।
33_3.translation: Lustful and greedy, you are addicted to vulgar pleasures. People will not respect you like the fire on the crematorium.
33_3.word_by_word: ग्राम्येषु vulgar, भोगेषु pleasures, सक्तम् addicted to, कामवृत्तम् who acts as he wishes, लुब्धम् greedy, महीपतिम् king, प्रजाः people, श्मशानाग्निमिव like the fire in the crematorium, नबहुमन्यन्ते will not respect.

33_4.shloka: स्वयं कार्याणि यः काले नानुतिष्ठति पार्थिवः।स तु वै सह राज्येन तैश्च कार्यैर्विनश्यति।।3.33.4।।
33_4.translation: A king who does not act at the right time will be ruined along with the kingdom and its works.
33_4.word_by_word: पार्थिवः king, काले at the right time, कार्याणि actions, नानुतिष्ठति does not execute, राज्येन सह along with kingdom, तैः with them, कार्यैश्च सह along with works, विनश्यति  is destroyed.

33_5.shloka: अयुक्तचारं दुर्दर्शमस्वाधीनं नराधिपम्।वर्जयन्ति नरा दूरान्नदीपङ्कामिव द्विपाः।।3.33.5।।
33_5.translation: Just as elephants keep away from a muddy river, people will keep distance from the king who does not employ spies, does not give audience to his people and is not independent.
33_5.word_by_word: अयुक्तचारम् without employment of spies, दुर्दर्शम्  not giving audience (to  people), अस्वाधीनम् not independent, नराधिपम् king, नराः people, द्विपाः elephants, नदीपङ्कामिव like a muddy river, दूरात् from a distance, वर्जयन्ति keep away.

33_6.shloka: ये न रक्षन्ति विषयमस्वाधीना नराधिपाः।ते न वृद्ध्या प्रकाशन्ते गिरयस्सागरे यथा।।3.33.6।।
33_6.translation: Kings who are not under their own control and cannot protect the country, do not attract the minds of the people like mountains inside sea water.
33_6.word_by_word: अस्वाधीनाः not independent, ये those, नराधिपाः kings, विषयम् their country, न रक्षन्ति do not protect, ते they, वृद्ध्या by intellect, सागरे in the sea, गिरयः यथा like the mountains, न प्रकाशन्ते do not shine.

33_7.shloka: आत्मवद्भिर्विगृह्य त्वं देवगन्धर्वदानवैः।अयुक्तचारश्चपलः कथं राजा भविष्यसि।।3.33.7।।
33_7.translation: Having created enmity with selfrespecting persons like gods, gandharvas and demons, with a fickle mind and without spies how long can you continue as king ?
33_7.word_by_word: त्वम् you, आत्मवद्भि: by the selfrespecting, देवगन्धर्वदानवैः by gods, gandharvas and demons, विगृह्य having made enmity, अयुक्तचारः  not appointed spies, चपलः fickleminded, कथम् how, राजा king, भविष्यसि will you be?

33_8.shloka: त्वन्तु बालस्वभावश्च बुद्धिहीनश्च राक्षस।ज्ञातव्यन्तु न जानीषे कथं राजा भविष्यसि।।3.33.8।।
33_8.translation: O demon  you are childish and foolish. You do not even know what ought to be known. How can you rule as a king?
33_8.word_by_word: राक्षस O demon, त्वं तु you are, बालस्वभावश्च childish in nature, बुद्धिहीनश्च devoid of any intellect, ज्ञातव्यम् what ought to be known, न जानीषे you do not know, कथं how, राज king, भविष्यसि will you be?

33_9.shloka: येषां चारश्च कोशश्च नयश्च जयतां वर।अस्वाधीना नरेन्द्राणां प्राकृतैस्ते जनैस्समाः।।3.33.9।।
33_9.translation: The best among the victorious kings, who are not masters of their espionage, judicial system and their exchequer are equal to the laity.
33_9.word_by_word: जयताम् of the victorious, वर best, येषाम् of those, नरेन्द्राणाम् of kings, चारश्च spy, कोशश्च treasury, नयश्च judiciary, अस्वाधीनाः not under control, ते those, प्राकृतैः with commoners, जनैः with people, समाः are equals.

33_10.shloka: यस्मात्पश्यन्ति दूरस्थान् सर्वानर्थान्नराधिपाः।चारेण तस्मादुच्यन्ते राजानो दीर्घचक्षुषः।।3.33.10।।
33_10.translation: Since kings can see things from a faroff place with the help of the spies they are called farsighted.
33_10.word_by_word: नराधिपाः kings, यस्मात् since, दूरस्थान् things at distant places, सर्वान् all, अर्थान् issues, चारेण by spies, पश्यन्ति see, तस्मात् for that, राजानः kings, दीर्घचक्षुषः farsighted, उच्यन्ते are called.

33_11.shloka: अयुक्तचारं मन्ये त्वां प्राकृतैस्सचिवैर्वृतम्।स्वजनं तु जनस्थाने हतं यो नावबुद्ध्यसे।।3.33.11।।
33_11.translation: Since you have not engaged any spy you do not know when your own relatives were killed in Janasthana. I take you to be a fool surrounded by ordinary ministers.
33_11.word_by_word: अयुक्तचारम् without employing spies, त्वाम् you, प्राकृतैः ignoramus, सचिवैः ministers, वृतम् surrounding, मन्ये consider, यः who, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, स्वजनम् your relations, हतम् killed, नावबुद्ध्यसे you do not know.

33_12.shloka: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां क्रूरकर्मणाम्।हतान्येकेन रामेण खरश्च सहदूषणः।।3.33.12।।
33_12.translation: One Rama alone killed all the fourteen thousand demons including Dusana and Khara, demons  capable of fierce exploits.
33_12.word_by_word: एकेन by one alone, रामेण by Rama, क्रूरकर्मणाम् perpetrators of cruel acts, रक्षसाम् demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, हतानि are killed, सहदूषणः and Dusana too, खरश्च Khara also.

33_13.shloka: ऋषीणामभयं दत्तं कृतक्षेमाश्च दण्डकाः।धर्षितं च जनस्थानं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।3.33.13।।
33_13.translation: Rama, the effortless performer of formindable tasks, has assured safety to the sages. Peace and happiness was restored to Dandaka forest but Janasthana has been ravaged.
33_13.word_by_word: अक्लिष्टकर्मणा by effortless performer of formidable tasks, रामेण by Rama, ऋषीणाम् of the ascetics, अभयम् safety, दत्तम् is given, दण्डकाः Dandaka's, कृतक्षेमाश्च peace restored, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, धर्षितं च is attacked.

33_14.shloka: त्वन्तु लुब्दः प्रमत्तश्च पराधीनश्च रावण।विषये स्वे समुत्पन्नं भयं यो नावबुध्यसे।।3.33.14।।
33_14.translation: O Ravana, you are not aware of what  has happened to your own kingdom. You are avaricious, intoxicated, and under others' control. A great fear has been generated in your own kingdom.
33_14.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, त्वं तु you are, लुब्धः  avaricious, प्रमत्तः intoxicated, पराधीनश्च under others control, यः who, स्वे his own, विषये kingdom, (सम्) उत्पन्नम् generated, भयम् fear, नावबुध्यसे not aware of.

33_15.shloka: तीक्ष्णमल्पप्रदातारं प्रमत्तं गर्वितं शठम्।व्यसने सर्वभूतानि नाभिधावन्ति पार्थिवम्।।3.33.15।।
33_15.translation: All living beings stop seeking refuge under a king who is, not a generous giver, but intoxicated, harsh, arrogant and fraudulent. They do not run to him for protection in times of calamity.
33_15.word_by_word: तीक्ष्णम् sharp one, अल्पप्रदातारम् not a generous giver, प्रमत्तम् intoxicated, गर्वितम् proud, शठम् fraudulent, पार्थिवम् to the king, व्यसने in calamity, सर्वभूतानि all beings, नाभिधावन्ति not run for protection.

33_16.shloka: अतिमानिनमग्राह्यमात्मसम्भावितं नरम्।क्रोधिनं व्यसने हन्ति स्वजनोऽपि महीपतिम्।।3.33.16।।
33_16.translation: A king who is extremely arrogant, who is not acceptable to good people, who is selfconceited and cholerictempered will be murdered even by his own people at the time of adversity.
33_16.word_by_word: अतिमानिनम् extremely arrogant, अग्राह्यम् one who is not acceptable (to good people), आत्मसम्भावितं नरम् selfconceited, क्रोधिनम् cholorictempered, महीपतिम् king, स्वजनोऽपि his own people also, व्यसने in adversity, हन्ति will murder.

33_17.shloka: नानुतिष्ठति कार्याणि भयेषु न बिभेति च।क्षिप्रं राज्याच्युतो दीनस्तृणैस्तुल्यो भविष्यति।।3.33.17।।
33_17.translation: A king who does not do what ought to be done, does not fear what ought to be feared, will surely be dislodged from the kingdom and live a wretched life like a blade of grass.
33_17.word_by_word: कार्याणि works, नानुतिष्ठति he does not do, भयेषु fear, न बिभेति च not afraid of, क्षिप्रम् surely, राज्यात् from the kingdom, च्युतः toppled down, दीनः wretched, तृणैः with a blade of grass, तुल्यः equal, भविष्यति will be.

33_18.shloka: शुष्कैः काष्ठैर्भवेत्कार्यं लोष्टैरपि च पांसुभिः।न तु स्थानात्परिभ्रष्टैः कार्यं स्याद्वसुधाधिपैः।।3.33.18।।
33_18.translation: Even dried up logs, or clods of earth, or a handful of dust may have some value but not a king who is dethroned.
33_18.word_by_word: शुष्कैः dried up, काष्ठैः logs of wood, लोष्टैरपि even clods of earth, पांसुभिरपि च even with the dust, कार्यम् may have some value, भवेत् will be, तु but, स्थानात् from the throne, परिभ्रष्टैः thrown out, वसुधाधिपै by the kings, कार्यम् work, न स्यात् will not be.

33_19.shloka: अपभुक्तं यथा वासस्स्रजो वा मृदिता यथा।एवं राज्यात्परिभ्रष्टस्समर्थोऽपि निरर्थकः।।3.33.19।।
33_19.translation: Like a piece of cloth that is worn and discarded, like garlands put on  and crushed, a king dislodged from the kingdom is worthless even if he is capable.
33_19.word_by_word: उपभुक्तम् worn and discarded, वासः cloth, यथा as, मृदिताः crushed, स्रजो वा even garlands, यथा as, एवम् in that way, राज्यात् from the kingdom, परिभ्रष्टः fallen, समर्थोऽपि even if he be capable, निरर्थकः worthless.

33_20.shloka: अप्रमत्तश्च यो राजा सर्वज्ञो विजितेन्द्रियः।कृतज्ञो धर्मशीलश्च स राजा तिष्ठते चिरम्।।3.33.20।।
33_20.translation: A king who is alert, omniscient, has control over his senses, has a sense of gratitude and one of righteous conduct continues to rule for a long time.
33_20.word_by_word: यः राजा such king, अप्रमत्तः alert, सर्वज्ञः omniscient, विजितेन्द्रियः has control over his senses, कृतज्ञः grateful, धर्मशीलश्च one with moral conduct, सः राजा that king, चिरम् for a long time, तिष्ठते continues to rule.

33_21.shloka: नयनाभ्यां प्रसुप्तोऽपि जागर्ति नयचक्षुषा।त्यक्तक्रोधप्रमादश्च स राजा पूज्यते जनैः।।3.33.21।।
33_21.translation: The king who keeps both his eyes shut but keeps the eye of justice open, one who is free from anger and remains ever alert, is worshipped by the people.
33_21.word_by_word: नयनाभ्याम् with both the eyes, प्रसुप्तोऽपि even when asleep, नयचक्षुषा eye of justice, जागर्ति  who is awake, त्यक्तक्रोधः devoid of anger, अप्रमादश्च attentive man, सः राजा such a king, जनैः by people, पूज्यते is worshipped.

33_22.shloka: त्वं तु रावण दुर्बुद्धिर्गुणैरेतैर्विवर्जितः।यस्य तेऽविदितश्चारै रक्षसां सुमहान्वधः।।3.33.22।।
33_22.translation: O Ravana you are evilminded. You  are devoid of all these good qualities. Your spies could not know that there had been a great massacre of your fellowdemons.
33_22.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, दुर्बुद्धि: evilminded, त्वं तु you are, एतैः by these, गुणैः qualities, विवर्जितः you are devoid of, यस्य whose, ते your, रक्षसाम् of demons, सुमहान् very great, वधः destruction, चारैः by spies, अविदितः was not known.

33_23.shloka: परावमन्ता विषयेषु सङ्गतो न देशकालप्रविभागतत्ववित्।अयुक्तबुद्धिर्गुणदोषनिश्चये विपन्नराज्यो नचिराद्विपत्स्यसे।।3.33.23।।
33_23.translation: A king who accuses others, who is addicted to sensual pleasures, who lacks a sense of judgement of  place and time, a sense of discrimination between virtue and vice and the right wisdom will destroy himself and the kingdom in no time.
33_23.word_by_word: परावमन्ता accusing others, विषयेषु in pleasures, सङ्गतः addicted, देशकालप्रविभागतत्ववित्  sense of judgement of place and time, गुणदोषनिश्चये discrimination of vice and virtue, अयुक्तबुद्धिः lacks wisdom, विपन्नराज्यः with loss of kingdom, नचिरात् in no time, विपत्स्यसे will destroy yourself.

33_24.shloka: इति स्वदोषान् परिकीर्तितांस्तया समीक्ष्य बुद्ध्या क्षणदाचरेश्वरः।धनेन दर्पेण बलेन चान्वितो विचिन्तयामास चिरं स रावणः।।3.33.24।।
33_24.translation: Ravana, king of demons, wealthy, arrogant and mighty, listened to Surpanakha and pondered over the mistakes she mentioned.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
33_24.word_by_word: क्षणदाचरेश्वरः lord of nightwalkers, धनेन by wealth, दर्पेण by arrogance, बलेन च and by strength, अन्वितः heeding, सः रावणः that Ravana, इति thus, तया by her, परिकीर्तितान् mentioned, स्वदोषान् his mistakes, बुद्ध्या by his intellect, समीक्ष्य after reviewing, चिरम् for a long time, विचिन्तयामास started thinking over.

34_1.shloka: [Surpanakha describes Rama and Sita to Ravana--incites him to abduct Sita and make her his wife.]ततश्शूर्पणखां दृष्ट्वा ब्रुवन्तीं परुषं वचः।अमात्यमध्ये सङ्क्रुद्धः परिपप्रच्छ रावणः।।3.34.1।।
34_1.translation: Incensed at the harsh words Surpanakha used in the midst of ministers, Ravana said:
34_1.word_by_word: ततः then, अमात्यमध्ये in the midst of ministers, परुषम् harsh, वचः words, ब्रुवन्तीम् while speaking, शूर्पणखाम् to Surpanakha, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, सङ्क्रुद्धः enraged, रावणः Ravana, परिपप्रच्छ asked.

34_2.shloka: कश्च रामः कथंवीर्यः किंरूपः किंपराक्रमः।किमर्थं दण्डकारण्यं प्रविष्टस्सुदुरासदम्।।3.34.2।।
34_2.translation: Who is Rama? What is his strength? How does he look? How valiant is he? For what purpose has he entered the impenetrable Dandaka forest?
34_2.word_by_word: रामः Rama, कः who is he, कथंवीर्यः what is his strength?, किंरूपः how does he look, किंपराक्रमः how valiant, सुदुरासदम् impenetrable, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, किमर्थम् for what purpose?, प्रविष्टः he entered.

34_3.shloka: आयुधं किञ्च रामस्य निहता येन राक्षसाः।खरश्च निहतस्संख्ये दूषणस्त्रिशिरास्तथा।।3.34.3।।
34_3.translation: With what weapons he has killed demons like Khara, Dusana and Trisira ?
34_3.word_by_word: येन by what, राक्षसाः demons, खरश्च and Khara, दूषणः Dusana, तथा likewise, त्रिशिराः Thrisira, सङ्ख्ये in war, निहताः killed, रामस्य Rama's, आयुधम् weapon, किम् what.

34_4.shloka: इत्युक्ता राक्षसेन्द्रेण राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता।ततो रामं यथातत्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।।3.34.4।।
34_4.translation: Thus questioned by Ravana, the demoness, overcome by anger, began telling him about Rama faithfully:
34_4.word_by_word: राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the king of demons, इति thus, उक्ता spoken, क्रोधमूर्छिता overtaken by anger, राक्षसी the demoness ततः then, रामम् Rama, यथातत्वम् faithfully, आख्यातुम् to describe, उपचक्रमे she started.

34_5.translation: Rama, Dasaratha's son, has long arms, large eyes. He is clad in deerskin and bark. He resembles Cupid.
34_5.word_by_word: दशरथात्मजः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, दीर्घबाहुः  long armed, विशालाक्षः large eyed, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरः clad in deer skin and bark , कन्दर्पसमरूपश्च resembled Cupid৷৷

34_6.shloka: शक्रचापनिभं चापं विकृष्य कनकाङ्गदम्।दीप्तान् क्षिपति नाराचान्सर्पानिव महाविषान्।।3.34.6।।
34_6.translation: His bow resembles Indra's, He is adorned with gold bands. Drawing the bow, he releases glittering arrows like highly poisonous snakes.
34_6.word_by_word: शक्रचापनिभम् bow like Indra's, कनकाङ्गदम् gold armlets, चापम् bow, विकृष्य draws, महाविषान् highly poisonous, सर्पानिव snake like, दीप्तान् glittering, नाराचान् iron arrows, क्षिपति releases.

34_7.shloka: नाददानं शरान्घोरान्नमुञ्चन्तं शिलीमुखान्।न कार्मुकं विकर्षन्तं रामं पश्यामि संयुगे।।3.34.7।।
34_7.translation: I could not see Rama in the dreadful war while he was pulling an arrow from the quiver, aiming the dart, and drawing the bowstring.
34_7.word_by_word: संयुगे in war, घोरान् dreadful, शरान् arrows, आददानम् drawing from the quiver, रामम् Rama, पश्यामि I see, शिलीमुखान्  darts, मुञ्चन्तम् released, न not, कार्मुकम् a bow, विकर्षन्तम् pulling apart, न not.

34_8.shloka: हन्यमानं तु तत्सैन्यं पश्यामि शरवृष्टिभिः।इन्द्रेणेवोत्तमं सस्यमाहतन्त्वश्मवृष्टिभिः।।3.34.8।।
34_8.translation: Just as Indra destroys the crop ready for harvest by raining hailstones, I have seen Rama killing the army with a shower of arrows.
34_8.word_by_word: इन्द्रेण by Indra, अश्मवृष्टिभिः by raining hailstones, आहतम् destroyed, उत्तमं सस्यमिव like the crop ready for harvest, शरवृष्टिभिः rain of arrows, हन्यमानम्  killed, तत् सैन्यम् that army, पश्यामि witnessed.

34_9.shloka: रक्षसां भीमरूपाणां सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।निहतानि शरै स्तीक्ष्णैस्तेनैकेन पदातिना।।3.34.9।।अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन खरश्च सहदूषणः।
34_9.translation: Fighting alone on foot with his sharp arrows Rama killed within a span of one and a half muhurta, the fourteen thousand dreadful demons including Dusana and Khara.
34_9.word_by_word: पदातिना on foot, एकेन alone, तेन by him, तीक्ष्णैः  sharp, शरैः arows, अर्धाधिकमुहूर्तेन within the span of one and a half muhurta ( muhurtha is fortyeight minutes), भीमरूपाणाम् dreadful in appearance, रक्षसाम् demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, निहतानि are killed, सहदूषणः also Dusana, खरश्च and Khara.

34_10.shloka: ऋषीणामभयं दत्तं कृतक्षेमाश्च दण्डकाः।।3.34.10।।एका कथञ्चिन्मुक्ताहं परिभूय महात्मना।स्त्रीवधं शङ्कमानेन रामेण विदितात्मना।।3.34.11।।
34_10.translation: Sages have been assured safety. Peace has been restored to Dandaka forest. As Rama, the great soul, who knows the self, hesitated to kill a woman, I was alone saved after this humiliation.
34_10.word_by_word: ऋषीणाम् for seers, अभयम् assurance of safety, दत्तम् is given, दण्डकाः Dandaka forest, कृतक्षेमाश्च peace restored, महात्मना great soul, विदितात्मना  knower of self, स्त्रीवधम् slaying a woman, शङ्कमानेन  hesitant of, रामेण by Rama, अहम् I, एका only, परिभूय insulted, कथञ्चित् somehow, मुक्ता left with life.

34_11.shloka: भ्राता चास्य महातेजा गुणतस्तुल्यविक्रमः।अनुरक्तश्च भक्तश्च लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान्।।3.34.12।।
34_11.translation: His brother called Lakshmana looks radiant. He is virtuous and courageous like him, valiant, devoted and loyal.
34_11.word_by_word: महातेजाः  radiant , गुणतः in quality, तुल्यविक्रमः of equal courage, अनुरक्तश्च very loyal, भक्तश्च devoted, वीर्यवान् valiant, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, अस्य his, भ्राता brother.

34_12.shloka: अमर्षी दुर्जयो जेता विक्रान्तो बुद्धिमान्बली।रामस्य दक्षिणो बाहुर्नित्यं प्राणो बहिश्चरः।।3.34.13।।
34_12.translation: He is impatient, invincible, victorious, bold, intelligent and strong. He is even the right hand of Rama, his outer life.
34_12.word_by_word: अमर्षी impatient , दुर्जयः invincible, जेता victorious, विक्रान्तः very bold, बुद्धिमान् intelligent, बली strong, नित्यम् always, रामस्य Rama, दक्षिणः बाहुः right hand, बहिश्चरः  moving outside, प्राणः his own life.

34_13.shloka: रामस्य तु विशालाक्षी पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना।धर्मपत्नी प्रिया भर्तुर्नित्यं प्रियहिते रता।।3.34.14।।
34_13.translation: Rama's beloved consort is a largeeyed lady. Her face is like the full moon. She is engaged in the wellbeing of her husband.
34_13.word_by_word: विशालाक्षी large eyed lady, पूर्णेन्दुसदृशानना face like the full moon, रामस्य Rama's, धर्मपत्नी consort, भर्तुः husband's, प्रियाः darling, नित्यम् always, प्रियहिते in the interest of her husband, रता engaged.

34_14.shloka: सा सुकेशी सुनासोरुस्सुरूपा च यशस्विनी।देवतेव वनस्यास्य राजते श्रीरिवापरा।।3.34.15।।
34_14.translation: She is an illustrious lady. She is goodlooking with her long hair, wellshaped nose and things. She appears to be the presiding deity of the forest, another goddess of wealth (Laxmi).
34_14.word_by_word: सुकेशी she has long hair, सुनासोरुः has beautiful nose and thighs, सुरूपा च of good look, यशस्विनी illustrious lady, सा she, अस्य of this, वनस्य of the forest, देवतेव like the presiding deity, अपरा another, श्रीरिव like goddess of wealth, राजते shining.

34_15.shloka: तप्तकाञ्चनवर्णाभा रक्ततुङ्गनखी शुभा।सीता नाम वरारोहा वैदेही तनुमध्यमा।।3.34.16।।
34_15.translation: She is Sita, princess of Videha, a virtuous lady of golden complexion, a beautiful lady of slender waist and heavy hips.
34_15.word_by_word: तप्तकाञ्चनवर्णाभा a lady of shining golden hue, रक्ततुङ्गनखी of red, pointed nails, शुभा auspicious, वैदेही daughter of Videha, तनुमध्यमा of slender waist, सीता नाम by name Sita, वरारोहा of heavy hips.

34_16.shloka: नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी न यक्षी न च किन्नरी।नैवंरूपा मया नारी दृष्टपूर्वा महीतले।।3.34.17।।
34_16.translation: I had not seen such a beautiful woman earlier, among the gandharvas, or yakshas, or kinneras. I have not seen such a beauty among the humans on earth.
34_16.word_by_word: एवंरूपा such a beauty, देवी goddess, मया myself, नैव दृष्टपूर्वा not seen earlier, गन्धर्वी gandharvi, न not, यक्षी yakshi, न not, किन्नरी kinneri, न not, नारी woman, महीतले on this earth, न not.

34_17.shloka: यस्य सीता भवेद्भार्या यं च हृष्टा परिष्वजेत्।अतिजीवेत्स सर्वेषु लोकेष्वपि पुरन्दरात्।।3.34.18।।
34_17.translation: Whosoever gets Sita as his wife, whoever she embraces happily will wish to live longer than Indra, the breaker of fortresses in this world.
34_17.word_by_word: यस्य whose, सीता Sita, भार्या as wife, भवेत् shall be, हृष्टा happily, यम् whom ever, परिष्वजेत्  she may embrace, सः he, सर्वेषु in all, लोकेषु in the worlds, पुरन्दरात् अपि more than Indra, the breaker of fortress, अतिजीवेत् may wish to live long.

34_18.shloka: सा सुशीला वपुश्श्लाघ्या रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि।तवानुरूपा भार्या स्यात्त्वं च तस्यास्तथा पतिः।।3.34.19।।
34_18.translation: She is a woman of good conduct, of praiseworthy beauty. She is matchless in her beauty on earth. She will be a suitable wife for you and you, a suitable husband for her.
34_18.word_by_word: सुशीला a woman of good conduct, वपुश्लाघ्या is a woman of praiseworthy beauty, रूपेण by appearance, भुवि on this earth, अप्रतिमा incomparable, सा Sita, तव your, अनुरूपा suitable  for you, भार्या wife, स्यात् will be, तथा similarly, त्वम् you, तस्याः to her, पतिः suitable husband.

34_19.shloka: तां तु विस्तीर्णजघनां पीनश्रोणिपयोधराम्।भार्यार्थे च तवानेतुमुद्यताहं वराननाम्।।3.34.20।।विरूपितास्मि क्रूरेण लक्ष्मणेन महाभुज।
34_19.translation: O mightyarmed one  I have been disfigured by cruel Lakshmana as I was attempting to bring that lady of broad thighs, pointed breasts, heavy hips and a beautiful face to make her your wife.
34_19.word_by_word: महाभुज O mightyarmed one, विस्तीर्णजघनाम् of broad thighs, पीनश्रोणिपयोधराम् a lady of pointed breasts and high hips, तां वराननाम् of beautiful face, तव your, भार्यार्थे as your wife to be, आनेतुम् to bring, उद्यता I have tried, अहम् I, क्रूरेण by the cruel, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, विरूपिता अस्मि have been disfigured.

34_20.shloka: तां तु दृष्ट्वाद्य वैदेहीं पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।मन्मथस्य शराणां वै त्वं विधेयो भविष्यसि।।3.34.21।।
34_20.translation: If you see her today, this lady with a face like the fullmoon, you will (instantaneously) fall a victim to the arrows of the god of love.
34_20.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् a lady with a face like the full Moon, ताम् her, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अद्य now, दृष्ट्वा by seeing, त्वम् you, मन्मथस्य of Cupid, शराणाम् arrows, विधेयः be a victim, भविष्यसि will be.

34_21.shloka: यदि तस्यामभिप्रायो भार्यार्थे तव जायते।शीघ्रमुद्ध्रियतां पादो जयार्थमिह दक्षिणः।।3.34.22।।
34_21.translation: If you intend her to be your wife, raise your right foot now and proceed to win her over.
34_21.word_by_word: तस्याम् in her, तव your, भार्यार्थे desire to make her your wife, अभिप्रायः intention, जायते यदि if it arises, इह from here, जयार्थम् to win her over, दक्षिणः पादः your right foot, शीघ्रम् quickly, उद्घ्रियताम् may be raised.

34_22.shloka: कुरु प्रियं तथा तेषां रक्षसां राक्षसेश्वर।वधात्तस्य नृशंसस्य रामस्याश्रमवासिनः।।3.34.23।।
34_22.translation: O lord of the demons, do a favour to your clan by  killing that cruel Rama dwelling in the hermitage.
34_22.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वर O lord of the demons  तथा such, नृशंसस्य cruel ones, आश्रमवासिनः of the dweller of the hermitage, तस्य रामस्य of that Rama, वधात् by killing, तेषाम् of those, रक्षसाम् of demons, प्रियम् favour, कुरु do.

34_23.shloka: तं शरैर्निशितैर्हत्वा लक्ष्मणं च महारथम्।हतनाथां सुखं सीतां यथावदुपभोक्ष्यसि।।3.34.24।।
34_23.translation: Kill Rama, that great warrior along with Lakshmana with sharp arrows and enjoy the  company of Sita happily as you like, with her husband dead.
34_23.word_by_word: महारथम् to that great warrior, तं that, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana also, निशितैः with sharp ones, शरैः with arrows, हत्वा after killing, हतनाथाम्  with her husband killed, सीताम् Sita, सुखम् happily, यथावत् as you like, उपभोक्ष्यसि you can enjoy.

34_24.shloka: रोचते यति ते वाक्यं ममैतद्राक्षसेश्वर।क्रियतां निर्विशङ्केन वचनं मम रावण।।3.34.25।।
34_24.translation: If you like what I have said, do accordingly without any hesitation, O Ravana, lord of the demons.
34_24.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वर O lord of the demons  रावण Ravana, मम my, एतत् all this, वाक्यं word ते to you, रोचते यदि if you like, निर्विशङ्केन without any hesitation, मम mine, वचनम् words, क्रियताम् do as I said.

34_25.shloka: विज्ञायेहात्मशक्तिं च ह्रियतामबला बलात्।सीता सर्वानवद्याङ्गी भार्यार्थे राक्षसेश्वर।।3.34.26।।
34_25.translation: Assess your own strength, O Lord of the demons, before you forcefully abduct that delicate Sita who is charming in all respects and make her your wife.
34_25.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वर O Lord of the demons, आत्मशक्तिम् your own strength, विज्ञाय  assessing,  सर्वानवद्याङ्गी charming in all respects, अबला delicate, सीता Sita, भार्यार्थे as wife, बलात् forcefully, ह्रियताम् abduct.

34_26.shloka: निशम्य रामेण शरैरजिह्मगै र्हतान् जनस्थानगतान्निशाचरान्।खरं च बुद्ध्वा निहतं च दूषणं त्वमत्र कृत्यं प्रतिपत्तुमर्हसि।।3.34.27।।
34_26.translation: On hearing about the death of the demons including Khara and Dusana who fell to the straight and swift arrows of Rama, you should decide your course of action.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtytfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
34_26.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, अजिह्मगैः not moving obliquely, शरैः by arrows, जनस्थानगतान्  staying at Janasthana, निशाचरान् nightwalkers, demons, हतान् killed, निशम्य after hearing, खरं च Khara and, दूषणं च Dusana, निहतम् killed, बुद्ध्वा after knowing, त्वम् you, अत्र here, कृत्यम् your duty, प्रतिपत्तुम् to decide, अर्हसि should.

35_1.shloka: [Ravana departs stealthily secretly to meet Maricha--description of the beautiful nature on the way to Maricha's hermitage.]ततश्शूर्पणखावाक्यं तच्छ्रुत्वा रोमहर्षणम्।सचिवानभ्यनुज्ञाय कार्यं बुद्ध्वा जगाम ह।।3.35.1।।
35_1.translation: Then hearing the horripilating words of Surpanakha, Ravana took leave of the ministers and went thinking about the task ahead of him.
35_1.word_by_word: ततः then, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, तत् that way, शूर्पणखावाक्यम् words of Surpanakha, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सचिवान् ministers, अभ्यनुज्ञाय  took leave, कार्यम् task, बुद्ध्वा thinking over, जगाम ह went.

35_2.shloka: तत्कार्यमनुगम्याथ यथावदुपलभ्य च।दोषाणां च गुणानां च सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्।3.35.2।।इति कर्तव्यमित्येव कृत्वा निश्चयमात्मनः।स्थिरबुद्धिस्ततो रम्यां यानशालां जगाम ह।।3.35.3।।
35_2.translation: Deliberating on the task ahead, duly considering the pros and cons, demerits and merits, strength and weakness, of the issue and having firmly decided within himself, he left for the beautiful coachshed.
35_2.word_by_word: अथ and, तत् that, कार्यम् task, अनुगम्य thinking deeply, यथावत् duly, उपलभ्य च understanding, दोषाणाम् of demerits, गुणानां च merits, बलाबलम् strength and weakness, सम्प्रधार्य reflected on it, इति this, कर्तव्यम् duty, इत्येव that way, आत्मनः in himself, निश्चयम् decided, कृत्वा did, स्थिरबुद्धि: firmly, ततः then, रम्यां delightful, यानशालाम् coachshed, जगाम ह went.

35_3.shloka: यानशालां ततो गत्वा प्रच्छन्नो राक्षसाधिपः।सूतं सञ्चोदयामास रथस्संयोज्यतामिति।।3.35.4।।
35_3.translation: Ravana went covertly to the coachshed and to the charioteer to get a chariot harnessed.
35_3.word_by_word: ततः then, राक्षसाधिपः the demonking, प्रच्छन्न: covertly, यानशालाम् to the coachshed, गत्वा having gone, रथः chariot, संयोज्यताम् harness, इति thus, सूतम् charioteer, सञ्चोदयामास ordered.

35_4.translation: Thus ordered, the smart charioteer got the chariot of his choice harnessed in an instant.
35_4.word_by_word: एवम् that way, उक्तः said, लघुविक्रमः a man of quick action, सारथिः charioteer, तस्य his, अभिमतम् choice, उत्तमम् great, रथम् chariot, क्षणेनैव in an instant, संयोजयामास harnessed.

35_5.shloka: काञ्चनं रथमास्थाय कामगं रत्नभूषितम्।पिशाचवदनैर्युक्तं खरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः।।3.35.6।।मेघप्रतिमनादेन स तेन धनदानुजः।राक्षसाधिपतिश्श्रीमान्ययौ नदनदीपतिम्।।3.35.7।।
35_5.translation: The younger brother of Kubera (Ravana), the prosperous lord of the demons ascendedthe chariot which could go where he desired. Embellished with gold, studded with gems, harnessed with demonfaced donkeys, the chariot rolled towards the ocean, rumbling like a cloud.
35_5.word_by_word: धनदानुजः younger brother of Kubera, श्रीमान् prosperous, सः राक्षसाधिपतिः the lord of the demons, काञ्चनभूषणैः embellished with gold ornaments, पिशाचवदनैः with demonfaced, खरैः donkeys, युक्तम् yoked, काञ्चनम् golden, कामगम्   go where one desires, रत्नभूषितम् decked with gems, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय riding, मेघप्रतिमनादेन rumbling like a cloud, तेन that Ravana, नदनदीपतिम् towards the ocean, ययौ went.

35_6.shloka: स श्वेतवालव्यजनः श्वेतच्छत्रो दशाननः।स्निग्धवैदूर्यसंकाश स्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः।।3.35.8।।विंशद्भुजो दशग्रीवो दर्शनीयपरिच्छदः।त्रिदशारिर्मुनीन्द्रघ्नो दशशीर्ष इवाद्रिराट्।।3.35.9।।कामगं रथमास्थाय शुशुभे राक्षसेश्वरः।विद्युन्मण्डलवान्मेघस्सबलाक इवाम्बरे।।3.35.10।।
35_6.translation: Ravana, enemy of the gods, slayer of towering sages, with white yaktail fans, and white parasols, shining like smooth vaidurya, wearing pure gold earrings, clad in attractive attire, ten necks with twenty strong hands, ten heads looking like ten mountain peaks, a cloud in the sky encircled by lightnings and accompanied by cranes, ascended the chariot that could go wherever he desired.
35_6.word_by_word: श्वेतवालव्यजनः with white yak tail fans, श्वेतच्छत्रः with white parasols, दशाननः ten headed, स्निग्धवैदूर्यसङ्काशः shining like smooth Vaidurya (Lapis Lazuli), तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः wearing pure gold earrings, विंशद्भुजः twenty hands, दशग्रीवः tennecked, दर्शनीयपरिच्छदः attired in attractive robes, त्रिदशारिः enemy of gods, मुनीन्द्रघ्नः slayer of towering sages, दशशीर्षः tenpeaks, अद्रिराडिव like king of mountains, सः राक्षसेश्वरः that lord of demons, कामगम् takes where  one desires to go, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय having ascended, अम्बरे sky, विद्युन्मण्डलवान् encircled by lightnings, सबलाकः accompanied by cranes, मेघः इव cloudlike, शुशुभे shone.

35_7.translation: Valiant Ravana wentwatching the mountains full of thousands of trees bearing flowers and fruits on the shore of the sea.
35_7.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् valiant, सः he, शैलम् the mountain, सहस्रशः thousandfold, नानापुष्पफलैः varieties offlowers and fruits, वृक्षैः with trees, अनुकीर्णम् full of, सागरानूपम् shore of the sea, अवलोकयन् seeing.

35_8.translation: (The area) surrounded on all sides with lotusladen ponds filled with cool, sacred water, sprawling hermitages with elevated altars.
35_8.word_by_word: शीतमङ्गलतोयाभिः by those filled with cool, sacred water, पद्मिनीभिः with lotusladen ponds, वेदिमद्भि: having elevated altars, विशालैः sprawlling one, आश्रमपदैः with hermitages, समन्ततः on all sides, समावृतम् surrounded.

35_9.translation: The place covered with banana plants and coconut trees  as well as blossoming sal and tamala trees was looking extremely beautiful.
35_9.word_by_word: कदल्याढकिसम्बाधम् full of banana plants, नारिकेलोपशोभितम् looking beautiful with coconut trees, पुष्पितैः with flowers, सालैः with sal trees, तालैः with palms, तमालैः with tamala, तरुभिः trees, वृतम् surrounded.

35_10.translation: The place looked charming with nagas, garudas, gandharvas, kinneras in their thousands and with the descendants of ajas, vaikhanasas, valakhilyas and with those who drink the rays of Sun and Moon for survival, with  sages who were highly disciplined in the intake of food,  spiritually accomplished  and selfcontrolled hermits and charanas.
35_10.word_by_word: नागैः with nagas, सुपर्णैः with garudas, गन्धर्वैः gandharvas, सहस्रशः in thousands, किन्नरैश्च with kinneras, आजैः by ajas, वैखानसैः by vaikhanasas, माषैः by mashas, मरीचिपैः by mareechipas, वालखिल्यैः by valakhilyas, अत्यन्तनियताहारैः by those who are highly disciplined in food, परमर्षिभिः by great sages, शोभितम् looked charming, जितकामैः by  those with perfect control over desires, सिद्धैश्च by the spiritually accomplished, चारणैः by charanas, उपशोभितम् delightful.

35_11.translation: (The place was) full of apsaras  in their thousands and paragons of beauty adorned with divine ornaments and garlands, and experts in lovesports.
35_11.word_by_word: दिव्याभरणमाल्याभिः  bedecked with fine ornaments and garlands, दिव्यरूपाभिः  paragons of beauty, क्रीडारतिविधिज्ञाभिः ladies acquainted with various lovesports, सहस्रशः  thousands, अप्सरोभि: apsaras, आवृतम् full of.

35_12.translation: It was chosen by prosperous wives of gods as a reosrt. Hosts of gods and demons were wandering, there in the hope of tasting nectar.
35_12.word_by_word: श्रीमतीभिः prosperous (deities), देवपत्नीभिः goddesses, सेवितम्  inhabited, श्रिया resort , वृतम् endowed, अमृतार्थिभिः gods who sought nectar, देवदानवसङ्घैश्च by hosts of gods and demons, चरितम् wandered about.

35_13.translation: (It was ) full of small floats, flocks of swans, kraunchas, sarasas cackling in the ponds, with great joy. It had stretches of vaidurya stones on the shore and shone with the radiance of the sea
35_13.word_by_word: हंसक्रौञ्चप्लवाकीर्णम् full of flocks of swans and kraunchas and small floats, सारसैः by sarasa birds, सम्प्रणादितम् filled with sound, वैढूर्यप्रस्तरम् having a stretch of vaidurya stones, रम्यम् delightful, सागरतेजसा by the radiance of the sea, स्निग्धम् shining.

35_14.shloka: पाण्डुराणि विशालानि दिव्यमाल्ययुतानि च।तूर्यगीताभिजुष्टानि विमानानि समन्ततः।।3.35.19।।तपसा जितलोकानां कामगान्यभिसम्पतन्।गन्धर्वाप्सरसश्चैव ददर्श धनदानुजः।।3.35.20।।
35_14.translation: Speeding along, the brother of Kubera (Ravana) saw palewhite, spacious aerial chariots on all sides controlled by those who had conquered the higher worlds by their penances. These chariots, decked with heavenly garlands, and ringing with divine music could fly where one desired. He saw gandharvas and apsaras as well.
35_14.word_by_word: अभिसम्पतन् spleding along, धनदानुजः younger brother of Kubera, तपसा with penance, जितलोकानाम्  who has conquered all the worlds, पाण्डुराणि by pale ones, विशालानि large ones, दिव्यमाल्ययुतानि च with divine flower garlands, तूर्यगीताभिजुष्टानि ringing with divine strains of music, कामगानि fly where one desires, विमानानि aerial chariots, समन्ततः on all sides, गन्धर्वाप्सरसश्चैव by gandharvas and apsaras also, ददर्श saw.

35_15.shloka: निर्यासरसमूलानां चन्दनानां सहस्रशः।वनानि पश्यन्सौम्यानि घ्राणतृप्तिकराणि च।।3.35.21।।
35_15.translation: He saw thousands of tree trunks with finesmelling resins and sandalwood trees.
35_15.word_by_word: निर्यासरसमूलानाम्  tree trunks with resins (emitting juices), चन्दनानाम् of sandalwood trees,सौम्यानि delighting, घ्राणतृप्तिकराणि satisfying to smell, च and, सहस्रशः by thousands, वनानि trees, पश्यन् seeing,

35_16.shloka: अगरूणां च मुख्यानां वनान्युपवनानि च।तक्कोलानां च जात्यानां फलानां च सुगन्धिनाम्।।3.35.22।।
35_16.translation: (He saw) very fine aguru trees in the forest as well as pleasuregroves of takkola fruits, fragrant  trees of a fine variety and fragrant nutmegs.
35_16.word_by_word: मुख्यानाम् of the prominent ones, अगुरूणाम् aguru trees, वनानि forests, उपवनानि च pleasuregroves, तक्कोलानाम् of takkola fruits, फलानाम् of fruits, सुगन्धिनाम् of the fragrant ones, जात्यानाम् nutmegs,

35_17.shloka: पुष्पाणि च तमालस्य गुल्मानि मरिचस्य च।मुक्तानां च समूहानि शुष्यमाणानि तीरतः।।3.35.23।।
35_17.translation: (He saw) tamala flowers in bloom, pepper shrubs in clusters and hoards of pearls kept for drying on the shores.
35_17.word_by_word: तमालस्य tamala trees, पुष्पाणि flowers in bloom, मरिचस्य of pepper, गुल्मानि shrubs, तीरतः on the shore, शुष्यमाणानि drying, मुक्तानाम् pearls, समूहानि च hoards,

35_18.shloka: शङ्खानां प्रसरं चैव प्रवालनिचयं तथा।काञ्चनानि च शैलानि राजतानि च सर्वशः।।3.35.24।।
35_18.translation: He saw stretches of conches, heaps of corals and mounds of gold and silver too.
35_18.word_by_word: शङ्खानाम् conches, प्रसरं चैव stretch also, तथा likewise, प्रवालनिचयम् heaps of corals, सर्वशः all over, काञ्चनानि gold, राजतानि च and silver, शैलानि mounds,

35_19.shloka: प्रस्रवाणि मनोज्ञानि प्रसन्नानि ह्रदानि च।धनधान्योपपन्नानि स्त्रीरत्नैश्शोभितानि च।।3.35.25।।हस्त्यश्वरथगाढानि नगराण्यवलोकयन्।
35_19.translation: He went watching fascinating waterfalls, pleasing ponds, cities filled with wealth and grain, looking splendid with beautiful women and full of elephants, horses and chariots.
35_19.word_by_word: मनोज्ञानि fascinating , प्रस्रवाणि waterfalls, प्रसन्नानि pleasing, ह्रदानि च ponds, धनधान्योपपन्नानि endowed with wealth and grains in abundance, स्त्रीरत्नैः best of women, शोभितानि  splendid looking, हस्त्यश्वरथगाढानि elephants with, horses and chariots, नगराणि cities, अवलोकयन् went on seeing.

35_20.shloka: तं समं सर्वतस्निग्धं मृदुसंस्पर्शमारुतम्।अनूपं सिन्धुराजस्य ददर्श त्रिदिवोपमम्।।3.35.26।।
35_20.translation: It was a veritable heaven with the plain land flooded with the backwaters of the sea and gentle breeze blowing.
35_20.word_by_word: सर्वतः all over, समम् levelled, स्निग्धम् beautiful, मृदुसंस्पर्शमारुतम् the breeze gentle to touch, त्रिदिवोपमम् comparable to heaven, सिन्धुराजस्य of the sea, तम् अनूपम् backwaters, ददर्श saw.

35_21.translation: He saw a banyan tree with its branches spread on all sides measuring a hundredyojanas, looking like a cloud and providing shelter to the sages.
35_21.word_by_word: तत्र there, सः he, यस्य whose, शाखा branches, शतयोजनम् one hundred yojanas, आयताः spread, मेघाभम् looking like a cloud, ऋषिभिः वृतम् occupied by sages, न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, अपश्यत् saw.

35_22.shloka: यस्य हस्तिनमादाय महाकायं च कच्छपम्।।3.35.28।।भक्षार्थं गरुडश्शाखामाजगाम महाबलः।
35_22.translation: In the past, the mighty Garuda brought an elephant and a huge tortoise and sat on a branch of this tree to feed on them.
35_22.word_by_word: महाबलः very strong, गरुडः Garuda, भक्षार्थम् for food, हस्तिनम् elephant, महाकायम् of huge body, कच्छपं च and tortoise, आदाय after getting, यस्य whose, शाखाम् branch, आजगाम came to,

35_23.shloka: तस्य तां सहसा शाखां भारेण पतगोत्तमः।।3.35.29।।सुपर्णः पर्णबहुलां बभञ्ज च महाबलः।
35_23.translation: Due to the weight of this best of birds, the mighty Garuda, the leafy branch at once broke down.
35_23.word_by_word: पतगोत्तमः the best of birds, महाबलः very strong, सुपर्णः Suparna (Garuda), तस्य his, तां शाखाम् that  branch, भारेण with weight, सहसा at once, बभञ्ज broke, पर्णबहुलां full of leaves.

35_24.shloka: तत्र वैखानसा माषा वालखिल्या मरीचिपाः।।3.35.30।।अजा बभूवुर्धूम्राश्च सङ्गताः परमर्षयः।
35_24.translation: Gathered together under the great tree were great sages like vaikhanasas, mashas, marichipas, valakhilyas, ajas and dhumras.
35_24.word_by_word: वैखानसा: vaikhanasas, माषाः mashas, मरीचिपाः marichipas, वालखिल्याः valakhilyas, अजाः ajas,धूम्राश्च dhumras, परमर्षयश्च great seers,तत्र there, सङ्गताः gathered,बभूवुः  were.

35_25.shloka: तेषां दयार्थं गरुडस्तां शाखां शतयोजनाम्।।3.35.31।।जगामादाय वेगेन तौ चोभौ गजकच्छपौ।
35_25.translation: Out of compassion for the (endangered) seers Garuda carried away that hundredyojanalong branch along with the elephant and the tortoise with great speed.
35_25.word_by_word: गरुडः Garuda, तेषाम् their, दयार्थम् out of compassion, शतयोजनाम् extending to a hundred yojanas, तां शाखाम् that branch, तौ उभौ both, गजकच्छपौ elephant and the tortoise, आदाय taking, वेगेन with speed, जगाम went.

35_26.shloka: एकपादेन धर्मात्मा भक्षयित्वा तदामिषम्।।3.35.32।।निषादविषयं हत्वा शाखया पतगोत्तमः।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे मोक्षयित्वा महामुनीन्।।3.35.33।।
35_26.translation: Righteous Garuda, the best among the birds, stood on one foot and ate the flesh (of elephant and tortoise) and  with the branch of the tree, destroyed the settlement of the demons. Over the destruction of the demons and deliverance of the great seers he felt immeasurable happiness.
35_26.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous self, पतगोत्तमः the best among birds (Garuda), तत् that, आमिषम् meat, एकपादेन (standing) on one foot, भक्षयित्वा eating, शाखया with the branch, निषादविषयम्  settlement  of nightwalkers, हत्वा destroying, महामुनीन् great seers, मोक्षयित्वा delivering, अतुलम् great, प्रहर्षम् happiness, लेभे felt.

35_27.shloka: स तेनैव प्रहर्षेण द्विगुणीकृतविक्रमः।अमृतानयनार्थं वै चकार मतिमान्मतिम्।।3.35.34।।
35_27.translation: Quite happy, his energy redoubled, wise Garuda made up his mind to obtain nectar.
35_27.word_by_word: मतिमान् wise, सः he (Garuda), तेनैव प्रहर्षेण out of that joy, द्विगुणीकृतविक्रमः with redoubled vigour, अमृतानयनार्थम् to obtain nectar, मतिम् चकार made up his mind.

35_28.shloka: अयोजालानि निर्मथ्य भित्वा रत्नमयं गृहम्।महेन्द्रभवनाद्गुप्तमाजहारामृतं ततः।।3.35.35।।
35_28.translation: Twisting and twirling the grills of the window, he broke open the room made of gems and quietly carried away the nectar from Indra's mansion.
35_28.word_by_word: अयोजालानि grills of windows, निर्मथ्य twisting and twirling, रत्नमयम् गृहम् house made of gems, भित्वा breaking, ततः from there, महेन्द्रभवनात् from the palace of Indra, गुप्तम् secretly, अमृतम् nectar, आजहार carried away.

35_29.shloka: तं महर्षिगणैर्जुष्टं सुपर्णकृतलक्षणम्।नाम्ना सुभद्रं न्यग्रोधं ददर्श धनदानुजः।।3.35.36।।
35_29.translation: Ravana, the younger brother of Kubera, beheld that banyan tree called Subhadram ,which was a favoured resort of the sages bearing the ensignia of Garuda.
35_29.word_by_word: धनदानुजः younger brother of Kubera, महर्षिगणैः by groups of seers, जुष्टम् favoured resort, सुपर्णकृतलक्षणम् marked with breaking of the branch by Garuda, नाम्ना by name, सुभद्रम् Subhadra, तं न्यग्रोधम् that banyan tree, ददर्श beheld.

35_30.shloka: तं तु गत्वा परं पारं समुद्रस्य नदीपतेः।ददर्शाश्रममेकान्ते रम्ये पुण्ये वनान्तरे।।3.35.37।।
35_30.translation: Ravana crossed over to the other side of the sea, the lord of rivers, and beheld a hermitage in a beautiful, secluded, sacred  place in the middle of the forest.
35_30.word_by_word: नदीपतेः of lord of rivers(ocean), समुद्रस्य of the sea, तम् that, परं पारम् गत्वा going over to the other side, रम्ये in a beautiful, पुण्ये in a sacred, वनान्तरे in the middle of the forest, एकान्ते in a secluded place, आश्रमम् hermitage, ददर्श beheld.

35_31.shloka: तत्र कृष्णाजिनधरं जटावल्कलधारिणम्।ददर्श नियताहारं मारीचं नाम राक्षसाम्।।3.35.38।।
35_31.translation: There he saw a demon Maricha, by name, clad in dark deerskin and bark ,with matted hair and living on restricted food.
35_31.word_by_word: तत्र there,कृष्णाजिनधरम् clad in deerskin, जटावल्कलधारिणम् with matted hair and bark  cloth, नियताहारम् living on regulated food, मारीचं नाम  named Maricha, राक्षसम् a demon, ददर्श saw.

35_32.shloka: स रावणस्समागम्य विधिवत्तेन रक्षसा।मारीचेनार्चितो राजा सर्वकामैरमानुषैः।।3.35.39।।
35_32.translation: When king Ravana reached there, Maricha received him  in accordance with tradition  and made worshipful offering to the king, fulfilling all his superhuman desires.
35_32.word_by_word: राजा king, सः रावणः Ravana, समागम्य reaching there, रक्षसा by the demon, तेन मारीचेन to Maricha, अमानुषैः superhuman, सर्वकामैः by fulfilling all desires, विधिवत् as per tradition, अर्चितः made worshipful offering.

35_33.shloka: तं स्वयं पूजयित्वा तु भोजनेनोदकेन च।अर्थोपहितया वाचा मारीचो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.35.40।।
35_33.translation: Maricha extended his hospitality with appropriate food and water and said with meaningful words:
35_33.word_by_word: मारीचः Maricha, तम् to him, भोजनेन food, उदकेन च water, स्वयम् himself, पूजयित्वा after offering, अर्थोपहितया meaningful, वाचा words, वाक्यम् अब्रवीत् said.

35_34.shloka: कच्चित्सुकुशलं राजन्लङ्कायां राक्षसेश्वर।केनार्थेन पुनस्त्वं वै तूर्णमेवमिहागतः।।3.35.41।।
35_34.translation: O king  O lord of the demons  hope all is well in Lanka. What brings you here again so soon ?
35_34.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वर O lord of demons, राजन् O king, लङ्कायाम् at Lanka, सुकुशलं कच्चित् I hope every thing is well, त्वम् you, केन अर्थेन to what purpose, तूर्णम् so soon, एवम् like this, पुनः again, इह here, आगतः came?

35_35.shloka: एवमुक्तो महातेजा मारीचेन स रावणः।ततः पश्चादिदं वाक्यमब्रवीद्वाक्यकोविदः।।3.35.42।।
35_35.translation: Thus addressed by Maricha, the effulgent, eloquent Ravana replied with these words:इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
35_35.word_by_word: मारीचेन by Maricha, एवम् thus, उक्तः spoken, महातेजाः effulgent, वाक्यकोविदः a skilled speaker, सः रावणः that Ravana, ततः पश्चात् later, इदम् this, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

36_1.shloka: [Ravana tells the story of Janasthana-- urges Maricha to help him in abducting Sita-- Maricha dissuades Ravana and describes the virtues of Rama.]मारीच श्रूयातां तात वचनं मम भाषतः।आर्तोऽस्मि मम चार्तस्य भवान्हि परमा गतिः।।3.36.1।।
36_1.translation: O dear Maricha hear my words. I am distressed and you are my ultimate refuge.
36_1.word_by_word: तात O child, मारीच Maricha, भाषतः as I speak, मम my, वचनम् words, श्रूयताम् hear, आर्तः distressed, अस्मि I am, आर्तस्य of the distressed, मम my, भवान् you, परमा ultimate, गतिः हि  refuge.

36_2.shloka: जानीषे त्वं जनस्थाने यथा भ्राता खरो मम।दूषणश्च महाबाहु स्वसा शूर्पणखा च मे।।3.36.2।।त्रिशिराश्च महातेजा राक्षसः पिशिताशनः।अन्ये च बहवश्शूरा लब्धलक्षा निशाचराः।।3.36.3।।वसत्नि मन्नियोगेन नित्यवासं च राक्षसाः।बाधमाना महारण्ये मुनीन्वै धर्मचारिणः।।3.36.4।।
36_2.translation: You know that my brothers, Khara and Dusana, the strongarmed heroes, my sister Surpanakha and  the mighty cannibal Trisira, and many other heroic demons successful in hitting their targets are bonafide residents. They have been harassing the followers of righteous path (the sages) at my behest.
36_2.word_by_word: मम my, भ्राता brother, खरः Khara, महाबाहुः of mighty arms, दूषणश्च and Dusana, मे my, स्वसा sister, शूर्पणखा च Surpanakha too, महातेजाः brilliant, पिशिताशनः flesh eater, राक्षसः demon, त्रिशिराश्च and Trisira, शूराः brave, लब्धलक्षाः unfailing in their targets, अन्ये बहवः many other, निशाचराः राक्षसाः nightwalker demons, मन्नियोगेन at my behest, महारण्ये in the great forest, धर्मचारिणः followers of righteous path, मुनीन् seers, बाधमानाः harassing, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, यथा likewise, नित्यवासं वसन्ति always living there, त्वम् you, जानीषे know.

36_3.shloka: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।शूराणां लब्धलक्षाणां खरचित्तानुवर्तिनाम्।।3.36.5।।
36_3.translation: These fourteen thousand heroes, perpetrators of terrible deeds, skilled in hitting the targets had been acting according to the direction of Khara.
36_3.word_by_word: भीमकर्मणाम् of terrible deeds, शूराणाम् of heroes, लब्धलक्षाणाम् skilled in hitting the targets, खरचित्तानुवर्तिनाम्  acting according to the will of Khara, रक्षसाम् of demons, चतुर्दश सहस्राणि fourteen thousand.

36_4.shloka: ते त्विदानीं जनस्थाने वसमाना महाबलाः।सङ्गताः परमायत्ता रामेण सह संयुगे।।3.36.6।।नानाप्रहरणोपेताः खरप्रमुखराक्षसाः।
36_4.translation: These mighty demons, living in Janasthana, eqipped with different kinds of weapons, supported and led by Khara, met Rama in an encounter.
36_4.word_by_word: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, वसमानाः living permanently, महाबलाः very strong, ते they, खरप्रमुखराक्षसाः demons led by Khara, इदानीम् now, परमायत्ताः with all support, नानाप्रहरणोपेताः wielding different kinds of weapons, संयुगे in war, रामेण सह with Rama, सङ्गताः have fought.

36_5.shloka: तेन सञ्जातरोषेण रामेण रणमूर्धनि।अनुक्त्वा परुषं किञ्चिच्छरैर्व्यापारितं धनुः।।3.36.7।।
36_5.translation: With his wrath generated, Rama, without even speaking anything, used his bow and the arrows.
36_5.word_by_word: सञ्जातरोषेण  even though wrathful, तेन रामेण by that  Rama, रणमूर्धनि on the battle front,परुषम् harsh , किञ्चित् a little, अनुक्त्वा not uttered, धनुः bow, शरैः arrows, व्यापारितम् shot.

36_6.translation: Being a human being who fought on foot, he killed fourteen thousand ferocious demons with his sharp arrows.
36_6.word_by_word: पदातिना  fighting on foot, मानुषेण by a human being, उग्रतेजसाम् of ferocious, रक्षसाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, निहतानि are killed.

36_7.shloka: खरश्च निहतस्सङ्ख्ये दूषणश्च निपातितः।हतश्च त्रिशिराश्चापि निर्भया दण्डकाः कृताः।।3.36.9।।
36_7.translation: Khara, Dusana and Trisira were killed in war.The residents of Dandaka forest are rendered safe and fearless.
36_7.word_by_word: सङ्ख्ये in the war, खरश्च Khara also, निहतः killed, दूषणश्च Dusana also, निपातितः is ruined, त्रिशिराश्चापि even Trisira, हतः got destroyed, दण्डकाः forest of Dandaka, निर्भयाः safe and fearless, कृताः are rendered.

36_8.shloka: पित्रा निरस्तः क्रुद्धेन सभार्यः क्षीणजीवितः।स हन्ता तस्य सैन्यस्य रामः क्षत्रियपांसनः।।3.36.10।।
36_8.translation: Rama, a victim of his father's anger, banished into the forest with his wife, a shortlived mortal and a calumny on the kshatriyas has killed the army of demons.
36_8.word_by_word: क्रुद्धेन by an angry one, पित्रा by father, सभार्यः with his wife, निरस्तः sent away, क्षीणजीवितः of a short life span, क्षत्रियपांसनः a calumny to kshatriyas, सः रामः that Rama, तस्य सैन्यस्य of the  army of demons, हन्ता killer.

36_9.shloka: दुश्शीलः कर्कशस्तीक्ष्णो मूर्खो लुब्धोऽजितेन्द्रियः।।3.36.11।।त्यक्तधर्मो ह्यधर्मात्मा भूतानामहिते रतः।
36_9.translation: He is a man of bad conduct, harsh, sharptonged, stupid, miserly and a slave to his senses. He is immoral and unrighteous, one who is busy harming others.
36_9.word_by_word: दुश्शीलः of bad conduct, कर्कशः harsh, तीक्ष्णः sharp one, मूर्खः stupid, लुब्धः avaricious, अजितेन्द्रियः slave to senses, त्यक्तधर्मः immoral, अधर्मात्मा unrighteous, भूतानाम् for others, अहिते in harming, रतः engaged,

36_10.shloka: येन वैरं विनाऽरण्ये सत्वमाश्रित्य केवलम्।।3.36.12।।कर्णनासापहरणाद्भगिनी मे विरूपिता।तस्यभार्यां जनस्थानात्सीतां सुरसुतोपमाम्।3.36.13।।आनयिष्यामि विक्रम्य सहायस्तत्र मे भव।
36_10.translation: With no enmity whatsoever, merely because he has strength, he cut off the nose and ears of my sister and mutilated her. His wife Sita  is like the daughter of heaven. I would like to abduct her with force from Janasthana for which you should be my accomplice.
36_10.word_by_word: येन by whom, वैरं विना without enmity, केवलम् only, सत्वम् strength, आश्रित्य depending, कर्णनासापहरणात् cut off nose and ears, मे भगिनी my sister, विरूपिता disfigured, तस्य his, भार्याम् wife, सुरसुतोपमाम् like the daughter of god, सीताम् Sita, विक्रम्य with my valour, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, आनयिष्यामि will bring, तत्र in that, मे to me, सहायः accomplice, भव you be,

36_11.shloka: त्वया ह्यहं सहायेन पार्श्वस्थेन महाबल।।3.36.14।।भ्रातृभिश्च सुरान्युद्धे समग्रान्नाभिचिन्तये।तत्सहायो भव त्वं मे समर्थो ह्यसि राक्षस।।3.36.15।।
36_11.translation: You are mighty. I do not care to fight even the gods when you and my brothers are by my side. Therefore, O demon, be my accomplice. (I know) you are capable of that.
36_11.word_by_word: महाबल of great  strength, सहायेन come for help, पार्श्वस्थेन at my side, त्वया by you, भ्रातृभिश्च by brothers also, युद्धे in war, समग्रान् together, सुरान् gods, नाभिचिन्तये I do not care, राक्षस demon, तत् therefore, त्वम् you, मे to me, सहायः accomplice, भव be, समर्थः capable, असि हि you are,

36_12.shloka: वीर्ये युद्धे च दर्पे च न ह्यस्ति सदृशस्तव।उपायज्ञो महान्शूरस्सर्वमायाविशारदः।।3.36.16।।
36_12.translation: In valour,  in war and in conceit there is no one equal to you. You know all means (of success). You are great. You are brave. You are an expert in all deceitful arts.
36_12.word_by_word: वीर्ये in valour, युद्धे च in war, दर्पे च in conceit, तव your, सदृशः equal, नास्ति हि none, उपायज्ञः you know all methods, महान् great, शूरः brave, सर्वमायाविशारदः an expert in all deceitful arts.

36_13.shloka: एतदर्थमहं प्राप्तस्त्वत्समीपं निशाचर।शृणु तत्कर्म साहाय्ये यत्कार्यं वचनान्मम।।3.36.17।।
36_13.translation: I have come to you for this purpose seeking your help. Listen to  my words on what you should do:
36_13.word_by_word: निशाचर demon, एतदर्थम् for this purpose, अहं I, त्वत्समीपम् to you, प्राप्तः I came, मम my, वचनात् words, साहाय्ये become a helper, यत् whatever, कार्यम् work, तत् this, कर्म task, शृणु  listen.

36_14.shloka: सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः।आश्रमे तस्य रामस्य सीतायाः प्रमुखे चर।।3.36.18।।
36_14.translation: Be a wonderful golden deer dappled with silver dots and roam in front of Sita in Rama's hermitage.
36_14.word_by_word: त्वम् you, रजतबिन्दुभिः dappled with silver dots, चित्रः wonderful, सौवर्णः golden, मृगः deer, भूत्वा  become, तस्य रामस्य that Rama's, आश्रमे in hermitage, सीतायाः of Sita, प्रमुखे in front, चर move.

36_15.shloka: त्वां तु निस्संशयं सीता दृष्ट्वा तु मृगरूपिणम्।गृह्यतामिति भर्तारं लक्ष्मणं चाभिधास्यति।।3.36.19।।
36_15.translation: Seeing you in the form of a deer, Sita will undoubtedly ask her husband and Lakshmana to capture you.
36_15.word_by_word: सीता Sita, मृगरूपिणम् in the form of a deer, त्वाम् to you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, गृह्यताम् catch it, इति thus, भर्तारम् her husband, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, निस्संशयम् without any doubt, अभिधास्यति will tell.

36_16.shloka: ततस्तयोरपाये तु शून्ये सीतां यथासुखम्।निराबाधो हरिष्यामि राहुश्चन्द्रप्रभामिव।।3.36.20।।
36_16.translation: Then during their absence it will be easy for me to abduct Sita in an isolated place without obstruction, like Rahu eclipsing the light of the moon.
36_16.word_by_word: ततः then, तयोः both (Rama and Lakshmana), अपाये तु in their absence, शून्ये in an isolated place, यथासुखम् with ease, निराबाधः without any impediment, सीताम् Sita, राहुः Rahu, चन्द्रप्रभामिव like the lustre of the Moon, हरिष्यामि I will abduct.

36_17.shloka: ततः पश्चात्सुखं रामे भार्याहरणकर्शिते।विस्रब्धः प्रहरिष्यामि कृतार्थेनान्तरात्मना।।3.36.21।।
36_17.translation: Thereafter, when Rama with his soul afflicted due to his wife's abduction. I can freely, happily, successfully strike him down.
36_17.word_by_word: ततः पश्चात् thereafter, भार्याहरणकर्शिते afflicted due to his wife's abduction, रामे  Rama, कृतार्थेन successfully, अन्तरात्मना inwardly, सुखम् happily, विस्रब्धः freely, प्रहरिष्यामि I can strike him.

36_18.shloka: तस्य रामकथां श्रुत्वा मारीचस्य महात्मनः।शुष्कं समभवद्वक्त्रं परितप्ता बभूव ह।।3.36.22।।
36_18.translation: At the mention of Rama's name, great Maricha's mouth dried up and he became concerned.
36_18.word_by_word: रामकथाम् mention of Rama's name, श्रुत्वा after hearing, महात्मनः of the great soul, तस्य मारीचस्य that Maricha's, वक्त्रम् mouth, शुष्कम् got dried, समभवत् became, परितप्त:was worried, बभूव हि became.

36_19.shloka: ओष्ठौ परिलिहञ्चुष्कौ नेत्रैरनिमिषैरिव।मृतभूत इवार्तस्तु रावणं समुदैक्षत।।3.36.23।।
36_19.translation: Licking his dried up lips, as though his eyes stopped winking like those of the dead, Maricha stared at Ravana, distressed.
36_19.word_by_word: शुष्कौ both dried, ओष्ठौ lips, परिलिहन् while licking, अनिमिषैरिव as though without winking, नेत्रैः eyes, मृतभूत इव like a dead person, आर्तस्तु distressed one, रावणम् Ravana, समुदैक्षत looked at Ravana.

36_20.shloka: स रावणं त्रस्तविषण्णचेता महावने रामपराक्रमज्ञः।कृताञ्जलिस्तत्वमुवाच वाक्यं हितं च तस्मै हितमात्मनश्च।।3.36.24।।
36_20.translation: Maricha who knows of Rama's valour was frightened and depressed at heart. He revealed to Ravana with folded hands some facts for mutual benefit.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट् त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
