36_20.word_by_word: महावने in the great forest, रामपराक्रमज्ञः one who knows Rama's valour, सः Maricha,त्रस्तविषण्णचेताः mind depressed and frightened, कृताञ्जलिः with folded palms, तस्मै to Ravana, हितम् for his wellbeing, आत्मनश्च of himself too, हितम् salutary, तत्वम् truth, वाक्यम् words, रावणम् to Ravana, उवाच spoke.

37_1.shloka: [Maricha describes the qualities of Rama and Sita to Ravana --advises Ravana to give up the idea of abduction of Sita.]तच्छृत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो मारीचो राक्षसेश्वरम्।।3.37.1।।
37_1.translation: Having heard the words of Ravana, lord of the demons, wise Maricha who was also an eloquent speaker replied:
37_1.word_by_word: राक्षसेन्द्रस्य  lord of the demons (Ravana), तत् वाक्यम् the words, श्रुत्वा having heard, महाप्राज्ञः very wise, वाक्यविशारदः eloquent speaker, मारीचः Maricha, राक्षसेश्वरम् to Ravana, प्रत्युवाच replied.

37_2.shloka: सुलभाः पुरुषा राजन्सततं प्रियवादिनः।अप्रियस्य तु पथ्यस्य वक्ता श्रोता च दुर्लभः।।3.37.2।।
37_2.translation: O king, it is always easy to find men who speak pleasing words, but it is difficult to get a speaker and a listener who use words unpleasant (to the ears) but beneficial (in life).
37_2.word_by_word: राजन् O king, प्रियवादिनः sweettongued, पुरुषाः men, सततम् always, सुलभाः easy to find, अप्रियस्य unpleasant to hear, तु but, पथ्यस्य salutary, वक्ता speaker, श्रोता च audience, दुर्लभः is difficult to find.

37_3.shloka: न नूनं बुध्यसे रामं महावीर्यं गुणोन्नतम्।अयुक्तचारश्चपलो महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम्।।3.37.3।।
37_3.translation: You  are fickleminded.  You have employed no spy ( who could have told you the truth about Rama's character). Rama is very brave and virtuous comparable to Indra and Varuna. Surely you are not able to know what Rama is.
37_3.word_by_word: अयुक्तचारः a man who does not employ a spy, चपलः  fickleminded, महावीर्यम्  very brave, गुणोन्नतम्  of good qualities, महेन्द्र वरुणोपमम् comparable to Indra and Varuna, रामम् Rama,नूनम् surely, न बुध्यसे not able to know.

37_4.shloka: अपि स्वस्ति भवेत्तात सर्वेषां भुवि रक्षसाम्।अपि रामो नासङ्क्रुद्धः कुर्याल्लोकमराक्षसम्।।3.37.4।।
37_4.translation: O dear may there be good to all the demons in the world. If Rama gets enraged, he will make this world demonless.
37_4.word_by_word: तात O dear, भुवि in the world, सर्वेषाम् of all, रक्षसाम् of demons, स्वस्ति safe, अपिभवेत् may be I wish, रामः Rama, न सङ्क्रुद्धः gets angry, लोकम् world, अराक्षसम् without rakshasa, अपि न कुर्यात् will he not do?.

37_5.shloka: अपि ते जीवितान्ताय नोत्पन्ना जनकात्मजा।अपि सीतानिमित्तं च न भवेद्व्यसनं मम।।3.37.5।।
37_5.translation: Hope the daughter of Janaka is not born to put an end to your life. Hope I will not face any disaster on account of Sita.
37_5.word_by_word: जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, ते to you, जीवितान्ताय to destroy your life, अपि नोत्पन्ना not born I hope, सीतानिमित्तम् on account of Sita, मम myself, व्यसनम् disaster, अपि न भवेत् hope it will not happen.

37_6.shloka: अपि त्वामीश्वरं प्राप्य कामवृत्तं निरङ्कुशम्।न विनश्येत्पुरी लङ्का त्वया सह सराक्षसा।।3.37.6।।
37_6.translation: I hope the city of Lanka along with the (entire) race of demons will not be destroyed, with a dictator like you who is a slave to sensual pleasure.
37_6.word_by_word: कामवृत्तम् a slave to sensual pleasures, निरङ्कुशम् a dictator, त्वाम् you, ईश्वरम् lord, प्राप्य  after getting, सराक्षसा along with demons, पुरी लङ्का city of Lanka, त्वया सह along with you, न विनश्येदपि may it not be destroyed,

37_7.shloka: त्वद्विधः कामवृत्तो हि दुश्शीलः पापमन्त्रितः।आत्मानं स्वजनं राष्ट्रं स राजा हन्ति दुर्मतिः।।3.37.7।।
37_7.translation: A king  who is a slave to passion, who is of bad conduct, of wicked thoughts, advised in evil ways destroys himself, his kith and kin and the entire kingdom.
37_7.word_by_word: कामवृत्तः passionate, दुश्शीलः a person of bad character, पापमन्त्रितः advised in evil ways, दुर्मतिः of wicked mind, त्वद्विधः one like you, सः राजा that king, आत्मानम् himself, स्वजनम् his own people, राष्ट्रम् country, हन्ति हि will ruin.

37_8.shloka: न च पित्रा परित्यक्तो नामर्यादः कथञ्चन।न लुब्धो न च दुश्शीलो न च क्षत्रियपांसनः।।3.37.8।।न च धर्मगुणैर्हीनः कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः।न तीक्ष्णो न च भूतानां सर्वेषामहिते रतः।।3.37.9।।
37_8.translation: Rama, the delight of Kausalya, has not forsaken by his father. He has never crossed the limits of dharma. He is not miserly. He has no  bad conduct. He is not a slur on the kshatriyas. He does not lack in righteousness. He is not cruel nor is he engaged in doing harm to others.
37_8.word_by_word: कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनः delight of Kausalya (Rama), पित्रा by father, न च परित्यक्तः not at all forsaken, कथञ्चन to do so, अमर्यादः nor crossed the limits of dharma, न not, लुब्धः miserly, न not, दुश्शीलः of bad conduct, न च and not, तीक्ष्ण sharptongued, क्षत्रियपांसनः च calumny to kshatriyas, न not, धर्मगुणैः in righteousness, हीनः not lacking, न not, तीक्ष्णः cruel, न not, सर्वेषाम् for all, भूतानाम् of beings, अहिते in doing harm, रतः is involved,

37_9.shloka: वञ्चितं पितरं दृष्ट्वा कैकेय्या सत्यवादिनम्।करिष्यामीति धर्मात्मा तात प्रव्रजितो वनम्।।3.37.10।।
37_9.translation: O dear, seeing that his truthful father was going to be deceived by Kaikeyi, righteous Rama himself offered to fulfil the promise of his father and came away to the forest.
37_9.word_by_word: तात dear, सत्यवादिनम् always speaks the truth, पितरम् father, कैकेय्या by Kaikeyi, वञ्चितम् deceived, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, धर्मात्मा righteous man, करिष्यामि इति saying I will do it, वनम् forest, प्रव्रजितः came.

37_10.shloka: कैकेय्याः प्रियकामार्थं पितुर्दशरथस्य च।हित्वा राज्यं च भोगांश्च प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।3.37.11।।
37_10.translation: To satisfy the desire of Kaikeyi and to fulfil his father's word he came to Dandaka forest,  leaving the kingdom and all royal pleasures, behind.
37_10.word_by_word: कैकेय्याः of Kaikeyi, पितुः father's दशरथस्य च and Dasaratha's, प्रियकामार्थम् to satisfy their desire, राज्यम् kingdom, भोगांश्च pleasures, हित्वा after leaving, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest प्रविष्टः he entered.

37_11.shloka: न रामः कर्कशस्तात नाविद्वान्नाजितेन्द्रियः।अनृतं दुश्श्रुतं चैव नैव त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।3.37.12।।
37_11.translation: O my dear, Rama is not harsh nor ignorant. It is not that he has no control over the senses. It is not proper  for you to say what is false. You are illinformed.
37_11.word_by_word: तात O dear, रामः Rama, कर्कशः hardhearted, न not, अविद्वान् not learned, न not, अजितेन्द्रियः not that he has no control over the senses, न not, त्वम् you, अनृतम् false, दुश्श्रुतं चैव illinformed, वक्तुम् to speak, नार्हसि not proper.

37_12.shloka: रामो विग्रहवान् धर्मस्साधुस्सत्यपराक्रमः।राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य देवानां मघवानिव।।3.37.13।।
37_12.translation: Rama is dharma incarnate. He is pious. His strength is truth. He is king of all the worlds like Indra to the gods.
37_12.word_by_word: रामः Rama, विग्रहवान् a personification of, धर्मः  dharma, साधुः pious , सत्यपराक्रमः one whose strength is truth, देवानाम् for gods, मघवानिव like Indra, सर्वस्य for all, लोकस्य worlds, राजा king.

37_13.shloka: कथं त्वं तस्य वैदेहीं रक्षितां स्वेन तेजसा।इच्छसि प्रसभं हर्तुं प्रभामिव विवस्वतः।।3.37.14।।
37_13.translation: Sita is protected by the strength of her character. How do you desire to carry her away forcibly (from Rama) ? Can any one separate the radiance of the Sun from the Sun itself ?
37_13.word_by_word: त्वम् you, तस्य his, स्वेन own, तेजसा strength of character, रक्षिताम् will be protected, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, विवस्वतः Sun's, प्रभामिव like the radiance, प्रसभम् forcibly, हर्तुम् to take, कथम् how, इच्छसि you wish.

37_14.shloka: शरार्चिषमाधृष्यं चापखङ्गेन्धनं रणे।रामाग्निं सहसा दीप्तं न प्रवेष्टुं त्वमर्हसि।।3.37.15।।
37_14.translation: You should not enter into the unquenchable fire that is  Rama,  the fire that has the  arrows (of Rama) as its flames and his sword and bow as fuel.
37_14.word_by_word: शरार्चिषम् arrows are flames, अनाधृष्यम् cannot be overpowered, चापखड्गेन्धनम् bow and  sword as fuel, रणे in war, दीप्तम् blazing, रामाग्निम् fire of Rama, सहसा at once, प्रवेष्टुम् to enter, त्वम् you, न अर्हसि should not.

37_15.shloka: धनुर्व्यादितदीप्तास्यं शरार्चिषममर्षणम्।चापबाणधरं तीक्ष्णं शत्रुसैन्यप्रहारिणम्।।3.37.16।।राज्यं सुखं च सन्त्यज्य जीवितं चेष्टमात्मनः।नात्यासादयितुं तात रामान्तकमिहार्हसि।।3.37.17।।
37_15.translation: You should not give up happiness,your dear life and kingdom and come to Rama who is a variable god of death. His bow is  like on open burning mouth, and his flaming arrows are like fire. He is all anger. He is wielder of bow and arrows. He can strike the enemy army (alone).
37_15.word_by_word: तात O dear, धनुर्व्यादितदीप्तास्यम् his bow is an open burning mouth, शरार्चिषम् flaming arrows as fire, अमर्षणम् anger, चापबाणधरम् wielder of bow and arrows, तीक्ष्णम्  sharp, शत्रुसैन्यप्रहारिणम् one who can strike the enemy's army, रामान्तकम् Rama like Yama himself, आत्मनः your own, इष्टम् dear, राज्यम् kingdom, सुखं च and happiness, जीवितं च life, सन्त्यज्य after abandoning, इह here, आत्यासादयितुम् to enter, न not, अर्हसि should.

37_16.shloka: अप्रमेयं हि तत्तेजो यस्य सा जनकात्मजा।न त्वं समर्थस्तां हर्तुं रामचापाश्रयं वने।।3.37.18।।
37_16.translation: Immeasurable indeed is the power of Rama to whom Sita, daughter of Janaka belongs. You are not competent to kidnap her, for she is under the refuge of Rama's bow in the forest.
37_16.word_by_word: सा she, जनकात्मजा Sita, daughter of Janaka, यस्य whose, तत् that, अप्रमेयम् immeasurable, तेजः हि is the power, वने in the forest, रामचापाश्रयम् under the refuge of Rama's bow, ताम् herself, हर्तुम् to abduct, त्वम् you, समर्थः competent, न not.

37_17.shloka: तस्य सा नरसिंहस्य सिंहोरस्कस्य भामिनी।प्राणेभ्योऽपि प्रियतरा भार्या नित्यमनुव्रता।।3.37.19।।
37_17.translation: Beautiful Sita happens to be the wife of Rama who is like a lion among men. Ramahas a broad chest like that of a lion. He loves Sita who is ever loyal to him, more than his life.
37_17.word_by_word: सा भामिनी effulgent lady, सिंहोरस्कस्य of a lion's chest, तस्य his, नरसिंहस्य of a lion in the form of man, प्राणेभ्योपि more than his life, प्रियतरा dearer, भार्या wife, नित्यम् always, अनुव्रता loyal to him.

37_18.shloka: न सा धर्षयितुं शक्या मैथिल्योजस्विनः प्रिया।दीप्तस्येव हुताशस्य शिखा सीता सुमध्यमा।।3.37.20।।
37_18.translation: Sita is the darling of mighty Rama. With her slender waist, she is like the leaping flames of blazing fire and it is not possible  for you to touch her.
37_18.word_by_word: मैथिली Maithili, ओजस्विनः of the mighty, प्रिया darling, सुमध्यमा slender waist, सा सीता that Sita, दीप्तस्य of burning, हुताशस्य fire's, शिखा इव like a leaping flame, धर्षयितुम् to touch her, न शक्या not possible.

37_19.shloka: किमुद्यममिमं व्यर्थं कृत्वा ते राक्षसाधिप।दृष्टश्चेत्वं रणे तेन तदन्तं तव जीवितम्।।3.37.21।।
37_19.translation: O chief of the demons, why do you make this futile attempt ? The moment you are seen by Rama in war will be the last of your life.
37_19.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिप chief of the demons, व्यर्थम् futile, इमम् this, उद्यमम् attempt, कृत्वा doing, ते you, किम् why, त्वम् you, रणे in war, तेन by him, दृष्टः seen, चेत् if, तव your, जीवितम् life, तदन्तम् that is the end.

37_20.shloka: जीवितं च सुखं चैव राज्यं चैव सुदुर्लभम्।यदीच्छसि चिरं भोक्तुं मा कृथा रामविप्रियम्।।3.37.22।।
37_20.translation: If you want to enjoy your life, happiness and even the kingdom which is not easily attainable for long, do not incur the displeasure of Rama.
37_20.word_by_word: जीवितं च life and, सुखं चैव also happiness, सुदुर्लभम् not easily attainable, राज्यं चैव even kingdom, चिरम् for long, भोक्तुम् to enjoy, इच्छसि यदि if you desire to, रामविप्रियम् displeasure to Rama, मा कृथाः do not incur.

37_21.shloka: स सर्वैस्सचिवैस्सार्धं विभीषणपुरोगमैः।मन्त्रयित्वा तु धर्मिष्ठैः कृत्वा निश्चयमात्मनः।।3.37.23।।दोषाणां च गुणानां च सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्।आत्मनश्च बलं ज्ञात्वा राघवस्य च तत्वतः।।3.37.24।।हिताहितं विनिश्चित्य क्षमं त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि।
37_21.translation: After consulting all your ministers and the righteous persons led by Vibhisana, you may take a decision. Assess the real strength and weakness, merits and demerits  of your own and of Rama. Decide what is good or bad for you and then take steps you deem proper.
37_21.word_by_word: सः त्वम्  you, धर्मिष्ठैः followers of righteous path, विभीषणपुरोगमैः by prominent people like Vibhisana, सर्वैः by all, सचिवैः सार्धम् with all ministers, मन्त्रयित्वा after discussing, आत्मनः yourself, निश्चयम् decision, कृत्वा  take, दोषाणां च of demerits, गुणानां च of merits, बलाबलम् strength and weakness, सम्प्रधार्य assessing, आत्मनश्च your own, राघवस्य च Rama's, बलम् strength, तत्वतः in fact, ज्ञात्वा  knowing, हिताहितम् welfare and otherwise, विनिश्चित्य after deciding, क्षमम् propriety, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि should.

37_22.shloka: अहं तु मन्ये तव न क्षमं रणे समागमं कोसलराजसूनुना।इदं हि भूयश्श़ृणु वाक्यमुत्तमं क्षमं च युक्तं च निशाचरेश्वर।।3.37.25।।
37_22.translation: O Ravana  I think it is not good on your part to confront the prince of Kosala in a war. Listen to my words and consider what is good for you.इत्यार्षे श्री मद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
37_22.word_by_word: निशाचरेश्वर Ravana, अहं तु on my part, तव your, रणे in war, कोसलराजसूनुना by Rama son of the king of Kosala, समागमम् meet, क्षमम् good, न मन्ये not consider, उत्तमम् best, क्षमम् capable, युक्तं च and proper, इदं वाक्यम् these words, भूयः further, शृणु you may listen.

38_1.shloka: [Maricha's narration of his experience of Rama's strength--explains to Ravana the consequences of waging a war with Rama.]कदाचिदप्यहं वीर्यात्पर्यटन्पृथिवीमिमाम्।बलं नागसहस्रस्य धारयन्पर्वतोपमः।।3.38.1।।नीलजीमूतसङ्काशस्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः।भयं लोकस्य जनयन्किरीटी परिघायुधः।।3.38.2।।व्यचरं दण्डकारण्ये ऋषिमांसानि भक्षयन्।
38_1.translation: Once I was roaming the earth, like a mountain possessing the  strength of a thousand elephants, like a dark cloud, wearing bright gold earrings and crown,holding a spear in hand, terrorising the people. I was wandering in Dandaka forest feeding on the flesh of ascetics.
38_1.word_by_word: कदाचित् at one time, अहमपि I also, वीर्यात् out of prowess, इमाम् this, पृथिवीम् earth, पर्यटन् while wandering, नागसहस्रस्य thousands of elephants, बलम् strength, धारयन् while possesed, पर्वतोपमः like a mountain, नीलजीमूतसङ्काशः looked like a dark cloud, तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः bright gold earrings, किरीटी crown, परिघायुधः spear, लोकस्य among people, भयम् fear, जनयन्  creating, ऋषिमांसानि flesh of ascetics, भक्षयन् eating, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, व्यचरम् I was moving about.

38_2.shloka: विश्वामित्रोऽथ धर्मात्मा मद्वित्रस्तो महामुनिः।।3.38.3।।स्वयं गत्वा दशरथं नरेन्द्रमिदमब्रवीत्।
38_2.translation: Hence the great sage, righteous Visvamitra afraid of me, went to king Dasaratha  and said:
38_2.word_by_word: अथ hence, धर्मात्मा righteous, विश्वामित्रः Visvamitra, महामुनिः great sage, मद्वित्रस्तः afraid of me, स्वयम् he himself, नरेन्द्रम् king, दशरथम् Dasaratha, गत्वा went  इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

38_3.shloka: अद्य रक्षतु मां रामः पर्वकाले समाहितः।।3.38.4।।मारीचान्मे भयं घोरं समुत्पन्नं नरेश्वर।
38_3.translation: 'O king Maricha has created in me a great fear. Spare the self possessed Rama to protect me while I do the sacrifice.'
38_3.word_by_word: नरेश्वर king, मारीचात् from Maricha, मे myself, घोरं (महत्) very, भयम् fear, समुत्पन्नम् has been created, अद्य now, रामः Rama, समाहितः composed, पर्वकाले while doing sacrifice at the time of lunar conjunctions on full moon and new moon days, माम् रक्षतु protect me.

38_4.shloka: इत्येवमुक्तो धर्मात्मा राजा दशरथस्तदा।।3.38.5।।प्रत्युवाच महाभागं विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्।
38_4.translation: When the great, venerable sage Visvamitra said so, the righteous king Dasaratha replied:
38_4.word_by_word: इत्येवम्  thus, उक्तः  spoken, धर्मात्मा righteous, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, तदा then, महाभागम् the glorious, महामुनिम् the great sage, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, प्रत्युवाच replied.

38_5.shloka: बालो द्वादशवर्षोऽयमकृतास्त्रश्च राघवः।।3.38.6।।कामं तु मम यत्सैन्यं मया सह गमिष्यति।
38_5.translation: 'My son Rama is only twelve. He is not experienced in the use of weapons. I shall accompany you with my army.
38_5.word_by_word: अयम् this lad, राघवः Rama, बालः young one, द्वादशवर्षे: twelve years old, अकृतास्त्रश्च not experienced in the use of weapons, मम mine, यत् that, सैन्यम् army, कामम् surely, मया सह along with me, गमिष्यति will come,

38_6.shloka: बलेन चतुरङ्गेण स्वयमेत्य निशाचरान्।।3.38.7।।वधिष्यामि मुनिश्रेष्ठ शत्रूंस्ते मनसेप्सितान्।
38_6.translation: 'O distinguished sage with the four divisions of my army I will slay the enemies you want me to.'
38_6.word_by_word: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O distinguished sage, चतुरङ्गेन with four divisions (elephants, horses, cavalry and infantry)of the army, बलेन with army, स्वयम् I myself, एत्य after coming, ते your, शत्रून् enemies, मनसा in your mind, ईप्सितान् desired ones, निशाचरान् nightwalkers, वधिष्यामि I will slay.

38_7.translation: When  the king thus responded to the sage,  he told him that none other than Rama in this world is a match for that demon.
38_7.word_by_word: इत्येवम् in that way, उक्त addressed, सः मुनिः that sage, राजानम् to the king, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, रामात् excepting Rama, अन्यत् other, बलम् strength, तस्य रक्षसः for that demon, लोके in this world, न पर्याप्तम् not enough.

38_8.shloka: देवतानामपि भवान् समरेष्वभिपालकः।।3.38.9।।आसीत्तव कृतं कर्म त्रिलोके विदितं नृप।
38_8.translation: 'O king, you have protected even gods in wars and have been a guardian. Your deeds are very wellknown in the three worlds.
38_8.word_by_word: नृप O king, भवान् you, समरेषु in wars, देवतानामपि even to gods, अभिपालकः a guardian, कृतम् help, तव your, कर्म deed, त्रिलोके in the three worlds, विदितम् well known, आसीत् was.

38_9.shloka: काममस्तु महत्सैन्यं तिष्ठत्विह परन्तप।।3.38.10।।बालोऽप्येष महातेजास्समर्थस्तस्य निग्रहे।गमिष्ये राममादाय स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु परन्तप।।3.38.11।।
38_9.translation: 'O scourge of foes as you wish, let your great army wait here. Even though Rama is young he is glorious, and capable of subduing the enemy. I will take him. Be blessed.'
38_9.word_by_word: परन्तप O scourge of the foes, महत् great, सैन्यम् army, अस्तु कामम् so you wish, इह here, तिष्ठतु let it stay, महातेजाः glorious one, एषः he, बालोऽपि even if he is a boy, तस्य his, निग्रहे in suppressing, समर्थः capable, परन्तप subduer of enemy, रामम् Rama, आदाय after taking, गमिष्ये I will go, ते to you, स्वस्ति auspicious, अस्तु be.

38_10.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु स मुनिस्तमादाय नृपात्मजम्।जगाम परमप्रीतो विश्वामित्रस्स्वमाश्रमम्।।3.38.12।।
38_10.translation: Sage Visvamitra saying so took the son of the king and went back very happily to his hermitage.
38_10.word_by_word: सः that, विश्वामित्रः मुनिः sage Visvamitra, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, परमप्रीतः very happily, तम् him, नृपात्मजम् prince Rama, आदाय after taking, स्वम् his, आश्रमम् hermitage, जगाम went.

38_11.shloka: तं तदा दण्डकारण्ये यज्ञमुद्दिश्य दीक्षितम्।बभूवोपस्थितो रामश्चित्रं विष्फारयन्धनुः।।3.38.13।।
38_11.translation: Then Rama was initiated for the protection of sacrifices and stood on guard, stretching his wonderful bow.
38_11.word_by_word: तदा then, रामः Rama, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, यज्ञम् Yagna, उद्दिश्य for the purpose, दीक्षितम् settled in rigorous religious discipline(vow), तम् him, उपस्थितः standing by, चित्रम् wonderful, धनुः bow, विष्फारयन् while stretching, बभूव became.

38_12.shloka: अजातव्यञ्जनश्रीमान्पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणः।एकवस्त्रधरो धन्वी शिखी कनकमालया।।3.38.14।।शोभयन् दण्डकारण्यं दीप्तेन स्वेन तेजसा।अदृश्यत ततो रामो बालचन्द्र इवोदितः।।3.38.15।।
38_12.translation: Thereafter, handsome Rama, with eyes like lotus petals, beards ungrown, clad in a single garment with knotted hair on the head, wielding a bow, with a chain of gold, luminous with his own lustre enhanced the glory of Dandaka forest by looking like the young moon just risen.
38_12.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, अजातव्यञ्जनः with beards ungrown, श्रीमान् handsome, पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणः having eyes like lotus petals, एकवस्त्रधरः clad in a single garment, धन्वी  wielding bow, शिखी wearing a knot of hair on the head, कनकमालया with a gold chain, दीप्तेन luminous, स्वेन  by his, तेजसा by lustre, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, शोभयन्  beautifying,  रामः Rama, उदितः just risen, बालचन्द्र इव like young Moon, अदृश्यत looked.

38_13.translation: Then looking like a dark cloud, wearing bright golden earrings, proud of power bestowed on me with boons, I arrived at the hermitage.
38_13.word_by_word: ततः then, मेघसङ्काशः looking like a dark hued cloud, तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः wearing bright golden earrings, बली a strong man, दत्तवरः bestowed with boons, अहम् I, दर्पात् with pride, तदाश्रमम् the hermitage, आजगाम arrived.

38_14.shloka: तेन दृष्टः प्रविष्टोऽहं सहसैवोद्यतायुधः।मां तु दृष्ट्वा धनुस्सज्यमसम्भ्रान्तश्चकार सः।।3.38.17।।
38_14.translation: I entered at once and lifted my weapons. Rama saw me and unperturbed, started stringing his bow.
38_14.word_by_word: उद्यतायुधः  with raised weapons, प्रविष्टः entered, अहम् I, सहसैव at once, तेन by him, Rama, दृष्टः seen, सः he, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, असम्भ्रान्तः unperturbed, धनुः bow, सज्यम्stringing, चकार did.

38_15.shloka: अवजानन्नहं मोहाद्बालोऽयमिति राघवम्।विश्वामित्रस्य तां वेदिमभ्यधावं कृतत्वरः।।3.38.18।।
38_15.translation: Out of my delusion I underestimated the young boy, and screaming, ran towards Visvamitra's sacrificial altar.
38_15.word_by_word: अहम् I, मोहात् due to delusion, अयम् this, बालः young boy, इति in this way, राघवम् Rama, अवजानन् underestimating, कृतत्वरः making sounds, विश्वामित्रस्य Visvamitra's, ताम् that, वेदिम् sacrificial altar, अभ्यधावम् ran towards the same.

38_16.shloka: तेन मुक्तस्ततो बाणः शितश्शत्रुनिबर्हणः।तेनाहं त्वाहतः क्षिप्तस्समुद्रे शतयोजने।।3.38.19।।
38_16.translation: Then Rama released a sharp arrow that could kill the enemy. It struck me and threw me at a distance of hundred yojanas into the sea.
38_16.word_by_word: ततः then, तेन by him, शत्रुनिबर्हणः a subduer of enemy, शितः sharp, बाणः arrow, मुक्तः unleashed, अहम् on me, तेन with that, आहतः struck, शतयोजने one hundred yojanas away, समुद्रे into the sea, आक्षिप्त: I was thrown.

38_17.shloka: नेच्छता तात मां हन्तुं तदा वीरेण रक्षितः।रामस्य शरवेगेन निरस्तोऽहमचेतनः।।3.38.20।।
38_17.translation: O dear being thrown away by the speed of his dart I lost my consciousness. I was protected by Rama who did not want to kill me.
38_17.word_by_word: तात O dear, तदा then, माम् me, हन्तुम् to kill, नेच्छता by not intending, वीरेण रक्षितः protected by the hero, रामस्य Rama's, शरवेगेन by the speed of his dart, अचेतनः lost conciousness, अहम् I, निरस्तः thrown away.

38_18.shloka: पातितोऽहं तदा तेन गम्भीरे सागराम्भसि।प्राप्य संज्ञां चिरात्तात लङ्कां प्रतिगतः पुरीम्।।3.38.21।।
38_18.translation: O dear I was thrown into the deep sea and after a long time regained consciousness and  returned to the city of Lanka.
38_18.word_by_word: तात O dear, तदा then, अहम् I, गम्भीरे in deep, सागराम्भसि in sea water, पातितः was thrown, चिरात् after a long time, संज्ञाम् consciousess, प्राप्य after attaining, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, प्रतिगतः went towards.

38_19.shloka: एवमस्मि तदा मुक्तस्सहायास्तु निपातिताः।अकृतास्त्रेण बालेन रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।3.38.22।।
38_19.translation: That way I was spared by the young boy who was not versed in archery and who could still accomplish the task with ease.Those who accompanied me were destroyed.
38_19.word_by_word: तदा then, अकृतास्त्रेण who had not mastered archery, बालेन by the young boy, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा by one who acomplishes any task with ease, रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, मुक्तः अस्मि I was spared, सहायास्तु others who accompanied me, निपातिताः were destroyed.

38_20.shloka: तन्मया वार्यमाणस्त्वं यदि रामेण विग्रहम्।करिष्यस्यापदं घोरां क्षिप्रं प्राप्स्यसि रावण।।3.38.23।।
38_20.translation: If you pick up conflict with Rama even while being warned by me you will soon face adreadful calamity.
38_20.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, तत् that, मया by me, वार्यमाणः while being prevented, त्वम् you, रामेण with Rama, विग्रहम् conflict, करिष्यसि यदि if you wage, क्षिप्रम् very soon, घोराम् dreadful, आपदम् calamity, प्राप्स्यसि you will face.

38_21.translation: You will bring grief and disaster into the lives of demons who are sporting in love and who are in the habit of celebrating community festivals with joy.
38_21.word_by_word: क्रीडारतिविधिज्ञानाम् of those who know lovesport, समाजोत्सवशालिनाम् of those who celebrate community festivals, रक्षसां चैव of demons too, सन्तापम् grief, अनर्थं च disaster, आहरिष्यसि you will bring.

38_22.shloka: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधां नानारत्नविभूषिताम्।द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं पुरीं लङ्कां विनष्टां मैथिलीकृते।।3.38.25।।
38_22.translation: You will see the city of Lanka dotted with magnificent royal mansions embellished  with different kinds of gems ruined for the sake of Sita.
38_22.word_by_word: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधाम्  with magnificent royal mansions, नानारत्नविभूषिताम् embellisted with various gems, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, त्वम् you, मैथिलीकृते for the sake of Sita, विनष्टाम् ruined, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

38_23.shloka: अकुर्वन्तोऽपि पापानि शुचयः पापसंश्रयात्।परपापैर्विनश्यन्ति मत्स्या नागह्रदे यथा।।3.38.26।।
38_23.translation: Even without committing any sin those pure souls because they keep company with sinners will be destroyed for the sins of others just like fishes in a pool of serpents.
38_23.word_by_word: पापानि sins, अकुर्वन्तोऽपि even without committing, शुचयः pure men, पापसंश्रयात् by contact with sinners, नागह्रदे in a pool of serpents, मत्स्याः यथा like the fish, परपापैः sins committed by others, विनश्यन्ति will be destroyed.

38_24.translation: You will see the demons who smear their limbs with sandal paste and unguents, who are adorned with excellent ornaments slain and laid on the ground for your mistakes.
38_24.word_by_word: दिव्यचन्दनदिग्धाङ्गान् with limbs smeared with sandal paste and unguents, दिव्याभरणभूषितान् adorned with excellent ornaments, राक्षसान् demons, तव दोषात् for your mistakes, भूमौ on this earth, अभिहतान् killed, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

38_25.shloka: हृतदारान् सदारांश्च दश विद्रवतो दिशः।हतशेषानशरणान्द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं निशाचरान्।।3.38.28।।
38_25.translation: You will see the rest of the demons with their wives gone or fleeing in all directions helplessly with none to take care of them.
38_25.word_by_word: हतशेषान् the surviving, निशाचरान् demons, हृतदारान् with their wives abducted, सदारांश्च those with wives, अशरणान् with none to take care of them, दश दिशः in ten directions, विद्रवतः while running, त्वम् you, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

38_26.translation: You will undoubtedly see Lanka filled with arrows, surrounded by flames of fire and its buildings on fire.
38_26.word_by_word: शरजालपरिक्षिप्ताम् scattered arrows, अग्निज्वालासमावृताम् surrounded by flames of fire, प्रदग्धभवनाम् with buildings on fire, लङ्काम् Lanka, त्वम् you, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see, संशयः doubt, न not.

38_27.shloka: परदाराभिमर्शात्तु नान्यत्पापतरं महत्।प्रमदानां सहस्रं च तव राजन्परिग्रहः।।3.38.30।।
38_27.translation: O king there is no sin greater than violating the chastity of others wives, when you have married a thousand lovely women.
38_27.word_by_word: परदाराभिमर्शात्  violating the chastity of others' wives, पापतरम् a greater  sin, महत् highly, अन्यत् other thing, न not, राजन् O king, प्रमदानाम् women  सहस्रम् thousand, तव your, परिग्रहःwhom you married,

38_28.shloka: भव स्वदारनिरतस्वकुलं रक्ष राक्षस।मानमृद्धिं च राज्यं च जीवितं चेष्टमात्मनः।।3.38.31।।
38_28.translation: Enjoy with your wives. Protect your race, prestige, kingdom, prosperity and your own dear life.
38_28.word_by_word: राक्षस O demon, स्वदारनिरतः enjoy your own wives, भव be, स्वकुलम् your race, रक्ष you protect, मानम् prestige, ऋद्धिं च prosperity also, राज्यं च kingdom too, आत्मनः your, इष्टम्  dear, जीवितं च and your life.

38_29.shloka: कलत्राणि च सौम्यानि मित्रवर्गं तथैव च।यदीच्छसि चिरं भोक्तं मा कृथा रामविप्रियम्।।3.38.32।।
38_29.translation: If you wish to enjoy your beautiful wives and your good friends for long, do not create enmity with Rama.
38_29.word_by_word: सौम्यानि beautiful ones, कलत्राणि wives, तथैव च similarly, मित्रवर्गम् friends, चिरम् for a long time, भोक्तुम् to enjoy, इच्छसि यदि wish to, राम विप्रियम् offence to Rama, मा कृथाः do not do.

38_30.shloka: निवार्यमाणस्सुहृदा मया भृशं प्रसह्य सीतां यदि धर्षयिष्यसि।गमिष्यसि क्षीणबलस्सबान्धवो यमक्षयं रामशरात्तजीवितः।।3.38.33।।
38_30.translation: If you violate Sita forcibly notwithstanding my friendly warning, your life will be drained by the arrows of Rama and you will reach the abode of Yama with your kith and kin, your strength depleted.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
38_30.word_by_word: सुहृदा by a friend, मया by myself, भृशम् profusely, निवार्यमाणः prevented, सीताम् Sita, प्रसह्य forcibly, धर्षयिष्यसि यदि if you violate Sita, क्षीणबलः with reduced strength, सबान्धवः along with your kin, रामशरात्तजीवितः your life taken away by Rama's arrows, यमक्षयम् abode of Yama , गमिष्यसि you will go.

39_1.shloka: [Maricha describes his escape to Dandaka forest -- advises Ravana against the idea of encountering Rama.]एवमस्मि तदा मुक्तः कथञ्चित्तेन संयुगे।इदानीमपि यद्वृत्तं तच्छृणुष्व निरुत्तरम्।।3.39.1।।
39_1.translation: I was somehow saved by him this way in the combat.Listen without any reply to what has taken place recently.
39_1.word_by_word: तदा then, तेन by him, संयुगे in the combat, कथञ्चित् somehow , एवम् in that way, मुक्तः अस्मि I was released, इदानीमपि recently also, यत् whatever, वृत्तम् has taken place, तत् that, निरुत्तरम् without any reply, शृणुष्व listen to it.

39_2.shloka: राक्षसाभ्यामहं द्वाभ्यामनिर्विण्णस्तथा कृतः।सहितो मृगरूपाभ्यां प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।।3.39.2।।
39_2.translation: Having done so, I picked up courage and entered Dandaka forest, accompanied by the two other demons in the form of deer .
39_2.word_by_word: तथाकृतः having done so, अनिर्विण्णः unworried, अहम् I, मृगरूपाभ्याम् in the form of deer, द्वाभ्याम् by two, राक्षसाभ्याम् by demons, सहितः accompanied by, दण्डकावनम् forest of Dandaka, प्रविष्टः entered.

39_3.shloka: दीप्तजिह्वो महाकायस्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रो महाबलः।व्यचरं दण्डकारण्यं मांसभक्षो महामृगः।।3.39.3।।
39_3.translation: I wandered in Dandaka forest in the form of a huge animal with a big and strong body, a flaming red tongue and sharp teeth feeding on flesh.
39_3.word_by_word: दीप्तजिह्वः flaming red tongue, महाकायः big body, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रः sharp teeth, महाबलः very strong , मांसभक्षः feeding on flesh, महामृगः a huge animal, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, व्यचरम् wandered.

39_4.shloka: अग्निहोत्रेषु तीर्थेषु चैत्यवृक्षेषु रावण।अत्यन्तघोरो व्यचरं तापसान्सम्प्रधर्षयन्।।3.39.4।।
39_4.translation: O Ravana, assuming a very dreadful form, I wandered about sacrificial spots, sacred places, river banks, under huge trees planted at quadranglestorturing the ascetics.
39_4.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, अत्यन्तघोरः very dreadful , अग्निहोत्रेषु at the sacrificial sites, तीर्थेषु at sacred rivers, चैत्यवृक्षेषु alter at the root of fig trees in sacred places, तापसान् ascetics, सम्प्रधर्षयन् torturing, व्यचरम् I wandered.

39_5.shloka: निहत्य दण्डकारण्ये तापसान्धर्मचारिणः।रुधिराणि पिबंस्तेषां तथा मांसानि भक्षयन्।।3.39.5।।
39_5.translation: I wandered  about the Dandaka forest slaying righteous ascetics, drinking their blood and eating their flesh.
39_5.word_by_word: दण्डकारण्ये in the Dandaka forest, धर्मचारिणः following righteousness, तापसान् ascetics, निहत्य after slaying, तेषाम् their, रुधिराणि  blood, पिबन् drinking, तथा likewise, मांसानि flesh, भक्षयन् eating.

39_6.translation: While thus roaming, I harmed the wanderers of the forest. Intoxicated with their bloodI used to frighten the righteous.
39_6.word_by_word: अहम् I, ऋषिमांसाशनः eater of the flesh of ascetics, क्रूरः cruel, वनगोचरान् roamers of the forest, त्रासयन् while frightening, तथा likewise, रुधिरमत्तः intoxicated with their blood, धर्मदूषकः harming the righteous, विचरन् wandered.

39_7.shloka: आसादयं तदा रामं तापसं धर्मचारिणम्।वैदेहीं च महाभागां लक्ष्मणं च महारथम्।।3.39.7।।
39_7.translation: I encountered again the righteous Rama who was in the form of an ascetic, with venerable Sita and the great warrior Lakshmana.
39_7.word_by_word: तदा then, धर्मचारिणम् the followers of the righteous path, तापसम् ascetic, रामम् Rama, महाभागाम् venerable lady, वैदेहीं च Vaidehi too, महारथम् great  warrior, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, आसादयम् I encountered.

39_8.shloka: तापसं नियताहारं सर्वभूतहिते रतम्।सोऽहं वनगतं रामं परिभूय महाबलम्।।3.39.8।।तापसोऽयमिति ज्ञात्वा पूर्ववैरमनुस्मरन्।अभ्यधावं हि संक्रुद्धस्तीक्ष्ण शृङ्गो मृगाकृतिः।।3.39.9।।जिघांसुरकृतप्रज्ञस्तं प्रहारमनुस्मरन्।
39_8.translation: Although Rama was very strong, he was living on restricted diet, engaged in the welfare of all beings. Treating him as a mere ascetic living in the forest, remembering my past hostility with him and disregarding his (fatal) blow, I ran towards him angrily, assuming the form of a sharphorned animal with an intention to kill him.
39_8.word_by_word: मृगाकृतिः in the form of a deer, तीक्ष्णशृङ्ग: pointed horns, सः अहम् that me, पूर्ववैरम् earlier hostility, अनुस्मरन् remembering, तापसम् ascetic, नियताहारम् with restricted food, सर्वभूतहिते wellwisher of all beings, रतम् engaged, महाबलम् very strong, वनगतम् came to the forest, रामम् Rama, अयम् this, तापसः an ascetic, इति thus thinking, परिभूय disregarding, तं प्रहारम्  his blow in the past, अनुस्मरन् remembering, जिघांसुः with an intention of killing, सङ्कृद्धः very angry, अभ्यधावम् ran towards him.

39_9.translation: His mighty bow drawn, Rama released three sharp darts that came whizzing like Garuda or the wind. They could destroy the enemy.
39_9.word_by_word: तेन by him, चापम् bow, बलवत् might, विकृष्य having drawn, शत्रुनिबर्हणाः slayers of enemies, शिताः sharp, सुपर्णानिलनिस्वनाः whizzing like Garuda or the wind, त्रयः three, बाणाः darts, मुक्ताः released.

39_10.translation: All the three tightly jointed, welltargetted darts, strong as thunderbolt, and which could feed on blood came together all at once.
39_10.word_by_word: वज्रसङ्काशाः  like the thunderbolt, रक्तभोजनाः  which feed on blood, सन्नतपर्वणः with strong joints, सर्वे all, ते त्रयः बाणाः the three darts, सुमुक्ताः welltargetted, सहिताः together, आजग्मुः came at once.

39_11.shloka: पराक्रमज्ञो रामस्य शठो दृष्टभयः पुरा।समुद्भान्तस्ततोमुक्तस्तावुभौ राक्षसौ हतौ।।3.39.12।।
39_11.translation: Having known Rama's prowess earlier and experienced tremendous fear, I ran away in a bewildered state as I was deceitful. The other two demons (who had accompanied me) succumbed.
39_11.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, शठ: deceitful, पुरा earlier, दृष्टभयः having seen that fearful, पराक्रमज्ञः  knower of his prowess, समुद्भ्रान्तः in a bewildered state, ततः then, मुक्तः let away, तौ two others, राक्षसौ two demons, उभौ both, हतौ were killed.

39_12.shloka: शरेण मुक्तो रामस्य कथञ्चित्प्राप्य जीवितम्।इह प्रव्राजितो युक्तस्तापसोऽहं समाहितः।।3.39.13।।
39_12.translation: With my escape from Rama's darts I somehow got a fresh lease of life. Now I am composed. I have started living the life of a recluse here. I have turned an ascetic.
39_12.word_by_word: अहम् I, रामस्य Rama's, शरेण by the darts, कथञ्चित् somehow, मुक्तः escaped, जीवितम् life, प्राप्य having attained, युक्तः engaged in, समाहितः composed state, तापसः an ascetic, इह here, प्रव्राजितः have started living the life of a recluse.

39_13.shloka: वृक्षे वृक्षे च पश्यामि चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम्।गृहीतधनुषं रामं पाशहस्तमिवान्तकम्।।3.39.14।।
39_13.translation: I see Rama in every tree, clad in bark and deerskin, wielding the bow, holding a noose in hand like the god of death.
39_13.word_by_word: चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् clad in bark and deerskin, गृहीतधनुषम् holding the bow, पाशहस्तम् having  a noose in hand, अन्तकमिव like the god of death, रामम् Rama, वृक्षे वृक्षे in every tree, पश्यामि I see.

39_14.shloka: अपि रामसहस्राणि भीतः पश्यामि रावण।रामभूतमिदं सर्वमरण्यं प्रतिभाति मे।।3.39.15।।
39_14.translation: O Ravana I see in my fear thousands of Ramas. The entire forest appears to me as though filled with Rama.
39_14.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, भीतः fearful, रामसहस्राण्यपि thousands of Ramas, पश्यामि I see, इदम् this, सर्वम् all over, अरण्यम् forest, रामभूतम् filled with Rama, मे to me, प्रतिभाति appears.

39_15.shloka: राममेव हि पश्यामि रहिते राक्षसाधिप।दृष्ट्वा स्वप्नगतं राममुद्भ्रमामि विचेतनः।।3.39.16।।
39_15.translation: O king of the demons  I see only Rama even in solitude. When I see him in a dream  I lose my senses in a state of bewilderment.
39_15.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिप O king of the demons, रहिते in a solitary state, राममेव only Rama, पश्यामि I see, स्वप्नगतम् even in my dreams, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, विचेतनः senseless, उद्भ्रमामि I am bewildered.

39_16.shloka: रकारादीनि नामानि रामत्रस्तस्य रावण।रत्नानि च रथाश्चैव त्रासं संजनयन्ति मे।।3.39.17।।
39_16.translation: O Ravana, every name beginning with the letter 'Ra', such as Ratna (gems), Ratha (chariot), etc. strike terror in me.
39_16.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, रामत्रस्तस्य for one frightened by Rama, मे to, me, रकारादीनि नामानि names beginning with 'Ra', रत्नानि gems, रथाश्चैव chariots also, त्रासम् fear, सञ्जनयन्ति create in me.

39_17.shloka: अहं तस्य प्रभावज्ञो न युद्धं तेन ते क्षमम्।बलिं वा नमुचिं वापि हन्याद्धि रघुनन्दनः।।3.39.18।।
39_17.translation: I know his power.It is not proper to wage a war with him. Rama, delight of the Raghu dynasty, can slay even Bali or Namuchi.
39_17.word_by_word: अहम् I, तस्य his, प्रभावज्ञः knower of his power, ते to you, तेन with him, युद्धम् war, क्षमम्  proper, न not, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu dynasty (Rama), बलिं वा Bali or, नमुचिं वापि even Namuchi, हन्याद्धि can slay.

39_18.shloka: रणे रामेण युद्ध्यस्व क्षमां वा कुरु राक्षस ।न ते रामकथा कार्या यदि मां द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ।।3.39.19 ।।

39_19.translation: There were many pious men in this world who practise yoga and dharma .They have been destroyed along with their retinue due to mistakes committed by others.
39_19.word_by_word: लोके in the world, युक्ताः absorbed in, धर्मम् righteous ways, अनुष्ठिताः followers, बहवः many, साधव: pious people, परेषाम् of others, अपराधेन by their mistake, सपरिच्छदाः along with alltheir followers, विनष्टाः are destroyed.

39_20.shloka: सोऽऽहं तवापराधेन विनश्येयं निशाचर।कुरु यत्ते क्षमं तत्त्वमहं त्वा नानुयामि ह।।3.39.21।।
39_20.translation: O demon   As such, I will perish due to your offence. You may do anything you deem appropriate. I will not follow you.
39_20.word_by_word: निशाचर O demon, सः अहम् that I, तव अपराधेन by your mistake, विनश्येयम् I will be ruined, ते to you, यत् whatever, क्षमम् appropriate, तत् that, त्वम् you, कुरु you may do, अहम् I, त्वा you, न अनुयामि ह will not follow.

39_21.shloka: रामश्च हि महातेजा महासत्त्वो महाबलः।।3.39.22।।अपि राक्षसलोकस्य न भवेदन्तकोऽपि सः।
39_21.translation: Rama is brilliant, powerful and strong. I hope he will not be the god of death for the world of demons.
39_21.word_by_word: रामश्च Rama also, महातेजाः brilliant, महासत्त्व: very powerful, महाबलः very strong, सः he, राक्षसलोकस्य for the community of demons, अन्तकः god of death, न भवेदपि not be.

39_22.shloka: यदि शूर्पणखाहेतोर्जनस्थानगतः खरः।।3.39.23।।अतिवृत्तो हतः पूर्वं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।अत्र ब्रूहि यथातत्त्वं को रामस्य व्यतिक्रमः।।3.39.24।।
39_22.translation: For the sake of Surpanakha, Khara of Janasthana committed excesses and got killed by Rama who can accomplish things with ease.Tell me truly if Rama did violate anything here.
39_22.word_by_word: जनस्थानगतः staying at Janasthana, खरः Khara, शूर्पणखाहेतोः for the sake of Surpanakha, पूर्वम् earlier, अतिवृत्तः a person who exceeded his limits, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा by one who can accomplish a work easily, रामेण by Rama, हतः slain, यदि if, अत्र here, रामस्य Rama's,व्यतिक्रमः violation, कः what, यथातत्त्वम् truly, ब्रूहि tell me.

39_23.shloka: इदं वचो बन्धुहितार्थिनामया यथोच्यमानं यदि नाभिपत्स्यसे।सबान्धवस्त्यक्ष्यसि जीवितं रणे हतोऽऽद्य रामेण शरैरजिह्मगैः।।3.39.25।।
39_23.translation: If you do not follow my advice given for the welfare of our kith and kin, O Ravana, you are killed today. With your relations you will succumb to his straightmoving arrows.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
39_23.word_by_word: बन्धुहितार्थिना one seeking the welfare of relations, मया by myself, उच्यमानम् being spoken, वचः word, यथा as, न no, अभिपत्यसे यदि you do not follow, सबान्धवः with all relations, अद्य now, रामेण by Rama, अजिह्मगैः that which moves straight, शरैः with darts, हतः you are  slayed, रणे in war, जीवितम् life, त्यक्षयसि you will give up.

40_1.shloka: [Ravana commands Maricha with the authority of a king-- threatens to kill him if he disobeyed determined Ravana indicates his plan of the golden deer.]मारीचेन तु तद्वाक्यं क्षमं युक्तं च निशाचरः।उक्तो न प्रतिजग्राह मर्तुकाम इवौषधम्।।3.40.1।।
40_1.translation: The demon Ravana did not heed the appropriate advice of the competent Maricha just like a man wishing to die refuses medicine.
40_1.word_by_word: उक्तः spoken, निशाचरः demon, (रावणः Ravana), मारीचेन by Maricha, क्षमम् competent, युक्तं च suitable, तत् that, वाक्यम् advice, मर्तुकामः one who wishes to die, औषधम् इव like medicine, न प्रतिजग्राह did not accept৷৷

40_2.shloka: तं पथ्यहितवक्तारं मारीचं राक्षसाधिपः।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यमयुक्तं कालचोदितः।।3.40.2।।
40_2.translation: The king of the demons, driven by fate, replied with improper and harsh words to Maricha whose advice was salutary and beneficial to him :
40_2.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः king of the demons, कालचोदितः driven by fate, पथ्यहितवक्तारम् to one who spoke salutary and beneficial words, तं मारीचम् that Maricha, अयुक्तम् not appropriate, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said.

40_3.shloka: यत्किलैतदयुक्तार्थं मारीच मयि कथ्यते।वाक्यं निष्फलमत्यर्थमुप्तं बीजमिवोषरे।।3.40.3।।
40_3.translation: O Maricha, the words addressed to me are not appropriate.Your advice is extremely fruitless like a seed sown in saline, barren soil.
40_3.word_by_word: मारीच O Maricha, अयुक्तार्थम् in appropriate, यत् which, वाक्यम् words, मयि towards me, कथ्यते  is being said, ऊषरे in saline soil, उप्तम् sown, बीजमिव like the seed, अत्यर्थम् very much, निष्फलम् useless.

40_4.shloka: त्वद्वाक्यैर्न तु मां शक्यं भेत्तुं रामस्य संयुगे।पापशीलस्य मूर्खस्य मानुषस्य विशेषतः।।3.40.4।।
40_4.translation: It is not possible to dissuade me from my encounter with Rama who is sinful, foolish and especially an ordinary human being.
40_4.word_by_word: त्वद्वाक्यैः by your words, पापशीलस्य of a sinner, मूर्खस्य of a foolish one, विशेषतः specially, मानुषस्य of a human being, रामस्य of Rama, माम् me, संयुगे in a combat, भेत्तुम् to break, न शक्यम् not possible.

40_5.shloka: यस्त्यक्त्वा सुहृदो राज्यं मातरं पितरं तथा।स्त्रीवाक्यं प्राकृतं श्रुत्वा वनमेकपदे गतः।।3.40.5।।
40_5.translation: On hearing the casual words of a woman, (this) Rama came to the forest at once, leaving his friends, kingdom, mother and father.
40_5.word_by_word: यः he who, प्राकृतम् ordinary, स्त्रीवाक्यम् woman's word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सुहृदः friends, राज्यम् kingdom, मातरम् mother, तथा also, पितरम् father, त्यक्त्वा after leaving, एकपदे at once, वनम् to the forest, गतः went.

40_6.shloka: अवश्यन्तु मया तस्य संयुगे खरघातिनः।प्राणैः प्रियतरा सीता हर्तव्या तव सन्निधौ।।3.40.6।।
40_6.translation: In your very presence I will surely abduct Sita, wife of Rama who killed Khara in war,Sita whom he loves more than his life.
40_6.word_by_word: संयुगे in a war, खरघातिनः of one who killed Khara, तस्य his, प्राणैः more than his life, प्रियतरा dearer, (भार्या wife), सीता Sita, तव your, सन्निधौ in the presence, अवश्यम् surely, मया by myself, हर्तव्या will abduct.

40_7.shloka: एवं मे निश्चिता बुद्धिर्हृदि मारीच वर्तते।न व्यावर्तयितुं शक्या सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः।।3.40.7।।
40_7.translation: O Maricha  I have made up my mind that way. Even demons or deities including Indra cannot alter this decision of mine.
40_7.word_by_word: मारीच Maricha, मे my, बुद्धि mind, एवम् this way, निश्चिता made up, हृदि in my heart, वर्तते stop, सेन्द्रैः with Indra, सुरासुरैरपि deities or demons, व्यावर्तयितुम् to change, न शक्या not possible.

40_8.shloka: दोषं गुणं वा सम्पृष्टस्त्वमेवं वक्तुमर्हसि।अपायं वाप्युपायं वा कार्यस्यास्य विनिश्चये।।3.40.8।।
40_8.translation: If I asked you the merits or demerits, the risks involved or the way out while deciding a case, you should have said what you did.
40_8.word_by_word: अस्य कार्यस्य in this task, विनिश्चये  this decision, दोषम् demerits, गुणं वा or merit, अपायम् danger, उपायं वा or any way out, सम्पृष्टः asked of you, त्वम् you, एवम् in that way, वक्तुम् अर्हसि should say.

40_9.shloka: सम्पृष्टेन तु वक्तव्यं सचिवेन विपश्चिता।उद्यताञ्जलिना राज्ञे य इच्छेद्भूतिमात्मनः।।3.40.9।।
40_9.translation: A wise counsellor should give advice to the king only when his opinion is sought and that too with folded hands, if he wishes his own prosperity.
40_9.word_by_word: यः whoever, आत्मनः his, भूतिम् riches, इच्छेत् wants, सम्पृष्टेन by him when asked, विपश्चिता by a wise man, सचिवेन by a minister, उद्यताञ्जलिना by him with folded palms, राज्ञे to the king, वक्तव्यम् be said.

40_10.shloka: वाक्यमप्रितकूलं तु मृदुपूर्वं हितं शुभम्।उपचारेण युक्तं च वक्तव्यो वसुधाधिपः।।3.40.10।।
40_10.translation: A king should be addressed with politeness and decorum, with words not unfavourble intended for his good luck and wellbeing.
40_10.word_by_word: वसुधाधिपः lord of the earth, अप्रतिकूलम् not unfavourable, मृदुपूर्वम् politely, हितम्  welfare, शुभम् auspicious,उपचारेण with proper decorum, युक्तम् with, वाक्यम् word, वक्तव्यः  suggested.

40_11.shloka: सावमर्दं तु यद्वाक्यं मारीच हितमुच्यते।नाभिनन्दति तद्राजा मानार्हो मानवर्जितम्।।3.40.11।।
40_11.translation: A king who deserves honour does not feel happy to hear even good words of advice if said in disrespectful or authoritarian way, O Maricha
40_11.word_by_word: मारीच O Maricha, मानवर्जितम् disrespectful, यत् whatever, हितम् good, वाक्यम् words, सावमर्दम् in an oppressive way, उच्यते when spoken, तत् that, मानार्हः who deserves respect, राजा king, नाभिनन्दति does not like.

40_12.shloka: पञ्च रूपाणि राजानो धारयन्त्यमितौजसः।अग्नेरिन्द्रस्य सोमस्य वरुणस्य यमस्य च।।3.40.12।।
40_12.translation: Very powerful kings assume five forms like fire, Indra, Moon, Varuna and Yama.
40_12.word_by_word: अमितौजस: very powerful , राजानः kings, अग्नेः of fire, इन्द्रस्य of Indra, सोमस्य Moon's, वरुणस्य Varuna's, यमस्य च and of lord of death, पञ्च five, रूपाणि forms, धारयन्ति will assume.

40_13.shloka: औष्ण्यं तथा विक्रमं च सौम्यं दण्डं प्रसन्नताम्।धारयन्ति महात्मानो राजानः क्षणदाचर।।3.40.13।।तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु मान्याः पूज्याश्च पार्थिवाः।
40_13.translation: Great kings possess heat, (of the firegod), valour (of Indra), coolness (of the Moon), command (of Varuna) and grace (of the Lord of death). Therefore kings at all stages deserve respect and reverence.
40_13.word_by_word: क्षणदाचर of demon, महात्मनः great self, राजानः kings, औष्ण्यम् heat, तथा similarly, विक्रमं च   valour, सौम्यम् gentleness, दण्डम् command, प्रसन्नताम् grace, धारयन्ति possess, तस्मात् therefore, पार्थिवाः kings, सर्वासु at all, अवस्थासु stages, मान्याः deserve to be respected, पूज्याश्च worthy of reverence.

40_14.shloka: त्वं तु धर्ममविज्ञाय केवलं मोहमास्थितः।अभ्यागतं मां दौरात्म्यात्परुषं वक्तुमिच्छसि।।3.40.14।।
40_14.translation: You do not know your rightful duty.Because of delusion and an evil mind, you want to speak only harsh words to me, a guest who has come to you.
40_14.word_by_word: त्वं तु you on your part, धर्मम् rightful duty, अविज्ञाय not knowing, केवलम् only, मोहम् because of delusion, आस्थितः have taken recourse to, अभ्यागतम् to a guest (who comes without prior announcement), माम् me, दौरात्म्यात् out of evil mind, परुषम् harsh, वक्तुम् to speak, इच्छसि want.

40_15.shloka: गुणदोषौ न पृच्छामि क्षमं चात्मनि राक्षस।मयोक्तं तव चैतावत्संप्रत्यमितविक्रमः।।3.40.15।।
40_15.translation: O demon  O extremely valiant demon  I ask you(to do) this much now. I am not asking you whether it is good or bad or whether it is for my welfare or not.
40_15.word_by_word: राक्षस O demon, गुणदोषौ good or bad, आत्मनि  yourself, क्षमम् welfare, न पृच्छामि not asked you, अमितविक्रमः extremely valiant one, सम्प्रति now, तव your, एतावत् as such, मया by me, उक्तम् asked.

40_16.shloka: अस्मिंस्तु त्वं महाकृत्ये साहाय्यं कर्तुमर्हसि।शृणु तत्कर्म साहाय्ये यत्कार्यं वचनान्मम।।3.40.16।।
40_16.translation: You have to help me in accomplishing this great task .Hear me on the kind of work you have to do.
40_16.word_by_word: अस्मिन् in this, महाकृत्ये great task, त्वम् you, साहाय्यम् help, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behove, मम वचनात् by my words, साहाय्ये render help, यत् that which, कार्यम् task, तत् that, कर्म action, शृणु listen.

40_17.shloka: सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः ।आश्रमे तस्य रामस्य सीतायाः प्रमुखे चर ।।3.40.17 ।।

40_18.shloka: सौवर्णस्त्वं मृगो भूत्वा चित्रो रजतबिन्दुभिः।आश्रमे तस्य रामस्य सीतायाः प्रमुखे चर।प्रलोभयित्वा वैदेहीं यथेष्टं गन्तुमर्हसि।।3.40.18।।
40_18.translation: Transform yourself into a wonderful golden deer with silver spots and move about in front of Sita at the hermitage of Rama. After fascinating her, you may go whereever you desire.
40_18.word_by_word: त्वम् you, रजतबिन्दुभिः with silver spots, चित्रः wonderful, सौवर्णः golden, मृगः deer, भूत्वा being, तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, आश्रमे in hermitage, सीतायाः Sita's, प्रमुखे in front, चर go about, वैदेहीम् Sita, प्रलोभयित्वा after fascinating her, यथेष्टम् as you desire, गन्तुम् to go, अर्हसि you may.

40_19.shloka: त्वां तु मायामृगं दृष्ट्वा काञ्चनं जातविस्मया।आनयैनमिति क्षिप्रं रामं वक्ष्यति मैथिली।।3.40.19।।
40_19.translation: Seeing the illusory golden deer, Sita, wonderstruck, will at once ask Rama to get thedeer.
40_19.word_by_word: मैथिली Sita, काञ्चनम् golden, मायामृगम् illusory deer, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, जातविस्मया  wonderstruck, एनं this deer, क्षिप्रम् quickly, आनय get me, इति thus, रामम् Rama, वक्ष्यति will say.

40_20.shloka: अपक्रान्ते तु काकुत्स्थे दूरं यात्वाप्युदाहर।हा सीते लक्ष्मणेत्येवं रामवाक्यानुरूपकम्।।3.40.20।।
40_20.translation: Divert Rama to a faroff place and cry, 'Alas, Sita, Alas, Lakshmana',  imitating the voice of Rama.
40_20.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थे  the scion of the Kakutsthas, अपक्रान्ते diverted, दूरम् to a distance, यात्वा  going, रामवाक्यानुरूपकम् resembling Rama's voice, हा Alas, सीते Sita, हा लक्ष्मण Alas, Lakshmana, इत्येवम् in this way, उदाहर अपि cry also.

40_21.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा रामपदवीं सीतया च प्रचोदितः।अनुगच्छति सम्भ्रान्तः सौमित्रिरपि सौहृदात्।।3.40.21।।
40_21.translation: On hearing you, Lakshmana will be bewildered. Urged by Sita and out of love for Rama, Lakshmana will follow the same track as Rama.
40_21.word_by_word: सौमित्रिरपि Lakshmana too, तत् that, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सीतया च by Sita, प्रचोदितः urged, सम्भ्रान्तः bewildered, सौहृदात् out of love , रामपदवीम् following the track of Rama, अनुगच्छति will go.

40_22.shloka: अपक्रान्ते च काकुत्स्थे लक्ष्मणे च यथासुखम्।आनयिष्यामि वैदेहीं सहस्राक्षश्शचीमिव।।3.40.22।।
40_22.translation: When Rama and Lakshmana are away I will comfortably abduct Vaidehi like the thousandeyed Indra brought Sachi.
40_22.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थे when Rama, लक्ष्मणे च and Lakshmana, अपक्रान्ते are away, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Indra, शचीमिव like Sachi, यथासुखम् comfortably, आनयिष्यामि will get Sita.

40_23.shloka: एवं कृत्वा त्विदं कार्यं यथेष्टं गच्छ राक्षस।राज्यस्यार्धं प्रयच्छामि मारीच तव सुव्रत।।3.40.23।।
40_23.translation: You may go wherever you want after accomplishing this task. I will give you, O demon of determination half my kingdom.
40_23.word_by_word: राक्षस O demon, इदम् this, कार्यम् work, एवम् in that way, कृत्वा having done, यथेष्टम् wherever you please, गच्छ go, सुव्रत a person of good determination, मारीच Maricha, तव to you, राज्यस्य of my kingdom, अर्धम् half, प्रयच्छामि I will offer.

40_24.shloka: गच्छ सौम्य शिवं मार्गं कार्यस्यास्य विवृद्धये।अहं त्वानुगमिष्यामि सरथो दण्डकावनम्।।3.40.24।।
40_24.translation: Go and accomplish this task. Let your path be auspicious. I will follow you on the chariot into the Dandaka forest.
40_24.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome, अस्य of this, कार्यस्य of this task, विवृद्धये for fulfilment, शिवम् auspicious, मार्गम् path, गच्छ go, अहम् I, सरथः riding on the chariot, दण्डकावनम् to Dandaka forest, अनुगमिष्यामि I will follow.

40_25.shloka: प्राप्य सीतामयुद्धेन वञ्चयित्वा तु राघवम्।लङ्कां प्रतिगमिष्यामि कृतकार्यस्सह त्वया।।3.40.25।।
40_25.translation: I will deceive Rama and obtain Sita, without waging a war. With the work done, I will return to Lanka along with you.
40_25.word_by_word: राघवम् Rama, वञ्चयित्वा  deceiving, सीताम् Sita, अयुद्धेन without a war, प्राप्य  obtain, कृतकार्यः having accomplished the task, त्वया सह along with you, लङ्कां प्रति towards Lanka, गमिष्यामि will go.

40_26.shloka: न चेत्करोषि मारीच हन्मि त्वामहमद्य वै।एतत्कार्यमवश्यं मे बलादपि करिष्यसि।राज्ञो हि प्रतिकूलस्थो न जातु सुखमेधते।।3.40.26।।
40_26.translation: O Maricha if you do not do this, I will kill you now. Or, by force make you do this work. No one who goes against the king lives in comfort.
40_26.word_by_word: मारीच Maricha, न करोषि चेत् if you do not do this, अहम् I, अद्य वै now itself, हन्मि I will kill, मे myself, एतत् this, कार्यम् task, बलादपि forcibly also , अवश्यम् certainly, करिष्यसि will make you do, राज्ञः to the king, प्रतिकूलस्थः against, जातु generally, सुखम् in comfort, न एधते हि will not live.

40_27.shloka: आसाद्य तं जीवितसंशयस्ते मृत्युर्ध्रुवो ह्यद्य मया विरुध्य।एतद्यथावत्प्रतिगृह्य बुद्ध्या यदत्र पथ्यं कुरु तत्तथा त्वम्।।3.40.27।।
40_27.translation: Your survival is doubtful after facing Rama in combat. But your death is certain if you oppose me now. Think carefuly and do whatever is desirable for you in the present circumstances.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
40_27.word_by_word: तम् to him, आसाद्य  facing in a combat, ते to you, जीवितसंशयः doubtful to be alive, मया with me, विरुध्य  picking up, अद्य now, मृत्युः death, ध्रुवः sure, एतत् as such, बुद्ध्या think, यथावत् do as you like, प्रतिगृह्य accept, अत्र here, यत् whatever, पथ्यम्  desirable, तत् that, त्वम् you, तथा like that, कुरु do.

41_1.shloka: [Maricha's admonitions and warnings to Ravana]आज्ञप्तो राजवद्वाक्यं प्रतिकूलं निशाचरः।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं मारीचो राक्षसाधिपम्।।3.41.1।।
41_1.translation: At this royal command which was against his interest Maracha used harsh words to the demonking:
41_1.word_by_word: निशाचरः demon, प्रतिकूलम् adversely, राजवत् royal, आज्ञप्तः commanded, मारीचः Maricha, राक्षसाधिपम् to the king of the demons, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

41_2.shloka: केनायमुपदिष्टस्ते विनाशः पापकर्मणा।सपुत्रस्य सराष्ट्रस्य सामात्यस्य निशाचर।।3.41.2।।
41_2.translation: Who is that sinner who has given you this advice which will spell destruction on you, your sons, your kingdom and your ministers ?
41_2.word_by_word: निशाचर Ravana, सपुत्रस्य with your sons, सराष्ट्रस्य with the kingdom, सामात्यस्य with the ministers, ते to you, अयम् this, विनाशः destruction, पापकर्मणा sinful action, केन by whom, उपदिष्टः advised.

41_3.shloka: कस्त्वया सुखिना राजन्नाभिनन्दति पापकृत्।केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते मृत्युद्वारमुपायतः।।3.41.3।।
41_3.translation: Which sinner is not able to see you happy? O king by whom is this gate of deathshown to you cunningly?
41_3.word_by_word: राजन् king, कः who, पापकृत् sinner, सुखिना happy one, त्वया by you, नाभिनन्दति not tolerate, मृत्युद्वारम् death gate, इदम् this, केन by whom, ते you, उपायतः cunningly, उपदिष्टम्  advised.

41_4.shloka: शत्रवस्तव सुव्यक्तं हीनवीर्या निशाचराः।इच्छन्ति त्वां विनश्यन्तमुपरुद्धं बलीयसा।।3.41.4।।
41_4.translation: This is clear that your enemy demons are now powerless. Hence they want you to be engaged with a stronger power and be destroyed.
41_4.word_by_word: तव your, शत्रवः enemies, हीनवीर्याः deprived of valour, निशाचराः demons, त्वाम् you, बलीयसा by a strong person, उपरुद्धम् obstructed, विनश्यन्तम् being destroyed, इच्छन्ति they like, सुव्यक्तम् it is very clear,

41_5.shloka: केनेदमुपदिष्टं ते क्षुद्रेणाहितवादिना।यस्त्वामिच्छति नश्यन्तं स्वकृतेन निशाचर।।3.41.5।।
41_5.translation: O Ravana by which mean fellow is this advice given against your welfare? Who wants you to be destroyed by your own action.
41_5.word_by_word: निशाचर O nightwalker (Ravana), यः he who, त्वाम् to you, स्वकृतेन by your own action, नश्यन्तम् being destroyed, इच्छति wishes, क्षुद्रेण by a mean fellow, अहितवादिना one who gives wrong advice, केन by whom, इदम् this, ते to you, उपदिष्टम् advised.

41_6.shloka: वध्याः खलु न हन्यन्ते सचिवास्तव रावण।ये त्वामुत्पथमारूढं न निगृह्णन्ति सर्वशः।।3.41.6।।
41_6.translation: O Ravana the ministers should have prevented you by all means from adopting this  wrong path. Since they have not done so, they deserve to be spain.
41_6.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, उत्पथम् wrong path, आरूढम् you ascended, त्वाम् you, ये those, सर्वशः by all means, न निगृह्णन्ति do not prevent, तव सचिवाः your ministers, वध्याः खलु deserve to be slayed, न हन्यन्ते they are not slain?

41_7.shloka: अमात्यैः कामवृत्तो हि राजा कापथमाश्रितः।निग्राह्यस्सर्वथा सदभिर्न निग्राह्यो निगृह्यसे।।3.41.7।।
41_7.translation: Good ministrers should always prevent a lustful king from taking resourse to an evil path. Why were you not stopped, even though you deserve to be checked.
41_7.word_by_word: कामवृत्तः lustful, कापथम् evil path, आश्रितः resorted to, राजा king, सद्भि: by the good people, अमात्यैः by ministers, सर्वथा always, निग्राह्यः हि should be stopped, निग्राह्यः prevent, न निगृह्यसे not prevented.

41_8.shloka: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च यशश्च जयतां वर।स्वामिप्रसादात्सचिवाः प्राप्नुवन्ति निशाचर।।3.41.8।।
41_8.translation: O Ravana  the best among the successful ministers attain piety, prosperity, pleasures and fame by the grace of the king.
41_8.word_by_word: जयताम् among the successful, वर best, निशाचर demons, Ravana, सचिवाः ministers, धर्मम् righteousness, अर्थं च prosperity, कामं च and pleasures, यशश्च and fame, स्वामिप्रसादात् by the grace of the king, प्राप्नुवन्ति attain.

41_9.shloka: विपर्यये तु तत्सर्वं व्यर्थं भवति रावण।व्यसनं स्वामिवैगुण्यात्प्राप्नुवन्तीतरे जनाः।।3.41.9।।
41_9.translation: Otherwise evrything will become useless, O Ravana  Others will suffer calamities on account of their master's vices.
41_9.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, विपर्यये if it be otherwise, तत् then, सर्वम् everything (the four attainments), व्यर्थं भवति will become useless, स्वामि वैगुण्यात् by the vices of the king, इतरे जनाः others, व्यसनम् calamity, प्राप्नुवन्ति suffer.

41_10.shloka: राजमूलो हि धर्मश्च जयश्च जयतां वर।तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु रक्षितव्या नराधिपाः।।3.41.10।।
41_10.translation: O Ravana, the best among the victorious indeed the king is at the root of righteousness and victory.Therefore, the king should be protected by all at every stage.
41_10.word_by_word: जयताम् among the victorious, वर best one, धर्मश्च righteousness, जयश्च victory, राजमूल: the king is the root, हि indeed, तस्मात् therefore, सर्वासु in all, अवस्थासु stages, नराधिपाः kings, रक्षितव्याः deserve to be protected.

41_11.shloka: राज्यं पालयितुं शक्यं न तीक्ष्णेन निशाचर।न चापि प्रतिकूलेन नाविनीतेन राक्षस।।3.41.11।।
41_11.translation: O nightwalking demon  a kingdom cannnot be governed by a king who is rude or hostile or impolite.
41_11.word_by_word: राक्षस demons, निशाचर nightwalker, तीक्ष्णेन by a rude one, राज्यम् kingdom, पालयितुम् to rule, न शक्यम् is not possible, प्रतिकूलेन by a hostile one, न not, अविनीतेन by an impolite one, न not.

41_12.shloka: ये तीक्ष्णमन्त्रास्सचिवा भज्यन्ते सह तेन वै।विषमे तुरगा श्शीघ्रा मन्दसारथयो यथा।।3.41.12।।
41_12.translation: Ministers who adopt improper strategies go down along with the king just like swift horses driven by a slow charioteer on a rugged terrain.
41_12.word_by_word: ये whoever, सचिवाः ministers, तीक्ष्णमन्त्राः who adopt improper strategies, मन्दसारथयः when the charioteer is driving slow, शीघ्राः swiftly, तुरगाः horses, विषमे यथा on a rugged surface, likewise, तेन by that, सह along with, भज्यन्ते वै are overthrown.

41_13.translation: Persons who walk the righteous path go down in this world along with their kith and kin due to the mistakes committed by others .
41_13.word_by_word: लोके in this world, युक्ताः engaged, धर्मम् rightful duty, अनुष्ठिताः following, बहवः many, साधवः pious, परेषाम् of others, अपराधेन by their mistakes, सपरिच्छदाः along with their kith and kin, विनष्टाः ruined.

41_14.shloka: स्वामिना प्रतिकूलेन प्रजास्तीक्ष्णेन रावण।रक्ष्यमाणा न वर्धन्ते मेषा गोमायुना यथा।।3.41.14।।
41_14.translation: O Ravana, people who are ruled by a cruel and hostile king will not grow like the sheep protected by a jackal.
41_14.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, प्रतिकूलेन by an unfavourable, तीक्ष्णेन by a rude one, स्वामिना by the  master, रक्ष्यमाणाः protected, प्रजाः people, गोमायुना by a jackal, मेषाः यथा like sheep, न वर्धन्ते do not grow.

41_15.shloka: अवश्यं विनशिष्यन्ति सर्वे रावण राक्षसाः।येषां त्वं कर्कशो राजा दुर्बुद्धिरजितेन्द्रियः।।3.41.15।।
41_15.translation: Under a rude, crooked king whose senses are not under his control the demons will surely perish.
41_15.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, येषाम् of whom, कर्कशः  rude , दुर्बुद्धि: evilminded, अजितेन्द्रियः having no control over the senses, त्वम् you, राजा king, सर्वे all, राक्षसाः demons, अवश्यम् surely, विनशिष्यन्ति perish.

41_16.shloka: तदिदं काकतालीयं घोरमासादितं मया।अत्र किं शोचनीयस्त्वं ससैन्यो विनशिष्यसि।।3.41.16।।
41_16.translation: I am faced with  this dreadful disaster accidentally. You will not only be in a miserable state because of your misdeeds, you will perish along with your army.
41_16.word_by_word: मया I, काकतालीयम् accidental, घोरम् dreadful, तत् that, इदम् this, आसादितम् reached, अत्र here, किम् what, त्वम् you, शोचनीयः deplorable, ससैन्यः along with your army, विनशिष्यसि   will perish.

41_17.shloka: मां निहत्य तु रामश्च न चिरात्त्वां वधिष्यति।अनेन कृतकृत्योऽस्मि म्रियेयमरिणा हतः।।3.41.17।।
41_17.translation: Rama will kill you not long after killing me.Hence even if I die in the hands of the enemy, my desire will be fulfilled.
41_17.word_by_word: रामः Rama, माम् me, निहत्य after killing, न चिरात् soon, त्वाम् you, वधिष्यति will kill, अरिणा by the enemy, हतः slayed, म्रियेयम् I will die, अनेन by this, कृतकृत्यः accomplished, अस्मि I will be.

41_18.shloka: दर्शनादेव रामस्य हतं मामवधारय।आत्मानं च हतं विद्धि हृत्वा सीतां सबान्धवम्।।3.41.18।।
41_18.translation: Yu most understand that if I die at the very sight of Rama, you along with your relatives will perish with the abduction of Sita.
41_18.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, दर्शनादेव by mere sight, माम् me, हतम् a dead one, अवधारय presume, सीताम् Sita, हृत्वा abducting, सबान्धवम् along with your kith and kin, आत्मानम् yourself, हतम् killed, विद्धि  understand.

41_19.shloka: आनयिष्यसि चेत्सीतामाश्रमात्सहितो मया।नैवत्वमसि नाहं च नैव लङ्का न राक्षसाः।।3.41.19।।
41_19.translation: If you bring Sita from the hermitage with my assistance, know that none of us will surviveyou nor I, nor Lanka , nor the demons.
41_19.word_by_word: मया सहितः along with me, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, सीताम् Sita, आनयिष्यसि चेत् if you bring, त्वम् नैव असि you will not survive, अहं च I also, न लङ्का nor Lanka, नैव not, राक्षसाःdemons, न not.

41_20.shloka: निवार्यमाणस्तु मया हितैषिणा न मृष्यसे वाक्यमिदं निशाचर।परेतकल्पा हि गतायुषो नरा हितं न गृह्णन्ति सुहृद्भिरीरितम्।।3.41.20।।
41_20.translation: O Ravana, you do not understand this word of warning coming from your wellwisher. Men who are going to die do not heed the advice given by their friends.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
41_20.word_by_word: निशाचर Ravana, हितैषिणा by your wellwisher, मया by me, निवार्यमाणः  warned, इदम् this, वाक्यम् words, न मृष्यसे do not comprehend, गतायुषः men of reduced life span, परेतकल्पाः almost dead, नराः people, सुहृद्भि: by friends, ईरितम् told, हितम्  good advice, न गृह्णन्ति हि not accept.

42_1.shloka: [Maricha goes to Rama's cottage transformed into a wonderful deer and wanders-- Sita wonders at the deer.]एवमुक्त्वा तु वचनं मारीचो रावणं ततः।गच्छावेत्यब्रवीद्दीनो भयाद्रात्रिंचरप्रभोः।।3.42.1।।
42_1.translation: Having thus spoken to the demonking, the distressed Maricha said out of fear, Let both of us go.
42_1.word_by_word: ततः then, मारीचः Maricha, एवम् in that way, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा spoken, रात्रिंचरप्रभोः of the king of the nightrangers, भयात् out of fear, दीनः distressed , गच्छाव let us both go, इति thus, रावणम् to Ravana, अब्रवीत् said.

42_2.shloka: दृष्टश्चाहं पुनस्तेन शरचापासिधारिणा।मद्वधोद्यतशस्त्रेऽण विनष्टं जीवितं च मे।।3.42.2।।
42_2.translation: If that warrior Rama carrying bow, arrows and sword sees me once again he will raise his weapon to kill me, and I will cease to be.
42_2.word_by_word: अहम् I, शरचापासिधारिणा holding bow, arrows and sword, मद्वधोद्यतशस्त्रेऽण who raises weapon to slay me, तेन by him, पुनः again, दृष्टः seen, मे my, जीवितं च विनष्टम्  life will cease.

42_3.shloka: न हि रामं पराक्रम्य जीवन्प्रतिनिवर्तते।वर्तते प्रतिरूपोऽसौ यमदण्डहतस्य ते।।3.42.3।।
42_3.translation: No one who exhibits his heroism before Rama will come back alive. To you, already hit by Yama's staff, he is another form of the same Yama.
42_3.word_by_word: रामम् Rama, पराक्रम्य after exhibiting bravery, जीवन् with life, न प्रतिनिवर्तते हि will not return, यमदण्डहतस्य hit by Yama's staff, असौ he, प्रतिरूपः another form, ते to you, वर्तते is being.

42_4.shloka: किं नु शक्यं मया कर्तुमेवं त्वयि दुरात्मनि।एष गच्छाम्यहं तात स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु निशाचर।।3.42.4।।
42_4.translation: What can I do if you remain evilminded? O dear demon, I am going. May your path be auspicious
42_4.word_by_word: त्वयि when you, एवम् in that way, दुरात्मनि  evilminded, मया I, कि नु what, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् is possible, तात dear one, निशाचर O demons, एष here, अहम् I am, गच्छामि  am going, ते to you, स्वस्ति be auspicious, अस्तु let it be.

42_5.shloka: प्रहृष्टस्त्वभवत्तेन वचनेन स रावणः।परिष्वज्य सुसंश्लिष्टमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.42.5।।
42_5.translation: Ravana was so overwhelmed with joy to hear those words that he embraced him tightly and said:.
42_5.word_by_word: सः रावणः that, Ravana, तेन वचनेन with those words, प्रहृष्टः felt happy, तु अभवत् he was, सुसंश्लिष्टम् tightly, परिष्वज्य  embracing, इदम् these, वचनम् words , अब्रवीत् said.

42_6.shloka: एतच्छौण्डीर्ययुक्तं ते मच्छन्दवशवर्तिनः।इदानीमसि मारीचः पूर्वमन्यो निशाचरः।।3.42.6।।
42_6.translation: Act according to my wish. It befits your valour. You were a different demon earlier. Now you are Maricha.
42_6.word_by_word: मच्छन्दवशवर्तिनः act according to my wish, ते to you, एतत् this, शौण्डीर्ययुक्तम् it  befits your valour, इदानीम् now, मारीचः Maricha, असि you are, पूर्वम् earlier, अन्यः other, राक्षसः हि demons.

42_7.shloka: आरुह्यतामयं शीघ्रं रथो रत्नविभूषितः।मया सह तथा युक्तः पिशाचवदनैः खरैः।।3.42.7।।
42_7.translation: Ascend quickly with me this chariot encrusted with gems and yoked with donkeys with devils' faces৷৷
42_7.word_by_word: तथा similarly, पिशाचवदनैः with devilish faces, खरैः with donkeys, युक्तः yoked, रत्नविभूषितः encrusted with gems, रथः chariot, शीघ्रम् quickly, मया सह along with me, आरुह्यताम्  ascend.

42_8.shloka: प्रलोभयित्वा वैदेहीं यथेष्टं गन्तुमर्हसि।तां शून्ये प्रसभं सीतामानयिष्यामि मैथिलीम्।।3.42.8।।
42_8.translation: You may go whereever you like after tempting Vaidehi. When the princess of Mithila  is alone, I will bring her by force.
42_8.word_by_word: वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, प्रलोभयित्वा after tempting, यथेष्टम् wherever you like, गन्तुम् to go, अर्हसि should, शून्ये when no one is there, मैथिलीम् princess of Mithila, तां सीताम् that Sita, प्रसभम् forcibly, आनयिष्यामि will bring.

42_9.shloka: ततो रावणमारीचौ विमानमिव तं रथम्।आरुह्य ययतुश्शीघ्रं तस्मादाश्रममण्डलात्।।3.42.9।।
42_9.translation: Thereafter Ravana and Maricha ascended the chariot, which was like an aerial car, and quickly departed from that cluster of hermitages.
42_9.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, रावणमारीचौ Ravana and Maricha, तं रथम् that chariot, विमानमिव like an aerial chariot, आरुह्य  ascending, तस्मात् from that, आश्रममण्डलात् cluster of hermitages, शीघ्रम् quickly, ययतुः departed.

42_10.shloka: तथैव तत्र पश्यन्तौ पत्तनानि वनानि च।गीरींश्च सरितस्सर्वा राष्ट्राणि नगराणि च।।3.42.10।।
42_10.translation: And likewise, they went past towns, forests, mountains, streams, states and cities.
42_10.word_by_word: तथैव and likewise, तत्र there, पत्तनानि towns, वनानि च and forests, गिरींश्च mountains, सर्वाः all, सरितः streams, राष्ट्राणि states, नगराणि च cities, पश्यन्तौ seeing

42_11.shloka: समेत्य दण्डकारण्यं राघवस्याश्रमं ततः।ददर्श सह मारीचो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.42.11।।
42_11.translation: Ravana, king of the demons, accompanied by Maricha, then reached Dandaka forest and saw Rama's hermitage.
42_11.word_by_word: सहमारीचः accompanied by Maricha, राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, रावणः Ravana, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, समेत्य reached, ततः then, राघवस्य Rama's, आश्रमम् hermitage, ददर्श noticed.

42_12.shloka: अवतीर्य रथात्तस्मात्ततः काञ्चनभूषणात्।हस्ते गृहीत्वा मारीचं रावणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.42.12।।
42_12.translation: Then Ravana got off the chariot decorated with golden embellishments and, holding Maricha's hand, said:.
42_12.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, काञ्चनभूषणात् decorated with golden ornaments, तस्मात् from that, रथात् chariot, अवतीर्य  getting down, ततः then, मारीचम् Maricha, हस्ते by hand, गृहीत्वा, held, वाक्यम्  words, अब्रवीत् said.

42_13.shloka: एतदाश्रमपदं दृश्यते कदलीवृतम्।क्रियतां तत्सखे शीघ्रं यदर्थं वयमागताः।।3.42.13।।
42_13.translation: O friend here is the site of the hermitage surrounded by banana plants. Quickly get to work on the purpose for which we have come.
42_13.word_by_word: सखे O friend, कदलीवृतम् surrounded by banana plants, एतत् this, तत् that, आश्रमपदम् siteof hermitage, दृश्यते is seen, वयम् we, यदर्थम् the purpose for which, आगताः we came, तत् that, शीघ्रम् quickly, क्रियताम् should be done.

42_14.shloka: स रावणवचश्श्रुत्वा मारीचो राक्षसस्तदा।मृगो भूत्वाऽश्रमद्वारि रामस्य विचचार ह।।3.42.14।।
42_14.translation: Hearing Ravana's words, Maricha transformed himself into a deer and started moving at the entrance of Rama's hermitage.
42_14.word_by_word: तदा then, सः that, राक्षसः demon, मारीचः Maricha, रावणवचः Ravana's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, मृगः deer, भूत्वा transformed, रामस्य Rama's, आश्रमद्वारि at the entrance of the hermitage, विचचार ह started moving.

42_15.translation: Maricha assumed the form of a wonderful and magnificent deer with his antlers studded with the most precious gems, his face dappled with luminous spots of white and  black.
42_15.word_by_word: सः Maricha, अद्भुतदर्शनम् wonderful to look at, महत् magnificent, तत् that, रूपम् form, आस्थाय  assumed, मणिप्रवरशृङ्गाग्रः antlers studded with the best of gems, सितासितमुखाकृतिः face dappled with luminous spots of white and black.

42_16.translation: The deer's face was like a pink lotus, his ears were like blue lotus. His neck slightly raised, his lips were like petals of blue lotus.
42_16.word_by_word: रक्तपद्मोत्पलमुखः mouth like  pink lotus, इन्द्रनीलोत्पलश्रवाः  ears  like blue lotus, किञ्चित् a bit, अभ्युन्नतग्रीवः  raised neck, इन्द्रनीलदलाधरः lips like petals of blue lotus.

42_17.translation: His bright belly was shining like kunda flowers or the Moon or diamond. His flanks were like the golden madhuka flowers. comparable to the filaments of lotus. His hooves were like vaidurya, and his legs were slim and willshaped.
42_17.word_by_word: अस्य its, भास्वरम् shining, उदरम् stomach, कुन्देन्दुवज्रसङ्काशम् like white kunda flower, Moon and diamond, मधूकनिभपार्श्वश्च sides like madhuka flowers, पद्मकिञ्जल्कसन्निभः comparable to the filaments of lotus, वैडूर्यसङ्काशखुरः hooves like Vaidurya, तनुजङ्घः slim shank, सुसंहतः willshaped.

42_18.translation: His tail stood up looking magnificent like a colourful rainbow. Bedecked with various gems, he shone beautiful.
42_18.word_by_word: ऊर्ध्वम् upward, विराजता stood, इन्द्रायुध like a rainbow, सवर्णेन colourful, पुच्छेन with the tail, मनोहरः delightful, स्निग्धवर्णः shining, नानाविधैः various, रत्नैः gems, वृतः decked.

42_19.shloka: क्षणेन राक्षसो जातो मृगः परमशोभनः।।3.42.19।।वनं प्रज्वलयन्रम्यं रामाश्रमपदं च तत्।
42_19.translation: Transformed into a most beautiful deer in a moment, Maricha brightened the beautiful forest and Rama's hermitage.
42_19.word_by_word: राक्षसः the demon, वनम् forest, रम्यम् beautiful, तत् रामाश्रमपदम् that Rama's hermitage, प्रज्वलयन् while brightening, क्षणेन in a moment, परमशोभनः very beautiful, मृगः deer, जातःwas transformed.

42_20.shloka: मनोहरं दर्शनीयं रूपं कृत्वा स राक्षसः।।3.42.20।।प्रलोभनार्थं वैदेह्या नानाधातुविचित्रितम्।विचरन्गच्छते तस्माच्छाद्वलानि समन्ततः।।3.42.21।।
42_20.translation: Transfigured into a beautiful, magnificent form painted with the colours of different minerals in order to tempt Sita, Maricha roamed all around the grassland.
42_20.word_by_word: सः that, राक्षसः demon, नानाधातुविचित्रितम् painted with colours of different minerals, मनोहरम् delightful, दर्शनीयम् beautiful, रूपम् form, कृत्वा after transforming, वैदेह्याः to Sita, प्रलोभनार्थम् to tempt, विचरन् while grazing, तस्मात् from that place, समन्ततः all around, शाद्वलानि grassland, गच्छते moved about.

42_21.shloka: रूप्यैर्बिन्दुशतैश्चित्रो भूत्वा स प्रियदर्शनः।विटपीनां किसलयान्भङ्त्क्वाऽदन्विचचार ह।।3.42.22।।
42_21.translation: That deer with hundreds of silver spots on the body appeared enchanting and pleasing to the eyes while he wandered about nibbling the tender leaves of trees.
42_21.word_by_word: सः that, रूप्यैः by silver, बिन्दुशतैः with hudreds of spots, चित्रः was wonderful, भूत्वा on transforming, प्रियदर्शनः pleasing to the eyes, विटपीनाम् trees, किसलयान् tender leaves, भङ्त्क्वा nibbling, अदन् eating, विचचार ह wandered about.

42_22.translation: The deer went wandering about the banana groves surrounding Rama's hermitage and moved slowly towards the karnikara trees in order to catch the attention of Sita.
42_22.word_by_word: कदलीगृहकम् groves of banana, गत्वा on going, कर्णिकारान् the karnikara flowers, इतस्ततःhither and thither, मन्दगतिः at a slow pace, तथा likewise, सीतासन्दर्शनम् the sight of Sita, समाश्रयत् resorted.

42_23.translation: That magnificent deer glittered with the colour of blue lotus on its back, wandered merrily in the vicinity of Rama's hermitage.
42_23.word_by_word: सः that, महामृगः magnificent deer, राजीवचित्रपृष्ठः his back with the colour of blue lotus, विरराज glittered, रामाश्रमपदाभ्याशे in the vicinity of Rama's hermitage, यथासुखम् comfortably, विचचार wandered.

42_24.shloka: पुनर्गत्वा निवृत्तश्च विचचार मृगोत्तमः।गत्वा मुहूर्तं त्वरया पुनः प्रतिनिवर्तते।।3.42.25।।
42_24.translation: The wonderful deer moved to and fro, now disappearing and now swiftly returning.
42_24.word_by_word: मृगोत्तमः best of deer, गत्वा on going, पुनः again, निवृत्तश्च came back, विचचार wandered, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, गत्वा after going, पुनः again, त्वरया swiftly, प्रतिनिवर्तते returned.

42_25.shloka: विक्रीडंश्च क्वचिद्भूमौ पुनरेव निषीदति।आश्रमद्वारमागम्य मृगयूथानि गच्छति।।3.42.26।।
42_25.translation: The deer is now sporting, now sitting on the ground, now standing at the entrance ofthe hermitage and now running with the herds of deer.
42_25.word_by_word: विक्रीडंश्च while sporting so, पुनरेव again, क्वचित् sometimes, भूमौ on the ground, पुनरेव again, निषीदति squat, आश्रमद्वारम् at the entrance of the hermitage, आगम्य after reaching, मृगयूथानि flock of deer, गच्छति goes.

42_26.shloka: मृगयूथैरनुगतः पुनरेव निवर्तते।सीतादर्शनमाकांक्षन्राक्षसो मृगतां गतः।।3.42.27।।परिभ्रमति चित्राणि मण्डलानि विनिष्पतन्।
42_26.translation: Followed by herds of deer and coming back to see Sita again and again, the deer cavorted and pranced and frisked in circles in a wonderful way.
42_26.word_by_word: मृगताम् form of a deer, गतः transformed, राक्षसः demon, सीतादर्शनम् seeing Sita, आकांक्षन् intending, मृगयूथैः herds of deer, अनुगतः been followed, पुनरेव again, निवर्तते he retuned, विनिष्पतन्  cavorted and pranced, चित्राणि wonderful, मण्डलानि circles, परिभ्रमति turned round.

42_27.shloka: समुद्वीक्ष्य च ते सर्वे मृगा ह्यन्ये वनेचराः।।3.42.28।।उपागम्य समाघ्राय विद्रवन्ति दिशो दश।
42_27.translation: Seeing the deer, other animals wandering in the forest come near and sniffing him run away in all ten directions.
42_27.word_by_word: वनेचराः wandering in the forest, अन्ये other, ते those, सर्वे all, मृगाः deer, समुद्विक्ष्य seeing, उपागम्य on coming near, समाघ्राय sniffing, दश दिशः in all ten directions, विद्रवन्ति run away,

42_28.shloka: राक्षसस्सोऽपि तान्वन्यान्मृगान्मृगवधे रतः।।3.42.29।।प्रच्छादनार्थं भावस्य न भक्षयति संस्पृशन्।
42_28.translation: The demon who was interested in killing wild deer touched and felt them but did notkill or feed on them in order to hide his intention.
42_28.word_by_word: मृगवधे in killing deer, रतः interested, सः he, राक्षसोऽपि demon also, वन्यान् those wild, तान् those, मृगान् deer, संस्पृशन् touching and feeling, भावस्य his intention, प्रच्छादनार्थम् to hide, न भक्षयति does not feed on.

42_29.shloka: तस्मिन्नेव ततः काले वैदेही शुभलोचना।।3.42.30।।कुसुमावचयव्यग्रा पादपानभ्यवर्तत।
42_29.translation: In the mean time Sita who, with her auspicious looks, was busy plucking flowers drew near the trees.
42_29.word_by_word: ततः then, तस्मिन्नेव काले at that time, शुभलोचना lady of auspicious looks, वैदेही Vaidehi, कुसुमावचयव्यग्रा busy plucking flowers, पादपान् the trees, अभ्यवर्तत came near,

42_30.translation: With her bewitching eyes and beautiful face, Sita, went about plucking flowers from karnikara, ashoka and mango trees.
42_30.word_by_word: मदिरेक्षणा woman with bewitching eyes, रुचिरानना of dazzling face, कर्णिकारान् karnikara trees, अशोकांश्छ ashoka, चूतांश्च mango, कुसुमानि flowers, अवचिन्वन्ती while plucking, चचार went about.

42_31.shloka: अनर्हाऽरण्यवासस्य सा तं रत्नमयं मृगम्।।3.42.32।।मुक्तामणि विचित्राङ्गं ददर्श परमाङ्गना।
42_31.translation: The great lady Sita, unworthy of dwelling in the forest, saw the wonderful deer decked with gems, with  spots of pearls all over the body.
42_31.word_by_word: अरण्यवासस्य of living in the forest, अनर्हा unworthy, सा that, परमाङ्गना great woman, रत्नमयम् encrusted with gold, मुक्तामणिविचित्राङ्गम् with a wonderful body dotted with pearls and gems, तं मृगम् that deer, ददर्श saw.

42_32.translation: A lady with beautiful teeth and lips, Sita saw the deer having silver and mineral coloured hair on the body. She gazed at the animal with wonder and joy and love.
42_32.word_by_word: रुचिरदन्तोष्ठी a lady of beautiful teeth and lips, सा that Sita, रूप्यधातुतनूरुहम् animal with silver and mineral coloured hair on the body, तम् deer, विस्मयोत्फुल्लनयना with eyes of wonder and joy, सस्नेहम् with affection, समुदैक्षत gazed at.

42_33.shloka: स च तां रामदयितां पश्यन्मायामयो मृगः।।3.42.34।।विचचार पुनश्चित्रं दीपयन्निव तद्वनम्।
42_33.translation: That illusory deer saw Rama's wife and moved around wonderfully as if illuminating the forest with his radiance.
42_33.word_by_word: मायामयः illusory one, सः that, मृगश्च the deer, तां her, रामदयिताम् Rama's wife, पश्यन् on seeing, तत् वनम् that forest, दीपयन्निव as if illuminating, पुनः again, चित्रम् wonderfully, विचचार moved around.

42_34.shloka: अदृष्टपूर्वं तं दृष्ट्वा नानारत्नमयं मृगम्।।3.42.35।।विस्मयं परमं सीता जगाम जनकात्मजा।
