42_34.translation: Seeing such  an unprecedented deer decorated with different gems, Sita, daughter of Janaka, stood amazed.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
42_34.word_by_word: अदृष्टपूर्वम् never seen before, नानारत्नमयम् decorated with different gems, तं मृगम् that deer, दृष्ट्वा seeing, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, सीता Sita, परमम् very much, विस्मयम् surprised, जगाम experienced.

43_1.shloka: [Sita pleads with Rama and Lakshmana to get the deer-- Lakshmana says it is the magic of Maricha-- Rama asks Lakshmana to take care of Sita and proceeds to catch the deer.]सा तं सम्प्रेक्ष्य सुश्रोणी कुसुमान्यपचिन्वती।हेमराजतवर्णाभ्यां पार्श्वाभ्यामुपशोभितम्।।3.43.1।।प्रहृष्टा चानवद्याङ्गी मृष्टहाटकवर्णिनी।भर्तारमपि चक्रन्द लक्ष्मणं चापि सायुधम्।।3.43.2।।
43_1.translation: Sita while plucking flowers Sita who had fine hips, flawless beautiful limbs and pure golden complexion felt delighted to see the deer with gold and silver colours on both sides of his body. She called out to Rama and Lakshmana who were equipped with arms.
43_1.word_by_word: सुश्रोणी with fine hips, अनवद्याङ्गी a lady of flawless beautiful limbs, मृष्टहाटकवर्णिनी of pure golden complexion, कुसुमानि flowers, अपचिन्वती while picking, सा she, हेमराजतवर्णाभ्याम् with gold and silver colour, पार्श्वाभ्याम् on both sides of the body, उपशोभितम् looking beautiful, तम् that animal, सम्प्रेक्ष्य after seeing, प्रहृष्टा delighted, भर्तारमपि husband and, सायुधम् with arms, लक्ष्मणं चापि Lakshmana too, चक्रन्द cried out.

43_2.shloka: तयाऽऽहूतौ नरव्याघ्रौ वैदेह्या रामलक्ष्मणौ।वीक्षमाणौ तु तौ देशं तदा ददृशतुर्मृगम्।।3.43.3।।
43_2.translation: When Sita called Rama and Lakshmana, the two tigers among men, they looked around and saw the deer.
43_2.word_by_word: तया by her, वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, आहूतौ called, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, (तं) देशम् that place, वीक्षमाणौ while glancing, तदा then, मृगम् deer, ददृशतुः saw.

43_3.shloka: शङ्कमानस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणो राममब्रवीत्।तमेवैनमहं मन्ये मारीचं राक्षसं मृगम्।।3.43.4।।
43_3.translation: Seeing the deer, Lakshmana suspected him to be Maricha and said this to Rama.
43_3.word_by_word: तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, शङ्कमानः  suspected, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, रामम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said, अहम् I, एनम् him, मृगम् deer, तम् him,  मारीचमेव Maricha only, मन्ये I think.

43_4.shloka: चरन्तोमृगयां हृष्टाः पापेनोपाधिना वने।अनेन निहता राजन् राजानः कामरूपिणा।।3.43.5।।
43_4.translation: Many kings, while on hunting expedition in the forest, have been deceitfully killed by malicious Maricha, who could assume any form at his free will.
43_4.word_by_word: राजन् O king, हृष्टाः happy, मृगयां चरन्तः while on hunting expedition, राजानः kings, कामरूपिणा assuming any form at his free will, अनेन by him, पापेन malicious, वने in the forest, उपाधिना deceitfully, निहताः killed.

43_5.translation: O tiger among men, this deceitful demon (Maricha) has been transformed into the illusory form of a radiant deer which does not exist.
43_5.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र O tiger among men, मायाविदः deceitful one, अस्य his, भानुमत् radiant, गन्धर्वपुरसन्निभम् like the city of the gandharvas (which does not exist), इदम् this kind, मायामृगरूपम् form of an illusory deer, कृतम् has assumed

43_6.shloka: मृगो ह्येवंविधो रत्नविचित्रो नास्ति राघव।जगत्यां जगतीनाथ मायैषा हि न संशयः।।3.43.7।।
43_6.translation: O Rama, lord of the world nowhere on earth does exist this kind of wonderful deer sparkling with gems. That it is a mere trick, an illusion there is no doubt.
43_6.word_by_word: जगतीनाथ O lord of the world, राघव Rama, जगत्याम् in the world, रत्नविचित्रः one with  wonderful and sparkling gems, एवंविधः this kind of, मृगः deer, नास्ति हि does not exist, एषा this is, माया trick, संशयः doubt, न not,

43_7.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं काकुत्स्थं प्रतिवार्य शुचिस्मिता।उवाच सीता संहृष्टा चर्मणा हृतचेतना।।3.43.8।।
43_7.translation: Sita was too enchanted by the skin of the deer to retain her sense of discrimination. Intervening, she said to Rama joyfully with a pure smile on her face:
43_7.word_by_word: शुचिस्मिता a lady with a pure smile, चर्मणा by the beauty of the skin, हृतचेतना who lost her sense of descrimination, हृष्टा a joyful, सीता Sita, एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणम् saying, काकुत्स्थम् Rama, प्रतिवार्य  intervened, उवाच said.

43_8.shloka: आर्यपुत्राभिरामोऽसौ मृगो हरति मे मनः।आनयैनं महाबाहो क्रीडार्थं नो भविष्यति।।3.43.9।।
43_8.translation: O prince O longarmed one, this deer has captivated my mind. Fetch him for  me.This  will be our playmate.
43_8.word_by_word: आर्यपुत्र O prince, अभिरामः attractive, असौ this, मृगः deer, मे to me, मनः mind, हरति captivating, महाबाहो O longarmed Rama, एनम् this animal, आनय bring, नः our, क्रीडार्थम् playmate, भविष्यति will be.

43_9.translation: Here at the hermitage there are many lovely deer, yaks and antelopes wandering in herds.
43_9.word_by_word: अस्माकम् for us, इह here, आश्रमपदे at the hermitage, पुण्यदर्शनाः piouslooking, बहवः many, मृगाः deer, सृमराः antelopes, तथा similarly, चमराः yaks, सहिताः in herds, चरन्ति wandering.

43_10.shloka: ऋक्षाः पृषतसङ्घाश्च वानराः किन्नरास्तथा।विचरन्ति महाबाहो रुपश्रेष्ठा मनोहराः।।3.43.11।।
43_10.translation: O longarmed one, most beautiful animals like bears, antelopes and groups of monkeys and kinneras are wandering here.
43_10.word_by_word: महाबाहो O longarmed one, रूपश्रेष्ठाः best of forms, मनोहराः enchanting, ऋक्षाः bear, पृषतसङ्घाश्च herds of spotted antelopes, वानराः monkeys, तथा similarly, किन्नराः kinneras, विचरन्ति wander about.

43_11.shloka: न चास्य सदृशो राजन्दृष्टपूर्वो मृगो मया।तेजसा क्षमया दीप्त्या यथाऽयं मृगसत्तमः।।3.43.12।।
43_11.translation: O prince  this kind of beautiful, tame and glittering deer I have never seen before.
43_11.word_by_word: राजन् O Prince, अयम् this, मृगसत्तमः great deer, यथा as, तेजसा by lustre, क्षमया by forbearance, दीप्त्या by glitter, अस्य his, सदृशः equal, मृगः animal, मया by me, न दृष्टपूर्वः never seen before.

43_12.translation: Its body glittering with different colours, speckled with gems of different kinds, is like the Moon shining and illuminating the forest.
43_12.word_by_word: नानावर्णविचित्राङ्गः one whose body is glittering with different colours, रत्नबिन्दुसमाचितः speckled with gems of different kinds, शशिसन्निभः like the Moon, अव्यग्रम् cool, वनम् forest, द्योतयन् while illuminating, शोभते shining.

43_13.shloka: अहो रूपमहो लक्ष्मीस्स्वरसम्पच्च शोभना।मृगोऽद्भुतो विचित्राङ्गो हृदयं हरतीव मे।।3.43.14।।
43_13.translation: Oh what a beauty, Oh what rich call  what delightful, wonderful, graceful limbs  This deer captivates my heart.
43_13.word_by_word: रूपम् form, अहो Oh, लक्ष्मीः beauty, अहो Oh, स्वरसम्पच्च rich call, शोभना is  delightful, अद्भुतः wonderful, विचित्राङ्गः graceful limbs, मृगः deer, मे to me, हृदयम् heart, हरतीव as if captivating.

43_14.shloka: यदि ग्रहणमभ्येति जीवन्नेव मृगस्तव।आश्चर्यभूतं भवति विस्मयं जनयिष्यति।।3.43.15।।
43_14.translation: If this deer can be caught  alive, it will be thrilling, it will work wonders.
43_14.word_by_word: मृगः deer, जीवन्नेव alive, तव your, ग्रहणम् caught, अभ्येति यदि if it can be obtained, आश्चर्यभूतम् thrilling, भवति will be, विस्मयम् wonder, जनयिष्यति will create.

43_15.shloka: समाप्तवनवासानां राज्यस्थानां च नः पुनः।अन्तःपुरविभूषार्थो मृग एष भविष्यति।।3.43.16।।
43_15.translation: After the completion  of exile in the forest, when we are back in the kingdom, this deer will add beauty to the harem.
43_15.word_by_word: एषः this, मृगः deer, समाप्तवनवासानाम् after the completion of exile in the forest, पुनः again, राज्यस्थानाम् and established in the kingdom, नः for us, अन्तःपुरविभूषार्थः add beauty to the  harem, भविष्यति will be.

43_16.shloka: भरतस्यार्यपुत्रस्य श्वश्रूणां मम च प्रभो।मृगरूपमिदं व्यक्तं विस्मयं जनयिष्यति।।3.43.17।।
43_16.translation: O king this deer will create amazement in Bharata, in mothersinlaw, in you and in me as well.
43_16.word_by_word: प्रभो O king, इदम् this, मृगरूपम् this form of a deer, भरतस्य to Bharata, आर्यपुत्रस्य for you, श्वश्रूणाम् for mothersinlaw, मम च to me, व्यक्तम् certainly, विस्मयम् wonder, जनयिष्यति will generate.

43_17.shloka: जीवन्न यदि तेऽभ्येति ग्रहणं मृगसत्तमः।अजिनं नरशार्दूल रुचिरं मे भविष्यति।।3.43.18।।
43_17.translation: O best among men, if this great deer cannot be captured alive, I will wear its beautiful skin.
43_17.word_by_word: नरशार्दूल O tiger among men, मृगसत्तमः great deer, जीवन् with life, ते to you, ग्रहणम् catch, न not, अभ्येति यदि can be caught, मे for me, रुचिरम् this beautiful, अजिनम् skin, भविष्यति will be.

43_18.translation: If this animal is killed and its golden skin is spread on a tender grass cushion, there will I like to sit.
43_18.word_by_word: शष्पबृस्यां on a cushion of tender grass, विनीतायाम् it spread, निहतस्य if killed, अस्य सत्त्वस्य this animal's, जाम्बूनदमयत्वचि its golden skin, अहम् I, उपासितुम् to sit, इच्छामि desire.

43_19.shloka: कामवृत्तमिदं रौद्रं स्त्रीणामसदृशं मतम्।वपुषा त्वस्य सत्त्वस्य विस्मयो जनितो मम।।3.43.20।।
43_19.translation: This kind of request arising out of a woman's desire may sound terrible, still then the beauty of this animal's skin has produced in me a wonder.
43_19.word_by_word: रौद्रम् terrible, इदम् this, कामवृत्तम्  arising out of desire, स्त्रीणाम् for a woman, असदृशम् not desirable, मतम्  opinion, तु you, अस्य even so, सत्त्वस्य  this animal's, वपुषा beauty of skin, मम me, विस्मयः amazing, जनितः creating.

43_20.shloka: तेन काञ्चनवर्णेन मणिप्रवरशृङ्गिणा।तरुणादित्यवर्णेन नक्षत्रपथवर्चसा।।3.43.21।।बभूव राघवस्यापि मनो विस्मयमागतम्।
43_20.translation: By his golden colour resembling the rising Sun, by  his horns with excellent gems shining like the milkyway, even Rama's mind was wonderstruck.
43_20.word_by_word: काञ्चनवर्णेन by its golden colour, मणिप्रवरशृङ्गिणा horned with excellent gems, तरुणादित्यवर्णेन by its colour resembling the rising Sun, नक्षत्रपथवर्चसा by shining like the milkyway, तेन by, राघवस्य of Rama, मनः अपि mind also, विस्मयम् amazement, आगतम् arose.

43_21.shloka: एवं सीतावचः श्रुत्वा तं दृष्ट्वा मृगमद्भुतम्।।3.43.22।।लोभितस्तेन रूपेण सीतया च प्रचोदितः।उवाच राघवो हृष्टो भ्रातरं लक्ष्मणं वचः।।3.43.23।।
43_21.translation: On hearing Sita's words and seeing the wonderful deer, Rama was tempted by its appearance.Prompted by Sita,he joyfully said this to Lakshmana:
43_21.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, एवम् in that manner, सीतावचः Sita's words, श्रुत्वा listening, अद्भुतम् wonderful, तं मृगम् that deer, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, तेन रूपेण by its appearance, लोभितः tempted, सीतया च by Sita, प्रचोदितः prompted, हृष्टः gladly, भ्रातरम् brother, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, वचः words, उवाच said.

43_22.shloka: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्याः स्पृहां मृगगतामिमाम्।रूपश्रेष्ठतया ह्येष मृगोऽद्य न भविष्यति।।3.43.24।।न वने नन्दनोद्धेशे न चैत्ररथसंश्रये।कुतःपृथिव्यां सौमित्रे योऽस्य कश्चित्समो मृगः।।3.43.25।।
43_22.translation: O Lakshmana, see the eagerness of Sita. Such a deer of exceptional beauty will not be found in this forest. There is no equal to this animal even in the Nandan garden of Indra, or the Chaitraratha, the garden of Kubera. Where can such an animal be found on earth?
43_22.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, वैदेह्याः Sita's, मृगगताम् pertaining to this deer, स्पृहाम् desire, पश्य  you may see, सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अद्य now, रूपश्रेष्ठतया due to its excellent beauty, एषः this, मृगः deer, वने in the forest, न भविष्यति will not be found, नन्दनोद्धेशे in the Nandana garden of Indra, न not, चैत्ररथसंश्रये in Chaitraratha,( garden of Kubera), न not, यः any such, अस्य its, समः equal, पृथिव्याम् on the earth, कुतः where do (we find).

43_23.shloka: प्रतिलोमानुलोमाश्च रुचिरा रोमराजयः।शोभन्ते मृगमाश्रित्य चित्राः कनकबिन्दवः।।3.43.26।।
43_23.translation: The stretches of hair on the deer's body bent both in the natural order and in the opposite direction look beautiful. The spots of gold on the skin are wonderful.
43_23.word_by_word: प्रतिलोमानुलोमाः च hair bent in the opposite direction and hair bent in the natural order, रुचिराः beautiful, कनकबिन्दवः golden spots, चित्राः beautiful, रोमराजयः the stretches of hair on the body, मृगम् the deer, आश्रित्य resorting to, शोभन्ते are looking delightful.

43_24.shloka: पश्यास्य जृम्भमाणस्य दीप्तामग्निशिखोपमाम्।जिह्वां मुखान्निस्सरन्तीं मेघादिव शतह्रदाम्।।3.43.27।।
43_24.translation: Look at his tongue stretched out of the mouth while yawning. It is glowing like flaming fire. It is like the lightning sparkling in the cloud.
43_24.word_by_word: जृम्भमाणस्य while it is yawning, अस्य its, मुखात् from the mouth, निस्सरन्तीम् stretching, दीप्ताम् glowing, अग्निशिखोपमाम् like flaming fires, मेघात् from the cloud, शतह्रदाम् इव like thelightning, जिह्वाम् tongue, पश्य see.

43_25.translation: His face is a drinking pot of emerald, the belly is a conch or a pearl. Whose mind will not be attracted by this indescribable beauty ?
43_25.word_by_word: मसारगल्लर्कमुखः face like a drinking pot made of emerald, शङ्खमुक्तानिभोदरः belly like conch or pearl, अभिरूप्यः indescribable, असौ मृगः this deer, कस्य नाम whose, मनः mind, न लोभयेत् not be attracted.

43_26.shloka: कस्य रूपमिदं दृष्ट्वा जाम्बूनद मयप्रभम्।नानारत्नमयं दिव्यं न मनो विस्मयं व्रजेत्।।3.43.29।।
43_26.translation: Whose mind will not be filled with wonder on seeing this divine beauty glittering like lustrous gold and studded with a variety of gems ?
43_26.word_by_word: जाम्बूनदमयप्रभम् glittering like the lustre of gold, नानारत्नमयम् adorned with a variety of gems, दिव्यम् divine, इदम् this, रूपम् beauty, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कस्य whose, मनः heart, विस्मयम् wonder, न व्रजेत् not attain.

43_27.shloka: मांसहेतोरपि मृगान्विनोदार्थं च धन्वनः।घ्नन्ति लक्ष्मण राजानो मृगयायां महावने।।3.43.30।।
43_27.translation: O Lakshmana kings who wield  bows  in hunting expeditions kill deer in the forest forsport as well as for venison.
43_27.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राजानः king, महावने in a great forest, मृगयायाम् in hunting expedition, मांसहेतोः for meat, धन्वनः archers, विनोदार्थम् for sporting, मृगान् deer, घ्नन्ति will kill.

43_28.shloka: धनानि व्यवसायेन विचीयन्ते महावने।धातवो विविधाश्चापि मणिरत्नसुवर्णिनः।।3.43.31।।
43_28.translation: From huge forests a variety of mineral wealth consisting of gems, stones and gold are collected with great effort.
43_28.word_by_word: महावने in the huge forest, व्यवसायेन with great effort, धनानि wealth, मणिरत्नसुवर्णिनः gems and gold etc, विविधाः of variety , धातवः precious minerals, विचीयन्ते will be collected.

43_29.shloka: तत्सारमखिलं नृ़णां धनं निचयवर्धनम्।मनसा चिन्तितं सर्वं यथा शुक्रस्य लक्ष्मण।।3.43.32।।
43_29.translation: O Lakshmana the essence of forest wealth is mineral wealth, which helps the growth of the treasury. It is conceived mentally as in the case of Venus.
43_29.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अखिलम् all, तत् all that, सारम् essence, धनम् wealth, नृ़णाम् of men, मनसा in the mind, चिन्तितम् thought over, सर्वम् all, शुक्रस्य यथा like Venus (Venus controls prosperity leading to procreation), निचयवर्धनम् growth of treasure.

43_30.translation: A materialist moves about thoughtlessly for making money. Economists call it material wealth.
43_30.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अर्थी materialist, येन by whichever, अर्थकृत्येन  done for material wealth, अविचारयन् without thinking, संव्रजति moves about, तम् that, अर्थशास्त्रज्ञाः economists, अर्थ्याः scientists, अर्थम् material, प्राहुः called.

43_31.shloka: एतस्य मृगरत्नस्य परार्ध्ये काञ्चनत्वचि।उपवेक्ष्यति वैदेही मया सह सुमध्यमा।।3.43.34।।
43_31.word_by_word: सुमध्यमा a lady of slender waist, वैदेही Vaidehi, एतस्य of this, मृगरत्नस्य of the gem of a deer, परार्ध्ये in an excellent, काञ्चनत्वचि in a golden skin, मया सह with me also, उपवेक्ष्यति  will sit.

43_32.shloka: न कादली न प्रियकी न प्रवेणी न चाविकी।भवेदेतस्य सदृशी स्पर्शनेनेति मे मतिः।।3.43.35।।
43_32.translation: The skins of various types of deer like Priyaki, Kadali or goats or sheep cannot be compared in softness to the skin of this deer.
43_32.word_by_word: स्पर्शनेन by touch, कादली blackstriped antelope, एतस्य of this, सदृशी comparable, न भवेत् will be there, प्रियकी goat's, न or even, प्रवेणी a hairy one, न not, आविकी च of a sheep, न not, इति like this, मे I, मतिः I think.

43_33.shloka: एष चैव मृगश्श्रीमान् यश्च दिव्यो नभश्चरः।उभावेतौ मृगौ दिव्यौ तारामृगमहीमृगौ।।3.43.36।।
43_33.translation: This majestic deer and the deer flying in heaven (the deer's figure seen in the Moon called Mrgasira)  both the deer of the star in the sky and the deer of the earth are divine.
43_33.word_by_word: श्रीमान् majestic, एषः this one, मृगश्चैव that deer too, नभश्चरः flying in the sky, यश्च whoever, दिव्यः divine, दिव्यौ both are divine, एतौ these two, तारामृगमहीमृगौ deer of the stars and deer of the earth, उभौ both, मृगौ deer.

43_34.shloka: यदि वाऽयं तथा यन्मां भवेद्वदसि लक्ष्मण।मायैषा राक्षसस्येति कर्तव्योस्य वधो मया।।3.43.37।।
43_34.translation: Lakshmana, as you say, if it is the illusion of a demon, even then it should be killed by me.
43_34.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, एषा this, राक्षसस्य of a demon, माया an illusion, इति thus, माम् me, यत् which, वदसि you say, तथा so also, अयम् surely, भवेद्यदि if it is, वा or, मया by me, अस्य his, वधः death, कर्तव्यः should be done.

43_35.shloka: एतेन हि नृशंसेन मारीचेनाकृतात्मना।वने विचरता पूर्वं हिंसिता मुनिपुङ्गवाः।।3.43.38।।
43_35.translation: The great sages were tortured and killed earlier by this cruel, evilminded Maricha while wandering in the forest.
43_35.word_by_word: नृशंसेन by  cruel, अकृतात्मना by evilminded, वने in the forest, विचरता while wandering, एतेन by him, मारीचेन Maricha, पूर्वम् earlier, मुनिपुङ्गवाः great sages, हिंसिताः are harassed.

43_36.shloka: उत्थाय बहवो येन मृगयायां जनाधिपाः।निहताः परमेष्वासास्तस्माद्वध्यस्त्वयं मृगः।।3.43.39।।
43_36.translation: Many kings who were great archers who set out on hunting expedition were killed by him. Therefore, this animal deserves to be killed.
43_36.word_by_word: येन since, उत्थाय after rising, मृगयायाम् during hunting expedition, बहवः many, परमेष्वासाः great archers, जनाधिपाः kings, निहताः killed, तस्मात् therefore, मृगः deer, वध्यः तु should be killed.

43_37.translation: Earlier in this forest, Vatapi used to humiliate the ascetic brahmins and to kill them by entering into their stomach like a womb killing the female mule.
43_37.word_by_word: पुरस्तात् earlier, इह here, वातापिः Vatapi, तपस्विनः ascetics, परिभूय defeating, उदरस्थः   stationed in the stomach, अश्वतरीम् female mule, स्वगर्भः इव as its own womb, द्विजान् brahmins, हन्ति killed.

43_38.shloka: स कदाचिच्चिराल्लोभादाससाद महामुनिम्।अगस्त्यं तेजसा युक्तं भक्षस्तस्य बभूव ह।।3.43.41।।
43_38.translation: That Vatapi after a long time, once greedily entered into the stomach of the great lustrous sage Agastya and became his food.
43_38.word_by_word: सः that Vatapi, चिरात् after a long time, कदाचित् once, लोभात् greedily, तेजसा by prowess, युक्तम् one endowed, महामुनिम् great sage, अगस्त्यम् Agasthya, आससाद reached, तस्य his, भक्षः food, बभूव ह became.

43_39.shloka: समुत्थाने व तद्रूपं कर्तुकामं समीक्ष्य तम्।उत्स्मयित्वा तु भगवान्वातापिमिदमब्रवीत्।।3.43.42।।
43_39.translation: When the venerable sage Agastya got up (after eating), he observed Vatapi wishing to turn into his real form. So smiling at him, he said:
43_39.word_by_word: समुत्थाने  when he rose, तत् that, रूपम् form, कर्तुकामम् to turn into real form, तम् him, वातापिम् Vatapi, समीक्ष्य after  seeing, भगवान् venerable sage, उत्स्मयित्वा by smiling at him, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

43_40.shloka: त्वयाऽविगण्य वातापे परिभूतास्स्वतेजसा।जीवलोके द्विजश्रेष्ठास्तस्मादसि जरां गतः।।3.43.43।।
43_40.translation: 'O Vatapi you killed the best of brahmins living in this world, disregarding them because of your power. Hence you were digested by me.'
43_40.word_by_word: वातापे O Vatapi, जीवलेके  in the world of living beings, द्विजश्रेष्ठाः best of brahmins, त्वया by you, अविगण्य disregarding, स्वतेजसा with your power, परिभूताः are insulted, तस्मात् onaccount of that, जरां गतः got digested, असि you are.

43_41.shloka: तदेवं न भवेद्रक्षोवातापिरिव लक्ष्मण।मद्विधं योऽतिमन्येत धर्मनित्यं जितेन्द्रियम्।।3.43.44।।भवेद्धतोऽयं वातापिरगस्त्येनेव मां गतः।
43_41.translation: O Lakshmana just like Vatapi, this demon will not live. Whoever violates a person of my kind who is ever righteous and selfcontrolled will be killed
43_41.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, वातापिरिव just as Vatapi, तत् that, रक्षः demon, न भवेत् not live, यः who, धर्मनित्यम् always righteous, जितेन्द्रियम् senses controlled , मद्विधम् my kind, अतिमन्येत whoever violates, अयम् this, मां me, गतः gone, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, वातापिरिव like Vatapi, हतः be killed,  भवेत् will be.

43_42.shloka: इह त्वं भव सन्नद्दो यन्त्रितो रक्ष मैथिलीम्।।3.43.45।।अस्यामायत्तमस्माकं यत्कृत्यं रघुनन्दन।
43_42.translation: O Lakshmana, delight of the Raghu dynasty, be very alert and restrained and protect Sita. Whatever duty we have to perform depends on her protection.
43_42.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghu dynasty, त्वम् you, इह here, सन्नद्धः be ready, भव your, यन्त्रितः  very alert, मैथिलीम् Maithili, रक्ष  protect, अस्माकम् for us, यत् whatever, कृत्यम् is the task, अस्याम् in her, आयत्तम् is dependent.

43_43.shloka: अहमेनं वधिष्यामि ग्रहीष्याम्यपि वा मृगम्।।3.43.46।।यावद्गच्छामि सौमित्रे मृगमानयितुं द्रुतम्।
43_43.translation: O Lakshmana I will go quickly and either kill the deer or catch it.  Now let me go.
43_43.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, अहम् I, एनम् him, मृगम् deer, वधिष्यामि will kill, अपि वा or else, ग्रहीष्यामिwill catch, मृगम् the deer, आनयितुम् to bring, द्रुतम् quickly, यावद्गच्छामि I will go to get the deer.

43_44.shloka: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेहीं मृगत्वचि गतस्पृहाम्।।3.43.47।।त्वचा प्रधानया ह्येष मृगोऽद्य न भविष्यति।
43_44.translation: See, how Vaidehi ardently longs for the skin of this deer  I will not let the animal live, O Lakshmana
43_44.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मृगत्वचि at this deerskin, गतस्पृहाम् desire is fixed, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, पश्य see, प्रधानया ardently, त्वचा by his skin, एषः मृगः of this deer, अद्य now, न भविष्यति will not live.

43_45.shloka: अप्रमत्तेन ते भाव्यमाश्रमस्थेन सीतया।।3.43.48।।यावत्पृषतमेकेन सायकेन निहन्म्यहम्।हत्वैतच्चर्म चादाय शीघ्रमेष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.43.49।।
43_45.translation: Keep vigil over Sita at the hermitage, O Lakshmana  I will certainly kill the speckled antelope with a single arrow, get his skin and come back quickly.
43_45.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, आश्रमस्थेन staying at the hermitage, ते by you, सीतया with Sita, अप्रमत्तेन   vigilant, भाव्यम् should be, पृषतम् speckled antelope, एकेन by only one, बाणेन by arrow, अहम् I, यावत् by the time, निहन्मि I will kill, हत्वा after killing, एतच्चर्म his skin, आदाय getting, शीघ्रम् quickly, एष्यामि I will come.

43_46.shloka: प्रदक्षिणेनातिबलेन पक्षिणा जटायुषा बुद्धिमता च लक्ष्मण।भवाप्रमत्तः परिगृह्य मैथिलीं प्रतिक्षणं सर्वत एव शङ्कितः।।3.43.50।।
43_46.translation: O Lakshmana, be vigilant in guarding Sita, suspecting danger every moment from all directions. Take the help of Jatayu, the mighty and wise bird who will be on his rounds.इत्याषे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga in Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
43_46.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मैथिलीम् Sita, परिगृह्य  guarding her, प्रतिक्षणम् every moment, सर्वतः एवfrom all directions, शङ्कितः suspecting danger, प्रदक्षिणेन  going round, अतिबलेन by the  mighty, बुद्धिमता by wise, पक्षिणा by the bird, जटायुषा Jatayu, अप्रमत्तः vigilant, भव be.

44_1.shloka: [Rama chases the magic deer-- unable to catch, kills it -- gets stunned at the deer calling out Sita, Lakshmana imitating his voice--death of the deer--Rama returns to the hermitage.]तथा तु तं समादिश्य भ्रातरं रघुनन्दनः।बबन्धासिं महातेजा जाम्बूनदमयत्सरुम्।।3.44.1।।
44_1.translation: The brilliant Rama, delight of the Raghu dynasty, thus instructed his brother and fastened a sword with a golden handle to his waist.
44_1.word_by_word: महातेजाः brilliant, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu dynasty, भ्रातरम् brother, तम् to him, तथा in that way, समादिश्य  instructed, जाम्बूनदमयत्सरुम्  golden  handle , असिम् the sword, बबन्ध tied.

44_2.shloka: तत स्त्र्यवनतं चापमादायाऽत्मविभूषणम्।आबध्य च कलापौ द्वौ जगामोदग्रविक्रमः।।3.44.2।।
44_2.translation: A man of indomitable prowess, he took the bow with three curves that was like an ornament to him, tied two quivers at the back and left.
44_2.word_by_word: ततः then, उदग्रविक्रमः  of indomitable prowess, त्र्यवनतम् bent in three places, आत्मविभूषणम् an ornament to him, चापम् bow, आदाय  took, द्वौ both, कलापौ two quivers, आबद्ध्य tied at the back, जगाम went.

44_3.shloka: तं वञ्चयानो राजेन्द्रमापतन्तं निरीक्ष्यवै।बभूवान्तर्हितस्त्रासात्पुनस्सन्दर्शनेऽभवत्।।च3.44.3।।बद्धासिर्धनुरादाय प्रदुद्राव यतो मृगः।
44_3.translation: On seeing Rama approaching him, the deer disappeared due to fear and again came within sight. With his sword and the bow, Rama chased wherever the deer ran.
44_3.word_by_word: आपतन्तम् approaching, राजेन्द्रम् to the king, तम् him, निरीक्षय seeing, वञ्चयानः while deceiving, त्रासात् out of fear, अन्तर्हितः disappeared, बभूव became, पुनः again, सन्दर्शने within sight, अभवत् appeared, बद्धासिः held his sword, धनुः bow, आदाय lifting, मृगः deer, यतः wherever, प्रदुद्राव ran.

44_4.shloka: तं स्म पश्यति रूपेण द्योतमानमिवाग्रतः।।3.44.4।।अवेक्ष्यावेक्ष्य धावन्तं धनुष्पाणिर्महावने।अतिवृत्तमिषोः पाताल्लोभयानं कदाचन।।3.44.5।।शङ्कितन्तु समुद्भ्रान्तमुत्पतन्तमिवाम्बरे।दृश्यमानमदृश्यं च वनोद्देशेषु केषुचित्।।3.44.6।।छिन्नाभ्रैरिव संवीतं शारदं चन्द्रमण्डलम्।
44_4.translation: Rama, wielder of the bow, saw that splendid animal ahead of him. Holding the bow he saw the deer running away, bewldered into the great forest looking at him again and again. The deer was getting out of the range of his arrow, while it enticed him now and then. Suspecting that he might be caught,  the deer was, as though jumping into the sky. Now it came within sight and now out of sight in the huge forest. It looked like the autumnal moon surrounded by clouds. (The clouds muffle the Moon and reveal him now and then).
44_4.word_by_word: धनुष्पाणिः wielder of the bow (Rama), अवेक्ष्य  saw, महावने in the huge forest, धावन्तम्  running, तम् him, रूपेण form, अग्रतः in front, पश्यति स्म saw, कदाचन sometimes, इषोः  scared of the arrow, पातात् ran, अतिवृत्तम् went out of reach, लोभयानम् enticing, शङ्कितम् frightened, समुद्भ्रान्तम् bewildered, अम्बरे in the sky, उत्पतन्तमिव as if flying  up, छिन्नाभ्रैः by the scattered clouds, संवीतम् surrounded, शारदम् autumnal,चन्द्रमण्डलम् इव like the orb of the Moon, केषुचित् in certain places, वनोद्देशेषु in the forest tract, दृश्यमानम् came within sight, अदृश्यं च again disappeared.

44_5.shloka: मुहुर्तादेव ददृशे मुहुर्दूरात्प्रकाशते।।3.44.7।।दर्शनादर्शनादेवं सोऽपाकर्षत राघवम्।सुदूरमाश्रमस्यास्य मारीचो मृगतां गतः।।3.44.8।।
44_5.translation: Maricha, transformed into a deer, was seen now near, now faroff. He pulled Rama away from the hermitage through his exits and entrances.
44_5.word_by_word: मृगताम् in the form of a deer, गतः transformed, सः मारीचः that Maricha, मुहूर्तादेव for a moment, ददृशे was seen, मुहुः again, (मुहूर्तात् another moment), दूरात् at a distance, प्रकाशते appeared, एवं as, दर्शनादर्शनात् appearing and disappearing, राघवम् Rama, उपाकर्षत pulled away.

44_6.shloka: आसीत् क्रुद्धस्तु काकुत्स्थो विवशस्तेन मोहितः।अथावतस्थे संभ्रान्तश्चायामाश्रित्य शाद्वले।।3.44.9।।
44_6.translation: Deluded by that deer, Rama got tired, perplexed and angry. Then bewidered, he waited on a grassland under a shade.
44_6.word_by_word: तेन by that, मोहितः deluded, काकुत्स्थ:Rama, विवशः tired, क्रुद्धः in rage, आसीत्  was, अथ then, संभ्रान्तः perplexed, छायाम् shade, आश्रित्य seeking, शाद्वले on green grass, अवतस्थे waited.

44_7.shloka: स तमुन्मादयामास मृगरूपो निशाचरः।मृगैः परिवृतो वन्यैरदूरात्प्रत्यदृश्यत।।3.44.10।।
44_7.translation: That demon transformed himself into a deer and, surrounded by the animals of the forest at close range, attracted his attention.
44_7.word_by_word: मृगरूपः assuming the form of a deer, सः निशाचरः that demon, तम् him, उन्मादयामास excited, वन्यैः with forest, मृगैः animals, परिवृतः surrounded by, अदूरात् not very far from him, अदृश्यत was seen.

44_8.translation: Seeing Rama's  intention to catch him, the deer ran away once again out of fear and disappeared in a moment.
44_8.word_by_word: गृहीतुकामम् intending to catch him, एवम् in that way, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, पुनरेव  once again, अभ्यधावत ran, तत्क्षणादेव in a moment, पुनरेव again, त्रासात् out of fear, अन्तर्हितः disappeared, अभवत् became.

44_9.shloka: पुनरेव ततो दूराद्वृक्षषण्डाद्विनिस्सृतम्।दृष्ट्वा रामो महातेजास्तं हन्तुं कृतनिश्चयः।।3.44.12।।
44_9.translation: Resplendent Rama saw the deer coming out of a cluster of trees at a distance and determined to kill him.
44_9.word_by_word: ततः then, महातेजाः resplendent, रामः Rama , पुनरेव again, दूरात् from a distance, वृक्षषण्डात् from a group of trees, विनिस्सृतम् coming out, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा  saw, हन्तुम् to kill, कृतनिश्चयः determined .

44_10.shloka: भूयस्तु शरमुद्धृत्य कुपितस्तत्र राघवः।सूर्यरश्मिप्रतीकाशं ज्वलन्तमरिमर्दनः।।3.44.13।।सन्धाय सुदृढे चापे विकृष्य बलवद्बली।तमेव मृगमुद्दिश्य श्वसन्तमिव पन्नगम्।।3.44.14।।मुमोच ज्वलितं दीप्तमस्त्रं ब्रह्मविनिर्मितम्।
44_10.translation: Powerful Rama, destroyer of foes, lifted in a rage his arrow blazing like the light of  the Sun, strung it to his sturdy bow and drew it with all his force. He then aimed at the deer and released the shining  arrow created by Brahma which went hissing like a  serpent.
44_10.word_by_word: तत्र there, भूयः again, कुपितः enraged, अरिमर्दनः destroyer of foes, बली powerful,राघवः Rama, सूर्यरश्मिप्रतीकाशम् glowing like the rays of the Sun, ज्वलन्तम् blazing, शरम् dart, उद्धृत्यlifting, सुदृढे in a sturdy, चापे in bow, सन्धाय  aiming, बलवत् with force, विकृष्य drew, श्वसन्तम् sighing, पन्नगम् इव like the serpent, ज्वलितम् burning, दीप्तम् shining, ब्रह्मनिर्मितम् created by Brahma, अस्त्रम् weapon, तम् him, मृगमेव on the deer, उद्दिश्य aiming, मुमोच released.

44_11.shloka: शरीरं मृगरूपस्य विनिर्भिद्य शरोत्तमः।।3.44.15।।मारीचस्यैव हृदयं बिभेदाशनिसन्निभः।
44_11.translation: The great arrow which was like a thunderbolt first pierced into the body of Maricha who had assumed the form of a deer and then tore his heart.
44_11.word_by_word: आशनिसन्निभः  like thunderbolt, शरोत्तमः the great arrow, मृगरूपस्य  assuming deer form, शरीरम् body, विनिर्भिद्य  pierced, मारीचस्य Maricha's, हृदयमेव heart, बिभेद tore.

44_12.translation: And, hurt by the dart, Maricha roared frighteningly, leaped as high as a  palm tree  and dropped down on earth almost dead.
44_12.word_by_word: अथ and then, सः Maricha, शरातुरः hurt by the dart, अल्पजीवितः very little life left, भैरवं नादम् frightening sound, विनदन् released, तालमात्रम् to the height of a palm tree, उत्प्लुत्य leaped up, धरण्याम् on earth, न्यपतत् dropped.

44_13.shloka: म्रियमाणस्तु मारीचो जहौ तां कृत्रिमां तनुम्।।3.44.17।।स्मृत्वा तद्वचनं रक्षो दध्यौ केन तु लक्ष्मणम्।इह प्रस्थापयेत्सीता शून्ये तां रावणो हरेत्।।3.44.18।।
44_13.translation: Maricha gave up his false form of the deer and before breathing his last, remembered the words of Ravana. He thought over the means through which Sita could send Lakshmana to this spot so that  Ravana would abduct her when she is alone.
44_13.word_by_word: मारीचः Maricha, म्रियमाणः breathing his last, कृत्रिमाम् artificial, ताम् that, तनुम् body, जहौ gave up, रक्षः the demon, तद्वचनम् those words, स्मृत्वा remembering, दध्यौ thought, सीता Sita, केन by what means, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, इह here, प्रस्थापयेत् she may send, शून्ये  in seclusion, ताम् her, रावणः Ravana, हरेत् will abduct.

44_14.shloka: स प्राप्तकालमाज्ञाय चकार च तत स्वनम्।सदृशं राघवस्येह हा सीते लक्ष्मणेति च।।3.44.19।।
44_14.translation: Then Maricha realised that the appropriate time had come. In a voice similar to Rama's, he shouted loudly 'Alas Sita, Alas Lakshmana '
44_14.word_by_word: ततः then, सः Maricha, प्राप्तकालम् the right time, आज्ञाय having realised, राघवस्य Rama's, सदृशम् similar, हा सीते Alas, Sita, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, इति च like that, स्वनम् a sound, चकार  released.

44_15.shloka: तेन मर्मणि निर्विद्धं शरेणानुपमेन हि।मृगरूपं तु तत्त्यक्त्वा राक्षसं रूपमास्थितः।।3.44.20।।चक्रे स सुमहाकायं मारीचो जीवितं त्यजन्।
44_15.translation: Struck in the vital part by Rama's matchless dart, Maricha gave up the form of the deer and assumed his huge body of the demon.
44_15.word_by_word: सः मारीचः that, Maricha, तेन by that, अनुपमेन  matchless, शरेण by  the dart, मर्मणि in vital part, निर्विद्धम् struck, तत् then, मृगरूपम् form of a deer, त्वक्त्वा giving up, राक्षसं रूपम् form of a demon, आस्थितः assumed, जीवितम् life, त्यजन्  while giving up, सुमहाकायम् that huge body, चक्रे attained.

44_16.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ राक्षसं घोरदर्शनम्।।3.44.21।।रामो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गं चेष्टमानं महीतले।जगाम मनसा सीतां लक्ष्मणस्य वचस्स्मरन्।।3.44.22।।
44_16.translation: Seeing that terrific demon fallen on the ground, drenched in blood, and strring his limbs, Rama thought of Lakshmana's words and reached Sita mentally (thought of her).
44_16.word_by_word: रामः Rama, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen down, घोरदर्शनम्  terrific figure, रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गम् drenched in blood, महीतले on the ground, चेष्टमानम् moving his limbs, तं राक्षसम् that demon, दृष्ट्वा seen, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वचः words, स्मरन् remembered, मनसा by his mind, सीताम् Sita, जगाम went.

44_17.shloka: मारीचस्य तु मायैषा पूर्वोक्तं लक्ष्मणेन तु।तत्तथा ह्यभवच्चाद्य मारीचोऽयं मया हतः।।3.44.23।।
44_17.translation: This is an illusion created by Maricha. It happened exactly the way Lakshmana had said earlier. Maricha is now killed.
44_17.word_by_word: एषा this way, मारीचस्य Maricha's, माया magic, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, पूर्वोक्तम् told earlier, तत् that, तथा in the same way, अभवत् हि it happened, मया by me, हतः killed, अयम् that, मारीचः Maricha.

44_18.shloka: हा सीते लक्ष्मणेत्येवमाक्रुश्य च महास्वरम्।ममार राक्षसस्सोऽयं श्रुत्वा सीता कथं भवेत्।।3.44.24।।लक्ष्मणश्च महाबाहुः कामवस्थां गमिष्यति।इति सञ्चिन्त्य धर्मात्मा रामो हृष्टतनूरुहः।।3.44.25।।
44_18.translation: This demon Maricha screamed aloud saying, 'Alas, Sita, Alas, Lakshmana'. He is now dead. How would Sita react to this voice? What would be the condition of Lakshmana? While righteous Rama reflected on this, his hair stood on end.
44_18.word_by_word: सः he, Maricha, अयं राक्षसः this demon, हा सीते Alas, Sita, लक्ष्मण (Alas,) Lakshmana,इत्येवम् in this manner, महास्वरम् loudly, आक्रुश्य  screamed, ममार died, श्रुत्वा heard, सीता Sita, कथम् how, भवेत् will she be, महाबाहुः long armed, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana too, काम् what, अवस्थाम् situation, गमिष्यति will reach, धर्मात्मा righteous , रामः Rama, इति like this, सञ्चिन्त्य on thinking, हृष्टतनूरूहः his hair stood on end.

44_19.shloka: तत्र रामं भयं तीव्रमाविवेश विषादजम्।राक्षसं मृगरूपं तं हत्वा श्रुत्वा च तत्स्वरम्।।3.44.26।।
44_19.translation: After killing the demon in the figure of a deer and hearing his voice, Rama was overtaken by intense fear born of despair.
44_19.word_by_word: मृगरूपम् in the form of a deer, राक्षसम् demon, हत्वा having killed, तत्स्वरम् that sound, श्रुत्वा च having heard, तत्र there, रामम् Rama, विषादजम् born of sadness, तीव्रम् intense, भयम् fear, आविवेश came over.

44_20.shloka: निहत्य पृषतं चान्यं मांसमादाय राघवः।त्वरमाणो जनस्थानं ससाराभिमुखस्तदा।।3.44.27।।
44_20.translation: Then Rama killed another deer, collected the venison and hastened to Janasthana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
44_20.word_by_word: तदा then, राघवः Rama, अन्यम् another, पृषतम् deer, निहत्य having killed, मांसम् venison, आदाय  collected, त्वरमाणः quickly, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, अभिमुखः towards, ससार departed.

45_1.shloka: [There at the hermitage Sita asks Lakshmana to rush to Rama's help Lakshmana resists, stating Rama needs no help--Sita lashes at Lakshmana in harsh words.]आर्तस्वरं तु तं भर्तुर्विज्ञाय सदृशं वने।उवाच लक्ष्मणं सीता गच्छ जीनीहि राघवम्।।3.45.1।।
45_1.translation: On hearing the voice in distress and recognising that it was similar to her husband's voice, Sita said to Lakshmana, 'Go and find out Rama's whereabouts'.
45_1.word_by_word: सीता Sita, वने in the forest, भर्तुः husband, सदृशम् similar, तम् that, आर्तस्वरम् voice in distress, विज्ञाय knowing, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, उवाच said, गच्छ go, राघवम् Rama, जानीहि know (what happened).

45_2.shloka: न हि मे हृदयं स्थाने जीवितं वाऽवतिष्ठति।क्रोशतः परमार्तस्य श्रुतश्शब्दो मया भृशम्।।3.45.2।।आक्रन्दमानं तु वने भ्रातरं त्रातुमर्हसि।
45_2.translation: I clearly heard Rama calling out in great distress. Indeed, my heart as well as my life is not in its place (restless). You ought to go and protect your brother who is crying in pain in the forest.
45_2.word_by_word: भृशम् greatly, क्रोशतः परमार्तस्य crying out in great distress, शब्द: voice, मया by me, श्रुतः heard, मे my, हृदयम् heart, जीवितं वा my life too, स्थाने in its place, न अवतिष्ठति is not resting, हि indeed, वने in the forest, आक्रन्दमानम् crying in pain, भ्रातरम् brother, त्रातुम् to protect, अर्हसि you ought to.

45_3.shloka: तं क्षिप्रमभिधाव त्वं भ्रातरं शरणैषिणम्।।3.45.3।।रक्षसां वशमापन्नं सिंहानामिव गोवृषम्।
45_3.translation: Like a bull caught by lions, your brother is seeking help caught by demons. You should run at once to your brother.
45_3.word_by_word: सिंहानाम् of the lions, गोवृषमिव like a bull, रक्षसाम् of demons, वशम् grip, आपन्नम् been under it, शरणैषिणम् seeking help, तं भ्रातरम् that brother, क्षिप्रम् quickly, त्वम् you, अभिधाव run.

45_4.shloka: न जगाम तथोक्तस्तु भ्रातुराज्ञाय शासनम्।।3.45.4।।तमुवाच ततस्तत्र कुपिता जनकात्मजा।
45_4.translation: When he did not budge in obedience to his brother's order (to protect Sita), the daughter of Janaka in a rage said :
45_4.word_by_word: तथा like that, उक्तस्तु though instructed , भ्रातुः brother's, शासनम् order, आज्ञाय knowing, न जगाम did not go, ततः then, कुपिता angry, जनकात्मजा Sita, तत्र there, तम् him, उवाच said.

45_5.shloka: सौमित्रे मित्ररूपेण भ्रातुस्त्वमसि शत्रुवत्।।3.45.5।।यस्त्वमस्यामवस्थायां भ्रातरं नाभिपत्स्यसे।
45_5.translation: Since you, O son of Sumitra,  are not reaching out to your brother in this situation, you are an enemy to your brother in the guise of a friend৷৷
45_5.word_by_word: सौमित्रे son of Sumitra,( Lakshmana), यः who, त्वम् you, अस्याम् in this, अवस्थायाम् situation, भ्रातरम् your brother, नाभिपत्स्यसे not going to, त्वम् you, भ्रातुः to brother, मित्ररूपेण in the form of a friend, शत्रुवत् enemy, असि you are.

45_6.shloka: इच्छसि त्वं विनश्यन्तं रामं लक्ष्मण मत्कृते।।3.45.6।।लोभात्त्वं मत्कृते नूनं नानुगच्छसि राघवम्।
45_6.translation: It is possess me that you wish Rama's death. You do not rush to him certainly because of greed for me.
45_6.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, त्वम् you, रामम् Rama, विनश्यन्तम् being destroyed, मत्कृते for my sake, इच्छसि desirous, त्वम् you, मत्कृते for my sake, लोभात् out of greed, रामम् Rama, नानुगच्छसि you are not following him, नूनम्  surely.

45_7.shloka: व्यसनं ते प्रियं मन्ये स्नेहो भ्रातरिनास्तिते।।3.45.7।।तेन तिष्ठसि विश्रब्धंतमपश्यन्महाद्युतिम्।
45_7.translation: I think Rama's adversity is welcome to you. You do not have any love towards your brother. It is for this that you stand unconcerned instead of proceeding to help your brilliant brother.
45_7.word_by_word: ते to you, व्यसनम् distrees, प्रियम् dear, मन्ये I think, ते to you, भ्रातरि for your brother, स्नेहः love, नास्ति is not there, तेन by that, महाद्युतिम् brilliiant, तम् him, अपश्यन् not seen, विश्रब्धम्  confident, तिष्ठसि you are standing.

45_8.shloka: किं हि संशयमापन्ने तस्मिन्निह मया भवेत्।।3.45.8।।कर्तव्यमिह तिष्ठन्त्या यत्प्रधानस्त्वमागतः।
45_8.translation: When he for whose service you have primary come here, has met with difficulty, what is the use of your being here? What purpose you serve by staying here with me ?
45_8.word_by_word: त्वम् you, यत्प्रधानः इह primarily to serve Rama, आगतः came here, तस्मिन् when he , संशयम् in difficulty, आपन्ने has met with, इह here, तिष्ठन्त्या remaining, मया by me, किम् what, कर्तव्यम् duty भवेत् be.

45_9.translation: While Sita thus spoke, flooded with tears of sorrow, frightened like a doe, Lakshmana replied :
45_9.word_by_word: इति thus, ब्रुवाणाम् while speaking, बाष्पशोकपरिप्लुताम् flooded with tears of sorrow, त्रस्ताम् frightened lady, मृगवधूमिव like a female deer, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सीताम् Sita, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

45_10.translation: O Vaidehi there is no doubt that pannagas, asuras, gandharvas, gods, men or even demons cannot defeat him.
45_10.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, तव your, भर्ता husband, पन्नगासुरगन्धर्वदेवमानुषराक्षसैः pannagas, asuras, gandharvas, gods, men or even demons, जेतुम् to win, अशक्यः not possible, न संशयः there is no doubt.

45_11.shloka: देवि देवमनुष्येषु गन्धर्वेषु पतत्रिषु।।3.45.11।।राक्षसेषु पिशाचेषु किन्नरेषु मृगेषु च।दानवेषु च घोरेषु स न विद्येत शोभने।।3.45.12।।यो रामं प्रतियुध्येत समरे वासवोपमम्।
45_11.translation: O brilliant Devi  none  among gods or men, gandharvas, birds or goblins kinnaras, wild animals or dreadful demons can encounter Rama in war.
45_11.word_by_word: शोभने देवि O brilliant Devi, समरे वासवोपमम् like Indra in war, रामम् Rama, यः who, प्रतियुध्येत may encounter, देवमनुष्येषु among gods or men, गन्धर्वेषु among gandharvas, पतत्रिषु among birds, राक्षसेषु among demons, पिशाचेषु among goblins, किन्नरेषु even among kinnaras, मृगेषुच even animals, घोरेषु dreadful, दानवेषु demons, न विद्येत not found.

45_12.shloka: अवध्यस्समरे रामो नैवं त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि।।3.45.13।।न त्वामस्मिन्वने हातुमुत्सहे राघवं विना।
45_12.translation: Rama is indestructible in war. It is not proper for you to say what you said. When he is not here I do not wish to leave you alone here in the forest.
45_12.word_by_word: रामः Rama, समरे in war, अवध्यः indestructible, त्वम् you, एवम् in this way, वक्तुम् to speak,नार्हसि it is not proper, त्वाम् you, राघवं विना without Rama, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, हातुम् to leave alone, न उत्सहे I do not wish.

45_13.translation: He cannot be stopped by the strength of the mighty, or by Indra supported by gods or by the wellequipped armies of all the three worlds.
45_13.word_by_word: बलवताम् of strong people, बलैरपि even with all their strength, सेश्वरैः by Indra, सामरैरपि even by those supported by gods, समुद्युक्तै: by the wellequipped, त्रिभिः लोकै by the three worlds, अपि also, तस्य his, बलम् strength, अनिवार्यम् irresistible.

45_14.shloka: हृदयं निर्वृतं तेऽस्तुसन्तापस्त्यज्यतामयम्।।3.45.15।।आगमिष्यति ते भर्ता श्रीघ्रं हत्वा मृगोत्तमम्।
45_14.translation: May your heart be relieved (of this fear)  Give up this grief. Your husband will soon return with the excellent deer killed.
45_14.word_by_word: ते your, हृदयम् heart, निर्वृतम् relieved, अस्तु may be, अयम् this, सन्तापः sorrow, त्यज्यताम् give up, ते भर्ता your husband, मृगोत्तमम् excellent deer, हत्वा after killing, श्रीघ्रम् quickly, आगमिष्यति will come back.

45_15.shloka: न च तस्य स्वरो व्यक्तं मायया केन चित्कृतः।गन्धर्वनगरप्रख्या माया सा तस्य रक्षसः।।3.45.16।।
45_15.translation: Surely it is not his voice. It is contrived by some one's illusory power. It is the illusion created by that demon, like the city of the gandharvas. (which does not exist.)
45_15.word_by_word: तस्य his, स्वरः voice, न not, व्यक्तम् it is clear, केन चित् by some one, मायया deceptively, कृतः is made, सा that, तस्य रक्षसः of that demon, गन्धर्वनगरप्रख्या like the city of the gandharvas, माया illusion.

45_16.shloka: न्यासभूतासि वैदेहि न्यस्ता मयि महात्मना।।3.45.17।।रामेण त्वं वरारोहे न त्वां त्यक्तुमिहोत्सहे।
45_16.translation: O best of women Vaidehi  great Rama has entrusted your safty to me. I do not wish to leave you here alone.
45_16.word_by_word: वरारोहे O beautiful lady, वैदेहि Vaidehi, न्यासभूतासि  entrusted for safety, महात्मना by the great self, रामेण by Rama, मयि with me, न्यस्ता  entrusted, इह here, त्वाम् you, त्यक्तुम् to leave, नोत्सहे  not act.

45_17.shloka: कृतवैराश्च वैदेहि वयमेतैर्निशाचरैः।।3.45.18।।खरस्य निधनादेव जनस्थानवधं प्रति।
45_17.translation: O Vaidehi since the killing of Khara and the residents of Janasthana we have developed enmity with the demons.
45_17.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, खरस्य Khara's, निधनादेव since his killing, जनस्थानवधं प्रति towards killing of the residents of Janasthana, वयम् we, एतैः by these, निशाचरैः by the demons, कृतवैराः  developed enmity.

45_18.shloka: राक्षसा विविधा वाचो विसृजन्ति महावने।।3.45.19।।हिंसाविहारा वैदेहि न चिन्तयितुमर्हसि।
45_18.translation: These demons wander about tormenting others and spreading rumours of all kinds.You need not worry about them.
45_18.word_by_word: वैदेहि Vaidehi, महावने in the great forest, हिंसा विहाराः who wander by torturing, राक्षसाः demons, विविधाः different , वाचः words, विसृजन्ति they spread, चिन्तयितुम् to worry, नार्हसि you need not.

45_19.shloka: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्ता सा क्रुद्धा संरक्तलोचना।।3.45.20।।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यवादिनम्।
45_19.translation: Addressed thus by Lakshmana, Sita got mighty angry. Her eyes turned red and she spoke harshly to truthful Lakshmana
45_19.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by  Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been told, सा Sita, क्रुद्धा an angry, संरक्तलोचना with eyes turned red, सत्यवादिनम् to the truthful, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् she spoke.

45_20.shloka: अनार्याकरणारम्भ नृशंस कुलपांसन।।3.45.21।।अहं तव प्रियं मन्ये रामस्य व्यसनं महत्।
45_20.translation: O ignoble, cruel Lakshmana, you are a disgrace to your family. I think this great disaster of Rama is a pleasure to you.
45_20.word_by_word: अनार्यकरणारम्भ man of bad conduct, नृशंस cruel one, कुलपांसन disgrace to your family, रामस्य at Rama's, महत् great, व्यसनम् disaster, तव yours, प्रियम् pleasing, अहम् I, मन्ये I think.

45_21.shloka: रामस्य व्यसनं दृष्ट्वा तेनैतानि प्रभाषसे।।3.45.22।।नैतच्चित्रं सपत्नेषु पापं लक्ष्मण यद्भवेत्।त्वद्विधेषु नृशंसेषु नित्यं प्रच्छन्नचारिषु।।3.45.23।।
45_21.translation: O Lakshmana,do you speak such words seeing the disaster of Rama?  No wonder that cruel men who always move like you in disguise will thus resort to sinful action against rivals.
45_21.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, रामस्य व्यसनम् Rama's disaster, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, तेन by that, एतानि these words, (प्र)भाषसे speak, नित्यम् always, प्रच्छन्नचारिषु  who move in disguise, नृशंसेषु cruel men, त्वद्विधेषु among men like you, सपत्नेषु among rivals, पापम् sin, भवेत् इति यत् will be thus, एतत् this, चित्रम् wonder, न not .

45_22.shloka: सुदुष्टस्त्वं वने राममेकमेकोऽनुगच्छसि।मम हेतोः प्रतिच्छन्नः प्रयुक्तोभरतेन वा।।3.45.24।।
45_22.translation: You are very wicked. You are hiding your true identity, and employed by Bharata, you are following Rama in the forest as he is alone.
45_22.word_by_word: सुदुष्टः very wicked , त्वम् you, एकः alone, प्रतिच्छन्नः  hiding your true self, हेतोः reason, भरतेन by Bharata, प्रयुक्तः वा or employed,  एकम् alone, रामम् Rama, वने in forest, अनुगच्छसि you are following.

45_23.shloka: तन्नसिध्यति सौमित्रे तव वा भरतस्य वा।कथमिन्दीवरश्यामं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम्।।3.45.25।।उपसंश्रित्य भर्तारं कामयेयं पृथग्जनम्।
45_23.translation: O Lakshmana such intention of yours or even of Bharata's will not be fulfilled. I have held the hands of Rama who has eyes like the lotus petal, who has the complexion of the blue lotus. How can I prefer some other man?
45_23.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, तव वा yours or, भरतस्य वा or Bharata's, तत् such, नसिध्यति will not be fulfilled, पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् eyes like lotus petals, इन्दीवरश्यामम् looks like a blue lotus,  भर्तारम् husband, उपसंश्रित्य held the hands of, पृथग्जनम् other men, कथम् how, कामयेयम् can I prefer ?

45_24.shloka: समक्षं तव सौमित्रे प्राणांस्त्यक्षे न संशयः।रामं विना क्षणमपि न हि जीवामि भूतले।।3.45.26।।
45_24.translation: I will undoubtedly give up my life in your presence.I will not live even for a moment on earth without Rama, O son of Sumitra
45_24.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, तव in your, समक्षम् presence, प्राणाम् life, त्यक्ष्ये I  give up, संशयः doubt, नnot, रामं विना without Rama, क्षणमपि even a moment, भूतले on earth, न जीवामि हि I will not live.

45_25.translation: The selfcontrolled Lakshmana with folded palms replied to Sita's harsh, horripilating words:
45_25.word_by_word: विजितेन्द्रियः  selfcontrolled, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सीतया by Sita, इति in this way, रोमहर्षणम् causing horripilation, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, उक्तः uttered, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, सीताम् to Sita, अब्रवीत् said.

45_26.shloka: उत्तरं नोत्सहे वक्तुं दैवतं भवती मम।।3.45.28।।वाक्यमप्रतिरूपं तु न चित्रं स्त्रीषु मैथिलि।स्वभावस्त्वेष नारीणामेवं लोकेषु दृश्यते।।3.45.29।।
45_26.translation: O princess from Mithila, I do not want to use such harsh words. To me you are a deity (worthy of adoration). It is not surprising that women of the world use such undeserving words. It is their nature.
45_26.word_by_word: मैथिलि Mythili, उत्तरम् reply, वक्तुम् to tell, नोत्सहे not wish, भवती yourself, मम for me, दैवतम् deity, अप्रतिरूपम् unworthy, वाक्यम् word, स्त्रीषु among women, चित्रम् wonder, न not, एषः such, नारीणाम् women's, स्वभावस्तु nature, लोकेषु in the world, एवम् likewise, दृश्यते is  seen.

45_27.shloka: विमुक्तधर्माश्चपलास्तीक्ष्णा भेदकराः स्त्रियः।न सहे हीदृशं वाक्यं वैदेहि जनकात्मजे।।3.45.30।।श्रोत्रयोरुभयोर्मेद्य तप्तनाराचसन्निभम्।
45_27.translation: Women devoid dharma are fickle and inconsistent. They use sharp, piercing words. O daughter of Janaka, O princess from Videha, your words pierce my ears like redhot darts.I cannot tolerate them.
45_27.word_by_word: स्त्रियः women, विमुक्तधर्माः devoid of dharma, चपलाः fickle, तीक्ष्णाः sharptongued, भेदकराः piercing, जनकात्मजे daughter of Janaka, वैदेहि Vaidehi, मे my, उभयोः two, श्रोत्रयोः ears, तप्तनाराचसन्निभम् like red hot darts(words that pierce ears like arrows), वाक्यम् words, अद्य now, न सहे हि cannot bear

45_28.shloka: उपशृण्वन्तु मे सर्वे साक्षिभूता वनेचराः।।3.45.31।।न्यायवादी यथान्यायमुक्तोऽहं परुषं त्वया।
45_28.translation: I speak what is just while you use harsh and unjust words. Let all beings who move in the forest bear witness.
45_28.word_by_word: न्यायवादी am just in speaking, अहम् I, त्वया by you, यथा like this, परुषम् harsh words, अन्यायम् unjustified, उक्तः spoken, मे to me, साक्षिभूताः witnesses , सर्वे all, वनेचराः  foresters, उपशृण्वन्तु listen.

45_29.shloka: धिक्त्वामद्य प्रणश्य त्वं यन्मामेवं विशङ्कसे।स्त्रीत्वलदुष्टं स्वभावेन गुरुवाक्ये व्यवस्थितम्।।3.45.32।।
45_29.translation: Fie upon you. Like a woman of wicked nature you doubt me when I stood firm by my brother's words. You will go to ruin.
45_29.word_by_word: त्वाम् you, धिक् fie upon, स्त्रीत्वात् दुष्टस्वभावेन  woman's wicked nature, त्वम् you, गुरुवाक्ये on the word of my brother, व्यवस्थितम् stood firmly, माम् me, यत्  since, एवम् thus, विशङ्कसे doubting, प्रणश्य you will fall to ruin.

45_30.shloka: गमिष्ये यत्र काकुत्स्थ स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु वरानने।।3.45.33।।रक्षन्तु त्वां विशालाक्षि समग्रा वनदेवताः।
45_30.translation: O beautiful lady, I will go to Rama wherever he may be. Be happy. O largeeyed one, may  all the deities of the forest protect you.
45_30.word_by_word: वरानने O beautiful lady, काकुत्स्थ Rama, यत्र whereever he be, गमिष्ये will go, ते स्वस्ति अस्तु be happy, विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, त्वाम् to you, समग्राः all the, वनदेवताः sylvan deties, रक्षन्तु protect you.

45_31.shloka: निमित्तानि च घोराणि यानि प्रादुर्भवन्ति मे।।3.45.34।।अपि त्वां सह रामेण पश्येयं पुनरागतः।न वेत्येतन्न जानामि वैदेहि जनकात्मजे।।3.45.35।।
45_31.translation: O daughter of Janaka O princess from Videha, I see dreadful omens. I do not know whether I will see you when I am back with Rama.
45_31.word_by_word: जनकात्मजे daughter of Janaka, वैदेहि Vaidehi, घोराणि dreadful, यानि those, निमित्तानि omens, मे me, प्रादुर्भवन्ति are manifesting, पुनः again, आगतः when I return, त्वाम् you, सह along with, रामेण with Rama, अपि पश्येयम् will I ever see, न वा or not, इत्येतत् in this way, न जानामि I do not know.

45_32.shloka: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्ता सा रुदन्ती जनकात्मजा।प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं तीव्रं बाष्पपरिप्लुता।।3.45.36।।
45_32.translation: At these words of Lakshmana Sita started crying. With eyes filled with tears she replied with harshness :
45_32.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, एवम् likewise, उक्ता spoken, सा जनकात्मजा she, the daughter of Janaka, ततः then, रुदन्ती while crying, बाष्पपरिप्लुता eyes filled with tears, तीव्रम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

45_33.shloka: गोदावरीं प्रवेक्ष्यामि विना रामेण लक्ष्मण।अबन्धिष्येऽथवा त्यक्ष्ये विषमे देहमात्मनः।।3.45.37।।
45_33.translation: O Lakshmana without Rama I will drown myself in Godavari or hang myself or leap from a cliff into death.
45_33.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, रामेण विना without Rama, गोदावरीम् Godavari, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter, अथवा or else, अबन्धिष्ये hang myself, विषमे  cliff ( dangerous place), आत्मनः myself, देहम् body, त्यक्ष्ये will give up.

45_34.shloka: पिबाम्यहं विषं तीक्ष्णं प्रवेक्ष्यामि हुताशनम्।न त्वहं राघवादन्यं पदापि पुरुषं स्पृशे।।3.45.38।।
45_34.translation: I will drink deadly poison or enter fire and die, but will not touch any other man even with my feet.
45_34.word_by_word: अहम् I, तीक्ष्णम् विषम् venom, पिबामि I will drink, हुताशनम् fire, प्रवेक्ष्यामि I will enter, तु but, अहम् I, राघवात् Rama's, अन्यम् other, पुरुषम् man, पदापि even with feet, न स्पृशे I will not touch.

45_35.shloka: इति लक्ष्मणमाक्रुश्य सीता दुःखसमन्विता।पाणिभ्यां रुदती दुःखादुदरं प्रजघान ह।।3.45.39।।
45_35.translation: Thus Sita cried in distress, sadly hitting her belly with both the hands, blaming Lakshmana (all the time).
45_35.word_by_word: सीता Sita, इति thus, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, आक्रुश्य दुःखसमन्विता blaming and crying in distress, रुदती crying, दुःखात् with grief, पाणिभ्याम् by her hands, उदरम् belly, प्रजघान ह hit herself.

45_36.shloka: तामार्तरूपां विमना रुदन्तीं सौमित्रिरालोक्य विशालनेत्राम्।आश्वासयामास न चैव भर्तु स्तं भ्रातरंकिञ्चिदुवाच सीता।।3.45.40।।
45_36.translation: Saumitri saw  the largeeyed, dejected Sita crying in distress.He pacified and consoled her but she did not say anything at all to her husband's brother.
45_36.word_by_word: सौमित्रिः Saumitri, विमनाः dejected, आर्तरूपाम्  in a pitiable state, रुदन्तीम् crying, ताम् her, विशालनेत्राम् largeeyed, आलोक्य seeing, आश्वसयामास  consoled, सीता Sita, भर्तुः husband's, भ्रातरम् brother, तम् him, किञ्चित् any thing, न उवाच did not speak.

45_37.shloka: ततस्तु सीतामभिवाद्य लक्ष्मणः कृताञ्जलिः किञ्चिदभिप्रणम्य च।अन्वीक्षमाणो बहुशश्च मैथिलीम् जगाम रामस्य समीपमात्मवान्।।3.45.41।।
45_37.translation: Selfcomposed Lakshmana with joined palms saluted her with great reverence.And then, turning towards her again and again, left for Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्जचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
45_37.word_by_word: ततः then, आत्मवान्  selfcomposed, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सीताम् to Sita, अभिवाद्य taking leave, कृताञ्जलिः with joined palms, किञ्चित् a little, अभिप्रणम्य saluting with great reverence, बहुशः in several ways, मैथिलीम् princess from Mithila, अन्वीक्षमाणः looking at her, रामस्य of Rama, समीपम् near, जगाम went.

46_1.shloka: [Lakshmana departs from the hermitage -- Ravana arrives in a saint's robes -- praises Sita and enquires of her -- Sita reveals details about her family to Ravana.]तया परुषमुक्तस्तु कुपितो राघवानुजः।स विकाङ्क्षन्भृशं रामं प्रतस्थे नचिरादिव।।3.46.1।।
46_1.translation: Lakshmana, brother of Rama, hurt by the harsh words of Sita, hastened with Rama's wellbeing in mind.
46_1.word_by_word: तया by her, परुषम् harsh, उक्तः said, सः he, राघवानुजः brother of Rama, कुपितः angry, भृशम् very much, विकांक्षन्  wished, न चिरादिव very soon, रामम् to Rama, प्रतस्थे  went.

46_2.translation: The tenheaded Ravana who was in hiding assumed the guise of a wandering mendicant and approached Sita.
46_2.word_by_word: अन्तरम् inside, आस्थितः in hiding, दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, तत् there, आसाद्य assuming, परिव्राजकरूपधृक् assuming the form of a wandering mendicant, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अभिचक्राम approached.

46_3.shloka: श्लक्ष्णकाषायसंवीतश्शिखी छत्री उपानही।वामे चांसेऽवसज्याथ शुभे यष्टिकमण्डलू।।3.46.3।।परिव्राजकरूपेण वैदेहीमन्वपद्यत।
46_3.translation: And then Ravana wearing fine orange robes, with hair knotted on the head, carrying a parasol, wearing sandals, hanging a kamandalu (waterpot), and a staff on the auspicious left shoulder walked towards Vaidehi like a mendicant.
46_3.word_by_word: अथ then, श्लक्ष्णकाषायसंवीतः wearing fine orange robes, शिखी with knotted hair on the head, छत्री with a parasol, उपानही wearing sandals, वामे अंसे on his left shoulder, शुभेauspicious, यष्टिकमण्डलू staff and water pot, आसज्य hung to the shoulder, परिव्राजकरूपेण as  a mendicant, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अन्वपद्यत walked towards.

46_4.shloka: तामाससादातिबलो भ्रातृभ्यां रहितां वने।।3.46.4।।रहितां चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यां सन्ध्यामिव महत्तमः।
46_4.translation: Mighty Ravana approached Sita deprived of both the brothers, Like darkness encompasses the evening twilight in the absence of the Sun and the Moon.
46_4.word_by_word: अतिबलः mighty Ravana, वने in the forest, भ्रातृभ्याम् with both brothers, रहिताम् in the absence of, ताम् them, चन्द्रसूर्याभ्याम् by both Sun and Moon, सन्ध्याम् in the evening twilight, महत् great, तमः इव like darkness, आससाद reached.

46_5.shloka: तामपश्यत्ततो बालां रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम्।।3.46.5।।रोहिणीं शशिना हीनां ग्रहवद्भृशदारुणः।
46_5.translation: The extremely cruel Ravana saw the illustrious young wife of Rama just as Ketu looks at Rohini star in the absence of the Moon.
46_5.word_by_word: ततः then, भृशदारुणः extremely cruel, यशस्विनीम् illustrious lady, रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, बालाम् young lady, ताम् her, शशिना Moon, हीनाम् without, रोहिणीम्  at  Rohini, ग्रहवत् like planet Ketu, अपश्यत् gazed.

46_6.shloka: तमुग्रतेजःकर्माणं जनस्थानरूहा द्रुमाः।।3.46.6।।समीक्ष्य सम्प्रकम्पन्ते न प्रवाति च मारुतः।
46_6.translation: Seeing the ferocious Ravana, the huge trees at Janasthana shook vidently. Even the wind ceased to blow.
46_6.word_by_word: उग्रतेजःकर्माणम् of ferocious activities, तम् him, समीक्ष्य  saw, जनस्थानरुहाः at Janasthana, महाद्रुमाः huge trees, सम्प्रकम्पन्ते  shaken up, मारुतः च even the wind, न प्रवाति blows not.

46_7.shloka: शीघ्रस्रोताश्च तं दृष्ट्वा वीक्षन्तं रक्तलोचनम्।।3.46.7।।स्तिमितं गन्तुमारेभे भयाद्गोदावरी नदी।
46_7.translation: Seeing Ravana with his bloodred eyes, the swiftflowing river Godavari slowed down out of fear.
46_7.word_by_word: शीघ्रस्रोताः swiftflowing, गोदावरीनदी river Godavari, रक्तलोचनम् bloodred eyes, वीक्षन्तम् looked at, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, भयात् out of fear, स्तिमितम् slow, गन्तुम् आरेभे started flowing

46_8.shloka: रामस्य त्वन्तरप्रेप्सुर्दशग्रीवस्तदन्तरे।।3.46.8।।उपतस्थे च वै देहीं भिक्षुरूपेण रावणः।
46_8.translation: The tenheaded Ravana who was waiting for Rama's absence now got it. Disguised as a mendicant he stepped toward to where Sita was.
46_8.word_by_word: रामस्य Rama's, अन्तरप्रेप्सुः waiting for a chance, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, रावणः Ravana, तदन्तरे  in his absence, भिक्षुरूपेण disguised in the form of a mendicant, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, उपतस्थे went close.

46_9.shloka: अभव्यो भव्यरूपेण भर्तारमनुशोचतीम्।।3.46.9।।अभ्यवर्तत वैदेहीं चित्रामिव शनैश्चरः।
46_9.translation: The evilminded Ravana in the guise of a holy man, like Saturn moves towards Chitrastar, came close to Sita who was brooding over her husband.
46_9.word_by_word: अभव्यः evil one, भर्तारम् about husband, अनुशोचतीम्  worried , वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, भव्यरूपेण disguised like a holy man, शनैश्चरः like the Saturn moving to, चित्रामिव towards Chitra , अभ्यवर्तत stood near.

46_10.shloka: स पापो भव्यरूपेण तृणैः कूप इवावृतः।।3.46.10।।अतिष्ठत्प्रेक्ष्य वैदेहीं रामपत्निं यशस्विनीम्।
46_10.translation: Just like a well is concealed by an overgrowth of grass, Ravana guised as a holy man stood looking at illustrious Sita, the wife of Rama.
46_10.word_by_word: कूपः well, तृणै by grass, भव्यरूपेण disguised like a holy man, आवृतः concealed, इव like, सः he, पापः that sinner, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, प्रेक्ष्य after seeing, अतिष्ठत् stood.

46_11.shloka: शुभां रुचिरदन्तोष्ठीं पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।।3.46.11।।आसीनां पर्णशालायां बाष्पशोकाभिपीडिताम्।स तां पद्मपलाशाक्षीं पीतकौशेयवासिनीम्।।3.46.12।।अभ्यगच्छत वैदेहीं दुष्टचेता निशाचरः।
46_11.translation: The wicked demon came close to that auspicious princess from Videha sitting in the cottage Her face was like the full moon. Her teeth and lips were lovely. She was clad in yellow silk. Her eyes were like lotus petals tormented by tears of grief.
46_11.word_by_word: दुष्टचेताः wicked, सः निशाचरः that nightwalker, शुभाम् auspicious lady, रुचिरदन्तोष्ठीम् lwith lovely teeth and lips, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् face like the fullmoon, पर्णशालायाम् in the cottage, आसीनाम् seated, बाष्पशोकाभिपीडिताम् tormented by tears of grief, पद्मपलाशाक्षीम् eyes like lotus petals, पीतकौशेयवासिनीम् clad in yellow silk, तां वैदेहीम् that Vaidehi, अभ्यगच्छत came close.

46_12.word_by_word: मन्मथशराविष्टः struck by the arrows of the god of love, सः राक्षसाधिपः that lord of the demons, ब्रह्मघोषम् chanting from the Vedas, उदीरयन् while chanting, रहिते in a solitary spot, प्रश्रितम् humbly, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

46_13.shloka: तामुत्तमां स्त्रियं लोके पद्महीनामिव श्रियम्।।3.46.14।।विभ्राजमानां वपुषा रावणः प्रशशंस ह।
46_13.translation: Sita was the most lovely lady of the world shining in beauty. She was like the goddess of wealth (Laxmi) without her lotus. Ravana praised her thus:
46_13.word_by_word: लोके in the world, उत्तमाम् the best, स्त्रियम् lady, पद्महीनाम् without a lotus, श्रियम् इव like goddess of wealth, वपुषा with her body, विभ्राजमानाम् shining, ताम् her, रावणः Ravana, प्रशशंस ह he praised.

46_14.shloka: का त्वं काञ्चनवर्णाभे पीतकौशेयवासिनि।।3.46.15।।कमलानां शुभां मालां पद्मिनीव हि बिभ्रती।
46_14.translation: Who are you with a golden complexion, clad in yellow silk, and looking like a lotuspond and wearing an auspicious lotus garland?
46_14.word_by_word: काञ्चनवर्णाभे of golden hue, पीतकौशेयवासिनि clad in yellow silk, पद्मिनीव like a lotus pond, कमलानाम् of lotuses, शुभाम् auspicious, मालाम् garland, बिभ्रती wearing, त्वम् you, का who are you?

46_15.shloka: ह्रीः कीर्तिः श्रीश्शुभा लक्ष्मीरप्सरा वा शुभानने।।3.46.16।।भूतिर्वा त्वं वरारोहे रतिर्वा स्वैरचारिणी।
46_15.translation: O lady with a beautiful face, with lovely thighs, are you 'hri', shyness personified? Are you the auspicious lovely Lakshmi, the  goddess of wealth? Are you the goddess of fame? Are you an apsara? Are you Bhuti, the goddess of fortune? Or are you Rati, the goddess of love moving at your free will ?
46_15.word_by_word: शुभानने lady of beautiful face, वरारोहे with lovely things, त्वम् you, ह्रीः shyness personified, कीर्तिः goddess of fame, शुभा auspicious, श्रीः or goddess of wealth, लक्ष्मीः or Lakshmi,अप्सरा वा  or apsara?, भूतिर्वा Bhuti, goddess of fortune, स्वैरचारिणी Rati who makes at will freely, रतिर्वा or Rati, golden of love.

46_16.shloka: समाश्शिखरिणस्स्निग्धाः पाण्डुरा दशनास्तव।।3.46.17।।विशाले विमले नेत्रे रक्तान्ते कृष्णतारके।
46_16.translation: Your teeth are even and pointed, white and beautiful.Your eyes are large and clear and sparkling with dark pupils with a red tinge at the corner.
46_16.word_by_word: दशनाः teeth, समाः even, शिखरिणः pointed, स्निग्धाः shining, तव your, पाण्डुराः pale white, नेत्रे eyes, विशाले large, विमले clear, रक्तान्ते having reddish tinge, कृष्णतारके having dark pupils.

46_17.shloka: विशालं जघनं पीनमूरू करिकरोपमौ।।3.46.18।।एतावुपचितौ वृत्तौ संहतौ सम्प्रवल्गितौ।पीनोन्नतमुखौ कान्तौ स्निग्धौ तालफलोपमौ।।3.46.19।।मणिप्रवेकाभरणौ रुचिरौ ते पयोधरौ।
46_17.translation: Your big hips are stout and strong, Your smooth thighs are like the trunk of an elephant, your breasts adorned with gems, are round and robust like palm fruits and drooping with heaviness with projected stiff nipples, shining and delightful, adding beauty.
46_17.word_by_word: विशालम् big, जघनम् hips, पीनम् stout, ऊरू thighs, करिकरोपमौ like the elephant's trunk, ते your, एताः these two, मणिप्रवेकाभरणौ adorned with gems, पयोधरौ breasts, उपचितौ wellformed, वृत्तौ round, संहतौ coming together, सम्प्रवल्गितौ drooping due to weight, पीनोन्नतमुखौ  are stout and nipples projecting, कान्तौ shining, स्निग्धौ delightful, तालफलोपमौ like two palm friuts, रुचिरौ adding beauty.

46_18.shloka: चारुस्मिते चारुदति चारुनेत्रे विलासिनि।।3.46.20।।मनो हरसि मे कान्ते नदी कूलमिवाम्भसा।करान्तमितमध्यासि सुकेशी संहतस्तनी।।3.46.21।।
46_18.translation: O lady with an elegant smile, beautiful teeth, lovely  eyes you are enticing.Your slender waist can be compassed by my fist.Your hair is beautiful and your large breasts are rubbing against each other.You are capturing my mind  just as the flow of water in a river  touches its banks.
46_18.word_by_word: चारुस्मिते lady  with an elegant smile, चारुदति lady of lovely teeth, चारुनेत्रे beautiful eyes, विलासिनि lovely lady, कान्ते attractive lady, नदी river, अम्भसा with water, कूलमिव like a river bank, मे my, मनः mind, हरसि  capturing, करान्तमितमध्या  slender waist could be compassed with fist, सुकेशी of beautiful hair, संहतस्तनी breasts rubbing agaist each other, असि you are.

46_19.shloka: नैव देवी न गन्धर्वी न यक्षी न च किन्नरी।नैवंरूपा मया नारी दृष्टपूर्वा महीतले।।3.46.22।।
46_19.translation: O beautiful lady I have not seen such a beauty earlier either among goddesses or among gandharavis, or yakshis or even among kinneris.
46_19.word_by_word: मया by  me, महीतले on this earth, एवं रूपा such a beauty, नारी lady, न दृष्टपूर्वा not seen earlier, देवी O goddess, नैव neither, गन्धर्वी gandharva woman, न not even, यक्षी yakshi, न not, किन्नरी kinnera woman.

46_20.shloka: रूपमग्र्यं च लोकेषु सौकुमार्यं वयश्चते।इह वासश्च कान्तारे चित्तमुन्मादयन्ति मे।।3.46.23।।
46_20.translation: You are the most beautiful among women in the world. With all your tenderness and youth you are living in this forlorn forest. This maddens my heart.
46_20.word_by_word: लोकेषु in the world, अग्र्यम् the best, ते your, रूपम् beauty, सौकुमार्यम् tenderness, वयश्च youth, इह here, कान्तारे in this forlorn forest, वासश्च living, मे my, चित्तम् heart, उन्मादयन्तिare maddening.

46_21.shloka: सा प्रतिक्राम भद्रं ते नैवं वस्तुमिहार्हसि।राक्षसानामयं वासो घोराणां कामरूपिणाम्।।3.46.24।।
46_21.translation: It is not safe for a lady like you to reside here. Move out at once. This is only fit for the dwelling of horrible demons who can change their form at will.
46_21.word_by_word: सा such a lady, प्रतिक्राम move out, ते of yours, भद्रम् safety, इह here, एवम् in this way, वस्तुम् to reside, न अर्हसि not proper, अयम् this is, घोराणाम् horrible, कामरूपिणाम् who can change their form at will, राक्षसानाम् of demons, वासः dwelling place.

46_22.shloka: प्रासादाग्राणि रम्याणि नगरोपवनानि च।सम्पन्नानि सुगन्धीनि युक्तान्याचरितुं त्वया।।3.46.25।।
46_22.translation: You deserve to stroll in the terraces of palaces, in beautiful, luxurious and fragrant city gardens.
46_22.word_by_word: प्रासादाग्राणि terraces of palaces, रम्याणि beautiful, सम्पन्नानि luxurious, सुगन्धीनि fragrant, नगरोपवनानि च city gardens, त्वया yourself, आचरितुम् to stroll, युक्तानि deserve.

46_23.shloka: वरं माल्यं वरं भोज्यं वरं वस्त्रं च शोभने।भर्तारं च वरं मन्ये त्वद्युक्तमसितेक्षणे।।3.46.26।।
46_23.translation: O beautiful, blackeyed lady, I think you deserve the best of garlands, best of food,and clothes and a suitable husband.
46_23.word_by_word: असितेक्षणे  black eyed lady, शोभने O beauty, वरम् best of, माल्यम् garlands, वरम् best of, भोज्यम् food, वरम् best of, वस्त्रम् clothes, वरम् choicest, भर्तारं च and husband, त्वद्युक्तम् suitable for you, मन्ये I think.

46_24.shloka: का त्वं भवसि रुद्राणां मरुतां वा वरानने।वसूनां वा वरावोहे देवता प्रतिभासि मे।।3.46.27।।
46_24.translation: O best of women O lady with beautiful buttocks  can you be one  of the Rudras or Maruts or Vasus? To me, you appear like a goddess.
46_24.word_by_word: वरानने O beautiful lady, वरारोहे O with beautiful buttocks lady, त्वम् you, का भवसि who are you, रुद्राणाम् among Rudras, मरुतां वा or Maruta's, वसूनां वा or Vasus, मे to me, देवता goddess, प्रतिभासि you appear.

46_25.shloka: नेह गच्छन्ति गन्धर्वा न देवा न च किन्नराः।राक्षसानामयं वासः कथं नु त्वमिहागता।।3.46.28।।
46_25.translation: Neither gandharvas, nor kinnaras, nor gods move here. This is only a dwelling place for the demons. How did you come here ?
46_25.word_by_word: इह here, गन्धर्वाः gandharva, न गच्छन्ति do not go this way, देवाः gods, न not, किन्नराः च and kinnara, न not, अयम् this is, राक्षसानाम् for demons, वासः dwelling place, त्वम् you, कथम् how, इह here, आगता came?

46_26.shloka: इह शाखामृगास्सिंहा द्वीपिव्याघ्रमृगास्तथा।ऋक्षास्तरक्षवः कङ्काः कथं तेभ्यो न बिभ्यसि।।3.46.29।।
46_26.translation: There are monkeys, lions, panthers, tigers, hyenas, bears, kanka birds and other wild animals here. How is it that you are not afraid of them?
46_26.word_by_word: इह here, शाखामृगाः monkeys, सिंहाः lions, द्वीपिव्याघ्रमृगाः panthers, tigers and other wild animals, तथा so also, ऋक्षाः bears, तरक्षवः hyenas, कङ्काः Kanka birds, तेभ्यः by them, कथम् how is it, न बिभ्यसि you are not frightened.

46_27.shloka: मदान्वितानां घोराणां कुञ्जराणां तरस्विनाम्।कथमेका महारण्ये न बिभेषि वरानने।।3.46.30।।
46_27.translation: O Charming lady how is it that although alone you are not afraid of the dreadful, swift, powerful wild animals like elephants in rut ?
46_27.word_by_word: वरानने beautiful lady, महारण्ये in dense woods, मदान्वितानाम्  in rut, घोराणाम् fierce, तरस्विनाम् swift and powerful, कुञ्जराणाम् of elephants, एका alone, कथम् how, न बिभेषि are you not scared of them?

46_28.shloka: कासि कस्य कुतश्चित्त्वं किं निमित्तं च दण्डकान्।एका चरसि कल्याणि घोरान्राक्षससेवितान्।।3.46.31।।
46_28.translation: Who are you, O auspicious lady ? Who are your people? Why are you here? From where have you come? For what reason are you going about alone in this fierce Dandaka tract, inhabited by demons?
46_28.word_by_word: कल्याणि O auspicious lady, त्वम् you, का असि who are you, कस्य to whose, कुतश्चित् where did you come from ?, राक्षससेवितान् inhabited by demons, घोरान् terrible, दण्डकान् Dandaka, एका alone, किं निमित्तम् for what reason, चरसि you roam.

46_29.shloka: इति प्रशस्ता वैदेही रावणेन दुरात्मना।द्विजातिवेशेण हि तं दृष्ट्वा रावणमागतम्।।3.46.32।।सर्वैरतिथिसत्कारैः पूजयामास मैथिली।
46_29.translation: Seeing Ravana, a villain in the guise of a brahmin praising her, Sita, the princess ofVideha, honoured him with all hospitality.
46_29.word_by_word: दुरात्मना by the villain, रावणेन by Ravana, इति thus, प्रशस्ता praised, मैथिली Maithili, वैदेही princess of Videha, द्विजातिवेशेण in the guise of a brahmin, आगतम् come, तं रावणम् that Ravana, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, सर्वैः with all, अतिथिसत्कारैः  with hospitality, पूजयामास  honoured him.

46_30.shloka: उपनीयासनं पूर्वं पाद्येनाभिनिमन्त्र्य च।।3.46.33।।अब्रवीत्सिद्धमित्येव तदा तं सौम्यदर्शनम्।
46_30.translation: She offered the handsome guest a seat first and then water for washing his feet with, and then invited him for food.
46_30.word_by_word: तदा then, पूर्वम् first, आसनम् seat, उपनीय brought, पाद्येन water for his feet, अभिनिमन्त्र्य  च and inviting (for food), सौम्यदर्शनम् lovelylooking, तम् to him, सिद्धम् food ready, इत्येव  in this way, अब्रवीत् said.

46_31.translation: Sita, being a lady, was unable to doubt him since he came in the guise of a brahmin, holding a bottlegourd and a begging bowl. Without knowing his illintention she invited him in, mistaking him for a brahmin.
46_31.word_by_word: तदा then, मैथिली Maithili, अङ्गना lady, द्विजातिवेशेण in the guise of a brahmin, समागतम् having come, पात्रकुसुम्भधारिणम् holding a bottlegourd as a begging bowl, उद्वेष्टुम् to hate, अशक्यम् not possible, अपायदर्शनम् dangerous intention, ब्राह्मणवत् brahmin, न्यमन्त्रयत् she invited.

46_32.shloka: इयं बृसी ब्राह्मण काममास्यतामिदं च पाद्यं प्रतिगृह्यतामिति।इदं च सिद्धं वनजातमुत्तमं त्वदर्थमव्यग्रमिहोपभुज्यताम्।।3.46.35।।
46_32.translation: O brahmin, here is the seat for you. Feel free to sit. Here is water to wash your feet with. This is the best of food for you collected from the forest. Please partake this without hesitation.
46_32.word_by_word: ब्राह्मण O brahmin, इयम् this is, बृसी the seat of an ascetic, कामम् freely, आस्यताम् be seated, इदम् this is, पाद्यम् water for washing feet, प्रतिगृह्यताम् please take, इति these, इदम् this is, उत्तमम् best, वनजातम् available in the forest, त्वदर्थम् for you, सिद्धम् kept ready, इह here, अव्यग्रम् without hesitation, उपभुज्यताम् please eat.

46_33.shloka: निमन्त्र्यमाणः प्रतिपूर्णभाषिणीं नरेन्द्रपत्नीं प्रसमीक्ष्य मैथिलीम्।प्रसह्य तस्याहरणे धृतं मनः समर्पयत्स्वात्मवधाय रावणः।।3.46.36।।
46_33.translation: Ravana was observing the princess from Mithila, wife of a king inviting him  and speaking to him in cordial manner. Looking at her, he resolved to  abduct her forcibly, inviting his own death.
46_33.word_by_word: निमन्त्र्यमाणः as he was being invited, रावणः Ravana, प्रतिपूर्णभाषिणीम् softspoken, नरेन्द्रपत्नीम् wife of the king, मैथिलीम् Maithili, प्रसमीक्ष्य looking at her, स्वात्मवधाय for his own destruction, प्रसह्य forcibly, तस्याः her, हरणे to abduct, मनः set his mind, धृतम् intent upon, समर्पयत् presented.

46_34.shloka: ततः सुवेषं मृगयागतं पतिं प्रतीक्षमाणा सहलक्ष्मणं तदा।विवीक्षमाणा हरितं ददर्श तन्महद्वनं नैव तु रामलक्ष्णौ।।3.46.37।।
46_34.translation: Sita looked out for the beautiful figure of Rama who had gone to hunt the deer along with Lakshmana. Waiting eagerly for her husband, she only saw the vast stretch of green forest  but not Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
46_34.word_by_word: ततः then, सुवेषम् that beautiful form of Rama, मृगयागतम् gone to hunt the deer, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, पतिम् husband, प्रतीक्षमाणा while waited, तदा then, विवीक्षमाणा  while she looked with eagerness, हरितम् green, तत् that, महत् dense, वनम् forest, ददर्श saw, रामलक्ष्मणौ तु for Rama and Lakshmana, नैव not seen.

47_1.shloka: [Ravana asks Sita to seek his hand -- Sita's refusal.]रावणेन तु वैदेही तदा पृष्टा जिहीर्षता।परिव्राजकरूपेण शशंसात्मानमात्मना।।3.47.1।।
47_1.translation: Then Ravana in the guise of a mendicant with crooked intention to abduct her, asked Vaidehi to tell him about herself.
47_1.word_by_word: तदा then, जिहीर्षुणा of crooked intention of abducting, परिव्राजकरूपेण in the guise of a mendicant, रावणेन by Ravana, पृष्टा was asked, वैदेही Vaidehi, आत्मानम् about her, आत्मना herself, शशंस told.

47_2.shloka: ब्राह्मणश्चातिथिश्चायमनुक्तो हि शपेत माम्।इति ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं तु सीता वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.47.2।।
47_2.translation: 'He is a brahmin and also a guest. If unanswered he may curse me'. Thinking this Sita thought for a moment and said:
47_2.word_by_word: ब्राह्मणश्च a brahmin, अतिथिश्च also a guest, अयम् this man, अनुक्तः unanswered, माम् me, शपेत हि may curse, इति thus, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, ध्यात्वा thought, सीता Sita, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

47_3.shloka: दुहिता जनकस्याहं मैथिलस्य महात्मनः।सीता नाम्नास्मि भद्रं ते रामभार्या द्विजोत्तम।।3.47.3।।
47_3.translation: O best of brahmins be pleased to know I am Sita by name, daughter of the great Janaka, king of Mithila and wife of Rama.
47_3.word_by_word: द्विजोत्तम O best of brahmin, अहम् I am, मैथिलस्य of the king of Maithila, महात्मनः of the great king, जनकस्य Janaka's, दुहिता daughter, नाम्ना by name, सीता अस्मि Sita, रामभार्या wife of Rama, ते to you, भद्रम् be pleased.

47_4.shloka: उषित्वा द्वादश समा इक्ष्वाकुणां निवेशने।भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी।।3.47.4।।
47_4.translation: I lived in the house of the Ikshvakus for twelve years and enjoyed all kinds of pleasures meant for mortals.
47_4.word_by_word: द्वादश twelve, समाः years, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of the Ikshvaku family, निवेशने in the house, उषित्वा  lived, मानुषान् of mortals, भोगान् pleasures, भुञ्जाना enjoying, सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी all my desires fulfilled.

47_5.shloka: ततस्त्रयोदशे वर्षे राजामन्त्रयत प्रभुः।अभिषेचयितुं रामं समेतो राजमन्त्रिभिः।।3.47.5।।
47_5.translation: In the thirteenth year, the king and lord Dasaratha consulted other kings and ministers to consecrate Rama.
47_5.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रभुः राजा king and lord, त्रयोदशे वर्षे in the thirteenth year, राजमन्त्रिभिः   kings and ministers, समेतः together, रामम् for Rama, अभिषेचयितुम् to consecrate, अमन्त्रयत  consulted.

47_6.shloka: तस्मिन्सम्भ्रियमाणे तु राघवस्याभिषेचने।कैकेयी नाम भर्तारमार्या सा याचते वरम्।।3.47.6।।
47_6.translation: Arrangements for consecration were on when queen Kaikeyi sought a boon from the king.
47_6.word_by_word: राघवस्य Rama's, तस्मिन् in that, अभिषेचने consecration, सम्भ्रियमाणे  arrangements were being made, कैकेयी नाम Kaikeyi by name, सा she, भर्तारम् her husband, आर्या lady, वरम् boon, याचते sought.

47_7.shloka: प्रतिगृह्य तु कैकेयी श्वशुरं सुकृतेन मे।मम प्रव्राजनं भर्तुर्भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।।3.47.7।।द्वावयाचत भर्तारं सत्यसन्धं नृपोत्तमम्।
47_7.translation: For the fulfilment of the promise made to Kaikeyi earlier by my truthful fatherin law, who, to my good luck, was the best of kings, she asked for two boons. One was banishment of my husband and second, consecration of Bharata.
47_7.word_by_word: कैकेयी Kaikeyi, मे श्वशुरम् my fatherinlaw, सुकृतेन by good luck, प्रतिगृह्य  extracted a  promise ( married for a consideration), सत्यसन्धम् truthful, नृपोत्तमम् best of kings, भर्तारम् husband's, मम भर्तुः of my husband, प्रव्राजनम् banishment, भरतस्य Bharata's, अभिषेचनम् consecration, द्वौ two (boons), अयाचत asked.

47_8.shloka: नाद्य भोक्ष्ये न च स्वप्स्ये न पास्येच कथञ्चन।।3.47.8।।एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।
47_8.translation: 'I shall not eat, or sleep or even drink if Rama is consecrated and I shall put an end to my life itself' (said Kaikeyi).
47_8.word_by_word: अद्य today, रामः Rama, यदिअभिषिच्यते if consecrated, न भोक्ष्ये I will not eat, न च स्वप्स्ये I will not sleep, कथञ्चन in any way, नपास्ये च I will not drink, एषः this is, मे my, जीवितस्य life's, अन्तः an end.

47_9.shloka: इति ब्रुवाणां कैकेयीं श्वशुरो मे स मानदः।।3.47.9।।अयाचतार्थैरन्वर्थैर्न च याञ्चां चकार सा।
47_9.translation: The king, my fatherinlaw, who respected her offered riches. Which she did not accept.
47_9.word_by_word: इति thus, ब्रुवाणाम् while speaking, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, मानदः respectable, सः he, मे my, श्वशुरः fatherinlaw, अन्वर्थैः अर्थैः riches, अयाचत requested, सा she, याञ्चाम् soliciting, न च चकार not agreed.

47_10.shloka: मम भर्तामहातेजा वयसा पञ्चविंशकः।।3.47.10।।अष्टादश हि वर्षाणि मम जन्मनि गण्यते।
47_10.translation: My husband who was very bold was twentyfive years and I had completed eighteen years since my birth.
47_10.word_by_word: महातेजाः very bold, मम भर्ता my husband, वयसा by age, पञ्चविंशकः twenty five, मम mine, जन्मनि completed after birth, अष्टादश eighteen, वर्षाणि years, गण्यते is counted.

47_11.shloka: रामेति प्रथितो लोके गुणवान्सत्यवान्शुचिः।।3.47.11।।विशालाक्षो महाबाहुस्सर्वभूतहिते रतः।
47_11.translation: My husband known in the world as Rama is largeeyed, longarmed, virtuous, truthful, pure and is always engaged in the welfare of all beings.
47_11.word_by_word: रामेति known as Rama, लोके in the world, प्रथितः famous, गुणवान् virtuous, सत्यवान् truthful, शुचिः pure, विशालाक्षः  large eyed, महाबाहुः  largearmed, सर्वभूतहिते in the wellbeing of all, रतः engaged.

47_12.shloka: कामार्तस्तु महातेजाः पिता दशरथस्स्वयम्।।3.47.12।।कैकेय्याः प्रियकामार्थं तं रामं नाभ्यषेचयत्।
47_12.translation: The brilliant king, Dasaratha, father of Rama, overcome by passion,  did not consecrate Rama in order to please Kaikeyi.
