47_12.word_by_word: कामार्तः overcome by love, महातेजाः brilliant, पिता father, दशरथः Dasaratha, स्वयम् himself, कैकेय्याः Kaikeyi, प्रियकामार्थम् to please her, तं रामम् Rama, नाभ्यषेचयत् not consecrated.

47_13.shloka: अभिषेकाय तु पितुस्समीपं राममागतम्।।3.47.13।।कैकेयी मम भर्तारमित्युवाच धृतं वचः।
47_13.translation: When my husband Rama approached his father for the consecration she said these unhesitating words:
47_13.word_by_word: अभिषेकाय for consecration, तु but, समीपम् near, आगतम् reached, मम भर्तारम् to my husband, रामम् Rama, इति धृतम् in unhesitating  वचः words, उवाच said.

47_14.shloka: तव पित्रा समाज्ञप्तं ममेदं शृणु राघव।।3.47.14।।भरताय प्रदातव्यमिदं राज्यमकण्टकम्।
47_14.translation: 'O Rama, listen, your father has ordered that this kingdom be bestowed on Bharata without any obstacles.
47_14.word_by_word: राघव O Rama, तव your, पित्रा by father, समाज्ञप्तम् is ordered, इदम् this way, शृणु listen, अकण्टकम् without any obstacles, इदं राज्यम् this kingdom, भरताय to Bharata, प्रदातव्यम् should be bestowed.

47_15.shloka: त्वया हि खलु वस्तव्यं नव वर्षाणि पञ्च च।।3.47.15।।वने प्रव्रज काकुत्स्थ पितरं मोचयानृतान्।
47_15.translation: 'O Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty, you should live in the forest for fourteen years and save your father from falsehood'.
47_15.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ Rama of the Kakutstha dynasty, त्वया by you, नव पञ्च च वर्षाणि fourteen years, वने in the forest, वस्तव्यम् खलु you should live indeed, प्रव्रज  proceed in exile, पितरम् to father, अनृतात् from falsehood, मोचय save him.

47_16.shloka: तथेत्युक्त्वा च तां रामः कैकेयीमकुतोभयः।।3.47.16।।चकार तद्वचस्तस्या मम भर्ता दृढव्रतः।
47_16.translation: My husband Rama, a man of fearlessness and firm resolution, said to Kaikeyi 'Be it so' and carried out her words.
47_16.word_by_word: अकुतोभयः a fearless man, दृढव्रतः of firm resolution, मम भर्ता my husband, रामः Rama, तथेति be it so, ताम् her, कैकेयीम् to Kaikeyi, उक्त्वा said, तस्याः her, तत् those, वचः words, चकार executed.

47_17.shloka: दद्यान्न प्रतिगृह्णीयात्सत्यं ब्रूयान्न चानृतम्।।3.47.17।।एतद्ब्राह्मण रामस्य ध्रृवं व्रतमनुत्तमम्।
47_17.translation: O brahmin this is his firm resolve and his great vow: 'One should give and never take one should speak the truth and nothing but he truth.'
47_17.word_by_word: दद्यात् giver, न प्रतिगृह्णीयात् not receive, सत्यम् truth, ब्रूयात् utter, अनृतम् other than truth, न च not utter, ब्राह्मण brahmin, एतत् this is, रामस्य Rama's, धृवम् resolve, अनुत्तमम् very great, व्रतम् vow.

47_18.shloka: तस्य भ्राता तु द्वैमात्रो लक्ष्मणो नाम वीर्यवान्।।3.47.18।।रामस्य पुरुषव्याघ्रस्सहायस्समरेरिहा।
47_18.translation: Son to the second mother of Rama, his mighty halfbrother, by name, Lakshmana, a tiger among men and a  slayer of enemies in battle is a companion to him.
47_18.word_by_word: तस्य रामस्य such Rama's, द्वैमात्रः भ्राता second mother's son, half brother, वीर्यवान् strong, पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, अरिहा slayer of enemies, लक्ष्मणो नाम by name Lakshmana, समरे in battle, सहाय: companion.

47_19.shloka: स भ्राता लक्ष्मणो नाम धर्मचारी दृढव्रतः।।3.47.19।।अन्वगच्छद्दनुष्पाणिः प्रव्रजन्तं मया सह।
47_19.translation: Lakshmana, his brother, is righteous and steadfast. Bow in hand, he followed Rama along with me, into exile.
47_19.word_by_word: धर्मचारी righteous, दृढव्रतः steadfast, लक्ष्मणो नाम Lakshmana by name, सः भ्राता his brother, धनुष्पाणिः wielder of bow, मया सह along with me, प्रव्रजन्तम् as he was being exiled, अन्वगच्छत् came along.

47_20.shloka: जटी तापसरूपेण मया सह सहानुजः।।3.47.20।।प्रविष्टो दण्डकारण्यं धर्मनित्यो जितेन्द्रियः।
47_20.translation: Rama who is ever righteous and selfcontrolled entered the Dandaka forest with matted locks, his brother and me.
47_20.word_by_word: धर्मनित्यः ever righteous, जितेन्द्रियः selfcontrolled, जटी with matted locks, मया सह along with me, सहानुजः with his brother, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered.

47_21.shloka: ते वयं प्रच्युता राज्यात्कैकेय्यास्तु कृते त्रयः।।3.47.21।।विचरामो द्विजश्रेष्ठ वनं गम्भीरमोजसा।
47_21.translation: O best of brahmins three of us have been wandering with courage in the deep forest, dislodged from  the kingdom on account of  Kaikeyi.
47_21.word_by_word: द्विजश्रेष्ठ O best among brahmins, ते those of us, वयम् we, त्रयः three of us, कैकेय्याः कृते on account of Kaikeyi, राज्यात् from kingdom, प्रच्युताः dislodged, ओजसा  with valour, गम्भीरम् deep, वनम् forest, विचरामः wandering.

47_22.shloka: समाश्वस मुहूर्तं तु शक्यं वस्तुमिह त्वया।।3.47.22।।आगमिष्यति मे भर्ता वन्यमादाय पुष्कलम्।रुरून्गोधा न्वराहांश्च हत्वाऽदायाऽमिषान्बहून्।।3.47.23।।
47_22.translation: Rest here awhile. My husband will return with plenty of meat of many kinds from the forest, killing deer, alligators and wild boars.
47_22.word_by_word: मुहूर्तम् for a while, समाश्वस take rest, त्वया by you, इह here, वस्तुम् to stay, शक्यम् it is possible, मे भर्ता my husband, रुरून् deer, गोधाः alligators, वराहांश्च boars, हत्वा after killing, बहून् many of them, आमिषान् varieties of meat, आदाय would fetch, पुष्कलम् in plenty, वन्यम् from the forest, आदाय getting, आगमिष्यति will come.

47_23.shloka: स त्वं नाम च गोत्रञ्च कुलं चाचक्ष्व तत्त्वतः।एकश्च दण्डकारण्ये किमर्थं चरसि द्विज।।3.47.24।।
47_23.translation: O brahmin, tell me your name, your gotra and your pedigree. And the purpose for which you are going about all alone in this Dandaka forest
47_23.word_by_word: द्विज O brahmin, सः such as you, त्वम् you, नाम च name and, गोत्रञ्च gotram, कुलं च race, तत्त्वतः truly, आचक्ष्व tell me, एकः च alone, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, किमर्थम् for what purpose, चरसि going about.

47_24.shloka: एवं बृवन्त्यां सीतायां रामपत्न्यां महाबलः।प्रत्युवाचोत्तरं तीव्रं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.47.25।।
47_24.translation: To these words of Sita, Rama's wife, Ravana, the powerful king of demons, replied  sharp:
47_24.word_by_word: रामपत्न्याम् when Rama's wife, सीतायाम् Sita, एवम् in that way, ब्रुवन्त्याम् speaking, महाबलः   powerful, राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, रावणः Ravana, तीव्रम् sharp, उत्तरम् reply, प्रत्युवाच replied.

47_25.shloka: येन वित्रासिता लोकास्सदेवासुरपन्नगाः।अहं तु रावणो नाम सीते रक्षोगणेश्वरः।।3.47.26।।
47_25.translation: O Sita I am called Ravana, the lord of demons by whom all the worlds of demons,snakes and gods are frightened.
47_25.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, अहम् I am, येन by whom, सदेवासुरपन्नगाः asuras and pannagas along with gods, लोकाः worlds, वित्रासिताः are frightened, रक्षोगणेश्वरः lord of demons, रावणो नाम Ravana by name.

47_26.shloka: त्वां तु काञ्चनवर्णाभां दृष्ट्वा कौशेयवासिनीम्।रतिं स्वकेषु दारेषु नाधिगच्छाम्यनिन्दिते।।3.47.27।।
47_26.translation: O flawless beauty of golden complexion seeing you clad in silk, I am not inclined to show any interest in my own wives.
47_26.word_by_word: अनिन्दिते O flawless lady, काञ्चनवर्णाभाम् of golden complexion, कौशेयवासिनीम् clad in silk, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, स्वकेषु my own, दारेषु wives, रतिम् love, नाधिगच्छामि do not feel.

47_27.translation: You will be the chief queen among the best of women I have won in wars. Be blessed.
47_27.word_by_word: इतस्तत: from various places, आहृतानाम् won over, बह्वीनाम् of many women, सर्वासामेव of all of them, उत्तमस्त्रीणाम् of the best of women, मम myself, अग्रमहिषी chief queen, भव be, ते भद्रम् be blessed.

47_28.shloka: लङ्कानाम समुद्रस्य मम मध्ये महापुरी।सागरेण परिक्षिस्ता निविष्टा नगमूर्धनि।।3.47.29।।
47_28.translation: My great city  called Lanka is on the peak of a mountain surrounded by, and in the middle of, the sea.
47_28.word_by_word: लङ्का नाम by name Lanka, मम my, महापुरी great city, समुद्रस्य of the sea, मध्ये in the  middle, सागरेण by sea, परिक्षिप्ता surrounded, नगमूर्धनि on the peak of a mountain, निविष्टा it is situated.

47_29.shloka: तत्र सीते मया सार्धं वनेषु विहरिष्यसि।न चास्यारण्यवासस्य स्पृहयिष्यसि भामिनि।।3.47.30।।
47_29.translation: O Sita, you can stroll with me in my pleasuregardens. O  beautiful lady, you will not like living in the forest (thereafter).
47_29.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, तत्र there, मया सार्धम् with me, वनेषु in the gardens, विहरिष्यसि can stroll with pleasure, भामिनि O beautiful woman, अस्य of this, अरण्यस्य वासस्य living in the forest, न च स्पृहयिष्यसि will not like.

47_30.shloka: पञ्च दास्यस्सहस्राणि सर्वाभरणभूषिताः।सीते परिचरिष्यन्ति भार्या भवसि मे यदि।।3.47.31।।
47_30.translation: O Sita  if you become my wife, five thousand female attendants adorned with all ornaments will attend on you.
47_30.word_by_word: सीते Sita, मे my, भार्या wife, भवसि यदि if you become so, सर्वाभरणभूषिताः adorned with all kinds of ornaments, सहस्राणि thousands, पञ्च five, दास्यः female attendants, परिचरिष्यन्ति they will serve you.

47_31.shloka: रावणेनैवमुक्ता तु कुपिता जनकात्मजा।प्रत्युवाचानवद्याङ्गी तमनादृत्य राक्षसम्।।3.47.32।।
47_31.translation: Thus addressed by Ravana, Janaki, a lady of blemishless limbs, got enraged and replied without caring for the demon:
47_31.word_by_word: रावणेन by Ravana, एवम् like that, उक्ता having been told, अनवद्याङ्गी a lady of blemishless limbs, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter(Janaki), कुपिता in rage, तम् that, राक्षसम् demon, अनादृत्य without caring, प्रत्युवाच replied.

47_32.translation: I am devoted to Rama, my husband, who is unshakeable like a huge mountain, is comparable to lord Indra and is imperturbable like the mighty ocean.
47_32.word_by_word: महागिरिमिव like a huge mountain, अकम्प्यम् unshakeable, महेन्द्रसदृशम् equal to great Indra, महोदधिमिव like a mighty sea, अक्षोभ्यम् imperturbable, पतिम् husband, रामम् Rama, अहम् I, अनुव्रता faithful follower.

47_33.translation: I am the loyal wife of venerable Rama who is endowed with all excellences, a refuge to all like  a spreading banyan tree, and a votary of truth.
47_33.word_by_word: अहम् I am, सर्वलक्षणसम्पन्नम् endowed with all excellences, न्यग्रोधपरिमण्डलम् a refuge like a spreading banyan tree, सत्यसन्धम् devoted to truth, महाभागम् venerable, रामम् Rama, अनुव्रता a loyal wife.

47_34.translation: I am the faithful wife of the longarmed, broadchested  Rama,  a lion among men. His gait is the gait of an advancing, invincible lion.
47_34.word_by_word: अहम् I am, महाबाहुम् longarmed hero, महोरस्कम् broadchested, सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् takes strides like an advancing lion, नृसिंहम् like a lion among men, सिंहसङ्काशम् invincible  like lion, रामम् Rama, अनुव्रता faithful wife.

47_35.shloka: पूर्णचन्द्राननं रामं राजवत्सं जितेन्द्रियम्।पृथुकीर्तिं महात्मानमहं राममनुव्रता।।3.47.36।।
47_35.translation: I am the devoted wife of great Rama, whose face is like a fullmoon, who is the son of a king, who has conquered his senses and whose fame is widespread (on earth).
47_35.word_by_word: अहम् I am, पुर्णचन्द्राननम् face like the full Moon, राजवत्सम् son of a king, जितेन्द्रियम्  who has conquered his senses, पृथुकीर्तिम् whose fame is widespread, महात्मानम् great self, रामम् Rama, अनुव्रता devoted wife.

47_36.shloka: त्वं पुनर्जम्बुकस्सिंहीं मामिच्छसि सुदुर्लभाम्।नाहं शक्या त्वया स्प्रष्टुमादित्यस्य प्रभा यथा।।3.47.37।।
47_36.translation: You are a jackal, and you want a lioness like me who is difficult to win. I am like the Sun's radiance whom you cannot even touch.
47_36.word_by_word: जम्बुकः jackal, त्वं पुनः you are, सुदुर्लभाम् most difficult to have, सिंहीम् a lioness, माम् me, इच्छसि you are desiring, आदित्यस्य like the Sun's, प्रभा यथा radiance, अहम् I am, त्वया by you, स्प्रष्टुम् even to touch, न शक्या not possible.

47_37.shloka: पादपान्काञ्चनान्नूनं बहून्पश्यसि मन्दभाक्।राघपस्य प्रियां भार्यां यस्त्वमिच्छसि रावण।।3.47.38।।
47_37.translation: O luckless Ravana  you want the beloved wife of Rama.You will, for sure, see golden trees. (which those close to death do).
47_37.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, यः one who, त्वम् you, राघवस्य Rama's, प्रियाम् dear, भार्याम् wife, इच्छसि you want, मन्दभाक् unfortunate, नूनम् certainly, काञ्चनान् golden, पादपान् trees, पश्यसि you will see.

47_38.translation: You are seeking to pull the teeth from  the mouth of a hungry and powerful lion who is considered the enemy of the deer(which you are). You intend to pull the fang of a poisonous snake.
47_38.word_by_word: मृगशत्रोः enemy of the deer, तरस्विनः of the powerful, क्षुधितस्य of a hungry, सिंहस्य lion's,आशीविषस्य of a poisonous snake, मुखात् from the mouth, दंष्ट्राम् teeth, आदातुम् to seize, इच्छसि intending.

47_39.shloka: मन्दरं पर्वतश्रेष्ठं पाणिना हर्तुमिच्छसि।कालकूटं विषं पीत्वा स्वस्तिमान्गन्तुमिच्छसि।।3.47.40।।
47_39.translation: You are trying to carry the greatest of mountains, the Mandara, with one hand. You are wishing to go safe after drinking deadly poison (produced from the churning of the ocean).
47_39.word_by_word: पर्वतश्रेष्ठम् greatest of the mountains, मन्दरम् Mandara, पाणिना with a hand, हर्तुम् to carry, इच्छसि want, कालकूटं विषम् deadly poison (produced from the churning of the ocean), पीत्वा after drinking, स्वस्तिमान् safely, गन्तुम् to go, इच्छसि wishing.

47_40.shloka: अक्षि सूच्या प्रमृजसि जिह्वया लेक्षि च क्षुरम्।राघवस्य प्रियां भार्यां योऽधिगन्तुं त्वमिच्छसि।।3.47.41।।
47_40.translation: You wish to violate the loving wife of Rama. You are rubbing your eyes with a needle and licking the razor with your tongue.
47_40.word_by_word: यः he who, त्वम् you, राघवस्य प्रियाम् dear to Rama, भार्याम् wife, अधिगन्तुम् violate, इच्छसि desiring to, सूच्या by needle, अक्षि eyes, प्रमृजसि rubbing, जिह्वया by your tongue, क्षुरम् razor, लेक्षि licking.

47_41.shloka: अवसज्य शिलां कण्ठे समुद्रं तर्तुमिच्छसि।सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ चोभौ पाणिभ्यां हर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.47.42।।यो रामस्य प्रियां भार्यां प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छसि।
47_41.translation: You want to assault Rama's dear wife. It is like girding a stone round the neck and trying to cross the sea.It is like intending to take the Sun and the Moon with both your hands.
47_41.word_by_word: यः he who, रामस्य Rama's, प्रियाम् very dear, भार्याम् wife, प्रधर्षयितुम् assault, इच्छसि desiring, कण्ठे in the neck, शिलाम् stone, अवसज्य after girding round the neck, समुद्रम् sea, तर्तुम् cross, इच्छसि desiring, सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ Sun and Moon, उभौ both, पाणिभ्याम् with both hands, हर्तुम् to carry, इच्छसि desiring,

47_42.shloka: अग्निं प्रज्वलितं दृष्ट्वा वस्त्रेणाहर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.47.43।।काल्याणवृत्तां रामस्य यो भार्यांहर्तुमिच्छसि।
47_42.translation: You intend to assaut the wife of Rama, who is a lady of virtuous conduct. You wish to hold blazing fire in your cloth.
47_42.word_by_word: यः one who, रामस्य Rama's, कल्याणवृत्ताम् a woman of virtuous conduct, भार्याम् wife, हर्तुम् to seize, इच्छसि you intend to, प्रज्वलितम् blazing, अग्निम् fire, दृष्ट्वा after seeing that, वस्त्रेण by cloth, आहर्तुम् to hold, इच्छसि desiring.

47_43.shloka: अयोमुखानां शूलानामग्रे चरितुमिच्छसि।।3.47.44।।रामस्य सदृशीं भार्यां योऽधिगन्तुं त्वमिच्छसि।
47_43.translation: You want to acquire Rama's worthy wife. You wish to walk on sharp ironheaded spear.
47_43.word_by_word: यः one who, त्वम् you, रामस्य Rama's, सदृशीम् his another worthy form, भार्याम् wife, अधिगन्तुम् to acquire, इच्छसि wish, अयोमुखानाम् sharp ironheaded, शूलानाम् spears, अग्रे on the top, चरितुम् to walk on, इच्छसि want.

47_44.shloka: यदन्तरं सिंहशृगालयोर्वने यदन्तरं स्यन्दिनिका समुद्रयोः।सुराग्र्य सौवीरकयोर्यदन्तरं तदन्तरं वै तव राघवस्य च।।3.47.45।।
47_44.translation: The difference between you and Rama is the difference between a jackal and a lion in the forest, between a ditch and the sea, and between sour gruel and the best of wines.
47_44.word_by_word: वने in the forest, सिंहशृगालयोः between a lion and a jackal, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, स्यन्दिनिकासमुद्रयोः between a ditch and a sea, यत् that, अन्तरम् difference, सुराग्र्य सौवीरकयोः best of wines and sour gruel, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, तव your, राघवस्य च and Rama, तत् there, अन्तरम् difference.

47_45.shloka: यदन्तरं काञ्चनसीसलोहयोर्यदन्तरं चन्दनवारिपङ्कयोः।यदन्तरं हस्तिबिडालयोर्वने तदन्तरं दाशरथेस्तवैव च।।3.47.46।।
47_45.translation: The difference between you and Rama is the difference  between gold and lead, sandal and slime, an elephant and a cat of the forest.
47_45.word_by_word: काञ्चनसीसलोहयोः between gold and lead, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, चन्दनवारिपङ्कयोः between sandal and slime, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, हस्तिबिडालयोर्वने between the elephant and the cat in the forest, दाशरथेः of Dasaratha's son, तवैव च and yours, तत् that, अन्तरम् difference.

47_46.shloka: यदन्तरं वायसवैनतेययोर्यदन्तरं मद्गुमयूरयोरपि।यदन्तरं सारसगृध्रयोर्वने तदन्तरं दाशरथेस्तवैव च।।3.47.47।।
47_46.translation: The difference between you and Dasaratha's son is the difference between a crow and Garuda, a watercrane and a peacock, a vulture and a swan in the forest.
47_46.word_by_word: वायसवैनतेययोः between a crow and and Garuda, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, मद्गुमयूरयोरपि beween a watercrane and a peacock, यत् whatever, अन्तरम् difference, वने in the forest, सारसगृध्रयोः between a vulture and a swan, यत् that amount, अन्तरम् difference, दाशरथेः Dasaratha's son, तवैव च and you, तत् that, अन्तरम् difference.

47_47.shloka: तस्मिन्सहस्राक्षसमप्रभावे रामे स्थिते कार्मुकबाणपाणौ।हृतापि तेहं न जरां गमिष्ये वज्रं यथा मक्षिकयावगीर्णम्।।3.47.48।।
47_47.translation: So long Rama, equal in prowess to the thousandeyed Indra stands with bow and arrows in hand, I will not, although abducted, wither away like a diamond gulped by an insect (fly).
47_47.word_by_word: हृतापि even if I am abducted, अहम् I, सहस्राक्षसमप्रभावे a man equal in prowess to the thousandeyed Indra, कार्मुक बाणपाणौ armed with bow and arrows, तस्मिन् when he, रामे while Rama, स्थिते when he stands, मक्षिकया by fly, अवगीर्णम् gulped (presuming it to be a grain of  rice), वज्रं यथा like a diamond, ते to you, जरां न गमिष्ये will not be withered.

47_48.shloka: इतीव तद्वाक्यमदुष्टभावा सुदुष्टमुक्त्वा रजनीचरं तम्।गात्रप्रकम्पाद्व्यथिता बभूव वातोद्धता सा कदलीव तन्वी।।3.47.49।।
47_48.translation: Having said thus to the wicked nightwalker Ravana, Sita, pure in thought remained  distressed.Her slender body started trembling like a banana plant becomes shaken by a violent wind.
47_48.word_by_word: अदुष्टभावा pure in thought, तन्वी slim, सा that, सुदुष्टम् forcefully, तं रजनीचरम् nightwalker, तत् that, वाक्यम् words, इति thus, उक्त्वा said, गात्रप्रकम्पात् due to trembling of the body, वातोद्धता shaken by violent wind, कदलीव banana, व्यथिता distressed, बभूव became.

47_49.shloka: तां वेपमानामुपलक्ष्य सीतां स रावणो मृत्युसमप्रभावः।कुलं बलं नाम च कर्म चात्मनः समाचचक्षे भयकारणार्थम्।।3.47.50।।
47_49.translation: Beholding Sita who was trembling, Ravana, powerful like death, started telling about himself, his clan, his strength and his deeds to instil more fear in her.इत्तयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
47_49.word_by_word: मृत्युसमप्रभावः powerful like death, सः that, रावणः Ravana, वेपमानाम् trembling, ताम् she, उपलक्ष्य beholding, भयकारणार्थम् to create more fear, आत्मनः of himself, कुलम् clan, बलं च and strength, कर्म च deeds, समाचचक्षे gave an account of.

48_1.shloka: [Ravana takes on his true form -- speaks of his glory -- Sita abuses Ravana in harsh words.]एवं बृवन्त्यां सीतायां संरब्दः परुषं वचः।ललाटे भृकुटीं कृत्वा रावणः प्रत्युवाच ह।।3.48.1।।
48_1.translation: Addressed thus by Sita, Ravana, his anger roused, knitted his eyebrows with a frown on his forehead and replied to her harshly:
48_1.word_by_word: सीतायाम् when Sita, एवम् in that way, बृवन्त्याम् as she spoke, रावणः Ravana, संरब्धः roused to anger, ललाटे forehead, भृकुटीम् knitted eyebrows, कृत्वा doing, परुषम् harsh, वचः words, प्रत्युवाच replied.

48_2.shloka: भ्राता वैश्रवणस्याहं सापत्न्यो वरवर्णिनि।रावणो नाम भद्रं ते दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान्।।3.48.2।।
48_2.translation: O paragon of beauty  I am the halfbrother of Kubera, born of his stepmother. I am known as the tenheaded, powerful Ravana. Be blessed
48_2.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनि most beautiful woman, अहम् I, वैश्रवणस्य of Kubera's, सापत्न्यः stepmother's son, भ्राता brother, दशग्रीवः ten headed, प्रतापवान् powerful, रावणो नाम called Ravana, ते to you, भद्रम् be pleased.

48_3.shloka: यस्य देवास्सगन्धर्वाः पिशाचपतगोरगाः।विद्रवन्ति भयाद्भीता मृत्योरिव सदा प्रजाः।।3.48.3।।
48_3.translation: Just as people get scared of death, all (creatures) including gandharvas, gods, evil spirits, birds and snakes run away from me.
48_3.word_by_word: प्रजाः people, मृत्योरिव like death, यस्य whose, भयात् out of fear, भीताः scared of, सगन्धर्वाः including gandharvas, देवाः gods, पिशाचपतगोरगा: evil spirits, birds and serpents, विद्रवन्ति run away.

48_4.shloka: येन वैश्रवणो राजा द्वैमात्रः कारणान्तरे।द्वन्द्वमासादितः क्रोधाद्रणे विक्रम्य निर्जितः।।3.48.4।।
48_4.translation: For some reason or other a duel took place between me and king Kubera. With my prowess, I defeated him in the duel.
48_4.word_by_word: येन by whom, कारणान्तरे for some other reason, क्रोधात् in anger, द्वन्द्वम् duel, आसादितः took place, द्वैमात्रः stepmother, वैश्रवणः राजा king Vaisravana, रणे in war, विक्रम्य with my prowess, निर्जितः was defeated.

48_5.translation: Out of fear for me, Kubera is residing on the mighty mount Kailasa, leaving his own earlier prosperous place of residence.
48_5.word_by_word: नरवाहनः Kubera (having a human being as his carrier), यद्भयार्तः due to fear of whom, ऋद्धिमत् prosperous, स्वम् his own, अधिष्ठानम् place of residence, परित्यज्य giving up, पर्वतश्रेष्ठम् mighty mountain, कैलासम् Kailasa, अध्यास्ते  residing.

48_6.shloka: यस्य तत्पुष्पकं नाम विमानं कामगं शुभम्।वीर्यादेवार्जितं भद्रे येन यामि विहायसम्।।3.48.6।।
48_6.translation: O noble lady  with my valour I gained over from Kubera the aerial chariot 'Pushpaka',which can go wherever one desires and in which I move about in the sky.
48_6.word_by_word: भद्रे O noble lady, यस्य whose, तत् that, पुष्पकं नाम by name Pushpaka, कामगम् goes where one desires, शुभम् auspicious, विमानम् chariot, वीर्यादेव by valour alone, आर्जितम् gained over, येन in which, विहायसम् sky, यामि I move about.

48_7.shloka: मम सञ्जातरोषस्य मुखं दृष्ट्वैव मैथिलि।विद्रवन्ति परित्रस्तास्सुराश्शक्रपुरोगमाः।।3.48.7।।
48_7.translation: O Princess from Mithila, seeing my angry face  even gods led by Indra take to their heels in fear.
48_7.word_by_word: मैथिलि O Maithili, सञ्जातरोषस्य when I get angry, मम my, मुखम् face, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing alone, परित्रस्ताः frightened , शक्रपुरोगमाः led by Indra, सुराः gods, विद्रवन्ति run away.

48_8.shloka: यत्र तिष्ठाम्यहं तत्र मारुतो वाति शङ्कितः।तीव्रांशुश्शिशिरांशुश्च भयात्सम्पद्यते रविः।।3.48.8।।
48_8.translation: Wherever I am, the Windgod blows with hesitation. So are the Sun and the Moon afraid of me. Afraid of me the Sun duly discharges his duties.
48_8.word_by_word: अहम् I am, यत्र wherever, तिष्ठामि stay, तत्र there, मारुतः the Windgod, शङ्कितः hesitantly, वाति blows, तीव्रांशुः the Sun with scorching rays, रविः च even Sun, भयात् in fear, शिशिरांशुः Moon of cool radiance, सम्पद्यते discharges duties.

48_9.shloka: निष्कम्पपत्रास्तरवो नद्यश्च स्तिमितोदकाः।भवन्ति यत्र यत्राहं तिष्ठामि विचरामि च।।3.48.9।।
48_9.translation: Wherever I stay or move about, the leaves of trees do not shake, and the waters in rivers remain still.
48_9.word_by_word: अहम् I am, यत्र यत्र wherever, तिष्ठामि stay, विचरामि move about, उदकाः water, निष्कम्पपत्राः  with their leaves, तरवः trees, नद्यश्च the rivers also, स्तिमितोदकाः have still waters, भवन्ति   remain.

48_10.shloka: मम पारे समुद्रस्य लङ्का नाम पुरी शुभा।सम्पूर्णा राक्षसैर्घोरैर्यथेन्द्रस्यामरावती।।3.48.10।।
48_10.translation: My city known as Lanka, teeming with terrific demons, is on the other side of the sea. It is  beautiful like the city of Indra's Amaravati.
48_10.word_by_word: घोरैः by the terrific, राक्षसैः by demons, सम्पूर्णा filled with, लङ्का नाम known as Lanka, शुभा auspicious, इंद्रस्य Indra's, अमरावतीव like Amaravati, मम my, पुरी city, समुद्रस्य on these, पारे shore.

48_11.shloka: प्राकारेण परिक्षिप्ता पाण्डुरेण विराजता।हेमकक्ष्या पुरी रम्या वैढूर्यमयतोरणा।।3.48.11।।
48_11.translation: The beautiful city of Lanka  shines with its pale white ramparts and golden interiors. The entrance gates are encrusted with vaidurya (cat'seye).
48_11.word_by_word: रम्या beautiful, पाण्डुरेण pale white, विराजता  shining , प्राकारेण by a ramparts, परिक्षिप्ता surrounded, हेमकक्ष्या interiors built of gold, वैढूर्यमयतोरणा entrance gates encrusted with vaidurya (cat's eye).

48_12.translation: It is crowded with elephants, horses and chariots. It resounds with the music of trumpets. The trees in the delightful pleasuregardens yield fruits in all seasons.
48_12.word_by_word: हस्त्यश्वरथसम्बाधा crowded with elephants, horses, and chariots, तूर्यनादविनादिता resounding with trumpets, सर्वकालफलैः yielding fruits in all seasons, वृक्षैः by  trees, सङ्कुलोद्यानशोभिता looks splendid with delightful pleasuregardens.

48_13.shloka: तत्र त्वं वसती सीते राजपुत्रि मया सह।न स्मरिष्यसि नारीणां मानुषीणां मनस्विनि।।3.48.13।।
48_13.translation: O highminded princess, O Sita while living with me, you will not even think of other women.
48_13.word_by_word: राजपुत्रि princess, मनस्विनि highminded, सीते Sita, तत्र there, मया सह along with me, वसती  while residing, मानुषीणाम् of human beings, नारीणाम् of women, न स्मरिष्यसि you will not think of.

48_14.shloka: भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्दिव्यांश्च वरवर्णिनि।न स्मरिष्यसि रामस्य मानुषस्य गतायुषः।।3.48.14।।
48_14.translation: O blessed lady of fine complexion, while enjoying both human and heavenly  pleasures with me there, you will not remember Rama who is a mortal of short lifespan.
48_14.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनि blessed lady of excellant complexion, मानुषान् mortals, भोगान् pleasures, दिव्यांश्च  wonderful as well as divine, भुञ्जाना enjoying, मानुषस्य mortals, गतायुषः of a short lifespan, रामस्य Rama's, न स्मरिष्यिसि not think of.

48_15.shloka: स्थापयित्वा प्रियं पुत्रं राज्ञा दशरथेन यः।मन्दवीर्यस्सुतो ज्येष्ठस्ततः प्रस्थापितो वनम्।।3.48.15।।
48_15.translation: Considering the eldest son a weakling, king Dasaratha has sent him away to the forest so that he could consecrate his dear son(Bharata).
48_15.word_by_word: राज्ञा by the king, दशरथेन Dasaratha's, प्रियम् dear, पुत्रम्  son (Bharata), स्थापयित्वा consecrating, ततः then, मन्दवीर्यः weakling, ज्येष्ठः सुतः eldest son, यः one who is, वनम् forest, प्रस्थापितः sent away.

48_16.shloka: तेन किं भ्रष्टराज्येन रामेण गतचेतसा।करिष्यसि विशालाक्षि तापसेन तपस्विना।।3.48.16।।
48_16.translation: O largeeyed Sita dislodged from the kingdom, Rama has lost his capacity to think. He is doing penance, assuming an ascetic role. What can he do (for you)?
48_16.word_by_word: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed, भ्रष्टराज्येन  dislodged from the kingdom, गतचेतसा lost the capacity to think, तापसेन ascetic, तपस्विना by a pitiable man, तेन रामेण such Rama, किं करिष्यसि what can he do (for you) ?

48_17.translation: I am lord of all the demons. You should not reject me I am here (only because I am) overcome by the arrows of the god of love.
48_17.word_by_word: कामात् owing to passion, स्वयम् I myself, इह here, आगतम् came, मन्मथशराविष्टम्   overcome by the arrows of the god of love, सर्वराक्षसभर्तारम् lord of all demons, त्वम्  you, प्रत्याख्यातुम् to reject, न अर्हसि not proper.

48_18.shloka: प्रत्याख्याय हि मां भीरु परितापं गमिष्यसि।चरणेनाभिहत्येव पुरूरवसमूर्वशी।।3.48.18।।
48_18.translation: O timid lady if you reject me, you will regret like Urvasi who kicked Pururava and regretted later.
48_18.word_by_word: भीरु O timid lady, माम् me, प्रत्याख्याय after you reject, पुरूरवसम् Pururava, चरणेन by the feet, अभिहत्य kicking, ऊर्वशीव like Urvasi, परितापम् regret, गमिष्यसि will you experience later.

48_19.shloka: अङ्गुल्या न समो रामो मम युद्धे स मानुषः।तव भाग्येन सम्प्राप्तं भजस्व वरवर्णिनि।।3.48.19।।
48_19.translation: O lady of fine complexion, Rama is a (mere) mortal. In war he is no match (even) for my finger. It is your good fortune that you have got me here. Take refuge in me.
48_19.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनि O lady of fine complexion, मानुषः a mere mortal, सः रामः that Rama, युद्धे in war, मम for me, अङ्गुल्या with my finger, समः equal, न not, तव your, भाग्येन by your luck,सम्प्राप्तम्  have I come, भजस्व take refuge.

48_20.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही क्रुद्धा संरक्तलोचना।अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं रहिते राक्षसाधिपम्।।3.48.20।।
48_20.translation: Thus addressed, Sita was enraged and her eyes turned red. She replied in harsh words to the chief of the demons in that solitary place:.
48_20.word_by_word: एवम् that way, उक्ता told, वैदेही Vaidehi, क्रुद्धा enraged, संरक्तलोचना eyes turned red, रहिते in that solitary place, राक्षसाधिपम् chief of the demons, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत्  said.

48_21.shloka: कथं वैश्रवणं देवं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम्।भ्रातरं व्यपदिश्य त्वमशुभं कर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.48.21।।
48_21.translation: Why do you wish to do something inauspicious by calling Lord Kubera who is worshipped by all beings your brother ?
48_21.word_by_word: सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् worshipped by all beings, देवम् god, वैश्रवणम्  Kubera, भ्रातरम् brother, व्यपदिश्य addressing him, त्वम् you, अशुभम् inauspicious deed, कर्तुम् to do, कथम् how come, इच्छसि you desire.

48_22.shloka: अवश्यं विनशिष्यन्ति सर्वे रावण राक्षसाः।येषां त्वं कर्कशो राजा दुर्बुद्धिरजितेन्द्रियः।।3.48.22।।
48_22.translation: O Ravana ,you are cruel and evilminded. You have no control over your senses. (And yet) you are the ruler of your breed. Surely they are going to be destroyed.
48_22.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, कर्कशः cruel, दुर्बुद्धि: evilminded, अजितेन्द्रियः having no control over the senses, त्वम्  you, येषाम् of whom, राजा king, सर्वे all of them, राक्षसाः demons, अवश्यम् certainly, विनशिष्यन्ति will be destroyed.

48_23.shloka: अपहृत्य शचीं भार्यां शक्यमिन्द्रस्य जीवितुम्।न च रामस्य भार्यां मामपनीयास्ति जीवितम्।।3.48.23।।
48_23.translation: It may be possible (for some one) to live after abducting Indra's wife, Sachi, but it is not possible for any one to live after kidnapping the wife of Rama.
48_23.word_by_word: इन्द्रस्य Indra's, भार्याम् wife, शची Sachi, अपहृत्य after abducting, जीवितुम् to live, शक्यम् may be possible, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, माम् me, अपनीय after carrying away, जीवितम् life, नास्ति not there.

48_24.shloka: जीवेच्चिरं वज्रधरस्य हस्ताच्छचीं प्रधृष्याप्रतिरूपरूपाम्।न मादृशीं राक्षस दूशयित्वा पीतामृतस्यापि तवास्ति मोक्षः।।3.48.24।।
48_24.translation: O demon, you may live long after forcibly snatching the most beautiful Sachi, from the hands of Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, but after abusing a woman like me, you will not be released from death even if you drink nectar.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyeighty sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
48_24.word_by_word: राक्षस demon, अप्रातिरूपरूपाम् most beautiful lady, शचीम् Sachi, वज्रधरस्य wielder of the thunderbolt, Indra's, हस्ताम् from the hands, प्रधृष्य after snatching, चिरम् long, जीवेत्  may live, मादृशीम् one like me, दूषयित्वा after assualting, पीतामृतस्यापि even after drinking  nectar, तव your, मोक्षः release from death, न not possible.

49_1.shloka: [Ravana carries away Sita in his chariot-- she screams and wails aloud -- implores the animals, trees, mountains and rivers to tell Rama about her.]सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवः प्रतापवाम्।हस्ते हस्तं समाहत्य चकार सुमहद्वपुः।।3.49.1।।
49_1.translation: On hearing the Sita's words, the powerful Ravana struck his palms one over the other and assumed a huge form (original figure).
49_1.word_by_word: प्रतापवाम् powerful, दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, हस्ते by the palm, हस्तम् palm, समाहत्य  striking, सुमहत् very great, वपुः body, चकार  assumed.

49_2.shloka: स मैथिलीं पुनर्वाक्यं बभाषे च ततो भृशम्।नोन्मत्तया श्रुतौ मन्ये मम वीर्यपराक्रमौ।।3.49.2।।
49_2.translation: Ravana again said to that princess from Mithila, I suppose you are too insane to disregard my strength and valour.
49_2.word_by_word: सः Ravana, मैथिलीम् Maithili, पुनः again, वाक्यम् these words, भृशम् very much, बभाषे said, उन्मत्तया by madness, मम my, वीर्यपराक्रमौ strength and valour, न श्रुतौ not heard, मन्ये I suppose.

49_3.shloka: उद्वहेयं भुजाभ्यां तु मेदिनीमम्बरे स्थितः।आपिबेयं समुद्रं च हन्यां मृत्युं रणे स्थितः।।3.49.3।।
49_3.translation: Standing in the sky, I can  lift the earth with my arms.  I can drink the oceans. I can kill even the god of death in a combat.
49_3.word_by_word: अम्बरे in the sky, स्थितः standing, भुजाभ्याम् with my arms, मेदिनीम् the earth, उद्वहेयम् lift, समुद्रं च and oceans, आपिबेयम् can drink away, रणे in war, स्थितः standing, मृत्युम् for death, हन्याम् can cause death.

49_4.shloka: अर्कं ऱुन्ध्यां शरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्विभिन्द्या हि महीतलम्।कामरूपिणमुन्मत्ते पश्य मां कामदं पतिम्।।3.49.4।।
49_4.translation: I can obstruct the Sun and shatter the earth with my sharp arrows. O mad woman I am a husband who can fulfil your desires, and can assume any form at my own free will. Look at me.
49_4.word_by_word: अर्कम् Sun, ऱुन्ध्याम् can obstruct, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, महीतलम् earth, विभिन्द्याम् I can shatter, उन्मत्ते O mad woman, कामदम् who can fulfil desires, पतिम् husband, कामरूपिणम् who can assume any form at will, माम् me, पश्य see.

49_5.shloka: एवमुक्तवतस्तस्य सूर्यकल्पे शिखिप्रभे।क्रुद्धस्य हरिपर्यन्ते रक्ते नेत्रे बभूवतुः।।3.49.5।।
49_5.translation: As Ravana exploded in anger, his ambercoloured eyes turned red like the radiance of the flaming fire, and almost as bright as the Sun.
49_5.word_by_word: एवम् in that manner, उक्तवतः as he spoke, क्रुद्धस्य  full of anger, तस्य his, सूर्यकल्पे almost like the Sun, शिखिप्रभे  radiance of flaming fire, हरिपर्यन्ते ambercoloured at the corners, नेत्रे eyes, रक्ते red, बभुवतुः became.

49_6.shloka: सद्यस्सौम्यं परित्यज्य भिक्षुरूपं स रावणः।स्वं रूपं कालरूपाभं भेजे वैश्रवणानुजः।।3.49.6।।
49_6.translation: Ravana, brother of Kubera, shed the gentle figure of a mendicant and assumed the form of the god of death.
49_6.word_by_word: वैश्रवणानुजः younger brother of Kubera, सद्यः instantly, सौम्यम् gentle, भिक्षुरूपम् form of a  mendicant, परित्यज्य shed, स्वम् his, कालरूपाभम् the form of the god of death, रूपम् figure, भेजे assumed.

49_7.shloka: संरक्तनयनश्श्रीमांस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणः।क्रोधेन महताविष्टो नीलजीमूतसन्निभः।।3.49.7।।दशास्यः कार्मुकी बाणी बभूव क्षणदाचरः।
49_7.translation: Overcome by intense anger, Ravana's eyes reddened. The nightranger, stood armed with bow and arrows and shining with glittering gold ornaments, appeared like a black cloud.
49_7.word_by_word: महता with intense, क्रोधेन with anger, आविष्टः overcome, संरक्तनयनः with reddened eyes, श्रीमान् shining, तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणः  glittering golden ornaments, नीलजीमूतसन्निभः looking like a dark cloud, दशास्यः the tenfaced Ravana, कार्मुकी with bow, बाणी with arrows, क्षणदाचरः nightranger, बभूव became.

49_8.shloka: स परिव्राजकच्छद्म महाकायो विहाय तत्।।3.49.8।।प्रतिपद्य स्वकं रूपं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।संरक्तनयनः क्रोधाज्जीमूतनिचयप्रभः।।3.49.9।।रक्ताम्बरधरस्तस्थौ स्त्रीरत्नं प्रेक्ष्य मैथिलीम्।
49_8.translation: Ravana, chief of the demons, shed the mendicant's form and assumed his real self. Clad in red garments, his eyes turned red in anger. Looking like layers of clouds, he stood in front of Sita, a gem among women.
49_8.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः chief of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, तत् that, परिव्राजकच्छद्म figure of a mendicant, विहाय shedding, स्वकम् his real, रूपम् form, प्रतिपद्य assuming, क्रोधात् in anger, संरक्त नयनः red eyes, जीमूतनिचयप्रभः radiating like layers of clouds, रक्ताम्बरधरः wearing red garments, स्त्रीरत्नम् gem of a woman, मैथिलीम् to Sita, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, तस्थौ stood in front.

49_9.shloka: स तामसितकेशान्तां भास्करस्य प्रभामिव।।3.49.10।।वसनाभरणोपेतां मैथिलीं रावणोऽब्रवीत्।
49_9.translation: Ravana said to the princess from Mithila, whose black hair was shining, who was luminous like the Sun and was clad in the best of clothes and ornaments.
49_9.word_by_word: सः that, रावणः Ravana, असितकेशान्ताम् a lady with shining black hair, भास्करस्य the Sun's, प्रभामिव like the radiance, वसनाभरणोपेताम् robed in the best of clothes and ornaments, मैथिलीम् to SIta, अब्रवीत् said.

49_10.shloka: त्रिषु लोकेषु विख्यातं यदि भर्तारमिच्छसि।।3.49.11।।मामाश्रय वरारोहे तवाहं सदृशः पतिः।
49_10.translation: O beautiful lady  if you desire a husband who is famous in the three worlds, take refuge in me. I am fit to be your husband.
49_10.word_by_word: वरारोहे O beautiful lady, त्रिषुलोकेषु in the three worlds, विख्यातम् famous, भर्तारम् husband, इच्छसि you desire, यदि so, माम् me, आश्रय take refuge in, अहम् I, तव your, सदृशः fit, पतिः husband.

49_11.shloka: मां भजस्व चिराय त्वमहं श्लाघ्यः प्रियस्तव।।3.49.12।।नैव चाहं क्वचिद्भद्रे करिष्ये तव विप्रियम्।त्यज्यतां मानुषे भावो मयि भावः प्रणीयताम्।।3.49.13।।
49_11.translation: I am your praiseworthy husband. I will not cause any unpleasantness to you at any time. Abandon on your inclination towards, a (mere) mortal. Divert your love to me.
49_11.word_by_word: भद्रे O auspicious lady, चिराय for long, माम् me, भजस्व accept, अहम् I am, तव your, श्लाघ्यः praiseworthy, प्रियः (पतिः) husband, अहम् I am, क्वचित् at any time, तव your, विप्रियम् unpleasantness, न करिष्ये चwill not cause, मानुषे mortal , भावः your attachment, त्यज्यताम्  abandon, मयि in me, भावः inclination, प्रणीयताम् diverted.

49_12.shloka: राज्याच्च्युतमसिद्धार्थं रामं परिमितायुषम्।कैर्गुणैरनुरक्तासि मूढे पण्डितमानिनि।।3.49.14।।यः स्त्रिया वचनाद्राज्यं विहाय ससुहृज्जनम्।अस्मिन्व्यालानुचरिते वने वसति दुर्मतिः।।3.49.15।।
49_12.translation: O stupid woman you think you are very wise. What is there in Rama so that you are attached to him ? He has left the kingdom and his kith and kin due to the words of a woman. He has not accomplished anything (in life). He has a limited life span and now lives in this forest haunted by wild animals.
49_12.word_by_word: मुढे O stupid woman, पण्डितमानिनि you think you are wise, दुर्मतिः wicked, यः he, स्त्रियाः woman's, वचनात् word, ससुहृज्जनम् including friends, राज्यम् kingdom, विहाय after leaving, व्यालानुचरिते  haunted by wild animals, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, चरति moves, राज्यात् from the kingdom, च्युतम् banished, असिद्धार्थम् who has not accomplished any objective, परिमितायुषम् of limited life, रामम् Rama, कैः by what, गुणैः virtues, अनुरक्ता a attached, असि are you.

49_13.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा मैथिलीं वाक्यं प्रियार्हां प्रियवादिनीम्।अभिगम्य सुदुष्टात्मा राक्षसः काममोहितः।।3.49.16।।जग्राह रावणस्सीतां बुधः खे रोहिणीमिव।
49_13.translation: Just as Budha (planet Mercury) catches Rohini (a cluster of five stars) in the sky, the evilminded, infatuated Ravana advanced towards the pitiable, pleasing Sita and caught hold of her.
49_13.word_by_word: सुदुष्टात्मा evilminded, काममोहितः infatuated, राक्षसः demon, रावणः Ravana, प्रियार्हाम् worthy of pity, प्रियवादिनीम् speaks pleasing words, मैथिलीम् Maithili, इति thus, उक्त्वा said, अभिगम्य going towards, खे बुधः Mercury in the sky, रोहिणीमिव like Rohini, सीताम् Sita, जग्राह caught hold of.

49_14.shloka: वामेन सीतां पद्माक्षीं मूर्धजेषु करेण सः।।3.49.17।।ऊर्वोस्तु दक्षिणेनैव परिजग्राह पाणिना।
49_14.translation: Ravana seized with his left hand the lotuseyed Sita by the hair and lifted her by the thighs with his right hand.
49_14.word_by_word: सः that Ravana, पद्माक्षीम् lotuseyed, सीताम् Sita, वामेन करेण with his left hand, मूर्धजेषु  holding her hair, दक्षिणेन पाणिना with right hand, ऊर्वोः under her thighs, प्रतिजग्राह held her.

49_15.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा मृत्युसङ्काशं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रं महाभुजम्।।3.49.18।।प्राद्रवन्गिरिसङ्काशं भयार्ता वनदेवताः।
49_15.translation: The sylvan deities fled out of fear on seeing the dreadful appearance of Ravana who had sharp teeth and mighty arms. He looked like a mountain, a veritable god of death.
49_15.word_by_word: मृत्युसङ्काशम् like the god of death, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रम् with sharp teeth, महाभुजम् mightyarmed, गिरिसङ्काशम्  like a mountain, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, वनदेवताः deities of the forest, भयार्ताः out of fear, प्राद्रवन् fled.

49_16.shloka: स च मायामयो दिव्यः खरयुक्तः खरस्वनः।।3.49.19।।प्रत्यदृश्यत हेमाङ्गो रावणस्य महारथः।
49_16.translation: There arrived the great  golden chariot of Ravana, illusive and wonderful, harnessed with donkeys and braying like donkeys.
49_16.word_by_word: मायामयः illusive form, दिव्यः divine, खरयुक्तः harnessed by donkeys, खरस्वनः brayins of  asses, हेमाङ्गः goldenlimbed, रावणस्य Ravana's, सः महारथः that great chariot, प्रत्यदृश्यत apeared.

49_17.translation: Reproaching the princess from Videha loudly and harshly, Ravana took her on his lap and put her on the chariot.
49_17.word_by_word: तदा then, महास्वनः Ravana in a loud voice, सः he, तां वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, परुषैः with harsh, वाक्यैः words, भर्त्सयन् reproaching, अङ्केन on his lap, आदाय on lifting, रथम् chariot, आरोपयत् placed.

49_18.shloka: सा गृहीता विचुक्रोश रावणेन यशस्स्विनी।।3.49.21।।रामेति सीता दुःखार्ता रामं दूरगतंवने।
49_18.translation: Seized by Ravana, illustrious Sita screamed aloud Alas, Rama. for one who was far away in the forest.
49_18.word_by_word: रावणेन by Ravana, गृहीता seized, यशस्स्विनी illustrious, सा सीता that Sita, दुःखार्ता helpless in grief, वने in the forset, दूरगतम् who was far away, रामम् Rama, राम इति saying, Alas Rama, विचुक्रोश screamed aloud.

49_19.translation: Passionate Ravana took hold of Sita who was not willing and was writhing in pain. He seized her  like (an eagle carrying away) a serpent queen and flew up.
49_19.word_by_word: अथ then, कामार्तः passionate, सः that, रावणः Ravana, अकामाम् not willing, पन्नगेन्द्रवधूमिव like a serpent queen, विवेष्टमानाम् writhing hard, ताम् her, आदाय seized,उत्पपात flew up.

49_20.shloka: ततस्सा राक्षसेन्द्रेण ह्रियमाणा विहायसा।।3.49.23।।भृशं चुक्रोश मत्तेव भ्रान्तचित्ता यथाऽऽतुरा।
49_20.translation: While Sita was being carried off in the sky by the king of demons,   she screamed a lot in agony and anxiety like a mad woman in a bewildered state:
49_20.word_by_word: ततः then, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the king of demons, विहायसा through the sky, ह्रियमाणा being carried off, सा that Sita, मत्तेव like a mad woman, भ्रान्तचित्ता with a bewildered mind, आतुराanxious, यथा like, भृशम् चुक्रोश screamed a lot in agony.

49_21.shloka: हा लक्ष्मण महाबाहो गुरुचित्तप्रसादक।।3.49.24।।ह्रियमाणां न जानीषे रक्षसा माममर्षिणा।
49_21.translation: Alas, O longarmed Lakshmana, you who used to entertain your brother do not know that I am being carried away by this ruthless demon.
49_21.word_by_word: महाबाहो O longarmed Lakshmana, गुरुचित्तप्रसादक  who entertains the brother's mind, हा लक्ष्मण Alas, Lakshmana, अमर्षिणा by this angry, रक्षसा demon, माम् me, ह्रियमाणाम् being carried away, न जानीषे you do not know.

49_22.shloka: जीवितं सुखमर्थांश्च धर्महेतोः परित्यजन्।।3.49.25।।ह्रियमाणामधर्मेण मां राघव न पश्यसि।
49_22.translation: O Rama, you have given up your life, pleasure and treasure for the sake of righteousness. Do you not see me carried off by an unrighteous fellow ?
49_22.word_by_word: जीवितम् life, सुखम् comfort, अर्थांश्च treasure, धर्महेतोः for the sake of righteousness, परित्यजन् giving up, राघव O Rama, अधर्मेण by unrighteous, ह्रियमाणाम्   carried off, माम् me, न पश्यसि do you not see.

49_23.shloka: ननु नामाविनीतानां विनेतासि परन्तप।।3.49.26।।कथमेवंविधं पापं न त्वं शासि हि रावणम्।
49_23.translation: O scorcher of enemies you are the chastiser of the haughty. Why do you not punish such a sinner like Ravana.
49_23.word_by_word: परन्तप scorcher of enemies, अविनीतानाम् of the haughty, विनेता a chastiser, असि ननु as such, एवंविधम् such, पापम् sinner, रावणम् Ravana, कथम् how is it, हि indeed, शासि you are not punishing?

49_24.shloka: ननु सद्योऽविनीतस्य दृश्यते कर्मणःफलम्।।3.49.27।।कालोऽप्यङ्गीभवत्यत्र सस्यानामिव पक्तये।
49_24.translation: The effect of arrogant action cannot be seen right away. Just as the crop yields results only after ripening, in the same way it takes time. Time acts as a supporting factor.
49_24.word_by_word: अविनीतस्य arrogant, कर्मणः action, फलम् result, सद्यः right now, न दृश्यते नु not seen, सस्यानाम् crop, पक्तये इव ripening, अत्र in the same way, कालोऽपि it takes time also, अङ्गीभवति serves as a supporting factor.

49_25.translation: Time has taken a toll of your senses. This has made you do what you have done. A great calamity is awaiting you in the hands of Rama. It will end your life.
49_25.word_by_word: त्वम् you, कालोपहतचेतनः time has taken a toll of your senses, एतत् this, कर्म action, कृतवान् have done, रामात् from Rama, जीवितान्तकरम् leading towards the end of your life, घोरम् dreadful, व्यसनम् sorrow, आप्नुहि will befall.

49_26.shloka: हन्तेदानीं सकामास्तु कैकेयी सह बान्धवैः।।3.49.29।।ह्रिये यद्धर्मकामस्य धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनः।
49_26.translation: Alas, the lawful wife of the glorious and righteous Rama is being abducted now. LetKaikeyi along with her relations be happy with her desire fulfilled.
49_26.word_by_word: धर्मकामस्य of one who wants to discharge righteous duties, यशस्विनः of the glorious, धर्मपत्नी lawful wife, यत् such, ह्रिये being carried away, इदानीम् now, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, बान्धवैः सह along with her relations, सकामा her desires, अस्तु may be fulfilled, हन्त alas.

49_27.shloka: आमन्त्रये जनस्थाने कर्णिकारान्सुपुष्पितान्।।3.49.30।।क्षिप्रं रामाय शंसध्वं सीतां हरति रावणः।
49_27.translation: O karnikar trees in full bloom in Janasthana, tell Rama quickly that Ravana is kidnapping Sita.
49_27.word_by_word: जनस्थाने in Janasthana, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, कर्णिकारान् karnikara trees, आमन्त्रये pray, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, हरति is abducting, क्षिप्रम् at once, रामाय to Rama, शंसध्वम् tell him.

49_28.shloka: माल्यवन्तं शिखरिणं वन्दे प्रस्रवणं गिरिम्।।3.49.31।।क्षिप्रं रामाय शंस त्वं सीतां हरति रावणः।
49_28.translation: I salute to Malyavan and  Prasravana mountains. Tell Rama at once that Ravana is carrying away Sita.
49_28.word_by_word: माल्यवन्तम् Malyavan, शिखरिणम्  mountain, प्रस्रवणं गिरिम् mount Prasravana, वन्दे I salute, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, हरति abducting, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् at once, रामाय to Rama, शंस tell.

49_29.shloka: हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णां वन्दे गोदावरीं नदीम्।।3.49.32।।क्षिप्रं रामाय शंस त्वं सीतां हरति रावणः।
49_29.translation: O river Godavari abounding in swans and cranes, my salutations to you  Tell Rama immediately that Ravana is taking away Sita.
49_29.word_by_word: हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णां filled with swans and cranes, गोदावरीं नदीम् river Godavari, वन्दे my salutations to you, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, हरति is carrying away, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् immediately, रामाय Rama, शंस tell.

49_30.shloka: दैवतानि च यान्यस्मिन्वने विविधपादपे।।3.49.33।।नमस्करोम्यहं तेभ्योभर्तुश्शंसत मां हृताम्।
49_30.translation: I offer my salutations to different deities residing in this forest abounding in trees of many kinds. Tell my husband about me that I am being whisked away.
49_30.word_by_word: विविधपादपे various trees, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, यानि those, दैवतानि deities, (सन्ति residing here), तेभ्यः to them, अहम् I, नमस्करोमि I offer salutations, माम् me, हृताम् taken away, भर्तुः to my husband, शंसत Tell.

49_31.shloka: यानि कानि चिदप्यत्र सत्त्वानि निवसन्त्युत।।3.49.34।।सर्वाणि शरणं यामि मृगपक्षिगणानपि।
49_31.translation: I seek refuge in all those living beings as well as herds of animals and birds in the forest.
49_31.word_by_word: अत्र here, यानि कानि चित् all the animals of the forest, सत्त्वानि living beings, निवसन्ति are  residing, सर्वाणि all, मृगपक्षिगणानपि including herds of animals and birds, शरणम् I seek refuge, यामि I seek.

49_32.shloka: ह्रियमाणां प्रियां भर्तुः प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम्।।3.49.35।।विवशाऽपहृता सीता रावणेनेति शंसत।
49_32.translation: Tell Rama that his dear wife Sita whom he loves more than his life is abducted helplessly.
49_32.word_by_word: प्राणेभ्योऽपि more than his life, गरीयसीम्  valuable lady, ह्रियमाणाम्  carried away, प्रियाम् beloved, विवशा helpless lady, सीता Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, अपहृता इति is abducted like this, भर्तुः to my husband, शंसत tell.

49_33.shloka: विदित्वा मां महाबाहुरमुत्रापि महाबलः।।3.49.36।।आनेष्यति पराक्रम्य वैवस्वतहृतामपि।
49_33.translation: If he knows that I am abducted by Yama, the god of death, that mighty, longarmed hero will save me even from there by virtue of his valour.
49_33.word_by_word: महाबलः mighty, महाबाहुः longarmed, वैवस्वतहृतामपि even if abducted by Vaivasvata, lord of death, माम् me, अमुत्रापि from there also, विदित्वा knowing, पराक्रम्य by his valour, आनेष्यति can get back.

49_34.shloka: सा तदा करुणा वाचो विलपन्ती सुदुःखिता।।3.49.37।।वनस्पतिगतं गृध्रं ददर्शाऽयतलोचना।
49_34.translation: When the griefstricken, largeeyed Sita was lamenting piteously, she saw the vulture (Jatayu) seated on a tree.
49_34.word_by_word: तदा then, करुणाः piteously, वाचः words, विलपन्ती pleading crying, आयतलोचना large eyed, सा that lady, सुदुःखिता very sadly, वनस्पतिगतम् seated on the tree, गृध्रम् vulture, ददर्श saw.

49_35.shloka: सा तमुद्वीक्ष्य सुश्रोणी रावणस्य वशं गता।3.49.38।।समाक्रन्दद्भयपरा दुःखोपहतया गिरा।
49_35.translation: The heavyhipped Sita felt frightened in the grip of Ravana. When she saw Jatayu she screamed, shaken by sorrow:
49_35.word_by_word: रावणस्य Ravana's, वशम् grip, गता gone, सुश्रोणी heavyhipped Sita, भयपरा frightened, सा she, तम् him, उद्वीक्ष्य seeing him, दुःखोपहतया shaken up by sorrow, गिरा with words, समाक्रन्दत् screamed.

49_36.shloka: जटायो पश्य मामद्य ह्रियमाणामनाथवत्।।3.49.39।।अनेन राक्षसेन्द्रेण करुणं पापकर्मणा।
49_36.translation: O Jatayu, see me now being carried away by the sinful king of demons in this pitiable condition as though I am an orphan.
49_36.word_by_word: जटायो O Jatayu, अद्य now, अनेन by this one, पापकर्मणा by sinful deeds, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the king of demons, अनाथवत् like an orphan, करुणम् in a desparate way, ह्रियमाणाम् being carried away, माम् me, पश्य see.

49_37.shloka: नैष वारयितुं शक्यस्तव क्रूरो निशाचरः।।3.49.40।।सत्त्वाञ्जितकाशी च सायुधश्चैव दुर्मतिः।
49_37.translation: This nightranger is equipped with weapons. Cruel, strong and evilminded, he has won wars. You cannot stop him.
49_37.word_by_word: क्रूरः cruel, सत्त्वान् strong, जितकाशी victorious, सायुधश्चैव wielding weapons, दुर्मतिः evilminded, एषः this, निशाचरः nightranger, तव you, वारयितुम् to prevent, न शक्यः not possible.

49_38.shloka: रामाय तु यथातत्त्वं जटायो हरणं मम।।3.49.41।।लक्ष्मणाय च तत्सर्वमाख्यातव्यमशेषतः।
49_38.translation: O Jatayu narrate to Rama and Lakshmana the exact facts of my abduction and all the details without any omission.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
49_38.word_by_word: जटायोः Jatayu, मम my, हरणम् abduction, यथातत्त्वम् exact fact, तत् सर्वम् everything, अशेषतः without any omission, रामाय to Rama, लक्ष्मणाय च and Lakshmana, आख्यातव्यम् please narrate.

50_1.shloka: [Jatayu sees Ravana carrying Sita-- pleads with Ravana to return Sita-- Ravana pays no heed  Jatayu fights with Ravana.]तं शब्दमवसुप्तस्तु जटायुरथ शुश्रुवे।निरीक्ष्य रावणं क्षिप्रं वैदेहीं च ददर्श सः।।3.50.1।।
50_1.translation: While reposing, Jatayu heard the cry and at once looked up and saw Ravana and Vaidehi.
50_1.word_by_word: अवसुप्तः reposing, जटायुः Jatayu, तं शब्दम् that sound, शुश्रुवे heard, अथ and, सः he, क्षिप्रम् at once, निरीक्ष्य observed, रावणम् Ravana, वैदेहीं च and Vaidehi, ददर्श saw.

50_2.translation: Glorious Jatayu, the best among the birds, looked like the peak of a mountain.His beak was sharp. His words were auspious. He spoke from the top of the tree:
50_2.word_by_word: ततः then, पर्वतकूटाभः looking like a part of the mountain, तीक्ष्णतुण्डः sharpbeaked, श्रीमान् glorious, वनस्पतिगतः from the top of the tree, खगोत्तमः best among birds, शुभाम् auspicious, गिरम् words, व्याजहार uttered.

50_3.shloka: दशग्रीव स्थितो धर्मे पुराणे सत्यसंश्रयः।जटायुर्नाम नाम्नाहं गृध्रराजो महाबलः।।3.50.3।।
50_3.translation: O tenheaded Ravana, I am Jatayu, king of vultures. I am mighty. An eternal follower, of dharma, I am an adherent to truth.
50_3.word_by_word: दशग्रीव tenheaded Ravana, अहम् I, पुराणे धर्मे in eternal dharma, स्थितः adhering to dharma, सत्यसंश्रयः  who abides in truth, महाबलः mighty, गृध्रराजः king of vultures, नाम्ना by name, जटायुर्नाम Jatayu.

50_4.shloka: राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः।लोकानां च हिते युक्तो रामो दशरथात्मजः।।3.50.4।।
50_4.translation: Rama, Dasaratha's son, is the king of the entire world. He is equal to Indra and Varuna. He is ever engaged in the welfare of the entire world.
50_4.word_by_word: दशरथात्मजः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, सर्वस्य of the entire, लोकस्य world, राजा king, महेन्द्रवरुणोपमः equal to Indra and Varuna, लोकानाम् in the world, हिते in the wellbeing, युक्तः engaged.

50_5.shloka: तस्यैषा लोकनाथस्य धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनी।सीता नाम वरारोहा यां त्वं हर्तुमिहेच्छसि।।3.50.5।।
50_5.translation: The lady you want to abduct from here is the famous Sita, the lawful wife of Rama, the lord of the world.
50_5.word_by_word: याम् whom, त्वम् you, इह from here, हर्तुम् to take away, इच्छसि are desiring, एषा she is, सीता नाम Sita by name, वरारोहा a beautiful lady, यशस्विनी illustrious, लोकनाथस्य of the lord of the world, तस्य his, धर्मपत्नी wife.

50_6.shloka: कथं राजास्थितो धर्मे परदारान्परामृशेत्।रक्षणीया विशेषेण राजदारा महाबल।।3.50.6।।
50_6.translation: How can a king who adheres to righteousness outrage another's wife ? O powerful one, a king's wife in particular should be protected.
50_6.word_by_word: धर्मे in righteousness, स्थितः adheres, राजा king, परदारान् another's wife, कथम् how, परामृशेत् can any one violate, महाबल powerful, राजदाराः king's wife, विशेषेण specially, रक्षणीयाः should be protected.

50_7.shloka: निवर्तय मतिं नीचां परदाराभिमर्शनात्।न तत्समाचरेद्धीरो यत्परोऽस्य विगर्हयेत्।।3.50.7।।यथात्मनस्तथान्येषां दारा रक्ष्या विपश्चिता।
50_7.translation: Refrain yourself from the vile thought of violating other's wives. Wise men do not adopt what is censured by others. Just like one's own, the wise should protect other's wives.
50_7.word_by_word: नीचाम् mean, मतिम् in mind, परदाराभिमर्शनात् thought of touching another's wife, निवर्तय refrain yourself, परः others, अस्य his, यत् such deeds, विगर्हयेत् if he reproaches, तत् that, धीरः learned, न समाचरेत् should not adopt, विपश्चिता by the wise man, आत्मनः his own, यथा likewise, तथा in the same way, अन्येषाम् another's, दाराः wife, रक्ष्याः be protected.

50_8.shloka: धर्ममर्थं वा कामं वा शिष्टाश्शास्त्रेष्वनागतम्।।3.50.8।।व्यवस्यन्त्यनु राजानं धर्मं पौलस्त्यनन्दन।
50_8.translation: O son of Paulastya learned men determine the path of dharma artha and kama,  following a king's conduct even if  they are not declared in sastras.
50_8.word_by_word: पौलस्त्यनन्दन O son of Paulastya, शिष्टाः learned, शास्त्रेषु sastras, अनागतम् unknown, अर्थं वा wish for material, यदि वा even if, कामम् pleasures, धर्मम् righteousness, राजानम् अनु kings follow, व्यवस्यन्ति prescribe.

50_9.shloka: राजा धर्मस्य कामस्य द्रव्याणां चोत्तमो निधिः।।3.50.9।।धर्मश्शुभं वा पापं वा राजमूलं प्रवर्तते।
50_9.translation: A king is the best repository of rigteousness, material wealth and pleasures. The king is the root of dharma, virtue and sin.
50_9.word_by_word: धर्मस्य of righteousness, कामस्य of pleasures, द्रव्याणां च and for material wealth, राजा king, उत्तमः best, निधिः repository, धर्मः righteousness, शुभंवा good or, पापं वा or bad, राजमूलम् king is at the root, प्रवर्तते is practised.

50_10.shloka: पापस्वभावश्चपलः कथं त्वं रक्षसां वर।।3.50.10।।ऐश्वर्यमभिसम्प्राप्तो विमानमिव दुष्कृतिः।
50_10.translation: O best of demons  by nature you are sinful, and fickleminded. You do all forbidden acts. Otherwise,how could you get this wealth, like the celestial chariot?
50_10.word_by_word: रक्षसाम् of demons, वर best one, पापस्वभावः of sinful nature, चपलः fickleminded, त्वम् you are, दुष्कृतिः who does forbidden acts, विमानमिव like this celestial chariot, ऐश्वर्यम् wealth, कथम् how, अभिसम्प्राप्तः did you get?

50_11.shloka: कामं स्वभावो यो यस्य न शक्यः परिमार्जितुम्।।3.50.11।।न हि दुष्टात्मनामार्यमावसत्यालये चिरम्।
50_11.translation: Indeed, it is not possible to erase the nature of any one, whatever it be. Prosperity does not rest for long in the house of the evilminded.
50_11.word_by_word: यः whatever, यस्य  his, स्वभावः nature, परिमार्जितुम् to erase, कामम् indeed, न शक्यः not possible, दुष्टात्मनाम् evilminded people, आलये in the house, चिरम् for long time, आर्यम् prosperity, न आवसति हि will not be.

50_12.shloka: विषये वा पुरे वा ते यदा रामो महाबलः।।3.50.12।।नापराध्यति धर्मात्मा कथं तस्यापराध्यसि।
50_12.translation: Powerful and righteous Rama has not offended you, your kingdom or your city. Why do you offend him?
50_12.word_by_word: महाबलः powerful, धर्मात्मा righteous self, रामः Rama, यदा since, ते to you, विषये वा in your kingdom, पुरे वा or in the city, नापराध्यति has not offended, तस्य his, कथम् how, अपराध्यसि do you offend.

50_13.shloka: यदि शूर्पणखाहेतोर्जनस्थानगतः खरः।।3.50.13।।अतिवृत्तो हतः पूर्वं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।अत्र ब्रूहि यथातत्त्वं को रामस्य व्यतिक्रमः।।3.50.14।।यस्य त्वं लोकनाथस्य भार्यां हृत्वा गमिष्यसि।
50_13.translation: On account of Surpanakha, Khara trespassed into Janasthana and got killed by Rama, without much effort. Tell me truly, what transgression (of dharma) did he commit for which you are stealing away the wife of Rama who is the lord of this world?.
50_13.word_by_word: शूर्पणखाहेतोः on account of Surpanakha, जनस्थानगतः staying in Janasthana, खरः Khara, अतिवृत्तः trespassed, आक्लिष्टकर्मणा by one who does something without much effort, रामेण Rama, पूर्वम् earlier, हतः यदि if killed, अत्र here, लोकनाथस्य lord of the world (Rama), यस्य whose, भार्याम् wife, त्वम् you, हृत्वा गमिष्यसि (हरिष्यसि) taking away, रामस्य Rama's, व्यतिक्रमः transgression of dharma, कः what, यथातत्त्वम् truly, ब्रूहि tell.

50_14.shloka: क्षिप्रं विसृज वैदेहीं मा त्वा घोरेण चक्षुषा।।3.50.15।।दहेद्दहनभूतेन वृत्रमिन्द्राशनिर्यथा।
50_14.translation: Leave Vaidehi at once lest with her fierce looks you should be burnt down like demon Vrtra by the thunderbolt of Indra.
50_14.word_by_word: क्षिप्रम् at once, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, विसृज leave, त्वा you, इन्द्राशनिः Indra's thunderbolt, वृत्रं यथा like Vritra, दहनभूतेन with fury, घोरेण with fierce, चक्षुषा with looks, मा दहेत् may not burn.

50_15.shloka: सर्पमाशीविषं बद्ध्वा वस्त्रान्ते नावबुध्यसे।।3.50.16।।ग्रीवायां प्रतिसक्तं च कालपाशं न पश्यसि।
50_15.translation: You are not aware that you are tying a venomous snake with the skirt of your cloth. worn by you. You are not able to see the noose of death tightened around your neck.
50_15.word_by_word: आशीविषम् venomous, सर्पम् serpent, वस्रान्ते with the skirt of your cloth, बद्ध्वा binding,नावबुध्यसे not understand, ग्रीवायाम् to the neck, प्रतिसक्तम् fastened tightly, कालपाशम् noose of death, न पश्यसि do not see.

50_16.shloka: स भारस्सौम्य भर्तव्यो यो नरं नावसादयेत्।।3.50.17।।तदन्नमपि भोक्तव्यं जीर्यते यदनामयम्।
50_16.translation: O gentle Ravana one should carry that much of weight which does not tire him. One should eat only that wholesome food which can be easily digested.
50_16.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle one, यः that which, नरम् man, नावसादयेत् does not fatigue, सः such, भारः weight, भर्तव्यः should be carried, यत् which, अनामयम् free from any disease, जीर्यते is digested, तत् that only, अन्नम् food, भोक्तव्यम् should be eaten, अपि even.

50_17.shloka: यत्कृत्वा न भवेद्धर्मो न कीर्तिर्न यशो भुवि।।3.50.18।।शरीरस्य भवेत्खेदः कस्तत्कर्म समाचरेत्।
50_17.translation: Who will do such a deed which cannot beget dharma, fame or glory in the world? Who will do such deeds that bring only exhaustion to the body?
50_17.word_by_word: यत् by what, कृत्वा doing, धर्मः duty, न भवेत् does not beget, भुवि world, कीर्तिः fame, न nor, यशः glory, न nor, शरीरस्य to the body, खेदः exhaustion, भवेत् brings, तत् that, कर्म deed, कः who, समाचरेत् will practise?

50_18.shloka: षष्टिर्वर्षसहस्राणि मम जातस्य रावण।।3.50.19।।पितृपैतामहं राज्यं यथावदनुतिष्ठतः।
50_18.translation: Sixty thousand years ago I was born, O Ravana  Since then I have ruled justly my hereditary kingdom.
50_18.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, पितृपैतामहम् hereditary, राज्यम् kingdom, यथावत् justly, अनुतिष्टतः while ruling, जातस्य since birth, मम me, षष्टिः sixty, वर्षसहस्राणि thosand years are completed.

50_19.shloka: वृद्धोऽहं त्वं युवा धन्वी सशरः कवची रथी।।3.50.20।।तथाप्यादाय वैदेहीं कुशली न गमिष्यसि।
50_19.translation: I am old, you are young, wielding a bow and arrows, with shield to protect and chariot to ride. Even then I will not let you go safe with Vaidehi kidnapped.
50_19.word_by_word: अहम् I am, वृद्धः old, त्वम् you, युवा young, धन्वी wielding bow, सशरः and arrows, कवची shield, रथी riding on the chariot, तथापि even then, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, आदाय carrying, कुशली safely, न गमिष्यसि will not go.

50_20.shloka: न शक्तस्त्वं बलाद्धर्तुं वैदेहीं मम पश्यतः।।3.50.21।।हेतुभिर्न्यायसंसिद्धैद्धृवां वेदश्रुतीमिव।
50_20.translation: You cannot carry Vaidehi by force within my very sight just as the everlasting revelations of the Vedas cannot be robbed by mere logic of reason.
50_20.word_by_word: मम पश्यतः within my very sight, त्वम् you, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न्यायसंसिद्धैः by those bound by logic, हेतुभिः by reason, ध्रुवाम् everlasting, वेदश्रुतीमिव like revelations of the Vedas, बलात् by force, हर्तुम् abduct, न शक्तः not possible for you.

50_21.shloka: युद्ध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि मुहूर्तं तिष्ठ रावण।।3.50.22।।शयिष्यसे हतो भूमौ यथापूर्वं खरस्तथा।
50_21.translation: O Ravana, if you are brave, fight with me. In a moment, you will be killed like Khara and lie down on the ground.
50_21.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, शूरः असि यदि if you are a hero, युद्ध्यस्व do fight with me, मुहूर्तम् तिष्ठ stay awhile, पूर्वम् earlier, खरः Khara, यथा as he was, तथा likewise, हतः slayed, भूमौ on the earth, शयिष्यसे will sleep.

50_22.shloka: असकृत्संयुगे येन निहता दैत्यदानवाः।।3.50.23।।नचिराच्चीरवासास्त्वां रामो युधि वधिष्यति।
50_22.translation: Clad in bark garments, Rama, who has often slain demons in the past will soon kill you in war.
50_22.word_by_word: येन by whom, असकृत् many times, संयुगे in war, दैत्यदानवाः demons, निहताः were slain, त्वाम् you, नचिरात् soon, चीरवासाः clad in bark robes, रामः Rama, युधि in war, वधिष्यति will slay৷৷

50_23.shloka: किं नु शक्यं मया कर्तुं गतौदूरं नृपात्मजौ।।3.50.24।।क्षिप्रं त्वं नश्यसे नीच तयोर्भीतो न संशयः।
50_23.translation: What can I do? O mean fellow the two princes have gone far away.You will soon be destroyed out of fear for them. There is no doubt.
50_23.word_by_word: मया by me, किं नु what else, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् am able, नृपात्मजौ the two princes, दूरम् far away, गतौ have gone, नीच mean fellow, तयोः both of them, भीतः fearing, त्वम् you, क्षिप्रम् at once, नश्यसे will be destroyed, संशयः doubt, न not.

50_24.shloka: न हि मे जीवमानस्य नयिष्यसि शुभामिमाम्।।3.50.25।।सीतां कमलपत्राक्षीं रामस्य महिषीं प्रियाम्।
50_24.translation: I will not let you take away the auspicious, lotuseyed Sita, the dear consort of Rama as long as I am alive.
50_24.word_by_word: मे myself, जीवमानस्य while I am alive, शुभाम् auspicious, कमलपत्राक्षीम् lotuseyed lady, रामस्य प्रियाम् Rama's dear, महिषीम् consort, इमाम् this lady, सीताम् Sita, न नयिष्यसि will not take.

50_25.shloka: अवश्यं तु मया कार्यं प्रियं तस्य महात्मनः।।3.50.26।।जीवितेनापि रामस्य तथा दशरथस्य च।
50_25.translation: I should do this important work of those great souls, Rama and Dasaratha, even if it claims my life.
50_25.word_by_word: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, तथा so, दशरथस्य च and Dasaratha's, मया my, अवश्यम् certainly, जीवितेनापि even giving up my life, प्रियम् dear, कार्यम् task.

50_26.shloka: तिष्ठ तिष्ठ दशग्रीव मुहूर्तं पश्य रावण।।3.50.27।।युद्धातिथ्यं प्रदास्यामि यथाप्राणं निशाचर।वृन्तादिव फलं त्वां तु पातयेयं रथोत्तमात्।।3.50.28।।
50_26.translation: O ten headed Ravana stay, stay for a while. O demon  as long as I am alive I will treat you with the hospitality of war. You will be pulled down from this best of the chariots like a ripe fruit drops from the stalk.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
50_26.word_by_word: दशग्रीव tenheaded, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, तिष्ठ तिष्ठ stay, stay, रावण Ravana, पश्य look, निशाचर nightwalker, यथाप्राणम् as long as I am alive, युद्धातिथ्यम् hospitality of war , प्रदास्यामि will accord, वृन्तात् from the stalk, फलमिव like a ripe fruit is dropped down, त्वाम् you, रथोत्तमात् from the best of the chariots, पातयेयम् will pull you down.

51_1.shloka: [Jatayu fights Ravana -- wounded Ravana clips Jatayu's wings and carries away Sita.]इत्युक्तस्य यथान्यायं रावणस्य जटायुषा।क्रुद्धस्याग्निनिभास्सर्वा रेजुर्विंशतिदृष्टयः।।3.51.1।।
51_1.translation: Ravana's twenty eyes glowed like fire in anger after Jatayu thus rightly said.
51_1.word_by_word: जटायुषा by Jatayu, यथान्यायम् justly, इति in this manner, उक्तस्य  told, क्रुद्धस्य of the enraged, रावणस्य Ravana's, सर्वाः all, विंशतिदृष्टयः twenty eyes, अग्निनिभाः like fire, रेजुः glowed.

51_2.translation: As the bright gold earrings of the intolerant king of demons glittered, his eyes turned red in rage and he pounced upon Jatayu, the lord of birds.
51_2.word_by_word: तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः bright gold earrings, अमर्षणः intolerant, राक्षसेन्द्रः king of demons, कोपात् in anger, संरक्तनयनः eyes turned red, पतगेन्द्रम् to lord of birds (Jatayu), अभिदुद्राव leaped.

51_3.translation: The clash between them was tumultuous and it appeared like the clash of two pieces of clouds in the sky raised by stormy winds.
51_3.word_by_word: तस्मिन् in that, महावने in the huge forest, तयोः between them, तुमुलः tumultuous, सः सम्प्रहारः fight, गगने in the sky, वातोद्धतयोः stormy wind that arose, मेघयोर्यथा like two flakes of clouds, बभूव appeared.

51_4.translation: The duel between Ravana and Jatayu looked as though it was a fight between two huge winged mountains of Malyavan range.
51_4.word_by_word: तदा then, (तयोः of both of them), गृध्रराक्षसयोः vulture and demon, तत् that, अद्भुतम् wonderful, युद्धम् war, सपक्षयोः of the winged ones, माल्यवतोः of Malyavan range, महापर्वतयोरिव between two huge mountains, बभूव took place.

51_5.translation: Then the mighty Ravana rained sharp, dreadful shafts, spears and Vikarnis at Jatayu,  king of vultures.
51_5.word_by_word: ततः then,महाबलः mighty, तीक्ष्णाग्रैः with sharp tips, महाघोरैः dreadful, नालीकनाराचैः by spears and shafts, विकर्णिभिः a weapon named Vikarni, गृध्रराजम्  king of vultures, अभ्यवर्षत् rained.

51_6.shloka: स तानि शरजालानि गृध्रः पत्त्ररथेश्वरः।जटायुः प्रतिजग्राह रावणास्त्राणि संयुगे।।3.51.6।।
51_6.translation: Jatayu, lord of the birds, faced the arrows and other weapons showered  by Ravana.
51_6.word_by_word: पत्ररथेश्वरः lord of birds, गृध्रः vulture, जटायुः Jatayu, संयुगे in encounter, तानि those, शरजालानि all the arrows, रावणास्त्राणि Ravana's weapons, प्रतिजग्राह endured.

51_7.shloka: तस्य तीक्ष्णनखाभ्यां तु चरणाभ्यां महाबलः।चकार बहुधा गात्रे व्रणान्पतगसत्तमः।।3.51.7।।
51_7.translation: The mighty, virtuous vulture with his sharp claws wounded many parts of the body of Ravana.
51_7.word_by_word: महाबलः very strong, पतगसत्तमः virtuous vulture, तीक्ष्णनखाभ्याम् with sharp claws, चरणाभ्याम् with both feet, तस्य his, गात्रे on the limbs, बहुधा many ways, व्रणान् wounds, चकार pierced.

51_8.translation: Ravana in a rage took ten dreadful darts (looking) like the staff of death with a desire to crush the enemy.
51_8.word_by_word: अथ at that time, दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, क्रोधात् enraged, शत्रुमर्दनकाङ्क्षया with a desire to crush the enemy, मृत्युदण्डनिभान् like the staff of death, घोरान् fierce, दश मार्गणान् ten darts, जग्राह unleashed.

51_9.translation: The mighty Ravana fully released his dreadful, sharp arrows that went straight and pierced the vulture.
51_9.word_by_word: महावीर्यः mighty, सः he, पूर्णमुक्तै: fully released, अजिह्मगैः going straight, निशितैः whetted, तीक्ष्णै with sharp, घोरैः dreadful, शिलीमुखैः with arrows, तैः those, बाणैः arrows, गृध्रम् at the vulture, बिभेद pierced.

51_10.shloka: स राक्षसरथे पश्यन्जानकीं बाष्पलोचनाम्।अचिन्तयित्वा तान्बाणान्राक्षसं समभिद्रवत्।।3.51.10।।
51_10.translation: Seeing Sita, daughter of Janaka, on the demon's chariot with eyes full of tears, Jatayu without minding the arrows renewed his attack.
51_10.word_by_word: सः that, राक्षसरथे on the demon's chariot, बाष्पलोचनाम् eyes filled with tears, जानकीम् Sita,daughter of Janaka, पश्यन् observing, तान् those, बाणान् arrows, अचिन्तयित्वा without minding, राक्षसम् to the demon, समभिद्रवत् attacked again.

51_11.shloka: ततोऽस्य सशरं चापं मुक्तामणिविभूषितम्।चरणाभ्यां महातेजा बभञ्ज पतगेश्वरः।।3.51.11।।
51_11.translation: The glorious lord of birds crushed with his feet the bow and arrow of Ravana with pearls and gems encrusted.
51_11.word_by_word: ततः then, महातेजाः glorious, पतगेश्वरः lord of birds, अस्य his, मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् encrusted with pearls and gems, सशरम् along with that arrow, चापम् bow, चरणाभ्याम् with his feet, बभञ्ज broke.

51_12.shloka: ततोऽन्यद्धनुरादाय रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः।ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।।3.51.12।।
51_12.translation: Overcome with anger, Ravana took another bow and rained (on him) hundreds and thousands of arrows.
51_12.word_by_word: ततः then, रावणः Ravana, क्रोधमूर्छितः overcome with anger, अन्यत् other, धनुः bow, आदाय after taking, शतशः hundreds of, अथ and, सहस्रशः in thousands, शरवर्षाणि rain of arrows, ववर्ष rained.

51_13.shloka: शरैरावारितस्तस्य संयुगे पतगेश्वरः।कुलायमुपसम्प्राप्तः पक्षीव प्रबभौ तदा।।3.51.13।।
51_13.translation: Jatayu, shot with arrows on all sides in the combat, shone like the bird that returned to its nest.
51_13.word_by_word: तदा then, संयुगे in the encounter, तस्य his, शरैः  arrows, आवारितः surrounded, पतगेश्वरः Jatayu, कुलायम् nest of the bird, उपसम्प्राप्तः returned, पक्षीव resemled the bird, प्रबभौ shone.

51_14.shloka: स तानि शरवर्षाणि पक्षाभ्यां च विधूयच।चरणाभ्यां महातेजा बभञ्जास्य महद्धनुः।।3.51.14।।
51_14.translation: Powerful Jatayu scattered the shower of arrows with his wings and broke down the great bow with his claws.
51_14.word_by_word: महातेजाः powerful, सः Jatayu, तानि those, शरवर्षाणि rain of arrows, पक्षाभ्याम् by the wings, विधूय च on scattering, अस्य his, महत् great, धनुः bow, चरणाभ्याम् with claws, बभञ्ज broke.

51_15.shloka: तच्चाग्निसदृशं दीप्तं रावणस्य शरावरम्।पक्षाभ्यां स महावीर्यो व्याधुनोत्पतगेश्वरः।।3.51.15।।
51_15.translation: Mighty Jatayu, lord of the birds, shattered with his wings the armour of Ravana that was glowing like fire.
51_15.word_by_word: महावीर्यः mighty, सः Jatayu, पतगेश्वरः lord of the birds, रावणस्य Ravana's, अग्निसदृशम् burning like fire, दीप्तम् glowing, तत् that, शरावरम् armour, पक्षाभ्याम् with the wings, व्याधुनोत् tore asunder.

51_16.translation: Powerful Jatayu killed in the combat, the splendid, swiftmoving, devilfaced asses with  golden shields yoked to the chariot.
51_16.word_by_word: बली powerful, काञ्चनोरश्छदान् golden shield, दिव्यान् splendid, पिशाचवदनान् devil's face, जवसम्पन्नान् endowed with great speed, तान् those, खरान् च asses, समरे in the combat, जघान killed.

51_17.shloka: वरं त्रिवेणुसम्पन्नं कामगं पावकार्चिषम्।मणिहेमविचित्राङ्गं बभञ्ज च महारथम्।।3.51.17।।
51_17.translation: Then he(Jatayu) broke down the great chariot(of Ravana) glowing like fire, glittering with gold and gems, made of three bamboo reeds, and capable of flying wherever the rider willed.
51_17.word_by_word: वरम् excellent, त्रिवेणुसम्पन्नम् endowed with three bamboo reeds, कामगम् go wherever one desired, पावकार्चिषम् glowing like fire, मणिहेमविचित्राङ्गम् glittering with gold and gems, महारथम् great chariot, बभञ्ज broke.

51_18.shloka: पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतीकाशं छत्रं च व्यजनैस्सह।पातयामास वेगेन ग्राहिभी राक्षसैस्सह।।3.51.18।।
51_18.translation: Jatayu violently pulled down the parasol shining like the full moon and the fans of the chariot along with the demons holding them.
51_18.word_by_word: पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतीकाशम् shining like the full moon, छत्रं च parasol also, व्यजनैः सह with  the fans, ग्राहिभिः with those holding them, राक्षसैः सह along with the demons, वेगेन violently, पातयामास pulled down.

51_19.translation: Again the glorious, powerful king of birds swiftly shattered the huge head of the charioteer with his beak.
51_19.word_by_word: पुनः again, महाबलः powerful, श्रीमान् glorious, पक्षिराजः king of the birds, अस्य his, सारथेः charioteer, महत् huge, शिरः head, वेगेन तुण्डेनैव violently with the beak, व्यपाहरत् shattered.

51_20.shloka: स भग्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः।अङ्केनादाय वैदेहीं पपात भुवि रावणः।।3.51.20।।
51_20.translation: With the bow broken, the chariot destroyed, asses (drawing the chariot) and the charioteer dead,  Ravana fell down on the ground holding Vaidehi on his lap.
51_20.word_by_word: भग्नधन्वा with the bow broken, विरथः chariot destroyed, हताश्वः asses (drawing the chariot) dead, हतसारथिः charioteer killed, सः रावणः that Ravana, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अङ्केन on his lap, आदाय held, भुवि on to the ground, पपात fell.

51_21.shloka: दृष्ट्वा निपतितं भूमौ रावणं भग्नवाहनम्।साधुसाध्विति भूतानि गृध्रराजमपूजयन्।।3.51.21।।
51_21.translation: Seeing Ravana fallen on the ground with his broken chariot, all beings honoured the king of the birds, saying, Well done Well done
51_21.word_by_word: भग्नवाहनम् with the broken chariot, भूमौ on the ground, निपतितम् fallen down, रावणम् Ravana, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, साधु साधु इति staying well done, well done, भूतानि all beings, गृध्रराजम् king of the birds, अपूजयन् honoured.

51_22.shloka: परिश्रान्तं तु तं दृष्टवा जरया पक्षियूथपम्।उत्पपात पुनर्हृष्टो मैथिलीं गृह्य रावणः।।3.51.22।।
51_22.translation: Seeing the lord of the flocks of birds exhausted due to age still fighting, Ravana felt glad. He flew back into the sky taking Sita, princess of Mithila, with him.
51_22.word_by_word: पक्षियूथपम् the lord of the flocks of birds (Jatayu), तम् him, जरया with old age, परिश्रान्तम् exhausted (after a long fight), दृष्ट्वा seeing, रावणः Ravana, हृष्टः glad, मैथिलीम् Maithili, गृह्य took, पुनः again, उत्पपात flew into the sky.

51_23.shloka: तं प्रहृष्टं निधायाङ्के गच्छन्तं जनकात्मजाम्।गृध्रराजस्समुत्पत्य समभिद्रुत्य रावणम्।।3.51.23।।समावार्य महातेजा जटायुरिदमब्रवीत्।
51_23.translation: Seeing Sita, Janaka's daughter, happily carried away into the sky by Ravana on his lap. Jatayu, the mighty king of vultures chased him, and obstructing his path said :
51_23.word_by_word: गृध्रराजः king of the vultures, महातेजाः mighty, जटायुः Jatayu, समुत्पत्य flew up.प्रहृष्टम् happy, जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter ( Sita), अङ्के on the lap, निथाय placed, गच्छन्तम् while going, तं रावणम् to that Ravana, समभिद्रुत्य chased, समावार्य obstructing, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.

51_24.shloka: वज्रसंस्पर्शबाणस्य भार्यां रामस्य रावण।।3.51.24।।अल्पबुद्धे हरस्येनां वधाय खलु रक्षसाम्।
51_24.translation: Foolish Ravana, you are kidnapping this lady, wife of Rama, whose arrows can hit like a thunderbolt. This will lead to the destruction of all demons.
51_24.word_by_word: अल्पबुद्धे foolish, रावण Ravana, वज्रसंस्पर्शबाणस्य whose arows can hit like a thunderbolt, रामस्य Rama's, भार्याम् wife, एनाम् this lady, रक्षसाम् of demons, वधाय for destruction, हरसि  kidnapping.

51_25.translation: You are drinking poison along with all your friends, relatives, ministers, the army and  your allies. like a thirsty man drinks water.
51_25.word_by_word: मित्रबन्धुः along with kith and kin, सामात्यः with ministers, सबलः with army, सपरिच्छदः with all your allies, पिपासितः thirsty man, उदकमिव like water, एतत् this, विषपानम् poison, पिबसि you  are drinking.

51_26.shloka: अनुबन्धमजानन्तः कर्मणामविचक्षणाः।।3.51.26।।शीघ्रमेव विनश्यन्ति यथा त्वं विनशिष्यसि।
51_26.translation: Fools who do not know the consequences of their action perish soon. Similarly you are going to die soon.
51_26.word_by_word: कर्मणाम् of the deeds, अनुबन्धम् consequences, अजानन्तः not knowing, अविचक्षणाः unwise, यथा similarly, श्रीघ्रमेव soon, विनश्यन्ति get destroyed, त्वम् you, विनशिष्यसि will be destroyed.

51_27.shloka: बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन क्व गतस्तस्य मोक्ष्यसे।।3.51.27।।वधाय बडिशं गृह्य सामिषं जलजो यथा।
51_27.translation: You are bound by the noose of death like a fish holding on to the bait of the fishing hook. Where can you go now?
51_27.word_by_word: त्वम् you, कालपाशेन by the noose of death, वधाय to die, बद्धः are bound, सामिषम् with a bait, बडिशम् fishhook, गृह्य having taken, जलजः fish, यथा so also, तस्य its, क्व गतः where can it go, मोक्ष्यसे will you get out.

51_28.shloka: न हि जातु दुराधर्षौ काकुत्स्थौ तव रावण।।3.51.28।।धर्षणं चाश्रमस्यास्य क्षमिष्येते तु राघवौ।
51_28.translation: O Ravana  know that Rama and Lakshmana, the Kakutsthas, are invincible. They will not forgive the asssault you have made on their hermitage.
51_28.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, दुराधर्षौ both invincible, काकुत्स्थौ both Kakutsthas, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, तव your, अस्य आश्रमस्य their hermitage, धर्षणम् assault, जातु surely, न क्षमिष्येते not forgive.

51_29.shloka: यथा त्वया कृतं कर्म भीरुणा लोकगर्हितम्।।3.51.29।।तस्कराचरितो मार्गो नैव वीरनिषेवितः।
51_29.translation: Your cowardly action will be condemned by the whole world. The path you have chosen is the path of a thief and not of a hero.
51_29.word_by_word: भीरुणा by a timid, त्वया you are, यथा like this, लोकगर्हितम् condemned by the whole world, कर्म  act, कृतम् is done, तस्कराचरितः adopted by thieves, मार्गः this path, वीरनिषेवितः followed by heroes, नैव not at all.

51_30.shloka: युध्यस्व यदि शूरोऽसि मुहूर्तं तिष्ठरावण।।3.51.30।।शयिष्यसे हतो भूमौ यथा भ्राता खरस्तथा।
51_30.translation: O Ravana if you are courageous, tarry awhile and fight with me. Like your brother Khara, you will lie on the ground dead.
51_30.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, यदि if you, शूरोऽसि are courageous, युध्यस्व may fight, मुहूर्तं for a moment, तिष्ठ stay, भ्राता brother, खर: Khara, तथा likewise, शयिष्यसे all down, यथा as, भूमौ on the ground, हत: killed.

51_31.shloka: परेतकाले पुरुषो यत्कर्म प्रतिपद्यते।।3.51.31।।विनाशायात्मनोऽधर्म्यं प्रतिपन्नोऽसि कर्म तत्।
51_31.translation: You have resorted to unrighteous action like a dying man. This will spell your destruction.
51_31.word_by_word: पुरुषः man, परेतकाले at the time of death, यत् whatever, कर्म actions, प्रतिपद्यते does, अधर्म्यम् unrighteous, तत् such, कर्म action, आत्मनः yourself, विनाशाय for destruction, प्रतिपन्नः  undertaken, असि you are.

51_32.shloka: पापानुबन्धो वै यस्य कर्मणः कर्मको नु तत्।।3.51.32।।कुर्वीत लोकाधिपतिस्स्वयंभूर्भगवानपि।
51_32.translation: If the consequences of an action be sin, who will do it ? Even the selfborn lord of the world may not.
51_32.word_by_word: यस्य by whomsoever, कर्मणः action, पापानुबन्धः resulting in sin, तत् such, कर्म action, लोकाधिपतिः lord of the world, भगवान् स्वयंभूरपि selfborn lord (Brahma) too, कः who, कुर्वीतmay do, नु indeed, तत् that.

51_33.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा शुभं वाक्यं जटायुस्तस्य रक्षसः।।3.51.33।।निपपात भृशं पृष्ठे दशग्रीवस्य वीर्यवान्।
51_33.translation: Brave Jatayu having thus said these cautious words to the demon dashed against his back again and again.
51_33.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् brave,जटायुः Jatayu, एवम् in that manner, शुभम् auspicious (cautious), वाक्यम् words, उक्त्वा having  said, रक्षसः of that demon, तस्य रावणस्य पृष्ठे at Ravana's back, भृशम् repeatedly, निपपात dashed.

51_34.shloka: तं गृहीत्वा नखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्विददार समन्ततः।।3.51.34।।अधिरूढो गजारोहो यथा स्याद्दुष्टवारणम्।
51_34.translation: Thereafter, seizing Ravana, Jatayu ascended on his back and pierced his body all over with his sharp claws just as a rider goads an unruly elephant.
51_34.word_by_word: (ततः thereafter), तं गृहीत्वा seizing him, अधिरूढः ascended, गजारोहः riding on an elephant, दुष्टवारणम् unruly elephant, यथा so also, स्यात् he, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, नखैः claws, समन्ततः all over, विददार pierced.

51_35.shloka: विददार नखैरस्य तुण्डं पृष्ठे समर्पयन्।।3.51.35।।केशांश्चोत्पाटयामास नखपक्षमुखायुधः।
51_35.translation: Jatayu who had  his claws, wings and beak as the only weapons  pierced and pricked  Ravana all over with his nails by pressing his beak on his back and pulled out his hair.
