51_35.word_by_word: अस्य his, पृष्ठे back, तुण्डम् beak, समर्पयन् pressing, नखैः claws, विददार pierced, नखपक्षमुखायुधः a warrior with claws, wings and beak as the only weapons, केशांश्च hair too, उत्पाटयामास pulled out.

51_36.shloka: स तथा गृध्रराजेन क्लिश्यमानो मुहुर्मुहुः।।3.51.36।।अमर्षस्फुरितोष्ठस्सन्प्राकम्पत च रावणः।
51_36.translation: Thus tormented again and again by the king of vultures, Ravana shook with anger, his lips quivering.
51_36.word_by_word: गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, तथा in that manner, क्लिश्यमानः being tormented, सः रावणः he, Ravana, अमर्षफुरितोष्ठः सन् with his lips quivering with anger, प्राकम्पत was shaken.

51_37.shloka: स परिष्वज्य च वैदेहीं वामेनाङ्केन रावणः।।3.51.37।।तलेनाभिजघानाशु जटायुं क्रोधमुर्छीतः।
51_37.translation: Losing his senses, with rage, Ravana held Vaidehi (Sita) with his left arm and hit Jatayu with his palm.
51_37.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, क्रोधमूर्छितः losing senses with rage, वामेन अङ्केन left arm, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, परिष्वज्य holding firmly, आशु quickly, जटायुम् to Jatayu, तलेन palm, अभिजघान hit him.

51_38.translation: Then Jatayu, lord of the birds, subduer of enemies, overpowered Ravana and dismembered his ten left arms with his beak.
51_38.word_by_word: तदा then, खगाधिपः lord of the birds, अरिन्दमः  subduer of enemies, जटायुः Jatayu, तम् him, अभिक्रम्य  occupied, तुण्डेन by his beak, अस्य Ravana's, दश ten, वामबाहून् left arms, व्यपाहरत् cut off.

51_39.translation: As the left arms were cut off, there came out from them all the ten arms instantaneously like serpents emitting poisonous flames from anthills
51_39.word_by_word: सञ्छिन्नबाहोः whose arms were cut off, बाहवः arms, सद्यैव instantly from them, वल्मीकात् from an anthill, विषज्वालाः poisonous flames, वलीयुक्ताः emitting, पन्नगाः इव like serpants, सहसा all of a sudden, अभवन् came out.

51_40.shloka: ततः क्रोधाद्दशग्रीवस्सीतामुत्सृज्य रावणः।।3.51.40।।मुष्टिभ्यां चरणाभ्यां च गृध्रराजमपोथयत्।
51_40.translation: Then the tenheaded Ravana left Sita and attacked Jatayu with his fists and feet out of anger.
51_40.word_by_word: ततः then, दशग्रीवः tenheaded, रावणः Ravana, सीताम् Sita, उत्सृज्य left, मुष्टिभ्याम् with his fists, चरणाभ्यां च and feet, गृध्रराजम् Jatayu, क्रोधात् with anger, अपोथयत् attacked.

51_41.shloka: ततो मुहूर्तं सङ्ग्रामो बभूवातुल्यवीर्ययोः।।3.51.41।।राक्षसानां च मुख्यस्य पक्षिणां प्रवरस्य च।
51_41.translation: Between the warriors of unequal valour, Ravana and Jatayu, the chief of the demons and the foremost of the birds, the fight took place for a moment.
51_41.word_by_word: ततः then, अतुलवीर्ययो: of unequal valour, राक्षसानां मुख्यस्य of the chief of the demons, पक्षिणां प्रवरस्य king of the birds, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, सङ्ग्रामः fight, बभूव took place.

51_42.shloka: तस्य व्यायच्छमानस्य रामस्यार्थे स रावणः।।3.51.42।।पक्षौ पार्श्वौ च पादौ च खड्गमुद्धृत्य सोऽच्छिनत्।
51_42.translation: Ravana lifted his sword and cut off both the wings and feet of Jatayu who was fighting relentlessly (for Rama's sake).
51_42.word_by_word: सः that, रावणः Ravana, खडगम् sword, उद्यम्य after lifting, रामस्य Rama's, अर्थे for the sake of, व्यायच्छमानस्य of one who was fighting relentlessly, तस्य his, पक्षौ two wings, पार्श्वौ च  both sides, पादौ च feet, अच्छिनत् cut off.

51_43.shloka: स च्छिन्नपक्षस्सहसा रक्षसा रौद्रकर्मणा।।3.51.43।।निपपात हतो गृद्रो धरण्यामल्पजीवितः।
51_43.translation: (Seriously) wounded and almost dead,the vulture fell down on the ground all at once, when his wings were chipped by the demon of terrible deeds.
51_43.word_by_word: रौद्रकर्मणा one who performs terrible deeds, रक्षसा by the demon, छिन्नपक्षः clipped wings, सः that, गृध्रः vulture, हतः hurt, अल्पजीवितः with very little life left, धरण्याम् on the ground, सहसा immediately, निपपात fell.

51_44.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा पतितं भूमौ क्षतजार्द्रं जटायुषम्।।3.51.44।।अभ्यधावत वैदेही स्वबन्धुमिव दुःखिता।
51_44.translation: Sita, princess of Videha, saw the wounded Jatayu fallen on the ground drenched in blood. Grieving, she ran towards him as if he was her relative.
51_44.word_by_word: वैदेही Sita, princess of Videha, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen down, क्षतजार्द्रम् drenched in blood , तं जटायुषम् that Jatayu, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, दुःखिता grieved, स्वबन्धुमिव as if he was her relative, अभ्यधावत ran towards him.

51_45.shloka: तं नीलजीमूतनिकाशकल्पं सुपाण्डुरोरस्कमुदारवीर्यम्।ददर्श लङ्काधिपतिः पृथिव्यां जटायुषं शान्तमिवाग्निदावम्।।3.51.45।।
51_45.translation: Lord of Lanka saw that very bold Jatayu of dark blue colour of the cloud, fair chest, fallen on the ground, looking like the forest fire that had been put out.
51_45.word_by_word: लङ्काधिपतिः lord of Lanka, नीलजीमूतनिकाशकायम् of colour like the dark bluish cloud,सुपाण्डुरोरस्कम् of fair chest, उदारवीर्यम् bold, शान्तम् made calm, अग्निदावमिव like the forest fire, तं जटायुषम् that Jatayu, पृथिव्याम् on the ground, ददर्श saw.

51_46.shloka: ततस्तु तं पत्ररथं महीतले निपातितं रावणवेगमर्दितम्।पुनः परिश्वज्य शशिप्रभानना रुरोद सीता जनकात्मजातदा।।3.51.46।।
51_46.translation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, whose face was radiant like the Moon once again embraced  Jatayu, the winged warrior, fallen on the ground, crushed by Ravana's onslaught and wept.इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
51_46.word_by_word: ततः then, शशिप्रभानना with her face like the radiant moon, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, सीता Sita, तां him, रावणवेगमर्थितम् crushed by Ravana's onslaught, महीतले on the ground, निपातितम् fallen, तं पत्ररथम् that bird who rides on wings, पुनः again, परिष्वज्य took hold of him, रुरोद wept.

52_1.shloka: [Ravana carries away  Sita-- Sita calls out for Rama and Lakshmana again and again.]सा तु ताराधिपमुखी रावणेन समीक्ष्य तम्।गृध्रराजं विनिहतं विललाप सुदुःखिता।।3.52.1।।
52_1.translation: Sita,whose face was like the lord of the stars (Moon), saw Jatayu, king of birds, struck down by Ravana, and lamented in extreme grif :
52_1.word_by_word: ताराधिपमुखी  with Moonlike face, सा तु that Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, विनिहतम् struck down, तं गृध्रराजम् king of the birds, समीक्ष्य  seeing, सुदुःखिता very  much agonised, विललाप wept.

52_2.shloka: निमित्तं लक्षणज्ञानं शकुनिस्वरदर्शनम्।अवश्यं सुखदुःखेषु नराणां प्रतिदृश्यते।।3.52.2।।
52_2.translation: People, for sure, foresee weal and woe in life from auspicious symptoms and ominous sounds.
52_2.word_by_word: लक्षणज्ञानम् prognostication, शकुनिस्वरदर्शनम् sounds of ominous birds, नराणाम् for people, सुखदुःखेषु in joy and sorrow, अवश्यम् certainly, निमित्तम् indications, प्रतिदृश्यते are perceived.

52_3.shloka: नूनं राम न जानासि महद्व्यसनमात्मनः।धावन्ति नूनं काकुत्स्थं मदर्थं मृगपक्षिणः।।3.52.3।।
52_3.translation: O Rama you are, indeed, unaware of the great disaster that has befallen you. All the animals and birds are running for my sake to tell you about me, O scion  of theKakutsthas.
52_3.word_by_word: राम Rama, आत्मनः your, महत् great, व्यसनम् disaster, न जानासि not aware, नूनम् surely, मदर्थम् for my sake, मृगपक्षिणः animals and birds, काकुत्स्थम् towards Kakutstha, धावन्ति running to tell you, नूनम् surely.

52_4.shloka: अयं हि पापचारेण मां त्रातुमभिसङ्गतः।शेते विनिहतो भूमौ ममाभाग्याद्विहंगमः।।3.52.4।।
52_4.translation: 'This bird that came forward to save me is hit by the sinner(Ravana) and lies down on the ground, as ill luck would have it.
52_4.word_by_word: माम् me, त्रातुम् to rescue, अभिसङ्गतः has come forward, अयम् his, विहङ्गमः bird, मम for me, अभाग्यात् due to bad luck, पापचारेण by the sinner, विनिहतः is hit down, भूमौ on the ground, शेते lies down.

52_5.shloka: त्राहि मामद्य काकुत्स्थ लक्ष्मणेति वराङ्गना।सुसन्त्रस्ता समाक्रन्दच्छृण्वतां तु यथान्तिके।।3.52.5।।
52_5.translation: Terribly frightened, the beautiful lady (Sita) cried bitterly, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana, save me', as if they were close by and were listening to her.
52_5.word_by_word: वराङ्गना beautiful lady, सुसन्त्रस्ता terribly frightened, काकुत्स्थ O Rama, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, अद्य and now, माम् me, त्राहि save, इति thus, अन्तिके close by, शृण्वतां यथा as if listening to her, समाक्रन्दत् cried bitterly.

52_6.shloka: तां क्लिष्टमाल्याभरणां विलपन्तीमनाथवत्।अभ्यधावत् वैदेहीं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.52.6।।
52_6.translation: Ravana, king of the demons, ran towards Sita who was weeping like an orphan with her garlands and ornaments crushed.
52_6.word_by_word: क्लिष्टमाल्याभरणाम् lady whose garlands were crushed and jewels let loose, अनाथवत् like orphan, विलपन्तीम् weeping lady, तां वैदेहीम् that Vaidehi, राक्षसाधिपः demon king, रावणः Ravana, अभ्यधावत ran towards.

52_7.shloka: तां लतामिव वेष्टन्तीमालिङ्गन्तीं महाद्रुमान्।मुञ्च मुञ्चेति बहुशः प्रवदन्राक्षसाधिपः।।3.52.7।।क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति रामेण रहितां वने।जीवितान्ताय केशेषु जग्राहान्तकसन्निभः।।3.52.8।।
52_7.translation: Separated from Rama in the forest, Sita hugged huge trees, running round and round like a creeper coiled, crying loudly, 'Rama, O Rama' . The king of the demons, like Yama, caught hold of her hair only to invite his death, all the time saying, Leave it, Leave it  (Leave the tree).
52_7.word_by_word: अन्तकसन्निभः like Yama, lord of death, राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, लतामिव like a creeper, महाद्रुमान् huge trees, वेष्टन्तीम् coiled  आलिङ्गन्तीम् embracing, वने in the forest, रामेण by Rama, रहिताम् separated from, राम रामेति saying 'Rama, Rama', क्रोशन्तीम् lamenting, ताम् her, मुञ्च मुञ्च इति leave it, leave it, बहुशः several times, प्रवदन् uttering, जीवितान्ताय to bring an end to his life, केशेषु by her hair, जग्राह caught hold.

52_8.shloka: प्रधर्षितायां सीतायां बभूव सचराचरम्।जगत्सर्वममर्यादं तमसान्धेन संवृतम्।।3.52.9।।न वाति मारुतस्तत्र निष्प्रभोऽभूद्दिवाकरः।
52_8.translation: While Sita was being assaulted, the earth with the animate and the inanimate crossed all limits of moral law and became enveloped in blinding darkness. The wind  ceased to blow and the Sun, to shine.
52_8.word_by_word: सीतायाम् when Sita, प्रधर्षितायाम् was assaulted, सचराचरम् with all beings animate and inanimate, सर्वम् all, जगत् world, अमर्यादम् crossed all moral law, अन्धेन तमसा  by pitch darkness, संवृतम्  enveloped, बभूव became, तत्र then, मारुतः wind, न वाति did not blow, दिवाकरः the Sun, निष्प्रभः lustreless, अभूत् became.

52_9.shloka: दृष्ट्वा सीतां परामृष्टां दीनां दिव्येन चक्षुषा।।3.52.10।।कृतं कार्यमिति श्रीमान्व्याजहार पितामहः।
52_9.translation: Brahma, the glorious Grandfather, saw with his divine eyes, Sita in a desperate state caught by the enemy and said, 'The task is accomplished.
52_9.word_by_word: श्रीमान् glorious, पितामहः grandfather( Brahma), दीनाम् a desperate woman, सीताम् Sita, परामृष्टाम् assaulted by the enemy, दिव्येन divine, चक्षुषा eyes, दृष्ट्वा saw, कार्यम् the task, कृतम् is accomplished, इति thus, व्याजहार said.

52_10.shloka: प्रहृष्टा व्यथिताश्चासन्सर्वे ते परमर्षयः।।3.52.11।।दृष्ट्वा सीतां परामृष्टां दण्डकारण्यवासिनः।रावणस्य विनाशं च प्राप्तं बुद्ध्वा यदृच्छया।।3.52.12।।
52_10.translation: All the great seers residing in Dandaka forest felt both happy and sad, happy because the destruction of Ravana is at hand and sad because Sita was in distress.
52_10.word_by_word: दण्डकारण्यवासिनः residents of Dandaka forest, सर्वे all, ते those, परमर्षयः great seers, सीताम् Sita, परामृष्टाम्  abducted, दृष्ट्वा  seeing, यदृच्छया that which happened naturally, रावणस्य Ravana's, विनाशं च destruction, प्राप्तम् has come, बुद्ध्वा knowing, प्रहृष्टाः happy, व्यथिताश्च distressed, आसन् became.

52_11.shloka: स तु तां राम रामेति रुदन्तीं लक्ष्मणेति च।जगामादाय चाकाशं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।।3.52.13।।
52_11.translation: While Sita was crying, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana', Ravana, lord of the demons, carried her back into the sky.
52_11.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, राम रामेति saying, Rama, O Rama, लक्ष्मणेति च O Lakshmana, रुदन्तीम् crying, ताम् her, आदाय taking her, आकाशम् into the  sky, जगाम went.

52_12.translation: SIta who had put on pure gold ornaments on her body and who was clad in yellow silk  shone like lightning.
52_12.word_by_word: तप्ताभरणजुष्टाङ्गी lady wearing on her limbs pure gold ornaments, पीतकौशेयवासिनी lady clad in yelow silk, राजपुत्री princess, विद्युत् सौदामिनी यथा like lightning, रराज shone.

52_13.shloka: उद्धूतेन च वस्त्रेण तस्याः पीतेन रावणः।अधिकं परिबभ्राज गिरिर्दीप्त इवाग्निना।।3.52.15।।
52_13.translation: Ravana was shining all the more with(her) yellow clothes blowing in the air, and looked like a mountain shining with fire burning around.
52_13.word_by_word: तस्याः her, उद्धूतेन blown, पीतेन yellow, वस्त्रेण clothes, रावणः Ravana, अग्निना with fire, दीप्तः glowing, गिरिरिव like a mountain अधिकम् more, परिबभ्राज shone.

52_14.shloka: तस्याः परमकल्याण्यास्ताम्राणि सुरभीणि च।पद्मपत्राणि वैदेह्या अभ्यकीर्यन्त रावणम्।।3.52.16।।
52_14.translation: The red lotus petals worn by the most auspicious Sita, princess of Videha, were showered on Ravana.
52_14.word_by_word: परमकल्याण्याः of the most auspicious, तस्याः her, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, ताम्राणि copper  coloured, सुरभीणि fragrant, पद्मपत्राणि lotus petals, रावणम् Ravana, अभ्यकीर्यन्त were showered on him.

52_15.translation: As the goldencoloured garment worn by Sita blew in the wind, it looked like a coppercoloured cloud illumined by the evening Sun in the sky.
52_15.word_by_word: तस्याः her, आकाशे in the sky, उद्धूतम् blown by the wind, कनकप्रभम् goldenhued, कौशेयम् silken robes, आतपे exposed to the evening Sun , आदित्यरागेण by the Sun's redness, ताम्रम् red, अभ्रमिव cloudlike, बभौ appeared.

52_16.shloka: तस्यास्तत्सुनसं वक्त्रमाकाशे रावणाङ्कगम्।न रराज विना रामं विनालमिव पङ्कजम्।।3.52.18।।
52_16.translation: Sita's face with her beautiful nose on Ravana's lap and not on Rama's, shone no more like a lotus without its stalk.
52_16.word_by_word: आकाशे in the sky, रावणाङ्कगम् in the lap of Ravana, सुनसम् with a beautiful nose, तस्याः वक्त्रम् her face, रामं विना without Rama, विनालम् without stalk, पङ्कजम् इव like lotus, न रराज did not shine.

52_17.shloka: बभूव जलदं नीलं भित्त्वा चन्द्र इवोदितः।सुललाटं सुकेशान्तं पद्मगर्भाभमव्रणम्।।3.52.19।।शुक्लैस्सुविमलैर्दन्तै प्रभावद्भिरलङ्कृतम्।तस्यास्तद्विमलं वक्त्रमाकाशे रावणाङ्कगम्।।3.52.20।।रुदितं व्यपमृष्टास्रं चन्द्रवत्प्रियदर्शनम्।सुनासं चारुताम्रोष्ठमाकाशे हाटकप्रभम्।।3.52.21।।
52_17.translation: Sita's face looked beautiful with her smooth forehead, shining hair and spotless complexion like the inside of a lotus, with clean, white, shining teeth, a nice nose and lovely red lips. She was continuously weeping and wiping her tears. Her face which was pleasing like the Moon on the lap of Ravana appeared as though the Moon was rising through dark clouds.
52_17.word_by_word: सुललाटम् a fine forehead, सुकेशान्तम् beautiful hair, पद्मगर्भाभम्  the glow of the inner side of a fully blossomed lotus, अव्रणम् whose face had no marks, शुक्लैः white, सुविमलैः  clean, प्रभावद्भि: shining, दन्तैः teeth, अलङ्कृतम् decorated, रुदितम् as she wept, व्यपमृष्टास्रम् wiped her tears, सुनासम् of nice nose, चारुताम्रोष्ठम् with lovely red lips, आकाशे in the sky, हाटकप्रभम् having golden glow, रावणाङ्कगम् held by Ravana, तस्याः her, तत् that, विमलम् pure, वक्त्रम् face, नीलम् dark blue, जलदम् rain cloud, भित्त्वा breaking through, उदितः risen,चन्द्र इव like Moon, बभूव appeared.

52_18.shloka: राक्षसेन समाधूतं तस्यास्तद्वदनं शुभम्।शुशुभे न विना रामंदिवा चन्द्र इवोदितः।।3.52.22।।
52_18.translation: Shaken up by the demon and deprived of Rama's company, Sita's beautiful face looked like the Moon during daytime without any glow.
52_18.word_by_word: राक्षसेन by the demon, समाधूतम् being shaken, तस्याः her, शुभम् auspicious, तत् that, वदनम् face, रामं विना without Rama, दिवा by daytime, उदितः arisen, चन्द्रः इव Moon like, न शुशुभे did not glow.

52_19.shloka: सा हेमवर्णा नीलाङ्गं मैथिली राक्षसाधिपम्।शुशुभे काञ्चनी काञ्ची नीलं मणिमिवाश्रिता।।3.52.23।।
52_19.translation: Goldencomplexioned Sita, princess of Mithila, held by the darkcoloured king of the demons, shone like a girdle resting on a dark blue sapphire.
52_19.word_by_word: नीलाङ्गम् dark body, राक्षसाधिपम् lord of the demons, आश्रिता was held, हेमवर्णा golden complexioned, सा मैथिली that Maithili, नीलम् मणिम् sapphire, काञ्चनी golden, काञ्ची इव like a girdle, शुशुभे shone.

52_20.shloka: सा पद्मगौरी हेमाभा रावणं जनकात्मजा।विद्युद्घनमिवाविश्य शुशुभे तप्तभूषणा।।3.52.24।।
52_20.translation: Bright like a golden lotus, adorned with gold ornaments, Sita, the daughter of Janaka, held by Ravana, looked like a streak of lightning shining bright in a dark cloud.
52_20.word_by_word: पद्मगौरी a lady like a bright lotus, हेमाभा of golden colour, तप्तभूषणा with bright goldornaments, सा जनकात्मजा  that Janaka's daughter, रावणम् to Ravana, आविश्य clinging, घनम् dark cloud, आविश्य held by, विद्युदिव like lightning, शुशुभे shone bright.

52_21.shloka: तस्या भूषणघोषेण वैदेह्या राक्षसाधिपः।बभौ सचपलो नीलस्सघोष इव तोयदः।।3.52.25।।
52_21.translation: The lord of the demons by the side of Sita, princess of Videha with her jingling ornaments looked like the darkblue raincloud with its lightning and thunder.
52_21.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः the lord of the demons, तस्याः वैदेह्याः that Vaidehi's, भूषणघोषेण by the tinkling ornaments, सचपलः along with lightning, सघोषः roaring, नीलः dark blue, तोयदः इव like raincloud, बभौ seemed.

52_22.shloka: उत्तमाङ्गाच्च्युता तस्याः पुष्पवृष्टिस्समन्ततः।सीताया ह्रिममाणायाः पपात धरणीतले।।3.52.26।।
52_22.translation: As Sita was being carried away, the shower of flowers dropped from her head and scattered on the earth.
52_22.word_by_word: ह्रियमाणायाः as she was being carried away, तस्याः सीतायाः that Sita's, उत्तमाङ्गात् from the head, च्युताः dropped, पुष्पवृष्टिः rain of flowers, समन्ततः all over, धरणीतले on the earth, पपात fell down.

52_23.shloka: सा तु रावणवेगेन पुष्पवृष्टिः समन्ततः।समाधूता दशग्रीवं पुनरेवाभ्यवर्तत।।3.52.27।।
52_23.translation: The shower of flowers that fell flew towards the tenheaded Ravana again in the swirling motion (of the chariot).
52_23.word_by_word: समन्ततः all over, सा पुष्पवृष्टिः that shower of flowers, रावणवेगेन by the speed of Ravana, समाधूता swirling together, पुनः again, दशग्रीवमेव on to the tenheaded Ravana only, अभ्यवर्तत went towards.

52_24.shloka: अभ्यवर्तत पुष्पाणां धारा वैश्रवणानुजम्।नक्षत्रमाला विमला मेरुं नगमिवोन्नतम्।।3.52.28।।
52_24.translation: The shower of flowers that dropped went round towards Ravana, brother of Vaisravana, like the bright garland of stars move towards mount Meru.
52_24.word_by_word: पुष्पाणाम् of the flowers, धारा flow, विमला clean, नक्षत्रमाला rows of stars, उन्नतम् high, मेरुं नगमिव mount Meru, वैश्रवणानुजम् on the brother of Vaisravana, अभ्यवर्तत went towards.

52_25.shloka: चरणान्नूपुरं भ्रष्टं वैदेह्या रत्नभूषितम्।विद्युन्मण्डलसङ्काशं पपात मधुरस्वनम्।।3.52.29।।
52_25.translation: The gemstudded anklet of Sita, looking like an orb of lightning, dropped with a gentle sound.
52_25.word_by_word: वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, चरणात् from her feet, भ्रष्टम् dropped, रत्नभूषितम् ornament studded with gems, नूपुरम् anklet, विद्युन्मण्डलसङ्काशम् looking like an orb of lightning, मधुरस्वनम् making gentle sound, पपात fell down.

52_26.shloka: तरुप्रवालरक्ता सा नीलाङ्गं राक्षसेश्वरम्।प्राशोभयत वैदेही गजं कक्ष्येव काञ्चनी।।3.52.30।।
52_26.translation: With her golden girdle, Sita whose complexion resembled tender leaves looked like a golden chain to bind an elephant with. (Here Ravana is the elephant).
52_26.word_by_word: तरुप्रवालरक्ता red like tender leaves, सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, नीलाङ्गम् dark coloured, राक्षसेश्वरम् Ravana, काञ्चनी golden, कक्ष्ये binding chain, गजमिव like an elephant, प्राशोभयत made him glow.

52_27.shloka: तां महोल्कामिवाकाशे दीप्यमानां स्वतेजसा।जहाराऽकाशमाविस्य सीतां वैश्रवणानुजः।।3.52.31।।
52_27.translation: The younger brother of Vaisravana (Ravana), like a massive comet, carried Sita, who was glowing in the radiance of her own beauty, and entered the sky.
52_27.word_by_word: वैश्रवणानुजः brother of Vaisravana, महोल्कामिव  like a massive comet, स्वतेजसा in her natural radiance, आकाशे in the sky, दीप्यमानाम् glowing, तां सीताम् Sita, आकाशम् into the sky, आविश्य having entered, जहार carried.

52_28.translation: Like the dim stars falling from the sky, her ornaments, bright as flame, scattered on the groundtinkling.
52_28.word_by_word: तस्याः her, अग्निवर्णानि bright as flame, तानि भूषणानि those ornaments, सघोषाणि tinkling, अम्बरात् from the sky, क्षीणाः dim, ताराः इव like the stars, महीतले on the ground, अवकीर्यन्त  scattered.

52_29.translation: Sita's necklace shining like the bright Moon slipped from between her breasts like the river Ganga falling down from the sky.
52_29.word_by_word: तस्याः वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, स्तनान्तरात् from between the breasts, भ्रष्टः fell down, ताराधिपद्युतिः shining like the Moon, हारः necklace, निपतन् fell, गगनात् from the sky, च्युता dropped, गङ्गेव like river Ganga, भाति seemed.

52_30.translation: The trees filled with birds of all kinds, shaken at the top by stormy winds seemed to be saying to Sita, 'Be not afraid'.
52_30.word_by_word: उत्पातवाताभिहताः hit by the stormy wind, नानाद्विजगणायुताः filled with different flocks of birds, पादपाः trees, विधूताग्राः 'Be not afraid', मा भैः इति saying, 'Be not afraid', व्याजह्रुः इव as if they said.

52_31.translation: Lotusponds with withering lotuses and with disturbed aquatic life like fishes in fright were as if grieving for Sita as one would grieve for a companion who is unable to breathe.
52_31.word_by_word: ध्वस्तकमलाः with lotuses withering, त्रस्तमीनजलेचराः with disturbed aquatic animals like fishes, नलिन्यः lotus ponds, गतोच्छ्वासाम्  who lost her power to breathe, सखीमिव like a companion, मैथिलीम् Maithili, अन्वशोचन्त felt sorry for her.

52_32.translation: Then the lions, tigers, deer and birds gathered together in anger (also anguish) and ran after Sita's shadow.
52_32.word_by_word: तदा then, सिंहव्याघ्रमृगद्विजाः lions, tigers, deer and birds, समन्तात् अभिसम्पत्य coming together from all sides, रोषात् due to anguish, छायानुगामिनः followers of the shadow, सीताम् Sita, अन्वधावन् ran following her.

52_33.translation: The  mountains were  shedding tears in the form of waterfalls, and  crying with hands lifted up in the form of peaks, while Sita was being carried away.
52_33.word_by_word: सीतायाम् Sita, ह्रियमाणायाम् carried away, पर्वताः mountains, जलप्रपातास्रमुखाः with tears rolling down in the form of waterfalls  शृङ्गैः representing the peaks, उच्छ्रितबाहुभिः lifting the hands high, विक्रोशन्तीव seemed as if they were crying in grief.

52_34.translation: Seeing Sita abducted, the glorious Sun looked lustreless and distraught. He developed a pale white disk around him.
52_34.word_by_word: ह्रियमाणाम् while being hijacked, वैदेहीम् Sita, दृष्ट्वा seeing, श्रीमान् glorious, दिवाकरः Sun, दीनः distressed, प्रतिध्वस्तप्रभः with dimmed lustre, पाण्डुरमण्डलः white disk around, आसीत् had.

52_35.shloka: नास्ति धर्मः कुतस्सत्यं नार्जवं नानृशंसता।यत्र रामस्य वैदेहीं भार्यां हरति रावणः।।3.52.39।।इति सर्वाणि भूतानि गणशः पर्यदेवयन्।
52_35.translation: When Rama's consort, the princess of Videha, is being carried away by Ravana, how can there be rightousness or truth or uprightness or compassion for men? Thus bewailed all beings in groups.
52_35.word_by_word: यत्र where, रामस्य Rama's, भार्या wife, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, रावणः Ravana, हरति is abducting, धर्मः dharma, नास्ति is not there, सत्यम् truth, कुतः where is it , आर्जवम् uprightness, न not, अनृशंसता compassion, न not, इति thus, सर्वाणि all, भूतानि beings, गणशः in groups, पर्यदेवयन्  wailed.

52_36.translation: The young deer full of fear and distress looked again and again with eyes blurred with tears at the direction in which Sita went. And wept.
52_36.word_by_word: मृगपोतकाः young deer, वित्रस्तकाः with fear, दीनमुखाः with distressed looks, अस्रपाताविलेक्षणाः unable to see clearly due to eyes filled with tears, नयनैः with eyes, उद्वीक्ष्योद्वीक्ष्य looked up (at the direction) again and again, रुरुदुः wept.

52_37.shloka: सुप्रवेपितगात्राश्च बभूवुर्वनदेवताः।।3.52.41।।विक्रोशन्तीं दृढं सीतां दृष्ट्वा दुःखं तथा गताम्।
52_37.translation: The  sylvan deities shivered, seeing Sita's grief and cried aloud.
52_37.word_by_word: तथा likewise, दुःखम् grief, गताम् experiencing, दृढम् strongly, विक्रोशन्तीम् called out weeping, सीताम् to Sita, दृष्टवा seeing, वनदेवताः sylvan deities, सुप्रवेपितगात्राश्च with their bodies shivering, बभूवुः became.

52_38.shloka: तां तु लक्ष्मण रामेति क्रोशन्तीं मधुरस्वरम्।।3.52.42।।अवेक्षमाणां बहुशो वैदेहीं धरणीतलम्।स तामाकुलकेशान्तां विप्रमृष्टविशेषकाम्।।3.52.43।।जहारात्म विनाशाय दशग्रीवो मनस्स्विनीम्।
52_38.translation: The ten headed Ravana abducted Sita who was calling out, O Rama, O Lakshmana with her sweet voice, weeping , looking down on the earth her hair dishevelled and auspicious, (vermilion) mark on the forehead erased. Ravana abducted this highminded Sita for his own destruction.
52_38.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राम Rama, इति saying so, मधुरस्वरम् in a sweet voice, क्रोशन्तीम् while she was weeping, बहुशः many times, धरणीतलम् down to the ground, अवेक्षमाणाम् looknig at, आकुलकेशान्ताम् hair dishevelled, विप्रमृष्ट विशेषकाम् with the  auspicious mark on the forehead erased, मनस्स्विनीम् highminded woman, तां वैदेहीम् to that Vaidehi, सः दशग्रीवः that tenheaded Ravana, आत्मविनाशाय for his own destruction, जहार abducted.

52_39.shloka: ततस्तु सा चारुदती शुचिस्मिता विनाकृता बन्धुजनेन मैथिली।अपश्यती राघवलक्ष्मणावुभौ विवर्णवक्त्राभयभारपीडिता।।3.52.44।।
52_39.translation: Then Sita  whose teeth were  beautiful and smile, sweet was distanced from her kins, and, unable to see both Rama and Lakshmana, grew pale in intense fear.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
52_39.word_by_word: ततः then, चारुदती of beautiful teeth, शुचिस्मिला a lady gifted with a sweet smile, बन्धुजनेन विनाकृता  distanced from her relatives, मैथिली Maithili, राघवलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, अपश्यती unable to see, विवर्णवक्त्रा face grew pale, भयभारपीडिता with the stress of fear.

53_1.shloka: [Sita reproaches Ravana--pleads, threatens Ravana with dire consequences.]खमुत्पतन्तं तं दृष्ट्वा मैथिली जनकात्मजा।दुःखिता परमोद्विग्ना भये महति वर्तिनी।।3.53.1।।
53_1.translation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, princess of Mithila felt miserable, looking at Ravana taking off and got very  much agitated out of fear.
53_1.word_by_word: जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, मैथिली Maithili, खम् into the sky, उत्पतन्तम् while flying, तम् Ravana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, परमोद्विग्ना agitated greatly, महति intense, भये fear, वर्तिनी became, दुःखिता miserable.

53_2.shloka: रोषरोदनताम्राक्षी भीमाक्षं राक्षसाधिपम्।रुदन्ती करुणं सीता ह्रियमाणेदमब्रवीत्।।3.53.2।।
53_2.translation: While being carried away, Sita wept piteously and her eyes went red with tears of anger and grief. Looking at the frightening eyes of the king of the demons, she said these words :
53_2.word_by_word: ह्रियमाणा while being carried away, सीता Sita, करुणम् piteously, रुदन्ती weeping, रोषरोदनताम्राक्षी eyes reddened due to crying out of anger and grief, भीमाक्षम् with frightening  eyes, राक्षसाधिपम् to Ravana, the lord of demons, इदम् these (words), अब्रवीत् said.

53_3.shloka: न व्यपत्रपसे नीच कर्मणानेन रावण।ज्ञात्वा विरहितां यन्मां चोरयित्वा पलायसे।।3.53.3।।
53_3.translation: O mean Ravana, are you not ashamed of kidnapping me when I was separated (from my husband)?
53_3.word_by_word: नीच O mean, रावण Ravana, विरहिताम् when I am separated, माम् me, चोरयित्वा having  stolen, पलायसे  run away, इति यत् like this, अनेन by this, कर्मणा by action, न व्यपत्रपसे areyou not ashamed?

53_4.shloka: त्वयैव नूनं दुष्टात्मन् भीरुणा हर्तुमिच्छता।ममापवाहितो भर्ता मृगरूपेण मायया।।3.53.4।।
53_4.translation: O wicked fellow, with an intention to abduct me you enticed my husband to a distance deceitfully in the form of a deer.
53_4.word_by_word: दुष्टात्मन् O wicked fellow, हर्तुम् to abduct, इच्छता desiring, भीरुणा by a timid one, त्वयैव  yourself, मम my, भर्ता husband, मायया with deceit, मृगरूपेण in the form of deer, अपवाहितः led to a distance.

53_5.shloka: यो हि मामुद्यतस्त्रातुं सोऽप्ययं विनिपातितः।गृध्रराजः पुराणोऽसौ श्वशुरस्य सखा मम।।3.53.5।।
53_5.translation: This Jatayu, an old friend of my fatherinlaw tried to protect me but he too has fallen a prey.
53_5.word_by_word: यः who, गृध्रराजः king of vultures, माम् me, त्रातुम् to protect, उद्यतः tried, मम my, श्वशुरस्य of fatherinlaw, पुराणः old, सखा friend, अयम् he, असौ अपि he too, विनिपातितः is fallen.

53_6.shloka: परमं खलु ते वीर्यं दृश्यते राक्षसाधम।विश्राव्य नामधेयं हि युद्धे नास्मि जिता त्वया।।3.53.6।।
53_6.translation: O lowly demon, you have, indeed, shown your heroism  (in killing this old vulture).You have not won me in a battle declared by you.
53_6.word_by_word: राक्षसाधमः O lowly demon, ते विर्यम्  bravery, परमम् very great, दृश्यते खलु is seen indeed, नामधेयम् your name, विश्राव्य after announcing, त्वया by your, युद्धे war, जिता won, नास्मि हि I am not.

53_7.shloka: ईदृशं गर्हितं कर्म कथं कृत्वा न लज्जसे।स्त्रियाश्च हरणं नीच रहिते च परस्य च।।3.53.7।।
53_7.translation: O lowly fellow how is it that you are not ashamed of commiting such a despicable act  abducting another's wife when she is alone ?
53_7.word_by_word: नीच O lowly fellow, रहिते when alone, परस्य च other's, स्त्रियाः woman's, हरणम् abduction, ईदृशम् this way, गर्हितम् despised, कर्म deed, कृत्वा after doing, कथम् how is it, न लज्जसे  are you not ashamed

53_8.shloka: कथयिष्यन्ति लोकेषु पुरुषाः कर्म कुत्सितम्।सुनृशंसमधर्मिष्ठं तव शौण्डीर्यमानिनः।।3.53.8।।
53_8.translation: You consider yourself to be brave after committing such a cruel, despicable and unrighteous act for which people of the world will condemn you.
53_8.word_by_word: शौण्डीर्यमानिनः considering yourself to be brave, तव yourself, सुनृशंसम् this very cruel act, अधर्मिष्ठम् unrighteous, कुत्सितम् despised by others, कर्म action, लोकेषु in the worlds, पुरुषाः people, कथयिष्यन्ति will talk about.

53_9.shloka: धिक्ते शौर्यं च सत्त्वं च यत्त्वं कथितवांस्तदा।कुलाक्रोशकरं लोके धिक्ते चारित्रमीदृशम्।।3.53.9।।
53_9.translation: Fie upon your heroism and strength about which you boasted. Fie upon your character that would bring calumny to the race and the world. I condemn such behaviour of yours.
53_9.word_by_word: strength, धिक् fie, लोके in the world, कुलाक्रोशकरम् that which would bring calumny to the family, ते to you, ईदृशम् such, चारित्रम् behaviour, धिक् I condemn.

53_10.shloka: किं कर्तुं शक्यमेवं हि यज्जवेनैव धावसि।मुहूर्तमपि तिष्ठस्व न जीवन्प्रतियास्यसि।।3.53.10।।
53_10.translation: Tarry a little, you will not go back with life. What can be done now since you are running away so swiftly?
53_10.word_by_word: किम् what, कर्तुम् to do, शक्यम् is possible, यत् since, एवम् in this way, जवेनैव  so swiftly, धावसि you are running, मुहूर्तमपि for a moment also, तिष्ठस्व you stay, जीवन् with life, न प्रतियास्यसि you will not.

53_11.shloka: न हि चक्षुष्पथं प्राप्य तयोः पार्थिवपुत्रयोः।ससैन्योऽपि समर्थस्त्वं मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम्।।3.53.11।।
53_11.translation: If you come within sight of these two princes, it will not be possible for you to live for a moment even if you are with your entire army.
53_11.word_by_word: तयोः of both of them, पार्थिवपुत्रयोः of the two princes, चक्षुष्पथम् within the range of their sight, प्राप्य on reaching, त्वम् you, ससैन्योऽपि even with your army, मुहूर्तमपि for a moment, जीवितुम् to live, न समर्थः हि not possible.

53_12.shloka: न त्वं तयोश्शरस्पर्शं सोढुं शक्तः कथञ्चन।वने प्रज्वलितस्येव स्पर्शमग्नेर्विहंगमः।।3.53.12।।
53_12.translation: Just as a bird cannot bear the touch of forest fire, you will not be able to endure the mere touch of arrows of the two heroes indeed.
53_12.word_by_word: वने in the forest, प्रज्वलितस्य of burning, अग्नेः fire, स्पर्शम् touch, विहङ्गमः इव like bird, त्वम् you, तयोः of both of them, शरस्पर्शम् touch of arrows, सोढुम् to endure, कथञ्चन anyhow, न शक्तः it is not possible for you.

53_13.shloka: साधु कुर्वाऽऽत्मनः पथ्यं साधु मां मुञ्च रावण।मत्प्रधर्षणरुष्टो हि भ्रात्रा सह पतिर्मम।।3.53.13।।विधास्यति विनाशाय त्वं मां यदि न मुञ्चसि।
53_13.translation: O Ravana be good and do whatever is beneficial to you. It is proper for you to release me. If you do not, enraged over my assault, my husband along with his brother, will bring about your destruction.
53_13.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, साधु it is only proper, आत्मनः your, पथ्यम् good for your wellbeing, कुरु you may do, माम् me, साधु be good, मुञ्च you may release, त्वम् you, माम् me, न मुञ्चसि you do not leave, यदि what, मत्प्रधर्षणरुष्टः enraged for the assaulting me, मम पतिः my husband, भ्रात्रा सह along with his brother, विनाशाय for destruction, विधास्यति he will arrange.

53_14.shloka: येन त्वं व्यवसायेन बलान्मां हर्तुमिच्छसि।।3.53.14।।व्यवसायस्स ते नीच भविष्यति निरर्थकः।
53_14.translation: O vile creature, the effort you are making to abduct me forcibly will be fruitless.
53_14.word_by_word: नीच O mean fellow, त्वम् you, येन by which, व्यवसायेन  effort, माम् me, बलात् by force, हर्तुम् to abduct, इच्छसि desire, ते your, सः that, व्यवसायः determination, निरर्थकः fruitless, भविष्यति will become.

53_15.shloka: न ह्यहं तमपश्यन्ती भर्तारं विबुधोपमम्।।3.53.15।।उत्सहे शत्रुवशगा प्राणान्धारयितुं चिरम्।
53_15.translation: I will not be eager to hold on to my life for long to live at the mercy of the enemy without being able to see my godlike husband.
53_15.word_by_word: अहम् I am, विबुधोपमम् godlike, भर्तारम् husband, तम् him, अपश्यन्ती without seeing him, शत्रुवशगा at the mercy of an enemy, चिरम् long, प्राणान् life, धरयितुम् to hold on, न उत्सहे हि I am not enthused.

53_16.shloka: न नूनं चात्मनः पथ्यं श्रेयो वा समवेक्षसे।।3.53.16।।मृत्युकाले यथा मर्त्यो विपरीतानि सेवते।
53_16.translation: At the time of death, mortals behave very differently. They act contrary to their own welfare. Likewise you are not able to foresee what is beneficial and good for you.
53_16.word_by_word: मर्त्य: a mortal, मृत्युकाले at the time of death, यथा as, विपरीतानि very differently, सेवते he will resort to, आत्मनः your own, पथ्यम् whatever is beneficial to you, श्रेयो वा your welfare, न समवेक्षसे you are not able to foresee.

53_17.shloka: मुमूर्षूणां हि सर्वेषां यत्पथ्यं तन्न रोचते।।3.53.17।।पश्याम्यद्य हि कण्ठेत्वां कालपाशावपाशितम्।
53_17.translation: Those who wish to die, do not like anything salutary. I see the noose of death wound round your neck now.
53_17.word_by_word: मुमूर्षूणाम्  who want to die, सर्वेषाम्  all of them, यत् what, पथ्यम् is salutary, तत् that, न रोचते not like, अद्य now, त्वाम् you, कण्ठे in your neck, कालपाशावपाशितम् noose of death wound round, पश्यामि हि I see.

53_18.shloka: यथा चास्मिन्भयस्थाने न बिभेषि दशानन।।3.53.18।।व्यक्तं हिरण्मयान् हि त्वं सम्पश्यसि महीरुहान्।
53_18.translation: O tenheaded Ravana, since you do not fear the source of fear, evidently you see golden trees. (a symptom of death).
53_18.word_by_word: दशानन tenheaded Ravana, त्वम् you, अस्मिन् in this, भयस्थाने cause of fear, यथा even so, न बिभेषि you are not scared, हिरण्मयान् golden, महीरुहान् trees, सम्पश्यसि you see, व्यक्तम्  evident.

53_19.shloka: नदीं वैतरणीं घोरां रुधिरौघनिवाहिनीम्।।3.53.19।।असिपत्रवनं चैव भीमं पश्यसि रावण।
53_19.translation: O Ravana, you see the dreadful river Vaitarani with torrents of blood flowing and frightening forest of trees with swords as leaves.
53_19.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, रुधिरौघनिवाहिनीम् river carrying torrents of blood flowing, घोराम् dreadful, वैतरणीं नदीम् river Vaitarani, भीमम् frightening, असिपत्रवनं चैव forest of trees with swords as leaves, पश्यसि see.

53_20.shloka: तप्तकाञ्चनपुष्पां च वैडूर्यप्रवरच्छदाम्।।3.53.20।।द्रक्ष्यसे शाल्मलीं तीक्ष्णामायसैः कण्टकैश्चिताम्।
53_20.translation: You will see a log of salmali tree with bright golden flowers and excellent vaidurya stone with pointed iron thorns.
53_20.word_by_word: तप्ककाञ्चनपुष्पाम् with bright golden flowers, वैडूर्यप्रवरच्छदाम् with barks of excellent Vaidurya stones like bark, आयसैः with iron, कण्टकैः thorns, चिताम् logged, तीक्ष्णाम् sharp, शाल्मलीम् salmali (silkcotton) tree, द्रक्ष्यसे you see.

53_21.shloka: न हि त्वमीदृशं कृत्वा तस्यालीकं महात्मनः।।3.53.21।।धरितुं शक्ष्यसि चिरं विषं पीत्वेव निर्घृणः।
53_21.translation: You are pitiless. You will not be able to survive for long after deceiving such noble Rama just as man cannot survive after drinking poison.
53_21.word_by_word: निर्घृणः pitiless, त्वम् you, महात्मनः of the noble, तस्य his, ईदृशम् such, अलीकम् deceiving, कृत्वा after doing, विषम् poison, पीत्वेव as if after drinking, चिरम् for long, धरितुम् to survive, न शक्ष्यसि not possible.

53_22.shloka: बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन दुर्निवारेण रावण।।3.53.22।।क्वगतो लप्स्यसे शर्म भर्तुर्मम महात्मनः।
53_22.translation: O Ravana you are bound by the inevitable noose of death. Where shall you get away from great Rama, my husband to obtain peace.
53_22.word_by_word: रावण Ravana, त्वम् you, दुर्निवारेण by the inevitable, कालपाशेन noose of death, बद्धः bound, मम my, भर्तुः husband's, महात्मनः great Rama, क्व where can you, गतः go, शर्म peace, लप्स्यसे will you get.

53_23.shloka: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण विना भ्रात्रा महावने।।3.53.23।।राक्षसा निहता येन सहस्राणि चतुर्दश।स कथं राघवो वीरस्सर्वास्त्रकुशलो बली।।3.53.24।।न त्वां हन्याच्छरैस्तीक्ष्णैरिष्टभार्यापहारिणम्।
53_23.translation: Rama has killed fourteen thousand demons alone without his brother within a moment. He is a strong warrior and wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons. You have stolen his loving wife. How can he live without killing you.
53_23.word_by_word: येन by whom, महावने in this great forest, भ्रात्रा विना without the help of his brother, निमेषान्तरमात्रेण in a short while, चतुर्दश सहस्राणि fourteen thousand, राक्षसाः demons, निहताः were killed, वीरः warrior, सर्वास्त्रकुशली wellversed in the use of all kinds of weapons, बली strong man, सः that, राघवः Rama, इष्टभार्यापहारिणम्  who has stolen his beloved wife, त्वाम् you, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp, शरैः arrows, कथम् how, न हन्यात् will he not kill?

53_24.shloka: तच्चान्यच्च परुषं वैदेही रावणाङ्कगा।।3.53.25।।भयशोकसमाविष्टा करुणं विललाप ह।
53_24.translation: Sita, daughter of Videha, full of sorrow and fear under Ravana's grip uttered these partly harsh and partly piteous wordsweeping.
53_24.word_by_word: रावणाङ्कगा a lady under Ravana's grip, वैदेही Vaidehi (Sita), भयशोकसमाविष्टा full of fear and sorrow, एतत् च these words, अन्यच्च and other words, परुषम् harsh, करुणम् piteously,  विललाप ह wept.

53_25.shloka: तथा भृशार्तां बहुचैव भाषिणीं विलापपूर्वं करुणं च भामिनीम्।जहार पापः करुणं विचेष्टतीं नृपात्मजामागतगात्रवेपथुम्।।3.53.26।।
53_25.translation: Sinful Ravana carried away the beautiful princess trembling with great fear, struggling helplessly, crying pathetically and pleading in many mournful ways.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
53_25.word_by_word: तथा likewise, भृशार्ताम् greatly terrified, विलापपूर्वम् weeping, करुणं च piteously, बहुचैव in many ways, भाषिणीम्  talking, करुणम् mournfully, विचेष्टतीम् struggling, नृपात्मजाम् princess, आगतगात्रवेपथुम्  whose  body started shivering, भामिनीम् to the beautiful lady, पापः sinner Ravana, जहार carried off.

54_1.shloka: [Sita puls a few ornaments in bundles and throws them down in the midst of vanaras-- she hopes somebody will communicate this to Rama.]ह्रियमाणा तु वैदेही कञ्चिन्नाथमपश्यती।ददर्श गिरिशृङ्गस्थान्पञ्च वानरपुङ्गवान्।।3.54.1।।
54_1.translation: While Sita was being kidnapped, she saw no one to protect her. Only five great monkeys stood on the top of a mountain.
54_1.word_by_word: ह्रियमाणा taken away, वैदेही Vaidehi, नाथम् protector, कञ्चित् some one, अपश्यती not seeing, गिरिशृङ्गस्थान् standing on the peak of the mountain, पञ्च five, वानरपुङ्गवान् great monkeys, ददर्श saw.

54_2.shloka: तेषां मध्ये विशालाक्षी कौशेयं कनकप्रभम्।उत्तरीयं वरारोहा शुभान्याभरणानि च।।3.54.2।।मुमोच यदि रामाय शंसेयुरिति मैथिली।
54_2.translation: Largeeyed, bright and beautiful Sita dropped her upper silk garment shining like gold and auspicious ornaments in their midst with a hope they may report this  to Rama.
54_2.word_by_word: विशालाक्षी large eyed, वरारोहा charming, भामिनी effulgent, कनकप्रभम् shining like gold, कौशेयम् silk, उत्तरीयम् upper cloth, शुभानि auspicious, आभरणानि च ornaments also, रामाय for Rama, यदि if at all, शंसेयुः they may tell, इति thus, तेषाम् them, मध्ये between, मुमोच dropped.

54_3.shloka: वस्त्रमुत्सृज्य तन्मध्ये निक्षिप्तं सहभूषणम्।।3.54.3।।सम्भ्रमात्तु दशग्रीवस्तत्कर्म न स बुद्धवान्।
54_3.translation: In his excitement Ravana failed to notice when Sita dropped down that garment along with ornaments in their midst.
54_3.word_by_word: सहभूषणम् along with ornaments, वस्त्रम् clothes, उत्सृज्य discarding, तन्मध्ये in their midst, निक्षिप्तम् thrown down, सः दशग्रीवः that tenheaded Ravana, सम्भ्रमात् due to excitement, तत्  that, कर्म action of Sita, न बुद्धवान् did not know.

54_4.shloka: पिङ्गाक्षास्तां विशालाक्षीं नेत्रैरनिमिषैरिव।।3.54.4।।विक्रोशन्तीं तथा सीतां ददृशुर्वानरर्षभाः।
54_4.translation: The best among the tawneyeyed monkeys gazed, without blinking, at the  largeeyed Sita lamenting.
54_4.word_by_word: पिङ्गाक्षाः tawney eyed, वानरर्षभाः best among monkeys, विशालाक्षीम् largeeyed, तथा like that, विक्रोशन्तीम् lamenting, तां सीताम् that Sita, अनिमिषैरिव without blinking, नेत्रैः eyes, ददृशुः gazed at.

54_5.shloka: स च पम्पामतिक्रम्य लङ्कामभिमुखः पुरीम्।।3.54.5।।जगाम रुदतीं गृह्य वैदेहीं राक्षसेश्वरः।
54_5.translation: Ravana crossed the lake Pampa and flew towards the city of Lanka carrying with him lamenting daughter of Videha.
54_5.word_by_word: सः राक्षसेश्वरः that lord of the demons, पम्पाम् Pampa, अतिक्रम्य on crossing, लङ्कां पुरीम् to the city of Lanka, अभिमुखः towards, रुदतीम् crying, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, गृह्य taking, जगाम went.

54_6.shloka: तां जहार सुसंहृष्टो रावणो मृत्युमात्मनः।।3.54.6।।उत्सङ्गेनेव भुजगीं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रां महाविषाम्।
54_6.translation: Delighted Ravana, carried off Sita, the very embodiment of his death, like one carrying a highly poisonous sharpfanged female snake on his lap.
54_6.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, सुसंहृष्टः delighted, आत्मनः his own, मृत्युम् death, ताम् her, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्राम् sharp fanged, महाविषाम् highly poisonous, भुजगीम् female snake, उत्सङ्गेनेव on his lap, जहार  carried.

54_7.shloka: वनानि सरितश्शैलांत्सरांसि च विहायसा।।3.54.7।।स क्षिप्रं समतीयाय शरश्चापादिव च्युतः।
54_7.translation: Like an arrow released from the bow, Ravana went through the sky, at once crossing forests, rivers mountains and tanks.
54_7.word_by_word: सः he, चापात् from the bow, च्युतः released, शरः इव like an arrow, क्षिप्रम् at once, वनानि forests, सरितः rivers, शैलान् mountains, सरांसि च tanks, विहायसा through the sky, समतीयाय crossed.

54_8.shloka: तिमिनक्रनिकेतं तु वरुणालयमक्षयम्।।3.54.8।।सरितां शरणं गत्वा समतीयाय सागरम्।
54_8.translation: Ravana soon crossed the refuge of rivers, the abode of Varuna, god of the sea, inexhaustible ocean, and the home for whales and crocodiles.
54_8.word_by_word: तिमिनक्रनिकेतम् the abode of whales and crocodiles, अक्षयम् inexhaustible,सरितां शरणम् refuge of all rivers, वरुणालयम् abode Varuna, god of the sea, गत्वा having covered, सागरम् ocean, समतीयाय crossed.

54_9.translation: While Sita, princess of Videha was being carried away, the ocean, abode of Varunagot bewildered, waves rolled back, the movement of big serpents and fishes stopped.
54_9.word_by_word: वैदेह्याम् to Sita, daughter of Videha, ह्रियमाणायाम्  was being carried away, वरुणालयः the abode of Varuna, the ocean, सम्भ्रमात् out of bewilderment, परिवृत्तोर्मिः waves turned back, रुद्धमीनमहोरगः movement of big serpents and fishes stopped, बभूव became.

54_10.translation: The charanas and siddhas moving in the sky said, O tenheaded Ravana this is your  end .
54_10.word_by_word: तदा then, अन्तरिक्षगताः flying in the sky, चारणाः bards, दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, एतदन्तः  इति this is the end, वाचः words, ससृजुः spoke, तदा then, सिद्धाः siddhas, अब्रुवन् uttered.

54_11.shloka: स तु सीतां विवेष्टन्तीमङ्केनादाय रावणः।।3.54.11।।प्रविवेश पुरीं लङ्कां रूपिणीं मृत्युमात्मनः।
54_11.translation: Ravana entered the city of Lanka holding Sita who was tossing from side to side and who was the very embodiment of his death.
54_11.word_by_word: सः रावणः that Ravana, आत्मनः his own, रूपिणीम् personified form, मृत्युम् death, विवेष्टन्तीम् struggling, सीताम् Sita, अङ्केन by his arm, आदाय holding her, लङ्कां पुरीम्  city of Lanka, प्रविवेश entered.

54_12.translation: Ravana went through the well laidout roads of the city of Lanka and through the well many guarded halls of the palace and entered the inner apartment.
54_12.word_by_word: सः Ravana, सुविभक्तमहापथाम्  well laidout roads, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, अभिगम्य entering, संरूढकक्ष्याबहुलम् with many wellguarded halls, स्वम् his, अन्तःपुरम् inner apartment, आविशत् entered.

54_13.shloka: तत्र तामसितापाङ्गां शोकमोहपरायणाम्।।3.54.13।।निदधे रावणस्सीतां मयो मायामिवस्त्रियम्।
54_13.translation: Sita, with her dark eye lashes and lost in utter sorrow was kept in the harem by Ravana, like demon Maya kept Mayamayi.
54_13.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, असितापाङ्गाम् a lady of dark eyelashes, शोकमोहपरायणाम् lady lost in sorrow, तां सीताम् that Sita, मयः demon Maya, मायामिव like Maya, तत्र there ( in the harem), नदधे kept.

54_14.shloka: अब्रवीच्च दशग्रीवः पिशाचीर्घोरदर्शनाः।।3.54.14।।यथा नेमां पुमान् स्त्री वा सीतां पश्यत्यसम्मतः।
54_14.translation: Ravana ordered the female goblins of fearful appearance,'Let no outsider whether man or woman, see her, without my permission'.
54_14.word_by_word: दशग्रीवः tenheaded Ravana, घोरदर्शनाः  of fearful appearance, पिशाचीः female goblins, अब्रवीत् च said, असम्मतः without my permission, पुमान् man, स्त्री वा or a woman, इमाम् this lady, सीताम् Sita, यथा in a way, न पश्यति will not see.

54_15.shloka: मुक्तामणिसुवर्णानि वस्त्राण्याभरणानि च।।3.54.15।।यद्यदिच्छेत्तदेवास्या देयं मच्छन्दतो यथा।
54_15.translation: Pearls, gems or gold, clothes or ornaments, whatever she desires, be made available to her without any hesitation.
54_15.word_by_word: मुक्तामणिसुवर्णानि pearls, gems or gold, वस्त्राणि clothes, आभरणानि च and ornaments, यत् यत् whatever, इच्छेत् she desires, तदेव all that, अस्याः to her, मच्छन्दतो यथा  without hesitation, देयम् should be given.

54_16.shloka: या च वक्ष्यति वैदेहीं वचनं  किञ्चिदप्रियम्।।3.54.16।।अज्ञानाद्यदि वा ज्ञानान्न तस्या जीवितं प्रियम्।
54_16.translation: Whoever utters any unpleasant words knowingly or unknowingly to Sita, princess of Videha is not worthy to survive (must be killed).
54_16.word_by_word: या च whosoever, अज्ञानात् out of ignorance, ज्ञानात् knowingly, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, किञ्चित् even a little, अप्रियम् displeasing, वचनम् words, वक्ष्यति utters, तस्याः her, जीवितम् life, न not, प्रियम्  worthy,

54_17.shloka: तथोक्त्वा राक्षसीस्तास्तु राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान्।।3.54.17।।निष्क्रम्यान्तः पुरात्तस्मात्किंकृत्यमिति चिन्तयन्।ददर्शाष्टौ महावीर्यान्राक्षसान्पिशिताशनान्।।3.54.18।।
54_17.translation: The courageous lord of the demons, having said so to the demonesses, came out of the inner apartment. While contemplating the future course of action, he saw eight powerful, carnivorous demons.
54_17.word_by_word: प्रतापवान्  courageous, राक्षसेन्द्रः lord of demons (Ravana), राक्षसीः demoness, तथा likewise, उक्त्वा having said so, तस्मात् from that, अन्तःपुरात् from the inner apartments, निष्क्रम्य  coming out, किम् what, कृत्यम् can be done, चिन्तयन् while thinking, महावीर्यान् most powerful ones, पिशिताशनान् flesheaters, अष्टौ eight, राक्षसान् demons, ददर्श saw.

54_18.shloka: स तान्दृष्ट्वा महावीर्यो वरदानेन मोहितः।उवाचैतानिदं वाक्यं प्रशस्य बलवीर्यतः।।3.54.19।।
54_18.translation: The mighty Ravana, deluded by the boons, praised the strength and valour of the demons and said :
54_18.word_by_word: तान्दृष्ट्वा seeing them, महावीर्यः mighty, वरदानेन by the boons, मोहितः  a deluded one, सः he, बलवीर्यतः about their strength, प्रशस्य after praising them, एतान् them, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, उवाच said.

54_19.shloka: नानाप्रहरणाः क्षिप्रमितो गच्छत सत्वराः।जनस्थानं हतस्थानं भूतपूर्वं खरालयम्।।3.54.20।।
54_19.translation: Armed with different weapons, proceed at once to Janasthana where Khara lived and died.
54_19.word_by_word: नानाप्रहरणाः a variety of weapons, सत्वराः very quickly, इतः from here, क्षिप्रम् at once, हतस्थानम्  where he was slain, खरालयम् the abode of Khara, भूतपूर्वम् the earlier (dwelling), जनस्थानम् Janasthana, गच्छत you may go.

54_20.shloka: तत्रोष्यतां जनस्थाने शून्ये निहतराक्षसे।पौरुषं बलमाश्रित्य त्रासमुत्सृज्य दूरतः।।3.54.21।।
54_20.translation: Go and there in the desolate Janasthana where all demons had been killed, leaving all your apprehensions and relying on your strength and vigour.
54_20.word_by_word: पौरुषम् prowess, बलम् vigour, आश्रित्य relying on, त्रासम् fear, दूरतः leaving, उत्सृज्य given up, निहतराक्षसे where all demons were killed, शून्ये desolate, तत्र there, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, उष्यताम् dwell there.

54_21.shloka: बलं हि सुमहद्यन्मे जनस्थाने निवेशितम्।सदूषणखरं युद्धे हतं रामेण सायकैः।।3.54.22।।
54_21.translation: I had stationed a great army at Janasthana, who were all killed along with Khara and Dusana by Rama's arrows.
54_21.word_by_word: मे mine, सुमहत् very great, यत् since, बलम् army, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, निवेशितम् had stationed, सदूषणखरम् with Dusana and Khara, रामेण by Rama, सायकैः arrows, हतम् killed.

54_22.shloka: तत क्रोधो ममामर्षाद्धैर्यस्योपरि वर्तते।वैरं च सुमहज्जातं रामं प्रति सुदारुणम्।।3.54.23।।
54_22.translation: My anger engineered by my intolerance has crossed the limits of my patience. It has created in me a terrific enmity against Rama.
54_22.word_by_word: ततः then, मम my, अमर्षात् due to that intolerance, क्रोधः wrath, धैर्यस्य one's patience, उपरि over and above, वर्तते is arising, रामं प्रति towards Rama, सुमहत् very great, सुदारुणम् terrific, वैरं च enmity, जातम् is created.

54_23.shloka: निर्यातयितुमिच्छामि तच्च वैरमहं रिपोः।न हि लप्स्याम्यहं निद्रामहत्वा संयुगे रिपुम्।।3.54.24।।
54_23.translation: I want to take revenge on my foe. I shall not sleep until I kill him in a combat.
54_23.word_by_word: अहम् I am, रिपोः enemy, तत् that, निर्यातयितुम् avenge, इच्छामि I am desirous, संयुगे in combat, रिपुम् enemy, अहत्वा without slaying, अहम् I, निद्राम् sleep, न लप्स्यामि हि I am not getting.

54_24.shloka: तं त्विदानीमहं हत्वा खरदूषणघातिनम्।रामं शर्मोपलप्स्यामि धनं लब्ध्वेव निर्धनः।।3.54.25।।
54_24.translation: I will be happy only after killing the destroyer of Khara and Dusana, just as a poor man feels happy only on acquiring wealth.
54_24.word_by_word: अहम् I am, इदानीम् now, खरदूषणघातिनम् the killer of Khara and Dusana, तम् him, रामम् Rama, हत्वा after slaying, निर्धनः one without wealth, धनम् wealth, लब्ध्वा having acquired, इव like that, शर्म pleasure, उपलप्स्यामि I will have.

54_25.translation: While dwelling at Janasthana, all of you should collect exact information about the activities of Rama.
54_25.word_by_word: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, वसद्भि: while dwelling, भवद्भि: by you all, किं what, करोति इति he does, रामम् Rama, आश्रिता pertaining to, प्रवृत्ति: activities, तत्त्वतः exactly, उपनेतव्या get theinformation.

54_26.shloka: अप्रमादाच्च गन्तव्यं सर्वैरपि निशाचरैः।कर्तव्यश्च सदा यत्नो राघवस्य वधं प्रति।।3.54.27।।
54_26.translation: All of you, O nightrangers, should be on the alert there and it should be always your duty to try to kill Rama.
54_26.word_by_word: निशाचरैः by nightrangers, सर्वैरपि by all of them, अप्रमादात् alertly, गन्तव्यम् go there, राघवस्य Rama's, वधं प्रति to slay Rama, सदा always, यत्नः effort, कर्तव्यश्च should be done.

54_27.shloka: युष्माकं च बलज्ञोऽहं बहुशो रणमूर्धनि।अतश्चास्मिन् जनस्थाने मया यूयं नियोजिताः।।3.54.28।।
54_27.translation: I have seen your strength on many war fronts. That is why you have been assigned this  duty at Janasthana.
54_27.word_by_word: अहम् I, रणमूर्धनि on war front, बहुशः many times, युष्माकम् your, बलज्ञः knower of strength, अतश्च therefore, यूयम् you, अस्मिन् in this, जनस्थाने at Janasthana, मया by me, नियोजिताः are  engaged.

54_28.shloka: ततः प्रियं वाक्यमुपेत्य राक्षसा महार्थमष्टावभिवाद्य रावणम्।विहाय लङ्कां सहिताः प्रतस्थिरे यतो जनस्थानमलक्ष्यदर्शनाः।।3.54.29।।
54_28.translation: The eight demons were glad to hear the pleasing and meaningful words of Ravana. They offered him salutations and left Lanka in the direction of Janasthana without being seen by any one.
54_28.word_by_word: ततः then, अष्टौ eight, राक्षसाः demons, प्रियम् dear, महार्थम्  words of profound meaningl, वाक्यम् statement, उपेत्य after receiving, रावणम् Ravana, अभिवाद्य offering salutations, लङ्काम् Lanka, विहाय  leaving, सहिताः together, अलक्ष्यदर्शनाः without being seen by any one, जनस्थानम् to Janasthana, यतः in that direction, प्रतस्थिरे left.

54_29.shloka: ततस्तु सीतामुपलभ्य रावणः सुसम्प्रहृष्टः परिगृह्य मैथिलीम्।प्रसज्य रामेण च वैरमुत्तमं बभूव मोहान्मुदितस्सराक्षसः।।3.54.30।।
54_29.translation: Then the demon Ravana felt greatly happy for getting Sita, princess of Mithila, without knowing in his delusion that he had created the bitterest enmity with Rama.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वामलीकीये आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
54_29.word_by_word: ततः then, राक्षसः the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, सीताम् Sita, उपलभ्य seeing, मैथिलीम् Maithili, परिगृह्य getting, सुसम्प्रहृष्टः feeling extremely happy, रामेण at Rama, उत्तमम्   highest, वैरम् enmity, प्रसज्य incited, मोहात् in delusion, मुदितः rejoiced, बभूव became.

55_1.shloka: [Ravana takes Sita to his palace -- shows her round the mansion, the wealth, attendants etc. to lure her -- persuades her to accept him.]सन्दिश्य राक्षसान्घोरान् रावणोऽष्टौ महाबलान्।आत्मानं बुद्धिवैक्लब्यात्कृतकृत्यममन्यत।।3.55.1।।
55_1.translation: After ordering the eight most fierce  and powerful demons, Ravana had a sense of accomplishment within himself because of his perverse intellect.
55_1.word_by_word: राणवः Ravana, महाबलान् very powerful, धोरान् fierce, अष्टौ eight, राक्षसान् demons, सन्दिश्य ordered, बुद्धिवैक्लब्यात् out of perversion, आत्मानम् himself, कृतकृत्यम् an accomplished one, अमन्यत felt.

55_2.shloka: स चिन्तयानो वैदेहीं कामबाणसमर्पितः।प्रविवेश गृहं रम्यं सीतां द्रष्टुमभित्वरन्।।3.55.2।।
55_2.translation: Thinking about Vaidehi and hit by the arrows of Cupid (the god of love). Ravana hastened to see Sita and entered the beautiful home.
55_2.word_by_word: सः he (Ravana), वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, चिन्तयानः  thinking about, कामबाणैः समर्पितः succumbed to the arrows of Cupid (the god of love), सीताम् Sita, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभित्वरन् hastened, रम्यम् beautiful, गृहम् home, प्रविवेश entered again.

55_3.shloka: स प्रविश्य तु तद्वेश्म रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।अपश्यद्राक्षसीमध्ये सीतां शोकपरायणाम्।।3.55.3।।
55_3.translation: Ravana, lord of the demons, entered his residence and saw Sita full of grief in the midst of the demonesses.
55_3.word_by_word: राक्षसाधिपः lord of the demons, सः रावणः that Ravana, तत् that, वेश्म residence, प्रविश्य entered, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of demonesses, शोकपरायणाम् full of grief, सीताम् Sita, अपश्यत् saw.

55_4.shloka: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीं दीनां शोकभाराभिपीडिताम्।वायुवेगैरिवाक्रान्तां मज्जन्तीं नावमर्णवे।।3.55.4।।मृगयूथपरिभ्रष्टां मृगीं श्वभिरिवावृताम्।अधोमुखमुखीं सीतामभ्येत्य च निशाचरः।।3.55.5।।तां तु शोकपरां दीनामवशां राक्षसाधिपः।स बलाद्दर्शयामास गृहं देवगृहोपमम्।।3.55.6।।
55_4.translation: The demon Ravana forcibly took Sita, her face full of tears, to show her his heavenlike home. Inflicted with grief she looked wretched. She resembled a female deer hounded out of the herd. With her head bent in grief, she looked pathetic like one not under her control, like a boat sinking under the sea driven by the wind.
55_4.word_by_word: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीम्  with face full of tears, दीनाम् piteous , शोकभाराभिपीडिताम् inflicted with the burden of sorrow, वायुवेगैः driven by the wind, (सम्)आक्रान्ताम् overpowered, अर्णवे in the sea, मज्जन्तीम् sinking, नावमिव like a boat, मृगयूथपरिभ्रष्टाम् separated from the herd, श्वभिः by hounds, आवृताम् surrounded by, मृगीमिव like a female deer, अधोमुखमुखीम् with head bent, सीताम् to Sita, निशाचर: demon, अभ्येत्य having gone near, शोकपराम् lady full of grief, दीनाम् pathetic woman, अवशाम् not under her own control, ताम् her, सः राक्षसाधिपः king of the demons(Ravana), बलात् forcibly, देवगृहोपमम् like a heavenly home, गृहम् home, दर्शयामास showed.

55_5.translation: His home was a complex of palaces and mansions served by thousands of women. It was an abode of different flocks of birds. It had captivating pillars studded with gold, crystals, silver, diamonds and vaiduryas. It resounded with wonderful sounds of drums. Its golden entrances were glittering.
55_5.word_by_word: हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधम् complex of palaces, स्त्रीसहस्रनिषेवितम् served by thousands of women, नानापक्षिगणैः by different flocks of birds, जुष्टम् attended, नानारत्नसमन्वितम्  studded with a variety of gems, दान्तकैः with ivory, तापनीयैः च and golden, स्फाटिकैः crystals, राजतैरपि silver, वज्रवैडूर्यचित्रैः diamonds and vaiduryas, दृष्टिमनोहरैः captivating, स्तम्भैः with pillars, दिव्यदुन्दुभिनिर्ह्रादम् resounding with wonderful drums, तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणम् having glittering golden entrance.

55_6.shloka: सोपानं काञ्चनं चित्रमारुरोह तया सह।।3.55.9।।दान्तका राजताश्चैव गवाक्षाः प्रियदर्शनाः।हेमजालावताश्चासन्स्तत्र प्रासादपङ्क्तयः।।3.55.10।।
55_6.translation: He ascended the wonderful golden staircase taking Sita along with him.Beautiful looked the rows of mansions with silver and ivory windows and golden trellis.
55_6.word_by_word: काञ्चनम् gold, चित्रम् wonderful, सोपानम् staircase, तया सह along with her, आरुरोह he climbed, तत्र there, दान्तकाः ivory, राजताश्च silver, प्रियदर्शनाः beautiful, गवाक्षाः windows, हेमजालावृताः covered by golden trellis, प्रासादपङ्त्कयः rows of mansions, आसन् there were.

55_7.translation: The tenheaded Ravana showed Sita, the princess from Mithila the floors with wonderful crystals.
55_7.word_by_word: दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, स्वभवने in his own mansion, सर्वशः all over, सुधामणिविचित्राणि with wonderful crystals, भूमिभागानि  the floors, मैथिलीम् to Sita, the princess from Mithila, प्रादर्शयत showed.

55_8.shloka: दीर्घिकाः पुष्करिण्यश्च नानावृक्षसमन्विताः।रावणो दर्शयामास सीतां शोकपरायणाम्।।3.55.12।।
55_8.translation: Ravana showed Sita who was overwhelmed with sorrow, stepwells surrrounded by various trees and tanks.
55_8.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, दीर्घिकाः stepwells, नानावृक्षसमन्विताः full of different kinds of trees, पुष्करिण्यश्च lotus tanks, शोकपरायणाम् in deep sorrow, सीताम् Sita, दर्शयामास showed.

55_9.shloka: दर्शयित्वा तु वैदेह्याः कृत्स्नं तद्भवनोत्तमम्।उवाच वाक्यं पापात्मा सीतां लोभितुमिच्छया।।3.55.13।।
55_9.translation: The sinful Ravana showed Sita, princess of Videha, the best of all his mansions in order to allure her, saying:
55_9.word_by_word: पापात्मा sinner, कृत्स्नम् entirely, तत् that, भवनोत्तमम् best of mansions, वैदेह्याः to Vaidehi, दर्शयित्वा on showing, सीताम् Sita, इच्छया desiring to, लोभितुम् to allure, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

55_10.shloka: दश राक्षसकोट्यश्च द्वाविंशतिरथापराः।तेषां प्रभुरहं सीते सर्वेषां भीमकर्मणाम्।।3.55.14।।वर्जयित्वा जरावृद्धान्बालांश्च रजनीचरान्।
55_10.translation: O Sita, leaving aside children and the aged, I am the lord of crores of nightrangers in addition to ten crore demons and twentytwo crore terrorists.
55_10.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, जरावृद्धान् the aged, बालांश्च children, रजनीचरान् night rangers, वर्जयित्वा apart from, दश ten, राक्षसकोट्यश्च crores of demons, अथ and, अपराः over that, द्वाविंशतिः twentytwo crore, भीमकर्मणाम् terrorists, तेषाम् them, सर्वेषाम् for all, अहम् I am, प्रभुः the king.

55_11.shloka: सहस्रमेकमेकस्य मम कार्यपुरस्सरम्।।3.55.15।।यदिदं राजतन्त्रं मे त्वयि सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम्।जीवितं च विशालाक्षि त्वं मे प्राणैर्गरीयसी।।3.55.16।।
55_11.translation: For me alone there are a thousand attendants.The  administration of the kingdom and all my subjects will be under your control. O largeeyed Sita you are dearer to me than my life.
55_11.word_by_word: एकस्य for me alone, मम for me, एकम् one, सहस्रम् thousand, कार्यपुरस्सरम् attending, यत् since, इदम् this, राज्यतन्त्रम् the administration of the kingdom, सर्वम् all, जीवितं च life also, त्वयि you, प्रतिष्ठितम् is resting, विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, त्वम् you, मे my, प्राणैः more than life, गरीयसी dearer.

55_12.shloka: बहूनांस्त्रीसहस्राणां मम योऽसौ परिग्रहः।तासां त्वमीश्वरा सीते मम भार्या भव प्रिये।।3.55.17।।
55_12.translation: O Sita dear  be my chief queen among the many thousands of women I have married.
55_12.word_by_word: सीते Sita, बहूनाम् of many, स्त्री सहस्राणाम् thousands of women, यः such, असौ this, परिग्रहः married to me, तासाम् to all of them, त्वम् you, ईश्वरी chief, भव be, प्रिये O dear, मम my, भार्या wife, भव be.

55_13.shloka: साधु किं तेऽन्यया बुद्ध्या रोचयस्व वचो मम।भजस्वमाभितप्तस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।।3.55.18।।
55_13.translation: Do not think otherwise. Be good and accept my request. I am consumed by thoughts of you. You should be gracious to me.
55_13.word_by_word: ते to you, अन्यया by another, बुद्ध्या by thought, किम् what, साधु be good, मम वचः my words, रोचयस्व you may accept, अभितप्तस्य consumed by thoughts of you, मम me, प्रसादम् grace, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि should.

55_14.shloka: परिक्षिप्ता समुद्रेण लङ्केयं शतयोजना।नेयं धर्षयितुं शक्या सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः।।3.55.19।।
55_14.translation: This Lanka extending to a hundred yojanas and surrounded by the sea is vulnerable to neither demons nor gods including Indra.
55_14.word_by_word: शतयोजना extinding to a hundred yojanas, इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, समुद्रेण by the sea, परिक्षिप्ता surrounded, सेन्द्रैः by deities including Indra, सुरासुरै रपि even sods and demons, इयम् this, धर्षयितुम् to assault, न शक्या not possible.

55_15.shloka: न देवेषु न यक्षेषु न गन्धर्वेषु पक्षिषु।अहं पश्यामि लोकेषु यो मे वीर्यसमो भवेत्।।3.55.20।।
55_15.translation: I do not see any one equal to me in valour among gods, or yakshas or gandharvas or birds.
55_15.word_by_word: लोकेषु in the world, यः whoever, मे to me, वीर्यसमः equal in valour, भवेत् may be, अहम् I, देवेषु among gods, न पश्यामि I do not not see, यक्षेषु among yakshas, न not, गन्धर्वेषु in gandharvas, न not, पक्षिषु in birds, न not.

55_16.shloka: राज्यभ्रष्टेन दीनेन तापसेन गतायुषा।किं करिष्यसि रामेण मानुषेणाल्पतेजसा।।3.55.21।।
55_16.translation: Of what use is Rama who has lost his kingdom, who is depressed and leads anascetic life and who is a shortlived, lacklustre human being.
55_16.word_by_word: राज्यभ्रष्टेन who lost his kingdom, दीनेन by a dejected person, तापसेन an ascetic, गतायुषा with a short life one, मानुषेण human being, अल्पतेजसा with one who lacks lustre, रामेण Rama, किं करिष्यसि what is the use for you ,

55_17.shloka: भजस्व सीते मामेव भर्ताहं सदृशस्तव।यौवनं ह्यध्रुवं भीरु रमस्वेह मया सह।।3.55.22।।
55_17.translation: O Sita take refuge only in me. I am a befitting husband to you. O timid one youth is impermanent. Enjoy (your life) with me while it lasts.
55_17.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, मामेव me alone, भजस्व accept, अहम् I am, तव your, सदृशः befitting, भर्ता husband, भीरु timid one, यौवनम् youth, अध्रुवं हि is not permanent, इह here, मया सह with me, रमस्व may enjoy.

55_18.shloka: दर्शने माकृथा बुद्धिं राघवस्य वरानने।कास्य शक्तिरिहागन्तुमपि सीते मनोरथैः।।3.55.23।।
55_18.translation: O lovely Sita, give up the thought of seeing Rama. Where does he possess the power to reach this place even on the mental plane ?
55_18.word_by_word: वरानने O lovely Sita, राघवस्य Rama's, दर्शने in seeing, बुद्धिं thought, मा do not, कृथा: entertain, सीते O Sita, अस्य his, मनोरथैरपि with his mind also, इह here, आगन्तुम् to come, शक्तिः power, का where is it?

55_19.shloka: न शक्यो वायुराकाशे पाशैर्बद्धुं महाजवः।दीप्यमानस्य वाप्यग्नेर्गृहीतुं विमलां शिखाम्।।3.55.24।।
55_19.translation: It is not possible to bind  the wind blowing at high speed in the sky. Similarly it is not possible to catch the brilliant glow of flaming fire.
55_19.word_by_word: महाजवः of high speed, वायुः wind, आकाशे in the sky, पाशैः by rope, बध्धुम् to bind, न शक्यः not possible, दीप्यमानस्य  of burning flame, आग्नेः fire, विमलाम् brilliant , शिखाम् flame, गृहीतुम् to catch.

55_20.shloka: त्रयाणामपि लोकानां न तं पश्यामि शोभने।विक्रमेण नयेद्यस्त्वां मद्बाहुपरिपालिताम्।।3.55.25।।
55_20.translation: O lovely lady, I do not see any one in these three worlds who can, by his valour, take you away from me guarded by my arms.
55_20.word_by_word: शोभने O beautiful lady, त्रयाणाम् in the three, लोकानामपि worlds too, यः whoever, मद्बाहुपरिपालिताम् protected by my arms, त्वाम् you, विक्रमेण by valour, नयेत् can take away, तम् him, न पश्यामि not see.

55_21.shloka: लङ्कायां सुमहद्राज्यमिदं त्वमनुपालय।त्वत्प्रेष्या मद्विधाश्चैव देवाश्चापि चराचराः।।3.55.26।।
55_21.translation: Rule this vast kingdom of Lanka. People like me, even gods and all beings, mobile and immobile, will be at your beck and call.
55_21.word_by_word: त्वम् you, लङ्कायां in Lanka's, सुमहत् vast, इदम् this, राज्यम् kingdom, अनुपालय you may rule, मद्विधाः people like me, देवाश्चापि even gods, चराचराः all mobile and immobile beings, त्वत्प्रेष्याः will be at beck and call.

55_22.shloka: अभिषेकोदकक्लिन्ना तुष्टा च रमयस्व माम्।दुष्कृतं यत्परा कर्म वनवासेन तद्गतम्।।3.55.27।।यश्च ते सुकृतो धर्मस्तस्येह फलमाप्नुहि।
55_22.translation: Drenched with the waters of consecration, entertain me. The effect of the bad deeds done in the past are over with your dwelling in the forest. Now enjoy the fruits  of yourgood and righteous deeds here with me.
55_22.word_by_word: अभिषेकोदकक्लिन्ना drenched with waters of consecration, तुष्टा च and satisfied , माम् me, रमयस्व enjoy, पुरा previous birth, यत् whatever, दुष्कृतम् evil deeds, कर्म तत् that, वनवासेन by dwelling in the forest, गतम् gone, ते your, यः whatever, सुकृतः  good deeds, धर्मः righteousness, तस्य of that, फलम् fruit, इह here, आप्नुहि enjoy.

55_23.shloka: इह माल्यानि सर्वाणि दिव्यगन्धानि मैथिलि।।3.55.28।।भूषणानि च मुख्यानि सेवस्व च मया सह।।
55_23.translation: O princess from Mithila, put on all garlands of wonderful fragrance and finest of jewels here with me.
55_23.word_by_word: मैथिलि Maithili, इह here, दिव्यगन्धानि of divine fragrance, सर्वाणि all, माल्यानि garlands, मुख्यानि finest, भूषणानि च jewels, मया सह with me, सेवस्व you put on.

55_24.shloka: पुष्पकं नाम सुश्रोणि भ्रातुर्वैश्रवणस्य मे।।3.55.29।।विमानं सूर्यसङ्काशं तरसा निर्जितं मया।
55_24.translation: O finehipped lady, I won by my strength from my brother Vaisravana (Kubera) an aerial chariot called Pushpaka shining with the radiance of the Sun.
55_24.word_by_word: सुश्रोणि O charming lady, मे my, भ्रातुः brother, वैश्रवणस्य Vaisravana's (Kubera's), पुष्पकं नाम called Pushpaka, सूर्यसङ्काशम् radiant like the Sun, विमानम् aerial chariot, तरसा with strength, निर्जितम् is won over.

55_25.shloka: विशालं रमणीयं च तद्विमानमनुत्तम्।।3.55.30।।तत्र सीते मया सार्धं विहरस्व यथासुखम्।
55_25.translation: O Sita that excellent chariot is big and beautiful. Where on you can roam happily along with me.
55_25.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, अनुत्तमम् excellent, तत् that, विमानम् chariot, विशालम् huge, रमणीयं च beautiful, तत्र on that, मया सार्धम् along with me, यथासुखम् happily, विहरस्व can roam with pleasure.

55_26.shloka: वदनं पद्मसङ्काशममलं चारुदर्शनम्।शोकार्तंतु वरारोहे न भ्राजति वरानने।।3.55.31।।
55_26.translation: O heavyhipped lady your face which is a clean lotus pleasing to the eye has lost its shine, stricken with grief.
55_26.word_by_word: वरारोहे O heavyhipped lady, वरानने lady with  a comely face , पद्मसङ्काशम् looking like lotus, अमलम् clean, चारुदर्शनम् pleasing to the eye, वदनम् face, शोकार्तम् striken with grief, न भ्राजति is not shining.

55_27.shloka: एवं वदति तस्मित्सा वस्त्रान्तेन वराङ्गना।पिधायेन्दुनिभं सीता मुखमश्रूण्यवर्तयत्।।3.55.32।।
55_27.translation: As Ravana went on speaking thus, Sita covered her beautiful, moonlike face with the edge of her garment and stood shedding tears.
55_27.word_by_word: तस्मिन् while he, एवम् in that manner, वदति was talking, वराङ्गना the best of beauty, सा सीता that Sita, इन्दुनिभम् Moonlike, मुखम् face, वस्त्रान्तेन by the edge of the garment, पिधाय covering, अश्रूणि tears, अवर्तयत् stood.

55_28.shloka: ध्यायन्तीं तामिवास्वस्थां दीनां चिन्ताहतप्रभाम्।उवाच वचनं पापो रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।।3.55.33।।
55_28.translation: While Sita was lost in thought, feeling ill at lase, looking wretched with her beauty dulled by her anxiety, the sinful lord of the demons continued :
55_28.word_by_word: पापः sinful, राक्षसेश्वरः lord of the demons, रावणः Ravana, ध्यायन्तीमिव as though in a contemplative mood, अस्वस्थाम् who was not well, दीनाम् piteously, चिन्ताहतप्रभाम् her beauty dulled by her anxiety, ताम् her, वचनम् these words, उवाच said.

55_29.shloka: अलं व्रीडेन वैदेहि धर्मलोपकृतेन च।।3.55.34।।आर्षोऽयं दैवनिष्यन्दो यस्त्वामभिगमिष्यति।
55_29.translation: O Sita you need not feel shamed that it is a violation of righteous conduct. Take it as godsend which has the approval of sages.
55_29.word_by_word: वैदेहि Sita, धर्मलोपकृतेन thinking it to be a violation of righteous conduct, व्रीडेन feeling shamed, अलम् no need to, यः whatever, त्वाम् अभिगमिष्यति will come your way, अयम् this one, दैवनिष्यन्दः granted by fate, आर्षः acceptable to sages.

55_30.shloka: एतौ पादौ मया स्निग्धौ शिरोभिः परिपीडितौ।।3.55.35।।प्रसादं कुरु मे क्षिप्रं वश्यो दासोऽहमस्मिते।
55_30.translation: I am bowing down, pressing my heads at your shining feet. I am at your mercy. Grant me your favourI will remain your slave and remain ever under your control.
55_30.word_by_word: एतौ these two, स्निग्धौ shining brightly, पादौ feet, मया शिरोभिः by my heads too, परिपीडितौ are touched and pressed, क्षिप्रम् quickly, प्रसादम् favour, कुरु do, अहम् I am, ते to you, वश्यः under your control, दासः slave, अस्मि I am.

55_31.shloka: इमाश्शून्य मया वाचश्शुष्यमाणेन भाषिताः।।3.55.36।।न चापि रावणः काञ्चिन्मूर्ध्ना स्त्रीं प्रणमेत ह।
55_31.translation: My throat has dried up. I have spoken these words in a forlorn state. Ravana has never bowed down to a woman in obeisance.
55_31.word_by_word: शुष्यमाणेन with parched throat, मया by myself, इमाः these, शून्याः desolate, वाचः words, भाषिताः spoken, रावणः Ravana, काञ्चित् स्त्रीं any woman, मूर्ध्ना  head bowed down, न प्रणमेत हि will not pay obeisance.

55_32.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा दशग्रीवो मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।।3.55.37।।कृतान्तवशमापन्नो ममेयमिति मन्यते।
55_32.translation: Having said this to the daughter of Janaka, the tenheaded Ravana who had fallen under the control of Yama, lord of death, misconceived that she had become his own.इतयार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
55_32.word_by_word: दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, जनकात्मजाम् to the daughter of Janaka, मैथिलीम् Maithili,एवम् in that manner, उक्त्वा having said, कृतान्तवशम् under the control of Yama, आपन्नः being distressed, इयम् she is, मम mine, इति like this, मन्यते thinks.

56_1.shloka: [Sita ridicules Ravana-- not willing to reply directly speaks to a blade of grass about Rama's might and Ravana's destruction-- Ravana sends Sita to Asoka garden.]सा तथोक्ता तु वैदेही निर्भया शोककर्शिता।तृणमन्तरतः कृत्वा रावणं प्रत्यभाषत।।3.56.1।।
56_1.translation: Thus addressed by Ravana, Sita, immersed in deep sorrow and unafraid of him, placed  a blade of grass between her and him (intending not to speak to him  straight) and replied:
56_1.word_by_word: तथा thus, उक्ता having addressed, शोककर्शिता sunk in deep sorrow, सा वैदेही that Sita, princess from Videha, निर्भया unafraid , तृणम्  blade of grass, अन्तरतः between him and her, कृत्वा placed, रावणम् Ravana, प्रत्यभाषत replied.

56_2.shloka: राजा दशरथो नाम धर्मसेतुरिवाचलः।सत्यसन्धः परिज्ञातो यस्य पुत्रस्सराघवः।।3.56.2।।
56_2.translation: Rama is a son of  the renowned king Dasaratha, who was a firm ambankment (protector) of righteousness and was true to his promise.
56_2.word_by_word: दशरथो नाम named Dasaratha, राजा king, अचलः steadfast, धर्मसेतुरिव as an embankment (protector) of righteousness, सत्यसन्धः true to his promise, परिज्ञातः renowned, सः राघवः that Rama, यस्य whose, पुत्रः son.

56_3.shloka: रामो नाम स धर्मात्मा त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः।दीर्घबाहुर्विशालाक्षो दैवतं हि पतिर्मम।।3.56.3।।
56_3.translation: The longarmed, largeeyed Rama is famous in all the three worlds. He is my husband, a righteous soul and a god to all.
56_3.word_by_word: त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु in the worlds, विश्रुतः highly renowned, दीर्घबाहुः longarmed, विशालाक्षः largeeyed, रामो नाम named Rama, सः he, धर्मात्मा righteous soul, मम my, पतिःhusband, दैवतम् god to all.

56_4.shloka: इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले जातस्सिंहस्कन्धो महाद्युतिः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा यस्ते प्राणान्हरिष्यति।।3.56.4।।
56_4.translation: The brilliant Rama of the Ikshvaku dynasty with the lion's shoulders will come with his brother Lakshmana and take away your life.
56_4.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of Ikshvakus, कुले in the dynasty, जातः born, सिंहस्कन्धः shoulders of a lion, महाद्युतिः  effulgent, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह along with Lakshmana, यः who, ते your, प्राणान् life, हरिष्यति will take away.

56_5.shloka: प्रत्यक्षं यद्यहं तस्य त्वया स्यां धर्षिता बलात्।शयिता त्वं हतस्संख्ये जनस्थाने यथा खरः।।3.56.5।।
56_5.translation: Had you abducted me forcibly in his presence, you would have been lying down dead just as Khara in Janasthana.
56_5.word_by_word: अहम् I, त्वया by your, तस्य his, प्रत्यक्षम् (in his) presence, बलात् with force, धर्षिता attacked, स्यां यदि if you were to be, त्वम् you, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, खरः Khara, यथा just as, हतः killed, शयिता lying down.

56_6.shloka: य एते राक्षसाः प्रोक्ता घोररूपा महाबलाः।राघवे निर्विषास्सर्वे सुपर्णे पन्नगा यथा।।3.56.6।।
56_6.translation: Those dreadful, mighty demons you have described are ineffective in his presence just like the serpents who with their venom are ineffective  in the presence of  Suparna (Garuda).
56_6.word_by_word: घोररूपाः of dreadful forms, महाबलाः very strong , ये those, एते such of, राक्षसाः demons, प्रोक्ताः has been said, सर्वे all, सुपर्णे Suparna, पन्नगाः serpents, यथा like, राघवे with regard to Rama, निर्विषाः are devoid of poison.

56_7.shloka: तस्य ज्याविप्रमुक्तास्ते शराः काञ्चनभूषणाः।शरीरं विधमिष्यन्ति गङ्गाकूलमिवोर्मयः।।3.56.7।।
56_7.translation: The goldtipped arrows released from his bowstring will shatter your body like the waves erode the banks of river Ganga.
56_7.word_by_word: तस्य his, ज्याविप्रमुक्ताः released from the string of the bow, काञ्चनभूषणाः goldtipped, शराः arrows, ऊर्मयः waves, गङ्गाकूलमिव like the bank of the Ganges, ते शरीरम् your body, विधमिष्यन्ति will shatter.

56_8.shloka: असुरैर्वा सुरैर्वा त्वं यद्यवध्योऽसि रावण।उत्पाद्य सुमहद्वैरं जीवंस्तस्य न मोक्ष्यसे।।3.56.8।।
56_8.translation: O Ravana, even if you stand invulnerable to gods and demons, you will not come out alive in the combat with Rama with whom you have earned great enmity.
56_8.word_by_word: रावण O Ravana, त्वम् you, असुरैर्वा by demons, सुरैर्वा or by gods, अवध्यः are not to be killed, असि यदि even if, सुमहत् great, वैरम् enmity, उत्पाद्य after creating, जीवन् with life, तस्य his, न मोक्ष्यसे you will not be released.

56_9.shloka: स ते जीवितशेषस्य राघवोऽन्तकरो बली।पशोर्यूपगतस्येव जीवितं तव दुर्लभम्।।3.56.9।।
56_9.translation: Powerful Rama will put an end to whatever little life you are left with. Just as a beasttied to a sacrificial post, you will not  survive.
56_9.word_by_word: बली powerful, सः राघवः  Rama, ते your, जीवितशेषस्य of the little life left, अन्तकरः destroyer of life, यूपगतस्य  tied to the sacrificial post, पशोरिव like a beast ready for sacrifice, तव your, जीवितम् life, दुर्लभम् difficult to survive.

56_10.shloka: यदि पश्येत्स रामस्त्वां रोषदीप्तेन चक्षुषा।रक्षस्त्वमद्य निर्धग्धो गच्छेस्सद्यः पराभवम्।।3.56.10।।
56_10.translation: O demon, you will be completely consumed if Rama looks at you with eyes burning in anger.
56_10.word_by_word: रक्षः O demon, सः रामः that Rama, रोषदीप्तेन burning with anger, चक्षुषा with eyes, त्वाम् you, पश्येत् if he sees, अद्य now, सद्यः instantly, त्वम् you, निर्धग्धः totally burnt, पराभवम् गच्छेः you will be destroyed.

56_11.shloka: यश्चन्द्रं नभसो भूमौ पातयेन्नाशयेत वा।सागरं शोषयेद्वापि स सीतां मोचयेदिह।।3.56.11।।
56_11.translation: He who can bring down the Moon to the earth from the sky or even dash it down, he who can drain the sea dry will definitely release me from here.
56_11.word_by_word: यः he who, चन्द्रम् Moon, नभसः from the sky, भूमौ on the earth, पातयेत् can bring down, वा or even, नाशयेत destroy, सागरम् sea, शोषयेद्वापि will make it dry, सः he, इह here, सीताम् Sita, मोचयेत् will liberate

56_12.shloka: गतायुस्त्वं गतश्रीको गतसत्त्व गतेन्द्रियः।लङ्का वैधव्यसंयुक्ता त्वत्कृतेन भविष्यति।।3.56.12।।
56_12.translation: Your life is coming to an end. Your fortunes will wane, your strength will be sapped. Your senses will be dissipated. By your deeds Lanka will attain widowhood.
56_12.word_by_word: त्वम् you, गतायुः life is gone, गतश्रीकः deprived of your fortune, गतसत्त्व your strength sapped, गतेन्द्रियः your senses dissipated, त्वत्कृतेन  by  your action, लङ्का Lanka, वैधव्यसंयुक्ता भविष्यति attain widowhood.

56_13.shloka: न ते पापमिदं कर्म शुखोदर्कं भविष्यति।याऽहं नीता विनाभावं पतिपार्श्वात्त्वया वने।।3.56.13।।
56_13.translation: This evil deed(of abduction) will not yield happy results.You have brought me from my husband from the forest without any forethought.
56_13.word_by_word: ते you, इदम् this, कर्म deed, शुखोदर्कम् will result in happiness, न भविष्यति will not be, या which, अहम् I, त्वया by you, वने in the forest, पतिपार्श्वात् from my husband, विनाभावम् without any feeling, नीता I am brought.

56_14.shloka: स हि दैवतसंयुक्तो मम भर्ता महाद्युतिः।निर्भयो वीर्यमाश्रित्य शून्ये वसति दण्डके।।3.56.14।।
56_14.translation: My effulgent, valiant husband armed with divine power resides fearlessly in the desolate Dandaka.
56_14.word_by_word: महाद्युतिः effulgent, मम my, भर्ता husband, सः he, वीर्यम् valour, आश्रित्य resorting to, निर्भयः a fearless, दैवतसंयुक्तः supported by divine power, शून्ये in a desolate, दण्डके in Dandaka, वसति is dwelling.

56_15.shloka: स ते दर्पं बलं वीर्यमुत्सेकं च तथाविधम्।अपनेष्यति गात्रेभ्यश्शरवर्षेण संयुगे।।3.56.15।।
56_15.translation: He will remove your pride, your power, your valour and haughtiness from your limbs with a shower of arrows in the fight.
56_15.word_by_word: सः he, संयुगे in combat, शरवर्षेण with showers of arrows, ते your, गात्रेभ्यः from limbs, दर्पम् pride, बलम् power, वीर्यम् heroism, तथाविधम् as such, उत्सेकं च haughtiness, अपनेष्यति will remove.

56_16.shloka: यदा विनाशो भूतानां दृश्यते कालचोदितः।तदा कार्ये प्रमाद्यन्ति नराः कालवशं गताः।।3.56.16।।
56_16.translation: When destruction draws near, people being prompted by time start commiting blunders in their deeds.
56_16.word_by_word: भूतानाम् for the living beings, यदा whenever, कालचोदितः prompted by time (death), विनाशः destruction, दृश्यते is seen, तदा then, नराः men, कालवशम् overcome by time, गताः become, कार्ये deeds, प्रमाद्यन्ति commit blunders.

56_17.shloka: मां प्रधृष्य स ते कालः प्राप्तोऽयं राक्षसाधम।आत्मनो राक्षसानां च वधायान्तःपुरस्य च।।3.56.17।।
56_17.translation: You vilest of demons, since you have assaulted me, the time of your death and destruction of all demons and of all women in the harem has drawn near.
56_17.word_by_word: राक्षसाधम O vilest of demons, माम् me, प्रधृष्य having assaulted, आत्मनः your, राक्षसानां च of all  demons, अन्तःपुरस्य च and of women of the harem, वधाय for destruction, सः कालः that time, ते to you, प्राप्तः has come near.

56_18.shloka: न शक्या यज्ञमध्यस्था वेदी सृग्भाण्डमण्डिता।द्विजातिमन्त्रपूता च चण्डालेनावमर्दितुम्।।3.56.18।।
56_18.translation: The sacrificial altar adorned with ladles and vessels and sanctified by the sacred mantras recited by brahmins cannot be defiled by a chandala (man of lowest caste).
