56_18.word_by_word: यज्ञमध्यस्था in the midst of the sacrificial ceremony, सुग्भाण्डमण्डिता decorated with ladles  and other vessels, द्विजातिमन्त्रपूता च sanctified by brahmins uttering sacred Vedic hymns, वेदी altar, चण्डालेन by a man of low caste, अवमर्दितुम् to violate, न शक्या is not possible.

56_19.shloka: तथाऽहं धर्मनित्यस्य धर्मपत्नी पतिव्रता।त्वया स्पृष्टुं न शक्यास्मि राक्षसाधम पापिना।।3.56.19।।
56_19.translation: O lowly demon  similarly I am a chaste woman and wife of the ever righteous Rama who cannot be defiled by a sinner like you.
56_19.word_by_word: राक्षसाधम lowly demon, तथा similarly, धर्मनित्यस्य of the ever righteous, धर्मपत्नी rigteous wife, पतिव्रता chaste woman, अहम् I am, पापिना sinner, त्वया you, स्पृष्टुम् to touch, शक्या possible, नास्मि not.

56_20.shloka: क्रीडन्ती राजहंसेन पद्मषण्डेषु नित्यदा।हंसी सा तृणषण्डस्थं कथं पश्येत मद्गुकम्।।3.56.20।।
56_20.translation: How can a female swan ever sporting in lotusponds in the company of a royal swan look at the watercrow resting on a grassy land?
56_20.word_by_word: पद्मषण्डेषु lotus ponds, नित्यदा always, राजहंसेन with royal swan, क्रीडन्ती sporting, सा हंसी for that female swan, तृणषण्डस्थम् resting on grass land, मद्गुकम् watercrow, कथम् how can, पश्येत will see.

56_21.shloka: इदं शरीरं निस्संज्ञं बन्ध वा खातयस्व वा।नेदं शरीरं रक्षयं मे जीवितं वापि राक्षस।।3.56.21।।न तु शक्ष्याम्युपक्रोशं पृथिव्यां दातुमात्मनः।
56_21.translation: O demon  this body has (now) no consciousness. You may bind it or bury it. I do not think that this body or even this life need to be protected. But at no cost can I make this an object of censure on earth (must not be branded an unchaste woman).
56_21.word_by_word: राक्षस demon, निस्संज्ञम् unconscious, इदम् this, शरीरम् body, बन्ध वा bind it on, वा खातयस्व or bury, मे to me, इदम् this, शरीरम् body, जीवितं वा even life, रक्षयम् to protect, न not, तु but, पृथिव्याम् on earth, आत्मन: of myself, उपक्रोशम् ignominy, दातुम् to give, न शक्ष्यामि not possible.

56_22.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेही क्रोधात्सुपरुषं वचः।।3.56.22।।रावणं मैथिली तत्र पुनर्नोवाच किञ्चन।
56_22.translation: Having uttered these very harsh words out of anger, the daughter of Videha, the princess from Mithila spoke no more.
56_22.word_by_word: वैदेही Sita (Vaidehi), मैथिली princess from Mithila, क्रोधात् in anger, रावणम् Ravana, एवम् in that way, सुपरुषम् very harsh, वचः words, उक्त्वा having uttered, तत्र there, पुनः again, किञ्चन not, नोवाच speak.

56_23.shloka: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा परुषं रोमहर्षणम्।।3.56.23।।प्रत्युवाच ततस्सीतां भयसन्दर्शनं वचः।
56_23.translation: Having heard such harsh, horripilating words from Sita, Ravana replied in a way designed to create fear in her:
56_23.word_by_word: सीतायाः Sita's such, परुषम् harsh, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ततः then, सीताम् Sita, भयसन्दर्शनम् creating fear, वचः words, प्रत्युवाच  replied.

56_24.shloka: शृणु मैथिलि मद्वाक्यं मासान्द्वादश भामिनि।।3.56.24।।कालेनानेन नाभ्येषि यदि मां चारुहासिनि।ततस्त्वां प्रातराशार्थं सूदाश्छेत्स्यन्ति लेशशः।।3.56.25।।
56_24.translation: O comely princess from Mithila, O lady with a sweet smile listen to my words. If you do not accept my hand in the course of twelve months, the cooks will cut you off into small bits for the (my) breakfast.
56_24.word_by_word: मैथिलि Princess from Mithila, भामिनि lovely one, मद्वाक्यम् my statement, शृणु listen, द्वादश twelve, मासान् months, चारुहासिनि a lady with sweet smile, अनेन otherwise, कालेन in course of time, माम् me, नाभ्येषि यदि if you do not accept my hand, ततः thereupon, सूदाः cooks, त्वाम् you, प्रातराशार्थे for breakfast, लेशशः in small bits, छेत्स्यन्ति will cut you.

56_25.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा परुषं वाक्यं रावणश्शत्रुरावणः।राक्षसीश्च ततः क्रुद्ध इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.56.26।।
56_25.translation: Enraged Ravana, who used to make enemies wail, turned to the demonesses and said these words.
56_25.word_by_word: शत्रुरावणः who makes enemies wail, रावणः Ravana, इति these, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, उक्त्वा having said, ततः then, क्रुद्धः enraged, राक्षसीः demoness, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

56_26.shloka: शीघ्रमेव हि राक्षस्यो विकृता घोरदर्शनाः।दर्पमस्या विनेष्यध्वं मांसशोणितभोजनाः।।3.56.27।।
56_26.translation: Addressing the flesheating, blooddrinking, loathsome and fearful demonesses Ravana said, Humble her pride at once.
56_26.word_by_word: विकृताः loathsome, घोरदर्शनाः fearful, मांसशोणितभोजनाः flesheaters and bloodsulkers, राक्षस्यः demonesses, शीघ्रमेव at once, अस्याः her, दर्पम् pride, विनेष्यध्वम् humble.

56_27.shloka: वचनादेव तास्तस्य सुघोरा राक्षसीगणाः।कृतप्राञ्जलयो भूत्वा मैथिलीं पर्यवारयन्।।3.56.28।।
56_27.translation: No sooner had Ravana said it than the dreadful demonesses offered obeisance to him with folded hands and surrounded Sita.
56_27.word_by_word: सुघोराः very dreadful one, ताः they, राक्षसीगणाः demonesses, तस्य his, वचनादेव soon after he said, कृत प्राञ्जलयः (offered obeisance) with folded hands, भूत्वा being, मैथिलीम् पर्यवारयन् surrounded Sita.

56_28.shloka: स ताः प्रोवाच राजा तु रावणो घोरदर्शनः।प्रचाल्य चरणोत्कर्षैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम्।।3.56.29।।
56_28.translation: Stamping his feet and shaking the ground as if tearing the earth, Ravana said to those fiercelooking demonesses:
56_28.word_by_word: घोरदर्शनः of terrific form, राजा king, सः रावणः that Ravana, चरणोत्कर्षैः stamping his feet, मेदिनीम् on the ground, प्रचाल्य after shaking, दारयन्निव as if tearing the ground, ताः to them, प्रोवाच said.

56_29.shloka: अशोकवनिकामध्ये मैथिली नीयतामियम्।तत्रेयं रक्ष्यतां गूढं युष्माभिः परिवारिता।।3.56.30।।
56_29.translation: Let this Sita be led into the Asoka grove. There sit round her and protect her in secret (her presence there should not be made public).
56_29.word_by_word: इयं मैथिली this Maithili (sita), अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the middle of Asoka grove, नीयताम् take, तत्र there, इयम् she, युष्माभिः by you, परिवारिता surrounded by, गूढम् secretly, रक्ष्यताम् protect.

56_30.shloka: तत्रैनां तर्जनैर्घोरैः पुनस्सान्त्वैश्च मैथिलीम्।आनयध्वं वशं सर्वा वन्यां गजवधूमिव।।3.56.31।।
56_30.translation: There you all bring her under control through forcing and cajoling as one would do to tame a wild sheelephant.
56_30.word_by_word: तत्र there, सर्वाः all, एनां मैथिलीम् this Sita, घोरैः terrrific, तर्जनैः threatening, पुनः again, सान्त्वश्च by gently coaxing, वन्याम् wild, गजवधूमिव like a female elephant, वशम् under control, आनयध्वम् being her.

56_31.shloka: इति प्रतिसमादिष्टा राक्षस्यो रावणेन ताः।अशोकवनिकां जग्मुर्मैथिलीं परिगृह्य तु।।3.56.32।।सर्वकालफलैर्वृक्षैर्नानापुष्पफलैर्वृताम्।सर्वकालमदैश्चापि द्विजैस्समुपसेविताम्।।3.56.33।।
56_31.translation: Thus instructed by Ravana, the demonesses took Sita into the Asoka grove, which was full of perenmal fruits and flowers of different kinds, where trees yielded fruits of all seasons and birds were always cheerful.
56_31.word_by_word: रावणेन Ravana, इति like that, प्रतिसमादिष्टाः instructed, ताः those, राक्षस्यः demonesses, मैथिलीम् to Sita, परिगृह्य  took, सर्वकालफलैः with fruits of all seasons, नानापुष्पफलैः with different kinds of flowers and fruits, वृक्षैः with trees, वृताम् surrounded, सर्वकालमदैः cheerful in all seaons, द्विजैः birds, समुपसेविताम् served by, अशोकवनिकाम् to the Asoka grove, जग्मुः went.

56_32.shloka: सा तु शोकपरीताङ्गी मैथिली जनकात्मजा।राक्षसीवशमापन्ना व्याघ्रीणां हरिणी यथा।।3.56.34।।
56_32.translation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, engulfed in grief found herself like a doe under the control of tigresses.
56_32.word_by_word: शोकपरीताङ्गी engulfed in grief, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, सा मैथिली that Sita, हरिणी doe, व्याघ्रीणां यथा as among tigresses, राक्षसीवशम् under the control of the demonesses, आपन्ना was placed.

56_33.shloka: शोकेन महता ग्रस्ता मैथिली जनकात्मजा।न शर्म लभते भीरुः पाशबद्धा मृगी यथा।।3.56.35।।
56_33.translation: Sita, daughter of Janaka, immersed in deep grief knew no peace just like a doe caught in a snare.
56_33.word_by_word: महता by great, शोकेन by grief, ग्रस्ता immersed, भीरुः helpless lady, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, मैथिली Sita, पाशबद्धा ensnared, मृगी यथा like a female, शर्म peace, न लभते not had.

56_34.shloka: न विन्दते तत्र तु शर्म मैथिली विरूपनेत्राभिरतीव तर्जिता।पतिं स्मरन्ती दयितं च देवतं विचेतनाऽभूद्भयशोकपीडिता।।3.56.36।।
56_34.translation: Sita had no peace as she was threatened excessively by those women of deformed  looks. Remembering her beloved husband who was also her god, and overtaken by fear and grief , she fell unconscious.इतयार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षटपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
56_34.word_by_word: विरूपनेत्राभिः by women of deformed eyes, अतीव excessively, तर्जिता threatened, मैथिली Sita,  तत्र there, शर्म peace, न विन्दते not had, दयितम् beloved, पतिम् husband, देवतं च desired deity, स्मरन्ती while remembering, भयशोकपीडिता tortured by fear and grief, विचेतना lost conciousness, अभूत् became.

57_1.shloka: [Rama returns after killing Maricha-- sees bad omens on the way-- sees sad face of Lakshmana midway--blames Lakshmana for leaving Sita alone-- doubts Sita's safety-- experiences bad omens again.]राक्षसं मृगरूपेण चरन्तं कामरूपिणम्।निहत्य रामो मारीचं तूर्णं पथि न्यवर्तत।।3.57.1।।
57_1.translation: Rama killed Maricha, the demon assuming the form of the deer as per his will and swiftly took the return path.
57_1.word_by_word: रामः Rama, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, चरन्तम् moving, कामरूपिणम् assuming a form at will, राक्षसम् to the demon, मारीचम् Maricha, निहत्य slaying, तूर्णम् swiftly, पथि  on the path, न्यवर्तत returned.

57_2.shloka: तस्य सन्त्वरमाणस्य द्रष्टुकामस्य मैथिलीम्।क्रूरस्वनोऽथ गोमायुर्विननादास्य पृष्ठतः।।3.57.2।।
57_2.translation: While Rama was hasting to see Sita, he heard from behind the ghastly howl of a jackal.
57_2.word_by_word: मैथिलीम् Maithili (Sita), द्रष्टुकामस्य desiring to see, तस्य his, सन्त्वरमाणस्य hastening, अथ at that time, क्रूरस्वनः ghastly sound, गोमायुः jackal, अस्य his, पृष्ठतः from behind, विननाद screamed.

57_3.shloka: स तस्य स्वरमाज्ञाय दारुणं रोमहर्षणम्।चिन्तयामास गोमायोस्स्वरेण परिशङ्कितः।।3.57.3।।
57_3.translation: Rama knew it was the horrible, horripilating cry of a jackal which made him apprehensive . It made him think.
57_3.word_by_word: सः he, तस्य गोमायोः the jackal's, दारुणम् dreadful, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, स्वरम् tone, आज्ञाय recognising, स्वरेण voice, परिशङ्कितः doubting it, चिन्तयामास started worrying.

57_4.shloka: अशुभं बत मन्येऽहं गोमायुर्वाश्यते यथा।स्वस्ति स्यादपि वैदेह्या राक्षसैर्भक्षणं विना।।3.57.4।।
57_4.translation: 'The way the jackal is howling appears ominous. May Sita be safe without being eaten up by demons
57_4.word_by_word: बत alas, गोमायुः jackal, यथा as, वाश्यते howling, अहम् I, अशुभम् inauspicious, मन्ये thinking, राक्षसैः by demons, भक्षणं विना without being eaten up, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, स्वस्ति wellbeing, स्यादपि may be.

57_5.shloka: मारीचेन तु विज्ञाय स्वरमालम्ब्य मामकम्।विक्रुष्टं मृगरूपेण लक्ष्मणश्शृणुयाद्यदि।।3.57.5।।स सौमित्रिस्स्वरं श्रुत्वा तां च हित्वाच मैथिलीम्।तयेह प्रहितः क्षिप्रं मत्सकाशमिहैष्यति।।3.57.6।।
57_5.translation: 'If  Lakshmana listens to Maricha imitating my voice in the form of a deer, he, sent by Sita will come for me at once, leaving her behind.
57_5.word_by_word: मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, मारीचेन by Maricha, विज्ञाय having known, मामकम् my , स्वरम् voice, आलम्ब्य imitating, विक्रुष्टम् cried out, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शृणुयाद्यदि if he listens, सः सौमित्रिः that Saumitri, स्वरम् voice, श्रुत्वा after hearing, तां मैथिलीम् to Sita, हित्वा च leaving her, तया by her, इह here, प्रहितः sent, क्षिप्रम् at once, इह here, मत्सकाशम् for me, एष्यति he will come,

57_6.shloka: राक्षसैस्सहितैर्नूनं सीताया ईप्सितो वधः।काञ्चनश्च मृगो भूत्वा व्यपनीयाश्रमात्तु माम्।।3.57.7।।दूरं नीत्वा तु मारीचो राक्षसोऽभूच्छरा हतः।हा लक्ष्मण हतोऽस्मीति यद्वाक्यं व्याजहार ह।।3.57.8।।
57_6.translation: 'Hence the murder of Sita must have been jointly planned by the demons. Maricha who had assumed the form of a golden deer, took me away from the hermitage to a faroff place where, killed by my arrows, he turned a demon uttering the words, Alas, Lakshmana, I am killed.
57_6.word_by_word: यत् that, मारीचः Maricha, काञ्चनः मृगः golden deer, भूत्वा having become, माम् me, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, व्यपनीय dragging away, दूरम् far off, नीत्वा after taking, शराहतः hit by my arrows, राक्षसः demon, अभूत् he became, हा लक्ष्मण Alas, Lakshmana, हतः अस्मि I am killed, इति these, वाक्यम् words, व्याजहार he said, सहितैः accompanying, राक्षसैः by demons, सीतायाः Sita's, वधः slaughter, ईप्सितः desired, नूनम् surely.

57_7.shloka: अपि स्वस्ति भवेत्ताभ्यां रहिताभ्यां महावने।जनस्थाननिमित्तं हि कृतवैरोऽस्मि राक्षसैः।।3.57.9।।निमित्तानि च घोराणि दृश्यन्तेऽद्य बहूनि च।
57_7.translation: 'On account of living in this dense forest in Janasthana I have earned enmity with the demons. Will Lakshmana and Sita be safe without my protection? I see many terrible portents.'
57_7.word_by_word: महावने in the dense forest, रहिताभ्याम् staying, ताभ्याम् those two, स्वस्ति safe, अपि भवेत् will be, जनस्थान निमित्तम् on account of Janasthana, राक्षसैः with demons, कृतवैरः have earned enmity, अस्मि हि because of me, अद्य now, घोराणि dreadful, बहूनि many, निमित्तानि च  portents, दृश्यन्ते are seen.

57_8.shloka: इत्येवं चिन्तयन्रामश्श्रुत्वा गोमायुनिस्स्वनम्।।3.57.10।।आत्मनश्चापनयनान्मृगरूपेण रक्षसा।आजगाम जनस्थानं राघवः परिशङ्कितः।।3.57.11।।
57_8.translation: On hearing the jackal's howl, Rama began thinking how the demon in the form of a deer drew him away. Thus in the midst of apprehensions he reached Janasthana.
57_8.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, गोमायुनिस्स्वनम् the jackal's howl, श्रुत्वा on hearing, इत्येवम् like this, चिन्तयन् worried, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, रक्षसा by the demon, आत्मनः his, अपनयनात् due to being drawn away, परिशङ्कितः  terrified, जनस्थानम् Janasthana, आजगाम came.

57_9.shloka: तं दीनमनसो दीनमासेदुर्मृगपक्षिणः।सव्यं कृत्वा महात्मानं घोरांश्च ससृजुस्स्वरान्।।3.57.12।।
57_9.translation: Dejected at heart, the birds and animals piteously kept the great soul (Rama) to the left and produced a dreadful cacophony.
57_9.word_by_word: दीनमनसः dejected at heart, मृगपक्षिणः animals and birds, दीनम् piteous, महात्मानम् great soul, तम् him, सव्यम् कृत्वा keeping him to the left, आसेदुः remained, घोरान् horrifying, स्वरान् sounds, ससृजुश्च released.

57_10.shloka: तानि दृष्ट्वा निमित्तानि महाघोराणि राघवः।न्यवर्तताथ त्वरितो जवेनाश्रममात्मनः।।3.57.13।।
57_10.translation: On seeing such dreadfu omens at that time, Rama hurried back to his hermitage.
57_10.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, महाघोराणि very dreadful, तानि निमित्तानि such omens, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, अथ then, त्वरितः hastened, जवेन with speed, आत्मनः his, आश्रमम् hermitage, न्यवर्तत returned.

57_11.shloka: सीतां स तु वरारोहां लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।आजगाम जनस्थानं चिन्तयन्नेव राघवः।।3.57.14।।
57_11.translation: Rama arrived at Janasthana thinking (of the safety) of charming Sita and mighty Lakshmana.
57_11.word_by_word: सः राघवः that Rama, वरारोहाम् charming, सीताम् Sita, महाबलम्  mighty, लक्ष्मणं च Lakshmana, चिन्तयन्नेव thinking of them, जनस्थानम् Janasthana, आजगाम arrived.

57_12.shloka: ततो लक्ष्मणमायान्तं ददर्श विगतप्रभम्।ततोऽविदूरे रामेण समीयाय स लक्ष्मणः।।3.57.15।।विषण्णस्सुविषण्णेन दुःखितो दुःखभागिना।
57_12.translation: He then saw Lakshmana coming towards him with a cheerless face. When the sad, depressed Lakshmana came near, he saw Rama (equally) despondent and griefstricken.
57_12.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, आयान्तम् while coming, विगतप्रभम् dull, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, ददर्श saw, ततः then, विषण्णः a despondent one, दुःखितः one in grief, सः लक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, सुविषण्णेन with a despondent one, दुःखभागिना immersed in sorrow, रामेण Rama, अविदूरे not very far, समीयाय went near.

57_13.shloka: सञ्जगर्हेऽथ तं भ्राता ज्येष्ठो लक्ष्मणमागतम्।।3.57.16।।विहाय सीतां विजने वने राक्षससेविते।
57_13.translation: In this situation Rama the elder brother rebuked Lakshmana for having left Sita behind in a desolate forest infested with demons.
57_13.word_by_word: अथ at that time, ज्येष्ठः भ्राता elder brother Rama, राक्षससेविते in a place infested with demons, विजने in a desolate, वने forest, सीताम् Sita, विहाय leaving, आगतम् one who came, तं लक्ष्मणम् to that Lakshmana, सञ्जगर्हे rebuked.

57_14.shloka: गृहीत्वा च करं सव्यं लक्ष्मणं रघुनन्दनः।।3.57.17।।उवाच मधुरोदर्कमिदं परुषमार्तिमत्।
57_14.translation: Rama, the delight of the Raghus, took hold of Lakshmana's left hand, and in sadness said these sweet harsh words :
57_14.word_by_word: रघुनन्दनः a delight of the Raghu dynasty, आर्तिमत् piteously, सव्यं करम् left hand, गृहीत्वा ontaking hold, मधुरोदर्कम् sweet as ever, परुषम् harsh, इदम् this, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, उवाच said.

57_15.shloka: अहो लक्ष्मण गर्ह्यं ते कृतं यस्त्वं विहाय ताम्।।3.57.18।।सीतामिहाऽगतस्सौम्य कच्चित्स्वस्ति भवेदिह।
57_15.translation: O gentle Lakshmana you are to blame for coming here, leaving Sita behind. Alas will she be safe now?
57_15.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle one, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, यः who, त्वम् you, ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, विहाय leaving, इह here, आगतः came, ते to you, गर्ह्यम् blameworthy, कृतम् done, इह here, स्वस्ति safe, भवेत् कच्चित् will she be safe, अहो Alas.

57_16.shloka: न मेऽस्ति संशयो वीर सर्वथा जनकात्मजा।।3.57.19।।विनष्टा भक्षिता वापि राक्षसैर्वनचारिभिः।अशुभान्येव भूयिष्ठं यथा प्रादुर्भवन्ति मे।।3.57.20।।
57_16.translation: O heroic Lakshmana I see many inauspicious omens. I think Sita might have been lost or eaten away by the demons of the forest. There is no doubt about it.
57_16.word_by_word: वीर O great hero, मे to me, भूयिष्ठम् many, अशुभान्येव inauspicious omens only, यथा similarly, प्रादुर्भवन्ति got manifested, जनकात्मजा Sita, सर्वथा by all means, विनष्टा she is lost, वनचारिभिः by forsetrangers, राक्षसैः demons, भक्षिता वापि must have been eaten up, मे for me, संशयः doubt, नास्ति is not.

57_17.shloka: अपि लक्ष्मण सीतायास्सामग्र्यं प्राप्नुयावहे।जीवन्त्याः पुरुषव्याघ्र सुताया जनकस्य वै।।3.57.21।।
57_17.translation: O Lakshmana, a tiger among men, will we be able to see the daughter of Janaka, living in a state of total wellbeing? Will we be able to get her back ?
57_17.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र O tiger among men, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, जीवन्त्या: of the living, जनकस्य सुतायाः of the daughter of Janaka, सीतायाः Sita's, सामग्र्यम् total well being, अपि प्राप्नुयावहे will we be able to get her back.

57_18.shloka: यथा वै मृगसङ्घाश्च गोमायुश्चैव भैरवम्।वाश्यन्ते शकुनाश्चापि प्रदीप्तामभितो दिशम्।।3.57.22।।अपि स्वस्ति भवेत्तस्या राजपुत्र्या महाबल।
57_18.translation: O  mighty Lakshmana  from the way the beasts, jackals and birds too have turned in the bright direction of the Sun, crying in a frightful manner, can we hope princess Sita is safe ?
57_18.word_by_word: महाबल mighty, मृगसङ्घाश्च herds of beasts, गोमायुश्च jackal also, शकुनाश्चापि birds too, प्रदीप्ताम् shining bright, दिशम् direction, अभितः towards, यथा as, भैरवम् in frightful manner, वाश्यन्ते howling, राजपुत्र्याः of the princess, तस्याः of that  Sita, स्वस्ति अपि भवेत् may her be well.

57_19.shloka: इदं हि रक्षो मृगसन्निकाशं प्रलोभ्य मां दूरमनुप्रयान्तम्।हतं कथञ्चिन्महता श्रमेण स राक्षसोऽभून्म्रियमाण एव।।3.57.23।।
57_19.translation: Appearing in the guise of a deer, this demon allured me to a great distance. With much effort he was somehow killed. but he assumed his demoniac form while dying.
57_19.word_by_word: मृगसन्निकाशम् appearing like a deer, इदं रक्षः this demon, अनुप्रयान्तम् who followed, माम् me, दूरम् far, प्रलोभ्य alluring, महता with great, श्रमेण with effort, कथञ्चित् somehow, हतम् killed, सः he, म्रियमाणः while on the verge of death, एव too, राक्षसः demon, अभूत् turned.

57_20.shloka: मनश्च मे दीनमिहाप्रहृष्टं चक्षुश्च सव्यं कुरुते विकारम्।असंशयं लक्ष्मण नास्ति सीता हृता मृता वा पथि वर्तते वा।।3.57.24।।
57_20.translation: With my heart dejected and depressed, my left eye throbbing, O Lakshmana, I have no doubt that Sita is either abducted or dead or abandoned on the way.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
57_20.word_by_word: इह here, दीनम् depressed, मे मनश्च my heart, अप्रहृष्टम् sorrowful, सव्यं चक्षुश्च left eye, विकारम् throbbing, कुरुते doing, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, असंशयम् no doubt, सीता Sita, नास्ति is not alive, हृता either abducted, मृता वा or died, पथि on the way, वर्तते वा lies.

58_1.shloka: [Rama wails -- doubts Sita's existenceblames Lakshmana -- looks out for Sita around the cottage.]स दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणं दीनं शून्ये दशरथात्मजः।पर्यपृच्छत धर्मात्मा वैदेहीमागतं विना।।3.58.1।।
58_1.translation: Rama, son of Dasaratha, the righteous self, saw Lakshmana downcast and dejected. Seeing him  without Sita, Rama enquired:
58_1.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous self, सः दशरथात्मजः that son of Dasaratha, शून्ये downcast, वैदेहीं विना without Vaidehi, आगतम् who came, दीनम् depressed, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, दृष्ट्वा seeing, पर्यपृच्छत questioned.

58_2.shloka: प्रस्थितं दण्डकारण्यं या मामनुजगाम ह।क्व सा लक्ष्मण वैदेही यां हित्वा त्वमिहागतः।।3.58.2।।
58_2.translation: Where is that princess from Videha who accompanied me when I entered Dandaka forest ? Why have you come here leaving her behind ?
58_2.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmna, दण्डकारण्यम् to Dandakaranyam, प्रस्थितम् entered, माम् me, या who,   अनुजगाम ह followed, याम् whom, हित्वा having left, त्वम् you, इह here, आगतः came, सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, क्व where is she?

58_3.shloka: राज्यभ्रष्टस्य दीनस्य दण्डकान्परिधावतः।क्व सा दुःखसहाया मे वैदेही तनुमध्यमा।।3.58.3।।
58_3.translation: Where is that princess from Videha, a sharer of my sorrows, Sita of slender waist who followed this hapless prince disloged from the kingdom into the Dandaka forest?
58_3.word_by_word: राज्यभ्रष्टस्य forsaking the kingdom, दण्डकान् Dandaka, परिधावतः running about, दीनस्य of a dejected, मे mine, दुःखसहाया a sharer of my sorrow, तनुमध्यमा lady of slender waist, सा वैदेही that Vaidehi, क्व where is she?

58_4.shloka: यां विना नोत्सहे वीर मुहूर्तमपि जीवितुम्।क्व सा प्राणसहाया मे सीता सुरसुतोपमा।।3.58.4।।
58_4.translation: O warrior Lakshmana where is that Sita without whom I have no interest to live for a moment, who was like the daughter of a god and a sustainer of my life?
58_4.word_by_word: वीर O Warrior, यां विना without whom, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, जीवितुम् to live, नोत्सहे I have no interest, सा she, सुरसुतोपमा who resembles the daughter of a god, मे my, प्राणसहाया sustainer of my life, सीता Sita, क्व Where is she?

58_5.shloka: पतित्वममराणां वा पृथिव्याश्चापि लक्ष्मण।तां विना तपनीयाभां नेच्छेयं जनकात्मजाम्।।3.58.5।।
58_5.translation: O Lakshmana I desire no lordship of the gods  or of the entire earth without that daughter of Janaka, that lady of golden complexion.
58_5.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, तपनीयाभाम् goldenhued lady, ताम् she, जनकात्मजां विना without Janaka's daughter, अमराणाम् of gods, पतित्वम् lordship, पृथिव्याश्च of the earth, नेच्छेयम् do not desire.

58_6.shloka: कच्चिज्जीवति वैदेहि प्राणैः प्रियतरा मम।कच्चित्प्रव्राजनं सौम्य न मे मिथ्या भविष्यति।।3.58.6।।
58_6.translation: O gentle Lakshmana I wonder if Vaidehi, who is dearer to me than my life is still aliveI hope my banishment from the kingdom is not going to prove false.
58_6.word_by_word: सौम्य O gentle, मम my, प्राणैः than life, प्रियतरा dearer, वैदेही Vaidehi, जीवति कच्चित् will she be alive, मे my, प्रव्राजनम् banishment from kingdom, मिथ्या prove to be false, न भविष्यति कच्चित् shall not become.

58_7.shloka: सीतानिमित्तं सौमित्रे मृते मयि गते त्वयि।कच्चित्सकामा सुखिता कैकेयी सा भविष्यति।।3.58.7।।
58_7.translation: O Saumitri when I am dead on account of Sita, and you are back, Kaikeyi with her desire fulfilled will be happy, indeed.
58_7.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Saumitri, सीतानिमित्तम् on account of Sita, मयि when I will be, मृते dead, त्वयि when you, गते will be gone, सा कैकेयी that Kaikeyi, सकामा with her desire fulfilled, सुखिता a happy soul, भविष्यति कच्चित् will be indeed.

58_8.shloka: सपुत्रराज्यां सिद्धार्थां मृतपुत्रा तपस्विनी।उपस्थास्यतिकौसल्या कच्चित्सौम्य न केकयीम्।।3.58.8।।
58_8.translation: O handsome one  I wonder if that lady of renunciation, Kausalya with her son dead, will have to serve Kaikeyi whose desire would be fulfilled, and who will enjoy the power of the throne in the company of her son
58_8.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, मृतपुत्रा  with her son dead, तपस्विनी a lady of renunciation, कौसल्या Kausalya, सपुत्रराज्याम् who enjoys the company of a son and power of the throne, सिद्धार्थाम् accomplished her desire, कैकयीम् Kaikeyi, न उपस्थास्यति कच्चित् cease to serve indeed.

58_9.shloka: यदि जीवति वैदेही गमिष्याम्याश्रमं पुनः।सुवृत्ता यदि वृत्ता प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.58.9।।
58_9.translation: O Lakshmana, only if Vaidehi is alive will I enter the cottage again or else I will give upmy life if that virtuous lady is no more.
58_9.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, वैदेही Vaidehi, जीवति यदि if she is living only, पुनः again, आश्रमम् to the cottage, गमिष्यामि will go, यदि वा or else, सुवृत्ता virtuous, वृत्ता dead, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यामि I will give up.

58_10.shloka: यदि मामाश्रमगतं वैदेही नाभिभाषते।पुनः प्रहसिता सीता विनशिष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.58.10।।
58_10.translation: I will die if Sita, princess from Videha, is not there to speak to me with her sweet smile when I return to the cottage, O Lakshmana
58_10.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, आश्रमगतम् when I return to the cottage, माम् me, वैदेही Vaidehi, सीता Sita, प्रहसिता with her sweet smile, पुनः again, नाभिभाषते यदि if she does not speak to me, विनशिष्यामि I will die.

58_11.shloka: ब्रूहि लक्ष्मण वैदेही यदि जीवति वा न वा।त्वयि प्रमत्ते रक्षोभिर्भक्षिता वा तपस्विनी।।3.58.11।।
58_11.translation: Tell me, O Lakshmana   if Sita is alive or not, whether she was eaten up by demons when you were off your guard.
58_11.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, वैदेही Vaidehi, जीवति वा alive or, न वा not, त्वयि you, प्रमत्ते were not alert, तपस्विनी lady of renunciation, रक्षोभिः by the demons, भक्षिता वा have they eaten, ब्रूहि tell me.

58_12.shloka: सुकुमारी च बाला च नित्यं चादुःखदर्शिनी।मद्वियोगेन वैदेही व्यक्तं शोचति दुर्मनाः।।3.58.12।।
58_12.translation: Vaidehi is delicate, young and she has never faced any sorrow.She will be certainly disheartened due to separation from me.
58_12.word_by_word: सुकुमारी च a delicate, बाला च young also, नित्यम् always, अदुःखदर्शिनी never experienced sorrow, वैदेही Vaidehi, दुर्मनाः troubled mind, मद्वियोगेन by separation from me, शोचति thinking of, व्यक्तम् it is true.

58_13.shloka: सर्वदा रक्षसा तेन जिह्मेन सुदुरात्मना।वदता लक्ष्मणेत्युच्चैस्तवापि जनितं भयम्।।3.58.13।।
58_13.translation: The evilminded, wicked demon calling out loudly 'O Lakshmana' must have by all means instilled fear in your mind.
58_13.word_by_word: जिह्मेन by the wicked, सुदुरात्मना by the evilminded, लक्ष्मण इति saying Lakshmana thus, उच्चैः loudly, वदता calling out, तेन by him, रक्षसा demon, सर्वथा by all means, तवापि for you also, भयम् fear, जनितम् is created.

58_14.shloka: श्रुतस्तु शङ्के वैदेह्या स स्वरस्सदृशो मम।त्रस्तया प्रेषितस्त्वं च द्रष्टुं मां शीघ्रमागतः।।3.58.14।।
58_14.translation: I am afraid, Vaidehi, frightened by hearing the voice which was like mine sent you to see me, and you came all at once.
58_14.word_by_word: वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, मम of me, सदृशः similar, सः that, स्वरः voice, श्रुतः was heard, शङ्के       I doubt, त्रस्तया by a frightened lady, प्रेषितः sent, त्वं च you too, माम् me, द्रष्टुम् to see, शीघ्रम् quickly, आगतः came.

58_15.shloka: सर्वथा तु कृतं कष्टं सीतामुत्सृजता वने।प्रतिकर्तुं नृशंसानां रक्षसां दत्तमन्तरं।।3.58.15।।
58_15.translation: You have definitely done a great mistake by leaving Sita alone in the forest. This has given a chance to the cruel demons to wreak revenge.
58_15.word_by_word: सीताम् Sita, वने in the forest, उत्सृजता leaving alone, सर्वथा by all means, कष्टम् difficult, कृतम् done, प्रतिकर्तुम् to take revenge, नृशंसानाम् of the cruel, रक्षसाम् of demons, अन्तरम् chance, दत्तम् is given.

58_16.shloka: दुःखिताः खरघातेन राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।तैस्सीता निहता घोरैर्भविष्यति न संशयः।3.58.16।।
58_16.translation: The dreadful, carnivorous demons aggrieved over my murder of Khara must have undoubtedly killed Sita.
58_16.word_by_word: पिशिताशनाः flesheaters, राक्षसाः demons, खरघातेन by the death of Khara, दुःखिताः are aggrieved, घोरैः dreadful, तैः by them, सीता Sita, निहता killed, भविष्यति may be, संशयः doubt, न no.

58_17.shloka: अहोऽस्मिन् व्यसने मग्नस्सर्वथा शत्रुसूदन।किं न्विदानीं करिष्यामि शङ्के प्राप्तव्यमीदृशम्।।3.58.17।।
58_17.translation: O destroyer of enemies  I am completely drowned in sorrow. What can I do at this moment. Alas, I am destined to suffer.
58_17.word_by_word: शत्रुसूदन O destroyer of enemies, सर्वथा in all respects, अस्मिन् in this, व्यसने in sorrow, मग्नः I am drowned, इदानीम् at this time, किं नु करिष्यामि what can I do?, ईदृशम् such, प्राप्तव्यम् destined, शङ्के I fear, अहो alas

58_18.shloka: इति सीतां वरारोहां चिन्तयन्नेव राघवः।आजगाम जनस्थानं त्वरया सह लक्ष्मणः।।3.58.18।।
58_18.translation: While thus brooding over the beautiful Sita, the scion of the Raghus along with Lakshmana hurried towards Janasthana.
58_18.word_by_word: राघवः Raghava, इति thus, वरारोहाम् beautiful, सीताम् Sita, चिन्तयन्नेव while brooding over only, सह लक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, त्वरया quickly, जनस्थानम्  Janasthanam, आजगाम he went.

58_19.shloka: विगर्हमाणोऽनुजमार्तरूपं क्षुधा श्रमाच्चैव पिपासया च।विनिश्श्वसन् शुष्कमुखो विवर्णः प्रतिश्रयं प्राप्य समीक्ष्य शून्यम्।।3.58.19।।स्वमाश्रमं सम्प्रविगाह्य वीरो विहारदेशाननुसृत्य कांश्चित्।एतत्तदित्येव निवासभूमौ प्रहृष्टरोमा व्यथितो बभूव।।3.58.20।।
58_19.translation: Thus blaming his dejected brother, the valiant Rama entered the hermitage, sighing deeply, his face pale and his throat dried up with hunger, exhaustion and thirst. Reaching his dwellingplace, he found it empty. He thoroughly searched the hermitage and the places where she used to move about on the premises. And 'so it has happened', he sadly said to himself, his hair raised on end.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
58_19.word_by_word: वीरः hero, आर्तरूपम् dejected, अनुजम् brother, विगर्हमाणः  blaming him, क्षुधा hunger, श्रमाच्चैव due to exhaustion, पिपासया and thirsty, विनिःश्वसन् sighing deeply, शुष्कमुखः face dried up, विवर्णः turned pale, प्रतिश्रयम् restingplace, प्राप्य reaching, शून्यम् empty, समीक्ष्य seeing, स्वम् his, आश्रमम् hermitage, सम्प्रविगाह्य searching thoroughly, कांश्चित् some of the places, विहारदेशान् places where she was moving about, अनुसृत्य after following her, निवासभूमौ in the dwelling place, एतत् all that, तदेव इति this itself, प्रहृष्टरोमा with horripilation, व्यथितः pained, बभूव became.

59_1.shloka: [Rama enquires Lakshmana the reason for leaving Sita alone-- Lakshmana tells him about Sita goading him to leave immediately.]अथाश्रमादुपावृत्तमन्तरा रघुनन्दनः।परिपप्रच्छ सौमित्रिं रामो दुःखार्दितं पुनः।।3.59.1।।
59_1.translation: Rama, the delight of the Raghus, once again questioned Lakshmana who had come out of the hermitage, deeply hurt:
59_1.word_by_word: अथ and then, रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghus, रामः Rama, दुःखार्दितम् afflicted, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, उपावृत्तम् returned, सौमित्रिम् Lakshmana, अन्तरा in the midst, पुनः again, परिपप्रच्छ questioned.

59_2.shloka: तमुवाच किमर्थं त्वमागतोऽपास्य मैथिलीम्।यदा सा तव विश्वासाद्वने विरहिता मया।।3.59.2।।
59_2.translation: Why did you come, leaving the princess from Mithila alone in the forest when I had left her under your trust ?
59_2.word_by_word: तम् him, उवाच had said, तव your, विश्वासात् with the confidence, मया myself, सा she, वने  in the forest, यदा as such, विरहिता left, मैथिलीम् Maithili, किमर्थम् for what reason, उपास्य having left her, त्वम् you, आगतः came.

59_3.shloka: दृष्ट्वैवाभ्यागतं त्वां मे मैथिलीं त्यज्य लक्ष्मण।शङ्कमानं महत्पापं यत्सत्यं व्यथितं मनः।।3.59.3।।
59_3.translation: When I saw you, O Lakshmana, coming without Sita, my mind was oppressed with evil thought which have come true.
59_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, मैथिलीम् Maithili, त्यज्य left, अभ्यागतम् your coming, त्वाम् your, दृष्ट्वैव on seeing, मनः in my mind, महत् great, पापम् evil, शङ्कमानम् doubted, व्यथितम् (इति) यत् I was pained, सत्यम् it was true.

59_4.shloka: स्फुरते नयनं सव्यं बाहुश्च हृदयं च मे।दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मण दूरे त्वां सीताविरहितं पथि।।3.59.4।।
59_4.translation: O Lakshmana, as I saw you from a distance without Sita, my left eye, my shoulder and my heart throbbed.
59_4.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सीताविरहितम् without Sita, त्वाम् you, दूरे at a distance, पथि on the way, दृष्ट्वा seeing, मे mine, सव्यम् left, नयनम् eye, बाहुश्च shoulder, स्फुरते throbbing, मे my, हृदयं च heart too.

59_5.translation: Thus addressed, virtuous Lakshmana, overwhelmed with sorrow replied to the grief stricken Rama:
59_5.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been spoken, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, शुभलक्षणः endowed with good  traits, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भूयः again, दुःखसमाविष्टः drowned in greater sorrow, दुःखितम् sorrowful, रामम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said.

59_6.shloka: न स्वयं कामकारेण तां त्यक्त्वाहमिहागतः।प्रचोदित स्तयैवोग्रैस्त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः।।3.59.6।।
59_6.translation: I did not leave her on my own nor have I  come here of my own accord. I came to you,provoked by her angry  words.
59_6.word_by_word: अहम् I, ताम् her, स्वयम् on my own, त्यक्त्वा after leaving, कामकारेण by my own desire, इह here, न आगतः not come, तयैव by herself, उग्रैः with angry words, प्रचोदितः provoked, इह here, त्वत्सकाशम् to you, आगतः I came.

59_7.shloka: आर्येणेव पराक्रुष्टं हासीते लक्ष्मणेति च।परित्राहीति यद्वाक्यं मैथिल्यास्तच्छ्रुतिं गतम्।।3.59.7।।
59_7.translation: Uttered loudly, 'Alas Sita, Alas, Lakshmana, save me', as if these were the words of your noble self, reached Sita's ears.
59_7.word_by_word: हा सीते Alas, Sita, हा लक्ष्मण Alas, Lakshmana, इति च these words, परित्राहि इति save  me, यत् such, आर्येणेव as if your noble self, पराक्रुष्टम् loudly, तत् then, मैथिल्याः Maithili's, श्रुतिम् to her ears, गतम् reached.

59_8.shloka: सा तमार्तस्वरं श्रुत्वा तव स्नेहेन मैथिली।गच्छ गच्छेति मामाह रुदन्ती भयविह्वला।।3.59.8।।
59_8.translation: The princess from Mithila heard this cry of pain and, wild with fear, urged me out of her love for you to go.
59_8.word_by_word: सा मैथिली that Maithili, तम् that, आर्तस्वरम् cry of pain, श्रुत्वा hearing, रुदन्ती crying, तव स्नेहेन  because of her love for you, भयविह्वला wild with fear, गच्छ गच्छ इति go, go, माम् to me said, आह pleaded.

59_9.shloka: प्रचोद्यमानेन मया गच्छेति बहुशस्तया।प्रत्युक्ता मैथिली वाक्यमिदं त्वत्प्रत्ययान्वितम्।3.59.9।।
59_9.translation: When I was repeated asked to go, I said this in order to instil confidence in the princess from Mithila :
59_9.word_by_word: गच्छ इति saying go, तया Sita, बहुशः many ways, प्रचोद्यमानेन while being provoked, मया by me, मैथिली Maithili, त्वत्प्रत्ययान्वितम्  cofidence in her, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युक्ता replied.

59_10.shloka: न तत्पश्याम्यहं रक्षो यदस्य भयमावहेत्।निर्वृता भव नास्त्येतत्केनाप्येवमुदाहृतम्।।3.59.10।।
59_10.translation: 'No one  can cause fear in Rama. I do not see any demon who can hold a threat to him. Give up fear. Some one might have said it.
59_10.word_by_word: अस्य his, यत् Rama, भयम् fear, आवहेत् who can cause, तत् such, रक्षः demon, अहम् I, न पश्यामि I do not see, निर्वृता give up fear, भव your, एतत् this, नास्ति does not exist, केनापि by some one, एवम् in that way, उदाहृतम् is uttered.

59_11.shloka: विगर्हितं च नीचं च कथमार्योऽभिधास्यति।त्राहीति वचनं सीते यस्त्रायेत्रिदशानपि।।3.59.11।।
59_11.translation: 'How can Rama who is capable of saving even gods speak such unworthy, demeaning words, 'Save me, O Sita'
59_11.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, यः he, त्रिदशानपि even gods, त्रायेत् he may save, आर्यः capable one, विगर्हितम् demeaning, नीचं च lowly, त्राहि इति saying 'save me', वचनम् words, कथम् how, अभिधास्यति will speak out?

59_12.shloka: किं निमित्तं तु केनापि भ्रातुरालम्ब्य मे स्वरम्।राक्षसेनेरितं वाक्यं त्राहि त्राहीति शोभने।।3.59.12।।
59_12.translation: O fair lady, for some reason some demon  has uttered these words 'Save me, save me' adapting my brother's voice.
59_12.word_by_word: शोभने O fair lady, किं निमित्तं तु for some reason, केनापि राक्षसेन by some demon, मे भ्रातुः my brother's, स्वरम् voice, आलम्ब्य adapting, त्राहि त्राहि इति 'save me, save me', वाक्यम् these words, ईरितम् is said.

59_13.shloka: विस्वरं व्याहृतं वाक्यं लक्ष्मण त्राहि मामिति।न भवत्या व्यथा कार्या कुनारीजनसेविता।।3.59.13।।
59_13.translation: 'Lakshmana, save me' are the words uttered in an altered tone. Like an ordinary, lowborn woman you are not to feel concerned for this.
59_13.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, माम् me, त्राहि save me, इति thus, विस्वरम् in an altered voice, वाक्यम्  these words, व्याहृतम् uttered, भवत्या yourself, कुनारीजनसेविता like an ordinary lowborn woman, व्यथा pain, न कार्या not to be taken.

59_14.shloka: अलं वैक्लब्यमालम्ब्य स्वस्था भव निरुत्सुका।न सोऽस्ति त्रिषु लोकेषु पुमान्वै राघवं रणे।।3.59.14।।जातो वा जायमानो वा संयुगे यः पराजयेत्।न जय्यो राघवो युद्धे देवैश्शक्रपुरोगमैः।।3.59.15।।
59_14.translation: 'You should not feel agitated or dispirited. Be composed. There is no one either born or going to be born in the three worlds who can defeat Rama in war. He cannot be conquered in a battle even by gods led by indra.'
59_14.word_by_word: वैक्लब्यम् bewilderment, आलम्ब्य resorting to, अलम् no need, निरुत्सुका frustrated, स्वस्था भव you should be calm, यः whoever, संयुगेरणे in an encounter, राघवम् Rama, पराजयेत् defeat, सः he, पुमान् a man, त्रिषु लोकेषु in the three worlds, जातो वा is born in the past, जायमानो वा or going to be born, नास्ति is not there, राघवः Rama, शक्रपुरोगमैः by those led by Indra, देवैः by gods, युद्धे in war, न जय्यः cannot be conquered.

59_15.shloka: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही परिमोहितचेतना।उवाचाश्रूणि मुञ्चन्ती दारुणं मामिदं वचः।।3.59.16।।
59_15.translation: Deluded by her senses, Vaidehi said these words, shedding tears when I  tried toconsole  her:
59_15.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्ता  consoled, वैदेही Vaidehi, परिमोहितचेतना of deluded intellect, अश्रूणि tears, मुञ्चन्ती shedding, माम् me, दारुणं harsh, इदं वचः these words, उवाच said.

59_16.shloka: भावो मयि तवात्यर्थं पाप एव निवेशितः।विनष्टे भ्रातरि प्राप्तुं न च त्वं मामवाप्स्यसि।।3.59.17।।
59_16.translation: 'You have an extremely sinful intention of getting me  when your brother is dead. But you will not be able to gain me.
59_16.word_by_word: भ्रातरि brother, विनष्टे is deceased, प्राप्तुम् to get, मयि me, अत्यर्थम् extremely, पापः भाव एव sinful thought only, तव you, निवेशितः is set, त्वम् you, माम् me, न च अवाप्स्यसि will not be able to gain.

59_17.shloka: सङ्केताद्भरतेन त्वं रामं समनुगच्छसि।क्रोशन्तं हि यथात्यर्थं नैवमभ्यवपद्यसे।।3.59.18।।
59_17.translation: 'Since you are not reaching out to Rama who is helplessly crying for his rescue, you must have followed Rama, instructed by Bharata (to do him harm)'৷৷
59_17.word_by_word: अत्यर्थम् intensely, क्रोशन्तम्  shouting for help, यथा as, एवम् in this, नाभ्यवपद्यसे  are not going, त्वम् you, भरतेन by Bharata, सङ्केतात् instruction, रामम् Rama,समनुगच्छसि followed.

59_18.translation: 'You are an enemy moving in disguise with an interest in me. You are waiting for an opportunity to set aside Rama. That is why you are not rushing to him.'
59_18.word_by_word: प्रच्छन्नचारी in disguise, रिपुः enemy, त्वम् you, राघवस्य Rama's, अन्तरप्रेप्सुः waiting for an opportunity, मदर्थम् for my sake, अनुगच्छसि are following, तथा like this, एनम् him, नाभिपद्यसे not going now.

59_19.shloka: एवमुक्तो हि वैदेह्या संरब्धो रक्तलोचनः।क्रोधात्प्रस्फुरमाणोष्ठ आश्रमादभिनिर्गतः।।3.59.20।।
59_19.translation: At these words from the princess of Videha, I came out of the hermitage in an agitated mood with my eyes turned red and lips quivering in anger.
59_19.word_by_word: वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, संरब्धः an agitated person, क्रोधात् in anger, रक्तलोचनः with reddened eye, स्फुरमाणोष्ठः quivering lips, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, अभिनिर्गतः came out.

59_20.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं रामस्सन्तापमोहितः।अब्रवीद्दुष्कृतं सौम्य तां विना यत्त्वमागतः।।3.59.21।।
59_20.translation: To Lakshmana thus reporting, Rama, overcome with grief, said,(Even then) O noble brother your coming here, leaving her behind, is a wrong step taken.
59_20.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणम् as he was telling, सौमित्रिम् Lakshmana, सन्तापमोहितः overtaken by grief, रामः Rama, अब्रवीत् said, सौम्य noble, यत् since, त्वम् you, तां विना without her, आगतः came, दुष्कृतम् a wrong act, कृतम् is done.

59_21.shloka: जानन्नपि समर्थं मां रक्षसां विनिवारणे।अनेन क्रोधवाक्येन मैथिल्या निस्सृतो भवान्।।3.59.22।।
59_21.translation: You have come out of the hermitage provoked by Maithili's angry words, even though you are aware that I am capable of warding off the demons.
59_21.word_by_word: माम् me, रक्षसाम् of demons, विनिवारणे in warding off, समर्थम् capable, जानन्नपि even knowing , भवान् yourself, मैथिल्याः Maithili's, अनेन by this, क्रोधवाक्येन angry words, निस्सृतः came out.

59_22.shloka: न हि ते परितुष्यामि त्यक्त्वा यद्यासि मैथिलीम्।क्रुद्धायाः परुषं श्रुत्वा तां विहाय त्वमागतः।।3.59.23।।
59_22.translation: I am not happy with you as you have come here deserting Sita on the plea that she was angry and spoke harsh words.
59_22.word_by_word: मैथिलीम् Maithili, त्यक्त्वा left, यद्यासि that you came, ते with you, न परितुष्यामि not pleased, त्वम् you, क्रुद्धायाः angry, परुषम् harsh, श्रुत्वा  listening, ताम् her, विहाय  deserting, इह here, आगतः came.

59_23.shloka: सर्वथा त्वविनीतं ते सीतया यत्प्रचोदितः।क्रोधस्य वशमापन्नो नाकरोश्शासनं मम।।3.59.24।।
59_23.translation: Provoked by the words of Sita spoken in anger you came without respecting my orders. It is definitely an act of disobedience.
59_23.word_by_word: सीतया by Sita, प्रचोदितः you are urged, क्रोधस्य by anger's, वशम् grip, आपन्नः came, मम my, शासनम् orders, नाकरोः (इति) यत् not respected, सर्वथा by all means, ते your, अविनीतम् act of disobedience.

59_24.shloka: असौ हि राक्षसश्शेते शरेणाभिहतो मया।मृगरूपेण येनाहमाश्रमादपवाहितः।।3.59.25।।
59_24.translation: This demon who misled me in the guise of a deer and took me away from the hermitage, lies dead, killed by my arrow.
59_24.word_by_word: मृगरूपेण in the guise of a deer, येन by whom, अहम् I, आश्रमात् from the hermitage, अपवाहितः was taken away, असौ राक्षसः this demon, मया by me, शरेण with an arrow, अभिहतः he is killed, शेते lies.

59_25.shloka: विकृष्य चापं परिधाय सायकं सलीलबाणेन च ताडितो मया।मार्गीं तनुं त्यज्य स विक्लबस्वरो बभूव केयूरधरस्सराक्षसः।।3.59.26।।
59_25.translation: Bending the bow I fixed the arrow and released it at ease. Hit by that arrow he gave up his guise of the deer and assuming the form of a demon with a bracelet on his arm fell down groaning.
59_25.word_by_word: मया by me, चापम् bow, विकृष्य bending, सायकम् an arrow, परिधाय after fixing, सलीलबाणेनarrow released with ease, ताडितः beaten , सः he, मार्गीम्  a deer, तनुम् body, त्यज्य having, सविक्लबस्वर: painful voice, केयूरधरः with a bracelet, राक्षसः demon, बभूव lay down.

59_26.shloka: शराहतेनैव तदार्तया गिरा स्वरं समालम्ब्य सुदूरसुश्रवम्।उदाहृतं तद्वचनं सुदारुणं त्वमागतो येन विहाय मैथिलीम्।।3.59.27।।
59_26.translation: Hit by the arrow, the demon imitating my voice cried out in desperation which could be clearly audible even from a distance. On hearing the dreadful words you deserted Sita and came here.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
59_26.word_by_word: तदा then, शराहतेनैव as soon as he was hit by the arrow, आर्तया in distress, गिरा with a voice, सुदूरसुश्रवम्  even heard from a distance, स्वरम् voice, समालम्ब्य adapting, सुदारुणम् very dreadful, तत् that, वचनम् words, उदाहृतम्  uttered, येन by which, त्वम् you, मैथिलीम् Maithili, विहाय after deserting, इह here, आगतः came.

60_1.shloka: [Rama's sorrow -- goes from tree to tree enquiring about Sita -- Rama and Lakshmana go in search of Sita.]भृशमाव्रजमानस्य तस्याधो वामलोचनम्।प्रास्फुरच्चास्खलद्रामो वेपथुश्चाप्य जायत।।3.60.1।।
60_1.translation: As  Rama was returning( to the hermitage), his left eye throbbed repeatedly  and he stumbled and his body trembled.
60_1.word_by_word: आव्रजमानस्य Rama was moving about, तस्य his, वामलोचनम् left eye, अधः underneath, भृशम् excessively, प्रास्फुरत् throbbed, रामः Rama, प्रास्खलच्च stumbled, अस्य his, वेपथुश्च shivering, जायत was produced.

60_2.shloka: उपालक्ष्य निमित्तानि सोऽशुभानि मुहुर्मुहुः।अपि क्षेमं नु सीताया इति वै व्याजहार च।।3.60.2।।
60_2.translation: As inauspicious omens appeared again and again, doubting if all is well with Sita, he said to himself, Can Sita be safe?
60_2.word_by_word: सः he, अशुभानि inauspicious, निमित्तानि omens, उपालक्ष्य  having marked, सीतायाः of Sita, क्षेमम् अपि नु doubting the welfare, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, व्याजहार च said also.

60_3.translation: Anxious to see Sita, he hastened to the hermitage and finding it empty, becamerestless.
60_3.word_by_word: अथ then, त्वरमाणः hastening , सीता दर्शनलालसः eager to see, जगाम went, शून्यम् empty, आवसथम् hermitage, दृष्ट्वा saw, उद्विग्नमानसः with an anxious mind, बभूव became.

60_4.shloka: उद्भ्रमन्निव वेगेन विक्षिपन्रघुनन्दनः।तत्र तत्रोटजस्थानमभिवीक्षय समन्ततः।।3.60.4।।ददर्श पर्णशालां च रहितां सीतया तदा।श्रिया विरहितां ध्वस्तां हेमन्ते पद्मिनीमिव।।3.60.5।।
60_4.translation: Rama, the delight of the Raghu dynasty, hurtled in, turning round, throwing his hands to and fro, casting his looks all around the cottage where she used to move. The cottage, devoid of Sita looked like a lotuspond, the beauty of its lotuses destroyed by winter.
60_4.word_by_word: रघुनन्दनः delight of the Raghu race, वेगेन quickly, उद्भ्रमन्निव turning round and round, विक्षिपन्  throwing his hands, तत्र तत्र  here and there, उटजस्थानम् place of hermitage, समन्ततः all round, अभिवीक्ष्य scaninng, तदा then, सीतया by Sita, रहिताम् devoid of, हेमन्ते in winter season, ध्वस्ताम् destroyed, पद्मिनीमिव like the lotus pond, श्रिया with beauty, विरहिताम् without, पर्णशालाम् cottage, ददर्श saw.

60_5.shloka: रुदन्तमिव वृक्षैश्च म्लानपुष्पमृगद्विजम्।श्रिया विहीनं विध्वस्तं सन्त्यक्तवनदेवतम्।।3.60.6।।विप्रकीर्णाजिनकुशं विप्रविद्धब्रुसीकटम्।दृष्ट्वा शून्यं निजस्थानं विललाप पुनः पुनः।।3.60.7।।
60_5.translation: The trees with flowers withered, the animals and birds turned pale looked as if theywere weeping. Bereft of their beauty they wore a ruinous look. The sylvan deities had left.  The deerskin and kusa grass were strewn here and there, the grass cushions and straw mats lay scattered. Seeing his cottage so desolate Rama wept again and again.
60_5.word_by_word: वृक्षैः by the trees, रुदन्तमिव as if crying, म्लानपुष्पमृगद्विजम्  flowers withered and animals and birds turned pale, श्रिया the beauty, विहीनम् devoid of, विध्वस्तम् destroyed, संत्यक्तवनदेवतम् sylvan deities left, विप्रकीर्णाजिनकुशम् with deerskin and kusa grass scattered, विप्रविद्धब्रुसीकटम् with grass cushions and straw mat thrown pellmell, शून्यम् desolate, निजस्थानम् own place, दृष्ट्वा seeing, पुनः पुनः again and again, विललाप wept.

60_6.shloka: हृता मृता वा नष्टा वा भक्षिता वा भविष्यति।निलीनाप्यथवा भीरुरथवा वनमाश्रिता।।3.60.8।।
60_6.translation: 'Timid Sita might have been abducted or dead or crushed or eaten up by demons. Or, she may be hiding for protection in the forest'
60_6.word_by_word: भिरुः timid, हृता abducted, मृता वा or dead, नष्टा वा or ruined, भक्षिता वा or eaten up, भविष्यति may be, अथवा or else, निलीना hiding, अथवा or else, वनम् forest, आश्रिता taken shelter,

60_7.shloka: गता विचेतुं पुष्पाणि फलान्यपि च वा पुनः।अथवा पद्मिनीं याता जलार्थं वा नदीं गता।।3.60.9।।
60_7.translation: 'Maybe she has gone to pluck flowers or fruits. Or to the lotuspond or river to  fetch water.'
60_7.word_by_word: अपिवा or else, पुष्पाणि flowers, फलानि च and fruits, विचेतुम् to pluck, गता gone, अथवा or may be, पद्मिनीम् to a lotus pond, याता to get, जलार्थम्  to get water, नदीम् river, गता gone.

60_8.shloka: यत्नान्मृगयमाणस्तु नाससाद वने प्रियाम्।शोकरक्तेक्षणश्शोकादुन्मत्त इव लक्ष्यते।।3.60.10।।
60_8.translation: He ransacked the forest, yet did not find his beloved. He  appeared like a mad man, his eyes turned red with tears of sorrow.
60_8.word_by_word: यत्नात् by effort, मृगयमाणः तु while searching, वने in the forest, प्रियाम् darling, नाससाद could not see, शोकरक्तेक्षणः eyes turned red with tears, शोकात् owing to grief, उन्मत्त इव like a mad person, लक्ष्यते he appeared.

60_9.translation: Running from tree to tree, hill to hill, and river to river and weeping, Rama was immersed in a sea of sorrow.
60_9.word_by_word: रामः Rama, वृक्षात् from tree, वृक्षम् to another tree, गिरेः mountain, अद्रिम् to another mountain, नदात् from one river, नदीम् to another river, प्रधावन् while running, विलपन्  while weeping, शोकार्णवपरिप्लुतः immersed in a sea of sorrow, बभूव remained.

60_10.shloka: अपि काचित्त्वया दृष्टा सा कदम्बप्रिया प्रिया।कदम्ब यदि जानीषे शंस सीतां शुभाननाम्।।3.60.12।।
60_10.translation: O Kadamba tree, tell me if you have seen my beloved with a fair face and with love for kadamba flowers.
60_10.word_by_word: कदम्ब O Kadamba, कदम्बप्रिया O lover of kadamba flowers, प्रिया my beloved, सा she, काचित् some lady, त्वया by you, अपि दृष्टा is seen, जानीषे यदि if you know, शुभाननाम्  fair face, सीताम् Sita, शंस tell.

60_11.shloka: स्निग्धपल्लवसङ्काशा पीतकौशेयवासिनी।शंसस्व यदि वा दृष्टा बिल्व बिल्वोपमस्तनी।।3.60.13।।
60_11.translation: O Bilva tree, tell me if you have seen a lady delicate like your tender leaf, dressed in yellow silk, a lady whose breasts are round like Bilva fruits.
60_11.word_by_word: बिल्व O Bilva, स्निग्धपल्लवसङ्काशा lovely like tender leaf, पीतकौशेयवासिनी dressed in yellow silk, बिल्वोपमस्तनी lady whose breasts are round (like Bilva fruit), यदि वा दृष्टा if you have seen her, शंसस्व let me know.

60_12.shloka: अथवाऽर्जुन शंस त्वं प्रियां तामर्जुनप्रियाम्।जनकस्य सुता भीरुर्यदि जीवति वा न वा।।3.60.14।।
60_12.translation: O Arjuna tree, tell me if you know a timid lady, daughter of Janaka and my beloved, fond of Arjuna tree. Is the living or not ?
60_12.word_by_word: अथवा or else, अर्जुन O Arjuna tree, त्वम् you, अर्जुनप्रियाम् lover of Arjuna tree, तां प्रियाम् that beloved of mine, शंस tell me if you know, भीरुः a timid lady, जनकस्य सुता daughter of Janaka, यदि जीवति वा is she living, न वा or not.

60_13.shloka: ककुभः ककुभोरूं तां व्यक्तं जानाति मैथिलीम्।यथा पल्लवपुष्पाढ्यो भाति ह्येष वनस्पतिः।।3.60.15।।
60_13.translation: This Kakubha tree rich with tender leaves and flowers (perhaps)knows Maithili whose thighs are beautiful like the trunk of the Kakubha tree.
60_13.word_by_word: वनस्पतिः the tree, पल्लवपुष्पाढ्यः rich with tender leaves and flowers, यथा as, भाति appears, ककुभः kakubha, ककुभोरूम् lady with beautiful thighs, ताम् her, मैथिलीम् Maithili's, व्यक्तम् clearly, जानाति the tree knows.

60_14.shloka: भ्रमरैरुपगीतश्च यथा द्रुमवरो ह्ययम्।एष व्यक्तं विजानाति तिलकस्तिलकप्रियाम्।।3.60.16।।
60_14.translation: This great Tilaka tree round which bees bumble surely knows the lady who loves to put tilaka marks on the forehead.
60_14.word_by_word: द्रुमवरः best of trees, अयम् this, तिलकः Tilaka, यथा as, भ्रमरैः with bees, उपगीतः is sung, एषः he that, तिलकप्रियाम् a lover of mark on the forehead, व्यक्तम् it is sure, विजानाति knows?

60_15.shloka: अशोक शोकापनुद शोकोपहतचेतसम्।त्वन्नामानं कुरु क्षिप्रं प्रियासन्दर्शनेन माम्।।3.60.17।।
60_15.translation: O Ashoka tree, dispeller of sorrow, by quickly showing me my darling make me ashoka (free from sorrow) as I am griefstricken at heart.
60_15.word_by_word: शोकापनुद O dispeller of sorrow, अशोक O Ashoka tree, प्रियासन्दर्शनेन by showing me my darling, शोकोपहतचेतसम् with a griefstricken heart , माम् to me, क्षिप्रम् quickly, त्वन्नामानम् let me be called by your name, कुरु do it.

60_16.shloka: यदि ताल त्वया दृष्टा पक्वतालफलस्तनी।कथयस्व वरारोहां कारुण्यं यदि ते मयि।।3.60.18।।
60_16.translation: O Palmyra tree be kind to me and tell me if you have seen my beautiful beloved who has breasts like ripe palmyra fruit?
60_16.word_by_word: ताल Palmyra tree, पक्वतालफलस्तनी one who has breasts like ripened palmyra fruit, त्वया by you, दृष्टा यदि if seen, ते you, मयि my, कारुण्यं यदि kind to me, वरारोहाम् Sita, कथयस्व tell me.

60_17.shloka: यदि दृष्टा त्वया सीता जम्बु जम्बूफलोपमा।प्रियां यदि विजानीषे निःशङ्कं कथयस्व मे।।3.60.19।।
60_17.translation: O Jambu tree, do not hesitate to tell me if you know Sita whose body shines lovely like gold.
60_17.word_by_word: जम्बु O Jambu tree, त्वया by you, सीता Sita, यदि दृष्टा if seen, जम्बूफलोपमा a lady whose body is shining lovely like gold, प्रियाम् the beloved one, (वि)जानीषे यदि know of her, मे to me, निःशङ्कम् without hesitation, कथयस्व tell me.

60_18.shloka: अहो त्वं कर्णिकाराद्य सुपुष्पैश्शोभसे भृशम्।कर्णिकारप्रिया साध्वी शंस दृष्टा प्रिया यदि।।3.60.20।।
60_18.translation: O Karnikara tree with flowers in full bloom, tell me if you have seen my faithful beloved who is fond of karnikara flowers.
60_18.word_by_word: कर्णिकाराः O Karnikara tree, त्वम् you, अद्य now, सुपुष्पैः with flowers in full doom, भृशम् शोभसेshine, अहो Oh, कर्णिकारप्रिया lover of Karnikara, साध्वी chaste woman, प्रिया beloved, दृष्टा यदि seen her, शंस tell.

60_19.shloka: चूतनीपमहासालान्पनसान्कुरवान्धवान्।दाडिमाननसान्गत्वा दृष्ट्वा रामो महायशाः।।3.60.21।।मल्लिका माधवीश्चैव चम्पकान्केतकीस्तथा।पृच्छन्रामो वने भान्तः उन्मत्त इव लक्ष्यते।।3.60.22।।
60_19.translation: Renowned Rama, like a madman confused, approached the Mango, Kadamba , Sal and Jackfruit, Dhava, Champak, Ketaki trees and Pomegranate, Jasmine and Madhavi creepers, in order to make similar queries.
60_19.word_by_word: महायशाः renowned, रामः Rama, वने forest, चूतनीपमहासालान् big trees like mango, kadamba and sal, पनसान् jackfruit tree, धवान् dhaba tree, दाडिमान् Pomegranate tree, अपि also,तान् them, मल्लिकाः jasmines, माधवीश्चैव Madhavi creepers, चम्पकान् champaks, तथा similarly, केतकीः Ketaki, दृष्ट्वा seeing, गत्वा going near, पृच्छन्  enquired, भ्रान्तः wandering in confusion, उन्मत्तः इव like a madman, लक्ष्यते looked.

60_20.shloka: अथवा मृगशाबाक्षीं मृग जानासि मैथिलीम्।मृगविप्रेक्षणी कान्ता मृगीभिस्सहिता भवेत्।।3.60.23।।
60_20.translation: Or,  O deer do you know about Maithili who has the eyes of a fawn? My beloved who has the restless eyes of a doe may be found in their company.
60_20.word_by_word: अथवा or, मृग O deer, मृगशाबाक्षीम् doe like eyes, मैथिलीम् Maithili, जानासि known, मृगविप्रेक्षणी  whose eyes  look like eyes of young deer, कान्ता beloved, मृगीभिः among the female deer, सहिता with, भवेत् may be.

60_21.shloka: गज सा गजनासोरूर्यदि दृष्टा त्वया भवेत्।तां मन्ये विदितां तुभ्यमाख्याहि वरवारण।3.60.24।।
60_21.translation: O elephant tell me if you have seen her whose thighs are like the trunk of an elephant. O best of elephants, tell me if you know her.
60_21.word_by_word: गज O elephant, गजनासोरूः whose thighs are like the trunk of an elephant, सा she, त्वया by you, दृष्टा is seen, यदि भवेत् if she be, ताम् her, तुभ्यम् to you, विदिताम् known, मन्ये I think, वरवारण O best of elephants, आख्याहि tell me.

60_22.shloka: शार्दूल यदि सा दृष्टा प्रिया चन्द्रनिभानना।मैथिली मम विस्रब्धं कथयस्व न ते भयम्।।3.60.25।।
60_22.translation: O tiger tell me freely and fearlessly if you have seen my beloved princess from Mithila with a face like the moon.
60_22.word_by_word: शार्दूल tiger, चन्द्रनिभानना lady with a Moon like face, प्रिया dear, सा मैथिली that Mythili, दृष्टा यदि if at all seen by you, विस्रब्धम् with confidence, मम to me, कथयस्व tell me, ते to you, भयम् fear, न not.

60_23.shloka: किं धावसि प्रिये दूरे दृष्टासि कमलेक्षणे।वृक्षैराच्छाद्य चात्मानं किं मां न प्रतिभाषसे।।3.60.26।।
60_23.translation: O lotus eyed darling, why are you running away? I have already seen you.  Why are you hiding behind trees and not replying to me?
60_23.word_by_word: कमलेक्षणे O lotuseyed, प्रिये dear, दूरे to a distance, किम् why, धावसि you are running, दृष्टा seen, असि you, आत्मानम् yourself, वृक्षैः with trees, आच्छाद्य covering, माम् me, किम् why, न प्रतिभाषसे not replying.

60_24.shloka: तिष्ठ तिष्ठ वरारोहे न तेऽस्ति करुणा मयि।नात्यर्थं हास्यशीलासि किमर्थं मामुपेक्षसे।।3.60.27।।
60_24.translation: O my beautiful beloved, stay, stay  Have you no compassion for me ? You are so fond of fun. Why do you avoid me?
60_24.word_by_word: वरारोहे O beautiful lady, तिष्ठ तिष्ठ stay, stay, ते to you, मयि in me, करुणा compassion, नास्ति is not there, अत्यर्थम् very much, हास्यशीला lady fond of making fun, नासि you are not, माम् me, किमर्थम् why, उपेक्षसे do you avoid me.

60_25.shloka: पीतकौशेयकेनासि सूचिता वरवर्णिनि।धावन्त्यपि मया दृष्टा तिष्ठ यद्यस्ति सौहृदम्।।3.60.28।।
60_25.translation: O lady of lovely complexion, I can see your yellow silk (flying), while you are running away. If you have love for me, stay on.
60_25.word_by_word: वरवर्णिनि O lady of lovely complexion, पीतकौशेयकेन by your yellow silk, सूचिता  indicated, असि you are, धावन्त्यपि even while you are running away, मया by me, दृष्टा you are seen, सौहृदम् love for me, अस्ति यदि if you have, तिष्ठ stay.

60_26.shloka: नैव सा नूनमथवा हिंसिता चारुहासिनी।कृच्छ्रप्राप्तं न मां नूनं यथोपेक्षितुमर्हति।।3.60.29।।
60_26.translation: O lady with a sweet smile I have never hurt you. When I am in difficulty it does not behove you to ignore me.
60_26.word_by_word: अथवा even so, सा she, नैव never, चारुहासिनी lady with sweet smile, हिंसिता hurt, नूनम् surely, यथा as such, कृच्छ्रप्राप्तम् when in difficulties, माम् me, उपेक्षितुम् to ignore, नार्हति should not, नूनम् surely.

60_27.shloka: व्यक्तं सा भक्षिता बाला राक्षसैः पिशिताशनैः।विभज्याङ्कानि सर्वाणि मया विरहिता प्रिया।।3.60.30।।
60_27.translation: It is clear that separated from me, the body of my young beloved is torn off and eaten away by carnivorous demons.
60_27.word_by_word: मया by me, विरहिता separated, प्रिया my beloved, सा बाला that young lady, व्यक्तम् it is clear, सर्वाणि all, अङ्गानि limbs, विभज्य tearing, पिशिताशनैः by flesheaters, राक्षसैः by demons  भक्षिता is eaten away.

60_28.shloka: नूनं तच्छुभदन्तोष्ठं सुनासं चारुकुण्डलम्।पूर्णचन्द्रनिभं ग्रस्तं मुखंनिष्प्रभतां गतम्।।3.60.31।।
60_28.translation: Her beautiful face with her sparkling teeth and lips, wellshaped nose, shining earrings has been like the full moon, eclipsed and rendered pale.
60_28.word_by_word: नूनम् surely, शुभदन्तोष्ठम् having beautiful teeth and lips, सुनासम् having beautiful nose, चारुकुण्डलम् shining earrings, पूर्णचन्द्रनिभम् full Moon like, तत् that, मुखम् face, ग्रस्तम् eclipsed, निष्प्रभताम् dull, गतम् is rendered.

60_29.shloka: सा हि चम्पकवर्णाभा ग्रीवा ग्रैवेयशोभिता।कोमला विलपन्त्यास्तु कान्ताया भक्षिता शुभा।।3.60.32।।
60_29.translation: That delicate, beautiful neck of my beloved having the complexion of a champak flower and adorned with necklaces was perhaps eaten up.
60_29.word_by_word: विलपन्त्याः wept, कान्तायाः  dear wife, चम्पकवर्णाभा like the colour of champak flowers, ग्रैवेयशोभिता adorned with necklaces and other golden chains, कोमला a delicate, शुभा auspicious, सा ग्रीवा of lovely neck, भक्षिता was eaten.

60_30.shloka: नूनं विक्षिप्यमाणौ तौ बाहू पल्लवकोमलौ।भक्षितौ वेपमानाग्रौ सहस्ताभरणाङ्गदौ।।3.60.33।।
60_30.translation: Her arms, delicate like tender leaves, their tips (fingers) quivering, adorned with armlets and bracelets have surely been eaten away.
60_30.word_by_word: विक्षिप्यमाणौ  thrown, पल्लवकोमलौ tender like leaves, वेपमानाग्रौ with trembling tips, सहस्ताभरणाङ्गदौ shining with armlets, bracelets, तौ बाहू those two arms, नूनम् surely,भक्षितौ eaten away.

60_31.shloka: मया विरहिता बाला रक्षसां भक्षणाय वै।सार्धेनेव परित्यक्ता भक्षिता बहुबान्धवा।।3.60.34।।
60_31.translation: The young lady having many relations, forsaken by me, has been (perhaps) picked up by a demon for food and later abandoned halfeaten.
60_31.word_by_word: बाला young lady, रक्षसाम् of the demons, भक्षणाय वै for eating by, मया by me, विरहिता  separated, बहुबान्धवा having many relations, सार्धेन when half of it is left, परित्यक्ता इव as if abandoned, भक्षिता eaten.

60_32.shloka: हा लक्ष्मण महाबाहो पश्यसि त्वं प्रियां क्वचित्।हा प्रिये क्व गता भद्रे हा सीतेति पुनः पुनः।।3.60.35।।
60_32.translation: O longarmed Lakshmana, are you able to see my beloved anywhere? O noble lady, O darling, where have you gone? O Sita  SIta
60_32.word_by_word: महाबाहो O longarmed one, हाः लक्ष्मण 'Alas Lakshmana ', त्वम् you, क्वचित् in any place, प्रियाम् dear, पश्यसि are you able to see, भद्रे  'O noble lady', हा प्रिये 'O darling', क्व where, गता you are gone, हा सीते O Sita', इति  thus, पुनः again, पुनः again.

60_33.shloka: इत्येवं विलपन्रामः परिधावन्वनाद्वनम्।क्वचिदुद्भ्रमते वेगात्क्वचिद्विभ्रमते बलात्।।3.60.36।।क्वचिन्मत्त इवाभाति कान्तान्वेषणतत्परः।
60_33.translation: Rama ran from forest to forest, now jumping, now taking strong strides, but all the time weeping, a madman busy in search of his beloved.
60_33.word_by_word: रामः Rama, इत्येवम् in that manner, विलपन्  weeping, वनात् from one forest, वनम् to the other forest, परिधावन्  running, क्वचित् at some place, वेगात् with speed, उद्भ्रमते jumped,क्वचित् at some place, बलात् with his strength, विभ्रमते moves fast, क्वचित्  at some place, कान्तान्वेषणतत्परः busy in search of his beloved, मत्तः इव like a madman, आभाति was seen.

60_34.shloka: स वनानि नदीश्शैलान् गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।।3.60.37।।काननानि च वेगेन भ्रमत्यपरिसंस्थितः।
60_34.translation: He rushed through forests, rivers, hills and mountain streams and through dense jungles with an unstable mind.
60_34.word_by_word: सः he, वनानि the forests, नदी: rivers, शैलान् hills, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च streams of mountains, काननानि च dense forests, अपरिसंस्थितः not stable, वेगेन rushed, भ्रमति he wandered.

60_35.shloka: तथा स गत्वा विपुलम् महद्वनं परीत्य सर्वं त्वथ मैथिलीं प्रति।अनिष्ठिताशस्सचकार मार्गणे पुनः प्रियायाः परमं परिश्रमम्।।3.60.38।।
60_35.translation: Rama went about the vast forest searching for the princess from Mithila all over not giving up hope of finding her. He continued to make great efforts for searching his beloved.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
60_35.word_by_word: सः Rama, विपुलम् vast, महत् great, वनम् forest, तथा in that way, गत्वा after going, सर्वम् all, परीत्य searching, मैथिलीं प्रति pertaining to Maithili, अनिष्ठिताशः giving up hope of finding her, सः Rama, पुनः again, प्रियायाः his beloved's, मार्गणे in search, परमम् supreme, परिश्रमम् effort, चकार made.

61_1.shloka: [Unable to find Sita, Rama gets restless -- Lakshmana consoles him -- Rama's speculation about Sita.]दृष्ट्वाश्रमपदं शून्यं रामो दशरथात्मजः।रहितां पर्णशालां च विध्वस्तान्यासनानि च।।3.61.1।।अदृष्ट्वा तत्र वैदेहीं सन्निरीक्ष्य च सर्वशः।उवाच रामः प्राक्रुश्य प्रगृह्य रुचिरौ भुजौ।।3.61.2।।
61_1.translation: Rama, son of Dasaratha, saw the empty cottage devoid of Sita. The mats were displaced. He searched everywhere but unable to see Vaidehi lifted his lovely arms and said:
61_1.word_by_word: दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, शून्यम् empty, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, रहिताम्  devoid of, च and, विध्वस्तानि disturbed, आसनानि च seats, दृष्ट्वा saw, तत्र thereafter, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अदृष्ट्वा having not seen, सर्वशः all over, सन्निरीक्ष्य च scanning, प्राक्रुश्य etched, रुचिरौ lovely, भुजौ shoulders, प्रगृह्य holding, उवाच said.

61_2.shloka: क्व नु लक्ष्मण वैदेही कं वा देशमितो गता।केनाहृता वा सौमित्रे भक्षिता केन वा प्रिया।।3.61.3।।
61_2.translation: O son of Sumitra, where is my beloved ? Where did she go? By whom was she abducted? Or, devoured? O Lakshmana
61_2.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, वैदेही Vaidehi, क्व नु where is she, कं वा देशम् in which land, गता gone, सौमित्रे O son of Sumitra, केन by whom, आहृता वा is abducted, प्रिया my beloved, केन वा by whom, भक्षिता eaten.

61_3.shloka: वृक्षेणाच्छाद्य यदि मां सीते हसितुमिच्छसि।अलं ते हसितेनाद्य मां भजस्व सुदुःखितम्।।3.61.4।।
61_3.translation: O Sita if you intend to make fun by hiding behind a tree, I tell you it is enough. Stop it and come to this extremely sorrowful man.
61_3.word_by_word: सीते O Sita, वृक्षेण by tree, आच्छाद्य hiding behind, माम् me, हसितुम् to make fun, इच्छसि यदि are you intending to, ते you, हसितेन fun, अलम् enough, अद्य now, सुदुःखितम् very muchgrieved, माम् me, भजस्व come to me.

61_4.shloka: यैस्सह क्रीडसे सीते विश्वस्तैर्मृगपोतकैः।एते हीनास्त्वया सौम्ये ध्यायन्त्यस्राविलेक्षणाः।।3.61.5।।
61_4.translation: O gentle  Sita those fawns who trusted you and played with you, are now separated from you. Brooding over you, their eyes are brimming with tears.
61_4.word_by_word: सौम्ये O gentle lady, सीते Sita, विश्वस्तैः relied on you, यैः by those, मृगपोतकैः सह with the fawn, क्रीडसे play, एते these, त्वया by you, हीनाः separated, अस्राविलेक्षणाः eyes filled with tears, ध्यायन्ति they are thinking of you.

61_5.shloka: सीतया रहितोऽहं वै न हि जीवामि लक्ष्मण।मृतं शोकेन महता सीताहरणजेन माम्।।3.61.6।।परलोके महाराजो नूनं द्रक्ष्यति मे पिता।
61_5.translation: O Lakshmana, I cannot live without Sita. I am filled with deep grief on account of Sita's abduction. My late father, the king will certainly see me in the other world (I will definitely commit suicide).
61_5.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सीतया by Sita, रहितः without, अहम् I, न हि जीवामि I cannot live, सीताहरणजेन arising out of Sita's abduction, महता by deep, शोकेन by grief, मृतं dead, माम् me, महाराजः the king (Dasaratha), मे पिता my father, नूनम् certainly, परलोके in the other world, द्रक्ष्यति will meet me.

61_6.shloka: कथं प्रतिज्ञां संश्रुत्य मया त्वमभियोजितः।।3.61.7।।अपूरयित्वा तं कालं मत्सकाशमिहागतः।कामवृत्तमनार्यं मां मृषावादिनमेव च।।3.61.8।।धिक्त्वामिति परे लोके व्यक्तं वक्ष्यति मे पिता।
61_6.translation: My father say will surely in the other world: Without completing the appointed period of the vow taken, how could you come here ? Fie upon you  You are irresponsible. You are ignoble. You are a liar.
61_6.word_by_word: माम् me, मया by me, अभियोजितः employed by me, त्वम् you, प्रतिज्ञाम् a vow, संश्रुत्य having promised, तं कालम् that full term, अपूरयित्वा without completing, मत्सकाशम् into my presence, कथम् how, इह here, आगतः came, कामवृत्तम् an irresponsible person, अनार्यम् ignoble, मृषावादिनमेव च liar, त्वाम् you, धिक् fie upon, इति thus, परे लोके in the other world, मे पिता my father, व्यक्तम् surely, वक्ष्यति will tell me.

61_7.shloka: विवशं शोकसन्तप्तं दीनं भग्नमनोरथम्।।3.61.9।।मामिहोत्सृज्य करुणं कीर्तिर्नरमिवानृजुम्।क्व गच्छसि वरारोहे मां नोत्सृज सुमध्यमे।।3.61.10।।त्वया विरहितश्चाहं मोक्ष्ये जीवितमात्मनः।
61_7.translation: O lovely lady where have you gone, leaving me here like fame deserting a crook? I am helpless griefstricken, pitiable, pathetic and disappointed. O lady of slender waist, leave me not. Separated from you, I will give up my life.
61_7.word_by_word: वरारोहे lovely lady, विवशम् helpless, शोकसन्तप्तम् tormented by sorrow, दीनम् piteous, भग्नमनोरथम् disappointed , माम् me, कीर्तिः fame, अनृजुम् crook, नरमिव like such a man, इह here, करुणम् pitiable, उत्सृज्य leaving, क्व गच्छसि where have you gone, सुमध्यमे lady with a slender waist, मा myself, मा उत्सृज leave me not, त्वया by you, विरहितः separated, अहम् I, आत्मनः my, जीवितम् life, मोक्ष्ये I will give up.

61_8.shloka: इतीव विलपन्रामस्सीतादर्शनलालसः।।3.61.11।।न ददर्श सुदुःखार्तो राघवो जनकात्मजाम्।
61_8.translation: Deeply distressed, Rama who was anxious to see Sita, daughter of Janaka, wailed and wailed but could not see her.
61_8.word_by_word: सीतादर्शनलालसः eager to see Sita, सुदुःखार्तः deeply distressed, राघवः Rama, इतीव in that manner, विलपन् wailed, जनकात्मजाम् the daughter of Janaka, न ददर्श did not see.

61_9.shloka: अनासादयमानं तं सीतां दशरथात्मजम्।।3.61.12।।पङ्कमासाद्य विपुलं सीदन्तमिव कुञ्जरम्।लक्ष्मणो राममत्यर्थमुवाच हितकाम्यया।।3.61.13।।
61_9.translation: Lakshmana, dedicated to his wellbeing, spoke to Rama, son of Dasaratha, who was sinking like an elephant into the quagmire, when he failed to trace Sita.
61_9.word_by_word: सीताम् Sita, अनासादयमानम् unable to find, दशरथात्मजम् the son of Dasaratha, विपुलम् deep, पङ्कम् mud, आसाद्य reached, सीदन्तम् sinking,  कुञ्जरम् इव like an elephant, तं रामम् that Rama, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अत्यर्थम् great, हितकाम्यया for his welfare, उवाच said.

61_10.shloka: मा विषादं महाबाहो कुरु यत्नं मया सह।इदं च हि वनं शूर बहुकन्दरशोभितम्।।3.61.14।।
61_10.translation: O longarmed, heroic Rama, do not grieve. This forest is full of caves. Let us try together.
61_10.word_by_word: महाबाहो  longarmed, विषादम् sorrow, मा do not resort to, मया सह along with me, यत्नम् effort, कुरु do, शूर O hero, इदम् this,वनम् forest,बहुकन्दरशोभितं हि full of caves.

61_11.shloka: प्रियकाननसञ्चारा वनोन्मत्ता च मैथिली।सा वनं वा प्रविष्टा स्यान्नलिनीं वा सुपुष्पिताम्।।3.61.15।।
61_11.translation: Sita is madly in love with the forest. She might have entered deep into the jungle or into a fully blossomed lotuspond.
61_11.word_by_word: प्रियकाननसञ्चारा one who is fond of wandering in the forest, वनोन्मत्ताच mad after forest , सा मैथिली that Maithili, वनं वा or in the forest, सुपुष्पिताम् flowering, नलिनीं वा or lotuspond, प्रविष्टा has entered, स्यात् perhaps.

61_12.shloka: सरितं वापि सम्प्राप्ता मीनवञ्जुलसेविताम्।स्नातुकामा निलीना स्याद्धासकामा वने क्वचित्।।3.61.16।।
61_12.translation: Maybe she has gone to take a dip in the river full of reeds and fishes  Or has hidden somewhere for the sake of fun.
61_12.word_by_word: स्नातुकामा ta take a dip, मीनवञ्जुलसेविताम् full of reeds and fishes, सरितं वापि or rivers, सम्प्राप्ता has reached, हासकामा to make fun, क्वचित् some where, निलीना वा might have hidden, स्यात् it may be so.

61_13.shloka: वित्रासयितुकामा वा लीना स्यात्कानने क्वचित्।जिज्ञासमाना वैदेही त्वां मां च पुरुषर्षभ।।3.61.17।।तस्याह्यन्वेषणे श्रीमन् क्षिप्रमेव यतावहे।
61_13.translation: O best of men, maybe Vaidehi has hidden in the forest intending to scare you and me. She wishes to test our love. O blessed Rama let us ransack the forest immediately.
61_13.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ O bull among men, वैदेही Vaidehi, त्वां च at you, मां च at me, वित्रासयितुकामा वा intending to scare us, जिज्ञासमाना  desire to know, कानने in the forest, क्वचित् somewhere, लीना hidden, स्यात् may be, श्रीमन् O blessed , तस्याः her, अन्वेषणे in search, क्षिप्रमेव immediately, यतावहे both of us will strive.

61_14.shloka: वनं सर्वं विचिनुवो यत्र सा जनकात्मजा।।3.61.18।।मन्यसे यदि काकुत्स्थ मा स्म शोके मनः कृथाः।
61_14.translation: O scion of the Kakutsthas, let us search all over the forest if you please. Do not indulge in sorrow.
61_14.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ Rama, मन्यसे यदि if you think , सा she, जनकात्मजा Sita, यत्र wherever, सर्वम् all, वनम् forest, विचिनुव: we both will search, शोके in grief, मनः mind, मा स्म कृथाः do not indulge.

61_15.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सौहार्दाल्लक्ष्मणेन समाहितः।।3.61.19।।सह सौमित्रिणा रामो विचेतुमुपचक्रमे।
61_15.translation: When Lakshmana consoled him so affectionately Rama became composed. He continued the search with Lakshmana, son of Sumitra.
61_15.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, सौहार्दात् very affectionately, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been told, रामः Rama, समाहितः became composed, सौमित्रिणा सह along with Lakshmana the son of Sumitra, विचेतुम् to search, उपचक्रमे he started.

61_16.shloka: तौ वनानि गिरींश्चैव सरितश्च सरांसि च।।3.61.20।।निखिलेन विचिन्वानौ सीतां दशरथात्मजौ।
61_16.translation: The two sons of Dasaratha went on searching for Sita in forests, mountains, rivers, ponds everywhere.
61_16.word_by_word: तौ दशरथात्मजौ those two sons of Dasaratha, वनानि forests, गिरीन् चैव and the mountains, सरितश्च and the rivers, सरांसि च and the ponds, निखिलेन entirly, सीताम् for Sita, विचिन्वानौ while they searched.

61_17.shloka: तस्य शैलस्य सानूनि गुहाश्च शिखराणि च।।3.61.21।।निखिलेन विचिन्वानौ नैव तामभिजग्मतुः।
61_17.translation: They were not able to find Sita even though they searched all over the mountain slopes, caves and peaks.
61_17.word_by_word: तस्य शैलस्य that mountain's, सानूनि slopes, गुहाश्च caves also, शिखराणि च mountain peaks too, निखिलेन entirely, विचिन्वानौ searched, ताम् her, नैव अभिजग्मतुः were not able to find.

61_18.shloka: विचित्य सर्वतश्शैलं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवित्।।3.61.22।।नेह पश्यामि सौमित्रे वैदेहीं पर्वते शुभाम्।
61_18.translation: After searching her all over, Rama said  Saumitri, I am unable to find the noble Vaidehi on the mountain
61_18.word_by_word: रामः Rama, सर्वतः everywhere, शैलम् mountain, विचित्य after searching, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said, सौमित्रे O son of Sumitra, इह here, पर्वते on mountains, शुभाम् noble lady, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न पश्यामि not seen.

61_19.shloka: ततो दुःखाभिसन्तप्तो लक्ष्मणो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.61.23।।विचरन्दण्डकारण्यं भ्रातरं दीप्ततेजसम्।
61_19.translation: Going about the Dandaka forest Lakshmana, consumed by sorrow, said  to his brother, glowing with brilliance:
61_19.word_by_word: ततः then, दुःखाभिसन्तप्तः  consumed by sorrow, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, दण्डकारण्यम् Dandaka forest, विचरन् while going about, दीप्ततेजसम् glowing with brilliance, भ्रातरम् brother, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

61_20.shloka: प्राप्स्यसि त्वं महाप्राज्ञ मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।।3.61.24।।यथा विष्णुर्महाबाहुर्बलिं बद्ध्वा महीमिमाम्।
61_20.translation: O longarmed brother O wise sire  just as Visnu obtained the earth by binding Bali you will obtain Sita certainly.
61_20.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ O wise sire, त्वम् you, जनकात्मजाम् daughter of Janaka, मैथिलीम् princess fromMithila, महाबाहुः one with long arms, विष्णुः Visnu, बलिम् Bali, बद्ध्वा after binding, इमाम् this, महीं यथा earned this earth, प्राप्स्यसि you will attain.

61_21.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु सौहार्दाल्लक्ष्मणेन स राघवः।।3.61.25।।उवाच दीनया वाचा दुःखाभिहतचेतनः।
61_21.translation: Having been addressed thus by Lakshmana, Raghava with a griefstriken heart said these piteous words :'Lakshmana,having  spoken like that very affectionately to Rama,who was disturbed by excessive grief said these words piteously:
61_21.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, सौहार्दात् affectionately, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been said, सः राघवः that Rama, दुःखाभिहतचेतनः  with griefstriken heart, दीनया piteously, वाचा by words, उवाच said.

61_22.shloka: वनं सर्वं सुविचितं पद्मिन्यः फुल्लपङ्कजाः।।3.61.26।।गिरिश्चायं महाप्राज्ञ बहुकन्दरनिर्झरः।न हि पश्यामि वैदेहीं प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसीम्।।3.61.27।।
61_22.translation: O wise Lakshmana I have searched the entire forest, the ponds with fully blossomed lotuses, the mountains with many caves and streams. But could not see Vaidehi who is dearer to me than my life.
61_22.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ wise sire, सर्वम् all over, वनम् the forest, सुविचितम् searched thoroughly, फ़ुल्लपङ्कजाः fully blossomed lotuses, पद्मिन्यः lotusponds, बहुकन्दर निर्झरः having many caves and streams, अयम् I, गिरिश्च mountains also, प्राणेभ्योऽपि more than my life, गरीयसीम् more important, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न हि पश्यामि do not see.

61_23.translation: Thus tormented by the abduction of Sita, Rama felt dejected and cried.Overpowered by grief he lost his consciousness for a moment.
61_23.word_by_word: सीताहरणकर्शितः tormented by Sita's abduction, सः रामः  Rama, एवम् thus, विलपन् cried, दीनः was dejected, शोकसमाविष्टः overpowered by grief, मुहूर्तम् for a moment, विह्वलः consciousess lost, अभवत् became.

61_24.translation: By grief tormented, limbs enervated, intellect atrophied, senses switched off, he felt anxious and depressed and sighed long and hot.
61_24.word_by_word: सन्तप्तः tormented, अवसन्नाङ्गः with limbs enervated, गतबुद्धि: intellect atrophied, विचेतनः lost senses, आतुरः anxious, दीनः dejected, अशीतम् hot, आयतम् long, निश्श्वस्य sighing, निषसाद reclined.

61_25.shloka: बहुलं स तु निश्श्वस्य रामो राजीवलोचनः।हा प्रियेति विचुक्रोश बहुशो बाष्पगद्गदः।।3.61.30।।
61_25.translation: Rama, his throat choked, shed propuse tears, sighing, O my darling.
61_25.word_by_word: राजीवलोचनः lotuseyed, सः रामः that Rama, बहुलम् long, निश्श्वस्य sighing, बाष्पगद्गदः throat choked with sobbing, हा प्रियेति saying 'Alas, my darling', बहुशः many times, विचुक्रोश cried lotuseyed.

61_26.shloka: तं ततस्सान्त्वयामास लक्ष्मणः प्रियबान्धवः।बहुप्रकारं धर्मज्ञः प्रश्रितं प्रश्रिताञ्जलिः।।3.61.31।।
61_26.translation: Then Lakshmana, the knower of dharma and a dear friend offered obeisance most humbly with folded palms and consoled Rama in many ways.
61_26.word_by_word: ततः then, प्रियबान्धवः  dear friend, धर्मज्ञः knower of dharma, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, प्रश्रिताञ्जलिः with folded palms, प्रश्रितम् humbly, बहुप्रकारम् many ways, तम् him, सान्त्वयामास consoled.

61_27.shloka: अनादृत्य तु तद्वाक्यं लक्ष्मणोष्ठपुटाच्च्युतम्।अपश्यंस्तां प्रियां सीतां प्राक्रोशत्स पुनः पुनः।।3.61.32।।
61_27.translation: Without caring  for the words from the lips of Lakshmana, Rama sobbed loudly, unable to see his beloved Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
61_27.word_by_word: सः he, तु on his part, लक्ष्मणोष्ठपुटात् from the lips of Lakshmana, च्युतम् uttered, तत् that, वाक्यम् words, अनादृत्य not caring, प्रियाम् beloved, तां सीताम् that Sita, अपश्यन् not able to see, पुनः पुनः again and again, प्राक्रोशत् cried loudly.

62_1.translation: The righteous, the longarmed,lotuseyed Rama, unable to see Sita wept with his senses overwhilmed by grief.
62_1.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous Rama, महाबाहुः longarmed, कमललोचनः lotuseyed, रामः Rama, सीताम् Sita, अपश्यन् not able to see, शोकोपहतचेतनः senses overwhelmed by grief, विललाप wept.

62_2.shloka: पश्यन्निव च तां सीतामपश्यन्मदनार्दितः।उवाच राघवो वाक्यं विलापाश्रयदुर्वचम्।।3.62.2।।
62_2.translation: Under the spell of Cupid, Rama uttered such words in grief which are otherwise unutterable. As if he was seeing Sita (before him) which was not a fact.
62_2.word_by_word: मदनार्दितः under the spell of Cupid, राघवः Rama, ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, अपश्यन् while not seeing, पश्यन्निव as if he was seeing, विलापाश्रयदुर्वचम्  words which cannot be uttered  in grief, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

62_3.shloka: त्वमशोकस्य शाखाभिः पुष्पप्रियतया प्रिये।आवृणोषि शरीरं ते मम शोकविवर्धिनी।।3.62.3।।
62_3.translation: O my beloved  as you love flowers you are hiding your body behind the branches ofthe Ashoke tree that enhances my sorrow (paradoxically).
62_3.word_by_word: प्रिये O my beloved, त्वम् you, पुष्पप्रियतया due to your love for flowers, मम my, शोकविवर्धिनी augmenting sorrow, अशोकस्य Ashoka's, शाखाभिः by branches, ते your, शरीरम् body, आवृणोषि  you are covering.

62_4.shloka: कदलीस्कन्धसदृशौ कदल्या संवृतावुभौ।ऊरू पश्यामि ते देवि नासि शक्ता निगूहितुम्।।3.62.4।।
62_4.translation: O Devi I can see both your thighs which resemble banana trunk hidden behind a banana plant. It is not possible for you to hide them from me.
62_4.word_by_word: देवि O Devi, कदलीस्कन्धसदृशौ appearing like banana trunk, कदल्या with banana plant, संवृतौ are covered, ते ऊरू both your thighs, पश्यामि I see, निगूहितुम् to hide, शक्ता possible, नासि not.

62_5.shloka: कर्णिकारवनं भद्रे हसन्ती देवि सेवसे।अलं ते परिहासेन मम बाधावहेन वै।।3.62.5।।
62_5.translation: O gentle one  you are wandering in the karnikara garden, laughing and making fun. Enough of this , that causes my pain.
62_5.word_by_word: देवि O lady, भद्रे O gentle one, हसन्ती  laughing, कर्णिकारवनम्  Karnikara garden, सेवसे wandering, मम myself, बाधावहेन causing pain, ते परिहासेन by your fun, अलम् enough of it.

62_6.shloka: परिहासेन किं सीते परिश्रान्तस्य मे प्रिये।अयं स परिहासोऽपि साधु देवि न रोचते।।3.62.6।।
62_6.translation: O my dear Sita, why are you joking when I am exhausted? Such fun cannot be relished  now.
62_6.word_by_word: प्रिये O beloved, सीते Sita, परिश्रान्तस्य when I am exhausted, मे my, परिहासेन by joking, किम् why, अयम् this, सः that, परिहासोऽपि fun also, साधु well, न रोचते not liked.
