62_7.shloka: विशेषेणाश्रमस्थाने हासोऽयं न प्रशस्यते।अवगच्छामि ते शीलं परिहासप्रियं प्रिये।।3.62.7।।आगच्छ त्वं विशालाक्षि शून्योऽयमुटजस्तव।
62_7.translation: O darling  joking specially in a hermitage  is not appreciated. I know your nature.You love fun. O largeeyed Sita, come here. This cottage of yours is empty.
62_7.word_by_word: विशेषेण especially, आश्रमस्थाने in a place like hermitage, अयम् this, हासः jest, न प्रशस्यते not appreciated, प्रिये O dear, ते you, परिहासप्रियम् lover of fun, शीलम् nature, अवगच्छामि I am aware, विशालाक्षि largeeyed lady, त्वम् you, आगच्छ come here, तव yours, अयम् this, उटजः cottage, शून्यः empty.

62_8.shloka: सुव्यक्तं राक्षसैस्सीता भक्षिता वा हृतापि वा।।3.62.8।।न हि सा विलपन्तं मामुपसम्प्रैति लक्ष्मण।
62_8.translation: O Lakshmana surely Sita is either devoured by demons or abducted. When I am weeping like this she is not coming to me.
62_8.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सीता Sita, सुव्यक्तम् surely, राक्षसैः by demons, भक्षिता वा devoured or, हृतापि वा or abducted, सा that, विलपन्तम् while I cry like this, माम् me, न उपसम्प्रैति हि not coming to me.

62_9.shloka: एतानि मृगयूथानि साश्रुनेत्राणि लक्ष्मण।।3.62.9।।शंसन्तीव हि वैदेहीं भक्षितां रजनीचरैः।
62_9.translation: O Lakshmana, these herds of deer with their eyes filled with tears are as if telling me that she is eaten away by the demons.
62_9.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, साश्रुनेत्राणि eyes filled with tears, एतानि these, मृगयूथानि herds of deer, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, रजनीचरैः night walkers, भक्षिताम् eaten away, शंसन्ति इव as if they are telling me.

62_10.shloka: हा ममार्ये क्व यातासि हा साध्वि वरवर्णिनि।।3.62.10।।हा सकामा त्वया देवी कैकेयी सा भविष्यति।
62_10.translation: Alas, my noble lady, where have you gone? O chaste lady of excellent complexion, that queen Kaikeyi's desire will be fulfilled now.
62_10.word_by_word: हा Alas, मम my, आर्ये noble lady, क्व where, याता असि have you gone?, हा साध्वि Ha chaste lady, वरवर्णिनि a woman of excellent complexion, हा Ha, त्वया by you, देवी the queen, सा that, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, अद्य now, सकामा desire fulfilled, भविष्यति will become.

62_11.shloka: सीतया सह निर्यातो विना सीतामुपागतः।।3.62.11।।कथं नाम प्रवेक्ष्यामि शून्यमन्तःपुरं पुनः।
62_11.translation: I left home with Sita. How can I reenter the inner apartment without her ?
62_11.word_by_word: सीतया सह along with Sita, निर्यातः came out, विना सीताम् without Sita, उपागतः coming back, शून्यम् empty, अन्तःपुरम्  linner apartment (of queens), पुनः again, कथं नाम how can I, प्रवेक्ष्यामि enter?

62_12.shloka: निर्वीर्य इति लोको मां निर्दयश्चेति वक्ष्यति।।3.62.12।।कातरत्वं प्रकाशं हि सीतापनयनेन मे।
62_12.translation: By Sita's abduction it will be  clear to the world that I lack manliness and compassion. My cowardly nature will clearly manifest.
62_12.word_by_word: लोकः the world, माम् me, निर्वीर्यः without valour, इति so also, निर्दयश्चेति a man who lack compassion, वक्ष्यति will say, सीतापनयनेन by Sita's abduction, मे my, कातरत्वम् timid nature, प्रकाशं हि will manifest.

62_13.shloka: निवृत्तवनवासश्च जनकं मिथिलाधिपम्।।3.62.13।।कुशलं परिपृच्छन्तं कथं शक्ष्ये निरीक्षितुम्।
62_13.translation: After completing the period of my exile when Janaka , king of Mithila, enquires of her welfare how can I face him?
62_13.word_by_word: निवृत्तवनवासश्च after completing the period of exile, कुशलम् welfare, परिपृच्छन्तम् as he enquires, मिथिलाधिपम् to lord of Mithila, जनकम् Janaka, निरीक्षितुम् to face, कथम् how do I, शक्ष्ये will be able.

62_14.shloka: विदेहराजो नूनं मां दृष्ट्वा विरहितं तया।।3.62.14।।सुतास्नेहेन सन्तप्तो मोहस्य वशमेष्यति।
62_14.translation: If the king of Videha sees me without her, he will surely be distressed and will fall into a swoon for the love of his daughter.
62_14.word_by_word: विदेहराजः king of Videha, तया विरहितम् without her, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सुतास्नेहेन out of love for his daughter, सन्तप्तः distressed, मोहस्य delusion's, वशम् grip, एष्यति he will be, नूनम् surely.

62_15.shloka: अथवा न गमिष्यामि पुरीं भरतपालिताम्।।3.62.15।।स्वर्गोऽपि सीतया हीनश्शून्य एव मतो मम।
62_15.translation: Or else, I will not go to the city ruled by Bharata. Without Sita even heaven will be empty for me.
62_15.word_by_word: अथवा or else, भरतपालिताम् ruled by Bharata, पुरीम् city, न गमिष्यामि not go, सीतया by Sita,मम for me, हीनः empty, स्वर्गोऽपि even heaven, शून्य empty, एव too, मतः to me.

62_16.shloka: मामिहोत्सृज्य हि वने गच्छायोध्यां पुरीं शुभाम्।।3.62.16।।न त्वहं तां विना सीतां जीवेयं हि कथञ्चन।
62_16.translation: Go to the auspicious city of Ayodhya, leaving me here in the woods. I can never live without Sita.
62_16.word_by_word: माम् to me, इह here, वने in the woods, उत्सृज्य deserting, शुभाम् auspicious, अयोध्यां पुरीम् to the city of Ayodhya, गच्छ you may go, अहं तु I also , तां सीतां विना without Sita, कथञ्चनindeed, न जीवेयं हि will not live.

62_17.shloka: गाढमाश्लिष्य भरतो वाच्यो मद्वचनात्त्वया।।3.62.17।।अनुज्ञातोऽसि रामेण पालयेति वसुन्धराम्।
62_17.translation: While embracing Bharata tightly, repeat my words, 'You are permitted by Rama to rule the earth.'
62_17.word_by_word: भरतः Bharata, गाढम् tightly, आश्लिष्य embracing, मद्वचनात् by my words, त्वया by you, वाच्यः  should be told, वसुन्धराम् earth, पालयेति may rule, रामेण by Rama's, अनुज्ञातः ordered, असि you are.

62_18.shloka: अम्बा च मम कैकेयी सुमित्रा च त्वया विभो।।3.62.18।।कौसल्या च यथान्यायमभिवाद्या ममाऽज्ञया।रक्षणीया प्रयत्नेन भवता सूक्तकारिणा।।3.62.19।।
62_18.translation: My mother Kaikeyi, Sumitra and Kausalya  should also be offered due obeisance. You should protect them with great effort, carrying out my instructions.
62_18.word_by_word: विभो O Lord, मम my, अम्बा mother, कैकेयी Kaikeyi, सुमित्रा च and Sumitra, कौसल्या च Kausalya also, त्वया by you, मम my, आज्ञया by orders, यथान्यायम् duly, अभिवाद्याः offer obeisance, (सु)उक्तकारिणा who does as instructed, भवता by you, प्रयत्नेन by effort, रक्षणीया: should be protected.

62_19.shloka: सीतायाश्च विनाशोऽयं मम चामित्रकर्शन।विस्तरेण जनन्या मे विनिवेद्यस्त्वया भवेत्।।3.62.20।।
62_19.translation: O Lakshmana, subduer of the enemy this loss of Sita and me should be explained in detail to my mother.
62_19.word_by_word: अमित्रकर्शन  subduer of enemy, सीतायाश्च Sita's, मम च and of me, अयम् this, विनाशः loss,त्वया by you, मे my, जनन्याः mother, विस्तरेण in detail, विनिवेद्यः make her know, भवेत् you will.

62_20.shloka: इति विलपति राघवे सुदीने वनमुपगम्य तया विना सुकेश्या।भयविकलमुखस्तु लक्ष्मणोऽपि व्यथितमना भृशमातुरो बभूव।।3.62.21।।
62_20.translation: When Rama, devoid of  Sita, the lady with beautiful hair, wailed piteously after reaching the forest, Lakshmana too, his face pale out of fear and mind dejected, felt extremely agitated.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
62_20.word_by_word: सुदीने very piteous, राघवे when Rama, वनम् woods, उपगम्य after reaching, सुकेश्या by that lady of beautiful hair, तया विना without her, इति thus, विलपति was wailing, लक्ष्मणोऽपि and Lakshmana too, भयविकलमुखः face perturbed by fear, व्यथितमनाः distressed mentally, भृशम् exceedingly, आतुरः agitated, बभूव became.

63_1.shloka: [Rama recalls the events starting from exile--  describes Sita's beauty, virtues and gentleness--drifts back to sorrow--Lakshmana tells Rama to think of a way of finding Sita.]स राजपुत्रः प्रियया विहीनः शोकेन मोहेन च पीड्यमानः।विषादयन्भ्रातरमार्तरूपो भूयो विषादं प्रविवेश तीव्रम्।।3.63.1।।
63_1.translation: Prince Rama, separated from his beloved, lost his senses out of sorrow. Seeing his brother in a distressed state, he sank again into intense grief.
63_1.word_by_word: प्रियया by the beloved, विहीनः separated, सः राजपुत्रः prince,Rama, शोकेन  out of  sorrow, मोहेन च delusion, पीड्यमानः being afflicted, आर्तरूपः in distressed state, भ्रातरम् brother, विषादयन्  worrying , भूयः again, तीव्रम् intense, विषादम् grief, प्रविवेश sunk.

63_2.shloka: स लक्ष्मणं शोकवशाभिपन्नं शोके निमग्नो विपुले तु रामः।उवाच वाक्यं व्यसनानुरूपमुष्णं विनिश्श्वस्य रुदंत्सशोकम्।।3.63.2।।
63_2.translation: Plunged in deep grief, Rama heaved hot sighs and said these words to griefstricken Lakshmanaweeping:
63_2.word_by_word: विपुले शोके in intense grief, निमग्नः plunged, सः that, रामः Rama, सशोकम् with sorrow, रुदन् crying, शोकवशाभिपन्नम्  who was caught in sorrow, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उष्णम् hot, विनिश्वस्य  sighing, व्यसनानुरूपम् in his grief, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच said.

63_3.shloka: न मद्विधो दुष्कृतकर्मकारी मन्ये द्वितीयोऽस्ति वसुन्धरायाम्।शोकेन शोको हि परम्पराया मा मेति भिन्दन्हृदयं मनश्च।।3.63.3।।
63_3.translation: I think there is none on earth like me who has performed such forbidden acts.  One grief after the other is successively piercing my heart and my mind.
63_3.word_by_word: वसुन्धरायाम् on earth, मद्विधः like me, दुष्कृतकर्मकारी who undertakes forbidden acts,  द्वितीयः second person, नास्ति not, मन्ये I think, शोकेन grief, शोकः grief, परम्परायाः continuously,हृदयम् heart, मनश्च mind also, भिन्दन् shattered, माम् my, एति हि is befalling.

63_4.shloka: पूर्वं मया नूनमभीप्सितानि पापानि कर्माण्यसकृत्कृतानि।तत्रायमद्यापतितो विपाको दुःखेन दुःखं यदहं विशामि।।3.63.4।।
63_4.translation: In the past I had certainly done some sinful deeds I often liked the consequences of which have descended on me now as I am experiencing one sorrow after another.
63_4.word_by_word: मया by me, पूर्वम् in the past, नूनम् certainly, अभीप्सितानि  dear to me, पापानि कर्माणि sinful deeds, असकृत् often, कृतानि done, तत्र there, अद्य now, विपाकः consequence of that, आपतितः has descended, यत् since, अहम् I, दुःखेन by sorrow, दुःखम् sorrow, विशामि I am entering.

63_5.shloka: राज्यप्रणाशस्स्वजनैर्वियोगः पितुर्विनाशो जननीवियोगः।सर्वाणि मे लक्ष्मण शोकवेगमापूरयन्ति प्रविचिन्तितानि।।3.63.5।।
63_5.translation: O Lakshmana, loss of kingdom, separation from kith and kin, death of father, separation from mother--all these thoughts augment my sorrow faster and in greater measure.
63_5.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राज्यप्रणाशः loss of kingdom, स्वजनैः kith and kin, वियोगः separation from, पितुः father, विनाशः death, जननीवियोगः separation from mother, सर्वाणि all, प्रविचिन्तितानि thinking over, मे I, शोकवेगम् fast increase sorrow, आपूरयन्ति greater measure.

63_6.shloka: सर्वं तु दुःखं मम लक्ष्मणेदं शान्तं शरीरे वनमेत्य शून्यम्।सीतावियोगात्पुनरप्युदीर्णं काष्ठैरिवाग्निस्सहसा प्रदीप्तः।।3.63.6।।
63_6.translation: O Lakshmana, all this sorrow calmed down when I came to this solitary forest. But with Sita's separation, it was rekindled just as fire blazes forth again with logs of wood.
63_6.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, इदम् this, सर्वम् all, दुःखम् sorrow, शून्यम् solitary, वनम् woods, एत्य on coming, शरीरे in the body, शान्तम्  calmness, सीतावियोगात् with the separation from Sita,काष्ठैः  logs of wood, सहसा along with, प्रदीप्तः blazing flame, अग्निः fire, पुनरपि again rises, उदीर्णम् came up.

63_7.shloka: सा नूनमार्या मम राक्षसेन बलाद्दृता खं समुपेत्य भीरुः।अपस्वरं सस्वरविप्रलापा भयेन विक्रन्दितवत्यभीक्ष्णम्।।3.63.7।।
63_7.translation: The timid princess of mine forcibly carried away into the sky by a demon must have again and again cried aloud out of fear in a broken voice.
63_7.word_by_word: मम my, भीरुः timid, सा आर्या that princess, राक्षसेन by the demon, बलात् forcibly, हृता is carried away, खम् into the sky, समुपेत्य  taken, सस्वरविप्रलापा cried aloud, भयेन in fear, अभीक्ष्णम् repeatedly, अपस्वरम् in a broken voice, आक्रन्दितवती wept bitterly, नूनम् surely.

63_8.shloka: तौ लोहितस्य प्रियदर्शनस्य सदोचितावुत्तमचन्दनस्य।वृत्तौ स्तनौ शोणितपङ्कदिग्धौ नूनं प्रियाया मम नाभिभातः।।3.63.8।।
63_8.translation: Her captivating copper coloured skin, smeared with the best of red sandal paste would not be surely pleasing now, drenched in blood and mud.
63_8.word_by_word: लोहितस्य of copper complexion, प्रियदर्शनस्य lovely to look at, उत्तमचन्दनस्य with the best of sandal paste, सदा always, उचितौ used, वृत्तौ two circular ones, मम प्रियायाः my beloved, तौ स्तनौ her breasts, नूनम् surely, शोणितपङ्कदिग्धौ drenched in blood and mud, नाभिभातः will not be pleasing.

63_9.shloka: तच्छलक्ष्णसुव्यक्तमृदुप्रलापं तस्या मुखं कुञ्चितकेशभारम्।रक्षोवशं नूनमुपागताया न भ्राजते राहुमुखे यथेन्दुः।।3.63.9।।
63_9.translation: Her face with her clear, sweet and gentle words and her curly hair falling will no more look bright coming under the grip of demons like the moon eclipsed by Rahu.
63_9.word_by_word: रक्षोवशम् demons' hold, उपागतायाः coming under, तस्याः her, श्लक्ष्णसुव्यक्त very clear words,मृदुप्रलापम् sweet and gentle, कुञ्चितकेशभारम् beautiful curly hair, तत् मुखम् her face, राहुमुखे Rahu's mouth, इन्दुः Moon, यथा like that, न भ्राजते not shine, नूनम् certainly.

63_10.shloka: तां हारपाशस्य सदोचिताया ग्रीवां प्रियाया मम सुव्रतायाः।रक्षांसि नूनं परिपीतवन्ति विभिद्य शून्ये रुधिराशनानि।।3.63.10।।
63_10.translation: The bloodthirsty demons must have drunk the blood of my faithful beloved in a lonely place breaking her neck that used to wear beautiful necklaces.
63_10.word_by_word: सदा always, हारपाशस्य necklace, उचितायाः accustomed to, सुव्रतायाः of a lady of exemplary conduct, मम प्रियायाः of my beloved, तां ग्रीवाम् that neck, रुधिराशनानि blood thirsty beings, रक्षांसि by demons, शून्ये in desolate , विभिद्य breaking, नूनम् surely, परिपीतवन्ति drunk.

63_11.shloka: मया विहीना विजने वने या रक्षोभिराहृत्य विकृष्यमाणा।नूनं निनादं कुररीव दीना सा मुक्तवत्यायतकान्तनेत्रा।।3.63.11।।
63_11.translation: The lovely, largeeyed lady separated from me in the desolate forest, abducted and dragged by demons must have cried at that time desperately like a female osprey.
63_11.word_by_word: या that, विजने वने in the desolate forest, मया by me, विहीना separated, सा that, आयतकान्तनेत्रा beautiful largeeyed lady, रक्षोभिः by the demons, आहृत्य after abducting, विकृष्यमाणा dragging, दीना  helpless, कुररीव like a female osprey, नूनम् surely, निनादम् sound, मुक्तवती would have released.

63_12.shloka: अस्मिन्मयासार्धमुदारशीला शिलातले पूर्वमुपोपविष्टा।कान्तस्मिता लक्ष्मण जातहासा त्वामाह सीता बहुवाक्यजातम्।।3.63.12।।
63_12.translation: On this rock, O Lakshmana, my goodnatured lady with her lovely smile sat with me in the past and chatted with you.
63_12.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, उदारशीला good natured, कान्तस्मिता lovely smile, सीता Sita, अस्मिन् on this, शिलातले on this rock, मयासार्धम् along with me, पूर्वम् earlier, उपोपविष्टा sitting here,जातहासा laughing away, त्वाम् seeing you, बहुवाक्यजातम् many words, आह spoke.

63_13.shloka: गोदावरीयं सरितां वरिष्ठा प्रिया प्रियाया मम नित्यकालम्।अप्यत्र गच्छेदिति चिन्तयामि नैकाकिनी याति हि सा कदाचित्।।3.63.13।।
63_13.translation: Would she have gone to Godavari, the foremost of the rivers so dear at all times to my beloved ? But I think she has not gone there alone at any time.
63_13.word_by_word: सरिताम् among rivers, वरिष्ठा foremost, इयं गोदावरी this Godavari, मम प्रियायाः of my beloved, नित्यकालम् at all times, प्रिया  dear, अत्र there, गच्छेदपि has she gone, इति thus, चिन्तयामि I think, सा that, एकाकिनी alone, कदाचित् any time, न याति हि will not go there.

63_14.shloka: पद्मानना पद्मविशालनेत्रा पद्मानि वानेतुमभिप्रयाता।तदप्ययुक्तं न हि सा कदाचिन्मया विना गच्छति पङ्कजानि।।3.63.14।।
63_14.translation: The lady whose face was like the lotus, whose large eyes were like lotus petals could  have gone to fetch lotuses (but) that also is not possible as she has never gone there without me.
63_14.word_by_word: पद्मानना a lady with a lotuslike face, पद्मविशालनेत्रा  lotus petal eyed, पद्मानि वा आनेतुम् or to fetch lotuses, अभिप्रयाता वा she would have gone, तदपि that also, अयुक्तम् not possible, सा she, कदाचित् at any time, मया विना without me, पङ्कजानि lotuses, न गच्छति हि will not go there.

63_15.shloka: कामं त्विदं पुष्पितवृक्षषण्डं नानाविधैः पक्षिगणैरुपेतम्।वनं प्रयाता नु तदप्ययुक्त मेकाकिनी सातिबिभेति भीरुः।।3.63.15।।
63_15.translation: Could she have gone to the forest where there are many kinds of trees in full bloom inhabited by a variety of birds? That is also not possible as she is timid and too scared to go there alone.
63_15.word_by_word: कामम् surely, पुष्पितवृक्षषण्डम् this thicket of trees in bloom, नानाविधैः by many kinds, पक्षिगणैः flocks of birds, उपेतम् inhabited, इदम् this, वनम् forest, प्रयाता नु could she have gone?,तदपि that too, अयुक्तम् not possible, भीरुः she is timid, सा that Sita, एकाकिनी alone, अतिबिभेति is scared a lot.

63_16.shloka: आदित्य भो लोककृताकृतज्ञ लोकस्य सत्यानृतकर्मसाक्षिन्।मम प्रिया सा क्व गता हृता वा शंसस्व मे शोकवशस्य नित्यम्।।3.63.16।।
63_16.translation: O Sungod, you know all the happenings of the world. You are witness to all the deeds of the people, true and false. Tell me where my beloved Sita has gone or has been carried off. My grief never ceases.
63_16.word_by_word: लोककृताकृतज्ञ knower of what is going on and not going on, लोकस्य in the world, सत्यानृतकर्मसाक्षिन् a witness to all true and false deeds of the people, आदित्यः Sun, मम my, प्रिया dear, सा Sita, क्व where, गता gone, हृता वा or taken away, नित्यम् always, शोकवशस्य  a griefstricken, मे to me, शंसस्व tell.

63_17.shloka: लोकेषु सर्वेषु च नास्ति किञ्चिद्यत्ते न नित्यं विदितं भवेत्तत्।शंसस्व वायो कुलशालिनीं तां हृता मृता वा पथि वर्तते वा।।3.63.17।।
63_17.translation: O Windgod, there is nothing that you know not in all the worlds. Do tell me if  that lady of a noble race has been abducted or dead or is on the way.
63_17.word_by_word: वायो O wind, सर्वेषु all over, लोकेषु in all worlds, यत् since, नित्यम् always, ते to you, विदितम् known, न भवेत् not be, तत् that, किञ्चित् a little, नास्ति is not, कुलशालिनीम् woman of the high birth, ताम् her, शंसस्व you may tell me, हृता taken away, मृता वा or dead, पथि on the way, वर्तते वा or where she is moving.

63_18.shloka: इतीव तं शोकविधेयदेहं रामं विसंज्ञं विलपन्तमेवम्।उवाच सौमित्रिरदीनसत्त्वो न्याये स्थितः कालयुतं च वाक्यम्।।3.63.18।।
63_18.translation: While Rama was thus in tears, in a state of sorrow and swoon, Lakshmana who was rational and courageous spoke to him words appropriate to the time :
63_18.word_by_word: इतीव like this, शोकविधेयदेहम् one whose body was gripped by grief, विसंज्ञम्  in a state of swoon, एवम् in that way, विलपन्तम् weeping, तं रामम् that Rama, अदीनसत्त्वः a man of fortitude, न्याये स्थितः rational, सौमित्रिः Lakshmana, कालयुतम् appropriate to time, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.

63_19.shloka: शोकं विमुञ्चार्य धृतिं भजस्व सोत्साहता चास्तु विमार्गणेऽस्याः।उत्साहवन्तो हि नरा न लोके सीदन्ति कर्मस्वतिदुष्करेषु।।3.63.19।।
63_19.translation: O noble prince, give up grief. Take courage. Show enthusiasm to search and find Sita. Enthusiastic people will not get despondent in carrying out the  most difficult tasks.
63_19.word_by_word: आर्याः O noble one, शोकम् grief, विमुञ्च give up, धृतिम् take courage, भजस्व you may adopt, अस्याः of Sita,  विमार्गणे in searching, सोत्साहता enthusiasm, अस्तु  be cultivated, लोके in the world, उत्साहवन्तः enthusiastic people, नराः men, अतिदुष्करेषु in most difficult, कर्मसु in tasks also, न सीदन्ति हि not get despondent.

63_20.shloka: इतीव सौमित्रिमुदग्रपौरुषं ब्रुवन्तमार्तो रघुवंशवर्धनः।न चिन्तयामास धृतिं विमुक्तवान्पुनश्च दुःखं महदभ्युपागमत्।।3.63.20।।
63_20.translation: Rama who carries on the (glorious) progeny of the Raghu dynasty, did not (however) consider seriously the words of Lakshmana, a man of great prowess. Forsaking his courage he was once again overtaken by deep sorrow.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
63_20.word_by_word: आर्तः dejected , रघुवंशवर्धनः one who carries on the progeny of Raghu dynasty, इतीव in this manner, ब्रुवन्तम् saying, उदग्रपौरुषम् man of great prowess, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, न चिन्तयामास not count, धृतिम् courage, विमुक्तवान् he gave up, पुनश्च again, महत् deep, दुःखम् sorrow, अभ्युपागमत् was overtaken.

64_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana continue their search for Sita -- find signs of ornaments and footprints of Sita,broken pieces of bow, shield and parasol -- Rama ventilates his anger towards all in the three worlds -- concludes that Sita has been hijacked by a demon.]स दीनो दीनया वाचा लक्ष्मणं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।शीघ्रं लक्ष्मण जानीहि गत्वा गोदावरीं नदीम्।।3.64.1।।अपि गोदावरीं सीता पद्मान्यानयितुं गता।
64_1.translation: Rama in dejection said these pitiable words to Lakshmana,O Lakashmana, go swiftly to the river Godavari and find out if Sita has gone there to get lotuses.
64_1.word_by_word: सः that Rama, दीनः piteous, दीनया pitiable, वाचा words, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, शीघ्रम् swiftly, गोदावरीं नदीम् Godavari river, गत्वा going, सीता Sita, पद्मानि lotuses, आनयितुम् to get, गोदावरीम् Godavari, अपि गता has  gone, जानीहि find out.

64_2.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।।3.64.2।।नदीं गोदावरीं रम्यां जगाम लघुविक्रमः।
64_2.translation: Lakshmana, destroyer of enemywarriors, went to the beautiful river Godavari with quick steps following the instruction of Rama.
64_2.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been told, परवीरहा destroyer of enemy warriors, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, लघुविक्रमः with quick steps, रम्याम् delightful, गोदावरीं नदीम् river Godavari, जगाम went.

64_3.shloka: तां लक्ष्मणस्तीर्थवती विचित्वा राममब्रवीत्।।3.64.3।।नैनां पश्यामि तीर्थेषु क्रोशतो न शृणोति मे।
64_3.translation: Searching for Sita at the landings of river Godavari, Lakshmana said to Rama, I am unable to find her at these landings.No one responds to my call.
64_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तीर्थवतीम् having landings, ताम् her, विचित्वा searching, रामम् to Rama, अब्रवीत् said, एनाम् her, तीर्थेषु at the landings, न पश्यामि do not see, मे when I, क्रोशतः called out, न शृणोति no one hears.

64_4.shloka: कं नु वा देशमापन्ना वैदेही क्लेशनाशिनी।।3.64.4।।न ह्यहं वेद तं देशं यत्र सा जनकात्मजा।
64_4.translation: Where could Vaidehi, destroyer of sorrow, go? I wonder. I am unable to trace the spot where the daughter of Janaka could be found.
64_4.word_by_word: क्लेशनाशिनी destroyer of sorrow, वैदेही Vaidehi, कं वा where else, देशम् place, आपन्ना नु had landed, सा that, जनकात्मजा daughter of Janaka, यत्र where, तं देशम् that place, अहम् I, न वेद हि do not know.

64_5.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा दीनस्सन्तापमोहितः।।3.64.5।।रामस्समभिचक्राम स्वयं गोदावरीं नदीम्।स तामुपस्थितो रामः क्व सीतेत्येवमब्रवीत्।।3.64.6।।
64_5.translation: Overwhelmed with grief on hearing Lakshmana's words, Rama himself went to river Godavari, and shouted, where are you, Sita?
64_5.word_by_word: रामः Rama, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, दीनः a dejected man, सन्तापमोहितः overwhelmed with grief, स्वयम् himself, गादावरीं नदीम् to river Godavari, समभिचक्राम went, सः रामः that Rama, ताम् the river, उपस्थितः approached, सीते Sita, क्व where, इत्येवम् in this manner, अब्रवीत् said.

64_6.shloka: भूतानि राक्षसेन्द्रेण वधार्हेण हृतामिति।न तां शशंसू रामाय तथा गोदावरी नदि।।3.64.7।।
64_6.translation: Like the elements of Nature, river Godavari did not disclose Rama that Sita had been abducted by the king of demons who deserved death.
64_6.word_by_word: वधार्हेण by one who deserved to be killed, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the lord of the demons, हृताम् kidnapped, ताम् her, इति like that, भूतानि beings, तथा similarly, गोदावरी नदी river Godavari, रामाय to Rama, न शशंसुः did not reply.

64_7.shloka: ततः प्रचोदिता भूतैश्शंसास्मैतां प्रियामिति।न तु साभ्यवदतसितां पृष्टा रामेण शोचता।।3.64.8।।
64_7.translation: River Godavari (although) prompted by creatures (of Nature) to tell him about his beloved did not respond to brooding Rama.
64_7.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, शोचता  brooding, रामेण by Rama, पृष्टा asked, सा that, प्रियाम् about his beloved, अस्मै to him, शंस you may tell, इति this, भूतैः beings, प्रचोदिता prompted, सीताम् Sita, नाभ्यवदत् no one has said.

64_8.shloka: रावणस्य तु तद्रूपं कर्माणि च दुरात्मनः।ध्यात्वा भयात्तु वैदेहीं सा नदी न शशंस ताम्।।3.64.9।।
64_8.translation: Remembering the evilminded Ravana's appearance and action, the river revealed nothing about Vaidehi out of fear.
64_8.word_by_word: सा नदी that river, दुरात्मनः of the evilminded, रावणस्य Ravana's, तत् that, रूपम् figure, कर्माणि च actions too, ध्यात्वा thinking over, भयात् out of fear, तां वैदेहीम् about Vaidehi, न शशंस did not speak.

64_9.shloka: निराशस्तु तया नद्या सीताया दर्शने कृतः।उवाच रामस्सौमित्रिं सीतादर्शनकर्शितः।।3.64.10।।
64_9.translation: Disappointed by the river and emaciated by not being able to see Sita, Rama said to Lakshmana :
64_9.word_by_word: सीतादर्शनकर्शितः emaciated on account of not finding Sita, रामः Rama, तया नद्या by that river not replying, सीतायाः of Sita, दर्शने see, निराशः disappointed, कृतः was made, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, उवाच said.

64_10.shloka: एषा गोदावरी सौम्य किंचिन्न प्रति भाषते।किं नु लक्ष्मण वक्ष्यामि समेत्य जनकं वचः।।3.64.11।।मातरं चैव वैदेह्या विना तामहमप्रियम्।
64_10.translation: O handsome Lakshmana this Godavari does not at all respond. How can I go to Janaka and my mother without Sita and break this unhappy news?
64_10.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome, एषा गोदावरी this Godavari, किञ्चित् even a little, न प्रतिभाषते is not answering, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, जानकीं Janaki, विना without, अहम् I am, जनकम् Janaka, समेत्य after meeting him, मातरं चैव to mother also, अप्रियम् unhappy, किं नु what can, वचनम् words, वक्ष्यामि tell.

64_11.shloka: या मे राज्यविहीनस्य वने वन्येन जीवतः।।3.64.12।।सर्वं व्यपनयेच्छोकं वैदेही क्व नु सा गता।
64_11.translation: Where could have gone that Vaidehi, who  removed all my sorrows and sufferings when I lost my kingdom and survived on food available in the forest?
64_11.word_by_word: राज्यविहीनस्य  who lost his kingdom, वने in the forest, वन्येन food available in the forest, जीवतः lived, मे me, सर्वम् all, शोकम् grief, या वैदेही that Vaidehi, व्यपनयेत्  remove sorrow, सा she, क्व where, गता नु has she gone?

64_12.shloka: ज्ञातिपक्षविहीनस्य राजपुत्रीमपश्यतः।।3.64.13।।मन्ये दीर्घा भविष्यन्ति रात्रयो मम जाग्रतः।
64_12.translation: Away from relatives and away from the princess, I keep awake during nights which seem too long.
64_12.word_by_word: ज्ञातिपक्षविहीनस्य away from relatives, राजपुत्रीम् princess, अपश्यतः not seeing, जाग्रतः keeping awake, मम for me, रात्रयः nights, दीर्घाः long, भविष्यन्ति appear, मन्ये I think.

64_13.shloka: गोदावरीं जनस्थानमिमं प्रस्रवणं गिरिम्।।3.64.14।।सर्वाण्यनुगमिष्यामि यदि सीता हि दृश्यते।
64_13.translation: I will roam about the river Godavari, Janasthana and this mount Prasravana till I find Sita.
64_13.word_by_word: गोदावरीम् Godavari, जनस्थानम् Janasthanam, इमम् this, प्रस्रवणं Prasravana, गिरिम् mountain, सर्वाणि all, अनुगमिष्यामि will follow up, सीता Sita, यदि हि दृश्यते if Sita can be found.

64_14.shloka: एते मृगा महावीर्य मामीक्षन्ते मुहुर्मुहुः।।3.64.15।।वक्तुकामा इव हि मे इङ्गितान्युपलक्षये।
64_14.translation: O mighty Lakshmana these deer are looking at me again and again indicating that they wish to tell me something.
64_14.word_by_word: महावीर्य O mighty one, एते these, मृगाः deer, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, माम् me,ईक्षन्ते looking, इङ्गितानि their signs, उपलक्षये indicating, मे to me, वक्तुकामा इव as if they wish to tell me.

64_15.shloka: तांस्तु दृष्ट्वा नरव्याघ्रो राघवः प्रत्युवाच ह।।3.64.16।।क्व सीतेति निरीक्षन्वै बाष्पसंरुद्धया दृशा।
64_15.translation: With his vision blurred by tears, Rama, the best among men, looked at them and asked them 'Where is Sita'?
64_15.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्रः tiger among men, राघवः Rama, तान् them, दृष्ट्वा seeing, बाष्पसंरुद्धया blurred by tears, दृशा with their sight, निरीक्षन् beholding, सीता Sita, क्व where, इति like this, प्रत्युवाच ह replied.

64_16.shloka: एवमुक्ता नरेन्द्रेण ते मृगास्सहसोत्थिताः।।3.64.17।।दक्षिणाभिमुखास्सर्वे दर्शयन्तो नभस्थलम्।मैथिली ह्रियमाणा सा दिशं यामन्वपद्यत।।3.64.18।।तेन मार्गेण धावन्तो निरीक्षन्ते नराधिपम्।
64_16.translation: Thus asked by the prince, all the deer got up suddenly, and pointed towards the southern sky, the direction in which the princess from Mithila was carried off. Looking at the Lord of men (Rama), they started running in that direction.
64_16.word_by_word: नरेन्द्रेण by the prince, एवम् in that way, उक्ताः said, मृगाः deer, सहसा suddenly, उत्थिताः got, सर्वे all, दक्षिणाभिमुखाः facing south, नभस्थलम् to the region of the sky, दर्शयन्तः pointing, ह्रियमाणा taken away, मैथिली Maithili, याम् such, दिशम् direction, अन्वपद्यत followed, तेन मार्गेण by that path, धावन्तः while running, नराधिपम् to the lord of men, निरीक्षन्ते were looking at.

64_17.shloka: येन मार्गं च भूमिं च निरीक्षन्ते स्म ते मृगाः।।3.64.19।।पुनश्च मार्गमिच्छन्ति लक्ष्मणेनोपलक्षिताः।
64_17.translation: Even Lakshmana marked that the deer were showing and looking at the path lying in that direction.
64_17.word_by_word: ते मृगाः those deer, येन by which, मार्गं च direction, भूमिं च and the land, निरीक्षन्ते स्म looking at, पुनश्च again, मार्गं that path, इच्छन्ति intend to go, लक्ष्मणेन even Lakshmana, उपलक्षिताः niticed.

64_18.shloka: तेषां वचनसर्वस्वं लक्षयामास चेङ्गितम्।।3.64.20।।उवाच लक्ष्मणो ज्येष्ठं धीमान्भ्रातरमार्तवत्।
64_18.translation: Observing intelligently their indications and understanding the meaning of their message, Lakshmana said to his distressed elder brother:
64_18.word_by_word: धीमान् wise, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तेषाम् their, वचनसर्वस्वम् meaning of their words fully, इङ्गितम् indication, लक्षयामास he observed, आर्तवत्  distressed,  ज्येष्ठं भ्रातरम् elder brother, उवाच said.

64_19.shloka: क्व सितेति त्वया पृष्टा यथेमे सहसोत्थिताः।।3.64.21।।दर्शयन्ति क्षितिं चैव दक्षिणां च दिशं मृगाः।साधु गच्छावहे देव दिशमेतां हि नैऋतिम्।।3.64.22।।यदि स्यादागमः कश्चिदार्या वा साऽथ लक्ष्यते।
64_19.translation: O lord these deer are indicating the land on the southern side.Therefore it will be proper for both of us to proceed in the southwestern direction. Maybe we will get some clue or find that noble Sita.
64_19.word_by_word: देव lord, इमे these, मृगाः deer, क्व where, (गता gone), इति thus, त्वया by you, पृष्टाः enquired, सहसा suddenly, उत्थिताः got up, क्षितिं चैव land as well as, दक्षिणां दिशम् southern side, यथा thus, दर्शयन्ति  are showing, एताम् this, नैऋताम् दिशम् south western direction, साधु well, गच्छावहे both will go, कश्चित् some, आगमः source, यदि स्यात् may be, अथ at that, सा that, आर्या वा noble lady, लक्ष्यते may be found.

64_20.translation: Handsome Rama said, 'yes'and started in southern direction, carefully looking at the ground, followed by Lakshmana.
64_20.word_by_word: श्रीमान् Handsome one, काकुत्स्थः Rama, बाढमित्येव saying 'yes', लक्ष्मणानुगतः followed by Lakshmana, वसुन्धराम् land, वीक्षमाणः while looking at, दक्षिणां दिशम् southwards, प्रस्थितः he started.

64_21.shloka: एवं सम्भाषमाणौ तावन्योन्यं भ्रातरावुभौ।।3.64.24।।वसुन्धरायां पतितं पुष्पमार्गमपश्यताम्।
64_21.translation: Talking with each other, the two brothers took the path on earth strewn with flowers.
64_21.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, अन्योन्यम् with each other, सम्भाषमाणौ conversing, (तौ) उभौ both, भ्रातरौ brothers, वसुन्धरायाम् on the path, पतितम् पुष्पमार्गम् path scattered with flowers, अपश्यताम् saw.

64_22.shloka: तां पुष्पवृष्टिं पतितां दृष्ट्वा रामो महीतले।।3.64.25।।उवाच लक्ष्मणं वीरो दुःखितो दुःखितं वचः।
64_22.translation: Seeing showers of flowers fallen on the ground, valiant Rama sadly said these words to sorrowful Lakshmana:
64_22.word_by_word: वीरः Valiant, रामः Rama, महीतले on the ground, पतिताम् fallen, तां पुष्पवृष्टिम् that shower of flowers, दृष्ट्वा seeing, दुःखितः sadly, दुःखितम् sorrowful, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, वचः these words, उवाच spoke.

64_23.shloka: अभिजानामि पुष्पाणि तानीमानीह लक्ष्मण।।3.64.26।।पिनद्धानि हि वैदेह्या मया दत्तानि कानने।
64_23.translation: O Lakshmana, here are the same flowers I had given Vaidehi to wear in the forest. I can recognize them.
64_23.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, इह here, तानि those, इमानि the very same ones, पुष्पाणि flowers, अभिजानामि I recognise them, इह here, कानने in the forest, मया by me, दत्तानि given, वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, पिनद्धानि worn, हि indeed.

64_24.shloka: मन्ये सूर्यश्च वायुश्च मेदिनी च यशस्विनी।।3.64.27।।अभिरक्षन्ति पुष्पाणि प्रकुर्वन्तो मम प्रियम्।
64_24.translation: I think the Sun, the wind  and the famed earth have done me a favour by preserving these flowers.
64_24.word_by_word: सूर्यश्च Sun too, वायुश्च wind also, यशस्विनी famed, मेदिनी च earth also, मम my, प्रियम् pleasure, प्रकुर्वन्तः while rendering, पुष्पाणि flowers, अभिरक्षन्ति preserving, मन्ये I think.

64_25.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा महाबाहुं लक्ष्मणं पुरुषर्षभः।।3.64.28।।उवाच रामो धर्मात्मा गिरिं प्रस्रवणाकुलम्।
64_25.translation: Rigteous Rama, the best among men, having said these words to the longarmed Lakshmana, asked mount Prasravana, full of streams:
64_25.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभः a bull among men, धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, महाबाहुम् longarmed, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, प्रस्रवणाकुलम् full of streams, गिरिम् mountain, उवाच said.

64_26.shloka: कच्चित् क्षितिभृतां नाथ दृष्टा सर्वाङ्गसुन्दरी।।3.64.29।।रामा रम्ये वनोद्देशे मया विरहिता त्वया।
64_26.translation: O king of the mountains have you seen a lady with beautiful limbs separated from me in this forest tract ?
64_26.word_by_word: क्षितिभृतां नाथ king of the mountains, रम्ये beautiful, वनोद्धेशे in the woods, मया by me, विरहिता separated from me, सर्वाङ्गसुन्दरी charming in all herlimbs, रामा woman, त्वया you, कच्चित्  whether, दृष्टा is seen?

64_27.shloka: क्रुद्धोऽब्रवीद्गिरिं तत्र सिंहः क्षुद्रमृगं यथा।।3.64.30।।तां हेमवर्णां हेमाभां सीतां दर्शय पर्वत।यावत्सानूनि सर्वाणि न ते विध्वंसयाम्यहम्।।3.64.31।।
64_27.translation: Like a lion aiming at a petty animal, angry Rama  said, O Mountain before I destroy  all your slopes show me that goldenhued Sita with lustre like gold.
64_27.word_by_word: तत्र there, सिंहः lion, क्षुद्रमृगं petty animal, गिरिम् mountain, क्रुद्धः angry, अब्रवीत् said, पर्वत mountain, अहम् I, ते your, सर्वाणि all, सानूनि slopes, यावत् before, न विध्वंसयामि I do not destroy, हेमवर्णाम् golden complexioned, हेमाभाम् with lustre like gold, सीताम् Sita, दर्शय show.

64_28.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण पर्वतो मैथिलीं प्रति।शंसन्निव ततस्सीतां नादर्शयत राघवे।।3.64.32।।
64_28.translation: Thus addressed by Rama, the mountain echoed as if it was telling about Sita but did not show her to Rama.
64_28.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, मैथिलीं Maithili, प्रति towards, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having said, पर्वतः mountain, ततः thereafter, सीताम् Sita, शंसन्निव appeared as if telling, राघवे to Rama, नादर्शयत not shown.

64_29.shloka: ततो दाशरथी राम उवाच च शिलोच्चयम्।मम बाणाग्निनिर्दग्धो भस्मीभूतो भविष्यसि।।3.64.33।।असेव्यः सततं चैव निस्तृणद्रुमपल्लवः।
64_29.translation: Rama, Dasaratha's son said to the mountain, The fire of my arrows will reduce you to ashes.You will have no grass, no tree, no twig. You will be unfit to be served any more.
64_29.word_by_word: ततः then, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son, रामः Rama, शिलोच्चयम् to the mountain, उवाच च said, मम my, बाणाग्निनिर्दग्धः burnt by the fire of my arrows, भस्मीभूतः reduced to ashes, सततम् always, असेव्यः unfit to be served, निस्तृणद्रुमपल्लवः with no grass, no trees, no twig, भविष्यसि you will be there.

64_30.shloka: इमां वा सरितं चाद्य शोषयिष्यामि लक्ष्मण।।3.64.34।।यदि नाख्याति मे सीतामार्यां चन्द्रनिभाननाम्।
64_30.translation: O Lakshmana if this river does not tell me about that noble Sita with countenance like the moon, I will drain it dry right now.
64_30.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, आर्याम् noble, चन्द्रनिभाननाम् Moonlike face, सीताम् Sita, मे to me, नाख्याति not tell, अद्य right now, इमाम् this, सरितं वा to the river too, शोषयिष्यामि will make it dry.

64_31.shloka: एवं स रुषितो रामो दिधक्षन्निव चक्षुषा।।3.64.35।।ददर्श भूमौ निष्क्रान्तं राक्षसस्य पदं महत्।त्रस्ताया रामकाङ्क्षिण्याः प्रधावन्त्या इतस्ततः।।3.64.36।।राक्षसेनानुवृत्ताया मैथिल्याश्च पदान्यथ।
64_31.translation: While Rama was angry with his eyes burning, he saw on the ground as he advanced large footprints of a demon and then the footprints of Maithili which signified as if chased by the demon, she was frightened and was running hither and thither, longing to see Rama.
64_31.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, रुषितः in anger, चक्षुषा with eyes, दिधक्षन्निव as if wishing to burn, रामः Rama, भूमौ ground, निष्क्रान्तम् crossed, राक्षसस्य the demon's, महत् large, पदम् footprint, अथ and then, त्रस्तायाः of the frightened lady, रामकाङ्क्षिण्याः who longed for Rama, इतस्ततः here and there, प्रधावन्त्याः who was running, राक्षसेन by the demon, अनुवृत्तायाः who followed, मैथिल्याः Maithili's, पदानि च footprints, ददर्श saw.

64_32.shloka: स समीक्ष्य परिक्रान्तं सीताया राक्षसस्य च।।3.64.37।।भग्नं धनुश्च तूणी च विकीर्णं बहुधा रथम्।सम्भ्रान्तहृदयो रामश्शशंस भ्रातरंप्रियम्।।3.64.38।।
64_32.translation: Bewildered to see the broken bow and quiver and many splinters of the chariot scattered all over, Rama said to his loving brother Lakshmana:
64_32.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, सीतायाः Sita's, राक्षसस्य च and the demon's, परिक्रान्तम् movement, भग्नम् broken, धनुश्च bow, तूणी च and quiver, बहुधा many ways, विकीर्णम् scattered, रथम् chariot, समीक्ष्य having seen, सम्भ्रान्त हृदयः bewidered mind, प्रियम् loving, भ्रातरम् brother, शशंस told.

64_33.shloka: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्याशशीर्णाः कनकबिन्दवः।भूषणानां हि सौमित्रे माल्यानि विविधानि च।।3.64.39।।
64_33.translation: O Saumitri  see the many broken bits of gold ornaments and garlands.
64_33.word_by_word: सौमित्रे son of Sumitra, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, पश्य see, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, भूषणानाम् of the ornaments, कनकबिन्दवः golden bits, शीर्णाः shattered, विविधानि many kinds, माल्यानि               garlands, च also.

64_34.shloka: तप्तबिन्दुनिकाशैश्च चित्रैः क्षतजबिन्दुभिः।आवृतं पश्य सौमित्रे सर्वतो धरणीतलम्।3.64.40।।
64_34.translation: See, O Lakshmana, the patches of blood looking like drops of shining gold spread all over the ground.
64_34.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, तप्तबिन्दुनिकाशैः shining like drops of gold, चित्रैः variegated, क्षतजबिन्दुभिः drops of blood, सर्वतः all over, आवृतम् spread, धरणीतलाम् on the ground, पश्य see.

64_35.shloka: मन्ये लक्ष्मण वैदेही राक्षसैः कामरूपिभिः।भित्वाभित्वा विभक्ता वा भक्षिता वा भविष्यति।।3.64.41।।
64_35.translation: O Lakshmana, Vaidehi might have been cut into pieces, and eaten up by the demons who can assume any form at their free will.
64_35.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana,  वैदेही Vaidehi, कामरूपिभिः assuming any form at their will, राक्षसैः by the demons, भित्त्वाभित्त्वा breaking into pieces, विभक्ता वा she is torn, भक्षिता वा eaten or,भविष्यति would have, मन्ये I think.

64_36.shloka: तस्या निमित्तं वैदेह्या द्वयोर्विवदमानयोः।बभूव युद्धं सौमित्रे घोरं राक्षसयोरिह।।3.64.42।।
64_36.translation: O Lakshmana, two demons might have fought a dreadful duel at this place contesting with each other for the sake of Vaidehi.
64_36.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, तस्याः her, वेदेह्याः Vaidehi's, निमित्तम् on account of her, विवदमानयोः contesting with, द्वयोः of both, राक्षसयोः demons, इह here, घोरम् dreadful, युद्धम् war, बभूव was fought.

64_37.shloka: मुक्तामणिमयं चेदं तपनीयविभूषितम्।धरण्यां पतितं सौम्य कस्य भग्नं महद्धनुः।।3.64.43।।
64_37.translation: O handsome Lakshmana whose is this huge bow embedded with pearls and gems and adorned with gold fallen on the ground?
64_37.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome Lakshmana, कस्य whose, इदम् this, मुक्तामणिमयम् embedded with pearls and gems, तपनीयविभूषितम् adorned with gold, महत् धनुः huge bow, भग्नम् broken, धरण्याम् on the ground, पतितम् fallen?

64_38.shloka: तरुणादित्यसङ्काशं वैडूर्यगुलिकाचितम्।विशीर्णं पतितं भूमौ कवचं कस्य काञ्चनम्।।3.64.44।।
64_38.translation: Whose is this shield of gold studded with Vaidurya, broken and strewn all over the ground, shining like the morning Sun?
64_38.word_by_word: तरुणादित्यसङ्काशम् looking like the morning Sun, वैडूर्यगुलिकाचितम् studded with Vaidurya (cat's eye), काञ्चनम् gold, कस्य whose, विशीर्णम् spread all over, कवचम् shield, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen?

64_39.shloka: छत्रं शतशलाकं च दिव्यमाल्योपशोभितम्।भग्नदण्डमिदं कस्य भूमौ सम्यङ्निपातितम्।।3.64.45।।
64_39.translation: Whose parasol is this with a hundred spokes, festooned with wonderful flowers thrown down on the ground with broken staff ?
64_39.word_by_word: शतशलाकं च having a hundred spokes, दिव्यमाल्योपशोभितम् festooned with wonderful flower garlands, भग्नदण्डम् with broken staff, इदं छत्रम् this parasol, कस्य whose, सम्यक् thrown down, भूमौ on the ground, निपातितम् fallen?

64_40.shloka: काञ्चनोरश्छदा श्चेमे पिशाचवदनाः खराः।भीमरूपा महाकायाः कस्य वा निहता रणे।।3.64.46।।
64_40.translation: Whose are these donkeys, with golden chestcoverings, with the devil's face, fierceful and huge and slain in the encounter ?
64_40.word_by_word: काञ्चनोरश्छदाः with golden chestcoverings, पिशाचवदनाः those with devil's face, भीमरूपाः fierceful, महाकायाः those with huge body, रणे in war, निहताः slain, इमे these, खराः donkeys, कस्य वा whose?

64_41.shloka: दीप्तपावकसङ्काशो द्युतिमान्समरध्वजः।अपविद्धश्च भग्नश्च कस्य साङ्ग्रामिको रथः।।3.64.47।।
64_41.translation: Whose war chariot with a battle flag is this, shining like burning fire, turned upside down and broken?
64_41.word_by_word: दीप्तपावकसङ्काशः looking like burning fire, द्युतिमान् dazzling, समरध्वजः battle flag, कस्य वा whose, साङ्ग्रामिकः useful in battle, रथः chariot, भग्नः broken, अपविद्धश्च turned upside down and broken.

64_42.translation: Whose are these pointless arrows of the size of a chariot axle adorned with bright gold destroyed and scattered ? Who is he that has performed such terrible deeds?
64_42.word_by_word: रथाक्षमात्राः of the size of the chariot's axle, विशिखाः pointless arrows, तपनीयविभूषणाः adorned with bright gold, अभिहताः destroyed, इमे बाणाः these arrows, घोरकर्मणः performing terrible deeds, कस्य whose, प्रकीर्णाः scattered about?

64_43.shloka: शरावरौ शरैः पूर्णौ विध्वस्तौ पश्य लक्ष्मण।प्रतोदाभीशुहस्तो वै कस्यायं सारथिर्हतः।।3.64.49।।
64_43.translation: O Lakshmana  look at these two quivers filled with arrows and lying shattered.  The charioteer is holding a whip and reins in his hands and is lying dead. To whom do they belong?
64_43.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, शरैः with arrows, पूर्णौ both filled, विध्वस्तौ shattered, शरावरौ two quivers, पश्य see, प्रतोदाभीशुहस्तः a man holding a whip and reins in the hands, हतः slain, अयं सारथिः this charioteer, कस्य whose?

64_44.shloka: कस्येमौ पुरुषव्याघ्र शयाते निहतौ युधि।चामरग्राहिणौ सौम्य सोष्णीषमणिकुण्डलौ।।3.64.50।।
64_44.translation: O best among men, O handsome Lakshmana see these carriers of fans with head dress and earrings studded with gems lying slain in the combat. Whose are they ?
64_44.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र O tiger among men, सौम्य O handsome one, सोष्णीषमणिकुण्डलौ with head dress and earrings made of gems, इमौ these two, चामर ग्राहिणौ carriers of fans, कस्य whose, युधि in war, निहतौ both are slain, शयाते both fallen down?

64_45.shloka: पदवीपुरुषस्यैषा व्यक्तं कस्यापि रक्षसः।वैरं शतगुणं पश्य ममेदं जीवितान्तकम्।।3.64.51।।
64_45.translation: This indeed is the path the man or the demon has traversed. My enmity with him now has become hundredfold. This will end only with the extermination of his life.
64_45.word_by_word: एषा this, व्यक्तम् it is certain, कस्यापि some one's, पुरुषस्य man's, रक्षसः demon's, पदवी path, मम for me, जीवितान्तकम् till the end of my life, शतगुणम् hundred times, इदं वैरम् enmity like this, पश्य see.

64_46.shloka: सुघोरहृदयैस्सौम्य राक्षसैः कामरूपिभिः।हृता मृता वा सीता सा भक्षिता वा तपस्विनी।।3.64.52।।नधर्मस्त्रायते सीतां ह्रियमाणां महावने।
64_46.translation: O handsome one, those demons can change their form at will and are of dreadful nature. Have they abducted or devoured or killed her in this great forest. Even her righteousness could not protect the helpless Sita.
64_46.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, तपस्विनी a helpless woman, सा सीता that Sita, सुघोरहृदयैः of terrible heart, कामरूपिभिः those who can change their form at will, राक्षसैः by the demons, हृता वा abducted or, भक्षिता वा eaten away or, मृता वा or killed, महावने dense forest, ह्रियमाणाम् while she is being carried off, सीताम् Sita, धर्मः righteousness, न त्रायते I did not protect.

64_47.shloka: भक्षितायां हि वैदेह्यां हृतायामपि लक्ष्मण।।3.64.53।।के हि लोके प्रियं कर्तुं शक्तास्सौम्य ममेश्वराः।
64_47.translation: If Sita has been devoured or kidnapped, none in this world or even gods could do anything to make me happy, O handsome Lakshmana
64_47.word_by_word: सौम्य लक्ष्मण O handsome Lakshmana, वैदेह्याम् when Sita, भक्षितायाम् was eaten, हृतायामपि or carried off, मम to me, लोके in this world, के ईश्वराः which of the gods, प्रियम् happiness, कर्तुम् do, शक्ताः not feasible?

64_48.translation: O Lakshmana even the compassionate and heroic Creator of the worlds will be disrespected by all beings, however ignorantly (if such things are allowed to happen).
64_48.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, लोकानाम् of these worlds, कर्तारमपि one who may be even the creator, शूरम् hero, करुणवेदिनम् compassionate, सर्वभूतानि all beings, अज्ञानात् by ignorance, अवमन्येरन् will disrespect.

64_49.shloka: मृदुं लोकहिते युक्तं दान्तं करुणवेदिनम्।।3.64.55।।निर्वीर्य इति मन्यन्ते नूनं मां त्रिदशेश्वराः।
64_49.translation: The gods will certainly consider me a man engaged in the welfare of the world, a man of selfrestraint and compassion, but at the same time a weak man.
64_49.word_by_word: मृदुम् gentle, लोकहिते for the welfare of the world, युक्तम् one engaged, दान्तम् selfrestraint, करुणवेदिनम् a compassionate, माम् me, त्रिदशेश्वराः the gods, निर्वीर्यः इति as weak, मन्यन्ते will consider, नूनम् certainly.

64_50.shloka: मां प्राप्य हि गुणो दोषस्संवृत्तः पश्य लक्ष्मण।।3.64.56।।अद्यैव सर्वभूतानां रक्षसामभवाय च।संहृत्यैव शशिज्योत्स्नां महान्सूर्य इवोदितः।।3.64.57।।संहृत्यैव गुणान्सर्वान्मम तेजः प्रकाशते।
64_50.translation: O Lakshmana even demerits turn into merits when they come in contact with me. Just as the Sun shines, effacing the moonlight, my brilliance will outshine my demerits of exterminating all (wicked) beings including the demons.
64_50.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, माम् me, प्राप्य after attaining, गुणः merit, दोषः demerit, संवृत्तः been  converted, पश्य see, शशिज्योत्स्नाम् light of the Moon, संहृत्यैव on effacing, उदितः risen, महान्mighty, सूर्यः Sun, इव like, तेजः glow, सर्वान् all, गुणान् qualities, संहृत्यैव effacing, अद्यैव now, सर्वभूतानाम् to all beings, रक्षसां च of demons, अभवाय for their extermination, प्रकाशते will shine forth.

64_51.shloka: नैव यक्षा न गन्धर्वा न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः।।3.64.58।।किन्नरा वा मनुष्या वा सुखं प्राप्स्यन्ति लिक्ष्मण।
64_51.translation: O Lakshmana, neither yakshas, nor goblins nor demons nor kinneras nor humans  will be in peace now.
64_51.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, यक्षाः yakshas, सुखम् peace, नैव प्राप्स्यन्ति not attain, यक्षाः yakshas, न not, पिशाचाः goblins, न not, रक्षसाः demons, न not, किन्नरा वा or kinneras, मनुष्या वा or human beings,

64_52.shloka: ममास्त्रबाणसम्पूर्णमाकाशं पश्य लक्ष्मण।।3.64.59।।निस्सम्पातं करिष्यामि ह्यद्य त्रैलोक्यचारिणाम्।
64_52.translation: O Lakshmana, just see, I will fill the sky with all my weapons and arrows and make all movements impossible in the three worlds.
64_52.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshman, मम my, अस्त्रबाणसम्पूर्णम् filled with all my weapons and arrows, आकाशम् sky, अद्य now, त्रैलोक्यचारिणाम् those who move in the three worlds, निस्सम्पातम् impossible to descend, करिष्यामि I will do, पश्य see.

64_53.translation: I will obstruct the movement of planets and the Moon, destroy the radiance of the Sun, the fire and block the wind crush the mountain tops, dry up the tanks, destroy the trees shrubs and creepers and annihilate the oceans. I shall bring about this fatal change at once in the three worlds.
64_53.word_by_word: त्रैलोक्यम् the three worlds, सन्निरुद्धग्रहगणम्  obstruct planets, आवारितनिशाकरम् preventing the movement of the Moon, विप्रणष्टानलमरुद्भास्करद्युतिसंवृतम् blocking and destroying the radiance of fire, wind and Sun, विनिर्मथितशैलाग्रम् crushing the mountain tops, शुष्यमाणजलाशयम् drying up the tanks, ध्वस्तद्रुमलतागुल्मम् destroying the trees, creepers and shrubs, विप्रणाशितसागरम् annihilating the ocean, कालकर्मणा by a fatal act, संयुक्तम् together, करिष्यामि I will do.

64_54.shloka: न तां कुशलिनीं सीतां प्रदास्यन्ति ममेश्वराः।अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते सौमित्रे मम द्रक्ष्यन्ति विक्रमम्।।3.64.63।।
64_54.translation: If the gods do not return my Sita safely to me, O Lakshmana  they will witness my power right now.
64_54.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, ईश्वराः gods, तां सीताम् Sita, कुशलिनीम् safely, मम to me, न प्रदास्यन्ति not give, अस्मिन् in this, मुहूर्ते this moment, मम my, विक्रमम् power, द्रक्ष्यन्ति they will witness.

64_55.translation: Lakshmana no beings will be able to move in the sky, blocked by arrows released from my bowstring there will be no space left there.
64_55.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, सर्वभूतानि all beings, मम me, चापगुणोन्मुक्तै: arrows released from my bow string, बाणजालैः by arrows, निरन्तरम् will have no place to move, आकाशम् sky, न उत्पतिष्यन्ति not fly.

64_56.translation: O Lakshmna now beasts and birds will be confused and destroyed by my darts.You will see them crossing all limits of propriety.
64_56.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अद्य now, मम my, नाराचैः by darts, अर्दितम् distressed, ध्वस्तभ्रान्तमृगद्विजम् समाकुलम् beasts and birds confused and destroyed, अमर्यादम् crossing all limits, जगत् world, पश्य see.

64_57.translation: For the sake of Maithili I will render this world devoid of goblins and demons with my irresistible arrows pulled up to my ears.
64_57.word_by_word: मैथिलीहेतोः for the sake of Maithili, जीवलोकम् this world of mortals, आकर्णपूर्णैः fully drawing up to the ears, दुरावरैः by the irresistible, इषुभिः arrows, अपिशाचम् devoid of evil spirits, अराक्षसम् without demons, करिष्ये will do.

64_58.shloka: मम रोषप्रयुक्तानां सायकानां बलं सुराः।द्रक्ष्यन्त्यद्य विमुक्तानामतिदूरातिगामिनाम्।।3.64.67।।
64_58.translation: Now the gods will witness the power of my arrows released in great rage which can hit distant targets.
64_58.word_by_word: विमुक्तानाम् released, मम my, रोषप्रयुक्तानाम् released in rage, अतिदूरातिगामिनाम् of those that can reach very distant places, सायकानाम् of the arrows, बलम् power, सुराः gods, अद्य now, द्रक्ष्यन्ति will witness.

64_59.shloka: नैव देवा न दैतेया न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः।भविष्यन्ति मम क्रोधात्त्रैलोक्ये विप्रणाशिते।।3.64.68।।
64_59.translation: My anger will destroy all the gods, demons and evil spirits. They will be extinghished from the three worlds.
64_59.word_by_word: मम my, क्रोधात् due to anger, त्रैलोक्ये in three worlds, विप्रणाशिते destroyed, देवाः gods, नैव भविष्यन्ति not exist, दैतेयाः demons, न not, पिशाचाः evil spirits, न not , राक्षसाः demons, न not.

64_60.shloka: देवदानवयक्षाणां लोका ये रक्षसामपि।बहुधा न भविष्यन्ति बाणौघैश्शकलीकृताः।।3.64.69।।
64_60.translation: The worlds of gods, yakshas or even demons torn into shreds by my arrows will not  survive.
64_60.word_by_word: देवदानवयक्षाणाम् of gods, demons and yakshas, रक्षसामपि demons too, ये those, लोकाः worlds, बाणौघैः by the touch of my arrows, बहुधा many times, शकलीकृता: broken into pieces, न भविष्यन्ति not survive.

64_61.shloka: निर्मर्यादानिमान्लोकान्करिष्याम्यद्य सायकैः।हृतां मृतां वा सौमित्रे न दास्यन्ति ममेश्वराः।।3.64.70।।
64_61.translation: If the gods do not hand over Sita to me either carried away or dead I will transgress these worlds, O Lakshmana
64_61.word_by_word: सौमित्रे O Lakshmana, हृताम् a lady carried away, मृतां वा or dead,  ईश्वराः by gods, मम me, न दास्यन्ति do not give, अद्य now, सायकैः by arrows, इमान् this, लोकान् worlds, निर्मर्यादान् without any boundaries, करिष्यामि will do.

64_62.shloka: तथारुपां हि वैदेहीं न दास्यन्ति यदि प्रियाम्।नाशयामि जगत्सर्वं त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम्।।3.64.71।।
64_62.translation: If my beloved Vaidehi is not given back to me in her true form I will destroy the three worlds with all animate and inanimate beings.
64_62.word_by_word: तथारूपाम् in her true form, प्रियाम् my beloved, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, न दास्यन्ति यदि not give me, सर्वम् all, सचराचरम् with animate and inanimate beings, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, जगत् world, नाशयामि I will destroy.

64_63.shloka: इत्युक्त्वा रोषताम्राक्षो रामो निष्पीड्य कार्मुकम्।शरमादाय सन्दीप्तं घोरमाशीविषोपमम्।।3.64.72।।सन्धाय धनुषि श्रीमान्रामः परपुरञ्जयः।युगान्ताग्निरिव क्रुद्ध इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.64.73।।
64_63.translation: After speaking these words, handsome Rama, his eyes red with anger, pressed his bow, took out the glowing arrow that was dreadful like a poisonous serpent, fixed it to his bow and said these words in a rage like the fire at the time of dissolution of the world.
64_63.word_by_word: रामः Rama, श्रीमान् handsome, परपुरञ्जयः one who can conquer the cities of enemies, रामः Rama, इति thus, उक्त्वा having said, रोषताम्राक्षः with eyes reddened in anger, कार्मुकम् his bow, निष्पीड्य having pressed, आशीविषोपमम् comparable to a  poisonous snake, घोरम् dreadful, सन्दीप्तम् glowing, शरम् arrow, आदाय after taking out, धनुषि bow, सन्धाय after stringing, युगान्ताग्निरिव like fire at the time of the dissolution of the world, क्रुद्धः angry man, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

64_64.shloka: यथा जरा यथा मृत्युर्यथा कालो यथा विधिः।नित्यं न प्रतिहन्यन्ते सर्वभूतेषु लक्ष्मण।।3.64.74।।तथाहं क्रोधसंयुक्तो न निवार्योऽस्मि सर्वथा।
64_64.translation: Just as all beings in this world cannot avoid age and death, or defy time and fate so also none can prevent me at all when I am  angry, O Lakshmana
64_64.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सर्वभूतेषु in all beings, जरा old age, यथा as, मृत्युः death, यथा as, कालः time, यथा as, विधिः fate, यथा as, नित्यम् always, न प्रतिहन्यन्ते cannot be averted, तथा in the same way, क्रोधसंयुक्तः full of anger, अहम् I, सर्वथा by all means, न निवार्यः not defy, अस्मि I.

64_65.shloka: पुरेव मे चारुदंतीमनिन्दितां दिशन्ति सीतां यदि नाद्य मैथिलीम्।सदेवगन्धर्वमनुष्यपन्नगं जगत्सशैलं परिवर्तयाम्यहम्।।3.64.75।।
64_65.translation: I will topsyturvy this entire world including the gods, the gandharvas, human beings, serpents and mountains if they do not show me the princess from Mithila, who is blemishless and whose teeth are beautifulइत्यार्शे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकेय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टिमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
64_65.word_by_word: चारुदंतीम् a lady with beautiful teeth, अनिन्दिताम् blemishless lady, मैथिलीम् Maithili, सीताम् Sita, पुरेव as earlier, अद्य now, मे my, न दिशन्ति यदि if they do not show me, अहम् I, सदेवगन्धर्वमनुष्यपन्नगम् gods, gandharvas, men, serpents, सशैलम् mountain, जगत् world, परिवर्तयामि I will topsyturvy.

65_1.shloka: [Lakshmana pacifies Rama -- explains that destruction of the world is not proper -- initiates the search.]तप्यमानं तथा रामं सीताहरणकर्शितम्।लोकानामभवे युक्तं सांवर्तकमिवानलम्।।3.65.1।।वीक्षमाणं धनुस्सज्यं निश्श्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः।दग्धुकामं जगत्सर्वं युगान्ते च यथा हरम्।।3.65.2।।अदृष्टपूर्वं सङ्क्रुद्धं दृष्ट्वा रामं तु लक्ष्मणः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं मुखेन परिशुष्यता।।3.65.3।।
65_1.translation: Tormented and emaciated due to Sita's abduction, resembling the fire at the time of dissolution of the creation, ready to destroy the world, Rama looked at his bow strung again and again, breathing hot sighs like Lord Siva at the end of the creation, wishing to burn down the world in a rage. Lakshmana who had never seen Rama in such anger before said to him with folded hands and parched throat.
65_1.word_by_word: तथा that way, तप्यमानम् tormented by pain, रामम् Rama, सीताहरणकर्शितम् emaciated by Sita's abduction, सांवर्तकम् pertaining to dissolution of the world, अनलमिव the fire like, लोकानाम् of the worlds, अभवे to annihilate, युक्तम् ready, सज्यम् strung, धनुः bow, वीक्षमाणम् while seeing, पुनः पुनः again and again, निश्श्वसन्तम् sighing hot breath, युगान्ते at the end of the world, हरं यथा like Lord Siva, सर्वम् all, जगत् world, दग्धुकामम् desiring to burn, अदृष्टपूर्वम् never seen before, संक्रुद्धम् enraged, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा seeing, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, प्राञ्जलिः with folded palms, परिशुष्यता mouth dried up, मुखेन face, अब्रवीत् said.

65_2.shloka: पुरा भूत्वा मृदुर्दान्तस्सर्वभूतहिते रतः।न क्रोधवशमापन्नः प्रकृतिं हातुमर्हसि।।3.65.4।।
65_2.translation: Earlier you were gentle, self restrained and engaged in the welfare of all beings. (Now) it is not proper for you to give up your natural composure in anger.
65_2.word_by_word: पुरा in the past, मृदुः gentle, दान्तः selfrestrained, सर्वभूतहिते in the welfare of all beings, रतः as engaged, भूत्वा after being, क्रोधवशम् under the spell of anger, आपन्नः attaining, प्रकृतिम् natural form, हातुम् to give up, नार्हसि do not behove.

65_3.shloka: चन्द्रे लक्ष्मीः प्रभा सूर्ये गतिर्वायौ भुवि क्षमा।एतत्तु नियतं सर्वं त्वयि चानुत्तमं यशः।।3.65.5।।
65_3.translation: In you are always present the grace of the Moon, the radiance of the Sun, the motion of the wind, the forbearance of the earth and reputation.
65_3.word_by_word: चन्द्रे of the Moon, लक्ष्मीः grace, सूर्ये of the Sun, प्रभा radiance, वायौ of the wind, गतिः motion, भुवि on earth, क्षमा forbearance, एतत् सर्वम् all this, नियतम् always, त्वयि in you, अनुत्तमम् the best, यशः च and fame.

65_4.shloka: एकस्य नापराधेन लोकान् हन्तुं त्वमर्हसि।न तु जानामि कस्यायं भग्नस्साङ्ग्रामिको रथः।।3.65.6।।केन वा कस्य वा हेतोस्सायुधस्सपरिच्छदः।
65_4.translation: To destroy the world for the mistake of a single person is not proper. Why and by whom is this warchariot broken with weapons and all its accesories I do not know.
65_4.word_by_word: एकस्य one's, अपराधेन by mistake, इह here, लोकान् worlds, हन्तुम् to destroy, नार्हसि it is not proper, सायुधः with weapons, सपरिच्छदः with all accesories, अयम् this, साङ्ग्रामिकः used in war, रथः chariot, कस्य whose, केन by whom, कस्य वा हेतोः for what reason, भग्नः broken, न जानामि I do not know.

65_5.translation: O prince, this place is damaged by the hooves of the horses and the rims of the chariot. It is soaked with drops of blood.Very dreadful must have been the fight here.
65_5.word_by_word: पार्थिवात्मज O prince , खुरनेमिक्षतः damaged by hooves of horses and the rims of the chariot', रुधिरबिन्दुभिः by drops of blood, सिक्तः drenched, सुघोरः very dreadful, अयं देशः this place, निर्वृत्तसंग्रामः a great combat was fought here.

65_6.shloka: एकस्य तु विमर्धोऽयं न द्वयोर्वदतांवर।।3.65.8।।न हि वृत्तं हि पश्यामि बलस्य महतः पदम्।
65_6.translation: O, best of the eloquent  this fight involves only one and not two. I do not see the footprints of a big army.
65_6.word_by_word: वदताम् of those intelligent in speech, वर the best one, अयम् this, एकस्य by one person, विमर्धः combat, द्वयोः of two people, न not, महतः great, बलस्य army, वृत्तम् this fight, पदम् footprints, न हि पश्यामि I do not see.

65_7.shloka: नैकस्य तु कृते लोकान्विनाशयितुमर्हसि।।3.65.9।।युक्तदण्डा हि मृदवः प्रशान्ता वसुधाधिपाः।
65_7.translation: To destroy the entire world for one individual is not right. The lords of the earth should remain gentle, peaceful and punish only the deserving.
65_7.word_by_word: एकस्य कृते for one's sake, लोकान् the worlds, विनाशयितुम् to destroy, नार्हसि not right, हि indeed, वसुधाधिपाः lords of the earth, युक्तदण्डाः punish the deserving, मृदवः gentle, प्रशान्ताः peaceful.

65_8.shloka: सदा त्वं सर्वभूतानां शरण्यः परमा गतिः।।3.65.10।।को नु दारप्रणाशं ते साधु मन्येत राघव।
65_8.translation: You are the ultimate resort and refuge of all beings. Who would like that your wife should be abducted ?
65_8.word_by_word: त्वम् you, सर्वभूतानाम् of all beings, सदा always, शरण्यः a refuge, परमा गतिः ultimate resort, राघव Raghava, ते to you, दारप्रणाशम् lost track of her whereabouts, को नु who will, साधु proper, मन्येत think.

65_9.shloka: सरितस्सागराश्शैला देवगन्धर्वदानवाः।।3.65.11।।नालं ते विप्रियं कर्तुं दीक्षितस्येव साधवः।
65_9.translation: Just as pious men do not do anything disagreeable towards persons who observe religious vows, so also rivers, seas and mountains, gods, gandharvas and demons are not capable of causing unhappiness to you.
65_9.word_by_word: सरितः rivers, सागराः seas, शैलाः mountains, देवगन्धर्वदानवाः gods, gandharvas and demons, ते to you, साधवः pious people, दीक्षितस्येव those who observe religious vows, विप्रियम् disagreeable, कर्तुम् to do, नालम् they are not.

65_10.shloka: येन राजन्हृता सीता तमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।।3.65.12।।मद्वितीयो धनुष्पाणिस्सहायैः परमर्षिभिः।
65_10.translation: O king bow in hands, followed by me and with the help of great sages you should search for the one who has abducted Sita.
65_10.word_by_word: राजन् king, धनुष्पाणिः wielding a bow, मद्वितीयः followed by one, सहायैः with the help of, परमर्षिभिः by great sages, सीता Sita, येन whomsoever, हृता carried off, तम् him, अन्वेषितुम् to search, अर्हसि is proper for you.

65_11.shloka: समुद्रं च विचेष्यामः पर्वतांश्च वनानि च।।3.65.13।।गुहाश्च विविधा घोरा नदी पद्मवनानि च।
65_11.translation: We will search oceans, mountains, forests and several dreadful caves, rivers and lotusponds.
65_11.word_by_word: समुद्रं च in the oceans, पर्वतांश्च in the mountains, वनानि च and the forests, विविधाः several,घोराः dreadful, गुहाश्च caves, नदीः rivers, पद्मवनानि lotus ponds, विचेष्यामः we will search.

65_12.translation: We will search relentlessly for the abductor of your wife everywhere including the world of gods and gandharvas till we find her.
65_12.word_by_word: समाहिताः relentlessly, तव your, भार्यापहारिणम् the abductor of your wife, यावत् so long as, नाधिगमिष्यामःwe will not find, देवगन्धर्वलोकांश्च the world of the gods and gandharvas, विचेष्यामः we will search.

65_13.shloka: न चेत्साम्ना प्रदास्यन्ति पत्नीं ते त्रिदशेश्वराः।।3.65.15।।कोसलेन्द्र ततः पश्चात्प्राप्तकालं करिष्यसि।
65_13.translation: O lord of Kosala when gods do not restore Sita on request, then you can think of taking action at the appropriate time.
65_13.word_by_word: कोसलेन्द्र lord of Kosala, Rama, त्रिदशेश्वराः gods, ते to you, पत्नीम् your wife, साम्ना with gentle request, न प्रदास्यन्ति not restore her, चेत् if so, ततः then, पश्चात् later, प्राप्तकालम् at the right time, करिष्यसि will take action.

65_14.shloka: शीलेन साम्ना विनयेन सीतां नयेन न प्राप्स्यसि चेन्नरेन्द्र।ततस्समुत्सादय हेमपुङ्खै र्महेन्द्रवज्रप्रतिमैश्शरौघैः।।3.65.16।।
65_14.translation: O king if you fail to get Sita through appeasement, through humility or diplomacy then you destroy (the three worlds) by your goldtipped stream of arrows comparable to Indra's thunderbolt.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
65_14.word_by_word: नरेन्द्र O king, शीलेन with right conduct, साम्ना by appeasing, विनयेन through humility, नयेन by diplomacy, सीताम् Sita, न प्राप्स्यसि यदि if you do not get her, ततः then, हेमपुङ्खैः with gold feathered, महेन्द्रवज्रप्रतिमैः equalling Indra's thunderbolt, शरौघैः by stream of arrows, समुत्सादय destroy.

66_1.shloka: [Lakshmana asks Rama to bear sorrow -- pleads with Rama to think rightly-- arouses Rama's wisdom.]तं तथा शोकसन्तप्तं विलपन्तमनाथवत्।मोहेन महताविष्टं परिद्यूनमचेतनम्।।3.66.1।।ततस्सौमित्रिराश्वास्य मुहूर्तादिव लक्ष्मणः।रामं सम्बोधयामास चरणौ चाभिपीडयन्।।3.66.2।।
66_1.translation: Lakshmana, son of Sumitra, consoling the mighty miserable Rama, who was afflicted with sorrow, and was weeping helplessly like an orphan, drowned in great delusion, devoid of consciousness, pressed his feet and addressed him:
66_1.word_by_word: ततः then, सौमित्रिः son of Sumitra, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तथा like that, शोकसन्तप्तम् afflicted with sorrow, अनाथवत् like an orphan, विलपन्तम् while weeping, महता mighty, मोहेन by delusion, आविष्टम् engrossed, परिद्यूनम् miserable, अचेतनम् devoid of consciousness, तं रामम् Rama, मुहूर्तादिव in a moment, आश्वास्य  consoled, चरणौ च his feet, अभिपीडयन् pressing, सम्बोधयामास addressed.

66_2.shloka: महता तपसा राम महता चापि कर्मणा।राज्ञा दशरथेनासि लब्धोऽमृतमिवामरैः।।3.66.3।।
66_2.translation: O Rama king Dasaratha begot you by doing a great penance and performing great deeds, just as gods begot the nectar.
66_2.word_by_word: राम Rama, राज्ञा by the king, दशरथेन by Dasaratha, महता great, तपसा penance, महता great, कर्मणाचापि the action, अमरैः by the gods, अमृतमिव like nectar, लब्धः असि obtained.

66_3.shloka: तव चैव गुणैर्बद्धस्त्वद्वियोगान्महीपतिः।राजा देवत्वमापन्नो भरतस्य यथाश्रुतम्।।3.66.4।।
66_3.translation: King Dasaratha, impelled by your virtues, and separation from you attained godhood as heard from Bharata.
66_3.word_by_word: भरतस्य Bharata's, यथा as, श्रुतम् heard, महीपतिः lord of the earth, राजा king, तव your, गुणैः          virtues, बद्धः bound, त्वद्वियोगात् by your separation, देवत्वम् godhood, आपन्नः attained.

66_4.shloka: यदि दुःखमिदं प्राप्तं काकुत्स्थ न सहिष्यसे।प्राकृतश्चाल्पसत्त्वश्च इतरः कस्सहिष्यति।।3.66.5।।
66_4.translation: O Rama, if you cannot bear this sorrow that has befallen you, how can weak and ordinary persons endure (such suffering)?
66_4.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Rama,  प्राप्तम्  has befallen, इदं दुःखम् this sorrow, न सहिष्यसे यदि not able to bear, प्राकृतः ordinary man, अल्पसत्त्वश्च with little strength, इतरः ordinary man, कः who, सहिष्यति will be able to bear?

66_5.shloka: दुःखितो हि भवान्लोकांस्तेजसा यदि धक्ष्यते।आर्ताः प्रजा नरव्याघ्र क्व नु यास्यन्ति निर्वृतिम्।।3.66.6।।
66_5.translation: O best of men  if you grieve and burn the world with your brilliance, wherefrom will the (ordinary) afflicted people get relief?
66_5.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र O best among men, दुःखितः in grief, भवान् you, तेजसा by your brilliance, लोकान् worlds, धक्ष्यते burn, यदि if, आर्ताः afflicted, प्रजाः people, क्व where, निर्वृतिम् relief,  यास्यन्ति will get?

66_6.translation: It is the go of the world. Yayati, son of Nahusa, shared heaven with Indra but because of his curse (for his bad conduct) suffered misfortune.
66_6.word_by_word: एषः so, लोकस्वभावः एव it is natural order in the world, नहुषात्मजः Nahusha's son, ययातिः Yayati, शक्रेण to Indra, सालोक्यम् sharing his stay in the same world, गतः attached, अनयः curse, तम् him, समस्पृशत् touched .

66_7.shloka: महर्षिर्यो वसिष्ठस्तु यः पितुर्नः पुरोहितः।अह्ना पुत्रशतं जज्ञे तथैवास्य पुनर्हतम्।।3.66.8।।
66_7.translation: To sage Vasistha, our father's priest, were born a hundred sons in a day.But all of them were killed in one day the same way.
66_7.word_by_word: महर्षिः sage, यः who, वसिष्ठः Vasistha, यः that, नः पितुः our father's, पुरोहितः priest, अस्य his, अह्ना one day, पुत्रशतम् one hundred sons, जज्ञे gave birth to, पुनः again, तथैव in the same way, हतम् killed.

66_8.shloka: या चेयं जगतां माता देवी लोकनमस्कृता।अस्याश्च चलनं भूमेर्दृश्यते सत्यसंश्रव।।3.66.9।।
66_8.translation: You (rigidly) adhere to truth.(Like you) the mother earth who is adored by all the worlds, is unshakeable. Yet she is seen to be shaking at times.
66_8.word_by_word: सत्यसंश्रव who adheres to truth, जगताम् for the worlds, माता mother, लोकनमस्कृता is adored by the whole world, या चेयम् she being so, देवी mother, अस्याः her, भूमेः earth, चलनम् movement, दृश्यते is seen.

66_9.shloka: यौ धर्मौ जगतां नेत्रौ यत्र सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम्।आदित्यचन्द्रौ ग्रहणमभ्युपेतौ महाबलौ।।3.66.10।।
66_9.translation: The powerful Sun and Moon, righteous entities, who are the two eyes of these worlds and on whom everything rests firmly, also suffer eclipses sometimes.
66_9.word_by_word: यौ whoever, धर्मौ two righteous entities, जगताम् of  the worlds, नेत्रौ two eyes, यत्र where, सर्वम् all, प्रतिष्ठितम् is resting, महाबलौ two very powerful, आदित्यचन्द्रौ Sun and Moon, ग्रहणम्eclipse, अभ्युपेतौ endures.

66_10.shloka: सुमहान्त्यपि भूतानि देवाश्च पुरुषर्षभ।न दैवस्य प्रमुञ्चन्ति सर्वभूतानि देहिनः।।3.66.11।।
66_10.translation: O best among men  Fate spares none. Great beings, every creature, even the gods cannot escape fate.
66_10.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ O bull among men, सुमहन्ति भूतानि great beings, देवाश्च gods, सर्वभूतानि all creatures, देहिनः mortals, दैवस्य fate, न प्रमुञ्चन्ति cannot be released.

66_11.shloka: शक्रादिष्वपि देवेषु वर्तमानौ नयानयौ।श्रूयेते नरशार्दूल न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि।।3.66.12।।
66_11.translation: It is I heard that Indra and other deities are also governed by the principle of justice. Therefore, you should not bewail, O tiger among men.
66_11.word_by_word: नरशार्दूल O tiger among men, शक्रादिषु among beings such as Indra and others, देवेषु deities, नयानयौ justice or otherwise, वर्तमानौ are present, श्रूयेते heard, त्वम् you, शोचितुम् to worry, नार्हसि not right for you.

66_12.shloka: नष्टायामपि वैदेह्यां हृतायामपि चानघशोचितुं नार्हसे वीर यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा।।3.66.13।।
66_12.translation: Even if Vaidehi is killed or abducted, you should not grieve like ordinary men, Osinless hero
66_12.word_by_word: अनघ O sinless soul, वीर hero, वैदेह्याम् when Vaidehi, नष्टायामपि killed, हृतायामपि when  carried off too, प्राकृतः an ordinary person, अन्यः यथा other man, शोचितुम् to worry, नार्हसि not right for you.

66_13.shloka: त्वव्दिधा न हि शोचन्ति सततं सत्यदर्शिनः।सुमहत्स्वपि कृच्छ्रेषु रामानिर्विण्णदर्शनाः।।3.66.14।।
66_13.translation: O Rama, you always see the truth. So  in the face of great difficulties men like you, whose vision is not blurred, should not lose heart.
66_13.word_by_word: राम Rama, सततम् always, सत्यदर्शिनः those who see the truth, अनिर्विण्णदर्शनाः men whose vision is free from depression, त्वव्दिधाः men like you, सुमहत्सु in very great, क्रुच्छ्रेष्वपि even in great calamities, न शोचन्ति हि will not lose heart.

66_14.shloka: तत्त्वतो हि नरश्रेष्ठ बुद्ध्या समनुचिन्तय।बुध्द्या युक्ता महाप्राज्ञा विजानन्ति शुभाशुभे।।3.66.15।।
66_14.translation: O best among men  judge the facts rightly with your intellect. The wise apply their minds and know what is right and what is wrong.
66_14.word_by_word: नरश्रेष्ठ O best among men, तत्त्वतः the facts, बुद्ध्या applying your intellect, समनुचिन्तय think rightly, महाप्राज्ञाः very wise, बुध्द्या with their intellect, युक्ताः endowed, शुभाशुभे right and wrong, विजानन्ति people know.

66_15.shloka: अदृष्टगुणदोषाणामध्रुवाणां तु कर्मणाम्।नान्तरेण क्रियां तेषां फलमिष्टं प्रवर्तते।।3.66.16।।
66_15.translation: Good results are not expected from the actions of persons who cannot distinguish between their virtues and vices, from those who are unstable in their deeds.
66_15.word_by_word: अदृष्टगुणदोषाणाम् of those who do not know their merits and demerits, अध्रुवाणाम् unstable, तेषाम् in this, कर्मणाम् deeds, इष्टम् good, फलम् results, क्रियाम् अन्तरेण from actions, न प्रवर्तते will not be obtained.

66_16.shloka: त्वमेव हि पुरा राम मामेवं बहुशोऽन्वशाः।अनुशिष्याद्धि को नु त्वामपि साक्षाद्बृहस्पतिः।।3.66.17।।
66_16.translation: O Rama you yourself in the past have instructed me many times that way. Who can be your adviser in this matter ? You are indeed like Brihaspati.
66_16.word_by_word: राम Rama, पुरा in the past, त्वमेव you yourself, माम् to me, एवम् that way, बहुशः many times, अन्वशाः you instructed, हि indeed, साक्षात् personally, बृहस्पतिरपि even Brihaspati, को नु who indeed, त्वाम् to you, अनुशिष्यात् हि can teach you.

66_17.shloka: बुद्धिश्च ते महाप्राज्ञ देवैरपि दुरन्वया।शोकेनाभिप्रसुप्तं ते ज्ञानं सम्बोधयाम्यहम्।।3.66.18।।
66_17.translation: Even gods cannot fathom your intellect. I am only trying to rouse your wisdom your sorrow has sent to sleep.
66_17.word_by_word: महाप्राज्ञ very wise, ते बुद्धि: your intellect, देवैरपि gods too, दुरन्वया difficult to fathom, शोकेन by sorrow, अभिप्रसुप्तम् put to sleep, ते ज्ञानम् your wisdom, अहम् I am, सम्बोधयामि arousing you.

66_18.shloka: दिव्यं च मानुषं च त्वमात्मनश्च पराक्रमम्।इक्ष्वाकुवृषभावेक्ष्य यतस्व द्विषतां वधे।।3.66.19।।
66_18.translation: O bull among the Ikshvakus, weigh your divine and human prowess before you try to kill your enemies.
66_18.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकुवृषभ among the Ikshvakus, त्वम् you, दिव्यम् divine, मानुषं च mortal, आत्मनः yourself, पराक्रमम् powers, अवेक्ष्य after knowing, द्विषताम् of the enemies, वधे in killing, यतस्व make efforts.

66_19.shloka: किं तेन सर्वनाशेन कृतेन पुरुषर्षभ।तमेव त्वं रिपुं पापं विज्ञायोद्धर्तुमर्हसि।।3.66.20।।
66_19.translation: O best among men  where is the good in the destruction of all? Know your sinful enemy before you uproot him.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकेय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
66_19.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ best among men, कृतेन by the act of, तेन by that, सर्वनाशेन destruction of all, किम् what for, त्वम् you, पापम् sinful, तं रिपुम् एव your enemy, विज्ञाय after knowing, उद्धर्तुम् to uproot, अर्हसि ought to.

67_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana see the wounded Jatayu with wings clipped.]पूर्वजोऽप्युक्तमात्रस्तु लक्ष्मणेन सुभाषितम्।सारग्राही महासारं प्रतिजग्राह राघवः।।3.67.1।।
67_1.translation: Even though Rama was elder, he could grasp the quintessence of the wise counsel only after Lakshmana had said it.
67_1.word_by_word: सारग्राही who can grasp the essence, राघवः Rama, पूर्वज अपि being elder, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, उक्तमात्रः तु only when told by, महासारम् the great essence, सुभाषितम् wise counsel, प्रतिजग्राह accepted.

67_2.shloka: सन्निगृह्य महाबाहुः प्रवृत्तं कोपमात्मनः।अवष्टभ्य धनुश्चित्रं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.67.2।।
67_2.translation: Restraining his anger, the longarmed Rama leaned over  his wonderful bow and spoke to Lakshmana:
67_2.word_by_word: महाबाहुः longarmed, रामः Rama, प्रवृत्तम् risen, आत्मनः his own, कोपम् anger, सन्निगृह्य after restraining, चित्रम् wonderful, धनुः bow, अवष्टभ्य leaning over, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

67_3.shloka: किं करिष्यावहे वत्स क्व वा गच्छाव लक्ष्मण।केनोपायेन गच्छेयं सीतामिति विचिन्तय।।3.67.3।।
67_3.translation: O dear Lakshmana, what shall we do? Where do we go ? Think of some means by which we can reach Sita.
67_3.word_by_word: वत्स O child, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, किम् what, करिष्यावहे shall we do, क्व वा where do we, गच्छाव will go, सीताम् Sita, केन उपायेन by what means, गच्छेयम् may I reach, इति this, विचिन्तय think.

67_4.shloka: तं तथा परितापार्तं लक्ष्मणो राममब्रवीत्।इदमेव जनस्थानं त्वमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।।3.67.4।।राक्षसैर्बहुभिः कीर्णं नानाद्रुमलतायुतम्।
67_4.translation: Lakshmana said to Rama, afflicted with grief, It is proper for you to (first) search in this Janasthana, covered with different kinds of trees and creepers, and teeming with demons.
67_4.word_by_word: तथा so, परितापार्तम् afflicted with grief, तं रामम् that Rama, लक्ष्मणः Lakshman, अब्रवीत् said, त्वम् you, बहुभिः many, राक्षसैः by demons, कीर्णम् full of, नानाद्रुमलतायुतम् covered with different trees and creepers, इमम् this, जनस्थानमेव Janasthna alone, अन्वेषितुम् to search, अर्हसि you should.

67_5.shloka: सन्तीह गिरिदुर्गाणि निर्दराः कन्दराणि च।।3.67.5।।गुहाश्च विविधा घोरा नानामृगगणाकुलाः।आवासाः किन्नराणां च गन्धर्वभवनानि च।।3.67.6।।
67_5.translation: Here are difficult mountains, caves, valleys, dreadful caves full of different animals, dwellingplaces of kinneras and mansions of gandharvas.
67_5.word_by_word: इह here, गिरिदुर्गाणि difficult mountains, निर्दराः valleys, कन्दराणि च and caves, विविधाः many, घोराः terrific, नानामृगगणाकुलाः inhabited by different animals, गुहाश्च caverns, किन्नराणाम् of kinneras, आवासाः dwellingplaces, गन्धर्वभवनानि च mansions of gandharvas, सन्ति are.

67_6.shloka: तानि युक्तो मया सार्धं त्वमन्वेषितुमर्हसि।त्वद्विधा बुद्धिसम्पन्ना महात्मानो नरर्षभ।।3.67.7।।आपत्सु न प्रकम्पन्ते वायुवेगैरिवाचलाः।
67_6.translation: Accompanied by me you should search for her in those spots. Great people endowed with wisdom do not destabilise in difficulties just as mountains are not shaken by the speed of the wind.
67_6.word_by_word: त्वम् you, युक्तः accompanied, मया सार्धम् along with me, तानि those, अन्वेषितुम् to search, अर्हसि it is proper for you, नरर्षभ: great men, बुद्धिसम्पन्नाः endowed with wisdom, त्वद्धिधाः of your type, महात्मानः great people, वायुवेगैः speed of wind, अचलाः इव like mountains, न प्रकम्पन्ते are not shaken.

67_7.shloka: इत्युक्तस्तद्वनं सर्वं विचचार सलक्ष्मणः।।3.67.8।।क्रुद्धो रामश्शरं घोरं सन्धाय धनुषि क्षुरम्।
67_7.translation: Thus advised, the angry Rama fixed a sharp arrow to his bow and roamed in the forest accompanied by Lakshmana.
67_7.word_by_word: क्रुद्धः becoming angry, रामः Rama, इति thus, उक्तः having been told, सलक्ष्मणः along with Lakskhmana , धनुषि in bow, घोरम् terrific, क्षुरं शरम् sharp arrows, सन्धाय fixing, सर्वम् all, तत् वनम् that forest, विचचार roamed.

67_8.shloka: ततः पर्वतकूटाभं महाभागं द्विजोत्तमम्।।3.67.9।।ददर्श पतितं भूमौ क्षतजार्द्रं जटायुषम्।
67_8.translation: Then he saw the great Jatayu, a wonderful bird, looking like a mountain top, drenched in blood and fallen on the ground.
67_8.word_by_word: ततः then, पर्वतकूटाभम् like a mountain top, महाभागम् great, द्विजोत्तमम् a wonderful bird, भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen down, क्षतजार्द्रम् drenched with blood, जटायुषम्  Jatayu, ददर्श saw.

67_9.shloka: तं दृष्ट्वा गिरिशृङ्गाभं रामो लक्ष्मणमब्रवीत्।।3.67.10।।अनेन सीता वैदेही भक्षिता नात्र संशयः।
67_9.translation: On seeing Jatayu looking like the peak of a mountain, Rama said to Lakshmana, There is no doubt that this bird has devoured Vaidehi.
67_9.word_by_word: गिरिशृङ्गाभम् like a peak of the mountain, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, रामः Rama, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said, अनेन by him, वैदेही Vaidehi, सीता Sita, भक्षिता is eaten, अत्र in this case, संशयः doubt, न no.

67_10.shloka: गृध्ररूपमिदं रक्षो व्यक्तं भवति कानने।।3.67.11।।भक्षयित्वा विशालाक्षीमास्ते सीतां यथासुखम्।एनं वधिष्ये दीप्तास्यैर्घोरैर्बाणैरजिह्मगैः।।3.67.12।।
67_10.translation: This demon in the guise of a vulture has evidently eaten away the largeeyed Sita and is happily relaxing in the forest. With my terrific arrows with burning tips that can go straight I will kill him.
67_10.word_by_word: इदम् this, रक्षः demon, गृध्ररूपम् in the guise of a vulture, कानने in the forest, भवति is, व्यक्तम् it is clear, विशालाक्षीम् largeeyed lady, सीताम् Sita, भक्षयित्वा after eating away, यथासुखम् happily, आस्ते relaxing, दीप्तास्यैः glowing tipped, घोरैः terrific, अजिह्मगैः by those which can go straight, बाणैः by darts, एनम् him, वधिष्ये l will kill.

67_11.shloka: इत्युक्त्वाभ्यपतद्गृध्रं सन्धाय धनुषि क्षुरम्।क्रुद्धो रामस्समुद्रान्तां कम्पयन्निव मेदिनीम्।।3.67.13।।
67_11.translation: Having siad so, Rama took his bow, fixed the sharp arrow, and aimed at the vulture. The seabound earth trembled.
67_11.word_by_word: रामः Rama, इति thus, उक्त्वा saying so, क्रुद्धः in anger, धनुषि on the bow, क्षुरम् sharp  arrow, सन्धाय after fixing, समुद्रान्ताम् extending up to the sea, मेदिनीम् the earth, कम्पयन्निव as though shaking, गृध्रम् vulture, अभ्यपतत् fell upon.

67_12.shloka: तं दीनं दीनया वाचा सफेनं रुधिरं वमन्।अभ्यभाषत पक्षी तु रामं दशरथात्मजम्।।3.67.14।।
67_12.translation: But the vulture who was in a piteous state, vomitting foamy blood, spoke these words pathetically to Rama, son of Dasaratha:
67_12.word_by_word: पक्षी तु but the bird, सफेनम् foamy, रुधिरम् blood, वमन् vomitting, दीनम् in a piteous way, तं him, दशरथात्मजम् Dasaratha's son, रामम् Rama, दीनया pathetic, वाचा with word, अभ्यभाषत spoke these words.

67_13.shloka: यामोषधिमिवायुष्मन्नन्वेषसि महावने।सा देवी मम च प्राणा रावणेनोभयं हृतम्।।3.67.15।।
67_13.translation: O Longlived one  she who you are searching in the forest like herbal medicine has been carried away by Ravana along with my life.
67_13.word_by_word: आयुष्मन् longlived one, याम् whom, महावने in this great forest, ओषधिमिव like herbal medicine, अन्वेषसि you are searching , सा देवी that queen, मम my, प्राणाः च life also, उभयम् both, रावणेन by Ravana, हृतम् is taken away.

67_14.shloka: त्वया विरहिता देवी लक्ष्मणेन च राघव।ह्रियमाणा मया दृष्टा रावणेन बलीयसा।।3.67.16।।
67_14.translation: I have seen her snatched from you and from Lakshmana and carried off by powerful Ravana.
67_14.word_by_word: राघव Rama, त्वया by you, लक्ष्मणेन च and by Lakshmana, विरहिता separated, देवी qeeen, बलीयसा by the powerful, रावणेन by Ravana, ह्रियमाणा taken away, मया I have, दृष्टा seen.

67_15.shloka: सीतामभ्यवपन्नोऽहं रावणश्च रणे मया।विध्वंसितरथश्चात्र पातितो धरणीतले।।3.67.17।।
