67_15.translation: I descended down to protect Sita, and in the battle with Ravana his chariot destroyed fell down here on the ground.
67_15.word_by_word: अहम् I, सीताम् Sita, अभ्यवपन्नः descended down, मया by me, रावणश्च Ravana, विध्वंसितरथः with his chariot destroyed, अत्र in this place, धरणीतले on this ground, पातितः I fell down.

67_16.shloka: एतदस्य धनुर्भग्नमेतदस्य शरावरम्।अयमस्य रथो राम भग्नसाङ्ग्रामिको मया।।3.67.18।।
67_16.translation: O Rama this is his broken bow, this is his quiver and this is his warchariot all devastated by me.
67_16.word_by_word: राम Rama, एतत् this, अस्य his, भग्नम् broken, धनुः bow, एतत् this, अस्य his, शरावरम् quiver, अयम् this, मया by me, भग्नः shattered, अस्य his, साङ्ग्रामिकः battle, रथः chariot.

67_17.shloka: अयं तु सारथिस्तस्य मत्पक्षनिहतो युधि।परिश्रान्तस्य मे पक्षौ छित्त्वा खड्गेन रावणः।।3.67.19।।सीतामादाय वैदेहीमुत्पपात विहायसम्।रक्षसा निहतं पूर्वं न मां हन्तुं त्वमर्हसि।।3.67.20।।
67_17.translation: He is Ravana's charioteer slain by my wings in the battle.  As I was exhausted in the encounter Ravana clipped my wings,  took Sita, and flew into the sky. You need not kill me. I am already slain by the demon.
67_17.word_by_word: अयं तु he is, युधि in the battle, मत्पक्षनिहतः killed by my wings, तस्य सारथिः his charioteer, रावणः Ravana, परिश्रान्तस्य an exhausted one, मे my, पक्षौ both wings, खड्गेन with a sword, छित्त्वा having cut, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सीताम् Sita, आदाय after taking, विहायसम् into the sky, उत्पपात flew up, रक्षसा by Ravana, पूर्वम् earlier, निहतम् slain, माम् me, त्वम् you, हन्तुम् to kill, नार्हसि not proper.

67_18.translation: Having known from Jatayu the story of his beloved Sita, Rama was full of tears, his grief redoubled.
67_18.word_by_word: तदा then, रामः Rama, तस्य his, सीतासक्ताम् about Sita, प्रियाम् dear, कथाम् facts, विज्ञाय having, बाष्पपूर्णमुखः face full of tears, द्विगुणीकृततापार्तः  helpless and pitiable due to redoubled sorrow.

67_19.shloka: गृध्रराजं परिष्वज्य परित्यज्य महद्धनुः।निपपातावशो भूमौ रुरोद सहलक्ष्मणः।।3.67.22।।
67_19.translation: Rama dropped the bow and embraced the king of birds. He fell down despondent on the ground and began crying along with Lakshmana.
67_19.word_by_word: महत् great, धनुः bow, परित्यज्य giving up, गृध्रराजम् king of birds, परिष्वज्य embracing, अवशः despondent, भूमौ on the ground, निपपात fell down, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, रुरोद cried.

67_20.shloka: एकमेकायने दुर्गे निश्श्वसन्तं कथञ्चन।समीक्ष्य दुःखिततरो रामस्सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।।3.67.23।।
67_20.translation: Rama saw Jatayu breathing with difficulty in that solitary, inaccessible place.Overcome by greater grief  he said to Lakshmana:
67_20.word_by_word: दुर्गे in a place difficult to reach, एकायने in a solitary place, एकम् lonely, कथञ्चन with great difficulty, निश्श्वसन्तम् sighing, समीक्ष्य on observing, रामः Rama, दुःखिततरः overcome by greater grief, सौमित्रिम् Saumitri, अब्रवीत् said.

67_21.shloka: राज्यं भ्रष्टं वने वासस्सीता नष्टा हतो द्विजः।ईदृशीयं ममालक्ष्मीर्निर्दहेदपि पावकम्।।3.67.24।।
67_21.translation: I have been expelled from the kingdom. I am made to stay in the forest. I have lost Sita (my beloved wife). This bird (who was my wellwisher) has been slain. Such misfortune will burn even fire.
67_21.word_by_word: राज्यम् kingdom, भ्रष्टम् expelled, वने forest, वासः dwelling, सीता Sita, नष्टा lost, द्विजः Jatayu, हतः is slain, मम me, ईदृशी this kind of, अलक्ष्मीः bad luck, पावकमपि even fire, निर्दहेत्  it will burn.

67_22.shloka: सम्पूर्णमपि चेदद्य प्रविशेयं महोदधिम्।सोऽपि नूनं ममालक्ष्म्या विशुष्येत्सरितांपतिः।।3.67.25।।
67_22.translation: Now if I enter even the great sea, the lord of the rivers filled with water, it will also dry up due to my misfortune.
67_22.word_by_word: अद्य now, सम्पूर्णम् full, महोदधिम् अपि even the great sea also, प्रविशेयं चेत् if I enter, सः that, सरितां पतिः अपि even the lord of rivers, sea, मम me, अलक्ष्मा misfortune, विशुष्येत् will dry up.

67_23.shloka: नास्त्यभाग्यतरो लोके मत्तोऽस्मिन्सचराचरे।येनेयं महती प्राप्ता मया व्यसनवागुरा।।3.67.26।।
67_23.translation: In this world of the animate and the inanimate there is no one more unfortunate than me fallen into the trap of adversities.
67_23.word_by_word: येन मया by me this way, इयम् this kind, महती great, व्यसनवागुरा snare of misfortunes, प्राप्ता attained, मत्तः more than me, अभाग्यतरः more unlucky, सचराचरे among animate and inanimate, अस्मिन् in this, लोके world, नास्ति not there.

67_24.shloka: अयं पितृवयस्यो मे गृध्रराजो जरान्वितः।शेते विनिहतो भूमौ मम भाग्यविपर्ययात्।।3.67.27।।
67_24.translation: This aged king of birds is my father's friend. To my illluck, he is struck down and is lying on the ground.
67_24.word_by_word: मे my, पितृवयस्यः father's friend, जरान्वितः in old age, अयम् he is, गृध्रराजः king of birds, मम of me, भाग्यविपर्ययात् by my misfortune, विनिहतः was slain, भूमौ ground, शेते lying.

67_25.shloka: इत्येवमुक्त्वा बहुशो राघवस्सहलक्ष्मणः।जटायुषं च पस्पर्श पितृस्नेहं विदर्शयन्।।3.67.28।।
67_25.translation: Saying such words and showing filial affection, he caressed Jatayu repeatedly with Lakshmana.
67_25.word_by_word: राघवः Rama, इत्येवम् in this manner, बहुशः many times, उक्त्वा after telling, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, पितृस्नेहम् filiat affection, विदर्शयन् showing, जटायुषम् Jatayu, पस्पर्श caressed.

67_26.shloka: निकृत्तपक्षं रुधिरावसिक्तं स गृध्रराजं परिरभ्य रामः।क्व मैथिली प्राणसमा ममेति विमुच्य वाचं निपपात भूमौ।।3.67.29।।
67_26.translation: Rama hugged the king of vultures with servered wings, drenched in blood and asking him where Sita who was as dear to him as his life was, he dropped him and fell down on the ground.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
67_26.word_by_word: सः रामः that Rama, निकृत्तपक्षम् severed wings, रुधिरावसिक्तम् drenched in blood, गृध्रराजम् king of vultures, परिरभ्य hugging, मम my, प्राणसमा equal to my life, मैथिली Maithili, क्व where, इति this, वाचम् speaking, विमुच्य भूमौ leaving the ground, निपपात fell down.

68_1.shloka: [Jatayu informs Rama about his combat with Ravana and Sita's abduction-- Jatayu's death-- cremation ]रामस्सम्प्रेक्ष्य तं गृध्रं भुवि रौद्रेण पातितम्।सौमित्रिं मित्रसम्पन्नमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।3.68.1।।
68_1.translation: Seeing the vulture lying on the ground thrown down by the fierce demon, Rama said to friendly Lakshmana:
68_1.word_by_word: रौद्रेण by fierce, भुवि ground, पातितम्  thrown down, तं गृध्रम् that vulture, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, रामः Rama, मित्रसम्पन्नम् friendly, सौमित्रिम् Lakshmana, इदं वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

68_2.shloka: ममायं नूनमर्थेषु यतमानो विहङ्गमः।राक्षसेन हतस्संख्ये प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यति दुस्त्यजान्।।3.68.2।।
68_2.translation: Struck down by the demon in the combat on my account this bird is going to give up his life which is indeed difficult.
68_2.word_by_word: मम my, अर्थेषु in my objective, यतमानः while he is making efforts, अयं विहङ्गमः this bird, सङ्ख्ये in battle, राक्षसेन by demon, हतः struck, दुस्त्यजान्  hard to leave, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यति going to give up, नूनम् surely.

68_3.shloka: अयमस्य शरीरेऽस्मिन्प्राणो लक्ष्मण विद्यते।तथा हि स्वरहीनोऽयं विक्लबस्समुदीक्ष्यते।।3.68.3।।
68_3.translation: O Lakshmana, it appears he is frightened and is experiencing excruciating pain in the body. His voice sounds faint, too.
68_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, अस्य his, अस्मिन् शरीरे in this body, प्राणः life, (अतिखिन्नः suffering from intense pain), विद्यते appears, तथा हि like that, अयम् he, स्वरहीनः faint voice, विक्लबः frightened, समुदीक्ष्यते feeling excruciating pain.

68_4.shloka: जटायो यदि शक्नोषि वाक्यं व्याहरितुं पुनः।सीतामाख्याहि भद्रं ते वधमाख्याहि चात्मनः।।3.68.4।।
68_4.translation: O Jatayu If you are still able to speak, tell me about Sita and about how you have been struck down.
68_4.word_by_word: जटायो Jatayu, पुनः again, व्याहरितुम् to speak, शक्नोषि यदि if you are able, ते भद्रम् be blessed, सीताम् about Sita, अख्याहि tell, आत्मनः yourself, वधम् striking, आख्याहि tell.

68_5.shloka: किं निमित्तोऽहरत्सीतां रावणस्तस्य किं मया।अपराद्धं तु यं दृष्ट्वा रावणेन हृता प्रिया।।3.68.5।।
68_5.translation: Why did Ravana abduct Sita? What fault did he find with me so that he kidnapped my beloved ?
68_5.word_by_word: रावणः Ravana, किं निमित्तः for what reason, सीताम् Sita, अहरत् abducted, मया by me, तस्य his, किम् what, अपराद्धम्  crime, यम् which, दृष्ट्वा seeing, प्रिया beloved, हृता taken?

68_6.shloka: कथं तच्चन्द्रसङ्काशं मुखमासीन्मनोहरम्।सीतया कानि चोक्तानि तस्मिन्काले द्विजोत्तम।।3.68.6।।
68_6.translation: O best of birds how did her delightful, Moonlike face look when she was hijacked. What did she say at that time?
68_6.word_by_word: द्विजोत्तम best of birds, चन्द्रसङ्काशम् Moon like, मनोहरम् delightful, तत् मुखम् her face, कथम् how, आसीत् it was, तस्मिन् काले at the time of abduction, सीतया by Sita,  कानि what, उक्तानि did she say?

68_7.shloka: कथं वीर्यः कथं रूपः किं कर्मा स च राक्षसः।क्व चास्य भवनं तात ब्रूहि मे परिपृच्छतः।।3.68.7।।
68_7.translation: O father  how powerful is that demon ? How does he look?What work does he do? Where does he dwell? Do answer my questions?
68_7.word_by_word: सः राक्षसः the demon, कथं वीर्यः how powerful, कथं रूपः how did he look, किं कर्मा what he does, अस्य his, भवनं च mansion also, क्व च where, तात dear, परिपृच्छतः I am asking you, मे to me, ब्रूहि please tell.

68_8.translation: Thereafter Jatayu, a piteous soul, looked up at Rama who was  crying incessantly and said this in a feeble voice:
68_8.word_by_word: अनन्तरम् incessantly, दीनात्मा a piteous soul, जटायुः Jatayu, विलपन्तम् wailing, रामम् to Rama, उद्वीक्ष्य seeing, अथ this, अतिसन्नया in a faint voice, वाचा spoke, इदम् these, अब्रवीत् said.

68_9.shloka: हृता सा राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन विहायसा।मायामास्थाय विपुलां वातदुर्दिनसङ्कुलाम्।।3.68.9।।
68_9.translation: Ravana, the lord of the demons created violent winds through terrific magic and whisked her away in the sky.
68_9.word_by_word: सा she, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the lord of demons, रावणेन by Ravana, वातदुर्दिनसङ्कुलाम् violent wind, विपुलाम् huge, मायाम् magic, आस्थाय creating, विहायसा in the sky, हृता taken away.

68_10.shloka: परिश्रान्तस्य मे तात पक्षौ छित्वा स राक्षसः।सीतामादाय वैदेहीं प्रयातो दक्षिणां दिशम्।।3.68.10।।
68_10.translation: O my child  when I was exhausted, that demon cut off my wings and carried Sita off in the southern direction.
68_10.word_by_word: तात O my child, सः राक्षसः that demon, परिश्रान्तस्य when I was exhausted, मे myself, पक्षौ wings, छित्त्वा after cutting, वैदेहीम् princess of Videha, सीताम् Sita, आदाय taking,दक्षिणां दिशम् southern, प्रयातः went.

68_11.translation: O scion of the Raghu race, I am gasping for breath. My eyes are reeling. I see root hair growing on the tops of golden trees.
68_11.word_by_word: राघव Rama, मे my, प्राणाः life, उपरुध्यन्ति obstructing, दृष्टिः sight, भ्रमति is reeling, अनुशीरकृतमूर्धजान् root hair grown on tops, सौवर्णान् golden , वृक्षान् trees, पश्यामि I see.

68_12.shloka: येन याति मुहूर्तेन सीतामादाय रावणः।विप्रणष्टं धनं क्षिप्रं तत्स्वामी प्रतिपद्यते।।3.68.12।।विन्दो नाम मुहूर्तोऽयं स च काकुत्स्थ नाबुधत्।
68_12.translation: The time Ravana kidnapped Sita is known as 'Vinda'. The effect (of that time), is that her husband will regain his lost wealth. O scion of the Kakutstha race  he (Ravana )did not know it.
68_12.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, रावणः Ravana, येन मुहूर्तेन by such moment, सीताम् Sita, आदाय taking, याति he, अयम् this, विन्द: Vinda, नाम by name, मुहूर्तः time, विनष्टम् lost, धनम् wealth, तत्स्वामी that person, क्षिप्रम् quickly, प्रतिपद्यते will obtain, सः च and he, नाबुधत् did not know.

68_13.shloka: त्वत्प्रियां जानकीं हृत्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।।3.68.13।।झषवद्बडिशं गृह्य क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यति।
68_13.translation: Ravana, king of the demons, will perish soon for running away with your beloved Janaki just like a fish carrying away a fishhook (which causes its destruction).
68_13.word_by_word: राक्षसेश्वरः lord of the demons, रावणः Ravana, त्वत्प्रियाम् your beloved, जानकीम् Janaki, हृत्वा after carrying away, बडिशम् fish hook, गृह्य having picked up, झषवत् like the fish, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, विनश्यति will be destroyed.

68_14.shloka: न च त्वया व्यथा कार्या जनकस्य सुतां प्रति।।3.68.14।।वैदेह्या रंस्यसे क्षिप्रं हत्वा तं राक्षसं रणे।
68_14.translation: You need not worry about Janaka's daughter. You will soon enjoy the company of your beloved, Vaidehi after killing that demon.
68_14.word_by_word: त्वया by you, जनकस्य सुतां Janaka's daughter, प्रति with regard to, व्यथा worry, न कार्या need not be, रणे in battle, तं राक्षसम् that demon, क्षिप्रम् soon, हत्वा having slain, वैदेह्या with Vaidehi, रंस्यसे will sport.

68_15.shloka: असम्मूढस्य गृध्रस्य रामं प्रत्यनुभाषतः।।3.68.15।।आस्यात्सुस्राव रुधिरं म्रियमाणस्य सामिषम्।
68_15.translation: As he(Jatayu) was speaking to Rama with an alert mind even while dying, blood mixed with flesh started oozing from Jatayu's mouth.
68_15.word_by_word: रामं प्रति with Rama, अनुभाषतः conversing, असम्मूढस्य of the bird that was not deluded, म्रियमाणस्य while dying, गृध्रस्य vulture's, आस्यात् from his mouth, सामिषम् mixed with flesh, रुधिरम् blood, सुस्राव dripped.

68_16.shloka: पुत्रो विश्रवसस्साक्षाद्भ्राता वैश्रवणस्य च।।3.68.16।।इत्युक्त्वा दुर्लभान्प्राणान्मुमोच पतगेश्वरः।
68_16.translation: Ravana was Visrava's son and Vaisravana's (Kubera's) brother, said Jatayu and gave up his rare life.
68_16.word_by_word: विश्रवसः Visrava's, पुत्रः son, वैश्रवणस्य साक्षात् Vaisravana's lawful, भ्राता brother, इति thus,उक्त्वा said, पतगेश्वरः Jatayu, the king of birds, दुर्लभान्  rare, प्राणान् life, मुमोच gave up.

68_17.shloka: ब्रूहि ब्रूहीति रामस्य ब्रुवाणस्य कृताञ्जलेः।।3.68.17।।त्वक्त्वा शरीरं गृध्रस्य जग्मुः प्राणा विहायसम्।
68_17.translation: As Rama was saying to the vulture with folded palms 'Tell me, tell me'( about Ravana) the life breath of the vulture soared into the sky leaving the body.
68_17.word_by_word: कृताञ्जलेः waiting with folded palms, रामस्य Rama's, ब्रुहि ब्रुहि इति saying 'tell me, tell me', ब्रुवाणस्य as he spoke so, गृध्रस्य of the vulture, प्राणाः life, शरीरम् body, त्वक्त्वा after leaving, विहायसम् to the sky, जग्मुः went.

68_18.shloka: स निक्षिप्य शिरो भूमौ प्रसार्य चरणौ तदा।।3.68.18।।विक्षिप्य च शरीरं स्वं पपात धरणीतले।
68_18.translation: Then Jatayu dropped his head down, his feet thrown about, his body outstretched on earth.
68_18.word_by_word: सः Jatayu, तदा then, शिरः head, भूमौ on the ground, निक्षिप्य after throwing, चरणौ feet, प्रसार्य stretching, स्वम् his, शरीरम् body, धरणीतले on the ground, विक्षिप्य scattering, पपात fallen down.

68_19.translation: Stricken with deep grief, his eyes red (with tears) Rama saw the vulture looking like a mountain. Seeing him dead, he said to Lakshmana:
68_19.word_by_word: सुबहुभिः with much, दुःखै: with sorrow, दीनः dejected, रामः Rama, ताम्राक्षम् eyes red (with tears), गतासुम् with his life gone, अचलोपमम् looking like a mountain, तं गृध्रम् to that vulture, प्रेक्ष्य  seeing, सौमित्रिम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

68_20.shloka: बहूनि रक्षसां वासे वर्षाणि वसता सुखम्।।3.68.20।।अनेन दण्डकारण्ये विशीर्णमिह पक्षिणा।
68_20.translation: Dwelling for many years happily in Dandaka forest, the abode of demons, the bird lost his life (on our account).
68_20.word_by_word: रक्षसाम् the demon's, वासे dwellingplace, इह here, दण्डकारण्ये Dandaka forest, सुखम् happily, बहूनि many, वर्षाणि years, वसता living, अनेन by this, पक्षिणा by the bird, विशीर्णम् lost life.

68_21.shloka: अनेकवार्षिको यस्तु चिरकालसमुत्थितः।।3.68.21।।सोऽयमद्य हतश्शेते कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः।
68_21.translation: This Jatayu, who lived for long years, is lying dead now. (The dictate of) destiny is inescapable.
68_21.word_by_word: अनेकवार्षिकः many years old, यः he, चिरकालसमुत्थितः lived for a long time, सः अयम् this Jatayu, अद्य now, हतः dead, शेते lying down, कालः time (fate), दुरतिक्रमः हि not possible to escape.

68_22.shloka: पश्य लक्ष्मण गृध्रोऽयमुपकारी हतश्च मे।।3.68.22।।सीतामभ्यवपन्नो वै रावणेन बलीयसा।
68_22.translation: O Lakshmana, see this Jatayu, my benefactor, killed by the powerful Ravana while he was reaching out to help Sita.
68_22.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, सीताम् Sita, अभ्यवपन्नः he reached out for help, मे उपकारी my wellwisher, अयं गृध्रः this vulture, बलीयसा by the powerful, रावणेन by Ravana, हतः is killed, पश्य see.

68_23.shloka: गृध्रराज्यं परित्यज्य पितृपैतामहं महत्।।3.68.23।।मम हेतोरयं प्राणान्मुमोच पतगेश्वरः।
68_23.translation: This lord of the birds left his ancestral kingdom of viltures and gave up life for my sake.
68_23.word_by_word: अयं पतगेश्वरः this lord of the birds, पितृपैतामहम् ancestral, महत् great, गृध्रराज्यम् kingdom of vultures, परित्यज्य  left, मम हेतोः for my sake, प्राणान् life, मुमोच gave up.

68_24.translation: O Lakshmana valiant souls and protectors, being righteous and honest are found even among animals and birds.
68_24.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Lakshmana, शूराः heroes, शरण्याः protectors, धर्मचारिणः rigteous people, साधवः good people, सर्वत्र all over, तिर्यग्योनिगतेष्वपि even among animals and birds, दृश्यन्ते खलु are seen.

68_25.shloka: सीताहरणजं दुःखं न मे सौम्य तथाविधम्।।3.68.25।।यथा विनाशे गृध्रस्य मत्कृते च परन्तप।
68_25.translation: O scorcher of enemies, O handsome Lakshmana the grief I experience due to Jatayu's death on my account is more intense than Sita's abduction.
68_25.word_by_word: परन्तप O scorcher of enemies, सौम्य handsome one, गृध्रस्य bird's, विनाशे at his death, मत्कृते च for my sake, यथा as, सीताहरणजम् caused by the abduction of Sita, दुःखम् grief, तथाविधम् in that way, न not experienced.

68_26.shloka: राजा दशरथश्श्रीमान्यथा मम महायशाः।।3.68.26।।पूजनीयश्च मान्यश्च तथाऽयं पतगेश्वरः।
68_26.translation: This lord of the birds for me is as worthy of reverence and honour as the famous and prosperous king Dasaratha.
68_26.word_by_word: महायशाः illustrious, श्रीमान् prosperous, राजा king, दशरथः Dasaratha, मम for me, यथा as, पूजनीयश्च worthy of reverence, मान्यश्च worthy of honour, अयम् this, पतगेश्वरः lord of the birds, तथा in the same way.

68_27.shloka: सौमित्रे हर काष्ठानि निर्मथिष्यामि पावकम्।।3.68.27।।गृध्रराजं दिधक्षामि मत्कृते निधनं गतम्।
68_27.translation: O Saumitri  fetch firewood. I shall generate fire by rubbing them and cremate the king of the birds who has laid down his life for my sake.
68_27.word_by_word: सौमित्रे Saumitri, काष्ठानि firewood, हर fetch, पावकम् fire, निर्मथिष्यामि I will rub, मत्कृते for my sake, निधनम् गतम् died, गृध्रराजम् king of the birds, दिधक्षामि I wish to burn.

68_28.shloka: नाथं पतगलोकस्य चितामारोप्य राघव।।3.68.28।।इमं धक्ष्यामि सौमित्रे हतं रौद्रेण रक्षसा।
68_28.translation: O scion of the Raghus  I will place the body of the lord of the world of birds, killed by the fierce demon, on the funeral pyre and crimate him with honour.
68_28.word_by_word: राघव O scion of the Raghu race, सौमित्रे Saumitri, रौद्रेण by the fierce, रक्षसा demon, हतम् killed, इमम् this, पतगलोकस्य नाथम् lord of the world of birds, चिताम् funeral pyre, आरोप्य placing, धक्ष्यामि I will cremate with honour.

68_29.shloka: या गतिर्यज्ञशीलानामाहिताग्नेश्च या गतिः।।3.68.29।।अपरावर्तिनां या च या च भूमिप्रदायिनाम्।मया त्वं समनुज्ञातो गच्छ लोकाननुत्तमान्।।3.68.30।।गृध्रराज महासत्त्व संस्कृतश्च मया व्रज।
68_29.translation: O mighty lord of the birds  by my grace attain the state of those who perform sacrifices, who kindle and maintain sacrificial fires, who beat no retreat from the battlefield and who offer land in charity. Purified by my offering of fire, you may depart for the best of the worlds.
68_29.word_by_word: महासत्त्व very strong, गृध्रराज king of the birds, मया by me, समनुज्ञातः permitted, त्वम् you, यज्ञशीलानाम of those who perform sacrifices, या such, गतिः resort, आहिताग्नेश्च for him who kindles sacrificial fires, या गतिः attainment, अपरावर्तिनाम् of those who beat no retreat (from battle), या च and such state, भूमिप्रदायिनाम् for those who offer land in charity, या च that state, गच्छ go, मया by me, संस्कृतः च purified, अनुत्तमान् best of, लोकान् worlds, व्रज depart.

68_30.shloka: एवमुक्त्वा चितां दीप्तामारोप्य पतगेश्वरम्।।3.68.31।।ददाह रामो धर्मात्मा स्वबन्धुमिव दुःखितः।
68_30.translation: Thus said, righteous Rama laid him on the pyre and sadly cremated the lord of the birds as one would do to his own relative.
68_30.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having said, पतगेश्वरम् lord of birds, चिताम् on the pyre, आरोप्य having laid, दुःखितः sorrowful, स्वबन्धुमिव like his own relation, ददाह cremated.

68_31.shloka: रामोऽथ सहसौमित्रिर्वनं गत्वा स वीर्यवान्।।3.68.32।।स्थूलान्हत्वा महारोहीननुतस्तार तं द्विजम्।
68_31.translation: Then the mighty Rama, accompanied by Saumitri, got into the forest and killed a hugedeer, brought it and spread it as an offering (to the dead Jatayu).
68_31.word_by_word: अथ then, वीर्यवान् mighty, रामः Rama, सहसौमित्रिः with Saumitri, वनम् forest, गत्वा after going, स्थूलान् large, महारोहीन् stately deer, हत्वा killed, तं द्विजम् to that bird (Jatayu), अनुतस्तार spread it as offering.

68_32.shloka: रोहिमांसानि चोत्कृत्य पेशीकृत्य महायशाः।।3.68.33।।शकुनाय ददौ रामो रम्ये हरितशाद्वले।
68_32.translation: Tearing the flesh of the deer to pieces and making them  into balls, the celebrated Rama laid it on a lovely, green grassy land as offering to the bird.
68_32.word_by_word: महायशाः famed, रामः Rama, रोहिमांसानि flesh of the deer, उत्कृत्य cutting to pieces, पेशीकृत्य making into balls, रम्ये in a lovely, हरितशाद्वले green, grassy land, शकुनाय the bird Jatayu, ददौ offered.

68_33.shloka: यत्तत्प्रेतस्य मर्त्यस्य कथयन्ति द्विजातयः।।3.68.34।।तत्स्वर्गगमनं तस्य पित्र्यं रामो जजाप ह।
68_33.translation: Rama muttered the mantras recommended by brahmins for dead mortals as one would do for his father, to help him ascend to heaven.
68_33.word_by_word: तत् that, यत् whatever, द्विजातयः brahmins, प्रेतस्य for the dead, मर्त्यस्य for a mortal, स्वर्गगमनम् for ascending to heaven, कथयन्ति they utter, तत् all that, पित्र्यम् pertaining to father, तस्य that, जजाप muttered.

68_34.shloka: ततो गोदावरीं गत्वा नदीं नरवरात्मजौ।।3.68.35।।उदकं चक्रतुस्तस्मै गृध्रराजाय तावुभौ।
68_34.translation: Then both the princes went down to river Godavari and offered libations for the king of vultures.
68_34.word_by_word: ततः then, उभौ तौ they both, नरवरात्मजौ two princes, गोदावरीं नदीम् to river Godavari, गत्वा after reaching, तस्मै for him, गृद्रराजाय for the vultureking, उदकम् libations, चक्रतुः offered.

68_35.shloka: शास्त्रदृष्टेन विधिना जले गृध्राय राघवौ।।3.68.36।।स्नात्वा तौ गृध्रराजाय उदकं चक्रतुस्तदा।
68_35.translation: Thereafter both the scions of the Raghu dynasty bathed in water, offered libations for the king of vultures as ordained in the scriptures.
68_35.word_by_word: तदा thereafter, (तौ) राघवौ both scions of the Raghu dynasty, शास्त्रदृष्टेन as ordained in scriptures, विधिना duly, गृध्राय for the vulture, जले in water, स्नात्वा bathing, गृध्रराजाय to the king of vultures, उदकम् water, चक्रतुः offered.

68_36.shloka: स गृध्रराजः कृतवान्यशस्करं सुदुष्करं कर्म रणे निपातितः।महर्षिकल्पेन च संस्कृतस्तदा जगाम पुण्यां गतिमात्मनश्शुभाम्।।3.68.37।।
68_36.translation: The king of vultures had performed a very difficult and glorious feat by laying down his life fighting. Sanctified by Rama's offering as laid down in scriptures by the seers, he attained a holy, auspicious and divine state of the self.
68_36.word_by_word: रणे in battle, सुदुष्करम् very difficult feat, यशस्करम् glorious, कर्म deed, कृतवान् done, निपातितः was made to fall, सः गृध्रराजः that lord of the vultures, तदा then, महर्षिकल्पेन following the prescription of sages, संस्कृतः sanctified, पुण्याम् holy, शुभाम् auspicious, आत्मनः his, गतिम् state, जगाम reached.

68_37.shloka: कृतोदकौ तावपि पक्षिसत्तमे स्थिरां च बुद्धिं प्रणिधाय जग्मतुः।प्रवेश्य सीताधिगमे ततो मनो वनं सुरेन्द्रविव विष्णुवासवौ।।3.68.38।।
68_37.translation: Rama and Lakshmana, like two lords of gods, Indra and Visnu, offered libations for the great bird with their settled minds and concentrated and then entered deeper into the forest turning their attention to the search for Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyeighth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
68_37.word_by_word: तौ अपि they both, कृतोदकौ  offering libation, पक्षिसत्तमे to the great bird, स्थिराम् settled, बुद्धिम् mind, प्रणिधाय employing their attention, ततः then, सीताधिगमे to search Sita, मनः mind, प्रवेश्य  entered , सुरेन्द्रौ like two lords of gods, विष्णुवासवाविव like Visnu and Indra, वनम् forest, जग्मतुः went.

69_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana proceed to search Sita -- Lakshmana punishes Ayomukhi -- Kabandha seizes Rama and Lakshmana -- Rama's lamentations at the calamity -- Lakshmana gets unnerved]कृत्वैवमुदकं तस्मै प्रस्थितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।अवेक्षन्तौ वने सीतां पश्चिमां जग्मतुर्दिशम्।।3.69.1।।
69_1.translation: Rama and Lakshmana offered libations (for Jatayu) and went westward, looking for Sita in the forest.
69_1.word_by_word: एवम् thus, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, तस्मै for him, उदकं कृत्वा after offering libation, प्रस्थितौ both started, पश्चिमाम् westward, दिशम् direction, वने in the forest, सीताम् Sita, अवेक्षन्तौ while both searching and looking, जग्मतुः went .

69_2.shloka: तौ दिशं दक्षिणां गत्वा शरचापासिधारिणौ।अविप्रहतमैक्ष्वाकौ पन्थानं प्रतिपेदतुः।।3.69.2।।
69_2.translation: Wielding bow, arrows and sword, both the princes of the Ikshvaku race went southward and entered an untrodden (densely wooded) tract.
69_2.word_by_word: शरचापासिधारिणौ wielding bows, arrows and swords, तौ both, ऐक्ष्वाकौ two princes of the Ikshvaku race, (ताम् that), दक्षिणाम् southward, दिशम् direction, गत्वा went, अविप्रहतम् untrodden, पन्थानम् path, प्रतिपेदतुः reached.

69_3.shloka: गुल्मैर्वृक्षैश्च बहुभिर्लताभिश्च प्रवेष्टितम्।आवृतं सर्वतो दुर्गं गहनं घोरदर्शनम्।।3.69.3।।
69_3.translation: It was a dense, impenetrable and dreadful forest covered with shrubs, trees and creepers spread all over.
69_3.word_by_word: बहुभिः by many, गुल्मैः by shrubs, वृक्षैश्च and  by trees, लताभिश्च and by creepers, प्रवेष्टितम् overgrown, सर्वतः all over, आवृतम् covered, दुर्गम् difficult to reach, गहनम् impenetrable,घोरदर्शनम् appearing ferocious

69_4.shloka: व्यतिक्रम्य तु वेगेन व्यालसिंहनिषेवितम्।सुभीमं तन्महारण्यं व्यतियातौ महाबलौ।।3.69.4।।
69_4.translation: The two mighty heroes swiftly forged through the great forest, which was an abode of serpents and lions.
69_4.word_by_word: महाबलौ two mighty princes, व्यालसिंहनिषेवितम् where serperts and lions dwell, सुभीमम् very fierceful, तत् that, महारण्यम् great forest, वेगेन swiftly, व्यतिक्रम्य after forging through, व्यतियातौ  both crossed over.

69_5.shloka: ततः परं जनस्थानातत्रिक्रोशं गम्य राघवौ।क्रौञ्चारण्यं विविशतुर्गहनं तौ महौजसौ।।3.69.5।।
69_5.translation: Both the mighty princes of the Raghu dynasty covered a distance of three krosas from Janasthana and entered the impassable kraunchaforest.
69_5.word_by_word: ततः then, परम् later, महौजसौ mighty, तौ they both, राघवौ two scions of the Raghus, जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, त्रिक्रोशम् three krosas distance (one krosa  2 miles), गम्य after going, गहनम् impassable, क्रौञ्चारण्यम् kraunchaforest, विविशतुः entered.

69_6.shloka: नानामेघघनप्रख्यं प्रहृष्टमिव सर्वतः।नानापक्षिगणैर्युक्तं नानाव्यालमृगैर्युतम्।।3.69.6।।दिदृक्षमाणौ वैदेहीं तद्वनं तौ विचिक्यतुः।तत्र तत्रावतिष्ठन्तौ सीताहरणकर्शितौ।।3.69.7।।
69_6.translation: Tormented due to abduction of Sita, the two princes anxious to see her searched all over the dense forest stopping here and there on the way. The thick forest looked like a conglomeration of big clouds. It was filled with different kinds of birds, snakes and animals.
69_6.word_by_word: सीताहरणकर्शितौ both tormented  by the abduction of Sita, तौ they two, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, दिदृक्षमाणौ eager to see, तत्र there, अवतिष्ठन्तौ both stopping a while, नानामेघघनप्रख्यम्  looking like dense clouds, सर्वतः all over, प्रहृष्टमिव as if it was over joyed, नानापक्षिगणैः with different birds, युक्तम्  filled, नानाव्यालमृगैः by various snakes and animals, युतम् filled with, तत् that, वनम् forest, विचिक्यतुः they both searched.

69_7.shloka: ततः पूर्वेण तौ गत्वा त्रिक्रोशं भ्रातरौ तदा।क्रौञ्चारण्यमतिक्रम्य मतङ्गाश्रममन्तरा।।3.69.8।।दृष्ट्वा तु तद्वनं घोरं बहुभीममृगद्विजम्।ननासत्त्वसमाकीर्णं सर्वं गहनपादपम्।।3.69.9।।ददृशाते तु तौ तत्र दरीं दशरथात्मजौ।पातालसमगम्भीरां तमसा नित्यसंवृताम्।।3.69.10।।
69_7.translation: Then both the sons of Dasaratha, went further east, crossed the kraunchaforest after three krosas. They saw a dreadful forest which was full of fierce animals and birds near the hermitage of sage Matanga. It was densely covered with trees. They saw there a cave perpetually enveloped in darkness which was as deep as the netherworld.
69_7.word_by_word: तदा then, भ्रातरौ the two brothers, तौ दशरथात्मजौ the two sons of Dasaratha, ततः then, पूर्वेण by eastern direction, त्रिक्रोशम् three krosas distance, गत्वा went, क्रौञ्चारण्यम्  kraunchaforest, अतिक्रम्य  crossed, मतङ्गाश्रमम् अन्तरा near the hermitage of sage Matanga, घोरम् terrific, बहुभीममृगद्विजम् filled with fearful beasts and birds, नानासत्त्वसमाकीर्णम् teeming with different kinds of creatures, गहनपादपम् dense trees, सर्वम् all, तत् that, वनम् forest, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तत्र there, (गिरौ  on the hill), पातालसमगम्भीराम् deep like the nether world, तमसा darkness, नित्यसंवृताम् always filled with, दरीम् cave, ददृशाते both saw.

69_8.shloka: आसाद्य तौ नरव्याघ्रौ दर्यास्तस्याविदूरतः।ददृशाते महारूपां राक्षसीं विकृताननाम्।।3.69.11।।
69_8.translation: Both the princes,the best among men, reached the cave and saw a huge demoness with a disfigured face not far from the cave.
69_8.word_by_word: तौ  both of them, नरव्याघ्रौ best among men, आसाद्य  reached, तस्याः from that, दर्याः from the cave, विदूरतः not very far from that place, महारूपाम् a woman of huge size, विकृताननाम् a woman of disfigured face, राक्षसीम् demoness, ददृशाते both saw.

69_9.shloka: भयदामल्पसत्त्वानां बीभत्सां रौद्रदर्शनाम्।लम्बोदरीं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रां करालीं परुषत्वचम्।।3.69.12।।भक्षयन्तीं मृगान्भीमान्विकटां मुक्तमूर्धजाम्।प्रैक्षेतां तौ ततस्तत्र भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.69.13।।
69_9.translation: Then the two brothers saw a fearful demoness who could strike terror in the mind of the timid, an uncouth figure with huge curved skins, with a big stomach, dishevelled hair, sharp and long teeth, devouring wild animals.
69_9.word_by_word: ततः then, भ्रातरौ both brothers, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, अल्पसत्त्वानाम् for the timid, भयदाम् one creating fear, बीभत्साम् a woman of uncouth appearance, रौद्रदर्शनाम्    a woman of terrific appearance, लम्बोदरीम् a woman of big stomach, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्राम् a woman with sharp teeth, करालीम् terrific woman, भीमान् fearful, मृगान् animals, भक्षयन्तीम् was eating, विकटाम् who had huge curved skins, मुक्तमूर्धजाम् a woman with hair spread out, तत्र there, प्रैक्षेताम् saw.

69_10.shloka: सा समासाद्य तौ वीरौ व्रजन्तं भ्रातुरग्रतः।एहि रंस्यावहेत्युक्त्वा समालम्बत लक्ष्मणम्।।3.69.14।।
69_10.translation: She came close to them, held Lakshmana who was walking ahead of his brother and said Come, let us enjoy.
69_10.word_by_word: सा she, वीरौ both heroes, तौ both, समासाद्य  coming close, एहि come on, रंस्यावहे we will both sport and enjoy sex, इति thus, उक्त्वा said, भ्रातुः brother's, अग्रतः in front of, व्रजन्तम्moving, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, समालम्बत held.

69_11.shloka: उवाच चैनं वचनं सौमित्रिमुपगूह्य सा।अहं त्वयोमुखी नाम लब्धा ते त्वमसि प्रियः।।3.69.15।।नाथ पर्वतकूटेषु नदीनां पुलिनेषु च।आयुश्शेषमिमं वीर त्वं मया सह रंस्यसे।।3.69.16।।
69_11.translation: Taking hold of Saumitri the demoness said 'I am Ayomukhi and I have been obtained by you. You got me, O hero, O lord  For the rest of your life you will sport with me on the lofty hills and river banks.'
69_11.word_by_word: सा she, सौमित्रिम् to Saumitri, उपगुह्य took hold of, एनम् him, वचनम् words, उवाच च spoke, अहं तु I am, अयोमुखी नाम Ayomukhi by name, ते to you, लब्धा obtained by you, त्वम् him, प्रियः dear, वीर hero, नाथ lord, इमम् this, आयुःशेषम् rest of your  life, त्वम् you, मया सह with me, पर्वतकूटेषु on the lofty hills, नदीनाम् पुलिनेषु  च on the river banks, रंस्यसे you will enjoy.

69_12.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु कुपितः खड्गमुद्धृत्य लक्ष्मणः।कर्णनासास्तनं तस्या निचकर्तारिसूदनः।।3.69.17।।
69_12.translation: Thus addressed, Lakshmana, subduer of enemies, became angry, took out the sword and cut off her ears, nose and breasts.
69_12.word_by_word: एवम् thus, उक्तः having been told, अरिसूदनः subduer of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, कुपितः became angry, खड्गम् sword, उद्धृत्य after lifting, तस्याः her, कर्णनासास्तनम् ears, nose and breasts, चकर्त cut off.

69_13.shloka: कर्णनासे निकृत्ते तु विस्वरं सा विनद्य च।यथागतं प्रदुद्राव राक्षसी भीमदर्शना।।3.69.18।।
69_13.translation: When the ears and nose of the frightening demoness were cut off she shouted in a fierce tone and ran away in the direction she had come from.
69_13.word_by_word: भीमदर्शना a woman of frightening appearance, सा राक्षसी that demoness, कर्णनासे ears and nose, निकृत्ते when they were cut, विस्वरम् with cracked voice, विनद्य after shouting, यथागतम् in the same way as she came, प्रदुद्राव ran away.

69_14.shloka: तस्यां गतायां गहनं व्रजन्तौ वनमोजसा।आसेदतुरमित्रघ्नौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.69.19।।
69_14.translation: The destroyers of enemies, Rama and Lakshmana of great valour went through the dense forest after she ran away.
69_14.word_by_word: तस्याम् when she, गतायाम् went away, व्रजन्तौ as both were advancing, भ्रातरौ two brothers, अमित्रघ्नौ both being destroyers of enemies, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, ओजसा with their might, गहनम् dense, वनम् woods, आसेदतुः reached.

69_15.shloka: लक्ष्मणस्तु महातेजास्सत्त्ववान् शीलवान् शुचिः।अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं भ्रातरं दीप्ततेजसम्।।3.69.20।।
69_15.translation: Lakshmana of great brilliance and power, of good conduct and pure character spoke to his highly effulgent brother with folded hands:
69_15.word_by_word: महातेजाः of great brilliance, सत्त्ववान् a powerful one, शीलवान् a man of good conduct, शुचिः pure, लक्ष्मणस्तु Lakshmna too, प्राञ्जलिः with folded hands, दीप्ततेजसम् glowing in splendour, भ्रातरम् his brother, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.

69_16.shloka: स्पन्दते च दृढं बाहुरुद्विग्नमिव मे मनः।प्रायशश्चाप्यनिष्टानि निमित्तान्युपलक्षये।।3.69.21।।
69_16.translation: My arm is throbbing heavily. My mind is agitated. The omens I see foretell some undesirable events.
69_16.word_by_word: मे my, बाहुः arm, दृढम् strongly, स्पन्दते is throbbing, मनः mind, उद्विग्नमिव is as if agitated, प्रायशः probably, अनिष्टानि undesirable ones, निमित्तानि omens, उपलक्षये I am observing.

69_17.shloka: तस्मात्सज्जीभवार्य त्वं कुरुष्व वचनं हितम्।ममैव हि निमित्तानि सद्यश्शंसन्ति सम्भ्रमम्।।3.69.22।।
69_17.translation: O noble brother be alert. Heed my words of good advice. The bad omens I see presage perils.
69_17.word_by_word: आर्य O noble one, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, सज्जीभव be ready, हितम् good, वचनम् words, कुरुष्व you may act upon, निमित्तानि omens, सद्यः presently, सम्भ्रमम् fear, मम I am, शंसन्ति इव हि as though they are forecasting.

69_18.shloka: एष वञ्चुलको नाम पक्षी परमदारुणः।आवयोर्विजयं युद्धे शंसन्निव विनर्दति।।3.69.23।।
69_18.translation: This vanchulaka bird's loud and dreadful screams suggest our triumph in war.
69_18.word_by_word: परमदारुणः extremely dreadful, वञ्चुलको नाम  by name Vanchulaka, एषः पक्षी this bird, युद्धे in strife, आवयोः both of us, विजयम् triumph, शंसन्निव as though telling, विनर्दति cries loudly.

69_19.shloka: तयोरन्वेषतोरेवं सर्वं तद्वनमोजसा।संजज्ञे विपुलः शब्दो प्रभञ्जन्निव तद्वनम्।।3.69.24।।
69_19.translation: As both the brothers with great prowess were searching for Sita all over, a hugesound exploded as if shattering the forest.
69_19.word_by_word: तयोः both, एवम् in that manner, ओजसा with strength, सर्वम् all over, तत् वनम् that forest, अन्वेषतोः while both were searching, तत् वनम् that forest, प्रभञ्जन्निव as if shattering, विपुलः very big, शब्दः sound, संजज्ञे broke out.

69_20.translation: It appeared as though a fierce wind rose from the forest and filled the sky.
69_20.word_by_word: गगनम् sky, अत्यर्थम् very much, मातरिश्वना by fierce wind, संवेष्टितमिव was as if covered, तस्य of that, वनस्य of the forest, शब्दः sound, दिवम् sky, आपूरयन्निव was filling, अभूत् rose.

69_21.shloka: तं शब्दं काङ्क्षमाणस्तु रामः कक्षे सहानुजः।ददर्श सुमहाकायं राक्षसं विपुलोदरम्।।3.69.26।।
69_21.translation: While looking for the sound, Rama with his brother saw a demon with a huge body and a big belly.
69_21.word_by_word: तं शब्दम् that sound, काङ्क्षमाणः a man looking for it, सहानुजः along with his brother, रामः Rama, कक्षे on the side, सुमहाकायम् one with a huge body, विपुलोदरम् and a big belly, राक्षसम् demon, ददर्श saw.

69_22.shloka: आसेदतुस्ततस्तत्र तावुभौ प्रमुखे स्थितम्।विवृद्धमशिरोग्रीवं कबन्धमुदरे मुखम्।।3.69.27।।
69_22.translation: Then both the brothers saw a very tall figure with a trunk that stood facing them. He had neither neck nor head. His face was in the stomach.
69_22.word_by_word: ततः then, तौ उभौ both of them, तत्र there, प्रमुखे in front, स्थितम् stood, विवृद्धम् very well grown, अशिरोग्रीवम् without head and neck, उदरे मुखम् with his face in the stomach, कबन्धम् trunk, आसेदतुः reached.

69_23.translation: With sharp bristled hair all over the body, he was a mammoth figure who looked like a mountain  resembling a dark cloud with his voice like the thunder.
69_23.word_by_word: निचितैः by those spread all over the body, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp bristles, रोमभिः hair, उच्छ्रिचतम् mammoth figure, महागिरिमिव like a big mountain, नीलमेघनिभम् resembling a dark cloud, रौद्रम् a fierce one, मेघस्तनितनिस्वनम् voice like the thunder of the cloud.

69_24.shloka: अग्निज्वालानिकाशेन ललाटस्थेन दीप्यता।महापक्ष्मेण पिङ्गेन विपुलेनायतेन च।।3.69.29।।एकेनोरसि घोरेण नयनेनाशुदर्शिना।महादंष्ट्रोपपन्नं तल्लेलिहानं महामुखम्।।3.69.30।।
69_24.translation: He had a single eye that was reddishbrown in colour resembling flaming fire. It was fixed in the chest. His eyelashes glowed. He had instant vision with massive fangs in his huge mouth. He was licking his lips.
69_24.word_by_word: अग्निज्वालानिकाशेन resembling the flaming fire, ललाटस्थेन on the forehead, दीप्यता by the glowing, महापक्ष्मेण with huge eyelashes, पिङ्गेन with reddishbrown colour, विपुलेन huge, आयतेन च stretched , आशुदर्शिना with instant vision, घोरेण terrific one, उरसि on the chest, एकेन one, नयनेन eye, महादंष्ट्रोपपन्नम् having massive fangs, लेलिहानम् while licking his lips, महामुखम् his huge mouth, तम् him

69_25.translation: The terrific demon kept eating bears, lions, deer and elephants, catching with both his arms stretching up to one yojana.
69_25.word_by_word: महाघोरान् terrific, ऋक्षसिंहमृगद्विपान् bears, lions, deer and elephants, भक्षयन्तम् while eating, योजनम् a Yojana (eight miles), आयतौ long ones, घोरौ both frightening, उभौ both, भूजौ two arms, विकुर्वाणम् as he was stretching.

69_26.translation: He stood rooted there, catching bears, flocks of birds and deer with both his hands stretching up to one yojana, pulling and pushing them. (Now) he obstructed the path of the two brothers.
69_26.word_by_word: ऋक्षान् bears, विविधान् various, पक्षिगणान् birds, मृगान् deer, अनेकान् many, मृगयूथपान् herds of deer, कराभ्याम्  by both his hands, गृह्य taking, आकर्षन्तम् seizing, विकर्षन्तम् throwing  away, प्रपन्नयोः reached there, तयोः both the, भ्रात्रोः of brothers, पन्थानम् path, आवृत्य after blocking, स्थितम् stood.

69_27.shloka: अथ तौ समभिक्रम्य क्रोशमात्रे ददर्शतुः।।3.69.33।।महान्तं दारुणं भीमं कबन्धं भुजसंवृम्।कबन्धमिव संस्थानादतिघोरप्रदर्शनम्।।3.69.34।।
69_27.translation: Then the brothers after covering one krosa (2 miles) saw a cruel, fierce, mighty monster named Kabandha looking like a trunk. He had a dreadful appearance and his arms encircled the area.
69_27.word_by_word: अथ then, तौ both, समभिक्रम्य after covering, क्रोशमात्रे at a distance of one krosa (2 miles), महान्तम् mighty, दारुणम् cruel, भीमम् frightening, भुजसंवृतम् his arms encircling, संस्थानात् from his form, कबन्धमिव like a trunk, घोरप्रदर्शनम् putting is a monstrous appearance, कबन्धम् one demon, Kabandha, ददर्शतुः they both saw.

69_28.shloka: स महाबाहुरत्यर्थं प्रसार्य विपुलौ भुजौ।जग्राह सहितावेव राघवौ पीडयन्बलात्।।3.69.35।।
69_28.translation: The longarmed demon spread his hands and caught hold of Rama and Lakshmana together by pressing them with all his force.
69_28.word_by_word: महाबाहुः long armed one, सः he, विपुलौ very big, भुजौ both arms, अत्यर्थम् greatly, प्रसार्य  spreading, सहितावेव राघवौ brothers together, बलात् with strength, पीडयन्  pressing, जग्राह held.

69_29.shloka: खड्गिनौ दृढधन्वानौ तिग्मतेजोवपुर्धरौ।भ्रातरौ विवशं प्राप्तौ कृष्यमाणौ महाबलौ।।3.69.36।।
69_29.translation: The two mighty brothers who wielded swords and strong bows and whose bodies were of fiery splendour became helpless, seized by the hands of Kabandha.
69_29.word_by_word: खड्गिनौ  wielders of swords, दृढधन्वानौ  with strong bows, तिग्मतेजोवपुर्धरौ  with bodies of fiery splendour, महाबलौ mighty, भ्रातरौ both brothers, कृष्यमाणौ both being seized, विवशम् प्राप्तौ both became helpless.

69_30.shloka: तत्र धैर्येण शूरस्तु राघवो नैव विव्यथे।बाल्यादनाश्रयत्वाच्च लक्ष्मणस्त्वतिविव्यथे।।3.69.37।।उवाच स विषण्णस्सन्राघवं राघवानुजः।
69_30.translation: Of the two heroes, Rama being courageous was not worried but Lakshmana being younger and not having as much courage, was very much concerned and depressed. He said to Rama:
69_30.word_by_word: तत्र there, शूरः heroic, राघवः Raghava, धैर्येण with courage, नैव विव्यथे not pained, लक्ष्मणस्तु but Lakshmana, बाल्यात् being younger, आनाश्रयत्वाच्च not having much courage, अतिविव्यथे very worried, सः that, राघवानुजः brother of Rama, विषण्णस्सन् depressed, राघवम् to Rama, उवाच said,

69_31.shloka: पश्य मां वीर विवशं राक्षसस्य वशं गतम्।।3.69.38।।मयैकेन विनिर्युक्तः परिमुञ्चस्व राघव।
69_31.translation: O heroic Rama see how helpless I am under the control of the demon. Set yourself free, leaving me alone and using me as an offering.
69_31.word_by_word: वीर heroic Rama, विवशम् helpless, राक्षसस्य वशम् under the control of the demon, गतम् gone, माम् me, पश्य see, राघव Rama, एकेन by one alone, मया by me, विनिर्युक्तः offering me, परिमुञ्चस्व set yourself free.

69_32.shloka: मां हि भूतबलिं दत्वा पलायस्व यथासुखम्।।3.69.39।।अधिगन्तासि वैदेहीमचिरेणेति मे मतिः।
69_32.translation: Giving me to this monstor as an offering, you may run away happily. I think you will soon obtain Vaidehi.
69_32.word_by_word: माम् me, भूतबलिम् as an offering, दत्वा after giving, यथासुखम् happily, पलायस्व you may run away, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अचिरेण soon, अधिगन्तासि will attain her, इति this is, मे my, मतिः opinion.

69_33.shloka: प्रतिलभ्य च काकुत्स्थ पितृपैतामहीं महीम्।।3.69.40।।तत्र मां राम राज्यस्थस्स्मर्तुमर्हसि सर्वदा।
69_33.translation: O scion of the Kakutstha dynasty, on getting the hereditary kingdom and ruling over it you should always remember me.
69_33.word_by_word: काकुत्थ्स O scion of Kakutstha dynasty, राम Rama, पितृपैतामहीम् heriditary reign, महीम् land, प्रतिलभ्य च on getting, तत्र there, राज्यस्थः as one ruling the country, सर्वदा always, माम् me, स्मर्तुम् remember, अर्हसि should.

69_34.shloka: लक्ष्मणेनैवमुक्तस्तु रामस्सौमित्रिमब्रवीत्।।3.69.41।।मा स्म त्रासं कृथा वीर न हि त्वादृग्विषीदति।
69_34.translation: O  valiant Lakshmana, a hero like you should not get desparate. said Rama to Saumitri when he was thus entreated by Lakshmana.
69_34.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been said, रामः Rama, सौमित्रिम् to Soumitri, अब्रवीत् said, वीर heroic Lakshmana, त्रासम् fear, मा स्म कृथाः do not entertain, त्वादृक् a hero like you, न विषीदति हि  should not get desperate.

69_35.shloka: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे क्रूरो भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.69.42।।पप्रच्छ घननिर्घोषः कबन्धो दानवोत्तमः।
69_35.translation: In the meanwhile the foremost of the demons, Kabandha, rumbling like thunder questioned the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana:
69_35.word_by_word: एतस्मिन् अन्तरे in the meanwhile, क्रूरः cruel one, दानवोत्तमः foremost of the demons, कबन्धः Kabandha, घननिर्घोषः rumbling like thunder, भ्रातरौ to the brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, पप्रच्छ questioned.

69_36.shloka: कौ युवां वृषभस्कन्धौ महाखड्गधनुर्धरौ।।3.69.43।।घोरं देशमिमं प्राप्तौ मम भक्षावुपस्थितौ।
69_36.translation: Who are you with bulllike shoulders, wielding big swords, bows and arrows? By coming to this place you have become my food.
69_36.word_by_word: वृषभस्कन्धौ whose shoulders are comparable to a bull, महाखड्गधनुर्धरौ both holding great sword and bow, घोरम् dreadful, इमं देशम् this place, प्राप्तौ reached here, युवाम् you both, कौ who are you, मम for me, भक्षौ both, उपस्थितौ have reached.

69_37.shloka: वदतं कार्यमिह वां किमर्थं चागतौ युवाम्।।3.69.44।।इमं देशमनुप्राप्तौ क्षुधार्तस्येह तिष्ठतः।
69_37.translation: For what purpose have you come? What work have you here ? You have come at the right time as my food, since I am hungry.
69_37.word_by_word: इह here, वाम् to you both, कार्यम् work, वदतम् speak, युवाम् both, किमर्थम् for what purpose?, आगतौ have come, क्षुधार्तस्य for the hungry, इह here, तिष्ठतः while staying here, इमम् this, देशम् place, अनुप्राप्तौ came at the right time.

69_38.translation: Holding bows, arrows and swords, looking like bulls with pointed horns you have entered my mouth. It is impossible for you to live any more.
69_38.word_by_word: सबाणचापखड्गौ holding bows and arrows and swords, तीक्ष्णशृङ्गौ two sharp horns, ऋषभौ इव like bulls, मम my, आस्यम् mouth, अनुसम्प्राप्तौ you both have reached, पुनः again, जीवितम् lives, दुर्लभम् impossible.

69_39.shloka: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कबन्धस्य दुरात्मनः।।3.69.46।।उवाच लक्ष्मणं रामो मुखेन परिशुष्यता।
69_39.translation: On hearing the words of the evilminded Kabandha, Rama said to Lakshmana with dried up mouth:
69_39.word_by_word: दुरात्मनः of the evilminded, तस्य कबन्धस्य that Kabandha's, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, रामः Rama, परिशुष्यता by dried up, मुखेन by mouth, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmna, अब्रवीत् said:

69_40.shloka: कृच्छ्रात् कृच्छ्रतरं प्राप्य दारुणं सत्यविक्रमः।।3.69.47।।व्यसनं जीवितान्ताय प्राप्तमप्राप्य तां प्रियाम्।
69_40.translation: O Lakshmana, your valour is truth.We have gone through from one calamity to a greater one without finding the beloved Sita. Now we have landed into a terrible crisis which will put an end to our own life.
69_40.word_by_word: सत्यविक्रम  one whose valour is truth, कृच्छ्रात् from one calamity, कृच्छ्रतरम् to a greater calamity, प्राप्य having reached, प्रियाम् beloved, ताम् her, अप्राप्य having lost, जीवितान्ताय forending life, दारुणम् unbearable, व्यसनम् crisis, प्राप्तम् experienced.

69_41.shloka: कालस्य सुमहद्वीर्यं सर्वभूतेषु लक्ष्मण।।3.69.48।।त्वां च मां च नरव्याघ्र व्यसनैः पश्य मोहितौ।
69_41.translation: O tiger among men see how powerful the might of time is for all beings Just see  yourself and myself afflicted wth this great calamity.
69_41.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र tiger among men, लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सर्वभूतेषु for all beings, कालस्य of the time, वीर्यम् power, सुमहत् great, व्यसनैः by calamity, मोहितौ afflicted, त्वां च yourself, मां me, च and, पश्य see.

69_42.shloka: नातिभारोस्ति कालस्य सर्वभूतेषु लक्ष्मण।।3.69.49।।शूराश्च बलवन्तश्च कृतास्त्राश्च रणाजिरे।कालाभिपन्नास्सीदन्ति यथा वालुकसेतवः।।3.69.50।।
69_42.translation: O Lakshmana look at the power of time over all creatures There is nothing too heavy for time. Even those who know the use of arms in war, or are brave or strong enough, cannot  withstand the force of time like the barriers built with sand.
69_42.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, कालस्य of the time, सर्वभूतेषु over all creatures, अतिभारः great weight, नास्ति not there, शूराश्च brave people, बलवन्तश्च or strong men, रणाजिरे कृतास्त्राश्च those who know the use of arms in the war, कालाभिपन्नाः by the force of time, वालुकसेतवः यथा like barriers built with sand, सीदतन्ति make way.

69_43.shloka: इति ब्रुवाणो दृढसत्यविक्रमो महायशा दाशरथिः प्रतापवान्।अवेक्ष्य सौमित्रिमुदग्रपौरुषं स्थिरां तदा स्वां मतिमात्मनाऽकरोत्।।3.69.51।।
69_43.translation: Firm in the strength of truth, famous and powerful Rama, son of Dasaratha,  determined to act with a steadfast mind, spoke to Lakshmana of mighty manliness on seeing him.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकोनसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyninth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
69_43.word_by_word: दृढसत्यविक्रमः Firm in the strength of truth, महायशाः illustrious, प्रतापवान्  powerful, दाशरथिः Dasaratha's son (Rama), इति thus, ब्रुवाणः spoke, उदग्रपौरुषम् of mighty manliness, सौमित्रिम् Saumitri, अवेक्ष्य on seeing, तदा then, स्वाम् his own, स्थिराम् determined, मतिम् mind, आत्मना himself, अकरोत् fixed.

70_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana sever the arms of Kabandha-- reveal their identity to him-- Kabandha welcomes Rama and Lakshmana-- his lamentation.]तौ तु तत्र स्थितौ दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।बाहुपाशपरिक्षिप्तौ कबन्धो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।3.70.1।।
70_1.translation: Kabandha saw the brothers, Rama and Lakshmana, stand there bound by the shackles of his arms and said:
70_1.word_by_word: बाहुपाशपरिक्षिप्तौ bound by the shackles of his arms, तत्र स्थितौ both stood there, भ्रातरौ brothers, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कबन्धः Kabandha, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.

70_2.shloka: तिष्ठतः किं नु मां दृष्ट्वा क्षुधार्तं क्षत्रियर्षभौ।आहारार्थं तु सन्दिष्टौ दैवेन गतचेतसौ।।3.70.2।।
70_2.translation: O bulls among the kshatriyas You are sent by destiny as food to appease my hunger. Seeing me hungry, why do you stand there with your senses switched off ?
70_2.word_by_word: क्षत्रियर्षभौ two bulls among the kshatriyas, क्षुधार्तम् suffering from hunger, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, किं नु why do you, तिष्ठतः both stand here, गतचेतसौ with the senses lost, दैवेन by god, आहारार्थम् for my food, सन्दिष्टौ  are sent.

70_3.shloka: तच्छ्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणो वाक्यं प्राप्तकालं हितं तदा।उवाचाऽर्तिं समापन्नो विक्रमे कृतलक्षणः।।3.70.3।।
70_3.translation: Having heard this, Lakshmana, who was greatly suffering gathered courage at appropriate time and said these salutary words:
70_3.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तत् that, श्रुत्वा having heard, तदा then, आर्तिम् suffering, समापन्नः he underwent, विक्रमे  to exhibit courage, कृतलक्षणः he has resorted to, प्राप्तकालम् appropriate time, हितम् good, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

70_4.shloka: त्वां च मां च पुरा तूर्णमादत्ते राक्षसाधमः।तस्मादसिभ्यामस्याशु बाहू छिन्दावहै गुरू।।3.70.4।।
70_4.translation: Before this vile demon gulps you and me let us cut off his long arms with our swords.
70_4.word_by_word: राक्षसाधमः this vile demon, तूर्णम् quickly, त्वां च your, मां च and me, पुरा आदत्ते before he gulps, तस्मात् therefore, अस्य his, गुरू long, बाहू shoulders, असिभ्याम् by our swords, छिन्दावहै cut off.

70_5.shloka: भीषणोऽयं महाकायो राक्षसो भुजविक्रमः।लोकं ह्यतिजितं कृत्वा ह्यावां हन्तुमिहेच्छति।।3.70.5।।
70_5.translation: This huge, horrible demon with the strength of his arms has conquered the world, and now intends to kill us here.
70_5.word_by_word: भीषणः horrible, महाकायः huge, भुजविक्रमः having the strength of his arms, राक्षसः demon, लोकम् world, अतिजितम्  having conquered, कृत्वा after doing so, इह here, आवाम् us, हन्तुम् to kill, इच्छति intends.

70_6.shloka: निश्चेष्टानां वधो राजन्कुत्सितो जगतीपतेः।क्रतुमध्योपनीतानां पशूनामिव राघव।।3.70.6।।
70_6.translation: O prince of the Raghu race  just as the animal brought in the midst of a sacrifice should not be killed, so also for a king to kill any harmless creature is despicable.
70_6.word_by_word: राजन् king, राघव of the Raghu race, निश्चेष्टानाम् of harmless creatures, वधः killing, क्रतुमध्योपनीतानाम् brought in the midst of a sacrifice, पशूनामिव like animals, जगतीपतेः lord of the world, कुत्सितः censurable.

70_7.shloka: एतत्सञ्जल्पितं श्रुत्वा तयोः क्रुद्धस्तु राक्षसः।विदार्याऽस्यं तदा रौद्रस्तौ भक्षयितुमारभत्।।3.70.7।।
70_7.translation: The cruel, ferocious demon heard them talk. He opened his mouth and attempted to eat both of them.
70_7.word_by_word: क्रूरः cruel, रौद्रः ferocious, राक्षसस्तु the demon, तदा then, तयोः them, सञ्जल्पितम् conversing, श्रुत्वा having heard, आस्यम् mouth, विदार्य widely opening, तौ them, भक्षयितुम् to eat, आरभत् made an effort.

70_8.shloka: ततस्तौ देशकालज्ञौ खड्गाभ्यामेव राघवौ।अच्छिन्दतां सुसंविग्नौ बाहू तस्यांसदेशतः।।3.70.8।।
70_8.translation: Then the agitated brothers, aware of time and space, quickly pulled out their swords and cut off both his arms from the shoulders.
70_8.word_by_word: ततः then, सुसंविग्नौ became agitated, देशकालज्ञौ knowers of time and space, तौ those two, राघवौ Raghavas, खड्गाभ्याम् with their swords, तस्य his, बाहू two arms, अंसदेशतः from  the shoulders, अच्छिन्दताम् cut off.

70_9.shloka: दक्षिणो दक्षिणं बाहुमसक्तमसिना ततः।चिच्छेद रामो वेगेन सव्यं वीरस्तु लक्ष्मणः।।3.70.9।।
70_9.translation: While standing on the right, Rama cut off his right arm and the brave Lakshmana cut off the left.
70_9.word_by_word: ततः then, दक्षिणः  standing on the right, रामः Rama, असक्तम् severed, वेगेन quickly, दक्षिणं बाहुम् right arm, असिना with a sword, चिच्छेद cut off, वीरः hero, लक्ष्मणस्तु Lakshmana, सव्यम् left arm.

70_10.shloka: स पपात महाबाहुश्छिन्नबाहुर्महास्वनः।खं च गां च दिशश्चैव नादयञ्जलदो यथा।।3.70.10।।
70_10.translation: The strongarmed demon, his arms severed, rumbling like a raincloud filling the sky, the earth and the quarters, fell down.
70_10.word_by_word: महाबाहुः with strong arms, सः that, छिन्नबाहुः with his arms severed, महास्वनः roaring, जलदः यथा like a stormy cloud, खं च sky, गां च earth, दिशश्चैव quarters, नादयन् while resounding, पपात he fell down.

70_11.shloka: स निकृत्तौ भुजौ दृष्ट्वा शोणितौघपरिप्लुतः।दीनः पप्रच्छ तौ वीरौ कौ युवामिति दानवः।।3.70.11।।
70_11.translation: The demon with his arms amputated, drenched in a pool of blood  looked pathetic and asked them, Who are you?
70_11.word_by_word: सः that, दानवः demon, निकृत्तौ with amputated, भूजौ arms, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, शोणितौघपरिप्लुतः drenched in the flood of blood, दीनः a pathetic one, युवाम् you both, कौ who are you, इति thus, तौ वीरौ those two heroes, पप्रच्छ asked.

70_12.shloka: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य लक्ष्मणश्शुभलक्षणः।शशंस राघवं तस्य कबन्धस्य महात्मनः।।3.70.12।।
70_12.translation: Imbued with auspicious signs, Lakshmana revealed the identity of Rama to great Kabandha.
70_12.word_by_word: तस्य his, इति thus, ब्रुवाणस्य when he was speaking, शुभलक्षणः a man of auspicious traits, सः लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, महात्मनः of the great self, कबन्धस्य of Kabandha, राघवम् Raghava, शशंस revealed.

70_13.shloka: अयमिक्ष्वाकुदायादो रामो नाम जनैश्श्रुतः।अस्यैवावरजं विद्दि भ्रातरं मां च लक्ष्मणम्।।3.70.13।।
70_13.translation: Here is Rama, an heir of the Ikshvaku family, known to the people and I am his younger brother Lakshmana for your information.
70_13.word_by_word: अयम् he, रामो नाम by name Rama, जनैः by people, श्रुतः famous, इक्ष्वाकुदायादः an heir of the Ikshvaku family, माम् me, अस्य his, अवरजं भ्रातरम् as his younger brother, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, विद्दि you may know me,

70_14.shloka: अस्य देवप्रभावस्य वसतो विजने वने।रक्षसाऽपहृता पत्नी यामिच्छन्ताविहागतौ।।3.70.14।।
70_14.translation: He is equal to a god in prowess. While living in this desolate forest his wife has been carried off by a demon. We both came here searching for her.
70_14.word_by_word: विजने desolate, वने in the forest, वसतः living, देवप्रभावस्य as powerful as a god, अस्य his, पत्नी wife, रक्षसा by a demon, अपहृता is carried off, याम् whom, इच्छन्तौ both wishing, इह here, आगतौ came.

70_15.shloka: त्वं तु को वा किमर्थं वा कबन्धसदृशो वने।आस्येनोरसि दीप्तेन भग्नजङ्घो विचेष्टसे।।3.70.15।।
70_15.translation: Who are you with only the trunk of the body, and a glittering mouth in the chest with your calf muscles broken rolling down in the forest?
70_15.word_by_word: त्वं तु you, कः वा who are you, कबन्धसदृशः appearing like a trunk, उरसि in the chest, दीप्तेन by a glittering, आस्येन with a mouth, भग्नजङ्घः with calf muscles broken, वने in the forest, किमर्थं वा for what purpose, विचेष्टसे you are rolling down?

70_16.shloka: एवमुक्तः कबन्धस्तु लक्ष्मणेनोत्तरं वचः।उवाच परमप्रीत स्तदिन्द्रवचनं स्मरन्।।3.70.16।।
70_16.translation: While hearing Lakshmana, Kabandha, reminded of Indra's words, replied to him in great joy :
70_16.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been told, कबन्धस्तु the Kabandha, तत् that, इन्द्रवचनम् Indra's words, स्मरन् remembering, परमप्रीतः very pleased, उत्तरम् reply, वचः words, उवाच said.

70_17.shloka: स्वागतं वां नरव्याघ्रौ दिष्ट्या पश्यामि चाप्यहम्।दिष्ट्या चेमौ निकृत्तौ मे युवाभ्यां बाहुबन्धनौ।।3.70.17।।
70_17.translation: O tigers among men you are welcome. It is my good luck that I am able to see you. It is my good luck also that the arms that bound you have been amputated.
70_17.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, वाम् to you, स्वागतम् welcome, अहम् I, दिष्ट्या luckily, पश्यामि I see, दिष्ट्या by my luck, युवाभ्याम् by both of you, मे my, इमौ these, बाहुबन्धनौ that arms which bound you, निकृत्तौ are cut off.

70_18.shloka: विरूपं यच्च मे रूपं प्राप्तं ह्यविनयाद्यथा।तन्मे शृणु नरव्याघ्र तत्त्वतश्शंसतस्तव।।3.70.18।।
70_18.translation: O best among men hear how I have been deformed due to my haughtiness.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventieth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
70_18.word_by_word: नरव्याघ्र O best among men (Rama), मे my, विरूपम् deformity, यत् such, रूपम् form, यथा as, अविनयात् due to haughtiness, प्राप्तम् is obtained, तव to your, तत्त्वतः exactly, शंसतः as I narrate, मे from me, शृणु you may listen.

71_1.shloka: [Kabandha narrates his story-- promises to help Rama in finding Sita-- attains his true form after his cremation.]पुरा राम महाबाहो महाबलपराक्रम।रूपमासीन्ममा चिन्त्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतम्।।3.71.1।।यथा सोमस्य शक्रस्य सूर्यस्य च यथा वपुः।
71_1.translation: O longarmed, mighty and powerful Rama in the past I was handsome like the Moon or Indra or the Sun inconceivable to all the three worlds.
71_1.word_by_word: महाबाहो longarmed, महाबलपराक्रम strong and powerful, राम O Rama, पुरा in the past, सोमस्य the Moon's, शक्रस्य Indra's, यथा as, सूर्यस्य च the Sun's, वपुः body, यथा like that, मम my,रूपम् form, अचिन्त्यम् inconceivable, त्रिषु लोकेषु in the three worlds, विश्रुतम् renowned, आसीत् it was.

71_2.shloka: सोऽहं रूपमिदं कृत्वा लोकवित्रासनं महत्।।3.71.2।।ऋषीन्वनगतान्राम त्रासयामि ततस्ततः।
71_2.translation: With my appearance, I was a great nuisance to the world and used to terrorise the sages living in the forest.
71_2.word_by_word: राम Rama, सः that, अहम् I, लोकवित्रासनम् a great terror in the world, महत् great, इदं रूपम् this form, कृत्वा after creating, ततस्ततः eventually, वनगतान् those men in the forests, ऋषीन् seers, त्रासयामि used to terrorise.

71_3.shloka: ततस्स्थूलशिरा नाम महर्षिः कोपितो मया।।3.71.3।।सञ्चिन्वन्विविधं वन्यं रूपेणानेन धर्षितः।
71_3.translation: With my appearance I invited the wrath of Sthulasira who I assaulted among the many seers, while he was collecting food in the forest.
71_3.word_by_word: ततः then, विविधम् different, वन्यम् forest material, सञ्चिन्वन् while collecting, स्थूलशिराः नाम by name Sthulasira, महर्षिः seer, अनेन by this, रूपेण form, धर्षितः was assaulted, मया by me, कोपितः was enraged.

71_4.shloka: तेनाहमुक्तः प्रेक्ष्यैवं घोरशापाभिधायिना।।3.71.4।।एतदेव नृशंसं ते रूपमस्तु विगर्हितम्।
71_4.translation: Seeing me he pronounced a dreadful curse on me saying, 'You will get a cruel, despicable form.'
71_4.word_by_word: प्रेक्ष्य seeing me, घोरशापाभिधायिना  pronounced a dreadful curse, तेन by him, अहम् I, एवम् in that way, उक्तः said, ते you, नृशंसम् mean, विगर्हितम् dispising, एतत् this, रूपमेव form only, अस्तु it may be.

71_5.shloka: स मया याचितः क्रुद्धश्शापस्योन्तो भवेदिति।।3.71.5।।अभिशापकृतस्येति तेनेदं भाषितं वचः।
71_5.translation: When I sought to know how the curse angrily pronounced on me would come to an end, he said:
71_5.word_by_word: क्रुद्धः angry, सः he, अभिशापकृतस्य pronounced on, शापस्य curse's, अन्तः end of it, भवेत् may be, इति thus, मया by me, प्रार्थितः begged, तेन by him, इदम् this, वचः words, भाषितम् spoke.

71_6.shloka: यदा छित्त्वा भुजौ रामस्त्वां दहेद्विजने वने।।3.71.6।।तदा त्वं प्राप्स्यसे रूपं स्वमेव विपुलं शुभम्।
71_6.translation: 'When Rama gets your arms in a desolate forest amputated and your body cremated, you would get back your gloriously auspicious form.'
71_6.word_by_word: रामः Rama, भुजौ two arms, छित्त्वा cutting, त्वाम् you, यदा when, विजने in a desolate, वने in forest, दहेत् cremate, तदा then, स्वमेव your own, विपुलम् शुभम् greatly auspicious, रूपम् form, प्राप्स्यसे you will obtain.

71_7.shloka: श्रिया विराजितं पुत्रं दनोस्त्वं विद्धि लक्ष्मण।।3.71.7।।इन्द्रकोपादिदं रूपं प्राप्तमेवं रणाजिरे।
71_7.translation: O Lakshmana know that I was the prosperous son of demon Danu. By the wrath of Indra in the battlefeild I obtained this form.
71_7.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, दनोः Danu's family, श्रिया by prosperity, विराजितम् shining, पुत्रम् son, त्वम् you, विद्धि know, इन्द्रकोपात् by the wrath of Indra, रणाजिरे in the battlefield, एवम् this, इदं रूपम् this form, प्राप्तम् is obtained.

71_8.shloka: अहं हि तपसोग्रेण पितामहमतोषयम्।।3.71.8।।दीर्घमायुस्स मे प्रादात्ततो मां विभ्रमोऽस्पृशत्।
71_8.translation: I pleased the creator Brahma with great penance. He blessed me with long life. Then this pride and confusion overtook me.
71_8.word_by_word: अहम् I, उग्रेण by intense, तपसा by penance, पितामहम् the creator Brahma, आतोषयम् I made him happy, सः he, मे my, दीर्घम् long, आयुः life, प्रादात् graced, ततः then, माम् me, विभ्रमः confusion, अस्पृशत्  overtook me.

71_9.shloka: दीर्घमायुर्मया प्राप्तं किं मे शक्रः करिष्यति।।3.71.9।।इत्येवं बुद्धिमास्थाय रणे शक्रमधर्षयम्।
71_9.translation: Having been blessed with long life and thinking, what can Indra do to me?, I attackedhim.
71_9.word_by_word: मया by me, दीर्घम् long, आयुः life, प्राप्तम् has been attained, शक्रः Indra, मे to me, किं करिष्यति  what can he do, इत्येवम् in that manner, बुद्धिम् in mind, आस्थाय considering, रणे in battle, शक्रम् Indra, अधर्षयम् I attacked .

71_10.shloka: तस्य बाहुप्रयुक्तेन वज्रेण शतपर्वणा।।3.71.10।।सक्थिनी चैव मूर्धा च शरीरे सम्प्रवेशितम्।
71_10.translation: The thunderbolt having a hundred nodes deployed by Indra pierced my thighs and my head.
71_10.word_by_word: तस्य his, बाहुप्रयुक्तेन deployed  from his arm, शतपर्वणा by a weapon of hundred nodes, वज्रेण with the thunderbolt, सक्थिनी चैव both my lower limbs, मूर्धा च head also, शरीरे into the body, सम्प्रवेशितम् entered.

71_11.translation: Entreated, he did not send me to the abode of Yama ( lord of death) and said, 'Let the words of the creator be true' .
71_11.word_by_word: सः he, मया by me, याच्यमानः सन् being begged of him, यमसादनम् to the abode of Yama, न आनयत् did not take me, तत् that, पितामहवचः word of the creator, सत्यम् true, अस्तु इति should become true, मम to me, अब्रवीत् said.

71_12.shloka: अनाहारः कथं शक्तो भग्नसक्थिशिरोमुखः।।3.71.12।।वज्रेणाभिहतः कालं सुदीर्घमपि जीवितुम्।
71_12.translation: Hit by the thunderbolt, my thighbones, head and face were broken. Somehow I could manage to live for a long time without food.
71_12.word_by_word: वज्रेण by the thunderbolt, अभिहतः struck by, भग्नसक्थिशिरोमुखः with thigh bones, head and face broken, अनाहारः starving, सुदीर्घं कालम् for a long time, जीवितुमपि to live, कथम् somehow, शक्तः was possible.

71_13.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु मे शक्रो बाहू योजनमायतौ।।3.71.13।।प्रादादास्यं च मे कुक्षौ तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रमकल्पयत्।
71_13.translation: Having been entreated, Indra created in me two long arms extending upto a yojana and set my mouth with sharp teeth in the stomach.
71_13.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been entreated, शक्रः Indra, मे to me, योजनम् one yojana, आयतौ long, बाहू two arms, प्रादात् he gave, मे to me, कुक्षौ in the stomach, तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रम् with sharp teeth, आस्यं च mouth also, अकल्पयत् created.

71_14.shloka: सोऽहं भुजाभ्यां दीर्घाभ्यां संकृष्यास्मिन्वने चरान्।।3.71.14।।सिंहव्दिपमृगव्याघ्रान् भक्षयामि समन्ततः।
71_14.translation: Stretching the long arms in the forest, I dragged creatures like lions, tigers, elephants and deer moving in the forest and ate them.
71_14.word_by_word: सः अहम् with that I, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, दीर्घाभ्याम् with long, भुजाभ्याम् with arms, अस्मिन् in this, वने in the forest, समन्ततः all over, चरान् moving creatures, सिंहव्दिपमृगव्याघ्रान् lions, tigers, elephants and deer, संकृष्य after pulling, भक्षयामि I eat.

71_15.shloka: स तु मामब्रवीदिन्द्रो यदा रामस्सलक्ष्मणः।।3.71.15।।छेत्स्यते समरे बाहू तदा स्वर्गं गमिष्यसि।
71_15.translation: Indra too had said, 'When Rama along with Lakshmana cuts off your arms in a fight,  you would reach heaven.'
71_15.word_by_word: सः that, इन्द्रः तु Indra too, माम् to me, अब्रवीत् said, यदा when, सलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, रामः Rama, समरे in the fight, बाहू छेत्स्यते cuts off the arms, तदा then, स्वर्गम् heaven, गमिष्यसि you will go.

71_16.shloka: अनेन वपुषा राम वनेऽस्मिन्राजसत्तम।।3.71.16।।यद्यत्पश्यामि सर्वस्य ग्रहणं साधु रोचये।
71_16.translation: O Rama, the best of kings I thought it was only proper in this forest and with this body to catch whatever creature I saw.
71_16.word_by_word: राजसत्तम best of kings, राम Rama, अस्मिन् वने in this forest, अनेन वपुषा with this body, यद्यत् whatever, पश्यामि I see, सर्वस्य of all, ग्रहणम् catch, साधु proper, रोचये I like.

71_17.shloka: अवश्यं ग्रहणं रामो मन्येऽहं समुपैष्यति।।3.71.17।।इमां बुद्धिं पुरस्कृत्य देहन्यासकृतश्रमः।
71_17.translation: O Rama, I was struggling to preserve my body all the time thinking that some day you would certainly come into my arms.
71_17.word_by_word: रामः Rama, अवश्यम् certainly, ग्रहणम् into the hold, समुपैष्यति will come, अहम् I, मन्ये  thinking, इमाम् this, बुद्धिम् thought, पुरस्कृत्य depending on, देहन्यासकृतश्रमः I am struggling to preserve my body.

71_18.shloka: स त्वं रामोऽसि भद्रं ते नाहमन्येन राघव।।3.71.18।।शक्यो हन्तुं यथातत्त्वमेवमुक्तं महर्षिणा।
71_18.translation: You are that Rama. Be blessed. As stated by the seer I cannot be really killed by any one except you.
71_18.word_by_word: राघव Rama, त्वम् you, सः रामः that Rama, असि you are, ते भद्रम् be blessed, महर्षिणा by the seer, तत्त्वम् truly, एवम् in that way, यथा as, उक्तम् stated, अहम् I, अन्येन by others, हन्तुम् be attacked, शक्यः possible, न not.

71_19.shloka: अहं हि मतिसाचिव्यं करिष्यामि नरर्षभ।।3.71.19।।मित्रं चैवोपदेक्ष्यामि युवाभ्यां संस्कृतोऽग्निना।
71_19.translation: O best among men I will help you with my wisdom and give you friendly advice when I am purified by you both through cremation on the funeral pyre.
71_19.word_by_word: नरर्षभ O best of men, अहम् I, अग्निना by fire, संस्कृतः purified man, युवाभ्याम् by you both, मतिसाचिव्यम् help you with my wisdom, करिष्यामि I will do, मित्रं चैव as a friend also, उपदेक्ष्यामि I will advise you.

71_20.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा दनुना तेन राघवः।।3.71.20।।इदं जगाद वचनं लक्ष्मणस्योपशृण्वतः।
71_20.translation: Rigteous Rama spoke the following words in response to the story of Danu within Lakshmana's earshot:
71_20.word_by_word: तेन by him, दनुना by Danu, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having been told, धर्मात्मा righteous, राघवः Rama, लक्ष्मणस्य to Lakshmana, उपशृण्वतः listening, इदम् these, वचनम् words, जगाद spoke.

71_21.shloka: रावणेन हृता भार्या मम सीता यशस्स्विनी।।3.71.21।।निष्क्रान्तस्य जनस्थानात्सहभ्रात्रा यथासुखम्।
71_21.translation: My illlustrious wife Sita was carried away by Ravana comfortably when I was away from Janasthana along with my brother.
71_21.word_by_word: जनस्थानात् from Janasthana, सह भ्रात्रा along with my brother, निष्क्रान्तस्य when I had gone out, मम my, भार्या wife, यशस्स्विनी famed lady, सीता Sita, रावणेन by Ravana, यथासुखम्  happily, हृता carried off.

71_22.shloka: नाममात्रं तु जानामि न रूपं तस्य रक्षसः।।3.71.22।।निवासं वा प्रभावं वा वयं तस्य न विद्महे।
71_22.translation: I only know his name. We do not know how he looks, where he lives and what influence he has.
71_22.word_by_word: तस्य his, नाममात्रम् only the name, जानामि I know, रूपम् form, न do not know, तस्य his, निवासं वा residence not known, प्रभावं वा or his power, वयम् we, न विद्महे we do not know.

71_23.shloka: शोकार्तानामनाथानामेवं विपरिधावताम्।।3.71.23।।कारुण्यं सदृशं कर्तुमुपकारे च वर्तताम्।
71_23.translation: Creatures like you may help those who, like orphans, run here and there, stricken with sorrow.
71_23.word_by_word: शोकार्तानाम् striken by sorrow, अनाथानाम् of orphans, एवम् that way, विपरिधावताम् of those running all over, उपकारे help, वर्ततां च do to others, कारुण्यम् kindness, कर्तुम् do show, सदृशम् worthy of your compasssion.

71_24.shloka: काष्ठान्यादाय शुष्काणि काले भग्नानि कुञ्जरैः।।3.71.24।।धक्ष्यामस्त्वां वयं वीर श्वभ्रे महति कल्पिते।
71_24.translation: O hero we will cremate you in a huge pit to be prepared for this occasion, collecting dry logs of wood broken by elephants.
71_24.word_by_word: वीर hero, काले in the proper season, कुञ्जरैः by elephants, भग्नानि broken, शुष्काणि dried, काष्ठानि logs of wood, आदाय after getting, कल्पिते in a place set, महति in a large one, श्वभ्रे in a pit, त्वाम् you, धक्ष्यामः we will cremate you.

71_25.shloka: स त्वं सीतां समाचक्ष्व येन वा यत्र वा हृता।।3.71.25।।कुरु कल्याणमत्यर्थं यदि जानासि तत्त्वतः।
71_25.translation: If you really know where SIta has been kidnapped and by whom, tell me. You will bedoing a great service.
71_25.word_by_word: सः he, त्वम् you, तत्त्वतः truly, जानासि यदि if you know, सीताम् about Sita, येन वा by whom, यत्र वा of wherever, हृता carried, समाचक्ष्व tell me, अत्यर्थम् very much, कल्याणम् wellbeing, कुरु you may do.

71_26.shloka: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वाक्यं दनुरनुत्तमम्।।3.71.26।।प्रोवाच कुशलो वक्तुं वक्तारमपि राघवम्।
71_26.translation: Danu who was proficient in speech spoke with chosen words to Rama who was a great speaker himself:
71_26.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः  having been asked, वक्तुम् telling, कुशलः one who can speak well, दनुः Danu, वक्तारम् addressing one who can speak, राघवम् to Rama, अनुत्तमम् best, वाक्यम् word, प्रोवाच spoke.

71_27.shloka: दिव्यमस्ति न मे ज्ञानं नाभिजानामि मैथिलीम्।।3.71.27।।यस्तां ज्ञास्यति तं वक्ष्ये दग्धस्स्वं रूपमास्थितः।
71_27.translation: I do not have divine wisdom (now). Nor do I know Sita. When you cremate me, I shall assume my original form and will tell you the name of the person who knows it.
71_27.word_by_word: मे to me, दिव्यम् divine, ज्ञानम् wisdom, नास्ति I do not have, मैथिलीम् Maithili, नाभिजानामि I do not know, दग्धः burnt one, स्वं रूम् my original form, आस्थितः getting, ताम् her, यः whoever, ज्ञास्यति know of her, तम् him, वक्ष्ये I will reveal.

71_28.shloka: अदग्धस्य तु विज्ञातुं शक्तिरस्ति न मे प्रभो।।3.71.28।।राक्षसं तं महावीर्यं सीता येन हृता तव।
71_28.translation: O lord before I am cremated, I do not have the ability to know  about that powerful demon by whom Sita has been abducted.
71_28.word_by_word: प्रभो O lord, येन by whom, तव your, सीता Sita, हृता is taken away, तम् him, महावीर्यम् very powerful, राक्षसम् rakshasa, विज्ञातुम् to know, अदग्धस्य without being burnt, मे to me, शक्तिः ability, नास्ति is not there.

71_29.shloka: विज्ञानं हि मम भ्रष्टं शापदोषेण राघव।।3.71.29।।स्वकृतेन मया प्राप्तं रूपं लोकविगर्हितम्।
71_29.translation: O Rama due to the curse I have lost my wisdom. By my own deed, I have attained this form despicable to the world.
71_29.word_by_word: राघव Rama, शापदोषेण due to the curse, मम my, विज्ञानम् wisdom, भ्रष्टं हि is indeed lost, मया by me, स्वकृतेन by my own deed, लोकविगर्हितम् a form despised by the world, रूपम् this form, प्राप्तम् is attained.

71_30.shloka: किं तु यावन्न यात्यस्तं सविता श्रान्तवाहनः।।3.71.30।।तावन्मामवटे क्षिप्त्वा दह राम यथाविधि।
71_30.translation: Before the Sun  disappears with his tired horses drop me into a pit and cremate me in accordance with tradition, O Rama
71_30.word_by_word: राम Rama, किं तु but, सविता Sun, श्रान्तवाहनः with his vehicle (horses) tired, अस्तम् (याति) setting, यावत् before, तावत् by then, माम् me, अवटे in a pit, क्षिप्त्वा dropping, यथाविधि in accordance with tradition, दह you may cremate.

71_31.shloka: दग्धस्त्वयाहमवटे न्यायेन रघुनन्धन।।3.71.31।।वक्ष्यामि तमहं वीर यस्तं ज्ञास्यति राक्षसम्।
71_31.translation: O heroic Rama, delight of the Raghus, if you drop me in a pit and cremate me as per custom, I will tell you about him who knows the demon.
71_31.word_by_word: वीर O hero, रघुनन्धन O delight of the Raghus, अहम् I, त्वया by you, न्यायेन as per custom, अवटे in a pit, दग्धः cremated, यः whoever, तं राक्षसम् to that demon, ज्ञास्यति knows, तम् about him, वक्ष्यामि I will let you know.

71_32.shloka: तेन सख्यं च कर्तव्यं न्याय्यवृत्तेन राघव।।3.71.32।।कल्पयिष्यति ते प्रीतस्साहाय्यं लघुविक्रमः।
71_32.translation: O Rama you should establish friendship with him in a just manner. That hero of swift action will help you when he is pleased.
71_32.word_by_word: राघव Rama, न्याय्यवृत्तेन rightfully conducting, तेन with him, सख्यं च friendship, कर्तव्यम् you should establish, लघुविक्रमः a warrior of swift action, प्रीतः a pleased one, ते to you, साहाय्यम् help, कल्पयिष्यति he will do.

71_33.shloka: न हि तस्यास्त्यविज्ञातं त्रिषु लेकेषु राघव।।3.71.33।।सर्वान्परिसृतो लोकान्पुरासौ कारणान्तरे।
71_33.translation: O Rama, there is nothing that he does not know in the three worlds. In the past for a different reason he roamed all the (three) worlds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
71_33.word_by_word: राघव Rama, त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु worlds, तस्य for him, अविज्ञातम् unknown to him, नास्ति is not there, हि do, असौ he, पुरा in the past, कारणान्तरे for a different cause, सर्वान् all, लोकान् worlds, परिसृतः has roamed about.

72_1.shloka: [Cremation of Kabandha-- his reappearance in the sky-- tells Rama to make friendship with Sugriva.]एवमुक्तौतु तौ वीरौ कबन्धेन नरेश्वरौ।गिरिप्रदरमासाद्य पावकं विससर्जतुः।।3.72.1।।
72_1.translation: Thus said by Kabandha, the two lords of men, the heroes reached a cave in the mountain and lighted the fire.
72_1.word_by_word: कबन्धेन by Kabandha, एवम् in that manner, उक्तौ having been advised, नरेश्वरौ two kings, तौ वीरौ the two heroes, गिरिप्रदरम्  mountain cave, आसाद्य reached, पावकम् fire, विससर्जतुः lighted.

72_2.translation: Lakshmana lit the pyre with big meteorlike logs on all sides and it burned.
72_2.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणस्तु Lakshmana himself, ज्वलिताभिः with burning, महोल्काभिः with big meteorlike logs, समन्ततः all round, चिताम् pyre, आदीपयामास set fire, सर्वतः on all sides, प्रजज्वाल lighted.

72_3.shloka: तच्छरीरं कबन्धस्य घृतपिण्डोपमं महत्।मेदसा पच्यमानस्य मन्दं दहति पावकः।।3.72.3।।
72_3.translation: As the flesh of Kabandha's body decomposed, if burnt slowly in the fire although itwas like a huge mass of fat.
72_3.word_by_word: मेदसा with flesh, पच्यमानस्य as the corpse was burning, कबन्धस्य Kabandha's, महत् great, घृतपिण्डोपमम् like a huge ball of ghee, तत् that, शरीरम्  body, पावकः the fire, मन्दम् slowly, दहति burnt.

72_4.shloka: स विधूय चितामाशु विधूमोऽग्निरिवोत्थितः।अरजे वाससी बिभ्रन्मालां दिव्यां महाबलः।।3.72.4।।
72_4.translation: Mighty Kabandha shook himself off the funeral pyre and rose like smokeless fire, wearing a pair of clean clothes and a divine garland.
72_4.word_by_word: महाबलः very strong , सः he, अरजे clean, वाससी pair of clothes, दिव्याम् divine, मालाम् garland, बिभ्रत् wearing, चिताम् from the pyre, विधूय  shaking, आशु immediately, विधूमः smokeless, अग्निरिव like fire, उत्थितः he rose up.

72_5.translation: Thereafter shining brightly in pure clothes and wearing ornaments all over the body, Kabandha hurtled out happily and instantaneously from the pyre.
72_5.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, भास्वरः shining brightly, विमलाम्बरः wearing clean clothes, संहृष्टः happily, सर्वप्रत्यङ्गभूषणः limbs adorned with ornaments, आशु instantaneously, वेगेन speedily, चितायाः from the pyre, उत्पपात came out.

72_6.shloka: विमाने भास्वरे तिष्ठन्हंसयुक्ते यशस्करे।प्रभया च महातेजा दिशो दश विराजयन्।।3.72.6।।सोऽन्तरिक्षगतो रामं कबन्धो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।शृणु राघव तत्त्वेन यथा सीतामवाप्स्यसि।।3.72.7।।
72_6.translation: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.
72_6.word_by_word: सः कबन्धः he, Kabandha, अन्तरिक्षगतः reached the sky, हंसयुक्ते harnessed by swans, यशस्करे famous, भास्वरे shining, विमाने in an aerial chariot, तिष्ठन् seated, महातेजाः a brilliant one, प्रभया with glow, दश दिशः all the ten directions, विराजयन् illumining, रामम् Rama,वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said, राघव Raghava, सीताम् Sita, यथा as, अवाप्स्यसि you will be getting her, तत्त्वेन truly, शृणु listen.

72_7.shloka: राम षड्युक्तयो लोके याभिस्सर्वं विमृश्यते।परिमृष्टो दशान्तेन दशाभागेन सेव्यते।।3.72.8।।
72_7.translation: O Rama there are six expedients (peace,war,marching,neutrality, alliance, making peace with one and waging war with another, for attaining your goal in the world. Only the unlucky can help the unfortunate.
72_7.word_by_word: राम Rama, याभिः by those, सर्वम् all, विमृश्यते is tested, षट् युक्तयः six expedients, लोके in the world, दशान्तेन when one crosses that period, परिमृष्टः a man's test, दशाभागेन met with bad luck, सेव्यते he will be served.

72_8.shloka: दशाभागगतो हीनस्त्वं हि राम सलक्ष्मणः।यत्कृते व्यसनं प्राप्तं त्वया दारप्रधर्षणम्।।।3.72.9।।
72_8.translation: Along with Lakshmna you are passing through a bad period on account of which your wife has been kidnapped and you, lying low, are experiencing great grief, O Rama
72_8.word_by_word: राम Rama, सलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, त्वम् you, दशाभागगतः going through a part of such bad period, हीनः low ebb, यत्कृते by that , त्वया by you, दारप्रधर्षणम् abduction of wife, व्यसनम् sorrow, प्राप्तम् obtained.

72_9.shloka: तदवश्यं त्वया कार्यस्ससुहृत्सुहृदां वर।अकृत्वा हि न ते सिद्धिमहं पश्यामि चिन्तयन्।।3.72.10।।
72_9.translation: O Rama, the best of friends  you should certainly make friendship with him. As I think over the matter, I do not see any success if you do not adopt this method.
72_9.word_by_word: सुहृदाम् of friends, वर best one, तत् so, सः that, त्वया by you, अवश्यम् certainly, सुहृत् friend,कार्यः should be done, अकृत्वा without doing so, ते to you, सिद्धिम् achievement, अहम् I, चिन्तयन् while I think over, न पश्यामि I do not see.

72_10.shloka: श्रूयतां राम वक्ष्यामि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः।भ्रात्रा निरस्तः क्रुद्धेन वालिना शक्रसूनुना।।3.72.11।।
72_10.translation: O Rama, listen. I shall tell you. A monkey named Sugriva has been banished from the kingdom in a fit of anger by his brother Vali, the son of Indra.
72_10.word_by_word: राम Rama, वक्ष्यामि l tell you, श्रूयताम् listen , शक्रसूनुना by Indra's son, भ्रात्रा by his brother, क्रुद्धेन in a fit of anger, वालिना by Vali, निरस्तः banished from the kingdom, सुग्रीवो नाम named Sugriva, वानरः monkey.

72_11.translation: A hero of great selfrespect, he lives with four monkeys on a beautiful mountain Rishyamuka extending up to lake Pampa.
72_11.word_by_word: आत्मवान् he is a man of great selfrespect, वीरः a hero, पम्पापर्यन्तशोभिते extending up to lake Pampa, ऋश्यमूके on Rishyamuka, गिरिवरे the best of the mountain, चतुर्भिः with four, वानरैः सह along with monkeys, निवसति residing.

72_12.translation: This king of monkeys is energetic with great strength and limitless lustre. He is humble and truthful, valiant, patient and intelligent. He is great.
72_12.word_by_word: वानरेन्द्रः king of monkeys, महावीर्यः endowed with great strength, तेजोवान् full of valour, अमितप्रभः of limitless lustre, सत्यसन्धः truthful, विनीतः humble, धृतिमान् patient, मतिमान् intelligent, महान् great.

72_13.shloka: दक्षः प्रगल्भो द्युतिमान्महाबलपराक्रमः।भ्रात्रा विवासितो राम राज्यहेतोर्महाबलः।।3.72.14।।
