72_13.translation: He is efficient, eloquent, brilliant. He is mighty and strong. (But) he is banished by his brother from the kingdom, O Rama
72_13.word_by_word: राम Rama, दक्षः efficient, प्रगल्भः eloquent, द्युतिमान् brilliant, महाबलपराक्रमः mighty and brave, महाबलः very strong, राज्यहेतोः for the sake of kingdom, भ्रात्रा by brother, विवासितः is banished.

72_14.shloka: स ते सहायो मित्रं च सीतायाः परिमार्गणे।भविष्यति हिते राम मा च शोके मनः कृथाः।।3.72.15।।
72_14.translation: O Rama he will help you as a benevolent friend in searching out Sita. Do not indulge in sorrow.
72_14.word_by_word: राम O Rama, सः he, ते your, मित्रम् friend, सीतायाः Sita's, परिमार्गणे in searching, सहायः  helpful, हिते in the welfare, भविष्यति he will be, शोके in sorrow, मनः your mind, मा कृथाः not indulge.

72_15.shloka: भवितव्यं हि यच्चापि न तच्छक्यमिहान्यथा।कर्तुमिक्ष्वाकुशार्दूल कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः।।3.72.16।।
72_15.translation: O best of the Ikshvaku race whatever is due to happen cannot be otherwise.  It is notpossible to transgress time (fate).
72_15.word_by_word: इक्ष्वाकुशार्दूल best of the Ikshvaku dynasty, यच्चापि whatever, भवितव्यम् has to happen, तत् that, अन्यथा otherwise, कर्तुम् to do, न शक्यम् is not possible, कालः time, दुरतिक्रमः हि cannot be transgressed.

72_16.shloka: गच्छ श्रीघ्रमितो राम सुग्रीवं तं महाबलम्।वयस्यं तं कुरु क्षिप्रमितो गत्वाऽद्य राघव।।3.72.17।।अद्रोहाय समागम्य दीप्यमाने विभावसौ।
72_16.translation: O Rama, immediately proceed today from here to mighty Sugriva. Having reached him, make him your friend without malice in the presence of burning fire.
72_16.word_by_word: राम Rama, इतः thus, श्रीघ्रम् swiftly, महाबलम् mighty, तं सुग्रीवम् to that Sugriva, गच्छ reach, राघव Rama, अद्य today, इतः from here, क्षिप्रम् quickly, गत्वा having gone, अद्रोहाय make alliance without any malice, विभावसौ  the fire, दीप्यमाने  is burning, तम् with him, वयस्यम् friend, कुरु you do.

72_17.shloka: स च ते नावमन्तव्यस्सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः।।3.72.18।।कृतज्ञः कामरूपी च सहायार्थी च वीर्यवान्।
72_17.translation: Thinking that Sugriva is only a vanara king, he should not be disrespected. He has a sense of gratitude. He can take any form at will. He is in need of your help although he is very strong.
72_17.word_by_word: वानराधिपः (अपि सन्) king of the monkeys, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, ते by you, नावमन्तव्यः not to be insulted, कृतज्ञः a grateful one, कामरूपी च he can take any form at will, सहायार्थी च he seeks your help, वीर्यवान् strong.

72_18.shloka: शक्तौह्यद्य युवां कर्तुं कार्यं तस्य चिकीर्षितम्।।3.72.19।।कृतार्थो वाऽकृतार्थो वा कृत्यं तव करिष्यति।
72_18.translation: You are both young and able to do the work he wants. Whether his work is done or not, he will fulfil your task.
72_18.word_by_word: युवाम् you both, अद्य now, तस्य his, चिकीर्षितम् desired, कार्यम् his work, कर्तुम् to do, शक्तौ हि you both have the ability, कृतार्थो वा whether his work is done, अकृतार्थो वा or not done, तव your, कृत्यम् work, करिष्यति he will do.

72_19.shloka: स ऋक्षरजसः पुत्रः पम्पामटति शङ्कितः।।.3.72.20।।भास्करस्यौरसः पुत्रो वालिना कृतकिल्बिषः।
72_19.translation: Born of Riksharaja, he is the offspring of the Sungod. He has developed enmity with Vali, and is roaming about the banks of Pampa, suspecting danger from Vali.
72_19.word_by_word: ऋक्षरजसः Riksharaja's, पुत्रः son, भास्करस्य Sungod's, औरसःपुत्रः lawful son, सः he, वालिना Valin, कृतकिल्बिषः developing enmity, शङ्कितः apprehending danger, पम्पाम् on the banks of Pampa, अटति roaming.

72_20.shloka: सन्निधायायुधं क्षिप्रमृष्यमूकालयं कपिम्।।3.72.21।।कुरु राघव सत्येन वयस्यं वनचारिणम्।
72_20.translation: O Rama, with your weapons kept ready, go to Sugriva, king of the monkeys, a resident of Rishyamuka. He is wandering in the forest. Establish friendship with him.
72_20.word_by_word: राघव Rama, आयुधम् weapon, सन्निधाय after keeping ready, वनचारिणम् a wanderer in the forest, ऋष्यमूकालयम् dwelling on Rishyamuka, कपिम् monkey, सत्येन truthfully, क्षिप्रम् at once, वयस्यम् friend, कुरु make.

72_21.shloka: स हि स्थानानि सर्वाणि कार्त्स्न्येन कपिकुञ्जरः।।3.72.22।।नरमांसाशिनां लोके नैपुण्यादधिगच्छति।
72_21.translation: He is the foremost of the monkeys. He knows well by his wisdom all thedwellingplaces of the carnivorous demons in the world.
72_21.word_by_word: कपिकुञ्जरः foremost of monkeys, सः he, लोके in the world, नरमांसाशिनाम् of cannibals, सर्वाणि all, स्थानानि dwellings, कार्त्स्न्येन entirely, नैपुण्यात् with tact, अधिगच्छति हि will find and reach.

72_22.shloka: न तस्याविदितं लोकेकिञ्चिदस्ति हि राघव।।3.72.23।।यावत्सूर्यः प्रतपति सहस्रांशुररिन्दम।
72_22.translation: There is nothing unknown to Sugriva in this world as far as the Sun shines, O subduer of enemies
72_22.word_by_word: अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, राघव Rama, सहस्रांशुः the god of a thousand rays, सूर्यः Sun, यावत् so far, प्रतपति radiates, लोके in the world, तस्य his, अविदितम् unknown, किञ्चित् hardly anything, नास्ति हि is not.

72_23.shloka: स नदीर्विपुलान्शैलान् गिरिदुर्गाणि कन्दरान्।।3.72.24।।अन्वीक्ष्य वानरैस्सार्धं पत्नीं तेऽधिगमिष्यति।
72_23.translation: Along with his monkeys, he will search all rivers, mountains and caves and will find out your consort.
72_23.word_by_word: सः he, वानरैः सार्धम् along with monkeys, नदीः rivers, विपुलान् big, शैलान् mountains, गिरिदुर्गाणि mountain caves, कन्दरान् caverns, अन्वीक्ष्य searching, ते your, पत्नीम् consort, अधिगमिष्यति will find out.

72_24.shloka: वानरांश्च महाकायान्प्रेषयिष्यति राघव।।3.72.25।।दिशो विचेतुं तां सीतां त्वद्वियोगेन शोचतीम्।स ज्ञास्यति वरारोहां निर्मलां रावणालये।।3.72.26।।
72_24.translation: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.
72_24.word_by_word: राघव Rama, त्वद्वियोगेन by separation from you, शोचतीम् brooding, तां सीताम् that Sita, विचेतुम् to search, महाकायान् gigantic, वानरांश्च monkeys, दिशः in all directions, प्रेषयिष्यति he will send, सः he, रावणालये in Ravana's home, निर्मलाम् chaste, वरारोहाम् beautiful, ज्ञास्यति will find out.

72_25.shloka: स मेरुशृङ्गाग्रगतामनिन्दितां प्रविश्य पातालतलेऽपि वा श्रिताम्।प्लवङ्गमानां प्रवरस्तव प्रियां निहत्य रक्षांसि पुनः प्रदास्यति।।3.72.27।।
72_25.translation: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, will reach the demons  and restore you that blameless, beloved consort of yours, even if she is there on top of mount Meru or in the deep underworld.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
72_25.word_by_word: प्लवङ्गमानाम् of monkeys, प्रवरः the best one, सः he, अनिन्दिताम् a blameless, तव प्रियाम् your dear consort, मेरुशृङ्गाग्रगता even if on top of mount Meru, पातालतले or in the nether world, श्रितां वापि or gone there also, प्रविश्य after reaching, रक्षांसि demons, निहत्य  killing, पुनः again, प्रदास्यति he will restore to you.

73_1.shloka: [Kabandha gives Rama the direction to Rishyamuka--  disappears, bidding farewell to Rama and Lakshmanadescription of nature  at Pampa ]निदर्शयित्वा रामाय सीतायाः प्रतिपादने।वाक्यमन्वर्थमर्थज्ञः कबन्धः पुनरब्रवीत्।।3.73.1।।
73_1.translation: Having shown Rama the means to find Sita, Kabandha spoke again these significant words:
73_1.word_by_word: अर्थज्ञः one who knows the meaning, कबन्धः Kabandha, सीतायाः Sita's, प्रतिपादने finding means to restore, (नि)दर्शयित्वा having shown, अन्वर्थम् meaningful, वाक्यम् words, पुनः again, अब्रवीत् spoke.

73_2.shloka: एष राम शिवः पन्था यत्रैते पुष्पिता द्रुमाः।प्रतीचीं दिशमाश्रित्य प्रकाशन्ते मनोरमाः।।3.73.2।।जम्बूप्रियालपनसप्लक्षन्यग्रोधतिन्धुकाः।अश्वत्थाः कर्णिकाराश्च चूताश्चान्ये च पादापाः।।3.73.3।।धन्वना नागवृक्षाश्च तिलका नक्तमालकाः।नीलाशोकाः कदम्बाश्च करवीराश्च पुष्पिताः।।3.73.4।।अग्निमुख्या अशोकाश्च सुरक्ताः पारिभद्रकाः।
73_2.translation: O Rama the delightful path going westward is auspicious for you. It is shining with trees in bloom. There are jambu (rose apple) trees, priyala trees, jackfruit trees, banyan trees, plaksha trees (a tree from which milky latex oozes out), tinduka trees, holy fig trees, karnikaras (of red and white flowers), mango trees and other trees like dryland, thorny trees, tilaka trees, trees that bloom at night, agnimukhya and asoka trees of blue flowers, kadamba trees, karavira trees, red ashoka trees, and paribhadraka trees.
73_2.word_by_word: राम Rama, यत्र whereever, प्रतीचीम् westward, दिशम् direction, अश्रित्य taking, मनोरमाः delightful, पुष्पिताः flowering, द्रुमाः trees, जम्बूप्रियालपनसप्लक्षन्यग्रोधतिन्दुकाः jambu trees , priyala trees, jackfruit trees, holy banyan trees and trees with red flowers, अश्वत्थाः holy fig trees, कर्णिकाराश्च karnikara trees, चूताश्च mango trees, अन्ये च and other, पादपाः trees,धन्वनाः dryland trees, नागवृक्षाश्च different kinds of thorny trees, तिलकाः tilaka trees, नक्तमालकाः trees that bloom at night, नीलाशोकाः ashoka trees of blue flowers, कदम्बाश्च पुष्पिताः kadamba trees in bloom, करवीराश्च karavira, अग्निमुख्याः agnimukhya, अशोकाश्च ashoka, सुरक्ताः red trees, पारिभद्रकाः paribhadrakas, प्रकाशन्ते are shining, एषः that is, शिवः auspicious, पन्थाः route.

73_3.shloka: तानारुह्याथवा भूमौ पातयित्वा च तान्बलात्।।3.73.5।।फलान्यमृतकल्पानि भक्षयन्तौ गमिष्यथः।
73_3.translation: Climbing those trees or else pulling them down with your strength, both of you eat the nectarlike sweet fruits and proceed ahead.
73_3.word_by_word: तान् those trees, आरुह्य climbing, अथवा or else, बलात् with your strength, तान् them, पातयित्वा pulling them down, अमृत कल्पानि nectarlike, फलानि fruits, भक्षयन्तौ while eating, गमिष्यथः go ahead.

73_4.shloka: तदतिक्रम्य काकुत्स्थ वनं पुष्पितपादपम्।।3.73.6।।नन्दनप्रतिमं चान्यत्कुरवो ह्युत्तरा इव।
73_4.translation: O scion of the Kakutstha race  proceeding further you will find another forest of the North Kuru state with trees in bloom resembling the pleasuregardens of Nandana.
73_4.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ Kakustha, पुष्पितपादपम् trees with flowers in bloom, तत् that, वनम् forest, अतिक्रम्य after crossing, नन्दनप्रतिमम् resembling Nandana gardens, उत्तराः कुरवः इव like the north Kuru state, अन्यत् another pleasuregarden.

73_5.shloka: सर्वकालफला यत्र पादपास्तु मधुस्रवाः।।3.73.7।।सर्वे च ऋतवस्तत्र वने चैत्ररथे यथा।
73_5.translation: The trees in that garden with fruits of all seasons drip honey. Like the Chaitraratha garden (of Kubera), it bears fruits of all seasons.
73_5.word_by_word: यत्र there, सर्वकालफलाः fruits of all seasons, पादपाः trees, मधुस्रवाः drip honey, तत्र वने in that garden, सर्वे all, ऋतवः seasons, चैत्ररथे यथा like the Chaitraratha.

73_6.translation: The trees with huge branches bent down with fruits look like mountains or clouds.
73_6.word_by_word: तत्र there, फलभारानताः borne down by the weight of fruits, मेघपर्वतसन्निभाः like mountains and clouds, महाविटपधारिणः trees with huge branches, शोभन्ते look delightful.

73_7.shloka: तानारुह्याथवा भूमौ पातयित्वा यथासुखम्।।3.73.9।।फलान्यमृतकल्पानि लक्ष्मणस्ते प्रदास्यति।
73_7.translation: Lakshmana will get you the nectarlike fruits either by climbing the trees or by pulling them down.
73_7.word_by_word: लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तान् those, आरुह्य  climbing, अथवा or else, यथासुखम् as you like, पातयित्वा pull down, अमृतकल्पानि nectarlike, फलानि fruits, ते to you, प्रदास्यति  he can give you.

73_8.shloka: चङ्क्रमन्तौ वरान्देशान्शैलाच्छैलं वनाद्वनम्।।3.73.10।।ततः पुष्करिणीं वीरौ पम्पां नाम गमिष्यथः।
73_8.translation: O brave men, pass from hill to hill, forest to forest in great countries until you reach a lake named Pampa.
73_8.word_by_word: वीरौ two brave men, वरान् great, देशान् places, शैलात् from one hill, शैलम् to another hill,वनात् from one forest, वनम् to another, चङ्क्रमन्तौ while going, ततः then, पम्पां नाम named Pampa, पुष्करिणीम् tank, गमिष्यथः you will both reach.

73_9.translation: The slopes of Pampa are without stones or pebbles, O Rama   They are not slippery slopes. They are without moss. The water is neither deep nor shallow. It has smooth beds of sand on the banks and it is full of lotuses and lilies.
73_9.word_by_word: राम Rama, अशर्कराम् without stones or pebbles, अविभ्रंशाम् or slipping, समतीर्थाम् level slopes, अशैवलाम् without moss, सञ्जातवालूकाम् smooth beds of sand on the banks, कमलोत्पलशालिनीम् full of lotuses lilies.

73_10.shloka: तत्र हंसाः प्लवाः क्रौञ्चाः कुरराश्चैव राघव।।3.73.12।।वल्गुस्वना विकूजन्ति पम्पासलिलगोचराः।
73_10.translation: Moving in the waters of Pampa you will see swans, ducks, krauncha birds and curlews cackling and cooing, O Son of the Raghus.
73_10.word_by_word: राघव O son of the Raghus, तत्र there, पम्पासलिलगोचराः moving in the waters of Pampa, हंसाः swans, प्लवाः ducks, क्रौञ्चाः Krauncha birds, कुरराश्चैव and curlews, वल्गुस्वनाः cackling, विकूजन्ति cooing.

73_11.translation: Not knowing that they may be killed, the innocent creatures will not be scared of human beings. Both of you can kill and eat the fat birds comparable to balls of ghee.
73_11.word_by_word: वधस्य to be killed, अकोविदाः not knowing, शुभाः auspicious, नरान् human beings, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, नोद्विजन्ते do not get scared, घृतपिण्डोपमान् like balls of ghee, स्थूलान् fat, तान्them, द्विजान् killing, भक्षयिष्यथः can eat.

73_12.shloka: रोहितान्वक्रतुण्डांश्च नडमीनांश्च राघव।।3.73.14।।पम्पायामिषुभिर्मत्स्यांस्तत्र राम वरान्हतान्।निस्त्वक्पक्षानयस्तप्तानकृशानेककण्टकान्।।3.73.15।।तव भक्त्या समायुक्तो लक्ष्मणस्सम्प्रदास्यति।
73_12.translation: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty  there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest  fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.
73_12.word_by_word: राघव scion of the Raghu dynasty, राम Rama, तत्र there, पम्पायाम् in Pampa, इषुभिः charging with arrows, हतान् killed, वरान् choicest, निस्त्वक्पक्षान् without scales and fins, अयस्तप्तान् baked on skewers made of iron, अकृशानेककण्टकान् fat ones with a single bone, मत्स्यान् fish, रोहितान् rohita fish, वक्रतुण्डांश्च crookedmouth fish, नडमीनांश्च huge fish, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भक्त्या with devotion, समायुक्तः is endowed, तव you, सम्प्रदास्यति will be able to give.

73_13.shloka: भृशते खादतो मत्स्यान्पम्पायाः पुष्पसञ्चये।।3.73.16।।पद्मगन्धि शिवं वारि सुखशीतमनामयम्।उद्धृत्य सतताक्लिष्टं रौप्यस्फाटिकसन्निभम्।।3.73.17।।असौ पुष्करपर्णेन लक्ष्मणः पाययिष्यति।
73_13.translation: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It  is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.
73_13.word_by_word: भृशम् very delightedly, मत्स्यान् fish, खादतः while eating, ते to you, पुष्पसञ्चये in a place full of flowers, पद्मगन्धि scent of lotuses, शिवम् beneficent, सुखशीतम् cool, अनामयम् healthy, सतताक्लिष्टम् always clear, रौप्यस्फाटिकसन्निभम् resembling silver and crystal, वारि water, असौलक्ष्मणः this Lakshmana, पुष्करपर्णेन in lotus leaf, पाययिष्यति will offer you.

73_14.translation: O best of men you will see huge boars of delightful appearance that roar like bulls resting in mountain caves, roaming in the forest and coming to Pampa for its water.
73_14.word_by_word: नरोत्तम O best of men, स्थूलान् huge, गिरिगुहाशय्यान् resting in the mountain caves, वनचारिणः  forestrangers, अपाम् of waters, लोभात्  desire , उपावृत्तान् approaching, वृषभानिव like bulls, नर्दतः roaring, रूपावनितान् delightful appearance, वराहान् boars, पम्पायाम् at Pampa, त्वम् you, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.

73_15.shloka: सायाह्ने विचरन्राम विटपीन्माल्यधारिणः।शीतोदकं च पम्पाया दृष्ट्वा शोकं विहास्यसि।।3.73.20।।
73_15.translation: When you stroll in the evening, you will see the trees laden with blossoms and lake Pampa full of cool water. You will forget your grief.
73_15.word_by_word: राम Rama, सायाह्ने in the evening, विचरन् while strolling, माल्यधारिणः laden with blossoms, विटपीन् trees, पम्पायाः at Pampa, शीतोदकं च cool waters also, दृष्ट्वा seeing, शोकम्  grief, विहास्यसि you will shake off.

73_16.shloka: सुमनोभिश्चितांस्तत्र तिलकान्नक्तमालकान्।उत्पलानि च फुल्लानि पङ्कजानि च राघव।।3.73.21।।
73_16.translation: O son of the Raghus  there you will see tilaka trees, night jasmines full of flowers. You will also see blossoming water lilies and lotuses in Pampa.
73_16.word_by_word: राघव Son of the Raghus, तत्र there, सुमनोभिः with flowers, चितान् full of, तिलकान् tilaka trees, नक्तमालकान् night jasmine, फुल्लानि blossoming, उत्पलानि च water lilies, पङ्कजानि च otuses.

73_17.shloka: न तानि कश्चिन्माल्यानि तत्रारोपयिता नरः।न च वै म्लानतां यान्ति न च शीर्यन्ति राघव।।3.73.22।।
73_17.translation: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama
73_17.word_by_word: राघव Rama, तत्र there, तानि माल्यानि those garlands, आरोपयिता wearing, नरः man, कश्चित्  any one, न not, म्लानताम् whithering, न यान्ति not become, न च शीर्यन्ति they do not wilt,

73_18.shloka: मतङ्गशिष्यास्तत्राऽसन्नृषयस्सुसमाहिताः।तेषां भाराभितप्तानां वन्यमाहरतां गुरोः।।3.73.23।।ये प्रपेतुर्महीं तूर्णं शरीरात्स्वेदबिन्दवः।तानि जातानि माल्यानि मुनीनां तपसा तदा।।3.73.24।।स्वेदबिन्दुसमुत्थानि न विनश्यन्ति राघव।
73_18.translation: While drops of sweat from the bodies of sage Matanga's disciples fell on earth under the heavy load of forest products they carried for their preceptor, they remained in a calm state. Those drops of sweat turned into flowers and those flowers do not witherdue to the power of penance of the sages.
73_18.word_by_word: तत्र there, सुसमाहिताः  in a calm state, मतङ्गशिष्याः seer Matanga's disciples, ऋषयः seers, आसन् they were, गुरोः of the preceptor, वन्यम् forest products, आहरताम् fetched, भाराभितप्तानाम् tired under the burden, तेषाम् from their, शरीरात् from the body, ये those, स्वेदबिन्दवः drops of sweat, तूर्णम् readily, महीम् on the earth, (प्र)पेतुः had fallen, तानि those, तदा then, मुनीनाम् of the sages, तपसा with penance, माल्यानि flowers, जातानि grown, राघव Rama, स्वेदबिन्दुसमुत्थानि sprung from the drops of sweat, न विनश्यन्ति not perish.

73_19.shloka: तेषां गतानामद्यापि दृश्यते परिचारिणी।।3.73.25।।श्रमणी शबरी नाम काकुत्स्थ चिरजीविनी।
73_19.translation: O Kakutstha  even now their attendant, named Sabari, an old ascetic is there even though they have left long ago.
73_19.word_by_word: काकुत्थ्स Kakutstha, तेषाम् for them, गतानाम् who had gone, परिचारिणी their attendant, चिरजीविनी living for long years, शबरीनाम named Sabari, श्रमणी ascetic, अद्यापि even now, दृश्यते is seen.

73_20.shloka: त्वां तु धर्मे स्थिता नित्यं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम्।।3.73.26।।दृष्ट्वा देवोपमं राम स्वर्गलोकं गमिष्यति।
73_20.translation: O Rama, she is established in righteousness, and you are godlike, and revered by all beings. When she sees you, she will attain heaven.
73_20.word_by_word: राम Rama, नित्यम् always, धर्मे in rigteous ways, स्थिता remaining, सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् revered by all beings, देवोपमम् godlike, त्वाम् you, दृष्ट्वा seeing, स्वर्गलोकम् heaven, गमिष्यति will go.

73_21.shloka: ततस्तद्राम पम्पायास्तीरमासाद्य पश्चिमम्।।3.73.27।।आश्रमस्थानमतुलं गुह्यं काकुत्स्थ पश्यसि।
73_21.translation: O Rama of the Kakutstha family, you will see on reaching the western bank of Pampa an incomparable site of hermitage concealed in a remote place.
73_21.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ Kakutstha, राम Rama, ततः thereafter, पम्पायाः Pampa's, तत् that, पश्चिमं तीरम् western bank, आसाद्य reaching, अतुलम् incomparable, गुह्यम् concealed, आश्रमस्थानम् site of hermitage, पश्यसि you will see.

73_22.shloka: न तत्राक्रमितुं नागाश्शक्नुवन्ति तमाश्रमम्।।3.73.28।।विविधास्तत्र वै नागा वने तस्मिंश्च पर्वते।ऋषेस्तत्र मतङ्गस्य विधानात्तच्च काननम्।।3.73.29।।
73_22.translation: The elephants of the forest and on the mountains do not attack the hermitage forbidden by sage Matanga.
73_22.word_by_word: तत्र There, नागा: elephants, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitage, आक्रमितुम् to attack, न शक्नुवन्ति not able, तस्मिन् in that, पर्वते in the mountain, वने forest, विविधाः many, नागाः elephants, तत् that, काननम् the forest, तस्य his, मतङ्गस्य ऋषेः seer Matanga's, विधानात् due to his command.

73_23.shloka: तस्मिन्नन्दनसङ्काशे देवारण्योपमे वने।नानाविहगसङ्कीर्णे रंस्यसे राम निर्वृतः।।3.73.30।।
73_23.translation: O Rama, you will enjoy your stay in that forest which is like Nandana garden, the garden of the gods, full of various birds.
73_23.word_by_word: राम Rama, नन्दनसङ्काशे like Nandana gardens, देवारण्योपमे comparable to the garden of the gods, नानाविहगसङ्कीर्णे full of several kinds of birds, तस्मिन् वने in that forest, निवृतः giving up your grief, रंस्यसे you will enjoy.

73_24.shloka: ऋष्यमूकश्च पम्पायाः पुरस्तात्पुष्पितद्रुमः।सुदुःखारोहणो नाम शिशुनागाभिरक्षितः।।3.73.31।।उदारो ब्रह्मणा चैव पूर्वकाले विनिर्मितः।
73_24.translation: Mount Rishyamuka situated on the bank of Pampa has trees filled with blossoms. Itis difficult to climb and is protected by young elephants.This lofty mountain was created by Brahma in olden days.
73_24.word_by_word: पम्पायाः Pampa's, पुरस्तात् before, पुष्पितद्रुमः trees with flowers in bloom, सुदुःखारोहणः quite difficult to climb, शिशुनागाभिरक्षितः protected by young elephants, उदारः exalted, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, ऋष्यमूकश्च Rishyamuka, पूर्वकाले in the past, विनिर्मितः is created.

73_25.shloka: शयानः पुरुषो राम तस्य शैलस्य मूर्धनि।।3.73.32।।यत्स्वप्ने लभते वित्तं तत्प्रबुद्धोऽधिगच्छति।
73_25.translation: Whatever wealth one dreams of in sleep on top of that mountain he will get on waking up, O Rama
73_25.word_by_word: राम Rama, तस्य of that, शैलस्य mountain's, मूर्धनि on top, शयानः while sleeping there, पुरुषः any man, स्वप्ने in a dream, यत् whatever, वित्तम् wealth, लभते obtains, तत् that, प्रबुद्धः on waking up, अधिगच्छति will get.

73_26.shloka: नत्वेनं विषमाचार पापकर्माऽधिरोहति।।3.73.33।।यस्तु तं विषमाचारः पापकर्माऽधिरोहति।तत्रैव प्रहऱन्त्येनं सुप्तमादाय राक्षसाः।।3.73.34।।
73_26.translation: If an evildoer or a sinner ascends the (Rishyamuka) mountain, he, in his sleep, will be thrown down with asleep by the demons from there itself. A sinner does not climb this mountain of uneven terrain.
73_26.word_by_word: विषमाचारः a place of uneven terrain for movement, पापकर्मा sinner, एवम् so also, न अधिरोहति cannot ascend, विषमाचारः evil doer, पापकर्मा sinner, यः whoever, तम् him, अधिरोहति ascends, सुप्तम् when asleep, तम् him, आदाय taking, राक्षसाः demons, तत्रैव there itself, प्रहरन्ति strike at him.

73_27.shloka: तत्रापि शिशुनागानामाक्रन्धश्श्रूयते महान्।क्रीडतां राम पम्पायां मतङ्गारण्यवासिनाम्।।3.73.35।।
73_27.translation: O Rama, the trumpeting of the young playful elephants inhabiting sage Matanga's forest can be heard at Pampa.
73_27.word_by_word: राम Rama, तत्रापि there also, पम्पायाम् at Pampa, क्रीडताम् sporting, मतङ्गारण्यवासिनाम् for those inhabiting sage Matanga's forest, शिशुनागानाम् for baby elphants, महान् great,आक्रन्द: roaring sound, श्रूयते will be heard.

73_28.translation: The great, nimble elphants, dark like clouds, drenched with the flow of ichor come together and then separate and scatter.
73_28.word_by_word: मेघवर्णाः like dark rainclouds, तरस्विनः swift, परमद्विपाः great elephants, संहृत्य drawn together, रुधिरधाराभिः streams of ichor(red in colour) flowing from their body, सिक्ताः are drenched, पृथक् separated, कीर्णाः scattered, प्रचरन्ति they wander.

73_29.shloka: ते तत्र पीत्वा पानीयं विमलं शीतमव्ययम्।निर्वृतास्संविगाहन्ते वनानि वनगोचराः।।3.73.37।।
73_29.translation: The wandering elephants of the forest drink plentiful water, pure and cool, from Pampa and contented, plunge into the forest.
73_29.word_by_word: वनगोचराः wandering in the forest, ते they, विमलम् pure, शीतम् cool, अव्ययम् plenty, पानीयम् water, पीत्वा drinking, निर्वृताः contented, वनानि in the forest, (सं)विगाहन्ते plunge into.

73_30.shloka: ऋक्षांश्च द्वीपिनश्चैव नीलकोमलकप्रभान्।रुरूनपेतापजयान् दृष्ट्वा शोकं जयिष्यसि।।3.73.38।।
73_30.translation: When you see, shining like sapphires, the bears, tigers, antelopes who know nodefeat, you will get over your grief.
73_30.word_by_word: ऋक्षांश्च bears and, द्वीपिनश्चैव tigers, नीलकोमलकप्रभान् shining like sapphire, अपेतापजयान् that which have not met with defeat, रुरून् antelopes,दृष्ट्वा on seeing, शोकम् grief, जयिष्यसि will get over.

73_31.shloka: राम तस्य तु शैलस्य महती शोभते गुहा।शिलापिधाना काकुत्स्थ दुःखं चास्याः प्रवेशनम्।।3.73.39।।
73_31.translation: O son of the Kakutstha family, there is a beautiful cave in that mountain covered with a slab of stone. It is difficult to enter.
73_31.word_by_word: काकुत्स्थ राम Rama of the Kakutstha family, तस्य शैलस्य of that mountain, शिलापिधाना covered with a slab, महती huge, गुहा cave, शोभते looks beautiful, अस्याः that cave's, प्रवेशनम्  entry, दुःखम् difficult.

73_32.shloka: तस्या गुहायाः प्राग्द्वारे महान्शीतोदको ह्रदः।फलमूलान्वितो रम्यो नानामृगसमावृतः।।3.73.40।।
73_32.translation: At the eastern entrance of the cave there is a cool watertank. On its bank teeming with various animals are delightful fruits and roots.
73_32.word_by_word: तस्याः of that, गुहायाः cave's, प्राग्द्वारे at the eastern entrance, शीतोदकः one with cool water, फलमूलान्वीतः filled with fruits and roots, रम्यः delightful, नानामृगसमावृतः surrounded by different kinds of animals, महान् great, ह्रदः lake.

73_33.shloka: तस्यां वसति सुग्रीवश्चतुर्भिस्सह वानरैः।कदाचिच्छिखरे तस्य पर्वतस्यावतिष्ठते।।3.73.41।।
73_33.translation: Sugriva dwells in that cave with four other monkeys. At times he sits on the top of the mountain.
73_33.word_by_word: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, चतुर्भिः with four, वानरैः सह along with monkeys, तस्याम् in that cave, वसति  dwells, कदाचित् at times, तस्य पर्वतस्य the mountain's, शिखरे top, अवतिष्ठते stays.

73_34.shloka: कबन्धस्त्वनुशास्यैवं तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।स्रग्वी भास्करवर्णाभः खे व्यरोचत वीर्यवान्।।3.73.42।।
73_34.translation: Having instructed both Rama and Lakshmana, courageous Kabandha, wearing a flowergarland, shone brightly like the Sun in the sky.
73_34.word_by_word: वीर्यवान् courageous, स्रग्वी wearing a flower garland, कबन्धस्तु Kabandha, तौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, एवम् in that way, अनुशास्य telling them, खे भास्करवर्णाभः like the colour of the Sun, व्यरोचत shone brightly.

73_35.shloka: तं तु खस्थं महाभागं कबन्धं रामलक्ष्मणौ।प्रस्थितौ त्वं व्रजस्वेति वाक्यमूचतुरन्तिके।।3.73.43।।
73_35.translation: Both Rama and Lakshmana, ready to depart, went near the glorious Kabandha waiting in the sky and said, You may go now.
73_35.word_by_word: प्रस्थितौ both set forth, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, अन्तिके gone near, खस्थम् he who stood in the sky, महाभागम् glorious, तं कबन्धम् that Kabandha, त्वम् you, व्रजस्व can go, इति thus, वाक्यम् words said, ऊचतुः both spoke.

73_36.shloka: गम्यतां कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थमिति तावब्रवीत्स च।सुप्रीतौ तावनुज्ञाप्य कबन्धः प्रस्थितस्तदा।।3.73.44।।
73_36.translation: Then Kabandha said to the brothers satisfied, You may go now to accomplish your task. Then he took leave.
73_36.word_by_word: तदा then, प्रस्थितः set to go, सः कबन्धश्च that Kabandha, सुप्रीतौ both of them very pleased, तौ both, अनुज्ञाप्य took leave, कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थम् to accomplish the task, गम्यताम् you may depart, तौ both, अब्रवीत् said.

73_37.shloka: स तत्कबन्धः प्रतिपद्य रूपं वृतश्श्रिया भास्करतुल्यदेहः।निदर्शयन्राममवेक्ष्य खस्थः सख्यं कुरुष्वेति तदाभ्युवाच।।3.73.45।।
73_37.translation: Kabandha assumed his true form, his body shining like the radiance of the Sun. He stood in the sky showing his form and looking at Rama, said, Make friendship with Sugriva.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
73_37.word_by_word: सः कबन्धः that Kabandha, तत् then, रूपम् his true form, प्रतिपद्य after attaining, श्रिया with radiance, वृतः surrounded, भास्करतुल्य देहः his body shining like the Sun, खस्थः from the sky, रामम् Rama, अवेक्ष्य seeing, निदर्शयन् while showing at, सख्यम् friendship, कुरुष्व  make, इति this, तदा then, उवाच said.

74_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana visit  the hermitage of Sabari-- Sabari's hospitalitythey go round the forest and hermitage of sage Matanga-- Sabari casts her body into the fire and ascends to heaven.]तौ कबन्धेन तं मार्गं पम्पाया दर्शितं वने।प्रतस्थतुर्दिशं गृह्य प्रतीचीं नृवरात्मजौ।।3.74.1।।
74_1.translation: The two princes set forth in the western direction towards Pampa shown by Kabandha.
74_1.word_by_word: तौ both, नृवरात्मजौ the two princes, वने in the forest, प्रतीचीं दिशम् western direction showed by, गृह्य took, कबन्धेन by Kabandha, दर्शितं shown by, तम् him, पम्पायाः Pampa's, मार्गम् way, प्रतस्थतुः both set out.

74_2.shloka: तौ शैलेष्वाचितानेकान् क्षौद्रकल्पफलान्द्रुमान्।वीक्षन्तौ जग्मतुर्ध्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं रामलक्ष्मणौ।।3.74.2।।
74_2.translation: Observing the trees loaded with honeysweet fruits on the mountain, Rama and Lakshmana   went to see Sugriva.
74_2.word_by_word: तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, शैलेषु in the mountain, आचितान् loaded with, क्षौद्रकल्पफलान् honey like fruits, द्रुमान् trees, वीक्षन्तौ seeing, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, द्रष्टुम् to see, जग्मतुः both went.

74_3.shloka: कृत्वा च शैलपृष्ठे तु तौ वासं रामलक्ष्मणौ।पम्पायाः पश्चिमं तीरं राघवावुपतस्थतुः।।3.74.3।।
74_3.translation: Rama and Lakshmana halted on the slope of the mountain and then departed for the western bank of Pampa.
74_3.word_by_word: राघवौ Rama, तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, शैलपृष्ठे on the slope of the mountain, वासम् stay, कृत्वा made, पम्पायाः Pampa's, पश्चिमं तीरम् western bank, उपतस्थतुःstarted on that path.

74_4.shloka: तौ पुष्करिण्याः पम्पायास्तीरमासाद्य पश्चिमम्।अपश्यतां ततस्तत्र शबर्या रम्यमाश्रमम्।।3.74.4।।
74_4.translation: Both reached the west bank of lake Pampa and saw the delightful hermitage of Sabari.
74_4.word_by_word: ततः then, तौ both, पम्पायाः Pampa, पुष्करिण्याः of the tank, पश्चिमम् western, तीरम्  bank, आसाद्य reached, तत्र there, शबर्याः of Sabari, रम्यम् delightful, आश्रमम् hermitage, अपश्यताम् observed.

74_5.translation: Both reached the beautiful hermitage full of many kinds of trees. There they saw Sabari, and went towards her.
74_5.word_by_word: तौ they both, तम् that, आश्रमम् hermitge, आसाद्य after reaching, बहुभिः with many, द्रुमैः with many trees, आवृतम् surrounded, सुरम्यम् very beautiful, अभिवीक्षन्तौ both looking at, शबरीम् Sabari's, अभ्युपेयतुः went towards.

74_6.shloka: तौ च दृष्ट्वा तदा सिद्धा समुत्थाय कृताञ्जलिः।रामस्य पादौ जग्राह लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः।।3.74.6।।
74_6.translation: On seeing them both, Sabari, an accomplished ascetic, got up with folded hands andtouched the feet of the sagacious Rama and Lakshmana.
74_6.word_by_word: तदा then, सिद्धा an accomplished ascetic, तौ both, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, कृताञ्जलिः joined palms and offered obeisance, समुत्थाय having got up, रामस्य Rama's, धीमतः sagacious, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, पादौ feet, जग्राह held.

74_7.shloka: पाद्यमाचमनीयं च सर्वं प्रादाद्यथाविधि।तामुवाच ततो रामश्श्रमणीं संशितव्रताम्।।3.74.7।।
74_7.translation: She offered them water to wash their feet and water to sip as per tradition. Then Rama spoke to Sabari who used to perform austere penance:
74_7.word_by_word: पाद्यम् water to wash feet, आचमनीयं च and water to sip, सर्वम् all, यथाविधि as per tradition, प्रादात् she offered, ततः then, संशितव्रताम्  doing penance, ताम् of yours, श्रमणीम् austere woman, रामः Rama, उवाच said:

74_8.shloka: कच्चित्ते निर्जिता विघ्नाः कच्चित्ते वर्धते तपः।कच्चित्ते नियतः क्रोध आहारश्च तपोधने।।3.74.8।।
74_8.translation: O ascetic   hope you have overcome your obstacles to penance, you have controlled your anger and your desire for food. Is your austerity in progress.
74_8.word_by_word: तपोधने  endowed with the wealth of penance(the ascetic), ते your, विघ्नाः obstacles, निर्जिताः कच्चित् hope you have overcome, ते your, तपः penance, वर्धते कच्चित्  progressing indeed, ते your, क्रोधः anger, आहारश्च desire for food, नियतः कच्चित् is controlled indeed?

74_9.shloka: कच्चित्ते नियमाः प्राप्ताः कच्चित्ते मनसः सुखम्।कच्चित्ते गुरुशुश्रूषा सफला चारुभाषिणि।।3.74.9।।
74_9.translation: O Sweettongued Sabari, have you achieved selfcontrol? Has your mind attained peace ? Have your services to the preceptor yielded results?
74_9.word_by_word: चारुभाषिणि sweettongued, ते you, नियमाः selfcontrol, प्राप्ताः कच्चित् have you attained , ते your, मनसः mind, सुखं कच्चित् attained peace, ते your, गुरुशुश्रूषा serving the preceptor, सफला कच्चित् has yielded results?

74_10.shloka: रामेण तापसी पृष्टा सा सिद्धा सिद्धसम्मता।शशंस शबरी वृद्धा रामाय प्रत्युपस्थिता।।3.74.10।।
74_10.translation: When Rama asked Sabari who was an old, accomplished ascetic adored by siddhas, she stood in front and replied :
74_10.word_by_word: रामेण by Rama, पृष्टा enquired, सिद्धा an accomplished ascetic, सिद्धसम्मता a lady adored and accepted by siddhas, तापसी ascetic, वृद्धा old woman, सा शबरी that Sabari, प्रत्युपस्थिता standing in front, रामाय to Rama, शशंस she spoke.

74_11.shloka: अद्य प्राप्ता तपस्सिद्धिस्तव संदर्शनान्मया।अद्य मे सफलं तप्तं गुरवश्च सुपूजिताः।।3.74.11।।
74_11.translation: On seeing you now my penance has attained fulfilment, my services to my preceptors have borne fruit.
74_11.word_by_word: अद्य now, तव your, संदर्शनात् by seeing you, मया by me, तपस्सिद्धि: fulfilment of my penance, प्राप्ता is attained, अद्य now, मे my, तप्तम् penance, सफलम् successful, गुरवश्च preceptors, सुपूजिता: have been honoured.

74_12.shloka: अद्य मे सफलं जन्म स्वर्गश्चैव भविष्यति।त्वयि देववरे राम पूजिते पुरुषर्षभ।।3.74.12।।
74_12.translation: O best of men, O highest of the gods my birth has become fruitful today with your worship, (you have made) even attainment of heaven quite certain.
74_12.word_by_word: पुरुषर्षभ best  of men, देववरे best among  gods, त्वयि when you, पूजिते worshipped, अद्य now, मे my, जन्म birth, सफलम् fruitful, स्वर्गश्चैव even heaven, भविष्यति is certain.

74_13.translation: O delight of the Raghus, your handsome look has sanctified me, O subduer of enemies, by your grace I will reach the inmperishable worlds.
74_13.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghus, तव your, सौम्येन by your handsome, चक्षुषा looks, पूता  sanctified, अस्मि I am, अरिन्दम O subduer of enemies, त्वत्प्रसादात् by your grace, अक्षयान् imperishable, लोकान् worlds, गमिष्यामि I will reach.

74_14.shloka: चित्रकूटं त्वयि प्राप्ते विमानैरतुलप्रभैः।इतस्ते दिवमारूढा यानहं पर्यचारिषम्।।3.74.14।।
74_14.translation: The men I served have ascended heaven on aerial chariots of incomparable radiance the moment you touched Chitrakuta.
74_14.word_by_word: अहम् I, यान् those men, पर्यचारिषम् I have served, ते they, त्वयि when you, चित्रकूटम् Chitrakutam, प्राप्ते arrived, अतुलप्रभैः with incomparable radiance, विमानैः with aerial chariots, इतः from here, दिवम् to heaven, आरूढाः I will reach.

74_15.shloka: तैश्चाहमुक्ता धर्मज्ञैर्महाभागैर्महर्षिभिः।आगमिष्यति ते रामस्सुपुण्यमिममाश्रमम्।।3.74.15।।स ते प्रतिग्रहीतव्यस्सौमित्रिसहितोतिथिः।तं च दृष्ट्वा वरान्लोकानक्षयांस्त्वं गमिष्यसि।।3.74.16।।
74_15.translation: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive himwith due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'
74_15.word_by_word: धर्मज्ञैः by knowers of rigteousness, महाभागैः by the honourable, तैः महर्षिभिः by those great seers, अहम् I, उक्ता have been told, रामः Rama, ते your, सुपुण्यम् very sacred, इमम् आश्रमम् this hermitage, अगमिष्यति will come, सौमित्रिसहितः along with Saumitri, सः he, ते for you, अतिथिः guest, प्रतिग्रहीतव्यः receive with due reverence, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, त्वम् you, वरान् great, अक्षयान् inexhaustible, लोकान् worlds, गमिष्यसि you will go,

74_16.shloka: मया तु विविधं वन्यं सञ्चितं पुरुषर्षभ।तवार्थे पुरुषव्याघ्र पम्पायास्तीरसम्भवम्।।3.74.17।।
74_16.translation: O best among men I have collected and kept for your sake different kinds of forestfood grown on the bank of Pampa.
74_16.word_by_word: पुरुषव्याघ्र O best among men, (रघुनन्दन delight of the Raghus), मया by me, तव अर्थे for your sake, पम्पायाः Pampa's, तीरसम्भवम् grown on the bank, विविधम् many kinds, वन्यम्   forestfood, सञ्चितम् collected.

74_17.shloka: एवमुक्तस्स धर्मात्मा शबर्या शबरीमिदम्।राघवः प्राह विज्ञाने तां नित्यमबहिष्कृताम्।।3.74.18।।
74_17.translation: Entreated by her in that manner, the righteous Rama spoke to Sabari who was established in true knowledge:
74_17.word_by_word: शबर्या by Sabari, एवम् in that way, उक्तः addressed, धर्मात्मा righteous, सः राघवः that Rama, नित्यम् always, विज्ञाने in knowledge, अबहिष्क्रताम् not kept away, तां शबरीम् that Sabari, प्राह he said.

74_18.shloka: दनोस्सकाशात्तत्त्वेन प्रभावं ते महात्मनः।श्रुतं प्रत्यक्षमिच्छामि सन्द्रष्टुं यदि मन्यसे।।3.74.19।।
74_18.translation: I have heard from great Danu about your power. If you agree, I would like to see this power in person.
74_18.word_by_word: महात्मनः by the great self, दनोः सकाशात् from Danu, श्रुतम् heard, ते your, प्रभावम् power, मन्यसे यदि if you think so, प्रत्यक्षम् directly, (सं)द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I desire.

74_19.shloka: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्ता रामवक्त्राद्विनिस्सृतम्।शबरी दर्शयामास तावुभौ तद्वनं महत्।।3.74.20।।
74_19.translation: At these words from the mouth of Rama, Sabari took them both round the great garden.
74_19.word_by_word: शबरी Sabari, रामवक्त्रात् from Rama's mouth, विनिस्सृतम् released, एतत् this, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, तौ उभौ both of them, महत् great, तत् that, वनम् garden, दर्शयामास started showing.

74_20.translation: O delight of the Raghus see this garden looking like the dense cloud. Full of animals and birds, it is popularly known as Matanga garden.
74_20.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन O delight of the Raghus, मेघघनप्रख्यम् looking like the dense cloud, मृगपक्षिसमाकुलम् filled with animals and birds, मतङ्गवनमित्येव known as Matanga garden, विश्रुतम् popular, पश्य see.

74_21.shloka: इह ते भावितात्मानो गुरवो मे महावने।जुहवाञ्चक्रिरे तीर्थं मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रपूजितम्।।3.74.22।।
74_21.translation: My precepters, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit made sacrificial offerings in this great garden, invoked gods through the power of mantras. They brought water and offered oblations to the sacrificial fire.
74_21.word_by_word: महावने in this great garden, भावितात्मानः who perceived the supreme spirit, ते they, मे गुरुवः my preceptors, इह here, मन्त्रवत् by the power of mantras, मन्त्रपूजितम् invoked by mantras, तीर्थम् waters, जुहवाञ्चक्रिरे  performed  sacrifice.

74_22.shloka: इयं प्रत्यक्थ्सली वेदिर्यत्र ते मे सुसत्कृताः।पुष्पोपहारं कुर्वन्ति श्रमादुद्वेपिभिः करैः।।3.74.23।।
74_22.translation: This is the altar named Pratyaksthali where the saints aged and exhausted( by performing chandrayana) whom I worshipped made offerings of flowers with trembling hands.
74_22.word_by_word: मे my, सुसत्कृताः revered ones, ते they, यत्र where, श्रमात्  exhausted, उद्वेपिभिः करैः did with trembling hands, पुष्पोवहारम् offering flowers for worship, कुर्वन्ति make, प्रत्यक्थ्सली वेदिः altar knows as Pratyaksthali, इयम् this is.

74_23.shloka: तेषां तपःप्रभावेण पश्याद्यापि रघूद्वह।द्योतयन्ति दिशस्सर्वाश्श्रिया वेद्योऽतुलप्रभाः।।3.74.24।।
74_23.translation: O Rama see, even now they illuminate the sacrificial altars with the power of their penance. They shed light in all directions with a matchless brilliance.
74_23.word_by_word: रघूद्वह O Rama, तेषाम् their, तपःप्रभावेण by the power of their penance, अतुलप्रभाः matchless brilliance, वेद्यः altars, श्रिया with glow, अद्यापि even today, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, द्योतयन्ति filling with light, पश्य see.

74_24.translation: Look at the seven seas, which have reached here at their mere thought as they could not reach them due to fatigue from fasting.
74_24.word_by_word: उपवासश्रमालसैः weariness due to fasting, गन्तुम् to move about, अशक्नुवद्भिः having no energy, तैः by them, चिन्तिते by mere thought, अभ्यागतान् came towards, सहितान् all together, सप्तसागरान् all the seven seas, पश्य see.

74_25.shloka: कृताभिषेकैस्तैर्न्यस्ता वल्कलाः पादपेष्विह।अद्यापि नावशुष्यन्ति प्रदेशे रघुनन्दन।।3.74.26।।
74_25.translation: O delight of the Raghus  look at the bark robes spread on the trees to dry after their bathing which are still wet.
74_25.word_by_word: रघुनन्दन delight of the Raghus, इह here, कृताभिषेकैः  after bathing, तै: by them, प्रदेशे place, पादपेषु on the trees, न्यस्ताः laid to dry, वल्कलाः bark clothes, अद्यापि even now, न अवशुष्यन्ति do not get dry still.

74_26.shloka: देवकार्याणि कुर्वद्भिर्यानीमानि कृतानि वै।पुष्पैःकुवलयैस्सार्धं म्लानत्वं नोपयान्तिवै।।3.74.27।।
74_26.translation: The flowers including lotuses offered by the sages while worshipping gods have not yet wilted.
74_26.word_by_word: देवकार्याणि for the worship of gods, कुर्वद्भि: they offered, कुवलयैःसार्धम् along with lotuses  and others, पुष्पैः with flowers, यानि all those, कृतानि arranged, इमानि all these, म्लानत्वम् wilted, नोपयान्ति वै do not attain.

74_27.shloka: कृत्स्नं वनमिदं दृष्टं श्रोतव्यं च श्रुतं त्वया।तदिच्छाम्यभ्यनुज्ञाता त्यक्तुमेतत्कलेबरम्।।3.74.28।।
74_27.translation: You have seen the entire garden and have listened what is to be heard. With your permission I would like to give up this body.
74_27.word_by_word: त्वया by you, कृत्स्नम् entirely, इदं वनम् this garden, दृष्टम् is seen, श्रोतव्यम् to be heard, श्रुतं च it is heard, तत् that, अभ्यनुज्ञाता with your permission, एतत् this, कलेबरम् body, त्यक्तुम् to give up, इच्छामि I desire to.

74_28.shloka: तेषामिच्छाम्यहं गन्तुं समीपं भावितात्मनाम्।मुनीनामाश्रमो येषामहं च परिचारिणी।।3.74.29।।
74_28.translation: I wish to reach those realisers of the Supreme Spirit whom I served and to whom this hermitage belonged.
74_28.word_by_word: आश्रमः hermitage, येषां मुनीनाम् of  those seers (to whom this hermitage belongs), अहं च I, परिचारिणी I am a servant, भावितात्मनाम् realisers of supreme spirit, तेषाम् their, समीपम् near, गन्तुम् to go, इच्छामि I desire.

74_29.shloka: धर्मिष्ठं तु वचश्श्रुत्वा राघवस्सहलक्ष्मणः।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे आश्चर्यमिति तत्त्वतः।।3.74.30।।
74_29.translation: Rama and Lakshmana on hearing the pious words of Savari joyfully exclaimed, This is really wonderful.
74_29.word_by_word: सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, राघवः Rama, धर्मिष्ठम् dedicated to dharma, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, तत्त्वतः truly, आश्चर्यम् wonderful, इति thus, अतुलम् incomparable, प्रहर्षम् happiness, लेभे attained.

74_30.shloka: तामुवाच ततो रामश्श्रमणीं संशितव्रताम्।अर्चितोऽहं त्वया भक्त्या गच्छकामं यथासुखम्।।3.74.31।।
74_30.translation: Looking at Sabari who was steadfast in her vow, Rama said, O ascetic, you have worshipped me with devotion. You may go wherever you like (to the world you desire)
74_30.word_by_word: ततः then, रामः Rama,संशितव्रताम् determined in her vow, श्रमणीम् female ascetic, उवाच said, अहम् I, त्वया by you, भक्त्या devotion, अर्चितः worshipped, कामम् verily indeed, यथासुखम् with pleasure, गच्छ you may go.

74_31.shloka: इत्युक्ता जटिला वृद्धा चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरा।तस्मिन्मुहूर्ते शबरी देहं जीर्णं जिहासती।।3.74.32।।अनुज्ञाता तु रामेण हुत्वात्मानं हुताशने।ज्वलत्पावकसङ्काशा स्वर्गमेव जगाम सा।।3.74.33।।
74_31.translation: With matted locks, tattered bark clothes and deer skin, Sabari consigned her old and emaciated body to the fire at that moment, with the permission of Rama and ascended to heaven, her body glowing like fire.
74_31.word_by_word: इति this, उक्ता was said, जटिला a woman of matted locks, वृद्धा old, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरा woman wearing tattered bark clothes and deer skin, शबरी Sabari, जीर्णम् emaciated, देहम् body, तस्मिन् मूहूर्ते at that moment, जिहासती desiring to give up, रामेण by Rama, अनुज्ञाता permitted, आत्मानम् herself, हुताशने in fire, हुत्वा after offering, ज्वलत्पावकसङ्काशा body glittering like fire, स्वर्गमेव to heaven, जगाम went.

74_32.shloka: दिव्याभरणसंयुक्ता दिव्यमाल्यानुलेपना।दिव्याम्बरधरा तत्र बभूव प्रियदर्शना।।3.74.34।।विराजयन्ती तं देशं विद्युत्सौदामिनी यथा।
74_32.translation: Adorned with wonderful ornaments and beautiful garlands, anointed with fragrant unguents, robed in most beautiful clothes, she appeared like a streak of lightning, her body shining bright and her face contented.
74_32.word_by_word: दिव्याभरणसंयुक्ता adorned with wonderful ornaments, दिव्यमाल्यानुलेपना wearing beautiful garlands and anointed with fragrant unguents, दिव्याम्बरधरा robed in most wonderful clothes, विद्युत् सौदामनी यथा like a streak of lightning, तं देशम् that place, विराजयन्ती illuminating, तत्र there, प्रियदर्शना pleasing appearance, बभूव appeared.

74_33.shloka: यत्र ते सुकृतात्मानो विहरन्ति महर्षयः।।3.74.35।।तत्पुण्यं शबरी स्थानं जगामात्मसमाधिना।
74_33.translation: By virtue of her selfmeditation, Sabari went to that sacred world where the holy sages lived because of their good deeds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
74_33.word_by_word: शबरी Sabari, आत्मसमाधिना her meditation, सुकृतात्मानः who did good deeds, ते महर्षयः the great sages, यत्र where, विहरन्ति  moved, तत् that, पुण्यम् sacred, स्थानम् holy place, जगाम went.

75_1.shloka: [Rama and Lakshmana reach Pampa-- admire the beautiful nature on the banks of Pampa.]दिवं तु तस्यां यातायां शबर्यां स्वेन तेजसा।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चिन्तयामास राघवः।।3.75.1।।
75_1.translation: When Sabari departed for heaven with her brilliance, Rama  contemplated (about the power of sages)with Lakshmana.
75_1.word_by_word: तस्याम् when she, शबर्याम् Sabari, स्वेन तेजसा by her own brilliance, दिवम् heavens, यातायाम् on departing, राघवः Rama, भ्रात्रा with his brother, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, चिन्तयामास contemplated.

75_2.shloka: स चिन्तयित्वा धर्मात्मा प्रभावं तं महात्मनाम्।हितकारिणमेकाग्रं लक्ष्मणं राघवोऽब्रवीत्।।3.75.2।।
75_2.translation: Thinking about the power of the great sages, righteous Rama said to Lakshmana,  his wellwisher with singleminded devotion:
75_2.word_by_word: धर्मात्मा righteous, सः राघवः Rama, महात्मनाम् of great sages, प्रभावम् power, चिन्तयित्वा  on thinking over, हितकारिणम् his wellwisher, एकाग्रम् with singleminded devotion, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, अब्रवीत् said.

75_3.translation: O handsome one, we have seen this highly wonderful hermitage, where deer and tigers dwell together with mutual confidence, where birds of all kinds inhabit.
75_3.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one  महात्मनाम् of the great sages, बह्वाश्चर्यः very wonderful, विश्वस्तमृगशार्दूलः deer and tigers live together with implicit faith, नानाविहगसेवितः where birds of all kinds dwell, अयम् आश्रमः this hermitage, दृष्टः seen.

75_4.shloka: सप्तानां च समुद्राणामेषु तीर्थेषु लक्ष्मण।उपस्पृष्टं च विधिवत्पितरश्चापि तर्पिताः।।3.75.4।।
75_4.translation: O Lakshmana, having bathed in the waters of the seven seas (by taking ritualistic bath in these waters) the manes are offered oblations in accordance with tradition.
75_4.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, सप्तानाम् of seven, समुद्राणाम् of seas, एषु तीर्थेषु in these waters, उपस्पृष्टम् having bathed, पितरश्चापि oblations to forefathers, विधिवत् in accordance with tradition, तर्पिताः have been invoked with offering.

75_5.shloka: प्रणष्टमशुभं तत्तत्कल्याणं समुपस्थितम्।तेन तत्त्वेन हृष्टं मे मनो लक्ष्मण सम्प्रति।।3.75.5।।हृदये हि नरव्याघ्र शुभमाविर्भविष्यति।
75_5.translation: We have got rid of inauspicious time and good days have come. Therefore, I feel truly happy. Good fortune will appear (now), O Lakshmana, O tiger among men
75_5.word_by_word: अशुभम् inauspicious time, प्रणष्टम् is got rid of, तत्तत् respectively, कल्याणम् auspicious tidings, समुपस्थितम् have reached, लक्ष्मण O Lakshmana, तेन therefore, तत्त्वेन truly, सम्प्रति presently, मनः mind, हृष्टम् happy, नरव्याघ्र O best among men, हृदये at heart, शुभम्  good fortune, आविर्भविष्यति हि will appear now.

75_6.shloka: तदागच्छ गमिष्यामि पम्पां तां प्रियदर्शनाम्।।3.75.6।।ऋष्यमूको गिरिर्यत्र नातिदूरे प्रकाशते।यस्मिन्वसति धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवोंऽशुमतस्सुतः।।3.75.7।।नित्यं वालिभयात्त्रस्तश्चतुर्भिस्सह वानरैः।
75_6.translation: Come, let us go to Pampa, which is pleasing to look at. Sugriva, the rigteous self, the son of the Sun has been staying for fear of Vali at the shining Rishyamuka, not far from here.
75_6.word_by_word: तत् therefore, धर्मात्मा the righteous soul, अंशुमतः सुतः son of the Sun, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, नित्यम् ever, वालिभयात् by the fear of Vali, चतुर्भिः with four, वानरैः सह along with monkeys, यस्मिन् in which, वसति stay, ऋष्यमूक: Rishyamuka, यत्र there, नातिदूरे not very far away, प्रकाशते  shines, ताम् that, प्रियदर्शनाम् pleasing to look at, पम्पाम् Pampa, गमिष्यामि I will go, आगच्छ you may come along.

75_7.shloka: अभित्वरे च तं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम्।।3.75.8।।तदधीनं हि मे सौम्य सीतायाः परिमार्गणम्।
75_7.translation: I am hastening to see that noble Sugriva the mighty monkey, as the search for Sita depends on him, O handsome one
75_7.word_by_word: सौम्य O handsome one, वानरर्षभम् mighty among the monkeys, तं सुग्रीवम् that Sugriva, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभित्वरे च I am in haste, सीतायाः of Sita, परिमार्गणम् searching, तदधीनम् depends on him.

75_8.shloka: एवं ब्रुवाणं तं धीरं रामं सौमित्रिरब्रवीत्।।3.75.9।।गच्छावस्त्वरितं तत्र ममापि त्वरते मनः।
75_8.translation: To the words of Rama who was of stable mind, Lakshmana replied : My mind too is hastening me. Let us get there quickly.
75_8.word_by_word: एवम् in that way, ब्रुवाणम् as he spoke, धीरम् stableminded one, तं रामम् to that Rama, सौमित्रिः Soumitri, अब्रवीत् said, मम my, मनः आपि mind also, त्वरते hurrying, त्वरितम् quickly, तत्र there, गच्छावः we both will go.

75_9.shloka: आश्रमात्तु तत स्तस्मान्निष्क्रम्य स विशाम्पतिः।।3.75.10।।आजगाम ततः पम्पां लक्ष्मणेन सह प्रभुः।
75_9.translation: Then Rama the lord of men along with Lakshmana departed from the hermitage and went to Pampa.
75_9.word_by_word: ततः then, विशाम्पतिः lord of men, सः he, प्रभुः lord, तस्मात् from that, आश्रमात् from that hermitage, निष्क्रम्य on departing , ततः then, लक्ष्मणेन सह with Lakshmana, पम्पाम् to Pampa, आजगाम went.

75_10.shloka: स ददर्श ततः पुण्यामुदारजनसेविताम्।।3.75.11।।नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णां पम्पां पानीयवाहिनीम्।पद्मैस्सौगन्धिकैस्ताम्रां शुक्लां कुमुदमण्डलैः।।3.75.12।।नीलां कुवलयोद्घाटैर्बहुवर्णां कुथामिव।
75_10.translation: He saw the sacred lake Pampa whose sweet flow of water was used by great seers. It abounded in trees and creepers. Its surface was red with lotuses at one place, white with clusters of lilies at another and with blue lotuses at other places. As such, it looked like a carpet with variegated colours.
75_10.word_by_word: ततः then, सः he, पुण्याम् that sacred, उदारजनसेविताम् the place where exalted seers lived, नानाद्रुमलताकीर्णाम्  abounding in different kinds of trees and creepers, पानीयवाहिनीम् with flow of waters, सौगन्धिकैः sweetscented, पद्मैः lotuses, ताम्राम् red, कुमुदमण्डलैः with clusters of lilies, शुक्लाम् white, कुवलयोद्घाटैः with blue waterlilies, नीलाम् blue lotuses, बहुवर्णाम् with variegated colours, कुथामिव like a carpet, पम्पाम् Pampa lake, ददर्श saw.

75_11.shloka: स तामासाद्य वै रामो दूरादुदकवाहिनीम्।।3.75.13।।मतङ्गसरसं नाम ह्रदं समवगाहत।
75_11.translation: Rama reached the Matanga lake which he could see from  a distance and bathed in it.
75_11.word_by_word: सः रामः Rama, उदकवाहिनीम् lake, ताम् that one, दूरात् from  a distance, आसाद्य reached, मतङ्गसरसं नाम a place called Matanga lake, ह्रदम् pond,समवगाहत bathed.

75_12.shloka: अरविन्दोत्पलवतीं पद्मसौगन्धिकायुताम्।।3.75.14।।पुष्पिताम्रवणोपेतां बर्हिणोद्घुष्टनादिताम्।तिलकैर्बीजपूरैश्च धवैश्शुक्लद्रुमैस्तथा।।3.75.15।।पुष्पितैः करवीरैश्च पुन्नागैश्च सुपुष्पितैः।मालतीकुन्दगुल्मैश्च भाण्डीरैर्निचुलैस्तथा।।3.75.16।।अशोकैस्सप्तपर्णैश्च केतकैरतिमुक्तकैः।अन्यैश्च विविधैर्वृक्षैः प्रमदामिव भूषिताम्।।3.75.17।।समीक्षमाणौ पुषपाढ्यं सर्वतो विपुलद्रुमम्।कोयष्टिकैश्चार्जुनकैश्शतपत्रैश्च कीरकैः।।3.75.18।।एतैश्चान्यैश्च विहगैर्नादितं तु वनं महत्।ततो जग्मतुरव्यग्रौ राघवौ सुसमाहितौ।।3.75.19।।तद्वनं चैव सरसः पश्यन्तै शकुनैर्युतम्।
75_12.translation: Lake Pampa was filled with red lotuses and their fragrance.The bank was lined with blossoming mango trees and trees of several kinds like tilaka trees with fruits full of seeds like citron, dhava trees, white trees in bloom, karavira trees loaded with flowers, punnaga trees, clusters of jasmine and kunda shrubs, fig trees, so also reeds, ashoka trees, atimuktaka creepors and several other trees looking like women adorned all over. Rama and Lakshmana passed by, glancing at them. There were other trees full of flowers, huge trees, koyashtika trees with reed. Different kinds of birds such as peacocks, parrots, dwelling in the forest were screaming aloud. Looking at all these in that forest Rama and Lakshmana passed by undisturbed with a composed mind.
75_12.word_by_word: ततः thereafter, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, अरविन्दोत्पलवतीम् having lilies and lotuses, पद्मसौगन्धिकायुताम् filled with fragrance of lotuses, पुष्पिताम्रवणोपेताम् with blossoming mango trees, बर्हिणोद्घुष्टनादिताम् resounding with the shrill by of peacocks, तिलकैः with tilaka trees, बीजपूरैश्च trees with fruits full of seeds, धवैः dhava trees, तथा so also, शुक्लद्रुमैः white trees, पुष्पितैः in bloom, करवीरैश्च with karaviras, सुपुष्पितैः loaded with flowers, पुन्नागैश्च with punnaga trees, मालतीकुन्दगुल्मैश्च with clusters of jasmine and kunda shrubs, भाण्डीरैः with fig trees, तथा so also, निचुलैः with reeds, अशोकैः with asoka, अतिमुक्तकैः with atimukta shrubs, अन्यैः and other, विविधैः several, वृक्षैश्च trees, भूषिताम् adorned, प्रमदामिव like a woman, सर्वतः all over, समीक्षमाणौ glancing at them, पुष्पाढ्यम् with abundance of flowers, विपुलद्रुमम् having great trees, कोयष्टिकैश्च with koyashtikas, अर्जुनकैःarjuna trees, शतपत्रैः peacocks, कीरकैः  parrots, एतैः all those, अन्यैः others, विहगैश्च with birds, नादितम् full of sounds, महत् great, शकुनैः with birds, युतम् with, वनम् forest, पश्यन्तौ seeing, अव्यग्रौ both unruffled, सुसमाहितौ both composed, सरसः tank, तत् that, वनम् forest, जग्मतुः both went.

75_13.translation: Rama saw lake Pampa with cool waters and the groves on the bank filled with tilaka, ashoka, punnaga, bakula and uddala trees.
75_13.word_by_word: ततः then, सः Rama, शीतवारिनिधिम् a bed of cool waters, शुभाम् auspicious one, तिलकाशोकपुन्नाग with tilaka, asoka, punnaga trees, वकुलोद्दालकाशिनीम् groves shining with vakula, uddala trees, पम्पाम् Pampa, ददर्श saw.

75_14.shloka: स रामो विविधान्वृक्षान्सरांसि विविधानि च।।3.75.21।।पश्यन्कामाभिसन्तप्तो जगाम परमं ह्रदम्।
75_14.translation: On seeing different kinds of trees and tanks, the lovestriken Rama visited that great lake.
75_14.word_by_word: सः that, रामः Rama, विविधान् several, वृक्षान् trees, विविधानि different, सरांसि tanks, पश्यन् seeing, कामाभिसन्तप्तः lovestriken, परमम् great, ह्रदम् lake, जगाम went.

75_15.shloka: पुष्पितोपवनोपेतां सालचम्पकशोभिताम्।।3.75.22।।षट्पदौघसमाविष्टां श्रीमतीमतुलप्रभाम्।स्फटिकोपमतोयाढ्यां श्लक्ष्णवालुकसन्तताम्।।3.75.23।।स तां दृष्ट्वा पुनः पम्पां पद्मसौगन्घिकैर्युताम्।इत्युवाच तदा वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यविक्रमः।।3.75.24।।
75_15.translation: There were lovely pleasuregardens in full bloom  filled with sal and champk trees. Honeybees on flowers looked lovely and bright. The waters were crystalclear and fragrant with lotuses.The soft sands on the banks of Pampa gleamed. Rama saw them again and again and described them to Lakshmana.
75_15.word_by_word: सत्यविक्रमः whose strength was truth, सः Rama, पुष्पितोपवनोपेताम् with pleasuregardens in full bloom, सालचम्पकशोभिताम् beautiful with sal and champak trees, षट्पदौघसमाविष्टाम् filled with honeybees, श्रीमतीम् lovely one, अतुलप्रभाम् full of incomparable brilliance, स्फटिकोपमतोयाढ्याम्  with crystalclear water, श्लक्ष्णवालुकसन्तताम्  soft sands that gleamed, पद्मसौगन्धिकैः with fragrant lotuses, युताम् filled, ताम् that, पुनः again, दृष्ट्वा seeing, तदा then, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इति thus, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

75_16.shloka: अस्यास्तीरे तु पूर्वोक्तः पर्वतो धातुमण्डितः।ऋष्यमूक इति ख्यातः पुण्यः पुष्पितपादपः।।3.75.25।।
75_16.translation: The famous mount, sacred Rishyamuka is situated on the bank of Pampa full of blossoming trees.
75_16.word_by_word: पूर्वोक्तः referred  earlier, धातुमण्डितः adorned with minerals, पुण्यः sacred, पुष्पितपादपः having trees with flowers in bloom, ऋष्यमूकः इति Rishyamuka by name, ख्यातः famous, पर्वतः mountain, अस्याः its, तीरे on the bank.

75_17.shloka: हरेः ऋक्षरजोनाम्नः पुत्रस्तस्य महात्मनः।अध्यास्ते तं महावीर्यस्सुग्रीव इति विश्रुतः।।3.75.26।।
75_17.translation: The mighty son of Riksharaja, the great soul, the Sun whose son was the wellknown Sugriva, resides on this mountain.
75_17.word_by_word: ऋक्षरजोनाम्नः of Riksharaja by name, महात्मनः of the great soul, तस्य his, हरेः Sun's, पुत्रः son, महावीर्यः mighty, सुग्रीवः इति known as Sugriva, विश्रुतः very wellknown, तम् him, अध्यास्ते is residing.

75_18.shloka: सुग्रीवमभिगच्छ त्वं वानरेन्द्रं नरर्षभ।इत्युवाच पुनर्वाक्यं लक्ष्मणं सत्यविक्रमम्।।3.75.27।।
75_18.translation: Rama said to Lakshmana, the best of men, who had truth as his strength, Go to Sugriva, lord of the monkeys.
75_18.word_by_word: नरर्षभ best among men, त्वम् you, वानरेन्द्रम् to the lord of monkeys, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिगच्छ approach, पुनः again, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इति this, उवाच said.

75_19.shloka: राज्यभ्रष्टेन दीनेन तस्यामासक्तचेतसा।कथं मया विना शक्यं सीतां लक्ष्मण जीवितुम्।।3.75.28।।
75_19.translation: O Lakshmana, deprived of the kingdom I have become a destitute. With my heart attached to Sita how can I live without her ?
75_19.word_by_word: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राज्यभ्रष्टेन by one dislodged from the kingdom, दीनेन by a pathetic one, तस्याम् in her, आसक्तचेतसा attached to her, मया by me, सीतां विना without Sita, जीवितुम् to live, कथम् how, शक्यम् is it possible?

75_20.shloka: इत्येवमुक्त्वा मदनाभिपीडितः स लक्ष्मणं वाक्यमनन्यचेतसम्।विवेश पम्पां नलिनीं मनोरमां रघूत्तमश्शोकविषादयन्त्रितः।।3.75.29।।
75_20.translation: Having said these words to Lakshmana who was listening to him with undivided attention, Rama, the best of the Raghus, oppressed by love and afflicted by tears of grief entered Pampa, the delightful lotuslake.
75_20.word_by_word: मदनाभिपीडितः oppressed by love, सः रघूत्तमः that best of the Raghus, अनन्यचेतसम् withoutfixing his heart anywhere else, लक्ष्मणम् to Lakshmana, इत्येवम् in this way, वाक्यम् words, उक्त्वा having said, शोकविषाद tears of sorrow, यन्त्रितः afflicted, मनोरमाम् delightful, पम्पां नलिनीं a lotus tank, Pampa, विवेश entered.

75_21.shloka: ततो महद्वर्त्म सुदूरसङ्क्रमं क्रमेण गत्वा प्रविलोकयन्वनम्।ददर्श पम्पां शुभदर्शकाननामनेकनानाविधपक्षिजालकाम्।।3.75.30।।
75_21.translation: Thereafter, going slowly to a distance, Rama and Lakshmana saw Pampa surrounded by beautiful forests full of many varieties of birds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे पञ्चसप्ततिमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfifth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
75_21.word_by_word: ततः then, सुदूरसङ्क्रमम् extending to a distance, महत् great, वर्त्म path, क्रमेण gradually, गत्वा after going, वनम् forest, प्रविलोकयन् while observing, शुभदर्शकाननाम् surrounded by  beautiful forests, अनेकनानाविधपक्षिजालकाम् many varieties of birds, पम्पाम् Pampa, ददर्श saw.
